reviews.text: We went here for a date night while traveling around Christchurch. Loved the place. The atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming. The staff were friendly and the food was tasty. Overall, a really lovely spot!

Signage on tpath encourages you in with promise of variety of beverages/champagne and suggestion to ask for recommendations at the bar. Actual service required waiting for the bar staff to bother to meander over, repeated attempts to order a specific wine variety off the menu met with blank stares and questions of if it's a Chardonay.. After 4 attempts get them to realise it does exist. No proactive service, no chat/banter interest show, had to stand at the bar waiting for someone to turn up to order another wine. It's a hotel bar. Do not go here if you aren't a guest with a voucher and even if you are, better bars a block either way.
Delicious food and very friendly staff.
Beautiful bar and bartenders! Nice and calm
First class service, drinks and food. The waitresses were so kind and generous.
Exquisite surrounding coupled with impeccable hosting and excellent menu promises this is an ideal amazing place for your coming dine or event
We enjoyed a very pleasant quiet time over lunch on a Sunday. Would be happy to return. The food was delicious. Phil and Adi
Absolutely amazing food and excellent service! Everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Definitely a 5-star experience.
One of the best restaurants in the area. Staff is really sweet and nice.
Delicious food and excellent service! The price is also affordable. From the appetizers to the desserts, everything was made perfectly. A must-try.

5Star Vietnamese – Truly Lives Up to Its Name!   Tried out 5Star Vietnamese recently and was genuinely impressed by both the flavor and presentation.   Fresh Spring Rolls – Light, crisp, and packed with herbs, prawns, and vermicelli. The peanut dipping sauce on the side was rich and creamy, perfectly tying it all together. A great way to start the meal!   5-Star Fried Vermicelli – This dish was a standout! Smoky wok-fried vermicelli, topped with crispy shallots, lemongrass chicken, and just the right hint of spice. It had that perfect balance of texture—crispy edges with soft noodles underneath.   5-Star Special Broken Rice – A total flavour bomb. The grilled pork chop was juicy and marinated to perfection, paired with a crispy spring roll, shredded pork skin, and a soft egg. The rice was fragrant and fluffy, and the fish sauce drizzle brought everything together.  Service was friendly, food came out fast, and the portions were generous. Highly recommend if you’re after authentic, satisfying Vietnamese in town.   Would definitely come back!
Delicious food, cozy and clean place, friendly and efficient staff

This is my favourite takeaways in chch!!! the food and service is always a 10/10 which is why I come here at least once a week.   The owner and the staff are very friendly and welcoming, highly recommended!!!!
The Pho here is unbelievable. Awesome service too!! Very calm atmosphere
The steaks and short rib were delicious. Panna cotta was a highlight. Bread board was OK. Nice atmosphere, and great service.
Delicious .Lovely dinner date with my husband
A place we had been keen to go to for a while and we finally found a booking. It was worth the wait. We will definitely be back.

Lovely friendly service, divine food which was beautifully presented! It's fine dining (without being too formal) everything was done to high standards and we were made very welcome. Much thanks Karen Smith
All the dishes were amazing! The staff were super friendly and gave really great service
The service is exemplary.  What a great dining experience.

We had an excellent and truly memorable dining experience here last 26th of August. From the moment we walked in, the cozy and romantic ambience set the perfect mood for our anniversary dinner.  Our server, Riley, went above and beyond, he was friendly, warm, and thoughtful. He made sure we had everything we needed without us ever having to ask, and even served us with a special anniversary dessert, which made the night extra special.  The food was outstanding, steak was a perfect 5/5, cooked beautifully and packed with flavor. The pork dish was also delicious, around 4/5, but still very enjoyable.  Overall, it was a night to remember, thanks to the wonderful service, great food, and intimate atmosphere. We would definitely come back again.

One of the finest farm to table restaurants I've ever been to in the world. The head chef is passionate about his craft, great staff, service and ambience. Don't miss this gem! Update. So good I came back 2 days later !

What a treat in Christchurch. Off the beaten path. In an  industrial area. But inside you feel like you're in a tropical garden. The food was excellent from start to finish. The lamb shank was other worldly. We tried a straticalla appetizer that was super. Fish croquettes were very good.  Nice bar with good wine list. We shared the chef table and our chef/owner/server Samson was sooo entertaining! My wife and I both loved this restaurant.  At the top of our favorite restaurants on our month long vacation to New Zealand and Australia. Get a res if your anywhere nearby.

Very elegant and nice warm wooden interior, love all the plants and natural light!   Service was also great, waiter explained the menu and was very attentive in answering questions and refilling water  Plating of food was beautiful! Great flavor profiles and ingredients felt high quality. The saffron cauliflower was perfectly warm and hearty. The cucumber salad was creamy and refreshing. And the lamb shoulder was sooo super tender, no knife even needed! The whipped labneh cream and zaatar flavoring paired so well w the lamb. Great meal, felt full and very satisfied after :)

Best meal in NZ so far!    Everything we had was amazing and the service was fantastic.  The small plates were wagyu and stracciatella with bread, then moved on to the medium plates of asparagus with ham and then the tomato salad, and for the finale we had the lamb shoulder. All were top notch.  This is a must for anyone, but particularly for visitors looking for a great meal.

Holy Sh*t this place rocked our world. We were only in Christchurch for a few hours before our flight back to Auckland and stopped here based on reviews. It. Was. Amazing. Best meal of the two week trip through Auckland, Queenstown, Rotorua, and Wellington. We've been to several of the "Best Of..." restaurants on this trip and there was only one other place (Charley Noble in Wellington) that was even close to as good as 5th street. We sat at the Chefs Table which made everything even better because Samson served us and he's one of the co-owners and lead chefs crafting the menu. Such a great dude, and his team is really doin the Lord's work over here. We had four cocktails (Mezcal Milkpunch, Spritz 2x, and the Stirred). The lead bartender is a blast as well and is coming up with some truly delicious, refreshing drinks on this ever-changing menu (so I hear). We got the broccolini, the beef with pickled ginger, potatoes, and the true gem of the meal = the lamb shoulder. The lamb melts in your mouth. Do not hesitate for a second to order it even if you're not a big red meat eater! I'm sitting here at the airport not an hour removed from dinner and I had to write this review because of the lamb AND the quality of service. Props to Samson, Chris, and the third mustached musketeer / co-owner for creating such a memorable dining experience. And if you're wondering, "is this guy still buzzed from the drinks he ordered at dinner?" The answer is "Hell yes. I couldn't NOT order a 4th cocktail." Anyway, cheers to the 5th street team for the beautiful work you're doing. We'll think of you every time we talk about our trip to NZ and/or use the chili oil we bought on our way out.

Location   Near city centre with hotels and other restaurants near by.  Food    International and inspired.  There is Asian, American and more represented on the menu. There are small, medium, and large plates to choose from.  We ordered pan fried shrimp, broccolini and kale, crispy potatoes, the tomahawk steak, and the risotto. We enjoyed all of it. We also had some sort of deconstructed lemon pie with a divine lemon ice cream.  Atmosphere/decor    The space is very green in more ways than one.  It's literally filled with plants and green decorations.  Beautiful lighting.  Hipster vibe.  Service    No issues here.  We sat at the 'chef's table' which is really 4 bar seats in front of the kitchen. This made the experience for us! The sous chef spoke with us and  answered questions all while doing his job of cooking.  He also let us try the zucchini fritters on the house. Outstanding gesture! He takes all your orders personally and you can see the chefs cooking your meal and then it is present directly to you.  Recommendation   Yup, eat here.
Best restaurant I’ve been to, if I lived in Christchurch it would be a monthly thing. Such  great food

It’s been a long time since I’ve been this excited about a restaurant! You can choose to sit near the chef and watch all the dishes being prepared, it’s such a fun and immersive experience. My husband and I had an absolutely wonderful time at the restaurant, I only wish we had the budget to go every week. Seriously, just go!

We dined here las night - we are visiting New Zealand from Los Angeles. The server (Holly) was terrific! Atmosphere seemed to us like a lot of locals, plants hanging from there rafters was unique. We had the local fish Crudo which was super fresh, the salad with parmesan, the carrots and asparagus and the market fish (grouper), fantastic!!!
Always love dinning at 5th street. We have been going for years and never disappoints.
Great food and awesome service!
Never disappoints. Always a favourite.
Thank you team for the most beautiful evening. Great food, amazing service It was special from start to end
Awesome pasta and cocktails served! Thanks to the delightful suggestions by the team who served us!
Staff here were amazing, very attentive and made the experience truly delightful. The food was incredibly delicious and we’ll definitely be back when their new Pizza Oven is installed in a few weeks!
The food was delicious, with excellent portions and a homemade taste you won't forget. 100% recommended
OK Italian food paired with rather expensive prices.

The service was excellent; the staff were very nice, and the decor was beautiful. However, the food was ridiculously bad. I didn't finish the pasta, but my friend ate it to avoid waste. Now I feel nauseous and want to vomit.  We had been looking forward to this restaurant for a long time and booked a first table reservation ages ago. Today, I was truly disappointed. This pasta is the worst I've ever had in Christchurch. I don't know why, but I'm sorry, this really hurt my feelings.

This is the place to go! Service was superb all night. The waiters are mind readers and attend to what you need when you need it. We were offered free bread to soak our pasta sauce in after our meal, which made the dish extra tasty. Food was exceptional. Tables can be a little close for an intimate setting, and a bit of mood music would go a as long way. Overall, excellent restaurant.
Monday is quiz night!
Fantastic music venue, awesome bar. Loved the scene and will be back for more for sure!
Great atmosphere and band, will definitely be back
Get there!
Nice vibe.

Good service decent prices, food is just okay. We had Massaman curry beef Pad Thai seafood (really fishy tasting... I mean really strong, and I like fish, and fish sauce. Usually.  Tom Kha soup (one of my favorites) was very bland.  Money Bags were good.  Others have given this place good reviews and it's probably worth another try.

After a two week long vacation in New Zealand, we had the good fortune to find this restaurant on our last night in New Zealand.  Excellent menu choices, very friendly staff, and good food!  My wife said it was the best meal she'd had in New Zealand.  We had walked about 2 miles from our hotel to get there, so when we finished dinner, we asked them to call a taxi for us...Five minutes later, the owner of the restaurant drove up and took us back to the hotel (couldn't have been more friendly).  Where else in the world do you get this type of service?  The restaurant is tucked back in a little strip mall, but do yourself a favor and take the time to look for it!
Prompt service, great food and BYO. Very friendly staff. Set menu was great. Good selection and very tasty. Also in the Entertainment book if you have one! Busy but great atmosphere.
Very good Thai food at reasonable prices. The sizzling hot plate meals are excellent, particularly the award winning Lamb. Worth a visit.

I came here about eight years ago — the food still tastes just as good! However, the service felt a bit different this time. There was no table check, and I had to wait quite a while to pay even though the restaurant was nearly empty. Not trying to be harsh, but a little more attention to service would make the experience much better.
Great food,  very tasty
4 meals and we all really enjoyed them. We will definitely be back soon.
Beautiful dinner and service. I got the shuttle pick up and drop off which was excellent.
A thai hidden gem in christchurch !

Very disappointing to order 3 mains via doordash only to discover that rice is an add on. For god’s sake just put the price of the main up $2 and include rice if that’s how a thai dish is traditionally served! Can’t comment on the food as am currently cooking rice before we can eat.
Two versions of menu , different price , one for Chinese, same dishes , how you create this amazing
Fully enjoyed my stir fry noodles here — great flavor, fresh ingredients, and perfectly cooked! Definitely coming back again.
Chinese people are treated differently. The dishes are the same but the prices are different. Chinese people will be charged more. This is obvious racial discrimination and is not recommended!
Best Biryani had so far. Highly recommend.
We love the porotta and vizhinjam chicken fry

I have been a customer to adipoli since few years. I always felt the price is really high comparing the competitors.  When ordering single briyani, they always push pepsi and get 18 dollars. I don't want pepsi, I asked the same to the person and he refused to remove the pepsi and told me it will cost the same despite don't wanting pepsi.  This cheap method of pushing stuffs to customers and with high profit margins is not fair. Also, day by day the quantity keeps reducing. I request you keep you standard at least.
Not usually a fan of biriyani, but the one from here was surprisingly good. Definitely worth a try!
Warm cossy place
Excellent everything.

Bought a voucher from Grabone to use here. Conditions said no cabinet food, something from menu, and minimum 2 people. That’s fine. But turns out you can’t buy a main and a side using the voucher. Man at counter told me it has to be two mains, well then you need to state that in the voucher because what I’m ordering is allowed. Ended up walking out with my little baby and partner. I’m very disappointed!
Cheese, onion & tomato toastie was delicious. Americano not bad as well. Very kind staff. We had a good experience here with our friends on the last day of our trip.
I love the chicken sandwich that is in cabinet, it is really delicious. And coffees are also good. Lovely cafe and nice workers.
Nice cafe with a good food. I tried chicken ficelle and it was really good!
Lovely place, lovely people. We tried cabinet food. Coffee was good as well.normally they are making really good latte art, so don’t mind this one’s bubble
Great food, cheap prices, I visit every time I am coming through. Be polite and respectful

If you’re looking for something truly delicious in Christchurch, Afghan Restaurant on Lincoln Road is a must-visit. The food is bold and generous - think flame-grilled lamb & chicken kebabs, savoury rice, chicken curry and fresh salad.
Came here late and managed to grab a meal before close. Amazing food for a very fair price!
Best i ever had Its on lincoln road  Tasty food Friendly staff Sometimes long lines but wait is worth it
Lives up to hype
Lively place

We had a table for Cup Day. We cannot commend the team highly enough. Nick the venue manager introduced himself at the start of the day to ensure my dietary requests were going to be met along with other health issues. The service from all the staff on a very busy day was exceptionally good as always. Can't wait to return for year 7 for Cup Day to celebrate with my group of friends.
Had an absolutely amazing lunch at Aikmans. Great atmosphere, great food and excellent service thank you Sophie our waitress.
Exceptionally good food! Thank you so much! Really appreciated Barnaby’s attentive service!

Went for lunch in the weekend. Margarita pizza for 2. Base was consistency of a water cracker. Obvious cheese on 2 slices only and burnt our mouths. So I asked if it had been microwaved? The waitress said it may have been too long in the oven. An understatement. No compensation or replacement offered. I was a guest of the other person but would otherwise have refused to pay.

We came for an early drink and food today with our two four year old boys and couldn’t have felt more uncomfortable and unwelcome by our waitress. We arrived at 1130am to avoid the rush. When tables starting filling up it was obvious we were not welcome with our kids. The boys (in my opinion) were very well behaved sitting at the table playing with their toys. She apologised to the table next to us regarding the truck and paper on the floor loud enough for us to hear. We all commented on how uncomfortable she made us feel and felt like she wanted us to leave. We were appalled with her attitude and the service we received. We won’t be returning if she’s serving us.
Best sushi shop at my area(burnside and avonhead) also very  reasonable
Had their Karaage chicken. Colour was quite dark, but the portion was decent and service was fast.
Super friendly staff and delicious food!  Highly recommended for lunch if you looking for something quick and tasty!

Came to Christchurch for business purpose, looking for lunch at the area, mostly everything are closed unfortunately. Visited the place and got pleasure to know what they are not only serving the sushi but can feed you for lunch as well. Fast and tasty. Recommend
Lovely little Japanese restaurant—very generous serves and extremely affordable. Karaage was fresh, crisp, and hot.

The food is amazing. and I understand that wait time is long for food because there was only 1 person running food and clearing dishes. but food is amazing. worth the wait tho. would come here again. I love the food, dont mind waiting.

Amazing food, 100% recommended.  I am choosy and these guys are awesome. Real, authentic Thai flavours; No weird chunks of carrot or celery, no gross frozen seafood mix, just real squid, prawns and mussels in the salads and tom yum  We got the whole fish in curry sauce and it was excellent. Super good and large portions.

Highly recommend the Tom Kha soup and Choo Chee Pla Tod Krob. We were so glad to find that all the seafood dishes were fresh — not a single frozen seafood mix in sight! The service was also spot on. Unfortunately, we were too busy savouring the food and forgot to take photos. We’ll definitely be back!
Fast service and great food! Didn’t have to wait long, and their garlic and pepper dish is an absolute must-have.

Yummy!!!! The flavours were amazing and the lunch specials are very worth it for the price, especially the noodles. Try the pandan coconut dessert - it has jackfruit in it and its not too sweet, just nicely balanced :)
Weeks ago I have tried this place but it lacked flavour. Other thai restaurants are better, I like the atmosphere though.
The meal was very nice and tasty.

Tried a Thai restaurant recently that serves boat noodles—not something you see every day, especially for lunch! I ordered the Num Tok version, and the soup was rich, flavorful, and full of that signature Thai spice and aroma. For around $15, it’s a really affordable and satisfying option.  The portion was generous, and the toppings were nicely balanced. The only downside was the big rice noodles, which were a bit too soft and soggy for my taste. Still, overall a great find if you’re craving something warm, spicy, and different without breaking the bank.

Excellent food, lovely atmosphere but no COFFEE.  Grrrrr. Been here many times and they  say machine not working? Could you please get me a coffee from next door. No. Disappointing if you want a nice lunch and coffee. Food is top rate

Amaterrace is a Japanese teppan or hibachi in the heart of the bustling city of Christchurch, we had trouble finding the exact location since it was on the second floor of Oxford terrace or simply called "The Terrace".  All dining guests are seated facing around the master chef, we found it enjoyable and had an intimate conversation while eating even with company of strangers, we both decided to order the Amaterrace special which is NZ 49$ that included an appetizer, soup, 5 hibachi entrees and dessert.  We started off with cold bottle of sake, miso soup and has started making stir fried mix veggies, he then followed it with tiger prawns glazed with butter, Akaroa salmon with scallops, teppanyaki fried rice together with NZ premium eye fillet served with garlic mushrooms and marinated grilled chicken, we found it overwhelming but managed to finish all the dishes as they were cooked and served right before our very eyes. We then capped our dinner with a delicious ice cream with chocolate syrup.  I considered our dining experience here as one of our best dinners while vacationing in New Zealand, The customer service was awesome, dishes were served in timely fashion in this pristine restaurant with a view. This place is a must try when in Christchurch city Centre!
Overall, food was slightly above average except for seafood which r overcooked.

We went and sat by the grilled table the other night. The food and atmosphere was great. The chef was interacting with customers. There is one thing, when I finished my meal, there’s no waiter/waitress to remove it and also, our rice came really late. Other customers finished their fried rice and we haven’t get our rice. And when our rice served, the stir fried veggie was cold. Chef should noticed that even it’s busy time.
Lovely food, lovely atmosphere, lovely people. Had a great night

This is our second time dining at Amaterrace Teppanyaki and it was once again amazing!! Even better than the first time. Our chef, Axel, was really entertaining. It made the experience really enjoyable. Last time we dined, they didn’t have any sets with chicken so we had to order it as extra. So glad they added it to a set!! My partner and I are not the biggest beef fans but we really enjoyed the one included in our set. We’ll bring family next time and request for Axel to be the chef

Wow, what a fantastic place for entertainment alongside your meal. The food was delicious and our chef Louis was highly entertaining and a master at his craft! It was also obvious that he was enjoying himself too, every now and then he'd let out a wee laugh. The service was impeccable, super quick and oh so polite. Everyone was so lovely!
Consistently great every time I visit, always worth coming back.
walked in on a Saturday night and got a booth immediately, great food and service and watching the chefs at the grill was very entertaining
Super yum!

Our first time dining at Amazonita & it was amazing! We sat outside with our dog, and one of the lovely staff we kind enough to bring out a bowl of water and treats for our Pup   We had a delicious meal and the cocktails were tasty too! Its a really nice vibe and cool atmosphere here! Highly recommend!!
6 stars, no comments
Best 3 item ..
Fantastic food with lovely staff

That was a fantastic meal, and I don't say that lightly. I would re-order everything we had tonight and, while I didn't take a photo of every plate, let me just say that each of these tasted better than similar dishes I had at a 'higher end' restaurant the night before. I'd be more than happy to order just the croquettes for myself, but add the prawn linguini to it and it's so, so good. Our table also split a rib-eye which was cooked well to our temp, the pork mac & cheese, and the buttermilked fried chicken entree. Very happy with the cocktails as well.  Basically, happy with everything which is why I'm writing this to remind myself that YES I would come back again next time I'm in Christchurch.

i was impressed with the servings! we ordered two small plates to share and one large plate.. more than enough for two. I was a bit disappointed with our  table though as we were tucked in the corner. All in all it was a good experience.
Great food, great service
Such a great place to dine.  Went there with some friends to celebrate a birthday and the food was amazing as was the service... Would definitely go again - Thank you thank you thank you .

Came in last week hoping to get dinner along with a couple of drinks. We asked for a table for two and were quickly sat at a table near the bar.  The server was quick to get our drink orders but we were never given menus for food by either the host or server. About 15-20 minutes go by before we were able to get hold of the server that took our drink order and was told they are only serving snacks.  We were not told this when we asked to be seated and had we known when we got in, we wouldn't have even bothered ordering drinks. The website mentions that the dinner is served from 5 PM to late and we had arrived at around 8:15 PM which is not late at all, since they were open until 12 AM that day. Super disappointed with the service and lack of informing us that they are no longer serving dinner when we asked for a table for two.  Hands down the most disappointing experience in New Zealand so far especially when the other reviews hyped up the restaurant.
Great dinner! Nice restaurant environment! The food is absolutely amazing. Strongly recommend the seafood the stew and the salmon tartar.

Food had no seasoning and tasted bland. Service was poor - didn't clear any plates, didn't offer any water, didn't ask for second drinks, just dropped the food and ran away. Ambiance was kinda cool, but they had the door wide open and even though the place was empty sat us right next to the open door in the front. Definitely seemed like they didn't want us there. At the end of the night they screwed up our tab and tried to over charge us.
Fantastic service, amazing chicken salad and mock tails, staff very friendly and helpful. Definitely going back.
Nice location near the Avon river and the seafoods is good. Good for group and great view of the bridge of remembrance.
Fantastic breakfast and fantastic service, have visited twice now for different occasions. Cocktail menu is the best in Christchurch Will come back again an again.

What a fantastic meal! Our server was Hamish and I've seldom had some recommend dishes with such passion and outstanding knowledge of the ingredients to create perfect cocktail pairings! We ordered the rainmaker and missionary's downfall at our server's recommendation and both drinks were some of the best cocktails I've ever had. Later on, my husband got an Inca Haze. Also an excellent drink! Moving on to food, we asked out server for recommendations and followed his direction and he did not steer us wrong. The chargrilled jalapeno sausage was flavorful, delicious and had great dipping sauces. I wish it was a bit more jalapeno-y, but I know spicy food scares people here... We moved on to the Pork Belly and Broccolini. Wow. The pork belly had a perfectly crispy layer of skin on top, the inside was tender and not overly fatty (due to the rotisserie cooking process maybe) and served on black bean sauce with pineapple salsa. Fantastic! And who gets excited about broccolini? Anyone who eats the broccolini from here. Delicious! We scrapped every bit of sauce off the plate under the veggies.  To finish we got the Zesti Roasted pineapple. Wonderful taste explosion! Fruity, spicy, creamy,, everything you want in a dessert. I also appreciate how helpful our server Hamish and the other staff were. About 90% through our meal another couple was seated next to me, who I can only describe as a perfume-bomb. The smell was so overwhelming it was almost sending me into an asthma attack and I couldn't breathe. The put our dessert into a to-go container and got our bill and we were able to finish our meal on the patio out front. I hate people who dip-dye their body in perfume and fumigate the rest of us. I appreciate the restaurant's help in allowing me to escape from the cloud of perfume as soon as possible.

Absolutely delicious steak and seafood. We did not have a reservation but the host made room for us at the counter overlooking the kitchen. Our waitress was professional and helpful. Best food in Christchurch!

Delicious food, friendly service, and a pleasing environment. Amazing patio seating is available when the weather is nice. It is also centrally located. All in all, you can't go wrong at Amazonita. Give it a try.

Our second time dining here and it was just as good as the first! The atmosphere is busy, but not noisy and made it easy to hold a conversation at the table. The waiting staff are prompt and friendly, can not fault the service :)  What really makes this place stand out for me is their knowledge around food safety for my pregnant wife.  We ordered some french fries as a side plate which on the menu comes with a spicy mayonnaise.  The waitress identified that my wife was pregnant (a brave call but she is obviously pregnant), and informed us that the mayonnaise had raw egg in it and that she can bring a small dish of ketchup if that would be better.  It's the first place that we've been to during the pregnancy where the staff were knowledgeable and informed about the food safety recommendations for women who are pregnant.  Good work Amazonita!!   Additionally the food is delicious and well priced, and with a wide range of food you are sure to find something that you feel like.  Looking forward to many more trips to this awesome restaurant.
Never got the appetizer otherwise nice food.
I frequently visit this place, love the food everytime! I'm going through the menu and always choosing something different, so far hasn't dissapointed.

Please don’t go here if you want to order food with chicken. Ordered take away food yesterday - Crystal “chicken” fried rice, emphasized on “chicken” and still got served pork. And this the second time that happened on my take away order. Why being so negligent when running a restaurant?? If you can’t serve chicken just say NO, why serve pork? Thank god I’m not allergic to pork. Just horrible customer service.

I had a very pleasant vegetarian meal here tonight. Tofu with scallions and mushrooms (T06) and Vermicelli (N11). The food was very good and the atmosphere nice. First time I have been here. Service was good but could be better if they had asked have you been here before? Then they may have realised it might be worth a couple of minutes to take me through the menu.
Always a good experience here. Food is good and reasonably priced and staff are friendly and attentive.
Decent late-night option with a nice atmosphere, but nothing particularly stood out, food and boba is mid.

Amazing sour soup, squid was skinny, tough and dry. Good to see a decent number of people there mid arvo. Reasonable pricing and other dishes looked nice but not exceptional. I would return for the soup.

restaurant: Ancient Lanzhou Beef Noodles 上古金城兰州牛肉面

reviews.text: The noodle soups are delicious! Beef is super tender. Struggled to finish the portions are huge. Definitely recommended.

It will be hard to find a better noodle in Christchurch or possibly New Zealand.  Service was extremely fast and everything presented well but a bit more space would be nice as it can be a tight fit when it is busy.  We had 3 meals (noodle soup, fried noodle and pork with rice) that were generous servings and 2 cans of drinks that totalled $59 - great prices
lot of people, can be crowded water and cutlery are self-serve food comes out very fast (5-10mins) - i recommend the triangular shaped noodles with the A1 or A2 dish! (can make less spicy if needed)
Fast and friendly service. The signature noodle dish was fab.
Nice authentic flavor, steamed food is made by hand too which is nice

The oil-splashed noodles were absolutely delicious! Authentic, fragrant, and perfectly portioned. There's a student discount, so the price is very reasonable. The waitress was incredibly kind. After hearing about my little experience, she gave me a little note, some gummy candies, and a bowl of hot soup. It was such a touching moment. Meeting such warm-hearted people in a foreign country was truly heartwarming.   Highly recommended. The food is delicious, and the people are even better!

Delicious spot near the train station for breakfast! Hubby and son got Anna's special, 2 pancakes eggs bacon and hash browns, and I had toast and eggs, also yummy cream cake! My chai latte really hit the spot. You select pastries and sandwiches from the counter display then order hot foods and drinks and pay at the cash register. Sandwiches in the counter display are wrapped so you could easily take them to go.

Had Brunch here with 5 friends. Beautiful location, rustic/warm ambiance.  Everyone at the table enjoyed their food selection.  Personally, the Hollandaise sauce was delicious. Absolutely would come back to try another selection and sit by the water.

Excellent little cafe nestled right on the Avon River across the street from the hospital. This cafe became a little escape for me as my mom required unexpected surgery while we were visiting from the States. It was always very busy but I always somehow managed to grab a table on the patio. Most of the outdoor seating is covered but there were a few that weren't. I happily took one in the sun as I was growing tired of the hospital ward staleness.   You order at the counter, get a number and have a seat. They have a large selection of pastries and pre made sandwiches as well as a large sit down menu. Soups, salads, sandwiches, fish. All kinds of good stuff. I didn't eat breakfast there but they have pancakes, eggs, etc. Food and drinks are brought out to you. Service was always friendly and very prompt. I was regularly surprised at how quickly my food came out despite how busy it was.   Lamb burger was delicious. Freshest feta I've ever had and the beet compote type thing on it was delish. I could have eaten that alone as a side dish. My one gripe was that it also had mayo and tomato on it which wasn't stated on the menu. I hate when places don't list all the ingredients they plan to put on my sandwich. I HATE mayo so that was a bummer. Luckily it was mostly on the lettuce so I was able to get it mostly off :)  Another day I had the fish and chips. It was very clear that fish was probably swimming this morning. Yum yum yum fresh!  My favorite by far was the chicken, pesto and Brie sandwich. Chicken was grilled perfectly and that pesto, oh that pesto! It puts other pestos to shame. Easily the best and most fresh pesto I've ever had. Swoon indeed.   The coffees are great. Iced Americano and flat white both lovely.    Wonderful place with wonderful staff and excellent food.
Awesome to sit in the Boatshed cafe and watch kayakers on the Avon. Delicious food and great service
almost swallowed a plastic piece from the soup and the rice quality aint the best

THE BEST KARE KARE EVER. Never had anything that good apart from my grandma's cooking. Their dishes are authentically Filipino with that home touch that makes you crave for more. The staffs in here are also so friendly and welcoming, and I'm so happy that is now owned by a new management. I will be coming in here more often! Dishes are reasonably priced yet very well done. Thank you very much for always satisfying my cravings!

Arbie Restaurant in Christchurch is a cozy spot for delicious Filipino food. Their dishes are full of authentic flavors, reminding you of home-cooked meals. The staff are friendly and welcoming, making the dining experience even better. Whether you’re craving classics like sisig or want to try something new, Arbie’s is worth a visit!

I ordered the build your own. Salmon, spinach and gluten free toast (x2 peices) which was $11. I didn't think to look for sauce so not sure where to find that (not that I would have wanted it). There was no salt and pepper on the dish or on the table, but there was cutlery and napkins. I had a decaf almond milk latte which was fine also. I loved the range of foods that appealed to me as I'm quite difficult with eating out. The only thing I would complain about was the toast was slightly dry/hard and it was buttered which I would have preferred not to have. Seating inside or outside was both lovely with a great city atmosphere.
Good variety of curries in a contemporary ambience, rather than the usual Indian restaurant decor cliches. Attentive and efficient staff.

Best curry in town hotter than a few Indians can eat they know how to please a kiwi that can handle tye heat  Great customer service   Great atmosphere  Smiles always there even when busy with a full dinner service
Chai was fantastic .Thank you
The food was ok, not spectacular but ok

This place was great, but not anymore. It's now profits 1st & Customers 2nd. We had 2 x Lamb Tikka Masala & there was almost no Lamb in it at all. Seriously only 3 tiny pieces in each meal & the Garlic Naan was seriously undercooked & still Doughy & rubbery. The fact they think that it's OK to sell people food without actually giving you any is pretty amazing. Basically $60 for 2 Tomato soups & rice. This was one of the worst meals we have ever had. Never again. Such a shame, because this place was so good, but not anymore. We'll not be going here ever again after this.
Food is incredibly flavorsome!
Food tasted like chicken in tomato sauce. Spice level was different for both curries that we ordered but tasted the same. Bad.

I been there on recommendation of my friend and it’s absolutely  amazing. Great food with no extra colour with good portions of curry . Must try their Fish masala curry . The girl on the counter has an amazing service with a great smile . Definitely will back

We recently had catering from Aroma Delight for an event, and the food was absolutely delicious – fresh, flavorful, and enjoyed by everyone. A special shoutout to Prince, who arranged everything for us. He was extremely nice, humble, and made the whole process stress-free. Highly recommend their service and food!
I order lamb rogangoash,garlic naan nd rumali roti.Must recommended place with very gud nd jeniun staff
The best Indian food in town every time they never disappoint!!
Great butter chicken love this place
Goat meat curry the best goat i have tasted in Chch

We had Hyderabad chicken biriyani which does not belong to the dish. They have somehow managed to give biriyani that’s all. Only there was a gravy with it that was good. Hyderabad chicken biriyani is entirely different, first time I am getting green coloured chicken in Hyderabad chicken biriyani was so bad.  We had the same dish before couple of months and it was good. But the food we had yesterday was not good.  I hope you will learn to make Hyderabad chicken biriyani in future or else remove Hyderabad chicken biriyani name from your menu and just add chicken biriyani and improve quality
Nice food and reasonable price

Aroy mak mak!  Had a great lunch at Aroy Thai. We ate in and ordered Khao Soi with fried chicken and it was very flavourful with generous chicken portion.  The iced Thai milk tea was super legitimate! My Thai milk tea experience in NZ has always been a bit disappointing but I was really impressed.  The menu looks friendly to vegetarians

Ordered through door dash. The chicken pad Thai had no chicken, the beef I added was chewy, and overall was so tasteless to the point where I actually couldn’t eat it despite adding lime juice, salt, and sweet chilli sauce. Very disappointing!! The curry puffs were just okay. The Thai tea was refreshing

I came from far to dine in this restaurant, I choose their location on the way from Dunedin because the status show that they are open. When I arrived at 3.00 pm they were still closed. But they didn't update this and I have to buy something else from another shop for my lunch. I also chat with the staff on the way back as they were open by the time I had my lunch. Before heading back to the vehicle and i mentioned about this to front counter staff.
One photo is what was advertised on uber eats, the other is what I received. It is 100% as bland as it looks. Very disappointing, I threw it away.
Great service, meals arrived quickly and was very pleasant. Would happily return.
Not sure why some people complained about the taste of food but my dishes were so yummy but a bit too hot for me  The menu are variety. Will be back for sure.
Great spot for lunch. Had a nice selection of menu items. We had the Panang curry and pad Thai, each for $12.

Excellent, classic Thai.  Good lunch options! My friends and I had the yellow and panang curry and sizzling beef platters. The beef was really tender and the curries were sliced well. Great friendly service!  It was close to our hotel across from a casino. Good central location in Christchurch.

What a unique and gloriously chilled space to indulge everything that's beautiful in this world. I always experience such a cathartic social occasion here, thanks to everything from superb craft beers, delicious food and absolutely top notch engaging customer service! Greg, Duty Manager, is very diligent, attentive and knowledgeable on every aspect of all Astro Labs F&B offerings. Sensational tunes too, btw! On chilly nights, this fine establishment offers hot water bottles to every patron to ensure they're comfortable and warm. The only place I'm aware of across the entire city of Christchurch that offers such!

What a great experience. Very cool barman who presented us with hot water bottles upon arrival, helped us choose a table and put the heater on above us. He looked after us so well and because of him we stayed a lot longer than we had intended and spent a lot more than we would have.
Thank you so much for the delicious lunch, wonderful atmosphere, and friendly service, highly recommended!

We ordered from the lunch menu and overall had a pretty good experience! The Beef Steak, Chicken Teppan and White fish were definitely the highlights — perfectly cooked, tender, and full of flavour. Service was great too, very attentive and friendly.  The Assorted Tempura Set was okay — I really liked the vegetable tempura, but the fish was a bit dry.  The Bento Set was also just okay. Not terrible, but for the price I expected a little more. They could’ve added a small salad instead of leaving one of the compartments just for sauce. The sushi tasted like supermarket sushi and the fried dumplings felt like they came from frozen, so that part was a bit of a downside for me. And the Salmon was a bit overcooked in my opinion — the juiciness was gone, which was a bit of a bummer!  Still, a pleasant lunch spot overall — I’d come back for the teppanyaki dishes!

We didn't have a chance to sit in front of the teppanyaki chef, but can over look some amazing flambes activities. Tony's combo teppanyaki set is delicious and has good variety. We highly recommend the salmon sashimi which is deliciously fatty.
Great food and awesome service. Highly recommend to dine here.
Love @Tony's so much... Just perfectly delicious food. My absolute fave place to eat in Christchurch!
Friendly staff and well prepared food.
The portions here were really small for the price, which was really disappointing. I hope the owner visits another Teppanyaki restaurant in Christchurch.
The atmosphere was great with the DJ GMC playing a eclectic mix of great beats and the cocktail was good
Really cool speakeasy bar with lovely cocktail selection and great bartenders! Highly recommend the espresso martini
I love this place. Hidden downstairs with a password protected access. Bar staff were awesome, drinks were absolutely delicious, and atmosphere was on point.
Great cocktails
I got a Satchmo of Japan and WOW thats probably the tastiest cocktail everrrrr. Awesome vibes too here it doesn't feel like you're in Christchurch!!
Such a cool place! The vibes are absolutely on point and the drinks are deliiiicious! I love that they also have a non alcoholic cocktail menu! And lots of vegan and gluten free options!

Sooooo good - wide variety of tasty ingredients and plenty of choice for broth (I got the mushroom broth and it was full of umami and flavour). Staff very friendly and helpful when asked about the process. Could use some more thorough labelling of ingredients but that’s the only fault. Lots of free toppings and add-ons. Would highly recommend!  Very easy to get takeout, was put in a big secure bowl with lid and came with bag to carry. Dine-in option looked lovely too, lots of people sitting down and enjoying meals

Checked out a newly opened malatang place in Christchurch today! The soup base was surprisingly good — they use a beef bone broth, which gave it a deep, rich flavor. The taste was definitely there, hearty and comforting. The price was a bit on the higher side, but with the grand opening special, it was quite affordable.  It’s safe to say this is the best malatang place in Christchurch. Well… there are only two malatang places in Christchurch, by the way — but still, this one takes the win.
I checked online, the restaurant was listed as "open," but when I arrived, it was CLOSED! UNBEARABLE! Bye!
Awsome burgers, tasty fried chicken and chunky chips
Super food.
Bacon Bros catered our event for 160 people with some great burgers! Incredible staff, well organised and easy to contact! Would highly recommend for any event

The guy serving was so rude. Didn’t say hello, was leaning on his elbows while serving placed the beeper an arms length away from me to the right. Was just a weird/rude encounter. Also when I collected he said nothing. Burger was okay.

Good size burger for the price! Both burger and the fries were very yummy! Service was very friendly and wait time is usually quite quick! Construction going outside on so minimal outdoor seating but we found a table and it was still good!
Greasy charred burgers that fall apart at first bite. Will not return.  The burgers were cold but the fires were hot.

As an American, I believe I'm well qualified to rate a burger because the hamburger is the great American contribution to the culinary world. I'm here to tell you, however, that there's not an American restaurant I've ever eaten at that makes a better burger than Bacon Brothers! Simply brilliant!!!

Best burger we have ever had in our lives! Came here straight from the airport and left very satisfied! Highly recommend, great food and ambiance. Very large craft beer selection too. Five stars for the service- everyone is super friendly and nice!
Great burger and excellent service. New Todd cooked me an excellent vegan burger. The jack fruit is a great substitute for a vegan like myself.

Me, my wife and daughter had just landed after a long trip from the states and were starving.  We jumped on Yelp and Bacon Brothers had good reviews.  The restaurant is inside an upscale, hipster food court with a number of other eclectic places.  The entire place was clean, bright and welcoming.  We had a bacon cheeseburger, vegan burger and and an order of fries.  The burgers were hot and tasty.  The fries were a huge portion and well seasoned.  My only criticism is that they were a bit soggy.  They appeared double fried, but should have been left in a bit longer.  The guy and girl at the counter were both friendly and professional.  Definitely worth it.  Highly recommend.

MY LIFE IS CHANGED AFTER EATING HERE!!! The burgers are so good, I'm wishing we had one of these places in the states. Maybe they do but I just don't know about it. Either way, a trendy and fun place, pretty reasonably priced, only downside is they got my mom's order wrong, but that can be easily remedied.   I got the Ben from accounting and it had pineapple and the bacon was delicious and I love love LOVE the bun. Also really fun that they put your fries/onion rings on cutting boards.   Also, in love with the Aoli/bbq sauce combo they give you. 10/10 would recommend!! Come to America if you haven't already bacon brothers!!

*** NB for non-locals:  This listing seems to have wrong hours - it can be hard to find when the eatery is closed! FYI, the eatery houses many restaurants and this is just one of them. it is located INSIDE the food court.  ***  We're vege. You can swap bacon with coconut bacon on any burger ~ and ~ they have a burger with Mac & cheese crocquette patty. It's amazing.  The service took a long time but the eatery was PACKED and it was NYE so forgiven.   The chips come with the most amazing sauce. Loved it.
The burgers looked pretty impressive and tasted pretty good - they're just pretty buried in bun and fixings; not much meat!

Vegan option is excellent. Normal burgers also good. Kinda hard to find. Location is good. Service was fast. Menu far less expensive than it could have been ($12 for a sizeable burger) but beer is a bit overpriced at $7 for a glass of speights.
Hot rod burger was tasty. Good loc surrounded by plenty of food spots in the hipster Little high eatery. Will he back

(This is probably closer to 3.5 stars to me.)  Bacon Bros. is located in the funky Little High Eatery conglomeration of restaurants.  The burgers and fries are very good, and served in large portions.  My family had split perceptions of the unique fried cauliflower side, between being excellent and being good-but-a-little-too-sweet-because-of-the-honey-sauce -- I recommend trying them and deciding for yourself.  The staff is friendly, patient, and efficient.  I'd happily come back again.
So to start with this place is inside "the little high eatery" staff is friendly, food is relatively inexpensive, and quite decent.
Excellent burger in fabulous concept. Ciabatta bun fresh and not overdone. Will be back!

The burgers were ok but a little overrated. I wasn't a big fan of the bun. The fries were pretty good but we're literally SWIMMING in bacon. I normally wouldn't complain but it was a little overwhelming.

This place was a little difficult to find, because it is located inside a building that is shared by a bunch of other restaurants. Once inside you'll find a host of other delicious eateries, much like a hipster gourmet food court. I ordered the Big Jim and it included fried chicken, bacon, avocado, and a yummy aioli (a NZ favorite which is a more delicious version of American ranch dressing). I had to remove the fried chicken because I couldn't bite into the burger due to its size, but it was fantastic! I got the fried cauliflower as a side and it was absolutely delectable. They were drizzled with maple syrup which was a salty/sweet combination that made my taste buds flutter with excitement. The guy at the counter was super cool, and gave my husband a discount for having a rad beard. Also, something I thought was extra special was that anything on the menu can be made vegan!   Keep in mind that seating is a fight for your life ordeal, so be aggressive and send your friends to find a spot while you're in line to order, otherwise you'll be walking around forever trying to find a spot to sit. Still worth all the trouble, though. All in all, one of the best meals we had in New Zealand, and the best food in Christchurch.
Great burger,  excellent friendly staff. If your family doesn't all want burgers there are other great eateries in this indoor gourmet food court.

Very cool place tucked into a conglomeration of eateries called Little High. We came for breakfast sandwiches and added onion rings (10am, right?). Everything was delicious and the vibe in the place was perfect for a rainy Christchurch day.
This is one of the most popular eateries in the Little High complex so be prepared to wait.  The burger was delicious - good quality meat patty with tasty bacon - and the chips were amazing!!

Exceptionally good and an excellent value!  Bacon Bros Burgers are located INSIDE 'The Little High Eatery' which has multiple fine eating establishments.  It's on High Street, but it's a little hard to find because you're looking for the Bacon Bros sign which is hidden, so look for the 'The Little High Eatery' sign (see the picture I posted...)  The whole eatery is more like OFF an alley off High Street and is easily obscured by some taller buildings.  Doesn't matter, FIND IT, it's worth it.  'The Little High Eatery' has about a dozen really cool, bohemian, artesian places.  Always better to support local than chains, go get out of Bubba Gump or the Olive Garden, and go to Bacon Bros.  Seriously kickin' burger, cooked perfectly, all the ingredients were fresh, the brioche bun soft but slightly chewy at the same time, and some nice slab bacon on top.  Very reasonably priced.  ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!!  If I lived in Wellington I'd be a serious regular and they'd know my name within a couple weeks.  It's a serious burger done right...

Best chicken bacon sandwich of my life. So huge and delicious. I didn't need to eat for 7 hours after! Ha. Coming from the US, people talk about Fergburger in Queenstown being the best burgers in NZ. But having had both, I say Bacon Brothers hands down is better. Just go and eat there. Located in the Little High Eatery. You won't regret it. Pro tip: go before 11am. There's no line.

Delightful customer service, however very disappointed to be informed that of the two vegetarian options, neither could be fulfilled to their full potential. On a positive note, we have discovered a new found love for cauliflower. 5 stars for the cauliflower and customer service. 3 for everything else.
Very friendly staff, great menu with a wide selection of drinks to go with awesome bacon buns.

Friendly staff and delicious food. I ordered the Bernie and it was ready in no time. AMAZING and reasonably priced. I would definitely drop by again. Was tough decision in little high eatery as there were many options but I'm glad I went with this.
Best Guinness in town, happy staff, pleasure to drink here.
Great place for a lunch meal deal plus a Guinness

Had a bad meal first time we visited but thought we would be fair and try again. BLOODY AWFUL. I ordered the Calamari with capers. The capers were fried burnt hard and inedible. The Calamari was not the round rings but the thick curled type. So tough the knife would not even cut through it. I tried a bit and it was so hard and salty I could not believe any restaurant would serve up such a terrible meal. When the server came and asked 'how was it' I said I could not eat my meal as the Calamari was tough. Her response 'oh sorry about that' and walked away. She needs to be trained to satisfy the customer not ignore them. Won't bother giving them another chance.
We order calamari it was that chewy and tough we couldn't eat it the bar maid did say sorry, but that's all no offer of refund or another meal. We will not be back .
Good pub grub. Friendly staff
Nice food. Love the daily specials. Friendly staff
Unfortunately under a new establishment, I think the crispy spicy chicken is a different texture meat than before, disappointed and won’t be back! All the best
Absolutely amazing pad Thai ever eat…. Cooked like exact i wanted. Very good portion for two people in great price. Will Highly recommended to anyone who loves pad thai

The staff were very kind and polite. I had Pad Thai, which was packed with ingredients and very delicious. The portion was large and I was very satisfied. (I split it into two meals.) They also provided spices, so I was able to adjust the spiciness as I wanted. Thank you!
amazing restaurant, food is superb

Bali Thai is an excellent spot for tasty food at a great price. I really appreciate that they offer halal options (even though I’m not halal myself) and that they stay open late — so convenient when you’re craving something good at night. Highly recommended!”
Super underrated, big portions, tasty food and personable staff. Highly recommend!! Have now tried three of their dishes, each have been fantastic.
Great value for money.  Pad thai

One of the best East Asian Cuisines in Christchurch. This place has been a staple to me. The buffet options are tasty, quick on-the-go and there's a lot of variety on the menu to choose. It's also halal which is good since there's a limited amount of halal cuisines, especially the good ones. I recommend trying out the buffet option if you're in a rush somewhere or in need of a quick feed, if planning to dine in with the menu choices, I highly recommend the Thai Panang. Overall amazing cuisine, 10/10. Highly recommended trying this place out if you haven't.
Shit food

Bali Thai is my go-to spot in Christchurch for authentic Indonesian and Thai food — always delicious and full of flavour!! Ulfa makes the place even better. He’s always smiling, kind, and generous with his portions. You can really feel his warmth every time you visit. 10/10 would recommend.
Indonesians in Christchurch must eat here.
It’s my second time trying fried noodle. Great flavor. Definitely worth coming back for. Highly recommended
The best thai in Christchurch. So fresh and delicious. This is the Thai fried vermicelli with chicken. All the vegetables are crisp and tastes so good  would highly recommend. Lovely friendly staff.
Delicious food and fantastic service. I have been several times since the opening. Some of the best Thai food in Christchurch. Excellent value for money. My new favourite eating spot.
I ordered a chicken pad Thai, it was really good ! The lady who took my command was very kind. All the staff seemed very welcoming !
It’s the most delicious Asian food I’ve ever had in the trip of NZ.Worth to try

Quite a disappointment, unfortunately. The Tomyum was supposed to be spicy and sour. It was slightly spicy and not sour at all. The tofu was of the lowest quality. And last and worst, the whole dish was so salty that I couldn't even finish it.
Lovely food and fantastic service! Meal was delicious and ready super quickly, highly reccomend
Had tom yum fried rice, with prawns. And the ubiquitous fried egg. It was tasty!
Best banh mi in New Zealand!!!
Great food ! Value for money, excellent service.Thanks Mike

This place is   The prices are fair.  You eat with your eyes first and visually the kai pleases you with its basic but colourful presentation.  The biggest Bahn Mi in chch and also authentic and delicious (if you want chilli ask them to put it in).  The Phoʻ broth   it's hard to explain what to expect,  but when you try it, it will be more than what you expected.  A hidden gem in chch.

So glad we finally tried Banh Mi and Beyond! It’s delish! Wish we’d come sooner! Mike is lovely, super kind and friendly. The BBQ Lemongrass Chicken banh mi was absolutely scrumptious! Best banh mi I’ve had in NZ! We will be back for sure! Do yourself a favour and try this place! You won’t regret it! It’s a wee Chch gem!
Phenomenal Bahn Mis! Have tried many and this one is at the top!
Tasty food, reasonable price, friendly service. Definitely come back.

We ordered from this yummy Vietnamese Restaurant, thru Uber Eats, for the first time while we stayed a night in Chch. The food was so good  Deep fried spring rolls were so delish..we were worried only two wouldnt be enough but they were a good size! Plus we had the Pork noodles & that was such a good size feed & extremely tastey! Thankyou to the staff at Banh Mi and Beyond we were very satisfied!
Very friendly staff and amazing food.
Soooo good. The rolls are fresh and soft, and the they don't scrimp on the filling. Will be back to go through the menu.
Chicken satay sandwich was out of this world delicious!
Great banh mi, great price
Best banh mi in town, and accepts payments in bitcoin - what an absolute legend that understands the pure value of HARD money!
Delicious crispy bread rolls and balanced of meat and vegetable textures, and Bitcoin payment available!
Got a Tofu Bahn mi here which was the perfect kind of sauciness and just really tasty. Loved the tofu
So authentic, great taste,
It’s such a great little find! Amazing food that is delicious and good value for money. Best takeaway food! And good for you.

No complaints. Easy to order, nice space, fast service, helpful staff. The bahn mi was really good with a crispy and flavoursome pork belly. Veg spring rolls reminded me of the first time I had Chinese takeaways as a kid, well crispy with a perfect balance of earthy and fresh flavours. You can choose any sauce to substitute for any meal that comes with one, so I got peanut satay for my rolls and it rocked. I love that user-friendly aspect - menu just felt like it was there to explain what they can practically make, and if I wanted it a certain way I felt it could be accomodated. Nobody likes to get charged $2.50 extra because they wanted aioli not ketchup, after all. Popping boba limonade was a novelty for me and was a great refreshment against the rich food.

tried this place because I drive past there frequently loves me a pho n Bahn Mi looks flashy      BUT my Bahn Mi was pork too sweet. roll was to hard. and I ate 3/4 before giving up and throwing out. the Pho was mid stock not great beef fatty like brisket but the kicker was eat ins ate using a cardboard bowl and paper spoons like why would u use paper for liquid soup very disappointed won't be returning will go to the Colombo for better vietnamese or BBs in Centaurus rd gave feedback but they were not really interested unhappy customer

I was really excited to try the banh mi and pho here, the food looked delicious and the atmosphere was great. Unfortunately the food was not very good. The pho was very underwhelming and bland, even after adding condiments which were available on our table. And the banh mi was almost inedible, the pork was chewy and a lot of it I had to leave aside, the bun tasted old, stale and very hard to chew. I think there was just too much pickled veg on the banh mi and not enough freshness to cut all the pickled carrots and radish. I will not be going back here again as it was a very disappointing meal.
Not a Banh Mi expert, but this place is excellent value. Not sure many places can beat $11.90 for a chunky sandwich that tastes great. Will definitely be back

Popped down for lunch on a Thursday, just had a Pork Banh Mi. Great roll, with plenty of lovely fillings. Very happy with it for the price of $11.90. Would be nice to add fresh chilli on the app. Overall 5/5

Ordering was super easy on the Kiosk. And the workers I spoke to were very polite. We did wait a bit for our food around 6pm but it was busy so far enough. They did check in on us aswell and kept us updated which was kind (we weren't in a rush) The fruit tea was yummy and I love they make it transparent on the upgrade from a combo. The Pork Bahn mi was soooo good. Can't wait to go back again
Very Good

The lady that served me didn't look too happy a couple of us came in?  anyway I order the pork banh mi, the bread was dry and the pork was just a big chunk of fat. The only nice thing were the fresh vegies

I’m unsure if the owner changed for this place, as the mother and daughter working together were great. But the lady who works there isn’t the greatest at managing the business. I’ve come here a few times only for the lady to say we’re closed, which goes against the open hours. Also had the situation multiple times when she has said to me ‘we have no more stock’ which seems to be dishonesty for when they are busy. The noodle soups are absolutely delicious (when they are done right) as they have been diluted at times when busy. Maybe another employee could be helpful with the busy demand.

I was excited to try this restaurant, but unfortunately it didn’t meet my expectations. The pho broth was bland, and the meat didn’t taste fresh. Service was slow even though the restaurant wasn’t very busy. I really wanted to like this place, but I don’t think I’ll be coming back.
Best pho I’ve had in Christchurch by far - absolutely delish!
veryvery delicous ， and Chilli is too hot, don't add it if you don't know how to eat spicy food（好吃好吃
I love the pizza it’s super delicious
Don’t order from here. Foods horrible and false advertising

Bar185 is a great place to hang out in Christchurch. Good vibe, nice atmosphere, and the service was spot on. Samson looked after us really well – super friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. Definitely worth a visit!
Disappointed…I’ll order on doordash 1 Margherita was show in picture are woodfried and I’ll receive uncooked based like frozen..very bad taste waste of my money
Such a great place and atmosphere, great for a wine and to win on the pokies
Going on their food, should be closed down
Boss was so rude, the shisha was not strong enough. Do not go
Ordered a meatlovers on Uber eats, picture showed a woodfired pizza, what they sent appeared and tasted like a cheap frozen pizza. I would not visit here.
Food and service were both fantastic, we will definitely be back.
Lovely ambience, attention to detail and the food was delicious!
Amazing night out can highly recommend

Lovely find in downtown Christchurch. I had a chicken breast crumbed and dressed in apple slices and a lovely light sauce. My friend had a pasta ragout. Service was friendly and fast. Staff were attentive and very courteous. Would definitely go again on my next visit to Christchurch.

We had a fantastic meal at Bar Franco, would absolutely recommend it. Everything we ate was amazing, the drinks were good, the wait staff provided great recommendations of dishes to try and wine to go with it, the service was outstanding, and it was a great atmosphere.
We had a wonderful experience at Bar Franco. Delicious food and extremely helpful and friendly staff, what more could you want!
Great option for a dinner catch up with the girls

Fab service through the evening! Great Italian food as the menu is different than other Italian restaurant - so it’s worth for Italian food lover to try Bar Franco’s cuisine  - Love the open kitchen style too.

Excellent,  we thoroughly enjoyed, will definitely be back, meat cooked to perfection, I would order more salads/veges to go with it next time to balance out the meats,  we tried quite a few meat dishes and were even given a freebie! we were very full ! Loved the Yuzu lemon RTD drink!  It's very busy (popular)we booked and the waitress suggested to order some karrageen chicken which is quick to come out which served as a good starter.  No room for dessert unfortunately!  TY

Our favourite place but so seriously disappointed with the food last night. & we had a guest from USA.. salmon skewers - really undercooked & too much sauce on top , prawns seriously overcooked & dry. Lamb skewers - meat was so stringy & way too salty again. Scallops were great. Service great but meal was so wanting ..  Sorry but this was one of the poorest quality meals we’ve ever had at yours & such a disappointment - we were at the early 5.30 pm dinner service.
Very good wangu beef and Salmon sashimi.Beautiful deco with green plants.
Delicious food all round but the star was the Salmon Nigigri and Karaage chicken! Will definitely be back very soon!

Wonderful experience, sat at high table in front of grills, chef was very knowledgeable added to the experience, food excellent would be nice to see shiitake mushrooms instead of brown mushrooms, sadly missed out on the fish collar only salmon left, perhaps next time. Reasonably priced
Service was exceptional and food was delicious, definitely will return.

We visit Bar Yoku every time we’re in Christchurch and it never disappoints! The atmosphere and vibe are always great, and the staff are super friendly and attentive. The food is incredible -highlights for us were the beef tataki, wagyu beef sushi taco, and the kingfish skirt. One of our absolute favourite spots in the city!
Menu was very good but to much. Portion are to big. We are not able to eat all of it
Such a wonderful atmosphere, wonderful and friendly staff. The food was delicious and the coffee was so yum
Sells clean food but not a clean eatery. Smutty windows are very off putting!
Perfect but the food portions are a tad small alas
Excellent variety of vegan goodies here, from sweet to savoury. Definitely worth a visit!
Great coffee great vegan breakfast!
Wonderful vegan cafe with a plethora of colorful and healthy options! The staff was friendly and welcoming!

Came here at 10am with the intention to grab some takeaway salad for my lunch, the two salads bowls in the cabinet were half and quarter full, the noodle salad looked like the noodles were dried out and it looked like it's all been sitting there since yesterday. Lacks presentation and put me off buying a salad. It wasn't busy, why did the staff not top up the salads and made them look yummy. The potential is there, but the place looks rather neglected.

Barefoot Eatery (Ōtautahi) – Review by Zee Tana  Visited: Friday morning, 10:30am Dined with: My partner Occasion: First-time visit, curious to try a fully vegan spot  ⸻  We decided to try Barefoot Eatery in central Ōtautahi for a relaxed Friday morning breakfast. As a vegan-friendly establishment with a strong online reputation, we had decent hopes — especially for a plant based-aligned offering. Unfortunately, while the café looked good on the surface, the experience didn’t quite live up to the visuals.  First Impressions  The location is central and easy to get to. The space is light, open, and inviting, with an earthy, conscious vibe. However, it was immediately clear that the place was understaffed — just one staff member running front-of-house during a busy Matariki morning crowd. They were doing their best, but the service naturally suffered because of it.  Service  Friendly but understandably stretched thin. No formal welcome, no check-in at the table, and minimal interaction beyond the counter. With only one person juggling coffee orders, seating, and food delivery, there was little opportunity for engagement or support. For what we paid, we hoped for more than just transactional.  Food & Drink  We ordered: •	2x Big Vegan Breakfasts •	1 Soy Latte •	1 Long Black / Americano  Let’s start with the highlight: the coffee was excellent — easily the best part of the morning. Smooth, strong, well-balanced, and perfectly made. That alone almost made up for the kai… but not quite.  The Big Vegan Breakfasts looked amazing when they landed at the table — visually, they were vibrant and beautifully plated. But the flavour didn’t match the appearance: •	The scrambled tofu was watery and overpowered by the crispy chilli oil — lacking the depth we expected from black salt or seasoning. •	The mushrooms (only four small slices, and shrivelled) felt like an afterthought. •	The sausages were small and bland. •	No butter or spread on the bread, and no salt or pepper available to help adjust the flavour. •	The beans, tomato, salad, and aioli were delicious and well-balanced, saving the plate from a total letdown.  The portioning across the plate was inconsistent — some items felt generous, others almost tokenistic. The cost: $91 total, including a 15% Matariki surcharge (not unexpected, but it raised expectations that weren’t met).  Overall Experience  There’s potential here, especially for vegan kai lovers looking for a light, stylish brunch spot. But for us, the value just didn’t add up. The coffee is worth coming back for — but not the full breakfast experience, not at that price, and not until they sort out the balance between staffing and service.  ⸻  Final Thoughts  Aesthetically pleasing but lacking in substance where it matters most — flavour and service. We left feeling a bit underwhelmed

A fun night scene for 18 and ups to socialize and drink. It has a classy feel with a pretty outdoor setting. There is a dress code, so make sure not to wear sandals or casual clothes. I have watched friends get turned away at the door for even wearing nice tennis shoes!
Very cool and cozy spot, but didn't live up to its expectations or price. Staff were rather uninterested.

Tonight (30/12/16) around 930-10pm I was enjoying a few drinks with a group of mates when I ordered a drink from the bar (quad shot of jack daniels on the rocks), took it back to our table, had a sip and noticed the glass was dirty (lip stick all around the glass). I took the drink back to the bar and asked the blonde girl who served me if I could have another where she told me she would poor the drink into a clean glass, I said no I would like a new one altogether.  I have had meningitis before so even if the glass was cleaned I am very cautious which means I see the glass and the drink no longer sanitary.  So anyway, she poured me a drink but it was only a double shot. I told her the drink she originally served was a quad shot which is when she told me I had already had a drink and she couldn't remember giving me a dirty glass and she could just give away free alcohol. It completely embarrassed me in front of everyone at the bar listening making me feel like I was trying to score extra alcohol for nothing when putting the old drink and the new drink side by side there was clearly nearly double in the old drink. I said to her if that"s the case I would rather have my money back for the double that she had re poured as at this stage I was clearly not happy with the service and how she handled the situation, when she continued to tell me she couldn't give me a refund. I know it's only a glass of spirits but being embarrassed and having service like that just getting into town lost your bar 6 customers wanting to have celebratory 30th birthday drinks at your bar.

Baretta is an ok place for a drink. But the food is terrible, badly cooked and overpriced. The service is also not very good, quite Arrogant.  My Veal was chewy and not cooked correctly. Fillet steak and potatoes was exactly that. Nothing else no gravy no other veg or salad or even seasoning. Twice been here to dine. But I never will again.

If I could give this place a half star I would. The best food and wine in the world could not make up for the terrible service Baretta has to offer. I could have painted the Sistine Chapel in the time it took to be served. The "dress code" is ridiculous, there is better consistency in curdled milk. This bar is basically a rat with a gold tooth. I would recommend Baretta to anyone who is looking for a reason to be pissed off.

Baretta is one of my favorite establishments in the city for two reasons: 1) the food is amazing and 2) their outdoor patio bar is a great place to mingle with young professionals in the city. Visit Baretta on a weekend night and be sure you're into the bar well before 10:00 as the line of 20 and 30-somethings extends down the block. If you're visiting for the restaurant and a little taste of Italy in Christchurch, be sure to make a booking a few days in advance. They DO have Entertainment Guide coupons!  FOOD: My husband and I started with the grilled ciabatta with parsley pesto and olive jam. The bread was extremely filling, so I definitely recommend sharing with several people. The olive jam was my favorite spread, but the parsley pesto is light and bright and an interesting take on pesto. We decided to split the side salad with parmesan cheese on top and a light balsalmic dressing. It was a crisp salad with a lot of complementary tastes. I ordered the Chicken Leg as my main and it was cooked beautifully: juicy and tender. It was served with pickled pumpkins (which were very interesting) potatoes with ricotta and garnished with radishes. I cleaned the plate! I just wish there had been about one serving less of the pickled pumpkins. My husband ordered the Squid Ink Gnocchi with mussels and calamari. If you enjoy the smell of fish and seafood overload, this is the dish for you. My husband enjoyed it, but the smell was overwhelming for me (a non-fish eater). We opted to pair the meal with a bottle of Chandon, but their wine list is quite extensive and the waiter will be more than happy to offer pairing suggestions. In fact, the waiters at the restaurant are on top of their game. Never was a glass left empty nor were we left alone for too long (but not in a creepy hovering way). He seemed to have his eye on our table at all times which made the evening a breeze.  Step outside before or after your meal to enjoy a cocktail from the patio bar. Often there is live music playing and heated tables to relax on.  What's the catch for the place? Be prepared to hand over your first born child with the meal as it ain't cheap. But quality food and impeccable service comes with a price.

When Barretta first opened I loved it. I was probably their biggest fan, I told anyone and everyone to go and emphatically told them how ridiculously good the red wine sangria was. It's still an amazing bar with a tasteful ambience and the sangria that is great (I make better but initially I probably did not). Barretta is a good bar and definitely the place to be on a Friday or Saturday night after 10;30pm just don't show up after 10:30 or you will be waiting in a line half way down the block for over an hour due to the arbitrary carrying capacity the council put on the bar. It's a great scene but I wouldn't go here to meet people because it's quite a clicky crowd (more so than Aikmans/bardello) and can also be an older group on certain nights.

Nice spot!  Fun lively and spacious patio in the back with a live musician, casual atmosphere, good beers and wines.  We ended up having bar bites, with a couple of good thin crust pizzas and risotto balls.  The restaurant does serve a full menu inside, which has cool Hollywood Regency decor.   Fun vibe!

Great bar appealing to quite a range of patrons. There's a large area out the back with building facades set up like you're in some kind of Western. The entertainment was good on the Friday night that we visited.

The pizza was amazing - so it was absolutely worth wandering around for a bit to find this place! We didn't realize Base was in the Little High Eatery and it took walking around the block to find it. What a fun food area. A little something for everyone in the food court. We were very pleased with our pizza. The crust wasn't too thick, the right portion of toppings - it was perfectly cooked and worth waiting for. In fact, we grabbed a drink and an appetizer somewhere else while we waited.
Our go-to on UberEats. Always delicious pizzas. The mushroom feta is a must-try. Proper wood fired pizza bases and quality toppings.

We had the best pizza here!  This buzzing place is located in the Little High Eatery.  Looking online Little High Eatery has reservation times so we thought this included all of the restaurants, including Base Pizza.  Since no seating times were available we ordered takeout and walked over to pick it up.  I think the reservations are for indoor seating because there was plenty of open seating outdoors!
