We just grabbed a table and went up to the host and they simply moved our takeaway pizza up in the queue for "dine in" and it was ready even sooner!  The large pizza was perfect for the two of us.  Such great pizza!  Highly recommend!  (And if you're with a non-pizza lover, there are many other food options at this location)!
great pizza, love the little high. not a big difference between the small and large size though

This was great wood fired pizza. We came here twice on our trip. I was so focused on pizza I didn't even look at the rest of the menu until we were about to leave and I think I missed some other good things! Someday when I go back to NZ I will try the other items on their menu!

3 of us dined here tonight (July 2018) and throughly enjoyed our meal. It is situated in the little high eatery, which has an eating hall feel. Very hip and trendy with lots of boutique beers on tap throughout the 8 different businesses. I cannot recommend highly enough. We had the spring rolls from the Thai stall, very fresh. Our main meal was a pepperoni pizza (sgt peppers) and meatlovers (sir george). Very very nice. Base was the best wood fired base I've had. Toppings where spot on too.

The map is correct! Ignore the previous reviews, Base has moved from the restart mall to Little High. The pizza is excellent. Little High is a food court with about 8 appealing restaurants. Cool, funky, and busy. All of the offerings look good.

Excellent pizza. Crust is thin, but not crunchy like a cracker. Slices are foldable for easy (and quick) eating! Definitely made to order flavor. Pepperoni is also notable with lots of black pepper.  Hard to find with all construction, but inside upscale food court at Little High Eatery. Not in container mall any more, take note.

ITS NOT WHERE IT SAYS IT IS !  It's amazing pizza we really enjoyed it but the map says it's in re start mall but it's actually in a place called little high eatery. We made that mistake. But otherwise it's really really good pizza at a good price and I would highly recommend it!
AMAZING PIZZA! Made fresh and was cool to see it being made. Very friendly staff, defiantly recommend and certainly will be going back :)

Delicious pizza! The perfect blend between simple flavors and unique pizza combinations. I tried both the Moroccan Lamb and the Sir George pizzas. Absolutely fantastic. Portion size isn't huge, I'd say get a pizza per person. And for New Zealand pizza, it's got good prices. Overall, I'm a fan of Base.

Base Woodfired Pizza, undoubtedly serves the best pizzas in town! Located in the re-start mall, this is one of the many other restaurants, cafes, shops, food trucks located here. Really cool place to walk around by the way.  They carry a limited variety of pizzas and I really wanted to get the butter chicken pizza. Unfortunately they sold out of butter chicken pizzas that day and I ended up getting a large order of Moroccan lamb pizza. We were initially a bit skeptical because the menu board mentioned that they add yogurt sauce and mango chutney on top of the pizzas. But ordered it nevertheless and took a seat outside waiting until our token number was called.   Within a few minutes, our token number was called out and the pizza was served.  Oh my, this was way too good. The crust was thin and crispy, just the way I love it. The thin lamb slices were marinated an cooked well. The yogurt sauce and mango chutney which we were quite skeptical about worked out so well. And the arugula on top - yumm.  Two of us split the large pizza and it was perfect! Love this little find. Thanks to Yelp.

Nice place to have a good pizza. I have been there with the family several times.I love pizza and have eaten it all over the world and this is a good one. The place is also very cute it's at the container mall,there is always a great atmosphere. Love to go there.

I have been exploring food joints in the city lately and I found this place really good. They have some of the best pizzas in town and every food lover out there should try. My personal recommendations are butter chicken pizza, vege supreme, and almost everything in their menu :)

Freakin delicious pizza!  Located in the Re:START mall, this is a perfect stop for lunch or just a snack.   The Sgt. Peppers had a nice spicy marinara and meaty slices of pepperoni.  I  even came back the next day to try the butter chicken pizza which came juicy chicken and a mild curry sauce.  $10 for the small pizza is plenty to share.  Highly recommend!

Really good pizza with inventive ingredients in the heart of the container mall downtown Christchurch. As with virtually everything else down there, it is operated out of a shipping container, but there is a large beer hall style table in front that you can sit at while you enjoy your pizza. The prices are good and the pizza is interesting and tasty.
I'd say there's a lack of choice, but the pizzas are really excellent, the small sizes are perfect when you're not very hungry or want to try several
Very good pizzas, somewhat Neapolitan in style and cooked in a wood-fired oven.
Four cheese pizza with caramelized onion. Good bang for the buck.
Yummiest pizza in Christchurch town, Thank you guys for amazing pizza and service.

Ordered the Margherita from BasePizza on DoorDash. The pizza was chewy, tasty, and nicely cheesed—classic flavors done well. For the discounted price, it was very affordable and a solid choice for a casual pizza night!
Truly great pizza

The dough is very good, airy and crispy. The pizzas are quite original (4 cheese with red onion confit and garlic base) but it was really not bad. Generous portions. Friendly staff and pleasant environment. These are not pizzas with Italian toppings but they are good and the most important thing is the dough which was great
Shakes were delish!
This is honestly some of the best Indian food I’ve ever had, definitely a new favourite in Christchurch. Highly recommend!
Fantastic service, fast and polite. The food was gorgeous, thick tasty curries and a hot chicken entree that would knock your socks off! Could not complain about a thing.

This is our favourite Indian Restaurant in all of Chistchurch. The food is flavoursome & made with the  freshest ingredients. The manager, Naveen is so friendly, kind & helpful and makes us feel so comfortable. We look forward to returning soooon :) ~ Marcus & Tracey
Loved the naan, goat curry, and dum biryani! Naveen served us with amazing, quick service.
Food was quick, amazing, and the service was phenomenal.
Really good beef stew,friendly staff, best service in Christchuch i have ever tried

Taste of food was pretty good. The shaking beefs flavour was pretty on par with a good one however the beef wasn't as tender as I have experienced elsewhere but none the less not bad at all. Bahn mi was very fresh and delicious and would highly recommend. A word of advice tho...make sure to either order in advance or avoid during lunch as the place gets pretty swamped making wait times super long as it is only a small kitchen.

The most delicious Vietnamese restaurant in Christchurch. I  come here once in a few weeks. This beef noodle is their signature. It has a strong flavor but is very refreshing. My Vietnamese friend said it is very authentic.
Best food Best service
Great food and good service. The food has great flavour and definitely taste authentic. The lady at the front is always welcoming.

Such a cute outdoor eatery with some of the BEST Vietnamese food! We got their hue style beef noodle soup which had SO much flavor and was different than any other pho I’ve ever had, the tofu vermicelli bowl which was also extremely flavourful, and the seafood noodle soup was the perfect comfort meal.
Wonderful

40 minutes driving trip from Burnside to this hidden gemstone. Wish I knew about this heaven earlier. The most authentic Vietnamese food in Chch I have visited Great taste/seasonings, freshness, no cut corner, wide range of selection(which you don not find in most of similar restaurants/eatery). I took away Banh Mi 12 dollars one. and BBQ pork sausage vercimi.(number 40). Rarely, it was not overseasoned with rare ingredients you do not find out side of Vietnam. Vietnam is my home and a happy workplace and it has been almost 20 years since last visit. I can not describe how thrilled I was to have such an experience-literally 1 minute back to Vietnam. MUST TRY.

I had the vegetarian Bahn Mi and my husband had the chicken satay Bahn mi. We had it delivered delivered on Uber Eats so had to check menu on Google because Uber Eats did not properly describe what was in the vegetarian. Added some chips and they came a good size to share as a side for us. Hubby didn't like the onion in his because he's not a fan of onion.
Very authentic Vietnamese banh mi and spring rolls. Delicious and lovely couple
BB’s is the best takeaways in Chch by such a margin. The Bahn Mi are so good. A+++++
very tasty
12/10!!! Best banh mi we have had in Christchurch!! So happy we stopped in.

came here this morning! such a cute lil café with friendly workers and free wifi. ordered a soy flat white... it was super good! nice and strong coffee. cool local art for sale inside. the food in the cabinet and the menu items looked good too. will be back the next time i'm in christchurch!

This is a popular 'hipster' cafe, food is organic and free range and tasty.  It's a small menu, and a little more expensive than a chain store, but worth it. Coffee is excellent and I have been known to drive across town for it. They also have a payitforward option. The staff are usually friendly and social and change regularly as they employ seasonal workers. I've grown up with this place over the last ten years and seen his business grow and develop, in the next couple of years I expect I won't be able to get a seat due to popularity. Try the potatoe hash, it's housemade :)
An alternative vibe in this cool little cafe. Still not too sure how I feel about it might need to come back a few more times.   The food was ok. Lots of vegan and vegetarian.

Man this place is a cool little cafe and much bigger than it looks from the outside. I love the mismatched 70s furniture and the funky tunes. The staff are friendly and very accommodating considering we went off menu. All hand made treats and a range of vegan meals to tempt the fussiest of eaters.
It was okay, but the eggs Benedict weren't cooked properly. Salmon was lovely, presentation was great. Had a lovely time
Porkies room. Friendly people. Yummy food. Casual. Relaxed atmosphere.

It's a great  pub staff are genuine  and prepared to make conversation and make you fell welcome Prices are not exuberant  and are average price point It's one of the  pubs that are hidden gems and off the tourist route Haven't tried the food yet Lots of meat tray raffles Wed Thursday Friday Saturday  and a live band on Fridays They also run a courtesy coach as well Another great night
A great bar real nice staff an nice people cheap drinks lovely food on fri thank you all staff love going their great pokes thank you see you soon again
A real pub!

Conveniently placed at the northern end of Belfast, just before you join the motorway. Has a reasonably priced bottle shop and an equally good selection of beers. Food here is solid pub grub, nothing outstanding, but pretty good nonetheless. Huge carpark surrounds the side and rear of the pub, with more than ample parking.
The food was great, authentic Chinese food.
Good food, very very yummy yummy., Staff very kind!
My favourite dish is Beancurd Beef (豆花牛肉）. I tried not spicy one today, unexpectedly delicious. I don’t know they could cook non spicy one. Well done.

It's super, super salty, but I still came here four times. People are so contradictory. In fact, the fried rice, roast duck, and tofu are okay, and the soup and the soup that comes with the rice are also good. However, some dishes are super salty, such as the mixed stir-fry, pickled cabbage, bean sprouts and shredded duck, and Kung Pao chicken. The taste is very, very good but also very salty. Why is that? Is it to sell drinks? Obviously, Uni-President was my favorite before, wuwuwu
Enjoyed our time at Benson's,food was awesome

Just ate there this evening. Four in our party.  Two entries brought out within a few minutes of each other. The other two entrees still had not arrived 20 minutes later. We asked one of the servers to check on them. She went in the kitchen, came out but did not return to our table.  Ten minutes later we asked another server to check. Clearly the order was lost. 5 minutes later one of the lost entrees appeared. 10 minutes later the final one arrived.  Absolutely terrible experience and the indifference on the parry of some of the staff was abhorrent. Would not recommend going there.

Benson Chinese Restaurant has been serving quality and delicious Chinese food for over 10 years. I was brought here by my cousins who have lived in Christchurch area for the last 9 years and have been coming to Benson's for that long. My aunt made a point to treat us to the spicy beef soft tofu stew as it is her favorite dish of the whole restaurant and that's a must try if you're down with spicy food. The fried tofu for the appetizer was really good as well. Definitely a must try if you are in Christchurch!

Don't come here unless you want to have possibly one of the best steaks of your life. You could possibly slip into a food coma and awaken to a reality that you might never again experience the life changing, mind altering, 3rd eye awakening taste of the steak from this place. It that a world you want to live in? Or are you content living day by day only eating bland and tasteless foods? I'm not thats why I went to Bessie's. I now exsist in a higher life form then most. I have transcended reality because of the glorious stakes I received
Awesome food and service!
Thank you Morton. We liked the place, the food and the ambiente
Fantastic steaks including the rib eye, tomahawk and eye fillet. The sauces a sides were great. Panna cotta was a highlight. Service was also cordial and prompt.
Honestly loved this meal and the experience, no rushing, drinks arrived quickly, service (Chloe) was amazing as we were all the staff. Food was fabulous. A truly great night. thanks

Went to Bessie tonight for the first time ever after thirsting from afar for quite a long time - 6 of us all had absolutely fantastic experience. The food was top-tier (special mention goes to the tartare with bone marrow omg) as was the service which was some of the best I've experienced in recent memory. From the moment we walked in Lawson and Ava were so attentive and friendly — any restaurant would be lucky to have them. It wasn't just great service but the impression I had that they would just both be such fun people to work with too. All in all, we're super grateful to the whole team and the establishment for a great evening.

I was given a very unfavorable table, even though there were plenty of free seats in the nicer corners of the restaurant. I finally gave feedback about it. Unfortunately, they didn't take me seriously.  The food was very good. Very expensive for New Zealand.
Accepted our reservation. Showed up and the restaurant was closed.  No prior email notification. Wasted our time.
Best kebabs in Christchurch, a matter of fact all there options are mouth watering delicious. Great service and best way to start or finish your night out, highly recommend Best Turkish Food Co
Best place for kebab

I am so disappointed with the food delivered to me. They tried to blame it on uber eats for it being cold but really this was a total sloppy waste of money… When I spoke to the manager he didn’t care about the poor quality of food and hung up on me twice I highly advise not to bother wasting your money on this lazy sloppy bad quality place.. Pictures to follow.. No trying to make this terrible order any better He doesn’t care

Wow my option was the falafel burger combo... boy oh boy was my dinner and save some for midnight snack... This falafel mix is beautiful so tasty - I am a meat lover but I was dying to find somewhere who can do it well $24 at the time of my visit for burger, decent amount of chips and a drink - not a very long wait and service was quick and friendly...I am very happy I'll be back to try more
Awesome place , good people 10/10
Good service
Very friendly staff and patrons. Good snack meal. Great music. Parking easy.
Music was too loud in smokers area otherwise all good
The karaage chicken curry is so good
Generous serving, excellent customer service, and delicious food
I ordered the soy garlic KFC, chicken was crispyand was pretty damn good.

Ordered big bang chicken and sushi through Uber eats. The mozzarella hotdogs are amazing. Yummy chicken karage bowls. Waffle fries and dumplings are good too. All very tasty and fresh! Will definitely buy again!
Nice place. Friendly staff, food is good value and yum

The chicken was too overcooked. It was so tough that my jaw hurt, and it was so chewy and tough that it felt like chewing rubber. It was not worth even giving it half a star. If I could, I would give it a minus star. I would absolutely not recommend it. Don't eat this chicken. It will break your jaw and teeth.
shout out to the owner, good lad

Great place for a quick and varied Chinese dinner. Fill your own take-away container from the variety of dishes available from the buffet, and if you don't fill it full enough "Ma" will top it up!! I find a $14 option enough for 2 meals. Hint: always put noodles on last as these fill the gaps between the dimsims and other goodies and squash down well :)
I always come here when I'm craving takeaway Chinese! It's tasty,  cheap and always satisfying!

I got food poison from here was my third time to try again sooo I thought of Chinese this time and will not try and go again after that one meal of sour pork and rice. That was the only meal I had that day .
Lovely friendly staff. Food is delicious and very reasonable price
Only place I buy Chinese from love it
Best Food, Best service. Great vibes. This is the best shop in Christchurch. Young handsome man serving the best meal
Curry is ridiculous
Poor quality food not visiting again.

I visited this restaurant yesterday and ordered the Amritsari Kulcha. Honestly, it didn’t look or taste like a real kulcha it was more like a simple potato naan and was half cooked. Quite disappointing. The service was quick and the server was polite and friendly, but the food quality really needs improvement. I wouldn’t recommend the Amritsari Kulcha here.
Tasty Indian street food at reasonable prices.
Food thali was great .....and good atmosphere with good customer service.

Extremely Disappointed – Rotten Food Served  I ordered Paneer Tikka Masala (large) and Butter Roti from Bikanervala Christchurch today, and the food was completely unacceptable. The paneer was rotten and tasted bitter, clearly spoiled. The dish wasn’t prepared properly, and the overall quality was terrible.  This is a serious food safety issue — serving spoiled food is not only unprofessional but dangerous. Very poor service and lack of quality control. Would not recommend this place to anyone unless they improve their hygiene and food standards.  Date: October 17, 2025 Order ID: #127 (Takeout – “Kush”)

We got food fish burger and chicken snichel and the food was OK chicken was dry half of it. but I order mushrooms sauce paid extra and they said it was coming out soon and never arrived we waited 30 minutes. Had to wait 45 minutes to even get our food at the start. Waitress staff was great from one and other Waitress staff didn't even talk to us. I use to go there and they where so great now we have been a few times and we do not get good service or its bad food. Chips where not chips
Awesome atmosphere when Jo's in the house
Great atmosphere, delicious food  awesome staff
Great little pub. My local. Great happy hour, nice food, delicious roast meals
Nice food, good quantity and tasty. Nice price too.
Was great especially Jo one of the staff . Is awesome with  ppl and makes you feel welcomed every time . Great with kids . Great food
Best roast around. Good value, generous portion, and delicious.
Had a pork roast and pavlova for $22, very  yummy and that combo took me back a few years

Looking for a local, my daughter and I came here last night, after we sat and got our drink the quiz night started, small venue, so very disruptive to conversation. Our starter arrived at the same time as our mains, so was barely touched, we were not meal checked at all, and my sirloin was so chewy half remained on my plate, my daughter's Flintstone was tender, but her duckfat potatoes had been cooked in a dirty fryer, should be golden, not brown and crumbly. As the nervous waitress (also smelling strongly of cigarette smoke), didn't know seasonal veges we took pity on her and ordered salads, also acceptable but nothing great. Staff were apologetic about mixup in delivery and offered 1 free drink, which i didn't accept, I expected the starter to not be charged for. They took it off with reluctance, and when presented with gold card she took it, but didn't get right discount. Unfortunately she didn't offer receipt, and I was to flustered to ask. Definitely will not be returning.
It’s a wonderful restaurant!
Went there for friends birthday lunch today. Food was really good! We all enjoyed our meals

Had dinner there for my mums birthday, amazing service. the man who served our drinks and food and brought out my mums birthday cake went the extra mile with his service, will definitely be back again
The food was excellent, the steak was perfectly cooked, and the staff was attentive.
We had the pork belly and the ribs both were delicious. The service was really good. We are looking forward to trying some of the other items on the menu
Great food and ambience! Meals were filling and prices were reasonable.

My partner and I went for breakfast. The poached eggs were overcooked, the cheese scone was lumpy (they hadn't even heated it), and the apple and caramel muffin was dry (it didn't taste like apple at all). To top it off, their card machine broke down just as we arrived. They told us they were fixing it and that we should order anyway. In the end, they didn't fix it, and after spending three weeks on vacation in New Zealand without withdrawing any cash, on the last day, a few hours before boarding our flight, we had to withdraw money and pay the ATM €3 in fees because of this breakfast. If they had told us we had to pay in cash, we would have gone somewhere else (and maybe we would have had a decent breakfast). And the place smelled like fried food; we left with our (freshly laundered) clothes smelling awful.
The ambiance here is great love the decor diverse group of people here for coffee and breakfast staff are friendly thanks always enjoy my detour here
My meal was pretty good, but I waited to be served for 40 minutes and I was a party of one. Other people sat down and were severe long before me.

THE BEST TASTING COFFEE in Christchurch--without a doubt! Always friendly and fast customer service. I think their menu could be freshened up more often with some lighter meals, but other than that it's amazing!

Stumbled across this cafe when I was looking for a place to study in Christchurch. They had nice outdoor seating with a rustic/modern look. I ordered the waffles, and it was a rich and delectable treat that looked pretty, too! I'm happy to have found a nice cafe to indulge my sweet tooth! I also enjoyed their meat pie.

After following Google maps with several trips around the block we found this warm and buzzy cafe where we enjoyed good coffee and breakfast. Parking in a city one is unfamiliar with was a challenge but saw there are parks at the cafe's back entrance. The place was very busy attesting to its popularity.

I'm a bit fussy with snack foods and hate sweet things so it's hard for me to find a snack at cafes that is small enough to be considered a snack but not a super sweet cake or slice. I ordered the Bounty Bar Slice purely because it has a little sign saying "refined sugar free" . Oh my lord it was amazing! They have heaps of gluten free options which is awesome for those customers. The place was packed solid at 11am on a Wednesday but the staff are efficient enough to handle it.

This place feels a little tucked away but it's worth the stretch of the legs to discover this beautiful cheery cafe. The staff are friendly, quick to clear tables and keep the place looking welcoming. Although busy when I arrived it took no time for the coffee to turn up and with good upbeat background music, vibrant feel and lots of seating options this is the place to enjoy a good cup of Joe.

Lovely coffee shop with delicious food! I had the avocado toast which was incredibly tasty and reasonably priced. For coffee, I tried the siphon (also spelled syphon) brew of an Indonesian bean...absolutely delicious. Black Betty makes for a fantastic brunch spot with plenty of seating.
Absolutely delicious!  I got the Stacey's Stack, and the pesto hollandaise was perhaps the best hollandaise sauce I've ever had!!

A very good, and very filling bacon avocado sandwich plus some crazy coffee selections in a country that seems filled to the seams with great coffee. When I went it was a particularly dreary and rainy day and Black Betty provided a nice bit of respite.
Great atmosphere, friendly staff, fresh food, and good coffee. Love that they offer vegan/vegetarian options and kid portion meals. They also have a little area with toys for the kids.

I had an amazing chai latte and the big veg breakfast. I loved the latte. The dish was okay. My friends had Betty luck with their dishes. Betty's granola was phenomenal !! The crispy bacon hash was also very good.

Great service. Everyone is so nice. Had their cappuccino, latte, Mexican breakfast fish and the veggie big dish.  The Mexican breakfast was amazing. Especially their chipotle cream sauce which I mixed into their veggie big breakfast. But the service here alone would bring me back!

Service was great buy there was no table service and a long queue with only one person at the till. It didn't seem like a very efficient way to take orders The food was out quickly and was nice but nothing to rave about (I had the smashed avocado) My Syphon coffee was beautiful!!!! And the girl who served it was awesome :)

Great food, great coffee, free Wi-Fi, and a cool atmosphere. The coffee is good compared to other cafes, and the food is fantastic. Try the French toast crumpets.  They also have a wide array of coffee brewing methods. I tried the "Aero-press" coffee and they explained in detail the process of that brewing method when they brought it to my table.

This place was fantastic.  As a first timer, I was not sure how it all worked, so showed up Sunday morning to a line (fortunately inside).  I stood there patiently waiting and watching amazing coffee and food pass by.  I finally arrived to the counter after passing all the goodies.  Made my order got  a number, found a table and sat down.  The coffee came first and my friend ordered tea.  Her milk came in a little poison bottle which was very clever and cute.  My latte was perfect! Food next.  Spin on English breakfast.  Impressive display and amazing flavor.  The ambiance, food, and service were fantastic.
This place is awesome.cute tbles. Good coffee and a ton of yummy brunch options. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a sweet coffee and brunch spot

Used to be my favorite but not at more unfortunately. There is hair in the dish,the potato taste not right - something is out of date. When I ordered at the counter I wasn't even asked how I'd like to have the eggs cooked.
Great coffee shop! Has a minimalist and clean look. Food is to die for. The tea is great, the croissant with chicken and avocado is my favorite.
Really good, had avacado smash for brunch - was delish and fresh  Super quick too - was out in 10mins  Coffee really good, milk silky etc

Really cool Cafe in the centre of town. Was packed when we arrived at 11am on Sunday for brunch. But that is a sign that the place is going to be good. We found our own table and the waitress explained it was a 25 minute wait for the food regardlesss if it was kitchen or cabinet food.   I ordered the avocado smash and a flat white. The coffee was amazing! I would come back just for that. The food was also top notch though. Great presentation and a generous portion. Overall a very good experience and would highly recommend this Cafe. Only thing to keep in mind is a wait time for food during peak times.

Nice food. A few different spins on the traditional breakfast which mixes it up a bits. Choice is also pretty decent too.   Coffee is delicious and you can tell they are nerds and put a lot of effort into it.   A cool setting with plenty of space and nice friendly staff. Definitely worth a visit

A fun and trendy spot for our afternoon in Christchurch. We had the desayuno de Mexico (tasty though beans were undercooked) and the creamy mushrooms (one of the better creamy mushroom dishes I've had recently). Really enjoyed it, but will probably try a different cafe next time I'm in town.

What a neat place! We are so glad we came here before we left town. The building is charming and fun to look around while inside. We had the boiled eggs and bacon twist and poached eggs on toast. Both super tasty and the bacon wasn't overly fatty. We arrived early and there wasn't any wait for brunch but it appeared to fill up quickly. They seem to really like their coffee and have coffee plants everywhere! Don't miss out!
casual dining atmosphere. good food. ppl enjoying affluent breakfast. lastly, it gave me a kind of insights for the dining business.

When I was at CPIT I used to come here purely for the service. Recently I've tried cooked breakfast and it is SO good. I have no other words to describe the food other than YUM. Compared to other cafes in chch, this is by far the best!   The food always comes out so quickly (sometimes amazingly quick) and the staff make a point to be friendly which makes it overall such a great environment and experience- no matter if you're by yourself doing a bit of work, or with a group of friends out for brunch. It's always a very busy place which tells me I'm not alone in my love of this place.  Lastly, as a barista of many years and a very picky person when it comes to coffee, I'd like to make a point of saying how consistently delicious the coffee is here, no matter what kind!   I'll gladly travel across town anytime to come here. Worth it.

I found Black Betty on yelp when we first arrived in Christchurch and were dying for some coffee and breakfast. I'm so glad that I listened to the reviews. This place is amazing. I'd kill to have it as my local haunt. They have a huge, really cool looking facility with plenty of seating. Their menu was broad and diverse. The coffee was the best though. Thoughtfully crafted, smooth and delicious. I absolutely loved it. Would it be weird if I flew half way across the world just to come back here?

2nd day in Christchurch and came here for breakfast. We were not disappointed. Great breakfast with gluten free whole meal toast. Breakfasts are not cheap but with free range eggs and bacon you can't go wrong.

Christchurch is meh but this place is awesome! Courteous and friendly staff and the food was amazing. I got the Shakshouka while my girlfriend got the Black Betty's Breakfast Stack. 10 out 10, just go there already!

I'm a coffee snob. There I said it. I'm a coffee snob and this shop gets 4 stars. The coffee here is amazing. I had a soy milk latte and it was perfectly foamed and not burnt. I'll definitely be back here.   I didn't have the food (still trying to swallow high NZ prices for brekkie) but what I saw coming out of the kitchen looked fresh, clean, and delicious.  Staff were quick to talk about GF/DF options and said they could happily accommodate a range of diets. Thanks so much folks!
Really nice coffee! & I'm picky. Great brunch too. Interesting atmosphere - but often quite busy.

We recently visited black Betty's when The restaurant wasn't busy and in sad to say my Last experience was really poor, both service and food was not good. Wouldnt go back. I tried to get the attention of various waitresses which just didn't happen so before I left I left a note with my number asking them to call so I could give them this feedback.. No response at all which indicated they weren't interested. Not s good effort from one of the city's supposedly better cafes.
Place had a gd vibe and was very busy. Food was nice but luke warm. Finished my food before coffee arrived!

Enjoyed the relaxed state of the 2 male staff.I asked for a bagel and spread, in which one of the guys replied..."What do you feel like?".I like this approach.The spreads and bagel hit the spot.Coffee was bang on.

We only had time for one breakfast in Christchurch before beginning our drive down to Queenstown, and I'm sure glad we found this place on Yelp. The cafe has a casual, comfortable environment. They served me a delectable toasted sesame bagel with cream cheese and pesto, and the best flat white I had anywhere in NZ. I got a double shot in their medium-sized cup, and savored every last sip. The espresso tasted almost caramelized. For the rest of my two-week trip I was just chasing the dragon, but nothing else compared.

Black Betty is a work in progress, at least from a structure standpoint as it is still recovering from the earthquake. The food is definitely not WIP - it's outstanding. Terrific innovative egg dishes (which I love, as does my family), yummy crumpet based french toast (for my kids), and super coffees. I had the avocado smash - a poached egg on thick multigrain toast with a huge dollop of avocado on it. My wife had shakshouka - this first time I've ever seen this outside of Israel. We didn't have the pastries from the case, but many other patrons were eating them, and appeared to be enjoying them. Probably our only time in Christchurch, as we were just passing through, but in the off chance we're back - we're definitely headed to Black Betty again.
Great brunch, good size & value for money.  Chairs & tables were quirky - good vibe.  Will definitely come back here again
First time in Chch....stumbled in here, in search of coffee. Bebop floated on the air and cake looks divine. Good coffee, big airy full of light. Wide spaced comfortable tables. Very nice.

They close at 4pm which is the only downside. Amazing coffee, baristas and food. Also, great savs on offer and big pitchers of water you can get freely from the fridge. Very happy with my multiple experiences here!
Food is nice, they are known for their coffee. It's good but not amazing (to me anyway!), service friendly but sometimes slow.
Amazing food and coffee. Normally a bit if a wait for a table and/or food but its what you expect in a place of this size. Recommended.

I really like this place - very good breakfast served until 2:30, fast, efficient service, and cool atmosphere: wood everywhere, blackboards with Poe-ish chalk drawings of ravens, warehouse ceiling and comfy chairs. No wonder this place is so popular.   I tried the French toast crumpet with fruit compote which was very nice (14.50) - with sweetness from the raspberries balanced by the tartness of the yogurt. Not sure the bananas are necessary, but you get those too. Good flat white - only had to go with one sugar where I usually need 2. For the purist, they also have a coffee tasting set if you want to explore their variety of beans.

Felling a little bit hungry and friends had recommended Black Betty to us, the food from the cabinet was very high quality. My wife had a sausage roll which much was bigger then it appeared and a mixture of quality sausage meat, vegetables and herbs, she loved it, and I had a whole-grain chicken brie and salad roll. Staff were nice, overall a very satisfying lunch.
I really love the burgers and the service is fast.
Obviously the food was unreal, the aesthetic is awesome.  But the true asset to the business is Ben, he was so amazing and welcoming and gave us some great advice on what to do in Christy LEGEND
Hands down best burgers in CHCH   Fresh ingredients, delicious food, amazing customer service from Ben!!!
Awesome burger

Burgers were nice and juicy and the chips were also good. I think that the only thing that was missing from your burgers was seasoning. I think in this case seasoning was the difference between a good and great burger experience. Keep up the good work as I look forward to returning soon.
Meanage!!!!  The burgers are so delicious. I had the chilli cheese it was so bomb that I thought another burger. This place knows how to cook a burger fr.
In my top 10 favourite burgers
Excellent coffee.  The smashed avocado toast was super. It comes with a yummy salad and feta and toast. Highly recommended.

Small, stylish, simple. Most importantly delicious food and excellent coffee. We had a very tasty leek and potato soup, served generously and piping hot. The espresso is dark, strong and rich without being bitter.   Great spot for brekkie, lunch or just a cup.

Dropped in for a coffee- remember this place from 15years ago when I worked over the road in a building now gone, like a big part of Christchurch.  Coffee was ok, bit burnt but acceptable - food cabinet was fu of yummy looking stuff and the menu had some winners.

The restaurant was not full key they couldn't find  us a table. We went to the bar for a drink a Bloody Mary. It was just plain, they acted like we were not dressed well enough for the place. I guess the don't like tourists.

Beautifully cooked and delicious meals, well presented and fresh. Staff were attentive but not overly. Butcher’s Board was excellent choice with nearly 1kg of meat and 3 sides and 3 sauces paired. A very memorable night. Thx.
Fantastic breakfast buffet. Food all kept topped up, fresh, and top quality. Excellent service from the helpful and friendly staff
Best steaks in Christchurch. We have been visiting for years and never been disappointed. A range of delicious sauces and butters to accompany the meats and a range of potato and vegetable dishes.
Lovely meal and service

Been a few times for work functions. Great private function room. Service was top notch and the food was absolutely delicious. Vast range of wine beer and spirits on offer. They also do amazing cocktails.
Had butchers platter, very good cuts of wagyu, lamb and filet. Cooked just right medium rare. Good service.
Delicious beetroot bruschetta and Pinot noir. Great service in the bar area. Very comfortable time. Thank you.

Overall Bloody Mary's was a good option for a nice dinner.  Unfortunately the service was horrible while we were there. The waitress kept trying to take our plates and drinks away before we were done. I had to ask her three separate times to not take my bread plate. We were being pushed through our dinner. Then when we ordered more cocktails it took more than 30 minutes to get and we only got them after we flagged down another server.   They do have a nice cocktail list with good options. Loved The Sandi'a. The oysters were ok but very briny. I ordered an award winning New Zealand beef cut that was delicious. (Greenstone Creek Scotch). The potatoes that accompanied were underwhelming.   The atmosphere was a highlight - comfortable and classy.

Food was excellent! Unfortunately our experience was not the best. Due to our servers lack of knowledge behind the restaurant/menu. She did not introduce us to the restaurant or the menu. We ordered the oysters. "I'm sorry those aren't available. We sold our last ones last night." What? Why didn't you say that? They post the grams/ml for drinks / food. which we're not used to. I asked about the wine size in ounces. They post under grams 250. She said she didn't know. Of course I could do my own calculations on my phone. And ruin the ambiance. The steaks are definitely for sharing. She let us order 1 steak each. Never mentioning how big they are- a whopping 20 ounces. As soon as she left I waved down the maître d. I explained what had happened. And he said oh yes those are huge steaks. He went to the back to cancel one of our steaks. The manager then comes out and says it's too late. That they're already being prepared. That he would give us 50% off the steak. The Money was not an issue. It's food waste. I tried to explain the server issue without ruining our experience. Felt like we were getting into a back and forth discussion. The service we received was not at the level you would expect from a fine dining restaurant. I did hear our neighbors server explain every detail of the menu/restaurant. So they do have knowledgeable servers! Next time!
Great steaks, great experience, well worth it. One of my pork bellies was overdone but the other was absolutely superb. My partner got the Wagyu and it was mind blowing.

Food and service excellent.   The Silere Alpine Merino Lamb Rack was perfectly prepared and tender.   The fully loaded seafood chowder starter full of tender seafood.   We've been in New Zealand for two weeks and everywhere we went the lamb was great and found this the best so far.  Recommend giving this restaurant a go.

I wanted to have lamb lunch, so I yelped and found some lamb pictures on this place. After I got a menu I realized the lamb is only served for dinner. This point was a bit disappointing since the lunch was the last meal in New Zealand trip. I instead had serloin steak, which was good. So I had a good experience but if you are seeking for lamb at lunch it is better to look for other places.
Fantastic food. Beat meal we had on South Island. Venison was to die for. Highly recommended.

We had the chicken Caesar salad. Has to be one of de better saladas for centurions of Roman legions. It was mainly young tender but crisp lettuce. With crunchy bacon and dressing on side. The chicken was a bit dry. The salmon main was delicious garnished with mussels. Just warm with crunchy seared skin. The prices for the beef mainswere similar to countries which didn't grow cows. So took a rain check fora birthday party or anniversary.

We came here to order the Mary's Cut Aged Beef. It's 7-day aged and slow cooked over 24 hours. Leading up to the main meal we had the garlic flat bread and oysters which came out both fast and incredibly tasty. They were probably some of the best oysters I had and were light enough to prepare for the main dish. The steak itself was incredible. The meat was so tender and flavorful that you didn't need any additional sauce or seasoning, however if you want an extra level of depth I enjoyed the garlic butter and peppercorn sauces for just the right amount of added flavor. Afterwards we had the Mary's affagato which wrapped up the flavors perfectly.  Honestly the food was so good it left me almost in tears. The meat here is also sourced from a halal plant in the area so it's friendly for Muslim travelers like myself. A must-stop place if you find yourself in Christchurch.

Well this place lived up to its name.   Our steaks where very good.   The staff where helpful and very friendly.   There's not much more to say than if you're looking for a great steak restaurant then go no further than here.

In town on holiday and had the best meal of the trip! We were in search of something authentic to New Zealand and for me that was lamb chops. I have to say they didn't disappoint!! They were absolutely amazing and delish. My husband ordered the prime rib and he was as equally pleased. The roasted beets with goat cheese is were super yummy as well. My daughter ordered a steak and gobbled it up as well. The overall experience was topped by great service by Bella. We highly recommend you try it out!!!

The food was good, although the blue cheese and asparagus soup was tasteless with too much raw asparagus in the soup.  However, the service was really poor for a lunch time meal without a lot of people in the restaurant, took far too long.    We actually stayed at this hotel and just decided to try lunch on the last day.  The hotel is much better than the restaurant.

We didn't make a reservation so we walked in as we stayed close by.  They have to sides to the restaurant the bar (doesn't require booking) or the main restaurant which requires booking.  They weren't full either sides but the reception said they can only spare us a table in 20 min.  We had time anyway so we waited at the bar.  Staff were friendly.  The service was a bit slow.  Food was very good.  Esp the lamb.  But don't go if you are extremely hungry else you may faint before your food arrives.
Delicious steak and amazing sauces. Great service and a nice atmosphere. Able to secure a last-minute reservation and a reasonable price.

Wonderful experience at this restaurant. We had to choose between the fine dining area vs the casual dining because we didn't have reservation for a table. I'm glad we chose the fine dining because we had the yummiest chataeubriand steak for two. It came with broccolini and potatoes. Wow so good! They cut it up on a large board right on your table. Loved this dining experience! We dipped it in horseradish and it was perfect!   They have extensive wine list and beers too. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who would want a good steak!
Great food and friendly chef~ would definitely come back again!
Good service, good food.

This was the best brunch I've had in New Zealand!! The owner and staff were so friendly, and the food was delicious :)  The green-lipped mussels and steak pictured below were a recipe the owner told me I must try when I visit New Zealand, and they were absolutely delicious!! Thank you for the wonderful memories :)
Fantastic eggs benny. Took longer than I expected to make, but I wandered around the food hall and had a look at all the shops.
Lovely brunch dishes and fresh juices in the marrkerpalce. Very friendly service too.
The Canterbury Mushroom brunch was truly excellent. The Avo Smash was very good. Everything seasoned to perfection. Get a fantastic coffee at a nearby stall and it’s a five-star brunch.
Loved it! Breakfast was delicious. Very satisfied. Would dine here again no doubt
Excellent customer service and food.
Value for money
I requested a special delivery, and they fulfilled it with meticulous attention and utmost care. Their customer service was excellent, and they demonstrated a caring attitude toward their customers.

First of all, service isn’t right because they are not sure about their communication for delights. The food they serve is old, bread pakoda a big disaster atleast 3 to 5 days old. Bread and pakoda both have no flavour and lost freshness of product so greasy. Food is biggest drop down for this place.

WOW!  We found this restaurant by accident while wandering around town. It happened to be during Diwali, and the restaurant was absolutely buzzing with a joyous, constant line of customers that was moving quickly as sweets were flying out the door. It felt like an honour to witness it.  The take away menu is clearly marked with vegan options. We ordered the onion bhaji, mushroom pakora, dal tadka, aloo mutter & eggplant korma. The rice was complimentary. The onion bhaji were a little more dense & chewy than I am used to, but all of the food was genuinely delicious and we couldn't fault it. "Medium" heat for the curries was perfect for us, and the containers were generously filled. We'd definitely eat from here again!
Pleasant and warm friendly environment....food is great ...

Absolutely loved my visit to Bolina Sweets! The food was bursting with authentic flavor, every dish tasted freshly made and perfectly spiced. The sweets were heavenly, especially the gulab jamun and barfi — soft, rich, and full of nostalgia. The staff were kind, attentive, and made us feel genuinely welcome. The place is clean, cozy, and smells amazing from the moment you walk in. Easily one of the best Indian eateries in Christchurch.  I’ll definitely be coming back with friends!
Absolutely perfect place and the owner is awesome... maybe I go in there too often because I'm now well known XD either way best Indian restaurant in thus side of town!

One of best places to order or take a way. I ordered food and it was super delicious. They takes little bit of  time because they don’t keep most of the food and items on the freezer and just heat them and give them to the customers like other restaurants. They cook fresh and give you larger portions and cheaper prices compared to other places. I personally recommend to buy or order food from here if you really want to eat fresh . They even make paneer in an organic way from fresh milk. If you ordered and wait around 15 to minutes then you will be served a healthy, delicious and fresh food. I can’t wait to eat next time.
I buy most weeks via uber - every week i think this place cant get any better until the next time its even better. By far the best in the South Island
Incredible chicken saag, super fast service and the bro working there is a really cool guy 10/10 definitely going again
The best Indian food. They have great Butter Chicken, Tikka Masala and lamb Rogan Josh. Naan is fluffy and buttery. Very delish!

Absolutely amazing experience! The food was full of authentic Indian flavours — perfectly spiced, rich, and fresh. The staff were welcoming and attentive, and the service was quick even though the restaurant was busy. Highly recommend the butter chicken and garlic naan — easily the best I’ve had in Christchurch. Can’t wait to come back!
Great tasty food. We will be back!

Our dining experience at Bombay Butler was truly amazing. The food was delicious, Spacially veg  Manchurian was supartasty and the other food was tasty too, service was warm and attentive from the moment we walked in. I can't recommend this place enough Thank you Priyanka
Great tasty food, exceptional service 10 outta 10 would recommend. Will be back next time I’m in Christchurch
Very friendly customer service ,food  was so delicious  .I highly recommend everyone to enjoy your special moment with Bombay bulter
Best garlic naan I've ever had.
Hahahah the staff was really really nice, we had a birthday party there and they were really engaging and helpful they hyped up the atmosphere and made everything lively

restaurant: Bombay Tandoor quality and quantity takeaway.

reviews.text: Very nice and fresh Love the flavour
One of the best food in Christchurch, We had chicken bhuna masala and garlic naan it was so delicious so I highly recommend to everyone please try once you won't be regret .
Beat food in the town so I highly recommend to everyone please try once.

This Restaurant Deserves a 5 star.. Best Tandoori Chicken I’ve had in Christchurch.. Balti garlic chicken was cooked to Perfection.. unlike other Restaurants they provide Authentic Indian flavour and spice in their curries.

Not very impressed when you spend $90 and you and your family end up with food poisoning. Not that we will get offered a refund our money back or a fresh order We ordered butter chicken combos x2 mango Lassie and onion bhaji x4 and garlic naan and cheese naan x2
Kinda ok. Nothing to rave about. No taste to the prawns.
Delicious takeaway curry. Thanks.
Delicious food (small plates / sharing style) with unique flavors, great drinks and friendly staff - what else can you ask for!

Four out of four stars because we were there for an early meal and did not experience the more late live music etc. Another time. We are a family of four with the oldies keen on jazz and blues, so a winner withe the set up and piped music. It feels like a place that goes off later in the evening, but cannot comment on that yet. The staff are friendly, efficient and not intrusive, just right for our needs. The drinks menu is extensive with us two oldies just having beers, but our son had a Roger Rabbit? cocktail which he really enjoyed with his sweet tooth. But the range is extensive and only limited by your imagination and liver. The food is based on southern USA and can be summed up as delicious sticky goodness. We shared some pretzel bread with a chilli molasses butter, which sounds interesting, but tastes divine and some Cajun fries which cater for the more timid Kiwi palate. Missy had chicken sliders which literally disappeared within minutes as we shared some Bourbon and coke ribs, gooey and tasty. We also tried the chicken tenders with a maple and black pepper sauce as well as the sirloin with loaded tater tots, both of which were delicious. We have big appetites and we were unable to consider pudding. Great place, great food and I want to go back without the kids for a later night.

Came here for drinks and tapas.  I had a whiskey sour and my husband had another whiskey-based cocktail.  We had the macaroni and cheese, olives, and sliders.  All of it was pretty good, but the prices felt a little high for what we got.

We went for a Wednesday night to have some fun after dinner. It was an open mic night and the music was super enjoyable but we sat on the edge of the bar where there are several pointless wax candles burning. Midway through the night, a wax edge broke and it began pouring down on us, scalding hot to skin and staining to clothes! I ran to the bar to ask for help extinguishing the high candles and was actually laughed at by the bar tender. We were dealing with scalding wax burning us and the staff did nothing but laugh. It instantly went from having a wonderful night, to one of the worst nights out we'd ever experienced. I work in the industry, which makes dealing with such lack of common decency from others within the same industry even more deplorable. As an establishment, the candles should be removed for health and safety standards, as a staff, the male bar tender on Wednesday January 24th, 2018 should either be fired or taught how to treat other human beings with at least some sense of decency before being allowed to work in the customer service industry.

Honestly we didn't have many options. We had 3 other options and the main reason we ended up here was because the prices per meal were a bit lower. We didn't learn until we sat down and read the menu that the prices were only lower because this was a 'tapas' style restaurant. Whoops. So we ended up spending a lot of money on a little bit of food. But since the food was good I left it a good rating.  The drinks looked amazing but we were hungry and tired and not in the mood to add a hangover to our morning. Apparently it is all about their alcoholic milkshakes but the sugar would have kept me up all night and it was a freezing cold night and we didn't have a car and the hotel was a far walk from town.  We ended up sharing the deviled eggs app, the Venison balls, and the sliders. We ordered 2 beef sliders and one chicken slider and both were good. The beef was better so just order 3 of those.   Afterwards we weren't full but also weren't still hungry. Probably would go to the other restaurants next time.
Nice bar, good drafts. Super friendly service. I like the decor as well. The selection of beer is pretty vast. 7+ on tap
Cool little bar with tapas style eats.  The night we were there, they had a great musician there. Worth a stop.

Came here with 5 of my buddies and right away loved the ambiance. Great vibes, with a great DJ. We ordered ton of pizzas to the table as well as our own dishes, we were stuffed to the brim, great food. Drink selection was great, and the check ended up being less than what we all had in mind.

Love this bar! Great whiskey choices, live music, pool table, and the BEST bartender ever Marco! He takes his mixology very seriously, but is so sweet and makes sure ppl get served in the queue in order. Wish I could say the same for the other bartenders. They seriously don't pay attention to anything and the really skinny blonde one had a huge attitude when she forgot to put a chips order in. Like who on this planet sits and argues with a customer when you're in a customer service industry, have a receipt, etc. Kiwi's for ya-just can't ever admit they're wrong. Anyway I'll be here again and just make sure to be on Marcos side of the bar.

Best bartenders in town!  These guys take their craft seriously and it shows!  Fabulous food to go along with the wonderful drinks.  Largest selection of whiskey I have seen in town.  I just wish I could transport this bar back to Texas with me when I leave.

Best food and cocktails in town with a great ambiance, music, etc. We were lucky enough to have the regular music line up followed by a great live band. Try the fried chicken and sweet potato salad, best this side is the southern US. Adorable bartender who knows his craft with delightful cocktails such as "Atticus Finch" and the "Scarlett O'Hara". We tried everything on the menu and were not disappointed. Even a pool table for those interested. Cheers to Boo Radley's for their clever name and charm!
Awesome little bar! My husband and I were both happy with customer service and our meals. We will be definitely coming back.
Chef was awesome and entertaining . The mixed grill meat plate was all grilled and very flavorful. Hummus , baklava and Turkish coffee delicious !

Saw this place online and gave it a shot. I had the 'Mixed Chargrilled Platter' and a side of Pita. Was so good. You could tell that thought and care went into the preparation. Meat was perfectly cooked. Bread was perfect and warm.   Being a one way street with not much in terms of advertising you could easily pass it by, but was a really good find.
Amazing middle eastern food!!! The kafta and chicken kebabs taste authentic and remind you of back home! Come here if you’re looking for amazing food and shisha. 10/10
Very nice
Delicious meals and lovely service - a little complimentary plate of Turkish delight at the end of the meal to share. Great service, cheap and cheerful- ā good choice!
Delicious and authentic Mediterranean food. Highly recommended.
Excellent food, friendly staff, lovely atmosphere, we are regulars at Boteco now!
Best Mediterranean food in town :)
Great food and service
The food is excellent with generous portions. The staff are also extremely friendly. Try it out if you are in the city!
8.4/10 Choripan sandwich with cassava fries Great flavour . Would prob just get regular fries next time Drink was elite
best place
Healthy food
Authentic and tasty Brazilian food. We had coxinhas and feijoada and both were delicious! Great find in Chch!
Had the executive steak - honestly, one of the few places I’d order steak in, cooked really well, portion was perfect. Great value as well.  Definitely give this place a go! Lovely service too.
Super friendly staff and welcoming. This place is underrated and an absolute hidden gem. I would strongly recommend the beef meals, it is cooked with love.
Great feed, with so much flavour! Very friendly staff 10/10
Wonderful friendly service! Food comes out at a perfect rate and is all delicious! Barzooka lager goes hard
Unbelievable food and even better service! The pineapple to finish is a game changer!
Who doesn’t love a high quality all you can eat. Lovely service
Great food excellent staff great for a midweek night out
Incredible meal. The food was amazing and service excellent. Top tier restaurant and super fun.
Love the food. Great service.
Non stop food which is cooked and seasoned beautifully, the team are super kind and easy to talk to.

I've had to come back and review again as this place is such a good vibe, great tasting food at affordable prices , beautiful $12 breakfast with drink so unheard of in 2025 but this place is doing it highly recommended to anyone especially come here for breakfast!!!

I cannot recommend this establishment enough, the owner Sam is the most positive, encouraging and attentive host any bar patron could hope for. The Tuesday quiz is the shiz and the food is priced well, delicious, high quality and timely. Where can you get delicious $5 fries these days?? Bridies bar that's where.
Sam the bartender needs a raise!!! He is so inviting and so so sweet. He is the reason we keep coming back each week for the quiz night
Honestly mean place to drink! Staff is awesome!
Just ordered via uber eats a caesar salad, fries and a side of gravy. SUPER IMPRESSED!  Tastes and looks like people care  5 stars, will order again!
Be careful to check your bill - the barman just tried to charge me for burger & 2 beers when I only ordered one of each … he seemed pretty out of it, but we all have issues I guess
Good place for eat and chill
Bartender (owner maybe?) was unpleasant and queerphobic. Wouldn't come here again and wouldn't reccomend even if you're not queer.

Use to go here weekly but service has diminished. Very disappointing experience tonight. Booked for 6 people, it took 75 minutes before our mains arrived and only because we chased them up. People who arrived later than us were served before our group etc. Poor service attention, no replenished water and a token apology. Very good food though. Fortunately there are plenty of good restaurants around Christchurch with great service so will go elsewhere from now on.

I have been to the Buddha six once,and it's not one of my favourite restaurants.In chch there are lots of Thai restaurants and most of them mediocre.The place is rather nicely decorated ,the service is o.k it's just the food does not taste like the food in Thailand. I had Thai meatballs and hubby had green curry.

As far as Thai food goes in Christchurch, this is among the best we've found. I definitely recommend a booking for the weekend (bookings can be made online or over the phone). Despite being located off busy Riccarton Road, Buddha Stix is tucked back in its own private lot and the massive Buddha head statue and greenery that greets you almost makes you forget you're in New Zealand. The restaurant has a modern feel with a very small bar/tall table seating area and a larger room with a mix of seating arrangements for large groups or intimate seating. We were seated along the wall where one side is booth seating and the other is a hard back chair. The room is bright with lots of windows, an ornate red mosaic and multi-colored patterned wall paper above the booth seats. The two-seater tables are small, so I am glad it wasn't cluttered with any decor or condiments. We were greeted immediately upon walking in the door and seated just as quickly. The service from drink orders to dinner orders was also just as efficient.  The menu is very intricate with options to please anyone. For starters we had the Spring Rolls (6 for $8.50) which came out quick, were crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. The rolls were served with two sauces: a sweet sauce and a soy based sauce. I highly recommend this. Not your bag, baby? They have plenty of other options from chicken wings and guri puffs to fried pork balls and marinated spare rib. If you're a soup person, you'll have plenty of options, we personally opted to stick with a main as we wanted to order dessert. The dinner menu is jam packed with your asian favorites from fried rice to noodle dishes, but what makes Buddha Stix stand out are its curry options and stir-fry/hot plate dishes. I ordered the Garlic Chicken on a hot plate which was chicken and various vegetables cooked in a wok with garlic (frankly, I could have been hit harder with the garlic as they say it's a "must" for garlic lovers). This dish was served with white rice and has great flavor.  My husband had the Fresh Chili and Basil stirfry which he devoured. If you're a spice lover, you can request that the chef add some more heat, which he will gladly do. The mains are big portions and would be perfect split for two dinners. We took half of each of our dinners as takeaway.  For dessert, you must save room for the chocolate brownie. It is a slightly larger than normal brownie cut in half diagonally and served with chocolate sauce, vanilla ice cream and lychee sauce. This is one of the best desserts I've had in a while - if you're in a chocolate mood, this is for you! Overall, the entire meal was under $80 (including two drinks, a beer and a glass of wine). What a deal! With food this good and prices this cheap, we will be back again and again.

restaurant: Burger Station - Best Burgers in Christchurch, NZ

reviews.text: great service
The burger was juicy, meaty, greasily satisfying. The bun should be slightly crunchy on the outside and soft inside. The cheese should be happily melting over the meat. Mouthmelting

Friends came from Dunedin and they really enjoyed the taste of you guys.its really an awesome experience with variety of burgers which we tried today Feeling satisfy and keep going on with the same way
The quality was superb  and the customer service was excellent

We just arrived from Taiwan today, and Burger Station was our very first meal in New Zealand. What an incredible start to our trip! ​A huge shout-out to Akhil (unsure if he's the owner or staff, but he's amazing!). His warm hospitality truly made us feel at home right away. He was so kind and friendly, even taking the time to greet our 7-month-old baby boy with such a genuine smile. It really warmed our hearts. ​We ordered the Hungry Man and Tattooed Lady. Wow! These beef burgers were absolutely massive and delicious – we could barely finish them! Such a satisfying meal. ​Thank you, Akhil, for the wonderful welcome to your beautiful country. We will definitely be back! (Don't forget to leave a review for a free ice cream sundae too!
Great atmosphere,staff are very welcoming.

This place is the best! Burgers were juicy, the beer battered fries were crispy and the strawberry lime shake was to die for! Blake's customer service was superb - he was so friendly and helpful. 10/10 recommend
Great burgers, and great staff at the papanui branch, highly recommended. Craig Owen Duffield

This is a delicious burger establishment-- I came here late one night after going out in Christchurch, and I ordered a cheesey burger with truffle oil, fried Mac n cheese bites, bacon, and all of the fixings. It was heavy, but absolutely divine. For a quick place to order burgers and shakes, this place is great.

We ate here several times while we were in Christchurch.  Some of the best burgers that I've had.  Also tried the poutine, which I would skip in the future, but the burgers were amazing.  Try the CN Cheese.

I think I might know why they've got a burger named the Bastard here. I might have called it a few names myself due to its propensity to slide apart. But what would one expect from a bacon cheeseburger that adds pineapple, avocado and beetroot to its content? Aside from the cheese, every topping and condiment on that sandwich is slippery. The combination isn't one I'd experienced before, but I found it all well matched. And I was surprised to find all that content didn't overwhelm the flavor of the beef (though not by much).  I might give even greater props, though, to the fries. Remember the perfect crispness of McDonald's fries when they were at their best? Take that fry quality but apply it to a chunkier, thicker cut of potato, and that's what you'll get at BurgerFuel. Delicious.   I enjoyed this meal after some lengthy travels, and the restaurant is positioned well for air and road travelers, being just off State Highway 1 and only a short distance from CHC.  Getting back to the sloppiness, it was only in the finishing bites of my meal that I realized the staff had provided me with a tool to help keep my burger together -- the nifty little Doofer, a pop-together burger keeper that my ignorance kept me from testing when I needed it most. Guess I'll have to stop in again and see how well it actually works.

Big portions and a pretty good burger, however the portion was a bit to big for my liking, and I've got to be honest, it's a bit spendy for a burger joint. I would recommend at least checking it out once!

Was absolutely hanging for a burger on this night, so ended up giving it a bash due to the wide variety of burgers available.   Front counter staff were nice & delivered the burgers to our table. The wait time for our meal was a little bit slow, however the flavour of the burger quickly let me forget about the delay.   The burgers are a little but pricey which I believe may turn a few customers away - especially international travellers. I honestly believe that they were get a higher turnover if they bought down the prices a little to stimulate higher patronage.   But the burgers were great. Plenty of flavour. Nice and juicy and would most likely return if I was in the area again.
Best burger place, hands down!  If you are a vegetarian or vegan and you like burgers-- you must go here. It's delicious!
It's a bit of a hole in the wall.  Needs a clean!  Yes, tables too.   So this is how burgers were 20 years ago. The bread is amazing.  This is a proper burger and chips.  So good!!
Wow what awsome burgers, highly recommended, and the staff are so friendly which made the whole experience..... Craig Owen Duffield

I was quite disappointed with this burger joint, after hearing so many good things about it.  I had the lamb burger. I found it to be over cooked and dry. The bun's they use did not help the dryness I experienced, as, it too, had a dry texture.  The decor was unique - I like the trashy horror movie theme, and award an extra star for it.   After hearing this was one of the best burger joints in Christchurch, I found myself somewhat disappointed.

Came in outta the pouring rain to find a gem of a place. Friendly staff in cool new shoes and dope pyjama-like pants helped me navigate the habit-forming menu and apologised for making me wait all of two minutes for my food. I had the Pulp Fiction Burger and chips with gravy. Couple that with a cold Steinlager, and there isn't much more you could ask for from a burger joint. Would be a regular if I lived here.

I've never liked chicken burger but their chicken pig is sensational. Juiciest deliciousness with avocado, bacon, chicken breast and greens with a delicious bun. And those chips. Yum. Another level. And staff is great, always friendly and funny.

We were recommended to try this place for great burgers and chips. The place is quite basic and themed in 50's horror. But the burgers were great and chips were amongst the best eaten, which is the reason for going there. It was nice to wash down with a local brew and listen to the band playing in the car park outback.  I'll be back again when in town !

I love this place, I've been a few times just because the burgers are so great, I get cravings everytime I think about it.  But it would be nice to be ask if I want to eat their instead of feeling like im being kicked out after I get my food, other than that as long as their open ill be back in many times :)
Decent burgers, great chips - although slightly salty. Decent beers, mainstream and christchurch based craft. Basic but kitsch decor and quick service.
Burgers and beers, two wonderful things and this place has a great range of both, plus the chips come with gravy! The decor is like an homage to 50s horror movies. Rip in.
Terrible service. Bar lady was on her phone the whole time while we were queuing for drinks. Pool table was terrible condition. Flat beers. Chips were way too salty.
Great pub with pool tables, food, tab room and pokies.
Terrible staff

I recently went here with a few mates we all get let in 5 minutes later one of the door men grabs me from outside kicks me out and punches me in the jaw. As I had done nothing wrong I was extremely shocked at this. This is illegal and terrible service. Hire proper security staff that will not assault customers
Great taste
Best dosa I had in ages.

Something different but awesome service and food. Food was nice and will be coming back for more. Thanks heaps. Would love to try your other food on your menu next time.... We tried their lamb briyani....the best so far  we had in Christchurch and raita was thick and tasty.....
Biriyani taste was awesome. Definitely recommend. Will be back again. Best wishes
I had a great Bahn mi! I also got the taro boba, which was delicious. It’s also close to the beach so I got it to go and enjoyed it while looking at the water. Great place!
Fresh and healthy food available here. Good portion size. Friendly and informative owners
The baguette was nice but the coffee was amazing, best I’ve had in Sumner.
Wonderful service , love the decor , food was great and a good hot coffee.

Had Chicken Banh mi and chicken noodle soup. It was one of the best Vietnamese noodle soups I have had. I tried Banh mi for the first time and I could taste all the healthy ingredients. 100% willing to come again with my kids.

Great Vietnamese food! The banh mi here is absolutely awesome — fresh bread, tasty fillings, and packed with flavor.  The pho is rich in flavor and the soup is superb — such a comfort meal! Another one of my favorite things at this shop is the Vietnamese coffee, it’s spot on. It’s such a good everyday go-to place for a quick, delicious meal.  The owner is really nice and welcoming, which makes the whole experience even better. Highly recommend!
Great food and awesome service from a brother/sister team. Have been here a couple of times and the banh mi are excellent! A +++, would recommend!
Lovely staff - bahn mi was great

We stopped by for dessert and were pleased with our choices. Salted-caramel chocolate cake and Passionfruit Orange Meringue Pie. The staff are super friendly and the cafe is clean and tidy. Decor is a bit dated, as is the music. There's only so much Christmas music we can handle

This café is absolutely wonderful and obviously a locals favorite. Amazing breakfasts, the Chicken BLT on Turkish bread is a winner and today had the lamb shank dinner, fabulous (and will be back to have again).  It's a few blocks from where I am staying on holiday and I have been to numerous places all over town, and I keep coming back here. The staff is friendly, helpful and always smiling. The food is consistently excellent and well priced.  I highly recommend.
Great stop for a coffee and danish. The flat white looked fantastic and was very good. The danish was fresh and tasty too.
Loved this place. Staff was so welcoming and friendly. I had the French toast and my wife had the eggs Benedict. Both were really good. Excellent flat white as well.

Wow. What a great spot for breakfast. Best coffee in New Zealand. The latte and cappuccino were both beautiful and delicious. We also had the eggs Benedict which were also delicious. Try it out if you are in Christchurch and hungry for a delicious and reasonably priced breakfast. Just plain super good.

Wow! What a great breakfast with a very pleasant atmosphere. I got the Eggs Benedict with bacon. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the sauce was great and there was a generous helping of bacon - even by my Yankee standards. I was especially pleased with the large flat white. My wife got some great scrambled eggs with what she said was some awesome multigrain toast. The cost ($$1/2$) was about right for the quality and atmosphere. I gotta go back before we leave.
Great selection of pastries and blueberry pancakes were worth a return visit. Has booths - always a plus and outdoor sunny seating to catch the morning rays.

Such an awesome place with great vibes great food and amazing atmosphere, loved their pasta so much and the Italian beer, portions were so big for the price (in a good way) definitely reccomend this place!

This is not the first time we went. The food is bigger portion compared to our previous visit which was last year. Our waitress is friendly and knowledgeable. We like the atmosphere as not too noisy though most tables were occupied.

I love the Caesar salad however it is very inconsistent- I guess, depending which chef is on. Sometimes they forget the egg, sometimes there are no anchovies, hardly any bacon or heaps of bacon and plain unseasoned croutons and very little lettuce. I made a point of asking this be rectified on ordering the salad for my 8th time in the past year, my request was met with extreme arrogance. A simple request and as a chef you should take pride in serving consistently excellent food to people who are paying good money and have reasonable expectations of what quality food is.
Great overall, just a bit pricy
Food is good. A place for dating and family. And the waitresses and the owner are super nice to me.

We sat near the front window in the corner so we had area where it was not so loud. The main area I could see where it could get noisy. The service was spot on amazing which paired well with dinner. I would definitely go back here.  I had the Fettuccine with smoked chicken and mushrooms which was delicious, my husband had the lasagna and was good, plenty of sauce and not dry. Enjoy!

Wow. Yum. Allow a bit of time as everything seems to be prepared fresh. The pastas and sauces are not just sitting in pots in the back ready to be served. You can watch them prepare the meals as ordered and it is DEFINITELY worth the short wait. Lovely place, atmosphere is Nice but also family friendly; fancy but not overpriced. I would come here with a group or on a date, this places caters to all customers. I am going to make a point to come back here for dinner.

We were visiting in town for just a few days and were tired after a long day of exploring. We wanted to eat somewhere with a nice atmosphere and fresh ingredients - Valentino delivered! We walked in and the waitress was very nice; the polenta fries and wine was exactly what we needed! The pastas were flavorful but my mom loved the lamb. If you need to take a break and appreciate the Italian ambiance, the food here is perfect for you.

The staff was very nice and the atmosphere was pretty neat; food just left us feeling meh. My daughter just wanted noodles with butter and Parmesan and I think they must've thought she wanted that on top of her spaghetti because she got normal spaghetti with parm on top. We are assuming they added butter too and melted it in. Strange.   I ordered spaghetti bolognese and I got a bowl of sauce with a few noodles. My daughter honestly got double the noodles I received. I was done in about 5 bites. Very disappointed.   I also got the Kiwi Summer drink - it's quite different - if you're not used to feijoa I wouldn't order it - I think it's an acquired taste.

This is an favourite of my and my partner for good reason. The food is always excellent and hasn't let us down yet, the service is always prompt and well timed. There is just no enough I can say to explain why we always go back

Fantastic place.  The atmosphere is good, comfortable.  I had the ravioli of the day (happened to be pumpkin with chorizo) which was simply amazing.  My wife had the Mediterranean salad and felt the same.  I could go on for  a couple of paragraphs about each, but suffice it to say that both dishes were amazing.  We have some very good Italian restaurants in our area in the States, but after tasting from each other's plates we agreed that this was better than any we could remember.  Our waitress Kate was absolutely charming. She made us feel very welcome, was helpful with questions about the menu, and was great to chat with.  We felt right at home.  We liked the place so much that we made a reservation for the Friday we'll be arriving back in Christchurch.  Our only regret is that we didn't save room for dessert.  Next time!
