We had our first dinner in New Zealand at Cafe Valentino, recommended by our Cottage host. It was a nice restaurant! Very good environment, very good service and very delicious food! We ordered a lamb shank, a veal and an entry size mussels. The lamb was tender and juicy, veal was deep fried I think and it was tasted. Mussels should be a must have dish! There are 14 mussels in an entry size dish, enough for 2 girls to share. The tomato sauce balanced the taste of seafood and they were mixed well. Will recommend to other friends who come to Christchurch!

It's a really quaint place that gets very popular on weekends. The place takes reservations, so make sure to book well in advance so that you don't have to wait. Walking in, the hostess was very polite and accommodated us for exactly where we wanted to sit. The wine, you need to figure out for yourself. The beer, I'd say you can't go wrong with the Three Boys craft brew. I loved the lamb shanks and my friend had the pizza which he finished entirely (make what you will of that). The fish was very soft and delicious but it did not take up any flavoring, rather it tasted like the fish itself. I ate too much for dessert, so maybe next time I can tell you about that.
Mains are very disappointing. Particularly the veal, salmon, and duck. Sent the duck back as was terrible. Pizzas ok.

Japanese family-style restaurant, as the name suggests. The staff are very charismatic and the Ramen I ordered was delicious , I've visited a total of 8 Japanese restaurants here in Christchurch and this one is in the top 2, because the proportion of meat in the Ramen was just right, neither too much nor too little.  I will definitely come back, especially to try the Udon.  Ps: they also have hamburgers, probably to make the Kiwis happy hahaha.
Sometimes a restaurant is so good you don't want to tell other people  marvelous, authentic Japanese Ramen for an extremely reasonable price.

Absolutely loved this place! A cozy, family-run Japanese restaurant with amazing food and a welcoming atmosphere. The food was fresh, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. The staff were kind and attentive, making us feel right at home. Perfect spot for anyone who appreciates Japanese cuisine and warm hospitality!
Yummy takeaway pork broth ramen, definitely lived up to the reputation!
I had the pork miso ramen and it was one of the best ramen’s Ive had in Chch. Definitely the best chasu pork I’ve had and a nice thick rich broth.
Amazing food, the most delicious Japanese food of all time. Lovely staff. The kids menu has great choices and good variety.
No food served just good beers once you understand where to queue! Very friendly staff. Good choice of drinks.

Awesome place with a fantastic selection of local craft beers.  The staff are really friendly and they know their stuff. My advice, tell them what you like and let them curate a tasting paddle for you.
Located in the best spot in the market, the tapmaster was friendly and the beer he recommended was delicious. I had the Garstemstein, and it was delicious.
Love this place, only local beer and wines, will be back

20+ taps in the awesome new(ish) riverside market. Amazing beers. Chris and Mel(?) were insanely friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming. Whilst they themselves don't offer food the location means you can grab a bite from the insane variety of different street food vendors around them to enjoy with a pint or tasting paddle. Supporting local at its finest.

The beers are good but frankly there are plenty of beer places in Chch but the kicker for me is Mel who is absolutely the best host ever. Hopefully the owners know who is the instigator of repeat business.
Mel is an awesome host. Knowledgeable, supportive on drinking the perfect beer  Thanks so much Mel
The beer is good and duty manager is giving good recommendations as well. My wife and I enjoyed the beer here.
Amazing food every time, really recommend the chicken quesadillas. Amazing friendly staff. Always a great experience
Pleasantly surprised by the service and food Margherita was huge

George was a fantastic bartender. He went out of his way to make a unique pisco sour on request. Hands down some of the best drinks in town, better than bars like The Pink Lady or anything I’ve had on the terrace. We also loved the margarita and caipirinha. Thanks George, absolute champion
Some of the best cocktails in town. George made the best magarita, Pisco sour, and Caipirinha this side of the Pacific.
Delicious food and I recommend George's maguaritas.
Thank you George for the awesome drinks and great service !
Caribe should be known world wide! Great times had by all! George at Caribe is an absolute wizard behind the bar! Highly recommend a visit
Fantastic food
I had a Sunday roast. The meat was very tender, there were plenty of vegetables, and the jus was delicious.
Rieleigh was a brilliant server. Very attentive and knowledgeable. Food was great Thank you!

I arrived a little before 9PM after a long day at work, waited at reception fo5 minutes to be told "just grab a table", so I went and found a nice quiet table where I could watch the sports. I sat there for 25+ minutes, then walked up to the bar and was ignored for another 5 minutes before I walked out to reception to find there was no one there. So I left and went to Grahemes bar where I got served straight away. Usually they are better than this.
Good quality dinner

Slow service, aggressive customer service  Food took 45 minutes to arrive and the ribs and greens were Luke warm, we complained and the Scottish manager arrived. He was extremely aggressive and defensive. If I can hold the ribs in my hand and they are cold then in my mind they’d should not be served however he disagreed. He did agree to take them back and after 15 minutes we are served a new portion, these again were not hot but  as hunger to over We decided to eat them! When paying the bill the manager came to remove the cost of the ribs and the greens but he would not give us eye contact and it was obvious he was not happy to take and criticism or feedback.

As I always enjoy at the Carlton Bar & Steakhouse: great food, tasty beverages and sublime customer service. It's an excellent space to breakout from the office, re-hydrate with craft beers whilst doing that creative work basking in the sun of the Auction Room. Special mention of the sterling customer service from new recruit Steven, the Liverpudlian who knows how to pour the perfect pint

Does it get any better? Beautiful and authentic Italian food in a size I, for once, couldn't finish.  We stopped in on a Wednesday night, quite late and they were able to take our last minute booking before the kitchen closed.  Fluffy gnocchi in a tomato and Basil sauce scattered with Parmesan.  Tender slices of veal on seasonal vegetables  Rolled pork loin, the star of the night.  A truly giant but very tender and tasty piece.  The staff were friendly and efficient and quite lovely with our group of five.  The atmosphere is cozy and family friendly but quite large.  Fabulous race of wind of wine and spirits.  Even if you just want to pop in and out, call for a a booking and try Casa Nostro, I know I'm going back.

This restaurant was highly enjoyable but the price to taste ratio was simply not balanced. A small average bowl of fries was definitely not worth $10. But the taste was great and recommend the pizzas. Also filling portion sizes which is always a bonus!
Fantastic - great service, great atmosphere, staff were awesome and so accommodating, especially considering our VERY large group booking.

Booking was easy on-line. Placement of our large group (16 adults) was great. Staff were awesome, particularly the young lady who looked after us. She was organised, effective, timely, very good communicator and very pleasant and affable. They catered to all food requirements, and the food was superb - not one issue from any of us. This was our third visit in several years, would definitely go back there again and highly recommend Casa Republica as a place to dine and socialise.
Great atmosphere. Love it!

Positioned right beside the tram tracks and in a vibrant busy lane, this South American inspired restaurant offers cuisine from various locations from that region of the World. Friendly service, but  food was average and could improve.
This place was OK. Food was a bit overpriced. We never had one wait staff, so was a bit more difficult to get service.
Great atmosphere, food and beer is incredibly good, would recommend the nachos and cheeseballs.
Had a great live singer and then DJ in. Great food. Nice atmosphere.

Cool, casual, comfortable atmosphere w/welcoming, warm service and all around wonderful, what a gem! Cascade very much has a Las Vegas speakeasy feel, as in you need to know in order to get it. What a pleasure!  Food portions are generous. Drinks are creative and well done.  The ambiance is lovely.  Service is second to none.  Cascade is an excellent place to be!

Josh was amazing- made great drinks, attentive and knowledgeable. Food was delicious, though a limited menu. Drinks menu was really good. We used first table so it was super cheap but even so, it would be reasonable
The side plates are real value for money n the food was on the well worth it
Great food, great service. Will definately recommend and be back again. Thanks guys

Yummy food we had the jackfruit nachos, chicken burger and beef burger. All were very delicious. Staff were polite and very tentative. There was a soloist on a guitar which added to the ambience. Definitely worth a visit
Great experience! Gluten free options! Great drinks and awesome service will be back :)

om nomnomnom No frills, yummy inexpensive Thai food. Quick friendly staff. Fresh delicious and exactly what I was craving. Great location next to several shopping areas and bus lines. I will try to stop back by here on my way home from Antarctica.
Award winning craft beers like the Milk Stout good place for larger groups. And for sure a great place to eat a wood fired pizza

I've been here a few times for drinks and once for Father's Day breakfast. The venue itself is really nice. Has a rustic-chic sort of vibe, but it in a bloke-y kind of way, if that makes any sense at all.  The Brewery (Cassels & Sons) is part of The Tannery shopping complex. They've got a narrow indoor seating area next to the bar and wood-fired pizza oven, and also a spacious outdoor area with plastic sidings and roof in wet or windy weather. Every time I've been here, I've sat in the outdoor area, which is nice even though your view is basically of the parking lot.  This place can get pretty busy, so just be aware at peak times that you might have a bit of a wait before you can find a seat. Father's Day breakfast was a 45-minute wait (somewhat understandable) but even on regular weekends this place can get busy.  The food is uninspired. They really have nothing on the menu for vegans, except hummus and flatbread. For breakfast, all I could order was the toast with jam and cream sans the cream. The staff was rather unapologetic about this as well. Guess they don't get many vegans in here.  My parents also felt the food was a bit so-so. Also, they'd run out of the dish that my dad wanted, so he had to choose something else. (Father's Day problems again, I guess.)  Overall, I'd say -- make this a drinking spot, not an eating spot.

Nice little brewery by the tannery. Huge patio that has both covered and uncovered seating. They do an $8 pint special each week too.  Enjoyed the beers. Had the mushrooms as an appetizer- huge serving for only $6 and tasty.

This seems like a nice enough place to gather for a drink after work, although I probably wouldn't stop back in for dinner.  I'm not sure why so many breweries seem to insist on serving sloppy, oversized burgers, but it is what it is I guess.  If you're a fan of hoppy NZ beers, though, this place is worth at least one quick visit.

Also known as The Brewery, this is a nice rustic bar and restaurant for a chilled time. I've been here for drinks and pizzas which was great, real good atmosphere at night, the pizzas were varied enough to have something for everyone and being a brewery, it had a great variety of craft beer on tap. Also came for breakfast early when it was very quiet and it was alright, probably wouldn't go again for breakfast as there's better places for a similar price
The layout is weird for ordering cabinet food and the staff really ruined it for me. They all seem like kids that are too cool for school. The industry is HOSPITALITY. The staff need a lesson.
Great tasting craft beers and friendly service with a smile. Great food menu. We tried the Calamari and a pizza from their main menu. Worth a trip out to the Tannery!

This is Gustav's Kitchen and Wine Bar, right?  If so, then the food and wine list is good. They don't have an extensive food menu, but they do right by what they have. We ordered a deviled beef sandwich and dry aged rib eye steak; the meat on both dishes was cooked perfectly.  Although there is a really long wine list comprised of mostly NZ wine, I highly recommend sticking to the NZ labels.  They have their own craft beer on tap, which are not too shabby either. Friendly service.   Prices for mains are roughly $20-$30.

A popular place to spend a weekend afternoon, The Brewery have delicious pizzas and a range of craft beers and ciders on offer.  I've only ever tried the pizza here, but there is also other main meals available.  The pizza flavours are quite different, think Pear, blue cheese, thyme & smoked bacon,  and an ever changing Pizza of the Week flavour.  I had to settle for an apple cider when I last visited; while admittedly very tasty, I was keen to try the grape and berry cider (sadly sold out).  They've got a whole heap of seating, indoors and outdoors, making it suitable for group gatherings.  Often there is a band playing in the afternoon.  Tip: Browse the nearby boutique shops in The Tannery complex while you wait for friends (or inbetween drinks).

Good service and quality hearty food. Beers are good too. You can take a good size party with you and sit outside with the option of dropping down partitions to separate you from others. They also have a large outdoor screen for when the big games are on.
Great pizza and great 2 for 1 deal on Tuesdays! Good service and love the atmosphere in the tent outside. The red apple cider was also delish!
Good spot, great beer
Pizza and a drink Perfect Sunday evening

Family favourite in my household, Cassels is idea for a midweek meal, date night or lunch catch up. Located at the tannery shops cassels not only delivery’s in flavour but with a delicious drinks menu as well.

We tried Castros for the first time since we arrived in Christchurch. The restaurant’s atmosphere is amazing — it invites you to a delicious gastronomic adventure.  There were two of us; we tried the Serrano ham as a starter and the mixed grill as our main. Everything was exquisite — the grill is huge, maybe a bit too many fries for my taste, and we missed the arepas
Amazing food, drinks and great place overall. We were served by Kyle and he was absolutely amazing 10/10 service. Went out of his way to give us a great experience!

A terrible experience. The seafood portions were small and not fresh; the shrimp were tough and mushy; there were only three squid rings; the clams were slightly better, but still not very good.  Even worse was the steak. I've never had such a tough steak before, it was tasteless and bland, I don't know how long it had been in the refrigerator. The tendon in the middle was so tough that it couldn't be cut with a knife. We can't understand this at a restaurant that costs over $30 per person.
Massive thanks to Kyle for providing our group with excellent service !! Food and drinks were both great
Food was amazing, drink were superb. Shout out to Kyle being the man and making our night. Will 100% be coming back
The owner speaks fluent Korean. They offer a Korean menu, Korean-style Chinese food, and traditional Chinese food, all delicious. Keshi's seafood soup was incredibly light and delicious.

Really special place we’ve been going to for years. The owners are lovely. One of them is the chef and they make sure everything is fresh and the oil is changed regularly and the front desk lady is welcoming and always remembers your name
Dined in and had takeaway, both times food and service wee lovely. So yummy!

The jjamppong was full of flavour. The noodles were perfectly chewy and satisfying. The jajangmyeon was rich & slightly sweet. Friendly service and generous portions made the whole experience even better.

A complete disaster meal. They can't cook a simple chicken fried rice properly. It's terrible to taste. There is no meat at all, only few microscope tiny bits here and there. The oil used to cook is not fresh, gunky and smells bad.
Wonderful food and service, best around
Long time customers, great food and great people. From the Symons'

We came here for dinner on our first night in NZ and it was great. We sat outside on their patio and service was friendly. The food was pretty good, and they had a decent beer selection. This was our first glimpse into how pricey NZ was going to be...expensive pizza! But tasty :)
Good selection of beers, pizza is made in their pizza oven and is tasty. Outside area lovely in the summer, they are open late so good place to finish the evening
Wonderful service and food was delicious will definitely be coming back
Good service from Kit and Maggie, environment and food are super nice.
Amazing dinner and service and very helpful
Had a great experience at the Ferrymead restaurant today,our service was quick and friendly, we will definitely be back!!
Staff were amazing and freindly and food was out fast
Dan was a great host. Food was well presented, plenty of options to choose from.
It's a good environment, great food excellent wine tasting. The Director always present interacting with the customers and staff. Weldone !!!

This is a great wine bar. The flights are carefully selected and the wines are good (perfect for someone who was hoping to explore, as I was, a selection of NZ wines from across the country). The food was excellent: we shared 4 starters (hummus, asparagus, ceviche, charcuterie) + 1 cheese and that was more than enough for 2.  The place has a really nice vibe! Thank you,

Best wine in town and absolutely exceptional staff.  Hidden little gem right in the Arts Centre, makes for a great date night. Food had great flavor and the ambiance was perfect in the warm spring weather.  Nice to walk through town after as well.  Looking forward to our next visit.

The perfect place to (re)discover a whole range of New Zealand (and other) wines in one evening! The setting is fantastic, the service excellent, and a special mention to Hector who gave us the best advice! We highly recommend this place!
We only had drinks here. There's an extensive wine list, but there are two beers on tap. There are also several non-alcoholic beers. There's a wide selection of organic fruit juices. Friendly staff.
Thank you so much for our beloved "alcove-table". Food and Service - as ALWAYS - BEAUTIFUL!!! Thanks a lot! You guys made our day - or better - evening :-)

I was looking for a late night meal (9:30pm) and it was possible. Burger with a good portion of fries for 25 dollars. Good atmosphere with the locals a little tipsy even though it was Wednesday evening. Really a pub atmosphere as you would imagine. I give it 5/5 because it was exactly what I was looking for: to be able to eat something good late at night, quickly and in a friendly atmosphere.
Great wee local pub, excellent Guinness and very cheap compared to the rest of the city. Happy hour better than the rest too, class staff, class locals
Friendly local pub. Typical bar food menu. Pool tables and dart board, plus a Juke box
A really good experience. Tasty food, good service and a nice atmosphere. Real nice to try something different to Indian or Thai food.
I love this place so much, kottu 100% recommended and they even do vegetarian and vegan food! They are so friendly, and keep the authentic taste of Sri Lanka
The kottu roti is magnificent. It really travels well with Uber Eats too.
Friendly staff and Incredible food. Lots of vegetarian options. I tried the lump rice and kottu, both which were great. Highly recommended!
Really tasty food, we ordered the kottu roti and lump rice, both delicious. Good prices, large portions, and very friendly service
Best Srilankan rice and curry Love the food there
Do not let the look and atmosphere fool you. The food is very good.
Lovely wee little place. Small, not very fancy but the food is hands down delicious. Service was good, had dosa and chicken vindaloo
Friendly and delicious!
Yum. Excellent South Indian cuisine. Will come again

We visited this South Indian restaurant today and were a bit confused as there was no one at the front to guide us. We weren’t aware that table booking was required today, as it’s usually not needed. It would really help if there was a staff member or a sign at the entrance to let customers know about bookings. The food here has always been great, but a little more communication at the front would make the experience even better.
Best Indian food Ive had in Christchurch, the dosa are incredible! The staff are also lovely
The khao soi and noodles were very delicious. I'll definitely come back and eat again.
I got the lunch special pad Thai. Quite tasty! I'd come back again and I'd reccommend!
I love beef noodle soup

I came in here around a week ago i come we get seated relatively fast but the table we were seated at was a disaster there was a cup of something on the floor under the table there was some sort of sticky substance all over the table and it was quite cold for our food it was not too bad but it took insanely long to get after we had finished we left quickly and were glad to be gone.  Would not recommend i will never return here.

First time here after reading amazing reviews. Didn't disappoint at all, delici authentic flavors,  warm ambience and great service.  We had Pad see ew and Northern Thai Curry noodles- Khao Soi, even Tried  extra mild medium hot and wow amazing! Highly recommended!
Aroi mak ka! Its alway our favourite noodle soup here ,  so delicious!
Had a really pleasant meal at Chang Thai Restaurant. The food is authentic, and the staff are all very friendly, would highly recommend if you would like to have nice Thai food.
We ordered Clear soup noodles and Massaman curry, both tasted amazing !!! Highly recommend. People are so friendly here :)

The beef is incredibly tender, and the broth is rich but not greasy , it honestly tastes just like that old beef noodle shop on a Taipei street corner. The first time I tried it, I almost thought I was back in Taiwan!
A friend recommended this place to me, and I was surprised to find that the food was amazing and they had karaoke! I had a blast all night!

We had an amazing night enjoying Taiwan-style food, drinks, and beer! The combo came with so many free side dishes, and there were plenty of choices for both adults and children. So lucky to catch the November promotion: free karaoke with the minimum spend. We’ll definitely be back!
The beef broth is absolutely amazing! Rich yet not overly salty. The beef is so tender that it trembles when you pick it up with chopsticks. I've brought all my friends from New Zealand to try it!
Working abroad often makes me crave Taiwanese street food , and this place has everything: braised snacks, fried chicken cutlets, and beef noodles. It’s basically heaven on earth

One of the best asian restaurant we been too. Service is 100% awesome. Food was really great and big servings with right price. The karaoke room is amazing, mic and sound system really got us singing. We will be back for sure
After singing, they eat some braised food and drink some beer – an absolutely unbeatable combination!
Our long-awaited class reunion couldn’t have picked a better place , the beef noodles and beer were absolutely perfect.

restaurant: Chic Persian Restaurant - Bar - رستوران ایرانی

reviews.text: We didn’t get to try the food yet, but it looked absolutely amazing! The shisha was the best we’ve had, smooth, flavorful, and perfectly prepared. The owner was super nice and helpful, making us feel really welcome. Can’t wait to come back to try the food next time!
Very good food.
Greatest service ever!

Chic Restaurant in Christchurch is an outstanding spot for authentic Persian cuisine! The kebabs were incredible, the chicken was tender and juicy, and the meat was perfectly soft and flavorful. They also offer fantastic vegetarian options, making it a great choice for everyone. The warm, inviting atmosphere with soft music in the background and beautifully presented dishes added to the experience, and the staff were attentive and welcoming. Whether you're a meat lover or prefer vegetarian dishes, Chic Restaurant delivers exceptional food with a cozy ambiance. Highly recommend for an unforgettable dining experience! Will come back over and over! Thank you for your excellent service and food!
Highly recommend, great atmosphere, cocktails and food on point. 10/10.
Great food. Friendly staff.  Definitely worth a visit
skye the bouncer really good
Had such a delicious meal there one time. Tyra is such a great chef, her food is the best! Highly recommend

Garlic bread really fragant, really good but can be improved. All thing considered, this one is truly the highly! Squid ink pasta were too salty. Rose chicken pasta is good! The bread that come on the pasta is hard.  Well priced.
Love the food.  Appreciate the service attitude.  Hope they move into larger premises; the tables are a little too close for comfort.
The pasta was fresh and delicious, the atmosphere was very homey! The crispy garlic on the garlic bread was to die for!

The pasta here is out of this world. Amazing portions, perfectly cooked pasta and flavours intense. I cant wait to go back for more!! Staff were very friendly and service was prompt but not rushed. Very good value for money
Delicious food & great service !
Attempted to eat here but kitchen was closed 45 minutes before closing time. Looked really good but disappointing for sure.
Fresh handmade pasta and sauces. Visiting from USA and we had an excellent dinner. Service was helpful and cheerful. Chicken Rose Pasta was fabulous.
Probably the best pasta I've ever had. Handmade with locally sourced ingredients. Casual but chic ambience. Delicious wine and cold beer.
Fabulous Italian.  Home made pasta.  Our best meal in New Zealand. Behind some other restaurants in a container village so don't be put off if you don't see it from the street.

We ordered one garlic naan and one lamb Prata. We were stoked as the garlic naan is very yummy then the lamb prata is even more yummy. The owner is very outgoing and we had lovely chat about Diwali festival while waiting for food getting ready. I was the last the customer, but the owner still preparing and cooking food carefully and patiently.
This is the best Indian takeaway in the eastern bays.

This restaurant is an absolute gem! The food is incredible and the hospitality makes it even better. The owner is one of the kindest, most genuine people I have ever met. He is so welcoming and humble, and you can tell he truly cares about his customers. The chili chicken was out of this world, perfectly spiced, full of flavor, and cooked to perfection. The shahi paneer was just as amazing, rich, creamy, and made with so much love that every bite melts in your mouth. I also tried lamb anar masala and chicken Bhuna masala just loved every bite of that. I never ever had that kind of lamb in my whole life. If you are craving authentic Indian food with top-notch service, this is the place to be. Highly recommend! Also I wanna mention I am from Australia (Sydney) me and my family had best food experience in all over New Zealand. Loved it and thanks to the owner and cooks as well.

You guys should seriously consider opening a franchise because the experience was that good. The owner was incredibly humble and kind, the service was flawless, and the food was absolutely mind-blowing. This was hands down the best Indian food I’ve ever had in my life. Every bite was bursting with authentic flavors and made with so much care. If you’re looking for a place that truly stands out, this is it.
Highly recommended chilli flakes for best Indian food sooo Damm delicious
Best Indian out these ways.
Best butter chicken in World. My son loves this place food.never disappoints the test . Fresh and flavourful food

Went In this afternoon. Got one and a half menus because one of them is broken along with dirty glasses. The food was ok but the atmosphere was terrible, no music just silence and one of the staff talking on the phone. Bathroom lock was broken and there was clothing on the ground. When it was time to pay, the guy at the front was on the phone the whole time and it barely acknowledged me.
Delicious, fresh, affordable fast food! Ordered the way you want, with good service.

After searching throughout the town of Christchurch for a bite to eat on Christmas Day, we finally stumbled upon Chillikiwi ('Thai in Da Box') on our way back to our hotel. I'm giving this restaurants 5 stars not only for the quality of the food for its pricepoint, but also for the effort put in by the management for opening on Christmas Day (which I think is really a truly needed public service). We ordered the pad thai with prawns, as well as a fried rice with chicken. The pad thai tasted authentic with very fresh (and plentiful!) prawns; not spicy, but I was able to add siracha to my liking. The fried rice was good, with some vegetables thrown in as well. I personally liked the pad thai more, of the two. The service was also very attentive. Really appreciate the staff opening shop on Christmas Day! Finally, the price was on point - the best value for our NZD on this trip so far. The three of us only spent 30NZD on our meal.
Good Price and Nice. Lunch time Meal Combo is $18 incl Can

This was our normal goto. On my second to last visit the green curry was still great but the chciken was extremely overcooked. This time round ordered green curry which smelt ferral from the moment we got in the car. Never had green curry so foul before not sure what's going on there. Bin it goes the balance of ingredients was extremely off! Also ordered panang which was very bland & flavorless. Did not resemble panang whatsoever...atleast it was edible though as the green curry was not. Sorry to say but we will NEVER be back. I wish I checked the most recent reviews although I didn't think that was necessary due to the fact we've been coming for years. Atmosphere always dead.
Excellent Authentic Thai food.
10/10 Establishment. Great food, biker friendly. Very accommodating! Would recommend!
Good service good portion size.  quality and authenticity was lacking
Ordered the Wonton soup, just tasted like wontons and veges in hot water. Bland and no taste at all.

We ordered Tom Yum soup, egg noodles with chicken, chicken money bags, chicken cashew nuts, and chicken rice rolls. Unfortunately, the food was the worst we've ever had. The Tom Yum soup tasted like cabbage soup, and the cashew chicken had absolutely no flavour. Rice roles average and money bag needs alot of flavor. If you want Thai food then then is not for you. If you're looking for Thai food without any taste, this might be the place for you.
Beautiful restaurant, great atmosphere, delicious food, good customer service. Highly recommended
Out standing.  new owner and staff àmasing not often I will eat at same place in one week but I will this time  lol highly recommend

We were seated promptly and given food and drink menus. Both of us opted for the beef fillet, one rare and the other medium rare. They were done to perfection, melted in your mouth and were tasty. The accompanying vegetables were also first rate. There was a good wine list , although not all were available by the glass. My glass of Cabernet Sauvignon was a standout. We thought the atmosphere and service were great and would we would return here to eat.

We did the seven course meal. My husband had dietary requirements which we had spoken about over the phone, they then asked when we arrived then asked again when we ordered. I felt sorry for my husband as they just left what he could not eat off the plate and didn’t substitute it with anything else. The staff were lovely but when we are paying that price, I don’t expect them to be reading off a list what is on the plate and I felt sorry for our waitress as I had to show her how to open a bottle of wine as it had a cork in it, not her fault, she should have been trained, because she pocketed the cork and filled the glasses up with out letting us taste it first. It took too long between courses, as they are very small, they need to come out faster - we were informed that the kitchen staff were overwhelmed - not sure why as you have to book and it is a set menu. Finally, pudding was not great, the honey cake tasted stale or had only just been taken out of the fridge and not brought up to room temperature These small things would not normally make me out in a review but this should be a top experience
Excellent service & excellent food. Lamb, Salmon & prawn dumplings were amazing!!
Excellent

We had the 5-course degustation menu, which they happily modified for a vegetarian. Every dish was phenomenal, perhaps the best I've had in Christchurch. The Jerusalem artichoke soup was particularly good.

PHENOMENAL first meal in New Zealand. We had the 7-course degustation menu with wine pairings and every single dish was fantastic! Highlights include a perfect scallop, melt-in-your mouth salmon, amazing beef course, and the most wonderful apple dessert.   I will highly recommend this restaurant to any of my friends who come to Christchurch.
Nothing to complain a bit here! Incredible food and service, couldn't ask for anything more.  I highly suggest the tasting course with win pairing and prepared to be stuffed when you leave.

Hands down the best meal I've had in New Zealand and one of the best meals I've had ever. I cannot believe this gem was hiding from me! I wanted to take my boyfriend out for a nice meal for his birthday (since he's quite a foodie) and was referred by the chef's cousin.  We opted for the fine dining and had the 6 course meal that the chef picked, as we didn't know what to choose haha! Each course was so delicious: melt-in-your-mouth truffle pasta, delicious fish with herbs, perfectly cooked beef, creamy chicken and Waldorf salad, a tangy and sweet rhubarb sorbet, and a lovely chocolate fondant for the birthday boy. Mmmm so yum!! They cater to your choices so don't feel like you have to get something you don't like. I'm not a big oyster fan and they were accommodating to not give us that in the meal.  They take you to the back room in a beautiful dining section. The staff are so attentive and helpful. We aren't super fancy people and I felt like we fit in just fine. Obviously we dressed up and had a few wines. The meal is expensive, but you get what you pay for.   All in all, amazing food, great ambiance, and helpful staff. What more can you ask for?

WOW! ! The food was spectacular. Every dish that was served was so refined and the flavors just complimented each other so well. Every bite left you wanting more and more. The staff were so attentive as well seeing to our every need. Pricey but you get what you pay for.  A fine dining experience to say the least. Don't go for a quick meal make a night of it.

​I arrived at 8:23 PM and was told by the manager that the kitchen was already closed because the chef was "tying up." ​While I respect a flexible closing time, I was confused because I could see existing order dockets on the pass instead of tyding up. More importantly, immediately after turning me away, the same manager walked to every other table to ask if they wanted to place a last order. ​It was disappointing to be told the kitchen was closed. ​I visited this restaurant based on a friend's recommendation and was deeply disappointed.

Delicious and authentic Japanese food. This was by far my favourite chirstchurch Japanese spot thus far. With excellently executed and flavoursome dishes, the whole family left well feed and satisfied.
Yum yum yum

This was one of the best Japanese meals we’ve had in Christchurch. This lovely restaurant appears to be family owned and tucked away in a quiet neighbourhood. Not super impressive from the outside but has a Lovely atmosphere once you enter. Great service. Fantastic menu options, many from Okinawa region. Great service and very affordable. Looking forward to going again soon.
Amazing food and service, just like in Japan. A++ highly recommend

Giving this one a 5  review. Fantastic lil mom n pop spot that over delivers and is great value for money. Love these wee local neighbourhood spots! We came in as a reserved table of four and food was prompt and delicious. We loved the Angry Bird and beef tataki. We got x6 small side dishes, drinks and matcha ice cream for about $43 per person. Crazy for 2025! Gochisousamadeshita
This place is bloody amazing food was on point and the atmosphere was amazing 100% recommend this place

Terrible service. They completely forgot my wife’s meal — I was done eating before she even got her food. All they did was take off the cost of one drink, without a single real apology. That’s pathetic. We felt disrespected and won’t ever come back.
Really good portion and tasty food, good portion to price

Recently, my girlfriend and I found this super budget-friendly Chinese restaurant in Christchurch — and honestly, I wanted to yell, “How is the owner even making money”   I ordered the Black Bean Beef on Rice It was only $13 on special, but the portion was massive! Loads of beef, rich black bean flavor, not too salty — perfect with fluffy white rice. I couldn’t stop eating.   My girlfriend got the Mushroom Chicken Rice The chicken was tender and full of flavor, and the mushrooms soaked up all the delicious sauce. Super comforting and satisfying!   The best part? Both meals together were under $30 — and we were absolutely stuffed. Total bargain!   Highlights:  Only $13 and seriously filling (this ain’t a small lunch box)  Cooked fresh to order, served piping hot  Home-style taste, not oily — easy to eat every day   Tip: Come during lunch specials for the best value!  ⸻  They also offer Lunch Combo Meals for $15–$16:   $15: Chicken corn soup + 4 mini spring rolls or chips + seasonal veg + chicken/beef fried rice or noodles  $16: Soup + sweet & sour pork, lemon chicken, fried fish or nuggets + rice + veg   Big portions — no one leaves hungry  Lots of variety — perfect for switching it up  No service charge — casual and affordable for daily lunch!
Quick service. Lovely food... they even made my food the way I like it. Thank you
Best food and best staff.

Recieved a meat dish instead of the vegetarian meal I ordered, no receipt or label to confirm contents. This is a massive risk for dietary restrictions. Disappointed and concerned about dietary accuracy.
Long opening hours. Hot and sour soup is my go to. Nice staffs, she could help to alter rye dish based on indivual requirements if possible.

This place serve really good Chinese food. One of their specialty is noodles. Their noodle is thick and super chewy. There are many variation of noodles you choose from. They have other great dishes as well. The portion size is huge for a great price.
healthy and yummy food with decent price, 4 days in town every day came for lunch or dinner, especially kids love it.
Was looking for a place to eat while waiting for my Car get serviced, and find that close by. Good and cheap surprise with tasty food.

Good value for money, delicious taste, Xiangyue is the Captain America of Chinese food, it can compete with any other restaurant, no matter what you order, there is nothing bad, but the sudden price increase is heartbreaking
Had a great time. Food was fab, lovely people and cool company
Worth the money and food  was fantastic
Very good service, our go too for Chinese food fried rice and chow mein, black bean chow mein nice crunchy vegetables ,very good place

I phone ordered 12 Wontons. My husband went to pick up and said that the front counter lady was adamant I ordered “12 dumplings”, my husband doesn’t like confrontation so he ordered Wontons on top of the dumplings he had to pay for. You were in the wrong but didn’t want to admit it, instead you made him pay for extra wontons as well as the Dumplings (that I didn’t order!!!) You stuffed up and took no accountability!
The BEST IVE HAD FROM ANYWHERE IN YEARS ,   ITS NOW MY LOCAL
Very good
Best for the price
Far too salty. Couldn't eat more than a few mouthfuls. A real shame.
The food is insanely good. The nachos were superb and huge for 2 people. The lamb tacos were very good. A little dry on the lamb though. But very favorable. They still deserve 5 star rating.

We were visiting and this place is so cute and right along the river bank. Good vibes, music playing, nice ambiance. It was fairly busy around 5pm on a weekday but thankfully no wait. We ordered just apps but was happy with everything we got. Nachos were truly loaded, and the kabobs weren't dry at all. Definitely a cute place to try out!

I really enjoyed my dinner at Chiwahwah Mexican Cantina.  I was lucky to get a table without a booking, even for just a party of one.  So I recommend making a booking if you plan on dining here.  I ordered the roasted cauliflower, that came with a romesco sauce, a fish taco, and one of their sangrias.  Everything was delicious!  I love roasted cauliflower and theirs definitely ticks all the boxes.  It was perfectly charred on the outside and soft on the inside.  The romesco sauce was bright flavors from the acidity of the tomato, which paired well with the smokiness of the cauliflower.  The fish taco was good too!  It wasn't greasy despite it being fried. It came with capers, which I don't actually like, but in this taco it was yummy and needed with the fish.  The sangria was comprised of rosé, mint, and strawberries.  It was light and fruity.  Service was excellent!  The staff made sure I was doing fine throughout my meal.  The atmosphere is vibrant and loud.  Chiwahwah's seems to be more of a fusion restaurant, but I don't think they advertised themselves as a traditional Mexican restaurant anyway.  If you want good food with Mexican-inspired flavors, definitely check them out.

Had dinner here the day before leaving to return home from our holiday in New Zealand.  Got to a table quickly but it was excruciatingly slow the rest of the night.  Server forgot drink orders and we had to remind her several times before they were brought to us.  The establishment is on the louder side when it comes to voices from nearby tables and the music playing through their sound system. Their only saving grace was the food.  It was great.  It was definitely not Mexican though.  I would categorize it more as a fusion between New Zealand and Mexican, so Kiwi-Mexican.  Although the food tasted great it is a little misleading to brand themselves as a Mexican Cantina.  Would recommend giving it a try and take a gamble on the possibility of getting better service.
Amazing Mexican food - best fried chicken and tacos. Also love the frozen margaritas and monkey bread!

My friends and I went here to celebrate our last day of nursing. One of the lovely waiters (I wish I could remember his name) saw it was my friends birthday on her ID and organised a sundae (on the house!) with a candle to come out after our drinks and the staff sang her happy birthday, it was so sweet. The overall service was amazing, such a friendly atmosphere.

Found Chiwahwah while traveling around Christchurch on a work trip and it did not disappoint! The food was delicious, the atmosphere was relaxed, and the staff were friendly. Perfect spot to hang out with friends. Definitely coming back!

I'm giving it a 1 for some good reasons. Originally gave it a 2 but the owners like to let their business down by trying snarky responses to reviews that they don't like instead of taking constructive criticism on board and fixing their own faults.  When we arrived we were greeted and sat and all was very friendly. First thing we notice is everyone in the restaurant is just yelling so loudly that we couldn't even speak between ourselves. Way too loud and I don't know why. It was like this all night and my ears are still ringing the day after. For this I won't be returning.  The next thing is we sat for nearly 20mins eating for someone to come and take out order, even just for drinks. We were getting pretty pissed off by this point and was on the verge of leaving because we couldn't talk with it being so loud.  After a further nearly 20mins the food came and it was ok. The monkey bread was nice but was pricey just for a mini pizza....  The quesadilla was good.  The fried chicken was not. I've never had anything so oily in my life. I ordered the fried chicken sliders and it was just tasteless from the amount of oil onboard the chicken. No care from the chef. Just a basic thing to do...they need some basic chef training to learn how to not make the chicken drip with oil.  All in all waaaay too loud, too expensive and not that great...the artwork was cool though..you definitely get enough time to look at it because you can't talk because everyone was yelling.  We weren't the only ones that were complaining about the 2 large tables yelling and filling the entire restaurant with noise. Several others had the same feelings.  Never returning, not recommended. Go elsewhere for a better experience....
A great night out for our son’s 30th birthday. The margaritas were superb. Not badly priced for its location in Christchurch’s CBD. Very careful with my partner’s coeliac requirements.

A place where you eat upstairs and with a very limited view of the street. Simple room with cheap posters on the wall. Nice waiter but he seemed to be doing everything as there was no other staff around.  Meal took a while to turn up and only one dish at a time.  Has a wide selection of Chinese meals listed on the shop front. Regular Chinese dishes available plus unusual such as stir fried sea cucumber. Some items are only written in Chinese!  I ordered the fried combination noodles which did not look like the picture (lacked vegetables), was cold and some of the chicken was raw, so I did not eat the meal ( photo available), I shared others meals of the sizzling beef and beef noodles which were ok. Entrees $5 to $22. Meals mostly $22. Good selection of regular alcohol.  Fresh juices only available in litre jugs. Ok selection of fizzy drinks. Take away menu available. Free WiFi. Toilet just outside the restaurant is available on request of key on a string. Overall just a place to go if you are hungry.

When I'm in New Zealand I love to go to Chongs. It's right across the street from my hotel and the food is excellent. I get the Diced Chicken and Peanuts - sans the peanuts! The skewers are great and so are the dumplings. Totally worth it.

It's decent if you are craving Chinese food. Not necessarily a place I would recommend for eating in Christchurch. We ordered the veggie fried rice and the stirfried eggplant and subbed the potato for tofu. We also got the potstickers. My aunt said the potstickers were just OK - the dumpling wrappers was way too thick. I thought they fried rice is actually very good. It had that wok/stirfried flavor that is so delicious. We did send back the vegetable dish because it was made with tofu that was tasting a little off. We brought it to the attention of the waitress and she promptly had it remade and provided her apologies. Service was good, and they have free Wi-Fi there as well. I wouldn't say this is the best Chinese food ever but it worked and satisfied my aunt's cravings.
Honestly the place is very simple decorated. We ordered lunch special mixed veg and fried rice. Very greasy and small potion. Won't go twice. Soup was OK....
The lamb is definitely over priced and not traditional at all, 18 NZ dollar, not recommended. Shrimp sashimi is 28 NZ dollar per shrimp, not live shrimp. Serving slow.

Cheap and convenient Chinese food in Christchurch.  It was late Sunday evening (close to 9 PM), and the Japanese restaurant Sakimoto was closed. My boyfriend was on the hunt for roast duck, but the nearby Thai restaurant, Sampan House Restaurant, didn't have great reviews. We set our eyes on Chong's, which was located very close to our hotel and had an expansive takeaway menu that included smoked duck, $24 for half, $46 for whole. We also got a small bowl of sour and spicy soup ($5 for small, $18 for large) and a small portion of steamed white rice ($2). The waitress quoted us 10-15 minutes, so we took a short walk around (the rather desolate) town before coming back to grab our food. The duck was pre-packaged in a vacuum-sealed bag (valid until Feb 5, 2018, so more than 2 weeks from today) and lukewarmly heated. Flavor wasn't bad, though it was too salty for my taste, so make sure you get some carbs to pair with the duck. The sour and spicy soup was indeed sour and mildly spicy, just like any ol' sweet and sour soup.  Overall, not a bad choice for Chinese food that won't break your wallet.
Food was terrible, worst chinese I have had and we got sick from it.
Lunch here, the food is still hot... the price is also cheap, but in my opinion the food is delicious.....
All disgusting actual rude

if i could i would not rate them at all. They don't deserve a rating. This is by far the WORST i have ever ordered food from. I regret not looking at the reviews before I ordered. I regret wasting money on this garbage food. The noodles is yuck taste like dishwasher, sweet n sour was alright until it left an expired after taste. Found bits of BONE even though i ordered food with no bone…I am warning anyone. I am not trying to bring them down. They seem really nice…just the food is so disgusting. Dont order food from them.
Yummy foods, friendly service, one of my favourite takeaways
Very rude owners and food is not tasty at all.
Noodles had no flavour, sweet and sour pork tasted old, and the roasted pork was tough and old. Yuck never again
Amazing service and delicious food for great value. I will 100% be coming back!
Good food, nice place, nice staff, fast service. Definitely coming back to taste the others in the menu.

Chopstick Restaurant is a cosy spot that serves up a great mix of Asian favourites, with a few Malaysian classics adding extra flavour to the menu. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, perfect for anything from a casual lunch to a relaxed dinner with friends.  I tried the char kway teow and wat dan hor — both were fantastic. The char kway teow had just the right smoky wok hei, and the wat dan hor came with silky noodles in a rich, eggy sauce that was pure comfort. Everything felt fresh, flavourful, and cooked with care.  The prices are fair for the generous portions. It’s the kind of place you’ll want to come back to — sometimes for the Malaysian classics, sometimes for a simple, well-made noodle dish.  Must-try: char kway teow, wat dan hor  #AsianEats #LocalGem #ComfortFood
Ants on the table. Chicken had a very odd texture. Very very average.
I have dined in to a lot of different chinese restaurants this place Is definitely in the top 5 always amazing food and customer service highly recommend.

With the wait staff being more pre occupied with the children doing school work than towards paying patrons, no wonder the food that was eventually served was bland and unapealling. Makes me wonder what goes on in the back. FYI Chilli chicken, is not chilli chicken if its just batter with bland sauce with acouple of chillis thrown on top.
Misleading promotion,  poor customer service,  food's no longer tasty. Very disappointed
Not to be missed if you’re in Christchurch

We had a booking for 4 so it was big outlay, the ride itself was enjoyable, but the main meals were below standard for the price. The Monk Fish main was simply awful. A suggestion for the management is to take the orders and have them filled and brought onto the Tram in hot boxes on the second or third lap of the city so people have hot food not food that has been sitting on the bench after being plated.
Delicious meal, great service and beautiful (changing) view.

Apparently there are people who 'enjoy' leaving a meal feeling hungry. Not me. To me it is awful to spend so much on a meal and then end up wondering if the takeaways would be open on the way home. It would not be that hard to have more sides available, even given the logistics. The gushy commentary might be appropriate to tourists but most of us seemed to be locals. Luckily the company made the experience enjoyable.
Friends treated my husband to this wonderful experience just wish it was longer

Worth the price of admission. The food was excellent, a testament to the chef who worked brilliantly in a very confined galley. Service was outstanding and Hannah couldn't do enough for us. And of course, the sights of Christchurch complemented the meal superbly. So, if you are ever in Christchurch, do yourself a favour and get onboard the tram.
Hilarious experience, we’ve defined had better food, but for the novelty it was great!
Pleasure bar with relaxed atmosphere
I played on a real pinball machine - like in the 80s - great
Good place to catch up with group.   Basic.   Bands at night.  Basic bar food.
Great staff
First time customer, the owner is a good guy, put up with our terrible karaoke, venue is good too. Was very quiet when we arrived on a Saturday night so not sure when there busy times are.

Simple and unassuming atmosphere. Friendly owner who is willing to customize if she's lacking some ingredients. Big serving of delicious food that feels home cooked, value for money. Be prepared for long wait if there are many orders as she's doing everything herself.
Great portion and great value!  Havent been back in a while but everything is as remembered!

Hidden Gem: Unassuming Shop, Legendary Hainanese Chicken Rice   Sometimes the best food comes from the most unexpected places — and this low-key little shop just proved that to me in the most delicious way.   Chicken That’s Unbelievably Tender The poached chicken was silky, juicy, and full of flavor. You can tell it’s been cooked with care — no dryness, no toughness, just pure, melt-in-your-mouth perfection with a light chicken aroma.   Fragrant Chicken Oil Rice The rice is hands-down one of the stars of the dish. Cooked in chicken broth and oil, each grain is separate and glistening with flavor. Honestly, I could eat a whole bowl of just the rice!   The Holy Trinity of Sauces The classic trio — ginger paste, chili sauce, and sweet soy sauce — were all spot on. Balanced, homemade-tasting, and they elevate the chicken to another level when mixed and matched.   Bok Choy on the Side Instead of the usual cucumber, this place served lightly blanched bok choy. Crisp, vibrant, and soaking in just a hint of that savory chicken flavor — it was the perfect complement and added a homey touch.   Comforting Soup Included A bowl of hot, clean-tasting chicken broth comes with the set — light but flavorful, and a lovely warm finish to the meal.   From the outside, this shop might not catch your eye. But take one bite of their Hainanese chicken rice and you’ll instantly know — this is the real deal. No hype, no frills, just honest, heartwarming food done really well. Definitely a hidden gem worth discovering.
Best thing to see in town!
That was so bad i couldve made it better myself and im not very good at cooking. Food was nothing like described. Very depressing in here also.

Truly disappointing. Food took over an hour to get here. The staff are racist and favoured the Asian people who ordered 15 minutes after we did by serving them well before us. Appealing wait of over an hour. Would not recommend
Amount of food is heaps but I ordered chicken noodles and fried dumplings but it was bland. Good price if you just want to be full
Nice Chinese takeaway. Lots of food choices. One could eat in, but we had takeaway. Food tasted great, thanks.

Amazing foods. Family faves are 1/2 duck 1/2 chicken on rice, won ton soup, pork belly stew, and king prawns. The flavors oh so yum. Tried other foods and they were yum but these are our go to's. Service is great..we have become regulars from well ova 10 years now..they're always surprised when I bring the kids just how big and tsll they are. Usually I'm holding out and going there when HUNGRY or craving soup or stew. Recommend this place to at least try once. And the plain fried rice no meat tastes like there's meat in it. Thanku my friends for this place.
I love the taste of the nasi goreng and the staff are very friendly!
Really enjoyed the takeaway from here! The food was tasty and packed well, and they even gave me a free Sprite which was such a nice touch. Great service, will definitely order again
Yum, quick and worth the price

We ordered from uber eats pickup from this restaurant. It was really quick within 10minutes the food was ready. We had ordered chicken fried rice, rice with chicken curry. Food portions were great with average taste and very affordable price.  Really happy with the food will definitely order next time from here

Decent food, good beer.  We were actually aiming for another BBQ place for dinner, but this was on the way and we decided to be adventurous and give it a try.  I had the pulled pork plate, Mister S had the brisket burger, and we were intrigued by the spiced cauliflower so we shared it.  The pork was fine. A little fatty (to be expected with pork shoulder) and not quite as flavorful as I've had elsehwere. Comes with pickles, a creamy slaw, crisps, and a whole grain mustard sauce that was absolutely inedible. I don't know if it was off or whether that was how it was supposed to taste, but yikes. The spiced cauliflower (spiced, not spicy) was so interesting - lots of flavor from the spices juicy-tart pomegranate arils.  They have a kid's menu, but we figured our little guy would just eat off ours and we weren't wrong. (He's still in that phase where he loves something one day and won't touch it the next - a pain when you're spending good money on food!) Case in point, the macaroni and cheese. He usually eats his body weight in noodles, but barely touched the side we ordered to share. It tasted great, so don't trust his review! There was plenty of food in our own meals for us to share with him, too.  Lots of choices for drinks. I was trying to decide between two different choices and the server offered to bring me a sample of both so I could taste.    Good service. Upstairs seating with some outside chairs, too. We ate early on a weekday and it wasn't very rowdy or noisy. Some larger tables upstairs were reserved, so they do take reservations.
Very good Chinese takeouts with generous portions. Been going there for about 30 years. Worth the drive. Recommended

Orders fish and chips before they close the store. The taste was ok, but the colour of the chips and fish was bit strange made me think whether they change the oil frequently or not. I am not sure if I want to come back again.
Awesome fish lovely couple
Not the best place for fish & chips, BUT you won't find better Chinese food for the price. eg Wontons $8 elsewhere $20. $17.50 main dishes, great value. Even better with the lunchtime specials.
Amazing food. Such great prices. And, fantastic customer service. Very very hardworking couple and served me even though I came in bang on when they closed. Food was really fast and delicious.

Finally tried 2 lunch dishes today after recommendation by a friend and did not disappoint. Had the combination fried noodles, it was filled with BBQ Pork, Beef, Chicken (all so tender) with that wok fire taste. Sweet Sour Pork was also very tasty! Our new favourite now when we're out that way

Best deep fried oysters ever. So big & juicy only 20 for a dozen, the deep fried mussels is on promotion sometimes 10 for a dozen plus half scope of chips.. Much bigger than other Fish & chips shop. BBQ pork fried rice are filled with pork    Lunch Special only 8.90nzd 5 stars for the price.
Juicy, tender and flavourful roast pork!
TonkotshuGood portion Good flavour
Super delicious
The worst ramen I’ve ever eaten
This place serves amazing food! I’ve tried both the ramen and the yakisoba, and they’re always delicious. Every time I visit Riverside Market, I make sure to grab something from Cluck Cluck Slurp
Nice service
Great spicy ramen
Lovely place to sit and have some great thai food, especially the Pad Kee Mao. Wonderful lady served us was very kind and a great host.
Nice little family run place. Food is good, but not fiery like authentic Thai food. Recommended.

Greeted warmly on our arrival. Menu's supplied with a smile when I explained we only wanted takeaways. Food arrived promptly, and we were wished well on our way. Absolutely delicious, sizeable portions, and I would happily return next visit to Christchurch. We weren't there for the atomsphere, but the restaurant was clean and inviting.
Great food and service with very reasonable prices
Great set up and friendly staff

Staff are SO nice and food great. Now a regular there as comfortable place to go. It's like visiting with great friends. Always so welcoming and friendly. My family threw me a surprise party there and everything was just magic. Thank you heaps to Nucole, Rachael, Robert and Nico
Great music. Good food and very good service!

First time customer. Sorry Staff. Facial expressions say: We don't want to be here. Example, we ask:  Do you have a Drinks Menu? Staff said "no" and walked away. No effort made to recommend or discuss. Premises clean and food was good value.
Great meal - food was fresh and well cooked. Wish we had found it earlier in our stay.
What a nice meal we both had sirloin steak and was cooked to perfection. Service was good and the meal was value for money.

EXCELLENT staff  that went out of her way to help Manager i a bii of a loud comedy act and definitely a people person.. Lots of different dishes on the menu, all reasonable priced . A real community  PUB with different social activities and  meal specials every  night Thursday 2 Oct Just had to give it a higher rating  Lamb shanks  on a bed of Smashed potatoes and thick gravy  with a side dish of mushrooms  was absolutely delicious   Top Job Chef  Also  I never thought a pink Gin and soda would go with this Dish but it added a  small sweetness to the lamb  Off the tap and only 4% alcohol  Another top Job from the Team  So refreshing to be welcomed. Looking forward to the next meal 11 October Brilliant night team  Excellent meal Pork Bally and seasonal veggies Desert the Cheesecake and caramel. Love the pink  Gin and berry  drink.

Made a fairly last minute decision to have dinner here for the first time last night when catching up with an old friend and can say it did not disappoint! The staff are incredible when it came to getting us seated and started with drinks quickly. Great selection on the menu, meals came out at a good pace there wasn’t a wait between receiving meals and the portion sizes were more than generous with everything cooked well and seasoned amazing. Was also nice to have staff check in after receiving our meals as it doesn’t happen at other places often would make for a good chance to fix an issue if we had of had any. Would definitely recommend
Friendly place with nice atmosphere.  Bartenders are great especially Jen and Brandy.  Karaoke night is a lot of fun. Good place to watch sports with the locals.

Unbelievable, Wouldn't serve me and my friends from out of state. The Barback is unable to see what an actual ID is while using a blacklight.  Embarrassing, ended up getting drinks from a place down the street that was packed. Now it makes sense why this place was empty. Some of the most disrespectful service I have ever experienced. Do not recommend you coming to this Bar especially if you are out of state. Ignorance & Horrible customer service and inept staffing clearly plague this dive bar of a place. If you want to enjoy your night or your possible visit to Long Island, I recommend you avoid this place at all costs.
Have a wonderful time every time I go here. Enjoy the bands and karaoke night and comedy nights. The bartenders are great and the beers are reasonably priced!
Went to a fundraiser here. Got great bar food and drinks. The bar tenders were nice and attentive. Great casual spot for hanging with friends and catching up.

Hosted a birthday gathering a few months back. Normally don't review, but had to mention the STUNNING service! Vinny the owner and the bartender Jen were super accommodating and made me and my friends feel right at home. They have board games, pool, darts, a juke box, and fairly priced drinks. The place itself and the bathroom is clean and decent. We were the youngest crowd there (mid 20's) but had an absolute blast! Highly recommend if you're looking for a nice and casual evening out, we plan on hosting our next event there again!
I was just there tonight for karaoke. I was given a bill as if I were drinking in Manhattan. It's a freaking dive bar and charging unbelievable prices. NEVER AGAIN!! Junior you are terrible.

I love this joint! By far my favorite LI bar . People here are down to earth, sincere and friendly. The drinks are reasonably priced and they have stand up comedy every now and then . The bartender Danielle is a sweetheart and damn good at what she does . If you want to have a low key, fun, yet local experience you should definitely visit this place.  A true Long Island staple lol !

Went here for my birthday night and was not disappointed for my first bar visit. The second I walked in I was greeted by the friendly staff and locals, Sal even made us some delicious fries even though he shut down the kitchen already. Amazing service! this was a very warm and welcoming environment and the next time I'm in town I'll be back! Thanks for making my 21st great, guys!

Lovely neighborhood tavern, where you can order some food, have a well-mixed drink, watch the sports, meet nice local people and even sing karaoke on occasion.  They have a great setup, with excellent singers, every once in a Friday night while. Make sure to call the bar to confirm if they are doing the karaoke thing on the Friday you are coming.

My friend was celebrating his 2nd 30th birthday here with his buds, and prior to my attending, I checked out the reviews. There's this one girl that has it all wrong. This place is awesome. I'm 30yrs old at current, and she claimed that she and her friend were in their 20's. Yes, the crowd is more mature, but it is mixed.   I was there with people my age, people older than us, and people younger than us, and not everyone who was there was there for the birthday boy. I dressed up too, but I didn't feel out of place. You wear what you want, within reason/appropriateness, and the better dressed you are the less it can hurt!  The bartenders were kind and professional. There's one pool table at the center where people can pay to play. Two C-shaped booth areas one to the left of the entrance upon walking in, and one at the rear left behind the mini-stage where we got to be entertained by a local singer. She sang mellow and sad cover songs, which sounded nice, but were not the right tune for the night. The background music they played when the singer took breaks was chill and upbeat, and not excessively loud! Yay, don't have to scream over each other to order a drink or have a conversation.   The highchairs at the bar area aren't stationed in and can be moved about, which is great for small to medium sized groups.  The restrooms are at the rear of the space. Decent and plenty of space.   I did not try any of the bites, only had a beer ($5.00) and a glass of water.   It's part of a mini shopping center, and it's a hidden gem, if you ask me. Next time some friends opt to hang out there or celebrate, I'll be back!   Happy Eats/Drinks/Lounging!

I love this bar all the bartenders are always friendly and remember you and what you drink  . Jenn , Gus , Corina Sal and Sal the owner always a good time and a place to shoot pool , dance , karaoke and make new friends. The only problem there is never wanting to go home
Great place to have a drink, awesome margaritas and Long Island iced Teas! Friendly Staff.
Drinks are priced great, service is top notch and the owners are as friendly as can be. They really care about their customers.

Was excited about this place because it had good stats but I should have known better because so few reviews. The Facebook page showed martini specials and it looked like a locals hangout. Sounded perfect. My bad!  My friend and I walked into this place after work for a drink on a Friday. I was honestly in jeans and a t-shirt and was the best dressed in this place. People were in sweats - which would have been FINE if, when we walked in, we weren't looked up and down because we didn't look like slobs and didn't fit in. It was so uncomfortable. We're in our twenties and were looking for a place to catch up and talk- but we left before even having a drink. We were BY FAR the youngest by 30 years. At least. It was not clean, not friendly.
Always such a pleasure to come to this great hidden gem. My girl and I always have such a great time there. Bartenders to the owner thank you for always treating my girl and like family
Very nice staff, food is notches above anywhere in the area. Pizza is delicious and crispy, Knish is out of this world. Good job so far guys!

restaurant: (Colombo Street) Krung Thep Thai Street Food

reviews.text: Loved the Massaman beef cheek  entrée & Chinese needs a little upgrade tho More of my food finds in IG: @ida_chch

Such a great meal and atmosphere during our time there. They were very accommodating to our children of varying ages and we thought the taste reminded us of our time living abroad and eating delicious Thai food, especially the green and yellow curries. I would certainly come back here again.

We ordered prawn pad thai, green curry and rice for food, and it turned out to be one of the best Thai meals we’ve had in a long time. The drinks weren’t awesome (they raised their bar real high with the food) and that’s where their team can improve. Absolutely, a no brainer for delish Thai food when you are in town. Also, the people are lovely.
All tables was full yet we got great service and food was delicious

The signature dish Massaman beef slow cooked is absolutely delicious!! I couldn't fault it, yum yum yum!! Duck rolls (spring rolls) were beautifully made and cooked but needed to have more duck as there were only tiny little bits. Lemon lime bitters drinks were lovely,  chicken wonton soup was tasty and fresh, perfectly cooked veges and nice base/broth. Caramelized pork belly had nice flavors. The environment and service was fantastic. We will definitely return!!
Lovely. Delicious food. Nice atmosphere.
It's very delicious.
Great food as always

Wow, been driving past this local place for the 10 years and finally poped in. The website pictures of the food don't do it justice, beautifully presented and delicious food with good portions. Great atmosphere and awesome staff.
Superb food and friendly service. Definitely recommend!
Excellent food, fast delivery, and great service.
A great restaurant with generous portions! We had the Pad Thai and the sizzling hot beef, and we were both super impressed. The staff were also really lovely. Can’t wait to come back!
What a delightful restaurant. Cool atmosphere and the wait staff were friendly, helpful & attentive.
Group of nine and everyone was very impressed with all  meals. My Beef rendang was the best I have ever eaten . Thank you
This place is closed and seems to have been closed for quite some time.
Great place to eat with excellent food, very friendly staff and cool athmosphere.
This place was not open even though it shows on the map it should be open.
love it!!!
They’re closed until further notice.  The reservation system on the web site doesn’t work - as it says “closed” but the web site doesn’t say “closed” anywhere.

I know times are tough in hospitality but they are equally tough for your suppliers too. We are all trying to make a living as small businesses. Can you please pay me? Your invoice is, again, overdue. DON'T support businesses that don't pay their suppliers.  X Wines.

We thought maybe this would be a great experience with the train type of dinning. We have eaten sushi throughout the world and have experienced some amazing places.  To date…..this has been the worst sushi we have ever experienced…absolutely awful!!!! We couldn’t even finish what we had because it was that terrible…we were then told we would have to pay extra for not finishing this food and leaving it on our plates. That’s pathetic, this restaurant should be ashamed. Honestly our recommendation would be to save your money or please eat somewhere else. We rate this place at a zero!
Terrible terrible. Meat and seafood was very dry. Seats were dirty. Booked for sushi train but there werent hardly any dish other than drinks.
Booked through bookme with 30% discount on sushi train. 3/4 of the train was empty. Not many to choose from except drinks. Fish and meat was very dry.

We came here for dinner today and the service was unbelievably poor. From the start we were ignored, waited ages for every dish, and the ramen we ordered as our main never even came — while the table next to us, who ordered the same dish, got theirs half an hour earlier.  We had to get up every time to find staff, and when leaving, they still tried to charge us for the ramen that never arrived. We ended up leaving hungry and disappointed. As someone in the hospitality industry, this was honestly the worst service I’ve ever experienced. This used to be one of our favourite places, but after tonight, never again.

We are very satisfied with the quality of the dishes Cookai prepared at our diner; very fresh ingredients including super fresh Sashimi plates; beautiful presentation and superb Flavours! Staff and the top chef are super friendly and attentive! Posted a few photos from our dining experience! This is the Best Japanese restaurant in chch central city, comparing this with the price you pay and the quality of the food you get, very cost-effective!

The food was brilliantly cooked and as soon as I walked in, we were seated and given a menu. The atmosphere was awesome and if someone else was with me, I would have been been able to talk and listen easily.
Been there 2 times and have had the same brilliant food, service, and atmosphere both times. Highly recomend this place.

Came here on a whim during my trip to NZ, was blown away by the food. The lamb was amazing, the oysters were also pretty good, and I loved all the desserts. The beef and duck were also good but the lamb was my favorite. Definitely want to return if I ever come back to Christchurch.

Looking for a spot within easy walking distance to our AirBnB in Christchurch, we stumbled upon this small restaurant literally around the corner from us. It was quiet, but there were people there and the staff was super friendly. The menu was interesting - and in an effort to taste as much as we could we decided to share. We weren't disappointed! They poured a nice drink and remained attentive and friendly throughout our meal without being intrusive. Go for the salt and pepper squid, excellently fried and crispy.  Followed that with the mussels, but asked the chef to please do a simple steamed which he did, no problem. I did the garden salad, amazingly fresh, lightly dressed and my partner did the baked market fish - on this evening monkfish - and prawns. Superbly done. We finished up with tea, coffee and the burnt cream - a lemon and almond creme burlee with a peanut butter cookie. Amazing.  Would go back in a blink.

The food was very good.  I had the special fish that was very uniquely prepared.  The menu is non-traditional, so it was a bit hard to make a choice with many unfamiliar items on it.  I got lucky with my choice, but my wife wasn't has excited about hers.    The ambiance is very nice in an old restored house.  Service was good, as well.
Amazing food.  Mussels are Gold Medal winners for an entree.  The Pork, venison, lamb were unbeatable as mains.  Don't miss it.  Service is fabulous and friendly.  Christchurch lives on!

Was visiting NZ for a few weeks. Had such a terrific meal there I went back before returning home 3 weeks later. We were lucky enough to try their Whitebait special & it was great. Sampled a few different regional beers that were recommended as well. Exceptional service & great food!

Solid all around. While the focus is on the food, the atmosphere doesn't disappoint either. This Christchurch staple serves up two styles with two restaurants in one - Astro Bar is in the back.   Cook'n with Gas - traditional New Zealand dishes done right. The keystone to the menu is lamb shanks with a mint jelly that will make a impression in the memory. The wine menu and pairings highlight what New Zealand has to offer to the wine world.   Astro Bar - good for drinks beforehand, after dinner, or a meal if you're not looking for the Cook'n with Gas full experience. As the signs in the bar say, "May the sauce be with you." Don't miss out on the Atomic fries and sauce.   Asaph Street may be for the up 'n comers and a good place to extend your night, but this is an essential Christchurch stop.

Cook'n with gas has been around a long time and for good reason. Our party of 6 dined here recently and had a fantastic evening. Our table was nearer the back of the restaurant and had a lot of space around it so we didn't feel crammed in and were able to be a little bit noisy. The food was fantastic, all the meat was perfectly cooked and delicious. I had the mussels as a starter and it was a very generous helping and the flavours were spot on. Next I had the mixed grill and wouldn't hesitate to order it again. Chocolate brownie for dessert was rich and decadent and a perfect finish. I tried most of the other dishes on the menu that other people had ordered and couldn't fault them.  What made dining at cook'n' with gas really special was the service. I think it takes a lot to make an impact as a server and NZ has a lot of good but not great service. Our waiter had extensive knowledge of wine and kept us entertained during the evening. Every wine choice he made was superb - it went with our meals and with our individual taste preferences. As a result I now have a few new favourite wines to hunt down!

Very nearly a perfect dinning experience; the staff were certainly aiming for perfection as I arrived here, having the door opened before I got there and for the first half of the meal serving in bulk two wait staff came to tell me  about the specials and drinks list!  I got great advice on trying the best oysters I have had the fortune of trying in all my visits to NZ and it was unusually matched with a dark hoppy ale that was supposing terrific! I asked for some tabasco and got that plus Lemon and Cracked pepper too.
