Next came my lamb cutlets which were beautifully prepared and was promised a match unique wine; unfortunately the later never arrived, and since by now the restaurant had started to fill I was unable to flag down anyone to point out this fact till long after the meal was done.  Pressing on I tried the chocolate dessert that despite my fears it would be too sweet I was assured that it was the most elegant to try and it delivered as good as I was promised.  Unfortunately again when it came to getting the bill I had to wait 10 minutes to get someone's attention and again for them to return with my receipts so that I could leave.  Despite these few small missed that seem due to not enough staff or over booking at one time this was a most enjoyable dinning experience.
Food was amazing! Food came out fairly quick and service was good.

Corianda Indian $19.90 Lunch Special  Tried their $19.90 lunch special — such a good deal! The curry was tasty and full of flavour, and the presentation was surprisingly nice for the price. Definitely worth checking out if you’re after a quick, affordable Indian meal that still feels a bit special.
Amazing spectacular dine in and the food was absolutely delicious
Good amount of food.
Very authentic Indian food. Worth a try.

Had a great meal with my wife and young child after a long day of travel.  The man waiting on us went above and beyond in terms of service, especially when our child was getting upset/tired/hungry.  Food was ace too.  Highly recommend.

Our visit to Corriander’s was very disappointing. The food was pathetic (below average). Waiting time too long although the restaurant was not too busy. Food lacked flavour and tasted terrible. We wouldn’t recommend.
Went here on a recommendation from a friend. I would definitely pass on that recommendation! Most delicious Indian cuisine I have had in a long time.

We were recommended to go to Coriander's Restaurant whilst visiting Christchurch as we were told they had a very good vegan menu.  We decided to go after a comedy show & arrived at the St Asaph St Corianders at 9.30pm very hungry.  Staff were very welcoming & said they were open until 11pm so we could get a table for two.  We explained that we needed all our food to be Vegan & Gluten-free & they said they could do that.  We ordered vegetable pakoras & onion bhajis for starters & a glass of wine each which was all very delicious.  The waitress bought out a yoghurt sauce with the starters which was quickly whisked away by the head waiter as it had dairy in it.  So we thought that they had the allergies & dietary requirements sorted.  We ordered two curries to share with rice as our main both from the vegan menu & were told that the curries were also GF & Vegan (we always ask several times as this combination is very rarely catered for well at any cafe or restaurant anywhere in NZ).  Everything was absolutely delicious & we were impressed with the soya chunks in the curries (used instead of chicken in the vegan curries), so much so that I asked where I could source it for my Vegan, 99% GF wholefood cafe in Timaru.  I was told by the waiter that it was called Soya Chaap & could get the tins of it at local Indian Supermarket or through food service providers.  Later that night my husband was feeling very uncomfortable with gut pain & bloating & the next day he was not well at all, barely able to function.  He is very intolerant to gluten (basically a coeliac), but we couldn't figure it out as we were sure that Coriander's had catered to our vegan & GF needs.  We decided to go to the Indian Supermarket to buy some of those tins of Soya Chaap & to our great disappointment discovered that they contained not only soy, but gluten wheat flour which was the 1st ingredient.  So as we own a 99% GF cafe, I definitely couldn't use it at all.  We are very hot on making sure the 1% of ingredients that do contain Gluten in our cafe (organic oat milk & organic date scones) do not ever get cross contaminated with the GF ingredients (as my hubby is very intolerant of course).  Anyway, I am very sorry to have to write all of this as we initially were thoroughly impressed with the service & the delicious food but I feel like I had to do this review to let other folks who are GF know that they can't have the vegan curries with the soy pieces in them as not GF.  My hubby was sick enough from just one meal but it could have been much worse for someone with chronic Coeliac Disease.  Suggest staff need more training all round both FOH & Kitchen staff as they may not be aware of the gluten content of the Soya Chaap they are using but it was clearly labelled on the tins of all the different brands at the Indian Supermarket.  We won't be going back unfortunately, which we are very sad about.
Didn't honor the 2 for 1 deal. Arrived cold. Didn't taste that good. Won't buy from again sorry

Chicken tikka was great. Biriyani was very bad, one of the worst I've ever had. It was a bit sweet and not much spice at all, and not much taste apart from this. Portion sizes for biriyani is also super heavy, restaurant should work on biriyani quality and have smaller portion sizes and prices. Staff were nice and when i conveyed the same reviews to them they took it humbly

Curry was better than expected and tasty, quite creamy and not runny. Medium hot wasn't very hot at all though so if you want some spice I'd recommend getting the hottest option. Garlic naan breads were soft and good portions. The restaurant itself is quite nice too with good seating and tables lighting, separate rooms and good decorations etc.
Corinader's consistently deliver great food and service. Unique colonial styled restaurant in the center of town with plenty of parking nearby.
We had the pleasure of dining at First Table last week. The food was really good, and the service was absolutely fantastic. Highly recommended to everyone looking for a great dining experience!
Had the breakfast bap twice now (I don't even live in Chch) and it's the best damn breakfast burger I've had. Can't wait for my next one!

The egg, bacon & cheese roll is absolutely amazing. We travel from Australia just for this roll. The chef is great at what he does, and this is genuinely one of those hidden gems. Can't recommend this store highly enough
Bbq ribs is the best order if you’re really hungry as the size was bigger than we expected. Meat was cooked just right and tasted really great.
Had BLT and Bacon Egg Cheese Roll. Cameron cooked them to perfection and asked us exactly how we liked them.  Would definitely eat here again

The burger is quite nice but overpriced. What upset me is the cheese was squeezed out and all over my hand but the owner would not let me wash my hands using the tap just behind the counter’ I have to say that was quite mean
Amazing place
The best chicken burger I've ever had.
This bloke is a magician brisket burger and pork loaded fries, gods work!!

restaurant: Costas Taverna Greek Restaurant and Ouzo Bar

reviews.text: The food was great and friendly staff.  Will go back again

My wife and I went for dinner on our anniversary and I have to say, Mr. fussy here was very impressed. I had the Village Style Kleftiko and my wife had the Canterbury Lamb Platter, wow, I mean far out. The Kleftiko was absolutely stunning, so full of flavour and fall apart melt in your mouth chunks of lamb, we of course sampled each others and my wife's was stunning as well, she concurred. Of course we had to have dessert and this is what sets Costas apart from every other dinning experience I've ever had. You've just had a beautiful main and in our case an entre not to mention a couple of wines and you're beginning to feel a bit full but you'd like a dessert, something sweet to finish things off. Enter Costas mini desserts, what a brilliant idea, you don't have to pay the full price of a dessert and its just enough so you're not left with that I ate too much feeling. I had the Baklava Ice Cream and my wife had the Chocolate Mousse, both excellent. All in all, a fantastic experience, beautiful food, great atmosphere and good service. Highly recommend Costas, can't wait to go back.
A little on the pricey side but really enjoyable food.

restaurant: costas taverna greek restaurant and ouzo bar

reviews.text: It's either Greek food is simply average Arabic food or I'm not a fan of Greek food.  We ordered all of our dishes from Souvlaki Platters section: we went with the falafel, chicken and lamb. All of these plates come with Greek salad, pita bread, four different sauces and your choice of side dish (rice, potatoes, or French fries)  The falafel was way below average. In the description they highlight it as crisp from the outside and moist from the inside, it was moist on both layers. Also felt very oily, should decrease the oil to get it to be crispy from the outside.  The chicken was good but then again I like this dish so it's hard not to satisfy me. The taste is very similar to "sheesh taowe" from a Lebanese restaurant. I would recommend ordering the chicken dish.  The lamb was just ok and again felt like "tikka" from a Lebanese restaurant so nothing special there.  Finally we got the baklava for dessert. The portion was big (we ordered the big size they also do have a mini if you want to taste) and it was good. Again I tasted mush better in Turkish restaurants.  Overall good restaurant if you want a middle eastern food in Christchurch.
Enjoyed a great dinner - had the calamari (good not spectacular), roast lamb (quite good) and roasted vegetables (fine).

We came in tonight for dinner. I got the fried chicken wrap and it was so great! Big portion for a good price and was delish. The blonde waitress (not sure of her name) was so kind,  attentive and funny!! Our meals did take a while but we were a large table
fish and chips very good

Family meal, very hot day was nice to sit inside and feel cool. The wait staff was lovely, very efficient and professional. We enjoyed our mains good value for money. I ordered the loaded wedges on the bar menu. Man those wedges just kept coming lol sour cream and cheese under the top wedges... happy days!! I took half home because I was full. We really enjoyed our meal and the atmosphere. The toilets were very clean. Parking was tight and saw cars tucked into the waitomo next door. Nice wee pub will go back.

We had visited here once, awhile ago but felt we had struck gold, visiting on a Thursday afternoon which was Happy Hour - 2 for 1 drinks (Kopiko Bay for a house wine was excellent) that included a good old free sausage sizzle - delicious.   We stayed on for dinner, and while it is a fairly typical pub restaurant, were pleasantly surprised by the quality and value for money.  Highly recommend and we will definitely be back.

Very dissapointed in the roast pork, waste of money, there was no butter, not enough gravy, the pork  tasted funny and the crackling tasted like lipstick but i would go back, i just wont be getting a roast again

Sat in the Sun, delicious food, great friendly staff made us feel welcome. We had amazing pork ribs for entrée, and lamb shanks curry, and juicy tender beef cheek. All cooked to perfection  was very happy with the experience, highly recommend. Would go back. Was also booked on first table, so makes the experience even better.

The thai food we ordered was very tasty, and the calamari and chips.  The ribs were pretty dry and the housemade BBQ sauce had no flavour, just sweetness.  Could be improved by adding tangy and smoky elements.  Definitely not very nice.  Overall recommend this place for a good local meal.  Prices were reasonable and service was good.
Amazing food, great portion size, excellent atmosphere and the best host anyone could ask for! Thanks Jum!!
First time visit - take aways. Delicious food; Pad thai & Chicken green curry!!  Will be back & might dine in some time! Looks like a nice venue! Thank you
This our first time here and our family really loved the food, the girls attended as well very nice. We really recommend!!
I came with my family and we loved the food , the Pad Thai  and fried chicken was delicious.
Think this place is a hidden wee gem, great value and the added bonus of the pokies for us degenerates

I like this place. It's a very nice cafe, with the added bonus of Keto offerings. The staff are professional, responsive and flexible to customers' needs. My companions and I enjoyed their Frittata, a Sandwich and an Omelette. On the day I visited, I had to take a business call in the midst of my lunch - the proprietor very helpfully took my meal and kept it warm while I was on my call. It was fabulous service. Coffee is good. I'll be back, thank you.

We thoroughly enjoyed an impromptu lunch here. It was like stumbling on Hansel & Gretells house in the middle of the Christchurch botanical gardens. It’s difficult to put into words how divine the gardens and ambience was. Then comes out the food which was fresh and flavoursome.  I would definitely recommend this experience.
This is a great place to eat. Excellent food and service. And close to excellent parking.

WOW WOW WOW.  Our party of 4 chose to sit inside as it was a little breezy. We had a nice room that seemed like our own private restaurant but with a view to the courtyard. I would come back simply because of the attentive and incredibly friendly service alone, but the food and wines were equally outstanding. Tapas and the selection of desserts exceeded our expectations. A special day for us was made all the more special. Thanks so much.
Lovely meal which was gluten-free.  I was served towards the closing time and I was not made to feel rushed.

Kind of hard to beat this location just inside the gate of the botanical gardens. What a pleasant atmosphere it has! The food was good, not great...but good. The best part is the freshness of the sauces and vegetables thanks to the fact it's all grown right behind the restaurant. The gardens are amazing and well worth the effort to check them out either before of after dinner. We had the seafood special and the seafood stew...both delicious. It's a nice dinner out.

Loved this place!  Found some good so tried it for lunch and the food was great.  The calamari was not my favorite, but the garden salad, croquettes and cheese plate were wonderful.  Had some great dry rose wine, as well.  If you are in the area, it's a must do.  Nice scenery.
A very pleasant lunch location at the edge of a large park and gardens. Fresh seafood and small plates, with a delicious soup. Service was a little slow, yet friendly and helpful with the menu.

Went by for an early supper with my wife. A very nice place, and despite the rating the prices were not too bad. We had the Tapas sampler plus the lamb tapa, and they were all very good. I felt we were ignored a bit by our waiter, but perhaps they were getting ready for their 6pm rush. I would definitely recommend reservations unless you are going by at 5pm as we did.
Had the grilled fish and sangria. Lovely meal. Had to whisper because it was so quiet!

We went here for dinner and it was a lovely experience. The service was exceptional, good menu knowledge and could accommodate variations. I also found the service attentive but not intrusive and could anticipate our needs without us having to ask. The food was amazing. Big portion sizes too. We had the bread with tomato and olive oil plus a dish of olives. For main we had vegetable trio and lamb shoulder and desert was brownie and almond tart. The food was fresh, full of flavor  and cooked to perfection. I know the chef not only takes pride in what they do but loves what they do, this was reflected in every dish. This restaurant comes highly recommended from me

Beautiful setting in the Botanic Gardens situated next to the Avon river. There is an extensive herb garden on one side of the old stone house. It was really hot so we ate outside on the side patio under umbrellas with a view of the garden. We had the croquettes , lamb and an amazing salad with goat cheese. It was all delicious ! We had a sweet waitress who was very attentive and nice glasses of wine ( pretty good selection to choose from). A wonderful way to enjoy a warm summer night in Christchurch .

A bit of an oddball place for lunch, but the location (literally in the Botanic Gardens) and the view (the Botanic Gardens) are hard to beat and the tapas were excellent.   The restaurant was quiet around lunch time, and we sat outside on the verandah to avoid the wind. Initially, we looked at the tapas menu and started wondering what we'd gotten ourselves into--ordering the plates piecemeal from the menu was a bit pricey for lunch. Fortunately, we noticed the lunchtime tapas platter that was meant to share, reasonably priced, and happened to include the tapas we'd planned to order anyway. Everything--the mushrooms, the croquettes, the chorizo--was delicious.   I only wish we'd had time to come back and explore the wine list...

For our last night in Christchurch we stumbled upon this restaurant while exploring the Christchurch Botanic Garden. We ordered potatoes and croquettes. Along with that we had a pitcher or red sangria. Amazing ! Make sure to have the sangria. The atmosphere was astonishing, the staff was super friendly. Definitely check this place out if you're around the area.

Curators house, The truth is that ,I did not enjoy the paella,it is once again not authentic Spanish.saying that I also have to say they have the best chorizo I have tasted in Chch.The chorizo can be bought from there shop. I know what I am speaking about I lived in Spain for 20 years and got trained there as a professional chef. The place is gorgeous,and it has a beautiful view.
Fine dining at its best. The type of place you go to that you always have to order a Scotch Fillet. Staff are always polite and friendly.
Not really a Tapas sort of guy but the authentic Paella topped up with the odd Tapas to fill was spectacular. Great setting in Botanic gardens open (fake) fire on cold, wet night. Fabulous.

A great spot to enjoy a glass of wine and some tapas after getting lost in the Botanic Gardens. With spectacular views of the Botanic Garden fountain and blooming flowers, it's hard to find a more picturesque location. The Curators House has indoor and outdoor seating which caters to the warm days and the chillier days. Their spanish tapas menu will set you back some dollars, but will leave you satisfied and they have a great list of local and imported wines for pairing.

We're a long way from home (San Diego, CA, USA) but at the Curators House we were made to feel right at home.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and the owner Javier stopped by the table twice to say hello and talk about the preparation of the dishes.    We had been to the restaurant before the big quake and had heard that they had damage and had been closed for quite some time.  We wondered if it would be as good as we remembered - and is was!  We had several tapas plates followed by lamb shoulder and a Spanish seafood stew.  They were top notch.  The wine list was not spectacular but solid and we had no trouble finding good pairings.   Of course, dining at the Curators is not complete if you don't take the time to roam the gardens.  A real first class garden mixing both a working garden and a decorative.  All in all a real complete experience!

What a wonderful place to have dinner while in Christchurch.  The location is lovely, adjacent to the botanical gardens, and the restaurant itself, is, as the name states, in the old curators cottage so history and charm abound.  We were lucky to get in on this Thursday night, the place was busy but I was lucky as my concierge pulled some strings and got us a cute table for two right in front of the window overlooking the garden.  A prime location, indeed!  Service was a bit slow which is why not the perfect score, but that may have been due to the fact that the place was very busy as it was a holiday the next day.  While they are known for their Spanish tapas, their menu has a pretty wide range.  Depending on how you want to eat, you can order a range of tapas to share as your dinner or a couple of tapas to begin with and then a couple of mains.  We chose to do the latter.  First up, we split the charcuterie plate.  This thing was huge and came with several kinds of meat as well as some bruschetta to enjoy it in.  We also had the lamb tapas which also was perfect for sharing.  For my main, I went with the lamb shoulder special of the day which was super tasty and very tender.  My friend wanted a steak and his came out perfectly prepared as well.  The ambiance is cute and the food is very good.  I also liked that the location allows for a stroll before or after dinner in the beautiful botanical gardens.  Dinner with drinks for two ran about $168 which was really reasonable given the quantity of food we consumed.  Too bad I don't live closer as this would go on my "to go again" list for sure!

I've been here a couple of times pre and post earthquake. I have very fond memories of having my 21st dinner here (way pre-EQ!) which was fantastic. Decor is nice, its a wonderful old house with fantastic views across Hagley Park.   Post-EQ I would say its a lovely place to come for drinks when the sun is shining. The outdoor area overlooking the park is amazingly relaxing on a warm summers afternoon/evening.   Last time I ate here though I have to say I was quite disappointed. There was a group of 6 of us and the meals were nothing special. Two of the steaks which had been requested medium-rare were in fact very well done and chewy and not so nice to eat, bordering on inedible. We debated saying anything as all of us are quite non-confrontational but one of us took up the baton and made the waiter aware! He ended up comping some desserts but I couldn't recommend this place on food alone. Although the chocolate mousse was good, the rest of the food was underwhelming. Maybe we hit the chef on a  bad day?   I probably won't be back for dinner, unless someone else makes the reservations.  On my last experience I would give this place 2.5 stars but seeing as I can't give half stars though yelp I rounded up to three as two seemed a little harsh. It gets rounded up for the outside drinks area.

I've heard such good things about the Curator's House Restaurant so we headed over there to celebrate my sister's birthday. Unfortunately the experience was one we'd all like to forget. The food wasn't good - two of the meals had to be sent back as the requests had been ignored, one of them was under cooked and the service was terrible. The waitress looked like she really didn't care and had so many other places she'd rather be (which is probably true but at least pretend!)  None of us have been back since. Such a shame as they have a really lovely location....

After trying multiple places since Everest in parklands sold and went through multiple hands Turing their food into garbage, I stumbled across this place. It doesn’t look like much, but as far as taste goes. It’s some of the best there is. I’m not there for the atmosphere. It’s the taste of the food and this place has it in spades. The garlic naan and vindaloo is authentic tasting and what I’m looking for. Good serving sizes also for the price. Absolutely recommend if your looking for Indian food in this area
Outstanding taste  of chicken tikka masala
Super yummy curry. I will be returning!
Chicken tikka masala was wonderful, the heat was just right, the serving was generous and the price very fair. This place would be my undoing if I lived nearby .

I ordered dinner from Curry Deluxe for delivery last night and spent over $100 on my Uber Eats order, but it was absolutely worth every dollar. I ordered several different curries for my family, and each one was a masterpiece. The butter chicken was creamy and rich, the lamb rogan josh was tender and full of flavour, and the vindaloo had the perfect amount of heat. Everything was packaged perfectly and arrived hot, which isn't always the case with delivery. The generous portions and incredible taste made the price feel justified. This is hands-down the best Indian takeaway in Christchurch, and I'll definitely be ordering from them again

Curry Deluxe is my go-to for lunch! I've had their delivery multiple times, and they're consistently fantastic. The food always arrives hot and fresh, as if I'd just ordered it in person. The flavors are incredible, and the portions are generous. Their delivery service is prompt, and the staff is always so friendly when I call to place an order. It's so nice to get five-star quality Indian food delivered right to my door. I highly recommend them if you're looking for a top-notch takeaway experience.

This is my new favorite spot! The food was incredibly flavorful, and every dish was prepared with care. The staff was friendly and attentive, making the dining experience truly enjoyable. I loved the atmosphere—it was so relaxing. I'll definitely be back for more. Specially the butter chicken was so good

I can honestly say that I have never had worse Indian food in all my life. I have been eating chicken tikla masala and Indian food for many many years and I asked for medium and what I got wasn't medium, I eat medium chicken tikla masala all the time and it's great but this was completely different texture and with bones in the chicken and next to no chicken as well, like 4 tiny little bony chicken bits and the heat was so hot it's as though someone was trying to prank me which I actually wonder if it was the case because it was inedible and I could not finish it for that reason. I feel ripped off and will never return and suggest you never do either.
Handsome Cashier and very social, made me wanna buy more hehe
The cashier is handsome and kind.
Got the curry for a good last price. We love this curry in a hurry
Really really good butter chicken $18.50 and Chana Masala $14.50. The guy who served us was super nice. The website is also really nice and intuitive with a good menu.
Unreal service
Some of the best food we have had. Have catered couple of times from then and the food is amazing...thank you guys for the great food. 100% recommend
Great tasting food and pleasant service, all at a good price - as always. Well done team.
Flavorful biryani with good spice balance, generous portions, and friendly service.
Ordered from Doordash  — prices are pretty good and the food was alright. Nothing flash, but decent feed for the price. Good spot if you just want something easy and affordable.
Great food, great service, and great price thanks
Delicious
One of best Indian food I had. The owner is friendly and the food is yummy. The price is good. Will definitely come back again
The staff here are awesome people and so great at what they do!  Food is amazing - We got butter chicken which is delicious every time
Another great meal at our favorite Indian restaurant. We will be back again
Excellent food. Friendly staff. Love the mango chicken. We will be back soon
The best Chicken Tikka Masala
We have this restaurant on our work team lunch rotation and I really look forward to when we go.  The staff are super friendly and the food is amazing!
Very good service and nice food!

Takeaway from here tonight  was excellent! After reading the reviews I went in cautious as it was nice and close to us but I didn't need to be. The service was polite and efficient. I ordered 2 curries with naan and a beer for the wait was just over $60 and was pleasantly surprised with a snack also as I waited. At home the food was piping hot and delicious!
Good food friendly staff
The owner was blocking the car park and when i asked him to allow us to exit. He verbally abused me and did a single figure gesture
Was brought here by family friends staying in NZ, the Chinese food here is delicious and rather decent and authentic. Definitely reccomended for those craving chinese hometown food.
Really enjoyed the food here. Service was great and staff were friendly.
Business is booming. Every dish is of excellent quality and leaves a lasting impression.
Every dish is super delicious
Went for a live show very cool venue.
This is a great location for bands to debut, have some fun and entertain. Great bar and staff.
Twas dark , in the shape of a room...
Love this place!
Cute cosy bar with a fun atmosphere. I learned that Double Brown was a craft beer, and highly revered in this venue.

Excellent vibe! Great sound system and crowd. Everyone was enjoying the live performance and hardly anyone on their phones. Would recommend this to anyone who wants a taste of CHC’s underground music scene. Be sure to check their website for the lineup. Tickets can be purchased at the door or online.
Osso buco was v. tender & yummy.

We had a great girls night at Delilah. There was live music when we arrived which was lovely. Can't really comment on the food as we only had nibbles (crispy chicken and chips) which were good. Their cocktails are yummy (we had the hey there delilah). The atmosphere it was really busy so it was really loud and hard to have a conversation as couldn't hear much. Service was good, the lady serving us was very friendly and accomodating.

The food was lovely, we went specifically to hear the live music and have a few nibbles with our drinks.  I am very critical when it comes to squid and what arrived on my plate was cooked to perfection.  I loved the live music supplied by the Jinx Duo, the atmosphere they created was fun and good easy listening.

The bread that we ordered seems very heavy and very oily as if it was soaked in oil for a long time, a but bland too. That server named Daisy is also SOOOOO RUDE. I was talking to her to order but she literally just walked pass me. It wasn’t even a busy night yet because you can see her not doing anything at the corner.

The server named Daisy (i think thats her name) is very rude! went there on halloween night. She looks very uninterested on serving us then go at the back and dance with her other coworker. The other servers are nice but her. She looks older than the other server because shes taller than all of them. Just hope shes not the manager because thats just not it.

Service today was pretty poor! We were told to take a seat and someone would be out with menus.... despite a few staff members coming out to serve the 3 or 4 other tables outside without noticing or caring that we were sat with an empty table, that didnt happen so we ended up using the QR code on the table after 20 mins passed (I was actually ready to leave). To be fair, if we were told or asked to us the QR code from the start we would've been happy to do so. 3/4 of our drinks arrived, the next arrived several mins after that. The food we ordered was actually really good (and the waitress that bought it out was very pleasant). I don't know why no one bothered to serve us today, I have enjoyed coming here in the past but today missed the mark completely when it comes to service. There are plenty of other choices in the area, lots of competition, wouldn't you want to show up for your customers as best you possibly can.

Nice restaurant with friendly staff and nice food. I didnt give it 5 stars because I felt the market fish was a little bland but otherwise tender. The steak was nice. My highlight was the chicken salad I thought the flavours worked well.
A nice American style dinner. Good on a low budget or for a basic meal.
Food wasn’t the best tasted like used old cooking oil customer service was good could improve
I had breakfast it was good and very reasonable price. Staff attentive coffee was topped a few times.
Come back here after 2 years and I am so disappointed to see that they cut down almost by half the size of the portions they serve. Not worth the price you pay anymore..

Great selection of yummy drinks. After an hour setting up a game, decided it was too complicated. Put it back and host helpfully recommended a new game we loved: Skytrain. Cooperative rather than competitive.

Charming little board game nook in central Christchurch. Great food, one pizza was perfect for two hungry travellers. Nice relaxed vibe and great music. We were super lucky that there was a free table outside and the weather was nice, all the inside tables were booked out in advance.

What an amazing place to spend time with family, have some fantastic pizza and drinks, and play some (board) games! I chose this venue as something different for birthday celebration. We were a bit lost given a huge selection of games to choose from, but staff were helpful and made suggestions that suited our group really well. The pizzas are huge and delicious! We got two for a group of 5 and ended up taking home some leftovers. The cocktails were great!
Great pizza, delicious cocktails and more games than you can imagine. Try the Turkish Delight - it comes in a very cute teapot and saucer. :)
Awesome pizza, super chill vibe

Forever and always the best food in Christchurch! The lamb makes me drool   I've made great friends overseas after bonding and realising we both loved Dimitris! You've got global recognition as being the best, and I'm yet to find any souvlaki that's half as good!
Food was ok. But the way, (the owner apparently) spoke to her staff was absolutely disgusting. We used to go here once a week. We will never go back Shame.
Nobody beats Dimitris, best souvlaki I've had and probably ever will have. Highly recommended. Delicious every time.
Perhaps the best Souvlaki I've had. Tender and delicious bite sized, tender, juicy, chunks of lamb, cushioned in warm, thick and soft pita and a tangy white sauce.  Delicious.
Quick food, but large portions and very well-made. The chicken was grilled perfectly!
Dimitri Food Truck , Very good souvlaki,I personally love the classic lamb one.Its situated in the container mall downtown Chch.The atmosphere is really cool there,the are lots of other food trucks.

Best food truck in town. Permanently based in the container mall. Great souvlakis, I recommend the lamb with kalamata olives. If your in the central city and looking for a light lunch you could do a lot worse.

Dimetris is a Christchurch institution, friendly service and fantastic food. But when it comes to Souvlaki there is none better than the triple lamb with extra feta. I'm so happy that they have finally move into their shop on Riccarton Road .
Solid spot for lunch. Service is friendly and quick. The portion is big for the price and it is quality. I liked the lamb. Really tasty spot I Definetly would check it out

The best restaurant in or around the container mall.  The servings are huge and the food is amazing.  You have to try the lamb/beef combo!  It is a little messy and greasy so grab some napkins and don't wear your Sunday best.

Dimitris Greek Food is a Christchurch Classic that has been in the CBD for years, their most common lunch is a thick bread souvlaki, served ready to eat with your fingers and a fork. It's not quite like a rolled pita pocket (say from pita pit), but a Greek version of, with a much thicker bread rolled into a cone shape to hold the ingredients.  Suggest getting the standard sauces, which include a garlic yoghurt tatziki and a Greek tomato based sauce. Together with a juicy meat of your choice (chicken, lamb, beef, or mixed) and salad it's a very tasty lunch indeed.  A single is $10, double $12.50, and triple $15.50.  There can be quite a queue, but these guys are efficient and quick to have it in your hands in no time.

Have been here three times now, so have collectively reviewed.  All three sets of meals (amongst groups, so a number to choose from) have been average or below average. Today's waffles were so dry that they needed absolutely drowning in maple syrup to choke them down. Our visitors said multiple times today that they regretted ordering them. Embarrassing. Portions are generally small.  Other times have had poor experiences. Food can take forever to arrive on occasion. Need to constantly beg for drinks/refills, including those we had actually ordered - service is excruiatingly slow.  It doesn't seem as if the owners have experienced a real American diner.  It's too hard. The theme is great and we want to love it, but this is a terrible example of Christchurch hospitality. The quality of the average Christchurch cafe is much higher than this. We eat out a lot and just cannot recommend this to others in good faith. The theme is the drawcard but on arrival, they do not deliver on anything except the bill.
Closest we've come to having what my family would consider to be a "normal burger", in New Zealand.
We dined here last night for my daughters birthday, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the food was great  althea Arizona burger was
Outstanding service by Meika we loved her such a Gem!!!! Went over and beyond dont find such a hospitality much more any longer.
Delicious food, great service.  Can join your loved ones at Summerset Retirement Village for morning tea, lunch, afternoon tea, or dinner.

restaurant: DOMI SICHUAN SNACKS/哆咪四川小吃

reviews.text: Authentic Chinese food with lots of variety of flavors. Such a beautiful dining experience with family! Love the food, friendly and helpful owner with great service! Definitely come back again
Always incredible food. Great flavour & taste. From the Dan Dan noddle's, to the eggplant & the yummy Sichuan dumplings  Can't wait for our next visit to try something new.
Decent Chinese restaurant in Chch! Lovely spicey mapo tofu

We went to this place for spicy food. I will say, it isn’t too spicy but the flavour is there. There is chilli oil if you need to put more spice in.  We got the sliced beef in tongue numbing sauce and the pork dumplings in Sichuan style sauce. The dumplings were soft and flavourful, the pork’s natural oil coated my lips nicely. The sliced beef was the standard velveted beef, the kicker is the sauce. Make sure to have Jasmine rice on the side to soak up all the flavour. They were very generous with the serving, three people could be full with the sliced beef.  The atmosphere was eccentric, kids would definitely have a blast looking at the paper statues of minecraft characters, a gigantic ice age character with his wallnut, and Chinese decorations. Despite its unusual decor, the temperature and the overall atmosphere makes you feel very at peace while eating and conversing with your loved ones.  I cannot stop talking about how the table and chair are the perfect height in relation to each other, it just makes you feel extra comfortable in the space.  I would highly recommend eating in, the service was very accommodating. They asked for my preference for forks or chopsticks, hot water, and if I needed more spice.  Overall, this place does well in what it does. 5/5.  Edit: We came back again, it was the best fried rice we have ever tasted. I thought it would be the usual fried rice from Chinese takeaways, but this one was different. It was not oily, the wok hei is to die for. They made it spicy just for us because we seem to have ordered only spicy food off the menu, which was nice. The wontons were so soft and tender. The intestine noodle soup was way more flavourful than our usual noodle spot in Riccarton. It definitely satisfied our spicy cravings. The front of house person is always accommodating, a stark contrast to some restaurants around the city.  We went back for a third time, but didn't realise they are closed on Wednesdays.
On October 11, 2025, I had lunch at Domi Sichuan Snacks, a pretty good Sichuan restaurant with reasonable prices.
the best Sichuan cuisine in NZ!!

Had the salmon sushi ,it was very mushy, not much flavor either, The owner/ manager after a month replied and  asked me what was mushy? The salmon was mushy and had no salmon flavour,and the rice was just average
Amazing flavours, generous -sized portions at affordable prices. All served quickly, fresh, hot and most importantly, with a smile! Thanks
I had the spicy pork and it tastes delicious. Nice place for sushi!

I ordered through Uber Eats and tried the takoyaki (octopus balls) and the gluten-free teriyaki chicken donburi. I was pleasantly surprised — everything arrived at the perfect temperature and tasted super fresh, from the tender meat to the crisp vegetables. The portions were generous, and the quality for the price is excellent. I was also really happy to see they offer several gluten-free options, which is a big plus. Definitely a great spot if you’re looking for fresh, flavorful food at a reasonable price.

Ordered on Uber Eats and had to come and leave a review. I’m a typical female where when I crave something, and it isn’t up to par I get hangry, this place satisfied every craving! Salmon bento box was absolutely delicious. Portion size and quality/freshness of the ingredients used were on the money! Thank you. Will definitely have this listed as a fav - Compliments to the chef and staff
Loved everything about this place. Great food, amazing service, and a cozy vibe. Can’t wait to come back!
The taste is good, but the amount is speechless, which is very different from the picture on the signboard.
Best service , best rice ball, my favourite lunch

One of the highlights of our visit to Christchurch was being able to visit multiple times and try various things here. It's absolutely phenomenal food and very lovely service too. If I visit Christchurch again, I will make sure I come back here.
Delicious food and very friendly customer services. Thili and the chefs are wonderful!
Highly recommended by many, and even better than expected!! The chicken curry is fantastic!!
Dosa was quite good.
Amazing staff and even better food  Do not miss this amazing place
Very delicious and tasty,  value for money
Beautiful service, the boy in the front counter was so kind hearted and he has a beautiful haircut

A fine cafe, nothing major to note. I'm just here to address the lack of bins in the toilet, weird right? Please add a change table for babies at toddlers, you have a great high chair service. A change table and bins would make this a fantastic cafes for young families.

One of the best egg Benedict's I've ever had. Taste very distinct and I choose pulled pork and it paired very well. Great coffee and the smoothies are very good. Went with a mango passion fruit smoothie

Dose is certainty my favorite cafe at the moment. Great coffee and service and the Eggs Benedict on home made Rosemary hash browns is the best in town. They have a nice selection of counter food along with bread and pastries from their own bakery.
Great food, great coffee, great yard in the sun at the back, excellent service. My chosen regular lunch venue.

LOVE Dose and visit often. Their new location is going through some growing pains, but their coffee is the best we've had in Chch and their brunch items are quite delish (would recommend eggs Benedict and salmon bagel).  Only thing lacking is free wifi which we feel is a must-have for café atmospheres
Awesome coffee, food and service. Highly recommended.
Lovely bar and friendly staff. We shared a delicious cheese platter.
Great cocktails, wines and beers. Food was pretty good, we loved the croquettes and the salad. Lots of options for dietaries like gluten free.
Excellent food and drink here, enjoyed myself greatly with some beautiful wine and lovely and attentive service throughout the evening - perfect way to start an evening.

Best dinner we had in NZ. Lamb and chips !! Duck liver dish was a bit heavy and huge. Add more cream! Fancy desserts too. Waitresssing was cheerful but of varying quality. If if I ask about a particular type of wine- don’t just tell me which is the cheapest- not helpful.

Awesome little spot in the heart of Christchurch! Great drinks, cool vibe, and super friendly staff. Max the manager is a legend – really welcoming and makes the place feel extra special. Definitely worth checking out if you’re in town.
Very good staff, went out of their way to make sure I was not allergic to what I had ordered. Friendly and fast

Had drinks here a couple of times. Small selection of craft beers but very well chosen. Amazing selection of wines and some awesome, interesting cocktails. From what we saw, we regretted not getting food! The staff are welcoming and absolute pros.
Great staff, helpful, friendly and courteous.
If you’re happy to wait an hour after ordering before your food comes, you’ve found your perfect restaurant.

Fair price. Big portion in every dishes. Tastes good. There is a black hair young lady treat mandarin- speaking customers so mean and poker face. Other waiters are nice. So weird that treat other people better than our own ethnicity….
Ordered a chicken fried rice. It was very dry and less amount of chicken. Wouldn’t recommend.

We ordered Beef brisket noodles. It was mouth-watering experience. Broth was rich in flavour and portion was huge. Good for 2 I guess but I was so hungry that time I was able to finish all. Parking was on the back. Church corner market area.
open until late night
Super fast and accommodating. Always come back for affordable yummy food.
very fast service, my food didn’t take long at all!
Great place to eat very busy but fast and good service  I would recommend this place to anyone .
Love the booths. Heaps of great options. Huge portions. Amazing value. Liked having filter coffee.
Awesome breakfast. Amazing staff.
Mean food, Karen served us and I loved her!  Funny lady to brighten up your morning :)

Came here for breakfast, disappointed. Plastic cups for water, ordered the eggs bene- burger buns instead of muffins? Apparently they’ve changed to “potato based buns” menu still states English muffins. Was my favourite to goto but now probably won’t come back!
Fantastic breakfast we really loved it thanks to the chef
Amazing food. Amazing service.

Visiting Christchurch from Australia and we are so glad we found this place. Not only are their meals delicious, they also have fantastic service. The restaurant is very clean and you are made to feel very welcome. Thankyou so much to the DTA team for doing a fantastic job!
Brand new, hidden gem  just a fee minutes from downtown or Riccarton.

DTA is a relatively new restaurant offering both eat-in and take out. It is the in-house restaurant at the Grand Riccarton Hotel, so is not immediately obvious. As an in-house restaurant the decor is toned down, but pleasant. The staff are both friendly and attentive. The menu choice is smaller than you might expect at an Indian restaurant, but the food was well cooked, being very well spiced and delicious. I had Paneer Padkora entree, which is made using their own made Paneer. It was my first try of tbis dish and I wasnt disappointed. For main I had Chicken Kadhi (hot) with plain rice and Naan. The main was beautifully spiced with great balance and very tasty. The rice portion was spot on, enough to enjoy with the main, leaving enough gravy to mop up using the Naan. It was a great meal, and I would definitely go again.

We hosted our annual team dinner at DTA (Don't Tell Anyone) and the experience was fantastic. The private room provided the perfect environment for a productive yet relaxed evening, and the staff were incredibly professional, ensuring every detail was covered with a friendly demeanor. The food was excellent across the board, handling various dietary needs with ease, and multiple colleagues commented on the high quality of the dishes. For any business looking for a reliable, high-end venue for a corporate function, DTA is a stellar choice we will definitely be using again.

We had a fantastic time for our business conference dinner! The atmosphere was warm and welcoming — perfect for great food and even better conversation. The staff were friendly and organized, making everything run smoothly. Every dish was delicious, from the starters to dessert. It was the perfect spot to unwind after a busy day of meetings. Highly recommend for any team or corporate event!

The name says “DNT Tell Anyone (DTA)”, but I honestly want to tell everyone!  The food here is absolutely amazing — authentic Indian flavours, perfectly balanced spices, and the consistency is always spot on. Every dish tastes fresh, rich, and made with love.  It’s rare to find a place that delivers true Indian taste every single time — DTA definitely sets a new standard! Highly recommend this hidden gem
Best lunch place around.
Great food
Loyal customer of the local legendary $2 rice ever since the store was down (2) arcade(s) in the city centre.  Never had a bad meal here.  :)
Very cheap and filling, and sooo good

Found hair in my food, my boyfriend and I bought Lunchbox 1 and was upset to find hair all throughout the fried rice. Staff were so rude and made us feel uncomfortable, safe to say we didn’t feel welcome and won’t return. Do better.
I came across it by chance; it offers quite a lot of things, but the coffee ice cream really gives the impression of biting directly into coffee grounds.
Great place for drinks, awesome live band
Absolutely awesome atmosphere loved it

Perfect location to imbibe boutique craft beers beginning in their sun drenched beer garden. Special mention of these tasty beers: Seasonal special release Throbbing Hazy and Dux Hazy. You gotta try them out! I've never been disappointed here, always a great vibe and exceptional service standards. Talk to the engaging and informative Anthony who will find the best beverage for you on any occasion

A lovely evening spent here with my laptop on their wifi as I've just arrived in Christchurch and trying to figure out what's next. Friendly bartender who pulled me a delicious cold beer.  Lots of options for drinks and food, seats inside and outside and even upstairs. Quiet, cool, comfortable.   [Review 365 of 2024 - 18 in New Zealand - 21398 overall]

Dog-friendly, solid outdoor patio, and right by the trolley line so you get to see the dinner-trolley-thing drive by.  Focused more on beer than wine, and the food is good enough to say it's better than average, but not so much that you might actually rave about it. Calamari strips and fried chicken were both decent enough deep fried items, and the seafood chowder was good enough to hit the spot on an evening rapidly turning cool.  Service was refreshingly honest (out of mussels due to a local shortage) and I think that really sealed the rating as 4* rather than 3*.

Possibly the worst food I've ever eaten. Poorly executed and lacking even the most basic of seasoning.  A truely horrible experience  Unfortunately I have to give it one star in order to post this review

Good atmosphere and nice staff. Beer was really good and the food was great. Had the pork belly with soy sauce, Caesar salad (salmon was so nice with it) and BBQ seafood pizza. If I lived locally I would definitely be back
Delicious menu options Lovely back garden seating
We booked for my Mum’s birthday, the server was amazing and made it a super special evening for her. Loved the atmosphere and super welcoming for dogs. Thanks!

I would no longer recommend Dux Dine to vegans  They used to have a number of great vegan options. Now the only main that can be made vegan is a quinoa salad, where the halloumi is removed and not replaced with anything.  I didn't want to pay $30 for just a quinoa salad, so I ended up with a starter for dinner, which was just flatbread with vegetables (goats cheese was removed and not replaced with anything)  The new menu is disappointing and my non-vegan family was also not really impressed with their meals
Never an excuse for poor customer service.
Beautiful food and excellent staff

If I could give the food a zero out of 5 I would. Fish and chips was equivalent to sealord hoki fillets from the freezer at the supermarket, only with 3 times the batter and a pathetic slice of fish. My father’s birthday lunch was totally ruined. I have no idea how this place is in business. An absolute disgrace

Of one the best experiences I’ve had in Nz. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive, food was delicious and the restaurant itself is well decorated and spacious with a beautiful outside area. I went there with my 8 years old son and from the front of house to the kitchen staff everybody received and served us super well.
Great night out
Absolutely divine food and service, the focaccia bread is to die for!
Amazing food and service, we had the Eat like an Earl for a selection of dishes which was well priced and delicious. The prawns and gnocchi was especially amazing. We'll be back soon!

I am now planing my business trips to ChCh to be there on a Tuesday (Pasta Night) constant changing pasta dishes and experimenting with flavours, texture and pasta … love this place and my star in the dull New Zealand hospo industry… I would love to drag most business owners here to learn what hospitality is all about 100/10 - well done

It could have been a great dinner, but it wasn't... It started with the waiter pouring us soda water without asking if we want soda or tap. The toilets are very unclean (we were at 17:30,so things couldn't get better after i think, and it was pretty bad). We ordered croquets for first, cocktails and for main we ordered the steak and gnocchi. At no point (not while given the menus nor when the order was taken) the waiters (different ones) bothered to notify us that the steak was not included in first table, like they do in other restaurants.  cocktails were very good, croquets not bad (had better but it were good). The mains arrived. The steak was good but relatively small and about 30 percent of it were hard fat. This is not something i would expect in a restaurant, definitely not for this price.  The gnocchi was excellent but the quantity of gnocchi was small (most of the dish was sauce, that was excellent but that's not the point). We had two more cocktails and finished with affogato which was good. As we paid, i realized the steak wasn't in the deal. I'm not the kind of person to argue so we paid and left. Overall our savings were 24$, definitely not worth it. In general, the whole experience was underwhelming and left a bitter taste. I wouldn't come again.
Just the most delicious food - my favouriterestaurant in Christchurch
I dine at Earl quite often when in Christchurch. Pleasant restaurant setting and the food is always well prepared and tasty.
Beautiful environment, great food and service. I ordered the lunch salad with lamb. Delicious! Back for the chicken schnitzel sandwich!

My friend and I, thanks to grab one went for an "eat like an earl" set menu experience  There isn't much that I didn't like about the place, the service was great. The food was fresh and delicious.  We weren't really explained what food was coming when we were seated, which was ok because I enjoy the  element of surprise. Portions were solid, would definitely come back to try full menu.

Save yourself from food poisoning. Do not come here. Their food is not fresh. The rice and tofu used in the tofu stew hot pot all tasted spoiled.  When we brought this up to the staff, they insisted everything was fresh. Even though I could not eat the majority of the food, they would not do anything to discount the order.

This restaurant was amazing. My family and I have been looking for a Korean restaurant to eat at for a while and i would say this restaurant is definitely a great choice. Staff is extremely helpful and kind. The food definitely exceeded my expectations, where I had the pork rice meal (#18) and my family shared the galbi-tang. Both were such delicacies   10/10 would come again!

This restaurant is AMAZING!! Tried many different dishes, the takoyaki was the BEST I've ever tried, sushi was amazing, fast and friendly service too. It's just as well I don't live in Christchurch or I would spend all of my money here  will most definitely be back again!
The chicken and corn dumplings are so so yum! Highly recommend, ordering online service was so handy and they have very helpful staff! Yummiest dumplings i've ever had!! :)

So busy and sooooooo good. Everything was SO flavorful. The Dan Dan noodles were very good, the dumpling sample was fun. I didn't like one of them but most were very good. I loved the pork and rice dish!!!!! Seriously I highly recommend.

Eightgrains served me the best gua bao (called pork belly bao on the menu) I've had since Taiwan! Just the right amount of pickled greens, peanuts, and a dusting of spice - mmmm! If I had more time in the city I'd have picked up a bag of these to have a picnic with (although really you can't let these sit, the bun will get soggy).  I also enjoyed the dumpling sampler platter, although I don't think it came with every flavor of dumpling like the lady behind the counter assured me. I also wished the sauce for the red wine/pulled beef didn't spread out all over the rest of the dumplings, because they had their own flavors that didn't need to be overshadowed. I think my favorite dumplings was the chicken, corn, and coriander - and I loved that they offered both spicy chili oil and regular sesame oil for dipping.

Eightgrains is located in the Little High Eatery, which is a food hall with eight local eateries.  We ordered a fried chicken bao, a fish bao, and two kinds of steamed dumplings.  They all were great.  As I mentioned in my Little High Eatery review, you'll need to grab a table to get seating.  On weekend rainy days that could be an issue because some of the outside seating won't be available.
Good food, friendly service. The food presentation was nice, and the taste was amazing. Lovely place for both lunch & dinner.
The ramen was really good, fantastic broth.  The sweet and spicy chicken was good, but didn’t come out super hot, it was like warm.
Recommend pork buns
awesome place, delicious food and friendly staff

The mapo tofu is delicious!!! It's a bit fusion-style, but it's more Chinese-style(?). I'll try the dumplings next time.  I came back and ordered the roast pork platter, but it was so thick...  It was so delicious! It was only $25! Worth it!  Mapo tofu is sooo nice.  We came again and ordered the roast pork platter. Crispy, thick, chewy, and so nice! Try it out.
Friendly customer service and food was delicious!
Best sushi in Christchurch.
Such a lovely little gem. Delicious and simple Japanese food! Love it
Delicious,
Braised beef, kids' burger, pork ribs
A truly authentic Japanese restaurant, offering delicious sushi and bentos. It's a shame they close at 3—I wish they were open for dinner as well!
Fabulous lunch spot! Visiting from the US and one of my favorite meals! I enjoyed the bento box and my wife loved the chicken curry!
Very authentic tasty food,
Customer service was great from lovely sparkly woman, food amazing and cooked to perfection

Ordered a medium rare ribeye steak, was served well done. When I brought it back the cook argued with me, claiming it was medium. It was not. The steak was dry,  chewy, and grey.  Additionally, it took over 45 minutes for the steak to come out. Really bad service and unfortunately bad quality food. Don’t eat here, there are plenty of other restaurants in this plaza and any of them will be a better use of your time and money.
I had simply the best steak sandwich here! Amazing taste, steak was cooked perfectly & was so tasty. 100% recommend.
These guys sure now how to grill. Love this place
Always have a great time when dining here - nice and cozy place, friendly staff and great food!

Was craving Argentine BBQ for a long time. Overall I was satisfied but the customer service I received left a bitter end. Firstly, I was going to be charged 20$ more, luckily I realised before I tapped my card. I ordered a mixed grill platter for 1, everything was cooked beautifully down to the sauces however the rump cap was extremely tough. When I sent it back the server wasn't helpful, he said they cannot replace it because I ate most of it, which was a lie (it was practically inedible ) . This went back and forth because I was very frustrated . I then agreed to have it cooked longer (against my will) , to then be given a brand new piece of rump, after all that fuss lol. Quite a disappointing service.

Steak was good abit pricey but your paying tourist prices.Service was poor we had to wait to order no one in shop? Waitress told us we couldn't use cutlery outside we had to use other cutlery.She stood waiting for us to exit with our $90.00 worth of food we had purchased which was very rude.Food was good,  service was poor.Wont be back.

Meat and chips on a shared platter = TO DIE FOR   Only suggestion: skip the bread-roll - it was more like a scone and not very edible. But honestly, we weren’t there for the bread, so it doesn’t change our 5-star rating!

Honestly the best meal I have had in Christchurch. Can't get over how full of flavor it all was, I got the Pork Belly with a side of cheesey potatoes and salad, I can't decide what was the best part. Service was friendly and fast. Looking forward to eating there again.
Really excellent food and the chips are one of the best I have had
love this place. bar man nathan is such a great bloke! super friendly and welcoming.
My grandad said I have to rate it 5star because he's been drinking here for over 30years lmao

Sadly noodles were overcooked and doughy. Meat portion in beef noodle soup was sparse. As for the bun with the filling, the bun was unfortunately very solid and hard to chew through. :( looked like a young family starting a new business so would like to come back to support but there needs to be improvement.
This place is the postman....it delivers everytime.  Best cold noodles in the South Island.
Great food
Great food, huge portions, affordable price and friendly staff! Very clean and tidy! Highly recommend
The cumin beef steamed bun and cold noodles are delicious and recommended. But be careful with the mutton soup steamed bun, as this is the worst mutton soup steamed bun I have ever eaten in my life.
Very good customer service, amazing food, super friendly and good music, very happy with my experience here!
This fried chicken place is so delicious, I kept licking my fingers after eating it!!

Visiting Christchurch, first day I spotted this place with a bold claim on the front of their store “best fried chicken in Christchurch”. That had me, had to try it, finally did; and damn!! Update the sign, possibly best in the country!! The juiciest fried chicken I have ever had
The chicken fillet is super delicious
Matt D at the food truck was awesome! Best chicken we have ever had and the most amazing service ever! Thank you for such an incredible experience Matt. Keep empire chicken in New Brighton!
We ordered the chicken strips and they were so good, best strips I’ve ever had. And the aioli was insane too! Sorta expensive for 4 tenders but worth it!!

Got a butter chicken and cheesy garlic naan. Butter chicken was very runny and no flavor sadly. Not sure if the naan had any cheese in it. It was also soggy seemed to not be cooked properly. Thought I'd try a new place but regret doing it now
The food was lovely. The service was fast. Thank you so much for an enjoyable evening.

Recently dined at Everest Indian Restaurant with a group of friends. Very positive experience, yummy good value food, attentive service, nice atmosphere. BYO also. We are regular customers and will be back.

I really loved the food at Everest Indian! The service was excellent, and the staff were very kind and well-behaved. I highly recommend this restaurant. For me, Everest Indian is the best in Christchurch I absolutely love it!
Best Indian food that I have ever had. The Chana masala is really good food I highly recommend it

I went to Everest Indian Restaurant in Parklands yesterday. The food was really delicious, and I was very impressed with their service. The staff were polite, kind, and very respectful. They truly cared about the customers’ needs. Along with the great food, I also received wonderful customer respect. I’ve never experienced such amazing service anywhere else before. I’m very happy with the service I got yesterday, and I’ll definitely visit again next time. It was an amazing experience!
Highly recommend Punjabi chicken. Great taste of Punjabi. Must try.

Taste like MSG curry! Mean palak, vegetable pakora a go to, green sauce lacking but (theory) msg in the pakora batter too? Tastes a little too good for chickpea flower. Would go back? Have been many times, staff are donnys . P.s. Handmade naan is flame out the gate hellishly cheesey
Great food and even better service! The staff were kind and helpful, and the meals were fresh and delicious. A wonderful place to eat — highly recommend!
Best restaurant in Christchurch
Great food
Had great butter chicken tonight, hopefully it's this good next time!
Christchurchs worst bar. Avoid at all costs. So many better options in Christchurch.  Unprofessional bouncers and management team and not a safe place to drink

We went to Fat Eddie's in mid afternoon, on a Sunday. For a quiet drink and snack. (We chose the bacon,cheese loaded fries)! Service was very friendly and hospitable- Venue itself is quiet large on first floor of building! Appears only accessible by stairs from a side lane. Full of character and a collection of chalk board - sayings, signs and weird and wonderful pieces adorn the walls and ceiling( lampshades and musical instruments to name some!) We have gone past in the evenings and this place has been busy with rollicking music,guests and a rock an roll vibe to boost!
Two for one pizza deal was great for an easy dinner exploring the city
The paneer bhurji is always good but tonight it was probably the best Indian food I’ve ever had. Incredible fresh flavours and spices. Highly recommend trying this.
Our favourite Indian place in Christchurch!! Best service and yummy food everytime !!

Bhuna lamb curry, worst I've ever had, uneatable, sour onion flavour.phone them to give feedback. all i got was sorry and hung up on. Totally disappointing service and food. Nan was small and no cheese like ordered.
The best Indian food in Christchurch by far. I love Indian, and have been to many around the city and South Island, this one is the best.

Always good to find a good curry. Have been told to try it many a time and no regrets. Great food and service. Will definitely go again as being english always good to find a good curry even if its a bit out of the way

Delicious curry’s from Ferry Indian!  I’ve only tried them through takeouts but still thoroughly impressed with quality and quantity!!  I’ve been told I should dine in! Apparently very cosy/intimate dining vibe, can’t wait to try!
Super excited to see that this place is amazing.  The staff is really fantastic and the food was exceptional.  Will definitely try it again.  We were lucky to get a reservation.

Dined solo here and got the "Lamb shoulder, creamy polenta, almond brown butter carrots, plum chutney, jus" and it was SO good. Lamb was super tender and all the other ingredients tasted great with the lamb. The piece of lamb was generous so come hungry! Service was standard. Inside is cozy and the chairs are comfortable. Totally recommend coming here if you're looking for some great food.

I enjoyed a great dinner here. I had booked a table the day before and my companions and I arrived to find the place already busy with a queue. But we got our table immediately. Service is really nice, with friendly staff and informal but respectful practices. We enjoyed lovely Scallops, Lamb rolls and Soup for entrees, then Eye Fillet steak, Salmon Fillet and Fish of the Day (Terakihi) for mains. Our sides were Mesclun Salad and Duck Fat Potatoes. Everything was really good, nicely presented, with good quality produce and good size portions. The wine list is very nice. Dessert was Chocolate Brownie and Ginger Pudding. There is no surprise about its popularity, everything was great. We were probably last to leave but didn't feel rushed at all, which was appreciated. The location is great, right across the road from the Arts Centre and on the tram route, within short walking distance of the river and city CBD. Parking on the nearby streets was available too. It's very good, I would recommend it.

Wonderful dinner at this inviting restaurant. We were able to snag a table without a reservation during a busy evening; so accommodating! My husband and I shared a terrific bottle of New Zealand wine and shared two appetizers a main course and a side. Plenty of food and all of it was delicious. Our server was warm and professional. Centrally located. Can't wait to return!

Stopped by for lunch between museums tours.  We ordered the bread plate to share with friends and then got baked falafels and a lamb pie for ourselves.  Bread plate was very good.  It was fresh and the butter served with the plate was light and fluffy.  The lamb pie was very tasty.  The only letdown was the baked falafels.  I understand they are trying to be more health conscience but somethings just need to be fried. The texture and flavor was a significant departure from tradition.  Outside seating was pleasant and service level was outstanding as we had a very mindful server.

An excellent restaurant for lunch !  Directly across the street from the fine arts museum and has a trolly stop directly in front. On nice days there is outdoor dining   Excellent food pleasant wait staff and the place appeared sparkling clean too!  Recommended!

We explored the amazing Christchurch Art Gallery and wanted a nice lunch afterwards.  Right across the street was an interesting looking cafe/pub place. It was cool and blustery, and we wanted something warming.  Wow! Did this place deliver!  Super friendly staff welcomed us.  As it was Sunday, many were there for brunch.  I saw many plates with eggs and other goodies that looked great.  But we were here for lunch.  My husband had a pie stuffed with smoked pork that he said was delicious.  It came with a pea purée and lovely salad. I chose the pappardelle with lamb ragout and white bean purée.  The shredded lamb was a delight and the sauce was light and flavorful with a hint of Moroccan spice, but light. The top of the food had some shavings of cheese and what appeared to be radish sprouts.  It was lush and unctuous with a marvelous taste and texture.  Perfect comfort food for such cool, damp late summer day.  The bean purée was a simple foil with hint of the spice I mentioned, or was that the only place where it was?  I'm not sure, but it was yummy.  We had a nice bottle of central Otago Pinot noir which was nicely acidic that was nice food wine and matched our meals perfectly.  The meal with the wine, which was over 50% of the bill, came to US $75.  Very fine meal and worth every penny.

Intrigued by the chef special of whitebait on the chalkboard ($24), I decided to try. The chalkboard said it was served with toasted brioche, pickled vegetables, and citrus mayo. So, imagine my surprise when it came in an egg patty!  I have to admit I was a bit disappointed. It was okay, but you really couldn't taste the fish - mostly egg. I pried a fish to taste by itself, but the egg was too overpowering. I think since this is a seasonal fish, the fish should be showcased. Without the citrus mayo, this would've been a bland dish   I learned from the waitress that this fish is always served in the form of a patty with something else. Too bad New Zealanders don't make a snack like Malaysians do, with dried small fish, peanuts, and sambal. That would be great!

The coconut bread and sangria were great! We ordered a lemonade for our daughter and they brought Sprite - turns out this is normal in NZ - we are the odd ones! Just beware when ordering lemonade in NZ!   We also ordered a strawberry milkshake and it was literally strawberry milk...shaken. (Photo)

I convinced my aunt to walk over here with me from our hotel, which was a bit of a struggle since she was less than thrilled about the ten minutes over. However, she raved about her fish dish so the walk was totally worth it. She got the market fish and I had the soup of the day and a spinach and walnut salad. The food was good and the service was friendly. She especially enjoyed her fish, which was a white flushed fish, served in a tomato broth with an olive tapenade on top.We didn't have reservations but we're seated promptly. I had to run past this restaurant earlier in the afternoon and noticed many outside enjoying a beer or wine and the local sunshine.

Having just one evening to enjoy a sit down private dinner, I decided on Fiddlesticks, as recommended by a few locals. Dining solo presented a challenge as I could only sample one meal. Judging off of previous Yelp comments and my desire to try local, I went with the Canterbury Lamb Shoulder.  Having nothing else on the menu to compare it to, I certainly vouch for this dish. You won't be disappointed. Served on a bit of greens and topped with a fruit sauce, the lamb, which had obviously been stewing for awhile, was super tender and extremely flavorful. In addition to its succulence, the portion was quite substantial! Adding a side of baby spinach salad and a Black Dog draft beer ensured I had no room for dessert.  Peeking at the table next to me, another customer had ordered the salmon. Based on appearance and the clean plate after 15 minutes, I'd guess that dish also comes recommended.  One last thing, the service was excellent - welcoming, warm, and prompt!

We may have visited on a bad night, but the service was a disaster. We sat for 2 hours and were largely ignored by our waiter.  Even getting the bill took multiple attempts.  And getting a take out container required asking our waiter, the manager and another server before someone managed to get us something.  The food was fine, but this is not a repeater.

One of the worst meals I've ever eaten. We started with the fried chicken appetizer and it was so dry that the only thing that made it edible was the sauce it came with. Next we ordered the feast, and it included a salad, lamb, roasted onions, peas, stuffed mushrooms, and two sides that included duck fat potatoes, and another salad. The lamb was cold and flavorless. It seemed like the chef had no idea how to cook lamb. Both salads were boring and also flavorless, but the most memorable dish was the potatoes. The duck fat potatoes were the hardest, most dry dish of potatoes I have ever seen in my life. The were impossible to chew because they were rock solid. How on earth do you mess up potatoes?? They're the world's easiest food to cook. Additionally, the portions were tiny for the supposed "feast" title. We both left so hungry, and had to order pizza later that evening to make up for it. I want to point out that before we got our food, the couple sitting next to us complained about their meal, so it wasn't just a matter of our taste buds. I will say that the waiter was very nice and the service was good, but I went for the food and the high ratings I saw on Google. It was also $95, including a drink each, and did not include dessert. So disappointed.

We went here on our last evening in Christchurch NZ. It was a very nice dining experience. The food was delicious and the service fantastic. This place was recommended to us by another local Chef. If a Chef is going to recommend a good place for a nice steak then you have to try it! Everything was fresh and delightful. It can get crowded for dinner so reservations are recommended!

Not sure what all of the hype is about. We had an early pick up for a tour the next morning so went to the first available dinner service. Our waiter seemed fairly uninterested & not too helpful with the menu items. The food was beautifully presented but execution was lacking. I had the Free range pork belly. It was under seasoned and mushy while the Chicharrón garnish was so hard that it was a dental hazard. My wife had a red gurnard that was skillfully cooked but again under seasoned.
The starter is very good, recommended. The waitress gave me good recommendation. Main course is not bad. I

What a great experience! Amazing food, wonderful staff, and such a great atmosphere! We had so much fun at dinner here. We will recommend it to all friends coming through the area. We both had the lamb shoulder for our main and it was so perfectly cooked. Our waitress was incredibly nice and easy to talk to. She was friendly without being the annoying fake friendly you often run into in the service industry. Prices reflect the great quality you receive in your dishes. Was an amazing night out and well worth our 30 minute walk to find!!
Amazing as always. Faultless service and food. Must be the best salmon in the world - rank it even higher than that in Vancouver or Scotland.

We went here on our first night in Christchurch and I'm glad we did.  The review were right on the spot and we enjoyed the restaurant very much.  The food is excellent, but as with much of NZ a bit on the pricey side.  The service was particularly good, which really made the meal.
Best vegetarian risotto ever!! Usually don't drink reds but their red wine is amazing!  love the ambience with twinkling lights, fireplace, comfortable seating, large windows, great service too!
Great service, delicious fresh food. Quiet afternoon lunch spot on a rainy day. Our server was very friendly informative about Christchurch hot spots. Nice menu $$$ is accurate but worth it.

We adored this place and came 3 times! Once for happy hour and twice for dinner. You can make reservations to sit in the main dining area or first come first serve in the bar area which also had a sun room. The vibe is very positive and a great place to hang for some wine or beer. Every dish we ordered was super tasty and we tried plenty!

Just finished dining here (dinner) and had the Hereford rib eye. Also had to order extra vegetables and at $44 for Main and $9 for vegetables it was just enough. Quality of food was ok only because of the price as you can get much better for less elsewhere. Service was however very good and all staff were very helpful and friendly.  Beers are about average at around $11 a pint for Heineken.
Great stop! Enjoyed sitting outside and watching the trams go by.  Great food and service. Soup was great.  Would recommend.

We came here after a full day of touring around Christchurch; we saw Fiddlesticks while walking around and so chose it, in part, because we knew it was walking distance from our hotel!   We arrived fairly early, around 5:30PM on a Sunday, and the dining room was nearly empty, but did  start to fill within an hour or so.    The wine list featured a lot of reasonably priced New Zealand selections; we were very happy with our Rockface Pinot Noir.   We shared an order of pumpkin hummus as a starter, which was good, and the perfect amount for the three of us to have just a little nibble before entrees.   I had the lamb shoulder which was excellent!   It was very tender and flavorful, and the potatoes, kale, and sauces all went with it perfectly.  A family member also had the lamb, and, unfortunately, one of his two pieces of lamb had a large chunk of fat, but he did enjoy it despite that!  Another family member had the fish special, and she said it was delicious!  It came with fried whitebait as a topping.  Given that this was our first night in New Zealand, we really didn't know what whitebait was....for others who are equally ignorant, it is exactly what it sounds like...tiny bait fish!  These were fried up nice and crispy, and we all tried some...just don't think about it too much, or look too closely at them, and they are quite tasty!
