Dessert was good, but not quite what we expected; all the desserts are served in a deconstructed style which, honestly, isn't a favorite of mine.     Service was excellent.  Our server was friendly, and knew the menu well.  We were seated in a porch-like area that was delightful - bright with lots of greenery!     This is a great option for dinner in Christchurch!

In what has become a theme in Christchurch, Fiddlesticks has excellent service. Very attentive but still relaxed staff make it a pleasure to drink and dine here. We went for a quick lunch and were not disappointed by a very nice duck parfait to start and pork pie as the main event. The meals were served quickly but not so as to make us feel rushed. The drinks menu is extensive with a reasonable priced range of alternatives.   The restaurant is well located on one of Christchurch's main thoroughfares between Cathedral Square and The Botanic Gardens / Canterbury Museum. We will definitely be back.

After a long journey to make it to New Zealand from the U.S., my wife and I came here for a relatively low-key dinner our first night in the country. We showed up pretty late - around 8:45 in the evening on a Sunday - and while the restaurant still had several tables when we came in, it was virtually deserted by the time we had finished. The restaurant has a modern feel to it, and while it is also a bar, the noise from the television didn't really intrude on the dining space at all. The service was solid at best, with it taking a bit long to place our order at the start and to get the check at the end. While there are some local beers available for order, the one I had (Pointer's Pale Ale) was one of the weakest offerings I've had in that genre of beer. My wife was less than impressed that flavored iced teas were the only option available in that kind of drink.  As for the food, I would say that the the bread was arguably the best part of the meal. It tasted like it was all cooked in-house and was warm and fresh. The wheat bread in particular had warmth and fluffiness to it that you would not take from how it was presented (as sliced triangles, like it would be for a sandwich). The butter was also very rich and worked very well with bread as soft as what was served. For an appetizer, we split the seared scallops. While the salsa verde worked very well as a complement to the scallops (which were prepared pretty well), the pickled fennel was a bit of a dissonant note and added too much acidity to the salsa. The entrees were also a bit on the inconsistent side. My wife's lamb shoulder fell apart quite easily, and it had very good smoky flavor - especially paired with the dahl - but paradoxically, the meat itself was also too dry - very little succulence with any bite. After my first choice was dk'ed (the king salmon), I went with the pork belly noodle soup. The pork belly was very juicy and flavorful, and the glass noodles were also pretty solid as well. However, the broth had a very muddled flavor, really making the soup more of a conveyance vehicle for the rest of the dish, as opposed to adding anything to the dish.  Overall, Fiddlesticks is a nice spot to take in a meal, but I was not blown away by it. The lamb was surprisingly overcooked, and while some of the fusion elements of the dishes were good (e.g. the dahl), others missed the mark. As a tourist from the other side of the world, I would probably check out another restaurant in Christchurch next time I am in town first.
Started in the afternoon for a beverage. Delicious & unique Mai Tai. Nice server as well. On our way for dinner now!

I would say this restaurant has many good features but value for money is not one of them. I've eaten here twice and each time have come away feeling that something was missing, like the main course can seem a little stodgy.

I think this place really deserves 4.5 stars but couldn't quite justify the five. I came here for dinner with a group of seven on a Sunday night.   The food presentation is stellar, a real feast for the eyes. Most of the food lived up to its looks with the exception of the whitebait patty which the eater felt was a little sparse on the whitebait, heavy on the egg. The fried chicken entree was raved about. My beef fillet was good although I asked for rare and everyone agreed it looked more med-rare. The highlight of it was the proscuitto fries which were very morish, and make up for the fact that  Quality of all the meats was top notch though. The fresh fish was absolutely divine, and the venison feast received two thumbs up (well four technically since its a shared dish!). The chocolate truffle dessert was outstanding, a real highlight of the meal for me. The salted caramel dessert was less spectacular but still good.   I thought service was above average - friendly, attentive, good humoured. The only small letdown was we were not asked if we wanted another round of drinks which we probably would have gone for if we had been asked, but weren't worried about enough to attract the attention ourselves. He also went to a lot of effort to bill us separately for our individual meals as we requested, even though this is a lot more work for him.    There is a lot of seating options in this restaurant including some nice outdoorsy areas which are perfect for summer evenings. I liked the decor, it was fresh and green and welcoming. They had a TV playing old black and white movies on silent which I though was an interesting touch and point of difference!   Price was ok - I spent about $80 on sangria/main/side/dessert which I thought was reasonable for the quality and size of the meals.

I came here with my elderly mum and her partner for her 85th birthday. They were fantastic, with excellent food and great, friendly service. This place serves gourmet pub food, lots of excellent choices, and a good variety of beers and wines.  We arrived early on a Saturday (6:15pm), and by the time we left at 8:30 if was full, with a pleasant buzz and great atmosphere.  I would come here again for myself, and recommend it.
Delicious food, a great place to eat in the heart of town - particularly as there is not a lot else that has opened in that area yet. Friendly staff, good atmosphere. I'd recommend.

Fiddlesticks was ok. I had the beef sandwich and although it tasted and was prepared perfectly the presentation left a lot to be desired. It is presented on the menu as a sandwich but when it arrived the bread was drastically too small. In that case fine, you can pick up your knife and fork and enjoy it as an open faced sandwich but that was very difficult as it is served on a wooden board (for aesthetic purposes) that was entirely too small so lunch turned out to be a messy experience which is never fun. Service was alright.

For what at first I expected to be a traditional pub meal I was really pleasantly surprised by the quality of both the service and the food.  Inside was warm and inviting on such a cold night and the staff were equally up to the task, offering advice on their favourite menu options and suggesting matching wines to try.  I had an expertly cooked steak with mustard and pickled vegetables and some specially prepared "fries" and a side of broccoli, the later unfortunately was a little over cooked for me; a very enjoyable meal
Amazing steak! And staff..
The service and food were excellent! I especially recommend the lamb. The IPA from the nearby brewery was also delicious!

Absolutely fantastic, we arrived thinking it would be quite on a Tuesday. It was busy but they found us a table. Service was brilliant. Food was good and well presented. Our waiter, Sam, was friendly and chatty. A great experience!
Delicious food, great beer, and incredibly friendly staff. The lamb shoulder and risotto are highly recommended (everything else is probably good too, but we didn't try it ).

This restaurant is a delight ....... from the excellent service to the great food. A group of 4 of us each had something different and all were pronounced delicious. I had the Canterbury lamb shoulder which was cooked perfectly and well accompanied with Kumara puree, potato fondant and sauteed greens - yum! Others had the fish, pork belly and the beef fillet. All very tasty and at a very reasonable price. A couple of us couldn't resist finishing with the passionfruit and coconut mousse. We will definitely be back!

Excellent food, service and vibe. We loved our meals and would recommend this restaurant to everyone visiting Christchurch. My gluten free meals were so tasty, polenta chips, salmon on potato purée and veggies; beef cheek pasta perfect and so was the lamb shoulder gorgeously presented and tasty..

Came here to say because doc all of the reviews and we were not disappointed! The food was deliciously crafted. Bonus was that the folks sitting next to us started up a conversation. The waitress was kind and patient as we chatted away - we were visiting from the states and love meeting locals. Highly recommend!
Lovely food. Well presented. Nice atmosphere. All staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. Would recommend a visit. Thank you dor a lovely evening.
This reminds me so much of the food canteens in Asia. An absolute bargain 4 dishes for $15 dollar and taste delicious as well. The lady who served me was vey lovely and helpful.
delicious and value food

Just discovered this hidden gem in Riccarton, Christchurch — a Chinese takeaway spot offering a 4-dish combo for only $15. It works like the food court classic Hungry Wok, but the flavours are way more authentic and tailored for Chinese tastes.   Tons of options to choose from, freshly cooked and steaming hot. From what I saw (and tasted!): •	Spicy chicken, tomato-braised chicken, mapo tofu •	Stir-fried black fungus and cabbage, sautéed shredded potatoes, dry-fried green beans •	Soy-braised eggplant, Chinese-style scrambled eggs, twice-cooked pork, home-style pork stew…   You choose one base (white rice, fried rice, or fried noodles) and three hot dishes, all served fast and generously. The flavours are bold and savoury — not overly sweet like Westernised Asian food — perfect for a real Chinese meal.   Staff speaks Mandarin, super friendly and quick service. Perfect for students, workers, or anyone who wants a filling, flavourful lunch or dinner.   Located right near Riccarton’s shopping area, so you can grab a hot meal before or after errands. Takeaway boxes are sturdy and packed to the brim. Great value, authentic taste, and fast service — what more do you need?

Whilst the ambiance was excellent the oysters were fresh and delicious. The mussels were overcooked and the calamari was as well looked like it was fried in stale oil. A disappointing experience in Queenstown .

It's an interesting name for a restaurant since 'Fisherman's Wharf' brings ideas of a water-place community where fisherman come in from the sea with the freshest products from the sea.  There might be a variety of seafood restaurants at a fisherman's wharf, but the singularity of naming a restaurant that, confused me for a bit.  But I realized it was a single restaurant, located between the cruise port of Lyttelton and its town center.  It did have a variety of seafood, and much of it was excellent.  We didn't have a reservation, but were seated right away.  There are choices of both outdoor and indoor dining, and the back outdoor patio was available (though it filled up by the time we left).  It had a great view of the port, with the ship that we came in on, prominently visible on the skyline.  A bottle of tap water was provided so we could fill our own glass...the water is very good here.   Dozen Bluff oysters:  6 of them raw, 6 battered and fried. NZ$72 We came for the Bluff oysters, which are currently in season.  It was the first time I had them, and they were superb, unlike other oysters I've had.  They are decent in size, but the difference is the texture, meaty instead of slippery.  It's not as briny as other oysters, and didn't come with any vinegar but instead a shareable green salad.  They are big enough to deep fry, which were fine.  But the best way is to eat them raw, to appreciate the taste and texture.  Fresh NZ Green lipped mussels. NZ$25.5 - probably 8 large full shell mussels, swimming in a light creamy tomato broth.   Frozen NZ half shelf mussels are available around the world, being very meaty.  These tasted similar, but were quite a bit larger in size which added to enjoyment.  This dish would be excellent served on top of fresh pasta.  Seafood Sizzle Plate (NZ$46.5) - portrayed as their most popular dish, it combines a variety of popular shellfish, served on a sizzling plate.  All the seafood was good.  Fisherman's Seafood Chowder (NZ$30.5) - a volute (basic french white sauce, no cream but uses butter) based soup, full of quality seafood.   This was the dish I thought I wouldn't be able to help finish, but ended up being the one where I ate the most of.  It came with a very good garlic bread, great to dip in the soup.  Blue Cod Fish Fry (NZ$40) - a large beer battered filet of cod, served with good chips (fries).   They had four beers on tap, so got a pint (NZ$14) of Montheiths Golden Lager, which was a good beer to drink with the seafood.   Service was prompt and friendly throughout, and the food didn't take very long to come out.  Of course, the beautiful weather and nice seaside views certainly didn't hurt the vibe.  It was a really nice lunch.

Fisherman's Wharf in Christchurch is out on Lyttelton Harbor but we made the trek anyway. It was rainy and chilly the day we went so I opted for a hearty meal, the seafood chowder. It was rich and creamy and was complemented perfectly by crisp fries with aioli. Add the stunning bay views, and this spot was a good pick. Everyone enjoyed their meal despite the gloomy weather.

It was busy, and seemed unexpectedly so.   It opened before noon, but only one person was serving multiple tables.  Anna did a great job.  Workers came in at noon.  I do think servers need to be dressed better.  The food was good.  Very fresh.  I did not like the dressing in the salad.  Too sweet.  The sr key date pudding and Kahula coffee are to die for!    Overall the food and service is worth the stop.
Great daily special of salmon risotto was outstanding. I would highly recommend this restaurant. Great view and outstanding service.

The biggest downside of this place was the wait, from order to food was 40-50 minutes. I was hoping the taste of the food would redeem the waiting time but it was pretty plain. I ordered the chowder and fisherman's pie. The chowder had an awesome variety of seafood and came out promptly but the pie left something to be desired. The seafood was fresh but lacked the flavor depth I was hoping for.

restaurant: Five river food truck. Open 7 days 2 pm to 9 pm

reviews.text: Yummiest noodles I’ve ever had. Prices are also very genuine. Highly recommend them!

I went the the other day and unfortunately no one was there in the truck to serve me even though the truck was open and lights were on i waited for a few minutes and then left as I didn't see the point in staying. I can't say anything about the food but that's not good service at all

We been for the very first time and ordered a noodle burger.. asked for less spicy he made it perfect… he was so nice … great customer service… highly recommend it… will definitely be back… great effort
Had Channa kulcha and aaloo tikki. Reminds me of home. Very tasty and fresh. 10/10. Highly recommended
Best aaloo tikki burger,I go there almost every 2nd week,all the way from redwood...reasonable price,and yummy burger...worth trying.
Delicious chana-kulcha in Christchurch for just $4. Definitely worth trying!
So delicious food love it

This is our third time visiting Flavors Kebab & Biracial, and it’s honestly the best! The food is always fresh and delicious, the service is friendly, and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. Thank you to the amazing team — you’ll definitely be seeing us every week!
I went in for the advertised lunch special shown on the poster in the window, only to be told it’s not available on weekends. Something the poster didn’t mention. Very disappointing.
Food is really delicious Especially the curry and the flavour The service is very welcoming. Highly recommend.
Taste really good.

Yes, I highly recommend this place in Wigram! The kai was fresh, flavourful, and delicious I had the Moroccan lamb salad and it was the bomb! We also tried the B6 chicken (I think that’s what it was called) and that was yum too.. was packed with flavour, a little bit of spice  The service -  informative, polite and kind. The atmosphere was — tidy, clean, bright, and felt really authentic. The portion sizes - were generous too so I can only imagine how good the family platters are. I’ll definitely be bringing all my kids next time they will def love it  Five stars from me whaanau!  Ngaa mihi!

We had our Pastors 50th Birthday here on the 17th of October. This restaurant was so accommodating despite us booking for 50 people at short notice, they were fantastic, very professional, friendly and catered to our needs! The food is exceptionally delicious packed full of flavor, catered well to our non spicy eaters, lots of kids in our group, we were a little noisy but the restaurant were good to us! Thank you so much to the owner & all your staff for a great memorable night for our Pastors wife's birthday. We appreciate the service we received!
My friends and I had diarrhea after eating this... I totally don't recommend it!
The food is so slow to come out!!!

I’ve been here twice now. The menu is slightly different to a lot of Chinese restaurants I’ve been to - but that means it forces you to be adventurous. What stands out though here is the service - every time I’ve been they have been so friendly, smiling and courteous and asking you if everything is up to your expectations. Food has also always been yum
The best Chinese food I've had in a very long time, and so many vegan options! We will definitely be back
Food was tasty. Very nice and welcoming staff.
I come here frequently for the shrimp rice noodle roll and the chicken fried rice, all the food is delicious and very reasonable pricing.
The yum cha menu isn't huge, but it is delicious!

Favourite chinese takeaway in Christchurch! My husband and i have been coming here for the last 10 years and the food has been exceptional every time with great portion sizes and reasonable pricing. Absolutely recommend
Best chips I’ve had for a very long time do not change what your doing
I had chicken egg foo yung. Good taste, good quantity, reasonable price. Served by a beautiful girl with a friendly smile.
Friendly helpful on the phone, great Yong Chow fried rice, very full container! See pic for updated menu pricing.
Loved all of this experience. The service was amazing-everyone helping to take care of all tables. Vegan menu to go along with the regular menu.

The food is to die for at Formaggios especially if you love Italian.  Service was fantastic the only minor complaint would have been the  noise from that resonated around the dining room which was distracting.
Awesome food, sweet staff, all good

Great Italian family restaurant. Came here to celebrate my son’s birthday with a party of five. Found the staff friendly and attentive and everyone agreed the food was delicious! Everything from the starters to the desert had clean plates. The staff even joined in singing happy birthday, great hospitality and atmosphere. Definitely will be back.
Lovely food and service. Will definitely be back.
Delicious pizza & mouth-watering desserts. Definitely recommended if in the area.  However, the restaurant can get a bit dark later as lighting is minimal.

Enjoyed a sizzling steak on a stone grill for the first time, sadly it was on a quiz night and found it way to load. Any other time I have gone their has been very enjoyable and great service and food
Great service & Amazing food.
Love this place.
Cool place to sit outside with a stein
Great place to eat and drink outside on a sunny day, offers loyalty rewards.
The staff seem to bombard you for your order quite often.

This is a pretty great bar located in The Palms. We came here for a group dinner and they had set aside the Oval Room for us that has TVs, a fireplace and seating for about 30 people. We had great service both from the wait staff and at the bar when we needed to order drinks.   I ordered the Chicken stonegrill which had a sort of teriyaki marinade on it with a garden salad and mashed potatoes. The chicken was also served with three different dipping sauces including a sweet and sour, ranch and chipotle mayo. I preferred the chipotle mayo. The chicken cooks very quickly and is easy to overdo, so be sure to monitor it closely. My husband ordered the Canterbury Fillet stonegrill which he cooked to about medium rare before pulling them off the grill. This also cooks very quickly! His sides were the seasonal veges and kumara mash. We both finished our entire plates.   This location does trivia on thursdays, also in the oval room, and absolutely requires a booking at least a few days in advance (if not more). This is different from most trivia venues because it is in an intimate setting with only so many spaces for players. There is also a second story seating level at this bar and patio seating outdoors (with heat lamps). Overall, great spot, great experience!

Wouldn't serve me a beer even though I'm 27, 6"7' and had my California drivers license. They did however serve my cousin without checking his ID who's is 1 year older than me. Guess facial hair is the key to getting a beer around here. Food was bland and waitresses were intrusive. Not recommending to anyone.

Had a great meal with my family here. Staff was very attentive. Food was above average. Son had the best chicken sandwich he's had in NZ. The fish and chips were excellent. Caesar salad with a poached egg had nice quality lettuce and delicious dressing. Eggs Benedict was great. If you are American you might want to ask for your bacon to be crispy instead of streaky. I wouldn't travel to eat here, but as a place that was on the way it was good.
We loved it! Great atmosphere, live music, great beer and wine. Kids menu was perfect, food was all great!  Highly recommend if you like a sports bar atmosphere with great food and drinks.
Went in at 5pm for a pint OF COKE(!) and was IDd by a rude barman with no people skills. Expensive, no atmosphere, don't bother going.
The Halloween themed party was very fitting last night considering the place was basically dead. They do make a pretty alright Pizza and for that I'll give it 2 stars.
Its a nice pub with a good vibe. Its good for a quick bite to eat if you are in the area but the food is not all that good in my opinion pretty bland flavors. mediocre at best

Reviewing on visiting during a pre lunch week day. Popped in for a couple of beers and to meet up with a mate . First time along pleasant spacious bar like surroundings. Staff cheery and service ideal . Guinness on tap a favourite. Look forward to popping in again soon. Cheers

I find the only good time to go drinking in this bar is when it's quiet, otherwise the bar staff can't seem to serve quick enough.   Food is only average (very greasy), however their Cesar Salad is lovely and if you fancy a savage Stone Grill then this is the place to go.
Delicious ViaVio burrata :-) in the heart of the city...
Small Italian restaurant with a wood-fired oven where we ate a couple of Neapolitan-style pizzas that were very good.
Pasta flavour was average and underwhelming. Fish was decent but not filling.  Generally portions are too small for the price charged.
Slightly overpriced but decent food. Francesca’s is in a great central location near vibrant bars and dessert parlours

The lamb wagu was nice, a little bland requiring salt, this is a personal preference, unfortunately no salt was available at the table. I was seated on the window facing benches which was very uncomfortable. I asked for a table for which I was told we will prepare one. During this time my meal was served, later I was informed the table was ready and declined the relocation as I had almost finished my meal. I mentioned the problem to staff when paying the bill, they acknowledged it then moved on. Unfortunately I would not go back.
Phenomenal! Outstanding service and the food was Devine. I look forward to adding this to our anniversary regular
Good pasta

The food here is fresh and excellent.  During my stay in Christchurch I had the pear &gorgonzola salad several times and the beet & goat cheese salad once.  My 5-year-old grandson lived the margharita pizza so much he wanted to have it every day for lunch.  My daughter-in-law and I shared the lamb ragu with tagliatelle at dinner.  It was delicious. The service is friendly and ambiance calm. And the prices are very reasonable. We recommend it highly.

This is some of the best Italian food I've had in years! I had the pea, asparagus, cheese risotto which was amazing, and a pear, gorgonzola and arugula salad that they made especially for me!  The wine was great and the service was attentive and excellent!!!  My friend had the gnocchi in red sauce which she said was one of the best she's had in years. Make a reservation as this place is packed and worth it!

Delicious Vegetarian Spaghetti Puttanesca. Bold flavors of tomato, garlic , peppers and capers. One of best meals during my stay in Christchurch. I will be back. Don't miss this gem. Great service and clean and modern ambiance.

We ate here on a weeknight and made reservations just in case - on previous nights we saw there were no tables available so we didn't want to chance a drop-in. This was a great restaurant, fairly roomy but seemed cozy, and with attentive service. We had focaccia to start, and I ordered the mushroom risotto which was SO flavorful. Others in my party had the squid ink linguine and potato gnocchi with beef cheek. Everyone's food was great.

We arrived at Francesca's Italian Kitchen without reservations, but the welcoming staff member said that we could eat at the window-facing counter, side by side. Actually, we then got to people-watch as they passed by on the street, while viewing the activity at the restaurant, as well.  With the menu offerings focused on pizzas and pastas, we both chose to start with a pear-and-gorgonzola salad, with toasted focaccia for the table. The salad greens were perfectly dressed, and the pears had just the right amount of crunch. I would have preferred a bit more gorgonzola, but I'm quite a cheese lover.  The duck ragu risotto was fantastic. The risotto was cooked perfectly al dente, and the rich flavors of the ragu and texture of the duck crackling pieces on top were fantastic. Just note that the portion is large, and two people could easily share one serving of this rich risotto.  There's a nice wine selection, with offerings from New Zealand and Italy.  What a delightful place and a delicious meal! Book a reservation because, even on a Monday evening, the restaurant fills up.

Amazing! We fell into Francesca's. It was recommended by a local server in a bar.  I've never had duck risotto, will probably never see it on a menu again, but it was so delicious.  I would come back and order again TOMORROW! My partner had the squid ink seafood pasta--again, delicious! They're busy, had to turn a couple walk-ins  away, so maybe make a reservation, or come early! Worth it!

Really loved this Italian place and especially enjoyed the beef carpaccio. We considered ordering it again and thought we'd be back to try the pizza on the tail end of our trip. I usually try to choose the fresh pasta at any Italian place I'm at - we chose the tagliatelle and squid ink pasta. The squid ink dish was a bit too salty for me but oddly my husband who usually likes less salt than me thought it was fine. Get the carpaccio!!
Food was AMAZING in every way! Service was great and personable and knowledgeable. The bar staff new how to make martinis!!!! Ambiance was open and simple. A no fuss no muss.

Visited at 5 pm on a Sunday.  Reservations were required,  did not have any but they allowed me to sit on a stool. Was not very hungry so ordered garlic bread and a gorgonzola and pear salad.  The salad was small and had apples, but no pear in it. Cost $30. Price to value relationship was not there fur me.

This is a really decent Italian restaurant right around the corner from New Regent Street. We had the tagliatelle ragu bolognese and the cappriciossa pizza.   Both were very tasty. Not the best I've ever had, but definitely decent. Nice ambiance.

A cute spot that's close to the main strip, yet in the cut (with a cute gift shop around the corner). The wine and pizza here are tasty and organic. An unexpected, yet cool find in Christchurch. Great service, comfortable space.
Really delicious gluten free food. A little on the pricey side. In a beautiful building with a warm and welcoming feeling on the inside.

Italian food in New Zealand, I didn't come in with high hopes.   I was extremely surprised and pleased.   The gnocchi was cooked and prepared to perfection.  I've been all over Italy and I would put this gnocchi up against some of the best in Italy.   This is a really gem.  Did I mention that the gnocchi is delicious?????    Gosh I can't get over it!!!!

Perfection. Imagine that you are arriving into a new city alone and travel worn. You wander down a cobblestone road and stumble into a festive modern establishment with elegance hailed from the early 20th century. Now imagine that you are greeted by servers who great you like family, long lost, recently found and treated to wine that sets your appetite on fire. Then as you engage in a dance with a parade of exceptional dishes, salads and pastas each unique in their own right you might admire the superb decorating or the music that does everything to elevate your senses and therefore the flavor of the food. And as you wander back into the street with a belly filled with a warmth only great food can give you have the chance to fall in love with the new city you happened to fall in.    Based on the personal experiences of Coleta Marie

1/1/2018, my fiance and I arrived at Christchurch that day after a long drive from Picton. Not surprisingly many restaurants were closed for the holiday so we were searching for places on Yelp and calling the ones that seemed appealing. Luckily for us, Francesca's was open.  We came here for a relatively early dinner and were able to get street parking. The restaurant itself is a quite larger open space, while I can't say it stood out appearance wise, it was definitely pleasant looking. We were seated almost immediately and considering that the rest of the city seemed to be abandoned, it was pretty lively in here.  The menu has a decent amount of options, we usually order a bruscheta to start but didn't feel like it this time around so we just went with mains. I ordered the Pasta Norma (tomato, chili, capers, goats cheese, pecorino with casareccia pasta) while he went with the House made potato gnocchi (braised Wakanui beef cheeks, gremolata, pecorino). I enjoyed my dish a lot, it was fresh and flavorful.  For a place of this size the service can often be compromised as waiters tend to forget about some tables, this wasn't the case here.   Our time at this restaurant was short but definitely enjoyable.

Got there right after 5 to score a table since reservations really seem to be necessary. I saw several people get turned unfortunately bc they were booked up on a Tuesday night. The house pinot grigio is very crisp and bright. The zucchini bruschetta was bland  I think it needed salt And acid maybe. Not enough goat cheese either but the pear gorgonzola salad was terrific! Fresh and flavorful.  My porcini prosecco risotto was rich but not overpowering. Decadent almost. I could have eaten more it was so good. Generous amount of mushrooms And cheese. Very nice dish. Would love to have it again. Well balanced. I could go on and on. The service was good and friendly. Prices were on par with everywhere else I've been in new zealand. Loved the style and decor, simple modem with fun accents. I wish I was here longer to try one of their pizzas.

Me and my wife's favorite spot on our honeymoon. The pasta was to die for! The gnocchi (house made) and beef cheeks... amazing.  Whenever we come back to New Zealand this restaurant will be a must on our list.

This place was a hidden gem for us. We wandered in for an early dinner at 5:30pm and were seated immediately. They told us we had to be out by 7:30pm for dinner rush, but honestly... that's plenty of time to eat.  We ordered two different mains. One was the Salsiccia pizza. We saw the chef tossing the dough fresh before putting it into the pizza oven! This pizza came with pork sausage, tomato, roasted onion, ricotta, rocket and mozzarella. So... if you like cheesy sausage pizza, it's the one you want.  We also ordered the lamb ragu paparadelle. Super fresh pasta, rich flavors with the lamb... it absolutely hit the spot and was a flavor party in my mouth.  The service took everything up a notch and we had a great conversation with the chef as well.   Come if you can!

The lamb Raghu was an amazing dish. Pear and Gorgonzola salad was as stated. Service was friendly and attentive which really pushed this to 5 stars. I came in for lunch which wasn't busy but the host was verifying a bunch of reservations so can assume one would be needed for dinner. Recommended.

Wandered in to this restaurant for lunch. The food was outstanding and the wait staff kind and informative.  The potato skins were crispy and the kale salad fresh . Had a beetroot pasta that was exceptional . Would definitely come here again.

I didn't expect it to be in a little shopping mall in "Chinatown".  The fish and chips were amazing and so are the price.  Under $5.00, for a large portion of fish.  I ended up ordering an extra piece of fish.
Best fish and chips. The fish is fresh and crispy. Cheap! Under 5NZ. One piece is so big!

Little fish and chip shop with fresh fish selection that has been part of the local community as long as I can remember. Really great fish and chips with options of multiple fish either battered or crumbed to takeaway. Always deep fried to perfection. Friendly service. Highly recommend.   PS they don't take credit cards and I am pretty sure they only take cash though I could be wrong...
Fresh and healthy, the tea and ingredients are all homemade, not the kind that are bought and heated up. It's delicious!

What a delicious meal! The food was flavoural and fresh. The lunch special also comes with a soup and 3 small side dishes. Pretty big portion of chicken for $16! A comfort meal for sure. Highly recommend this restaurant. It's nice to also be supporting a small family-owned business.

The food was very authentic! A variety of flavors were available. The lady at the front desk, from Northeast China, was very welcoming. I'll definitely come again! A very beautiful place with good food at a cheap price and high quality.
Clean and comfortable place with friendly and attentive service. The breakfast buffet was quite busy this morning, but they kept refilling the food quickly — very well done! Great experience overall.

Never order their breakfast on Uber Eats! The wontons were raw, the buns were pre-made frozen ones, and they tasted absolutely terrible! The meat seemed really old, and there was even hair inside the takeaway bowl！！so disgusting!

It was too salty for the wonton soup and the centre part of wonton is not fully cooked. The bun is dry. The receptionist is trying to sale her $15 buffet, but without much food around 9:30 am in the morning, feels uncomfortable
The taste is salty, the steamed buns are dry, and the filling is not very tasty, very average...
IM HERE CUZ THEIR LUNCH MENU ARE UNDER $16 AND ITS TASTY AND THAT's 2015 PRICE. QUICK SERVICE, FRENLY STAFF, ALL NICE AND CLEAN. THANK YOU FOR READING!
"I'm so glad I found this place! The food is so good, and the staff is so friendly." I will definitely go again and I will suggest you guys should also go.
Family dinner was awesome.
Welcoming staff, delicious food, great vibes with a great ambiance — I always enjoy visiting this place
Good and Tasty food. Lady at the counter was really helpful and ensured good service
The food is amazing.. the service is very fast.. the staff here is also very good.. yummy taste.. do try it.. I found it the best... I will go again

I recently visited this Indian fine dine restaurant and had an amazing experience. The vegetarian snacks and main course were absolutely delicious — full of authentic flavors and beautifully presented. The ambiance is elegant and perfect for a relaxed evening out.  The drinks were simply outstanding! A special mention to the Duty Manager, who truly knows how to craft exceptional drinks — each one was perfectly balanced and refreshing. Definitely a must-try spot for anyone who enjoys great food, superb drinks, and warm hospitality. Highly recommended!
Great food and friendly staff .  Sorry you guys have to stay back for us .   Overall 5star . Thanks ones again
An awesome place for dining and party.

Very cool spot, great fixed price lunch on Saturday. Lovely ambiance, friendly staff, attentive service. Delicious oysters appetizer, monkfish burger and salad, pair with a tasty white wine. Finished with a Campari Parfait. A real gem. Don't miss out! I came back for dinner. WOW!!! One the two best restaurants in the city.
...extraordinary culinary delight...what a supreme surprise this small gem was just steps away from the Mayfair Hotel...

We only learned of the restaurant because we had a tour of Christchurch and our guide was familiar with it.  After visiting, I had to add it to Yelp.  It can be very difficult to accommodate a gluten-free-vegan for a digestive menu, but they did.  We each had a tasting menu that suited us, a vegan-gluten-free, a vegetarian and one with seafood. I also recommend the wine pairing as they have a very unique collection.

Chef Alex & Campbell in the front of house teamed up to deliver one of the best experiences in my month-long visit from San Francisco. Gatherings is in what appears to be an emerging culinary hot spot at the corner of Victoria & Bealey, an easy 25’ walk or quick Uber ride from the CBD, & the just-picked produce (asparagus & radish/lettuce salad) & perfectly executed mains (crumbed Poaka pork chop w/ a wonderful mustard butter sauce) & dessert (crème caramel taken to the next level with a crispy clove/lemon biscuit) made for a terrific value, reminiscent of Delfina or State Bird in SF. Hope to be back on a future visit, after they’ve grabbed a star to match their hat :-)
My local spot, and probably the only one I visit regularly.  Seasonal dishes, cozy atmosphere, good wines by the glasses/bottles.  Using fresh, local ingredients that are in season.

A beautiful boutique resturant. The food was exceptionally great all seasonal fresh and beautifully plated. Had a great Negroni and a lovely bottle of Wine. The service was warm and knowledgeable. She was knowledgeable and her suggestions were right on. Great great place
Food was interesting and creative, the front door opens in (it’ll make sense), we chose the feed us option and enjoyed it.
Absolutely beautiful. The perfect combination of exquisite, considered, and inspired flavours in a warm, understated and classy atmosphere.
Such amazing food, decour and service, best restaurant in Christchurch
Came for dinner and a drink and received wonderful service. Had the beef snitty, it was a large serving and tasted great, good value.
Could not ask for a better local pub. Great vibes, great prices and amazing staff. Amanda and Patch are top shelf publicans.
Great wee spot! I go for the Seafood Chowder once a week now. Mrs and i split it with a bowl of fries, soooo much food and soooooo good

What a great night lovey service great food and a live band that was awesome No 8 Wired rocked the place irs was buzzing definitely be back  a great awesome place for a Saturday and then the might warriors live ah to good
Great meal had a Guinness but only a can,just ain't the same.

Went for lunch. I had the roast port and it was huge I had to ask for a doggie bag as I only got through half of it. Very reasonable prices and quiet atmosphere. Will definitely recommend and be going back

Had a lovely meal. Staff were lovely, very friendly and helpful. Nothing like fresh food cooked in front of you, great for picky eaters who can customize their own meal. We will definitely be going back often!!

We have been to Gengys a couple of times now. We book for 5:30pm to get in before the crowds. There is a good selection of meat and veges for the chefs to cook and you should expect a wait time for your meal. While you wait there is also a selection of other food in the buffet. The pancakes and ice cream for dessert are nice if you haven’t over done it on the all you can eat dinner.
Very great place

We were there as a big group. The varieties of food were good. You grab what you like in a bowl, take it to the chefs and he will cook them in front of you while you wait in line. But limited dessert though. Could do with some cakes to finished up. Overall a great night out.
Cheers gengys...rubcore
Love the food and service at this place. amazing for birthdays and night out with your family
Best gin joint in town
Atrocious service. We were told to go to an outside table, but left after 20 minutes when no-9ne bothered to take our order.
The girls are fantastic  Walked in after 10pm and they couldn't have been kinder. Beautiful girls with such class, would recommend
Beautiful and tasty cocktails
Amazing vibes! Beautiful location & great atmosphere. Mix of young and older crowd. But suited to everyone’s vibe. Spectacular food!
Great place with great staff! Food and drinks are amazing too, I highly recommend the karaage chicken

Absolutely loved the atmosphere and decor in this place. Unfortunately the staff (and i’m assuming the manager - older lady) were not friendly and had the attitude that they didn’t want to be there. The portion sizes are not worth the price. Definitely better Italian restaurants around.
Great meal. But of a nuisance that their eftpos machine had broken.

The wait staff were nice & friendly. It would have been nice to have been told before ordering what was not available on the menu. The entrées were very good. The mains were not good at all. Chicken dish was tasteless & very very dry. The lamb shank was also absolutely tasteless, vegetables were like they had been steamed not roasted & this was all floating in a watery slop. The decor & atmosphere was great although a bit cold.
A beautiful place to dine. Made me feel like I was in Italy.
Best Italian I’ve had in my life!!!! A must have in rotorua for sure!!! Loved the handmade pasta and wood fire pizza!

Hearty Italian restaurant with classic mains to choose from. Range of pastas was on the smaller side but with lovely sauces. Steak was fresh and locally sourced, paired with a delicious mushroom gravy and the side of vegetables were roasted well. Would note that the steak was medium-well done despite asking for rare.  Thoughtful staff who did ask kindly about steak cooking preference and gave a lovely sauce recommendation. The ladies were happy to quickly set us up at a private 2-diner table.  The atmosphere was warm and homey, with a semi formal arrangement inside and some tables undercover outside as well. Sweet Italian music and nice ambiance overall. No pianist on our night but there was a piano inside so you might be lucky!  Ordered: Canterbury steak, beef ragú pappardelle

What a delightful find in Christchurch. An old style Italian restaurant with something of a kitchy vibe. They ran out of tagliatelle and had to make some for us fresh. Oh, darn!  ;) The potato gnocchi with sauce of roasted peppers and tomatoes was fabulous. Thank you, Hanneke for the best meal in our 10-day NZ trip.
Went last night with family, we all had a great time and enjoyed the meal. Service was good, food was good and music was good. Highly recommended and glad my brother took us !
we (6) enjoyed a wonderful meal on day 26th September.  We had entrees mains and desserts . All were very well cooked. Thank you so much for a very enjoyable night.
Good homey pub Recommend
We got some food tonight it was really great

We went for a meal there on Saturday at the Glenbyre we were was so amazed of the quality and the taste we had the special plater which was absolutely amazing and also the chowder it was so delicious my 6 year old loved it so much and so did I she said on the way home that was the best meal and I will say it really was so 10/10 to the chef and also the staff who checked on us to make sure if everything was was ok and which I said it so tasty  so if your reading this please give this place  a try you will be totally surprised what a great deal  and you won’t regret it we will be back very soon many thanks Mike and family
Exquisite new cuisine a the Glenbyre. Highly recommended. Compliments to the chef!
I love this little place. Used to walk in before my nightshift. It's a little run down, but that adds to the charm. Let's call it patina   Very reasonably priced and very friendly.
This is absolutely a hidden Gem that in Christchurch. I would say golden boat is one of the best Hong Kong restaurants in NZ. Love it! Highly recommend spring roll. So gorgeous
Do not recommend at all everything over cooked/under cooked, tasted moldy wouldn't feed to a homeless person would like a refund.

Authentic Chinese takeaway with a menu in Chinese and décor that feels like a slice of China. Flavours are solid, portions are generous, and prices are student-friendly—$19 for a meaty combination stir-fried rice is a great deal. The real gem? They stay open late, perfect for a late-night meal. Their seafood soup once saved me on a rainy night—warm, comforting, and satisfying!
Underestimated restaurant!! The food is so delicious and the staff there are so nice.

It’s the worst customer service I’ve ever experienced in my life. If you decide to work at a restaurant atleast know how to speak to customers. The person I was talking to just hung up on me and I don’t rate this place at all do better please.
A lovely reasonably priced restaurant. Lovely food and excellent service
Delicious food

I never expected to have the best meal of my New Zealand trip (I know this is such a cliché), but this Thai restaurant near the airport. Souls weary of fish and chips, steak, and meat pies, come here. I got the pig's trotters rice bowl and the chilli fish fry to go. Everything was perfect. Not greasy at all, and the spicy chilli sauce was perfectly balanced. I'm so glad I had my last meal of the trip here. I will definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone visiting Christchurch.

This is the must try. Legit Thai. Professional prepared Thai meals exclusively only in here. A good selection of Thai lunch menu that transforms you to Thailand river with ease and authenticity.  Great customer service and amiable and approachable Chefs.  Hidden on Kendel , easy parking.

Do you have any leftovers, boss..? Chichi is the best value for money restaurant!!! I came to a famous restaurant next door and this one looked delicious too, so I came back the following week. But this one is even tastier and more value for money..!!! The meat keeps coming outㅋㅋㅋ I ordered medium and it was spicy so delicious. I ate so well and left. (I'm scribbling this down before I leave because I'm so impressed)  The best Thai restaurant ever!! I was literally wondering if the owner could make money from here due to the cheap pricesooooooooo gooooooood
Nice food. A lot of new menus.
Food was average. Most of the curries are sweet, caters more to the kiwi taste buds
Overall good food
Believe the hype -- the thali is indeed one of the best out there. The thukpa (soup noodles) are clear, clean, crisp, and delightfully tart.
Amazing food. Indian and Nepalese authentic styles.
Seriously good food. Great service. Chefs and service staff are amazing. Highly recommend.
Love this place, bring all my friends here
Seriously the best sized and cooked fish in Christchurch. Perfectly cooked every time. It's worth the 15 minute walk.

This place has undergone multiple change in management over the years. It's gotten much cleaner, more modern, but the food is not the same as it used to be. I remember the days of picking out metal bits from the Szechuan sticky chicken.  The place- spacious, mixture of 4 sweaters and large Chinese round table. Ample parking outside.   The food- the main selling dishes are those that serve in a stone pot. Has a curry based flavor. You can pick your meat of preference. Very filling and not too spicy. Recommend not to order too many other dishes of you are getting this one. The Szechuan spicy chicken is juicer now, and not over powered with chili. I still preferred the old dry and spicy version but others in my table really enjoyed it.  Drinks- a wall full of Chinese liquor for you to choose from. Tea is free.   Service- we came here on a Sunday lunch time. Was pretty quiet. The waitress was a little slow and uncertain of the menu.   Overall I would probably still come here again during next trip to Christchurch. More for nostalgia.

restaurant: green chilli thai restaurant and takeaway

reviews.text: Best thai restaurant in christchurch. Very friendly staff and the food is amazing. We come from the other side of the city,definately worth it.the spareribs are a must for an entree. Green curry Is my ultimate fav, i carnt seem to bring myself to try anything else.yom. My partner eats everything else on the menu for me anyway.
Typical Indian restaurant
The samosas were very good however the buter chicken was quite plain with absolutely no spice so definitely make sure to specify how you want it
Authentic Indian Dishes Really Delicious.
Food  good quality pakora good uncle ji from paramjeet barnala
The food here is beautiful. Our whole meal taste like a secret family recipe. The Samosa's were the best I've ever tried and the nan was cooked perfectly.
Their $10 lunch special is great , highly recommend.  They also have a $15 combo option that comes with Naan and coke .. good portion size and super tasty
Always great food from here and lovely service as well. Highly recommend
From breakfast variety and service to superb evening meals and service. Really excellent. Just should offer pure green tea for those who don’t like flavoured green tea.
The staff here are so very accomodating, notably Devang, Nicky, Rebekah and Ethan These individuals have been so wholesome and make you really feel cared for!

Great vibe and setting. Food took a little longer to prepare than usual. Friendly staff. Ordered the rib eye with mushroom sauce and chips. Sauce was great! Steak was chewy and for the first time in my life I couldn't leave a clean plate.
Very nice pleasant staff. Helpful in ever way.
Buffet breakfast was great - especially the Bircher muslie, chia seed parfait, mango and berry smoothie shots.

We came here for the  breakfast buffet. It was pretty average, it took them a long time to stock things back up. The cheese selection was a bit of a joke, grated cheese, Bree and cheddar. No alternative milk available. The staff was nice and the location was awesome.
Had a lovely afternoon tea on Sunday here. A birthday  treat for me. It was delicious! Beautiful food, service was tops, thank you Charmaine and to the chefs.
Great food great staff
A lucky find!

It was really difficult to find a authentic Indian restaurant in NZ. A friend of mine who completed his education in NZ suggested this Indian restaurant and it was completely worth it. I will recommend everyone to try food from this restaurant.

I’m emotionally connected to this restaurant in Christchurch — completely in love with this Indian place that serves absolutely fabulous food! Damn, it’s hands down the best Indian restaurant in Christchurch

We ordered a mild lamb biryani so my 3yr old  daughter can share it with us. Unfortunately, what we got is a spicy lamb biryani which she can't eat. We ordered takeaway so we don't have to cook for dinner but this happened. The food is great, which is why we always order takeaway here.
Very nice dining. Food with great flavors exceptional attention from waiter. Highly recommend. Thank you.

Absolutely loved our experience at Gunpowder Restaurant, From the moment we walked in, the staff made us feel so welcome and looked after us like family. The atmosphere was cozy and vibrant perfect for a relaxed evening out.  The food was outstanding packed with authentic Indian flavours and cooked to perfection. Every dish we tried was bursting with taste, and the portion sizes were really generous too!  A special shoutout to the team for surprising the birthday boy with a chocolate naan and ice cream such a sweet and thoughtful touch that made the night even more memorable.  Hands down the best Indian restaurant in Christchurch can’t wait to go back again soon!
Mouthwateringly good Indian food. We ordered take away after a long day of travel and it was ready ahead of schedule, well packaged, and delicious. We are only in town for a few days but may be back!

First time in Christchurch, first restaurant we tried and my goodness, the food is absolutely beautiful, we all enjoyed every bit of it  will definitely be back when we find ourselves back in the south island
Great restaurant, food and staff! Went twice and always had tasty food with a great service :)

I love this place. I live nearby and it is a total asset to the neighbourhood - I use it both as a casual place to drop in when I don't feel like cooking, and also to take friends from out of town to show off the amazing tannery.   The wine and cocktail list is refined but comprehensive, and the tapas are awesome - delicious, sophisticated, ranging from light (pickled vegetables with fresh herbs, or pil pil prawns with garlic confit) and fresh to sticky, fried yumminess (Yorkshire puds, braised beef cheek croquettes). The decor is also beautiful and original and if you're lucky there will be a piano player in the house, giving it a luxey, retro lounge bar vibe.

Hachi Hachi offers great Japanese comfort food. The Tonkotsu ramen broth was rich and tasty. The chicken karaage was crispy and juicy, and the sushi was super fresh. Service was quick and polite, and the restaurant has a nice, relaxed vibe. A great place for casual dining with friends or family.

Gyoza was obviously frozen and not defrosted properly - cold in the middle. Ramen broth was watery, pork was cold as well, had not been reheated properly. No fresh ingredients used at all. Cost $60 for that and two servings of sushi. Didn’t even eat it. No good
Awesome meals... quick and delicious
Nice ramen  sushi  is ok  more self service
Very average, expected better food for the price. Lettuce looked old and bruised, chicken over cooked and rice was dry
very tasty and authentic. we appreciate food quality and its consistency. well priced.
Avoid. Pork dish was mainly fat. Would not recommend.
My go to for a quick lunch

Excellent opportunity to have some good food around Hereford av. In Central Christchurch. The music remembers me an Japanese karaoke with no doubt. Lovely staff and delicious food, was a very good pick specially with our first table reservation what guarantee’s us 50% off.

food was was alright but mood was ruined when they forgot to put down what we asked and gave us only waffle fries when we ordered it with karaage but they forgot the karaage we had to remind them of the order they brought out a tiny plate of sauce and karaage then charged us extra after we had payed for everything because they only gave us fries when it was their fault they didnt get our order right

I was ill, have an avocado allergy and tried the tuna nori rolls which seemed to be the only sushi item without avocado, however, 10 mins after leaving symptoms started which floored me for 5 days, assuming cross contamination. Even without this the food was bang average, wouldn’t recommend
The tonkotsu ramen was very good.

My husband and I had lunch here. I was craving ramen and so I had the chicken ramen. It was delicious. My husband had the udon (I can't remember what meat he had with it). He said his was yummy!  There was inside seating. Pretty busy at the time. Seems like a lot of people bought there sushi boxes to take away, it must be their best seller.  Service was good and staff were friendly! Give them a try if you happen to be visiting Christchurch City Center in New Zealand.
Nice place for something casual and food was great. Portions were good. Would recommend.

A good Japanese restaurant with quick service and tasty food. They have good Japanese curry and dumplings, and food seems like it is served quickly. The restaurant is in a convenient location in Christchurch, and it is a very casual dining place.

This is not Japanese food. I ordered the N1 udon, and there was so much mayonnaise and teriyaki sauce the udon, vegetables and chicken was fully immersed in its. The salmon sashimi bento was horrible.  The slices were thick and had chewy parts that wasn't meant to be part of the sashimi.  The udon in the tempura udon is so soggy and soft, plus the soup was layered with oil from the chicken.  The salad was still cold from the hours that it's been frozen in the fridge.  I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. I thought food in New Zealand was supposed to be authentic.

We opted for sushi since we're originally from Hawaii and was craving raw fish! We ordered the rice bowl with salmon and sweet egg and a ramen bowl with chicken. It actually tasted pretty good. We also shared a salmon roll, this particular one had cream cheese in it, which I ended up not caring for.   On another occasion we decided to try the sushi burger with chicken. It ended up being difficult to hold since the chicken was sliding out from between the two rice patties. There was a reason why they served it with a fork.   I think the bowls were a little overpriced, but overall it was a decent option for Japanese food.
The verity at this restaurant his amazing, fresh and great qulity sushi it has a good vibe through the whole place. I strongly recommend this sushi.

I enjoyed the few times I went in here for either lunch or dinner.  I quickly got a favourite in the steak curry and boneless Japanese fried chicken.  The food was great and the staff are very friendly . Would defiantly go back again .

this is a Japanese restaurant but they don't serve ramen!!! So I ordered the Karaage (crispy chicken) Don. It was good but you need to drink water after this. This Don doesn't worth 12.9 dollars I think. But it still taste good!

Hachi hachi,is the best sushi in town,actually all the food I have tried there is amazing,the sushi was very fresh and tasty. love the Gyoza, Kakuni-don, and noodles! It was like the one I had in Japan. Staffs was o.k I go there quite often.The decorations of the place is also cool

This is a great and fast Japanese sit-down/take-out restaurant on Victoria Street. I stopped in around 7 with two others and there were plenty of seats available. We were really craving sushi, but unfortunately their sushi department is rather lacking and they aren't made fresh to order. I tried the Teppan Teriyaki Chicken Bento Value Set and the chicken was extremely tender. The rice was cooked okay and the miso soup was good, but the salad lacked any dressing. My husband and I also ordered edamame as well as our other friend and they only brough one order to us. After we explained it to them, it took about 10 minutes to get the other edamame and they had to verify with us 3 times that we actually did order two. My husband had the salmon ngiri which looked really fresh, and the Tori Tama (hot udon noodles with a fried egg and crispy chicken) which was really flavorful. I would come back for that! The restaurant serves beer (and even has a beer tower if you want to get crazy) and sake as well. This is definitely good for a casual, quick meal.

Whilst in Christchurch met up with my coworker's family here. Always nervous to try an un-yelped venue on the road, but we dove in!  Pretty interesting things on offer here, different from your typical sushi joint. A particularly interesting offer was the rice burgers. In place of a bun the burgers had a sicky rice cake. Sounded weird but totally worked.   Bit of a letdown how few veg options were on offer here. They were also a bit inflexible on adding/subbing tofu to things, which I wasn't too pleased about. We veggie types need protein too!!!  I went for the tempura burger which was strangely delightful. Crunchy tempura in place of meat, with peri peri sauce. I have to admit I went back for a second I was so taken with it! Also got the agadashi tofu which was really nice.   My dinner mates got some of the noodle bowls which looked beautiful with lots of different toppings.   An interesting place, not sure I am dying to go back, except maybe for a rice burger from time to time!!
Good local place that has bento boxes. Good value. Great location. I wish these joints had bottomless sodas, but that must be an American thing.
I had ramen and donburi The ramen was too salty and Donburi was not bad. The most of service was self
This place is an all around no for me. The only half decent thing on the menu is their steak and  cheese curry but it's really heavy. Don't even bother with the new Ramen either.

It was a great choice on a cold and rainy day. We got:  Salmon sashimi- 5 pieces for 10NZD. It didn't look super fatty or fresh but it tasted fine, an average piece of salmon.  Pork Katsu Curry- very thick portion of pork. The crust was crispy, generous portion of rice, and lots of curry sauce.   Karagi donburi- the flavor went through the batter and into the chicken, crispy, and juicy pieces. A good choice if you're feenin' for fried chicken.   Also happy hour choices on their appetizers and drinks from 5-7 I believe.
Good tasting ramen! And good customer service! Love the tonkatsu ramen and shoyu ramen and kumara chips !

Giving this place anything try after the first disappointment. Got the Gyoza dumplings, they were obviously frozen and fell apart when picked up with chopsticks. Full of water inside... I don't know why.  Also ordered the pork miso ramen, one of my favourite dishes. The miso broth was bald, the ramen noodles were over cooked, the bamboo shoots tasted horrible. Somehow the managed to burn the pork, why do you burn pork???????  Two stars for the pretty waitress.
The food at hang seng food bar soul food to my tummy and soul. Love it. I differently would take my Whanau there for lunch

I've only ever got one dish here. The combination meat fried noodles. It's one of those things where I really should branch out and try something else but it's so damn delicious that I can't bring myself to. A touch smokey, salty, full of veges and very generous helpings of chicken, beef, duck, and prawns. Also fantastic value for money- I can easily get 2 meals out of one portion.

I ordered the char siu and crispy BBQ pork. The portion was huge with lots of meat and rice. It is very authentic compared to what you get in Hong Kong. Chef makes it in house! The service was friendly and felt like home. I'll be back!
We were right around the corner from this place and didn’t know it was here. We found it our last night in Christchurch. The food was excellent. I would highly recommend the place.

Had spicy pork mince on rice and topped up with soy sauce tofu.  Young lady with glasses was kind and responsible to remind me that a fried egg comes with the main I ordered.  The OG Hong Kong Food bar delivered to you within 5 minutes.  And it opens at 10a.m.  90 minute parking
Best chinese restaurant in christchurch by far. Good fried rice.
The food is very good. Great flavors, large servings. The crispy pork, wonton and lemongrass chicken is the best I have had. Restaurant quality meals at fast food prices.
Very quick service
Yum chicken broth

Had the pork Banh Mi. The service was great. The Banh Mi (after tasting Banh Mi in Vietnam) was average. The roll was tasty but small. It lacked the taste of pate and all the pork cuts, plus the all pickles and coriander. Average.
Had grill pork noodle salad. It was fresh and healthy. Good portion for lunch.

Worst banh mi I’ve ever eaten. Picture they have up on the menu is very misleading, the pork looks to be crispy but what came out was some gross slimey pork which smelt really bad. The portion was also pretty small.
The pork bahn mi is packed with generous portions of flavorful meat. Chicken fresh spring rolls are super good as well. Great value for the quality so highly recommended.
Food was help yourself. Good food. Good people but I have reacted to the food.
Lovely food would recommend and also clean and tidy ,I’ll be back

I orded a dozen nuggets to the young boy then when the order was made the lady came bk and said I only ordered half and wanted me to pay she didn't even take the order  how dose tht work and said I only paid for half shes weird tht asian
Lovely family, great food!
Food is very tasty and the price is reasonable too. Portion is good. Feindly staff. Love the combination noodles and cashew nut chicken with mix veggies on rice. So yummy

Went to dinner with my boyfriend and the place didn't look so flash from the outside but when we went in, it had a great set up! Waiter was lovely and food was good and well priced. Recommend as a good spot to eat as a local

To be fair, I ordered this delivered but even reheated, the pizza was average. Not a lot of flavor and the crust was a little thick. I got the half buffalo half beast.  However, I do recommend the unholy donut. Unholy indeed - full of chocolate and salted caramel, and covered with cinnamon sugar. Very good.
Yum. Pizzas look small but filling and v tasty! Quick service and good deal with pizza and drink $15!

What an unexpected treat! We wanted to eat in after a day of a lot of walking in Christchurch, so decided on pizza. Found Hell on Yelp -- it's a FIND. We had the Camembert and cranberry pizza and the Savior pizza (chicken, avocado, portobello mushrooms, almonds, slaw and more) plus two salads -- it was a taste treat. Hell is a take out place -- just a counter where you could eat, but mostly it's used by people waiting for their pizzas. The staff are -- like all of the Kiwis we've met --  super friendly.

This was fantastic. We'd been walking by all week and we just had to go to "Hell" before we left Christchurch.   I got a "Pandemonium" chicken pizza with cranberry sauce and Camembert- it was amazing. I'd never had pizza like it. My husband got a meat pizza with bbq sauce that was also great. The crust was fantastic.

very cute shop with good coffee (tiramisu latte) and innovative meals (beef cheek hash + Black Forest oats). Turkish eggs for me were a little bland but crispy chickpeas were the best part of the dish- worth it.   service was good and food came out timely :) a little empty this morning but lively nonetheless! overall pretty decent breakfast!

This is mostly to confirm the previous reviews were on point as the last review was a while ago.  Make reservations if you can.  We didn't and were seated quickly, but I noticed our table was reserved after us. The food and service were great.

Tom Jones playing in the background... mad rush of takeaway coffee slurpers... but if you sit down and take the time to enjoy breakfast (small but refreshingly different menu to to the nz/au fare) you will be very pleasantly surprised.  Had the shakshuka for breakfast  ($22) and was fantastic. Came with home made flat bread with sea salt and caraway seeds. Really good. And with an awesome friendly staff, this can easily become your go to place every Monday to Friday. Or even Sunday.

Sorry had to downgrade the rating because the smoked salon Benedict was just way too salty. The service is ok and the place is really nice. Really wanted to give it a 4 star but then crazy saltiness of the smoked salmon was too much.

This place is a must for breakfast if you are Christchurch! They are very creative with the food and their food is presented nicely.  I went with the beef hash cheek. It was good but nothing spectacular. The portion was good. If the potatoes were more crispier and salty it would have been better, nevertheless still a good order.  My wife went with the granola. I thought it was going to be a boring order but I was proven wrong!!! It tasted great and the portion was big.  Finally the reason for the five star rating is their banana loaf which we shared. It's a must if you are in hello Sunday cafe.
Tasty and beautifully presented brunch. Well worth the visit for the fresh take on beef hash alone!
Excellent food! I ordered 2 plates just for myself! Food is delicious and health concious! Excellent brunch venue!

Used my Yelp community to check out a place to eat after visiting the Ferry St Antique shops. Thanks to you all who previously reviewed Hello Sunday. Lunch was just what I wanted and even my mother-in-law was happily taken care of which her sweet choice of crumpets with berries and coconut yoghurt. My salad was excellent and the Japanese pancake chosen by my husband was delish!

Cute, hip breakfast / lunch spot about 30 min walk from the cathedral in downtown. Friendly staff and a good mix of people. There's outdoor space as well as indoor and an adorable courtyard out back with herbs growing in pots along the path. Definitely recommended as a local spot to eat!

The food variety is perfect and the range of heathy dishes available - some with meat and many others without, was just great. The falafel was soft and flavourful and the coffee delicious. Cabinet food also looked good

I definitely recommend a booking for this fantastic brunch spot in the CBD. It ranks up as one of my top brunch spots in Christchurch and one not to be missed by locals and visitors alike. There will absolutely be a wait if you don't have a booking (and maybe even so if you do have a booking and tables haven't turned over, the space is small and the wait is worth it). If you try to walk in (as we did) the staff will usher you to a waiting room in the store next door and ask for your drink order. Having the coffee while we waited helped wake us up and keep us cheery. About 30 minutes later we were seated at a small wooden table with a chair on one side and wooden bench seat on the other. My husband ordered the Ham Hock Waffles and I ordered the Avocado Smash (not listed on their online menu).   The Ham Hock Waffle was a large waffle smothered in ham hock bits and a tomato relish salad complete with melted cheese covering the waffle, chunks of soft cheese, tomatoes, rocket and sprouts. The presentation is fabulous, but the flavor is even better.   The Avocado Smash was simply a piece of multi-grain toast simply smothered in smashed avacado and topped with a poached egg, served with polenta fries and chopped cherry tomatoes on the side. Holy Yum. I didn't even want to share with hubby, but since he let me try the waffle, I had to return the favor. VERY reluctantly.   We also split a cinnamon bun, which disappeared from our plates before I could snap a photo. It was warm, gooey and fantastic. Overall, effective table turnover, presentation, wait time and taste all exceeded my expectations. You MUST try this brunch spot out!
It's really delicious here
My daughter and I had lunch here. Absolutely delicious. I'll be back next holiday
Amazing breakfast!! Super friendly staff, can not recommend this place enough! It’s a must try
Really tasty food and good choice on the menu. lovely decor and friendly staff.
The food was delicious and the service was excellent. Special mention to how good the coffee was too! I’d definitely be back as the rest of the food on the menu looks amazing to try
Absolutely delicious overnight oats.  Always reliably great food,  service and general vibe

We loved the decent portion of mung bean sprouts in the rare beef pho with its rich, aromatic broth and tender beef — a huge portion easily enough for two. The place was absolutely packed during weekend dinner time, and it’s easy to see why.

Very good authentic Vietnamese Bun Bo Hue (spicy beef noodle soup) & Bun Thịt Nướng chào giò (vermicelli with grilled pork and spring rolls) Does not have similar herbs like we have in Melbourne but the flavour of the broth and the fish sauce is really good.  Would come back again if we visit Christchurch.

This place has its ups and downs. Initially, the food was flavorful, authentic, and very affordable. Over time, prices went up and the quality dipped, making it less appealing. Recently, I saw a discounted price on DoorDash and decided to give it another try. The food quality was back, and for the price, it was decent—an encouraging return to form.
Beautiful pho and fried spring rolls ! Always go here for Vietnamese food
The food is delicious. The beef pho soup is very delicious. There are many kinds of food and the price is not expensive.

Im struggling to give 3 stars. Our meals were lacking flavors and the meat in the sizzling steak dish was tough and chewy. We have had meals here in the past. This was a disappointment of a meal. The past meals ( sometime ago were really good) They did nail the crispy chicken. That was good. Not too sure if I will be returning.
Bun Bo Hue in here is the best I've ever had . The taste is really authentic of south side!!!

This restaurant had some of the best pho that I have ever tasted outside of Vietnam! I ordered the seafood pho which included shrimp, squid, quail eggs, etc. It was very flavorful and came in a large portion size.  I came to the restaurant with a large group, and it was a very nice setting with turning table so that people could rotate entrees and appetizers around the table.  This is one of the best Vietnamese restaurants is have been to, I highly recommend!
beef noodle soup is so good, the beef bone and beef ball makes it much more delicous.

Our last meal in Christchurch. After a movie in Riccarton, we decided to check out Hello Vietnam Restaurant for pho. They specialize in Southern Vietnamese (believe they are from Can Tho).  We dropped in on a Wednesday evening (around 8:15pm) and the place was packed. A mix of customers which is a good sign. FYI: it's BYO (for wine only).   The menu is humongous; appetizers, salad, soup, rice noodle soup, rice vermicelli, fried egg noodle, fried rice noodle, steamed rice, fried rice, meat dishes (chicken/beef/pork/squid/fish/prawn), tofu, vegetable, egg omelet, chef special menu, roast duck and desserts. They even have a couple set menu options. So many things. Only thing I ever look it as the pho/speciality soups!  - Pho dac biet (#23) ($16.00 NZD) - special beef rice noodle soup. Comes with the standard bean sprouts and basil (super fresh!). Broth is flavourful but on the sweeter side (Southern Vietnam influence). A bit too sweet for my liking. Meat was generous and a good variety; beef tendon, beef flank, pork balls, tendon and oxtail. Oxtail was bomb.  - Bun rieu cau ($13.00 NZD) - spicy crab rice vermicelli soup. Always a must whenever I see this on the menu! This was delicious; fantastic broth with depth and flavour. Good variety of meats including two tender meat balls, pork, a small piece of pork rib and crab. There was also a few tomatoes, tofu puffs (silky smooth) and green onion. I ate every last bit.  Super satisfying last meal. We were stuffed and in food coma heaven. 4.5 stars.
Fantastic meal, lovely new building and a wide choice at reasonable prices. 3 of us had dinner for $70. Ginger chicken and vegetables was my hit.

Authentic with a capital A. Also reasonably priced. Visiting two good friends who moved hear a few years back, this is their "go to" for Vietnamese. The appetizers and main courses were all delicious and quickly delivered. Note that they may ask you politely to head along if you've long since finished and there are others waiting for your table. It's expected that you share the accommodations! :-)
Fast, friendly service. Lots of seating. The food was delicious and fairly priced. Friends go there often and it is consistently great. Would recommend the Lemongrass & Chilli Tofu

Wow a random and delicious restaurant close to our hotel. Pho was a huge portion and delicious thick meat slices. NZ beef is very different from American beef - it's all free range and grass fed and has a gamier taste that I think is delicious. We also got the bok choy and salt and pepper fried squid. The salt and pepper fried squid was the BEST I've had in years and years. Wow! Flavorful and tender and moist while still crispy!

While on a recent stay in Christchurch, we asked our friends to suggest the best pizza they could think of. When they suggested Hells, we were intrigued. We ordered a few different pizzas to share. All of them great. Their thin crust is great and they are not shy on toppings. We appreciated that they had a lot of specialty vegetarian and vegan options to choose from. And we found the different levels of hell (spiciness) a fun twist. The pizzas were, in fact, spicy!
They've always delivered on the predicted time and also have never messed up on special requests notes for specific food items. Will always order from this place.
I think it is a great place to get pizza they degrees price but definitely not quality I really like the grimestone it is very delicious.

I love the whole concept of Hell's Pizza.They have great tasting pizza with a ton of options. The Hell theme is awesome and they really stay true to brand. This location used to be just around the corner from my flat and I used to splurge on it! Yum! When I'm back in NZ I'll definitely come back!
Very fresh ingredients for vegetarians. Nice location next to the river side

The food was good, I had falafel with beetroot feta sandwich. The falafel was warm, soft and flavorful. The salad was fresh, well seasoned but however I wish there was a little more of feta and edamame. Spinach and beetroot dominated the salad. Would like to try a medium portion next time :)

Herba Gourmet is a place that surprised me with its unique approach to food. I came here on a recommendation and I wasn't disappointed at all! The menu is modern, based on fresh, local ingredients, and everything is served with meticulous attention to detail. I ordered the lamb burger, and it was one of the best meals I've had in New Zealand – juicy meat, fresh vegetables, and a perfectly seasoned sauce. The service was incredibly friendly and professional, and it's clear the team truly enjoys what they do. The interior is stylish, but not overdone – warm lighting, plants, and pleasant background music. It's the perfect place for both lunch and an evening dinner after a busy day. I felt at ease there, and the food truly impressed me. I definitely recommend it to anyone who values ​​quality and authentic flavor.

I am disappointed and my husband is in pain.  My husband a coeliac works near Herba and was one of his go to eating spots for the last few years.  Unfortunately, the business was sold and has rapidly gone down hill.  The quality of the food has taken a nose dive and the treatment of customers has done the same. After avoiding the place for a few months after his last dissatisfied experience there. today he went back as he'd received an offer for $5 off.
