Big mistake, the protein size has decreased the chips were inconsistently cut and therefore terribly cooked.  And that is not the worst part: The food was contaminated. As a "dedicated GF" facility we expected it to be safe. His current agony tells a different story and I would recommend caution to all other coeliacs

The options were quite tempting and tasty. In the end, I'd say this meal was just okay, it did the trick, but I wasn't surprised by the taste or found the food particularly tasty. It lacked flavor and taste. I'm giving this rating because it was still edible and not bad either, I'm just saying that it lacked something extra.
Worst service
Delicious options filled with all the veggies and loaded with flavor. Really enjoyed trying the medium size last night for dinner.
SOO GOOD WITH MY FRIENDS!-  Them having spicy levels were amazing, absolutely one of the best ones.
Food is excellent, but a little salty, however the service is simple and sincere.
good selection of hot pot ingredients, quick to cook and be served and delicious hot pot soup base (got less spicy)
Nice and cozy place to enjoy hot pot! I spent $25 dollars average. I think I is worth enough to pay this much for a meal. Staff was nice and friendly the ingredients were very fresh and good
Really yummy malatang hotpot, perfect flavours and good spicy broth. The man and woman were very kind as well :) We will come back next time we are in Christchurch

Food was excellent (was fun picking out the options to put in the hot pot) and was very well priced. The lady that served us was welcoming and kind. Overall I would highly recommend this place - going back there sometime this week!
Great service.  Well priced and the care and bed side maners of the Dr is excellent.
This business knows its craft.  Simply amazing, every course created to perfection.  Our group all said the same thing, best food we've ever had.  Thank you!
This place was fabulous, absolutely amazing food. It was clean and well presented. Service was well good.
Really delicious meal! The staff was so attentive and me and my friends had the best time here! Definitely recommend the wagyu course

What​‍​‌‍​‍‌ a great spot to go and have an original coal self-BBQ! The equipment used allowed you to barbecue your food right on the charcoal, which not only gives the food a deep and smoky flavor but also makes the whole process very engaging and fun. The food was fresh, the service was speedy, and the crew were eager to help you and explain the procedure if you were a first-timer. A great combination of excellent food, getting to know, and the right ​‍​‌‍​‍‌vibe!
Very good food drink and service. On first table ess very reasonably priced. The set meal is very generous and yummy. Would definitely come back

A wonderful experience. The food was fresh, healthy, tasty, balanced and delicious. The staff were very reserved, polite and catered to all our needs. The only thing I would suggest is they are more engaging on a personal level to build rapport. Otherwise faultless.
The staff was so attentive and fast, and obviously the food was amazing and high quality. If I have the chance again, I will definitely come back!
Ordered from Hikari through UberEats while in MIQ. Those are good sushis, well-presented and well-packaged. Delivery was on time.  A trustable choice for a weekday night.
Badest Teriyaki Salmon Bowl ever. Loveless created. Overprized for that quality. Waitress friendly, but thats not the point.

This place started well earlier in the year, and we've been maybe 10 times.  Now the owners sit in the business watching customers while tables need to be clear, maybe wating is below them, the food is average, the price is average but what is really really obvious is that the portion size is well down, and I mean well down.  The California rolls are now 1/2 the size they previously were, and the sushi is tiny...sadly I suspect this place is loosing customers quickly, We wont be back, we tried to support it, but there's good sushi everwhere in CHCH central.

The food quality has gotten worse than before... and the prices have gotten more expensive... The ramen is so salty that I can't finish it and end up leaving some behind. A plate costs $6, but it only comes with two pieces of fried shrimp... I was like, what the heck.
Love this place an all time favourite everyone is so nice definitely coming again soon

The food was good and the service was excellent. The staff were very honest and kind. When my son forgot his sunglasses, a male staff member looked around the busy food court, found us, and returned the glasses. I was truly impressed with their warm hospitality.
Nice sushi for the price. If you come during peak hours the sushi is very fresh.
Food was pricey and there was smoke coming from another store that had us all coughing.
A large variety of options including Indian, Salads, Steaks and Fish. Excellent service. Good prices.
Lovely happy atmosphere, delicious food (huge portions) and the most amazing people! They people are like sunshine in human form  Highly recommend!!
Very friendly owner, lovely food and it's our new favorite place to go

Wow! Been meaning to go here for a while finally got the opportunity,  so no disappointed! Amazing food, great price, friendly staff,  Thanks so much for a great experience  21/10/26 Came back with family and friends for mums birthday,  such a fantastic experience,  so thank you yet agin. Cheers
Great service, delicious food and generous portions. I highly recommend this place.

Yesterday, we made a special visit to the restaurant because of its very high rating.  This is a very small restaurant that can house about ten tables. We ordered their pork ribs and two plates of red eye steaks. As we arrived at the restaurant very early, all the tables were empty. The food was served quickly. The ribs were pre-cut, and the size was small. Upon first trying the meat, it was soft and lacked the grilled, fire-roasted flavor. We ordered the red eye steaks to be served medium and medium-rare, but it turned out the steaks were prepared medium and well done. The fries were good and well prepared. Overall, the service was okay, as the staff couldn't understand and communicate with us well, except for the boss.
Lovely reasonable meals
We were greeted by very friendly staff. Delicious food and very reasonable prices. Plenty of choice. A great little restaurant.

restaurant: Himalayas Indian Restaurant City Centre Christchurch

reviews.text: We all enjoyed our meals. Service was great
The food was delicious. The place is a bit bare, which also makes the acoustics a bit poor.

Authentic Flavours & Excellent Service! I was in Christchurch for a work meeting from Auckland, and by the third day, I was really craving some good Indian food — and Himalayan Restaurant absolutely delivered! The food was amazing, full of authentic flavour, and I honestly can’t fault a thing. The staff were so friendly and welcoming, which made the experience even better. Definitely coming back next time I’m in town!

We got a small group together for a neighbourhood meal and I was looking forward to a nice meal.  However the menu -as in all Indian Restaurants is so long I asked the waiter for a steer on a popular dish.  He recommrnded one of Chefs specials and I said yes.  It truly was so smoky, not the tandoor flavour but the liquid smoke that can be bought and so the meal could not be eaten. Three of us tried it, so it was a very disappointing experience.  Others enjoyed their meals.

We were only in Christchurch for 5 nights and ate here twice. The second time as a last minute group of 14, which the staff handled very well. The menu is large but the dishes maintain their authenticity, the food is top quality and the best we’ve eaten in a long time. The service was very good, efficient and friendly with good attention to detail. All 14 of us highly recommend.
Nice food everyone should try
Yummy food. Great atmosphere and service. Highly recommend.

This Indian restaurant was a lovely dining experience. You could tell it was a family business and they took pride in their product. The service was great, very attentive and checked in with us during our dining. We had the chickpea vegetarian recommended dish, saag prawns, garlic naan and spicy pickles. One let down was I found the dishes not spicy enough even tho we asked for medium and I would have like more intensity in the flavour. I gave a 4 because of the whole experience and not just the meal.

I had fairly high expectations of this place after a recommendation from a friend. Unfortunately I left the place disappointed. Ordered Chicken bhuna and lamb rogan josh. Both came served with basmati rice. Taste for both were average, nothing to really write home about. Portions were on the small side, suitable for light mid eaters. The mango lassi tasted of syrup rather than mangoes. Could definitely do better. Overall there are better ones around for the price.
Everything was so delicious. I've never had better Indian food. The lamb roganjash was so tender and perfectly season. The chicken tikka masala was super juicy and had the perfect hint of smokiness.
Great food. Was my first time getting food from and it was so damn good  there's plenty to of park everywhere and also nearby shops also. Great staff too
Good Indian restaurant. Tasty food.
Best Indian restaurant in the city best for Indian street food and specially veg samosa and curry
Good vegan options Nice staff

I did a phone order over the phone and was told it would take 20 minutes to make. I got there exactly 20 minutes later and he told me it would take another 20 minutes. It ended up taking 25 so 45 minutes in total waiting. When he came out with my food the order was completely wrong. I ordered my dish to be vegetarian and it came with chicken and also had asked to swap out the naan which didn't happen. So after waiting for 45 minutes and the wrong order I refused to pay and left.
Reasonable pricing and great service. Tawa parantha
Worst lemon chicken. Just a lemon in butter chicken gravy. Worst taste ill never go for non-veg there. Wasted meal.

I tried the samosa chaat at Hobson Indian Takeaway and honestly, it’s the yummiest I’ve had in Christchurch! The samosas were perfectly crisp, the chutneys had the right balance of tangy and spicy, and the flavors came together beautifully. It felt authentic and fresh, just like back home. If you’re craving real Indian street food vibes, this place is a must-visit. Friendly service and generous portions made it even better. Definitely my new go-to spot for chaat in the city!

Best experience here, food was amazing, we had the Hoi A Feast and it was delicious, flavours were intense, good cocktails and generous portions. Great service from staff and great for groups! 10/10 recommend!!!

We heard great things about this place and it definitely lived up to our expectations! Our family (two children, Mum, Dad, and Nana) visited Hoi An House while down from Auckland and had the most wonderful evening. The food was delicious and enjoyed by everyone. The setting is stunning — a real hidden gem. It would make a fantastic venue for special events or functions. The service was friendly and welcoming, and Ollie made us feel right at home. Highly recommend!
Generous portions but quite expensive
very good food and service, and the coffee is amazing
lovely meal & service as aways
Always excellent :)
Thoroughly enjoyed the evening.  Learned about Hoi An House last week and have already returned with two other friends.
We loved the Share menu, it made deciding easy and Sam our waitress was exceptional.  Looking forward to our next visit already!

This place has all the ingredients for a great restaurant - happy servers, great atmosphere, comfy chairs, and an enticing  menu. I ordered the salmon sliders ($18) not realizing that they were cold smoked salmon. Each of the 4 is different in the kind of salmon, as well as the add ons - herbs, onions, sauces. I would have preferred if the buns were toasted, and felt it was a little pricey - but the flavors and quality of ingredients lead me to believe that these guys know what they are doing - and are either on their way to greatness or are applying it to the other dishes. Next time, I would go for the salmon soup which they also recommended.  Their only major fault was giving me a giant espresso when I ordered a flat white. Not sure if it was just a one off mistake of theirs, or mine for ordering a coffee in a smoke house ....
if you want a proper kiwi Chinese thos is the place for you! full heartedly recommend the sweet and sour pork and being nice to the couple who run the joint. delicious

I absolutely LOVE this place! Prior to having discovered this place, I absolutely could not stand Chinese takeaways. These guys have proved me so wrong in my opinion and changed my mind! The quality and price are so good and not to mention their hot chips are just the cherry on top!!

This place has nice food but man it took ages to get our order and we rang it in I’d never go back here for that alone took 40mins ish and another customer was shocking there head because he was in the same boat!! Don’t do it

No point doing phone order. They dont cook it until you paid. Not good when you are in a hurry and they dont tell you. Food was barly edible and most of the 4 meals went to chook food. Voting with our feet and we wont be back.
Awesome and friendly, knowing they closed at 9.30pm, they still served us outside opening hours, the food is a solid 9 out of 10...thank you Hong Kong Star Chinese

The potatoes & carrots in the curry were perfectly cooked this time, not rushed, and soft enough to chew while maintaining its cut shape. The only thing is, many restaurants with brothy dish don’t seem to want to add more choice of proteins or vegetables in their like curry & soup dish. I have added more frozen shrimps, fish balls & vegetables into my ordered curry & Tom Yum so family & I can enjoy it to the fullest!  I will definitely order your dishes again, this is not my first time! A-ròi mâak mâak khâ

Had Thai food from here and tried the Numtok salad. Portion size was decent, and the taste was pretty authentic with a slight twist of their own — fresh and flavorful. The price was affordable, especially with the DoorDash special that made it an even better deal. Overall, a nice, satisfying meal for the price.
Love this little place, fast and efficient service   Fresh spring rolls excellent and Red curry superb
The best Thai green curry I have ever had in Christchurch.  Great service.

Have experienced super good service here! The staff are always friendly and I’ve often been given a complimentary drink, which is such a nice touch. I usually get delivery or pick-up rather than dining in, and it’s always been super fast and ready when I arrive. Portion sizes are generous, the food is always delicious, and they consistently have great deals available online. I even took my grandparents here once, and now they’re huge Thai fans too! Definitely one of my go-to spots & would highly recommend!
Repeat regular customer.  Fabulous food every time

First time getting food from here tonight, safe to say I have found my new favourite Thai spot!!!! From the second I got close to the restaurant the smell was insane, the service was incredible and everyone was so friendly, the food was crazy good! Bussin!! I will 100% be back

We ordered 2 takeaway dishes. Sweet and sour chicken ( very sweet no sour and very little chicken. The combination pad Thai was not good at all. So much sugar added and no savoury flavour at all. Very disappointing given the reviews. We would not go back
Lovely breakfast, had pancakes loved the individual sauce jug etc. Great service and cabinet food display.
Always a great atmosphere and friendly staff!!
Great place for brunch lunch during the week
Great food value for money.
A group of 7 of us ordered 4 dishes with rice when we were 1/2 hour’s drive out of Christchurch. The food was ready and hot and well packaged when we arrived for our ‘Takeaway’
Love to visit Hungry thaiger lovely service with various option available as we had some   Honey lemon chicken and beef cheek massaman curry really delicious, Highly recommend this place
Ordered off Uber. Food was delicious, Lots of veggie and meat. Great flavour
Had a takeaway order. It was Beautiful!!!  Best Thai food I’ve had. Every mouthful was delicious. Will definitely go back when over in Chch next.
ordered off uber eats and honestly it was so delicious!!! so much flavour and good portions! really enjoyed our dinner and even eating some leftovers for lunch today!
Absolutely delicious! And safe for a sensitive coeliac. I have order a few times now from door dash. Highly rate the Beef cheek massaman curry and Bangkok Cashew Nut. Yum!
Great food.
I have been going to Hungs takeaways for many years. One of the best Vietnamese and Chines takeaways in Christchurch.

Great place for some "noodle canteen' like food. I'm not a fan of this type of food, but this place has become one of our regular, and most visited places for take out. Well priced, and great portions.  One of the only reasons we keep coming back is the affordability. Along with the consistency with food and portions per order.

Went on a Friday night so was expecting there to be a bit of a wait, which ended up being about 30min as we went in at peak rush and ordered in store a variety of dishes. Watching the two workers preparing the food was absolutely mesmerising. They were working as fast as humanly possible to get on top of the orders, amazing team work!  Their portions were great and no.61 beef black bean was so delicious and tender, and the vegetables weren't overcooked. I will be going back to try out their other dishes.  There were 3 chairs out to sit on while waiting and a table with 2 chairs as well.
Ordered honey chicken it was rubbery, chewy seemed like it was old? overcooked? or not even sure if it was chicken..? just disappointed went to waste.
Meals are huge

THE WORST fish and chips we've had ever!  - Fish: the fish was soggy and tasted terribly fishy (I know they say it's fresh if it's fishy but seriously not this fishy). The pieces 'seemed' large... but I think the batter bulked them up...  - Batter on fish: the batter was all bubbly and thick... sooo thick... it soaked up so much oil that it it fell apart. On some parts of the fish, the batter was raw... - Chips: chips were overcooked but thick cut, so they weren't terribly dry... but were very discoloured because they were overcooked. - Battered sausage: Horrible... this huge sausage with thick batter... the sausage was the size of a large Bratwurst. - Battered meat pattie: Gross.... I don't even know what this was... it was like 10% mince meat with 70% sausage meat with the leftover of flour paste... This wasn't pleasant at all...  Unfortunately, we threw 70% of this out because it was almost inedible. Price was okay at $33 in total, but no way at all was it quality for money.

I ordered Butter Chicken and goat curry on Uber eat. Both curry were very yummy, especially Butter Chicken! It was the best in town! . They also gave us an extra Naan. It’s shown their care! . I will support them again great service and best Butter Chicken. . Thanks for serving us great food!
Bad Experience

My favourite takeaways place, the noodle burger is super filling and so good, and their butter chicken is easily the best I’ve had anywhere. The staff are always really friendly and the food comes out fast every time. Can’t go wrong with this place!

I think the garlic naan was a bit too doughy for my liking, but the food wasn’t bad :) medium butter chicken is spicier than most I’ve tried but not more flavourful, sort of tastes a bit more like chicken tikka masala than butter chicken xx  overall 7/10

An awesome experience dining at Inati. I say experience, as not only was everything absolutely delicious, all dishes were precisely crafted. Highly recommend to anyone in Christchurch to experience Inati!

I've often walked past this place thinking I'll give it a try. Finally my partner and I decided to. Now this is a small place and the kitchen is in full view situated behind the bar.  We went for the trust the chef option because, well that was the only option I could choose when booking which has a penalty of $50 if you don't turn up. This have the place an air of exclusivity but it annoyed me. Not a good start but hey. We also noticed people were ordering what they liked, so not sure if there was a limit on order your own or not. Anyway, ordered some wine by the glass from a snotty waiter. A young guy who clearly needs to eat some humble pie.  The other waiter thankfully was the opposite and real nice. So the food was below par, the chicken we got was cooked well, moat and tasty. But the rest of the 5 courses other than the dessert were how can I say, like stuff they wanted to get rid of. I'm short, for what you pay and what you get, which includes the service, the food, the experience, it's not worth the money. It's overpriced and there is much better offerings out there for less money and with more welcoming service.

Despite all the other rave reviews, I thought this place was just ok. We made a reservation but the table was not ready when we arrived. At that time, there was also no space in the lounge, so they directed us to the building lobby to sit down and offered us some water. During this time, I wish they would have given us a drink menu or something because it felt a little strange to just wait outside in this random lobby (also, another party was given a drink menu). Then, when we entered the restaurant, we were directed to these high barstools that overlook the kitchen area. It took until we started awkwardly draping our coats on the barstools for them to offer to take our coats (we also witnessed the hostess take the coats for others before us, so I'm not sure why it was so awkward for us). We did the 'Trust the chef" option. The food was good, but not amazing. Some of the dishes were on the saltier side, and I couldn't finish the main entree, and they don't allow take away of any leftovers. The wine pairing was tasty and definitely showcased some great NZ wines! In the end, it was cool to watch the kitchen, but for the pricepoint, I was expecting a little better service.

This place is really something special. I feel one can tell whether chef is just cooking well or whether they really know what they are doing, and in my opinion, this place has it. I've been to "starred" restaurants around the world, and live in LA (which has the most exciting  restaurant scene in the world right now) and I feel Inati ranks right up there as a place of note. The duck trumpets (mini ice cream cones with duck mousse) , boeuf-nuts (donut holes with perfect beef) were excellent, but the charred broccoli was just spectacular. These all showed imagination and mastery. The next table couldn't stop raving about the mutton.  Not to be missed, when in Christchurch!

My wife and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner at Inati a few weeks ago. We had 7pm reservations and were promptly seated at the kitchen bar with a view of all the delicious dishes being prepared. The restaurant features a sharable menu in which you can either order dishes separately or you can "Trust Us".  We had to go with the "Trust Us" menu, which featured six different dishes. We also added the wine pairing featuring local New Zealand wines that went perfectly with each dish. The first dish was the Tua Tua Clam Crudo, Cucumber & Gin. These tender and fresh clams were topped with citrusy crispy cucumbers. This was a light but flavorful dish and a nice way to start dinner. Next came my favorite dish of the night: Duck Trumpets & Blackberry Jam. Rich and creamy duck pate with a hint of sweet jam sat in a crispy waffle cone and was topped with crunchy nuts. This was an addictive balance of flavors and textures. I was on the verge of ordering another pair but the next dish distracted me: Charred Broccoli Root, Smoked Ricotta & Almonds. Inati turned the part of the broccoli that you threw away as a kid into something amazing! The broccoli stalk was super tender with a hint of smokiness and paired with creamy ricotta and crunchy almonds. Next was the Parsnip, Apple & Candied Walnut. I don't think I've ever had a parsnip before but I quickly became a fan! The vegetable was savory with a creamy topping (similar to mashed potatoes), sweet apples, and crisp walnuts. Aged Duck & Scratching was next. A crisp juicy lightly fatty skin surrounded mouthwatering, tender and lightly salty duck meat. An eggroll with even more tender duck meat added more deliciousness. Before our last dish (dessert), I wanted to order one more savory item that wasn't included in the "Trust Us" offering: Venison Bresaola, Seaweed & Pistachio. The venison was tender and gamey with a sweet jam and topped with powdered pistachios. Finally we had the Honey, Brown Butter & Sage for dessert. Airy and lightly sweet and salty custard was topped with creamy sweet sage ice cream and crunchy nuts. When in Christchurch, I highly recommend Inati for a nice date night.

Fabulous!  Easily topped the small plates we've had in the USA. We shared a bottle of wine (thank you to our server for recommending something based on our preferences rather than the priciest option), the curried cauliflower, seaweed braised potatoes (our least favorite), heritage tomatoes, soft cheese with walnuts and cucumber, smoked fish, and creamed corn with salted caramel ice cream.  In hindsight, we probably should have ordered the 6 plates "Trust Us" chef's choice.  All plates were meticulously presented, service was excellent and we loved the unusual combinations that complemented each other perfectly.

A tapas style restaurant with creative takes on local materials. You can sit at bar and chat with the sous chefs. Wines were excellent choices for the dishes. Of 5 dishes and dessert 4 were excellent and the only slight disappointment was dessert.  Service was near excellent (forgot to pour the red to accompany the lamb) but made up for it with apology and a stiff pour of the red.  Highly recommended

This is an amazing new restaurant to hit the city of Christchurch. It is Inati to share food and experience unlike any other. The food is simple and so full of flavour. It is a place to visit when you are in Christchurch and a must. Food and wine is all local fare and matches are amazing. An amazing experience to have especially if you are into food and wine- a foodies dream!!! Keep going Christchurch we need more place a like this in the city

We are definitely people who "live to eat" so finding inspiring meals is always a priority when we travel. As a result we have had the good fortune to encounter many new and memorable foods, cooking techniques, and dining experiences. Inati was a one of our most recent gems. I have sent pictures and descriptions to friends & relatives stating that the evening we spent with Simon, Lisa and their staff was easily within one of the top 20 meals we've encountered in our 68 years. To describe the food would take many pages. I'll just say that everything is prepared by very highly skilled and motivated people who clearly love what they do. This alone is ample reason for all foodies to make this restaurant a priority. However, what really sets them apart is that the entire staff goes out of their way to make you feel that you are an important part of their evening and that they want you to feel as excited about what they are doing as they are. We are so glad that we get to return to Christchurch and re-visit Inati before we head back home from our vacation. The memories will stay with us for many years to come.
Inati has amazing food ! The monk fish was spectacular ! Beets were unlike any I've ever had ! It is a little pricey but definitely worth the money for a great date night.

There's a gym in the same building as Inati, on the other side of the elevators on the ground floor. I may as well get a membership to the gym, because I will be in the building, at Inati frequent enough to want to burn that guilt off at said gym. I could go to the gym, then go to Inati... Or just skip the gym all together.  This place is incredible. World class fare, new style, eclectic takes on classic and modern cuisines. Butcher's "scrapes" honoring the whole beast. Using familiar, natural and curious (in a good way!) flavors, all rolled together and discovered in a single plate. With local organic ingredients.  Small plates concept, with a couple larger plates available - I dined alone, so I opted to stick with the smaller plates (be warned larger plates. Your time will come to be inside me, too...)  Tonight was my first time dining at Inati, and the food was very possibly the best I've had in all my years visiting Christchurch (about 9 years now). Possibly the best meal I've had in the whole of New Zealand.  Service was professional, courteous and friendly (albeit the server was a little slow - Which is fine, as I recognized that there seemed to only be 2 front of the house staff, working the room. Maybe three? There was a guy who greeted me, but I couldn't tell his actual position. Sommelier/Host maybe?) But, I was fortunate enough to sit in front of whom I presume was the Chef - Who helped with front of the house duties for his single diner guest.   2 notes of disappointment that I experienced: The drink selections seemed somewhat limited with only beer and wine options. I personally prefer a small, limited cocktail program as an apertif. As well as coffee and/or espresso with dessert - But the restaurant is small, so it's forgivable that they may not have the room for a bar/hot drinks area. Or I just didn't notice them on the menu, which is entirely possible, too.  Secondly, the Chef's Table/Bar seats are too high for my stubby frame and I kind of struggled to get in and out. No suggestions, just an observation. It certainly won't deter me from dining at the same seat again.  Just. Plain. Delicious.
The best seats are at the bar amongst the action. Great dishes, flavour & presentation. Recommend!
What an amazing place. The food, wine and service were all wonderful. Beautiful food that's very clever and well thought out.

A wonderful evening experiencing a collab with visiting chef Julian from Melbourne’s Navi!  Simon and the team put on an incredible menu and as always a wonderful show watching the industry’s best dance around the kitchen delivering perfection and world class service.

The food was absolutely delicious — full of flavor and beautifully prepared. The staff were friendly, attentive, and made us feel so welcome. Everything was perfect from start to finish. Highly recommend!
Best in the town....
The food at Indian Dreams was absolutely yummy! Great flavours and everything was cooked perfectly. The service was excellent too — very friendly and attentive staff. Highly recommend!
Nice food, very corporative all staff..
We come here every week for Friday lunch. The lunch combo is a great deal and the right amount of food so you don’t fall asleep at your desk in the afternoon. Service is friendly and speedy.
Ashu had our meal ready in under 10 minutes. We waited in the car and he brung it out to us. Very tasty butter chicken and the garlic naan is a hit thank you  highly recommend

popped past to check if they still did kickass lunch specials as its no longer on the signs outside, it's not noted on the website for ordering or the signs anymore but the window has a lunch menu special. The naan and cheese naan and butter chicken here are superb
always delicious and not too badly priced as well

We ordered the mango chicken and prawn jalfrezie and both were so disappointing. They lacked flavour and were watery in consistency. The mango chicken was sickly sweet and the prawn jalfrezie tasted and looked like tomato sauce it was so watery and sugary. There were no other spices in it at all. We have eaten from here before and it’s been great but this has missed the mark tonight unfortunately.
Great bunch of guys, good food and excellent taste. Everything is halal on the menu.
Very obliging with delivery and the Chicken Tikka and Butter Chicken was extremely enjoyable along with the Garlic Naan, I would recommend
Good food, good service, nice people

We ordered 1 chicken fried rice and there is no egg and veggies. Only some frozen beans and hot chilli.There is no other vegetables and egg on this.Nothing else and very very poor fried rice.Atleast give a decent dish for the money that we are paying
Best catering service, food was excellent

We ordered takeaway tonight and asked for an Indian hot spice curry, not mild. Unfortunately, the curry tasted only sweet and tangy from the tomato with no spice at all. It didn’t taste like a proper Indian hot curry, and we were quite disappointed. We ended up eating something else instead. Not happy with our order tonight.
Amazing food with authentic flavors and great service! Cozy atmosphere and friendly staff. Highly recommend this place for delicious Indian cuisine.
Wasn't just a meal it was an experience. Definitely coming back. Food was amazing
Tried their chicken biryani and it is so good. One of the best biryani I've tried.
Went for lunch. The food, decor and service was great. And their Naan is the best I've ever had....so light.
Everything is good I love it.

We did first table here and it did not disappoint! Food was very good and was nice atmosphere inside the restaurant. Shout out to our server Anish he was a real g and was is a great man - we will be back!
A great meal, generous portions. Awesome naan. Lovely service and atmosphere . One meal was acceptable bit hotter than expected but absolutely no issue to make a new one. Defo recommend.
Fantastic Food! Great service!
OK, they win. By far the best Indian we have ever had. We ordered thru Uber, and it arrived hot and fresh, mainly due to tin foil packing. We will definitely be back.
I highly recommend this place. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was fantastic, making for a thoroughly enjoyable dinner. However, the service could be improved.

Fantastic restaurant — one of the best Indian places around! Tried their chicken tikka masala and sahi paneer , both were bursting with flavour. Service was fast and friendly. Highly recommend Indian Ocean for anyone who loves authentic, high-quality Indian food.

Really disappointing experience at this Indian restaurant. The owner’s behaviour felt shady — overcharging customers and making excuses when questioned. Several people seemed to have similar issues with missing items or being charged for things they didn’t get. Feels more like a scam than a proper business. Be careful and check your bill before paying.
Lovely Indian food. Different flavors to other Indian fare. Great to look out onto estuary and the birds. Excellent service.
Really disappointed with the food we ordered tonight. It wasn’t cooked properly and didn’t taste good at all. Definitely not worth the money.
Food was outstanding and the service was even better! Will definitely be making this a regular curry night spot.

Genuinely impressed with the select menu and price range, fantastic food!! warm & friendly environment & thought I have to put in a quick review  :-) lovely wall texture with an authentic appearance within the restaurant.
Ordered fried rice from there, ridiculous   I wouldn't recommend anyone to go there for takeaways. Wasted my time and my money .

Indian Paradise was my favorite restaurant but unfortunately no more. We ordered chicken korma, chicken biryani and cheese garlic naan. The taste of Chicken korma is blend, we request for medium spicy but it is not spicy at all. Chicken biryani, we request for extremely spicy but we got only too much herbs so hard to eat and not spicy at all. For cheese and garlic naan seem like naan is not fresh, not cheese on the naan. We are not really happy with the food.
The best authentic indian meals , tried so many places nothing is as good as this, so delicious and flavoured.Also prices are very affordable compare to other take aways.
I had taken food from here last week there food is very bad the food needs improvement and too much use of red color
Our go to takeaway spot. Indian Pearl always delivers
Consistently the best curries, the meat is always tender, the flavour is so balanced. Incredible!

Delivery order via Uber. Couldnt fault anything. From Naan to Masala and a real surpise " Malai Tika" it was the best Indian weve had in a long time. Well done, makes our future Indian choice a no brainer!  Another great takeaway tonight Sept 2025. Possible best butter chicken I've had! Don't change a thing!
Great Indian food at reasonable price.

Really love the food here, and have been here several time on different occasions . Recommending their New Delhi specials. The staff and owners are very friendly, Tanisha is very friendly every time we visit. Highly recommend if you wanna try good quality Indian food.
Kia and Ron... Gorgeous humans. All the the staff are fantastic. Best Indian food ever!!
Excellent great service

One of the very few places that deliver hot when you ask for hot…. And they still maintain the flavour- one of the best Lamb Kormas I have had in years… and my family thoroughly enjoyed their mild dishes as well
So yummy food and vibes of restaurant are so good., Best Indian restaurant you can find in Christchurch, NZ.
Tried a goat biriyani and it was phenomenal. $23 and the one person serving was more than enough for 2 people. Had lots of meat in the dish, very satisfied.

Dining in. This is a hidden gem. Absolutely beautiful cuisine, authentic, with high quality  fresh ingredients. Expansive menu, and great wine list. This is the best Indian restaurant that I’ve ever been to in Chch. Good sized meals - a main and rice was too much for me to eat alone. Perfect for family groups , or solo diners. Very homely feeling atmosphere, and the acoustics are great- meaning you can actually hear the conversation at your own table. Highly recommend. First time I’ve been there, but will definitely return.
I have eaten here three times recently and will be back. Love the interesting menu, both mains and starters, and the wide variety of tastes and spice mixes. I have had takeout, lunch and dinner in.
We come to this restaurant few times. Food is awesome, service is amazing, beautiful atmosphere.

The Angel Rangra was on duty manager board. The guy on counter was not at all at the counter. always in the kitchen. not even a busy day. just 3/of us n mayb few delivery orders. we came around 9pm on 14th oct. First of all he didnt even greet. then my cutleries was on the menu book, he took the menu book even without saying a word n dropped my cutleriees on the table. I tried to greet him, i said hi, we said thank u no response. he might be wrking under pressure, if u cant even handle few customers here then hire more staff and train them well. We came here for the name of this place. The hanmer one was awesome but this one not good at all. even the duty manager name was under a morning shift person name. He said he forgot to change the name and he mentioned his name is lakshman something. then he said thats his real name. full of lies. If you guys wana run a business. do it properly. definitely not cmg back again.

I can’t recommend this place enough! We had the Combo for 2 (2 curries, 2 nans, 2 onion bajis, 2 drinks for $56) which I thought was great value to start with.  But the food exceeded our expectations- I had the kadai chicken and man, it was soooo good.  Something fresh and authentic about it, different than other kadai I had.  The staff were very lovely and I wished I could go there for dinner every day  they also gave us free poppadoms! If you like indian food, this is where you should go for a lovely experience.

Super impressed with our meal at Indian Vibes tonight. The samosas, pakoras, lamb korma and butter chicken were ELITE! The butter chicken wasn’t too sweet and the meat was tender. The lamb korma was just so flavourful. We were thoroughly looked after by the very kind gentleman who served us and who anticipated our every need. And the meal was very reasonable, price wise. Thank you to you both - an excellent experience all round!
Goat Nawabi was incredible. tender, rich, and full of flavour. Indian Vibes nailed it!
Great food great service

I was also lucky enough to try their new ramen dish, and it was amazing too. The meat and egg in the ramen were absolutely perfect. The warm broth was just what I needed on a cold winter day. Izumi is best Restaurant in Nz I usually visit every week I like sushi and pork katsu curry I hope everyone try  yummy food of Izumi !!
Popped in for an early dinner. Wasnt busy at all. The service was good and the food was great! Too full for dessert unfortunately.
We really enjoyed the food; the dishes were delicious, and the juices too! The atmosphere was super relaxed, and we were able to chat and have a lovely time with my friends.

I came here and I just ordered a fries and i took them 25 mins just for a fries and im inside the restaurant it wasn’t even busy and when I ordered the fries they gave it to me in a plate instead of a take away and isn’t their Cashier’s job to ask if its dine in or take away. I had lunch here again on September 20, 2025. The ambiance was pleasant, and since it was a weekend, it was packed. The steamed fish was a bit pricey, at $78 NZD. There was no price when ordering, and only three of us could share. The fish's belly was completely unscaled, neatly arranged on the belly. A bowl of noodle soup I’ve eaten for 30 years — my Cambodian soul food   I’ve eaten this same bowl of noodle soup for 30 years. And every bite feels like traveling back in time. Within that familiar flavor lies a different memory each time.  After school as a kid, I’d bike past this little noodle shop. In high school, I’d sneak out at lunch for a bowl of Cambodian kuy teav. Even after long shifts at work, I’d still find my way back for a hot bowl. Everyone has that one noodle soup they call their own. For me, this isn’t just lunch or dinner, and definitely not just street food — It’s a taste of home, and a timeline of my life.  The broth is made from chicken bones simmered all day — rich, yet clean. The rice noodles are silky, the beef slices cooked just right, Finished with a spoon of that signature tangy chili sauce — Each bite is familiar, each sip carries me back to childhood.  It’s been 30 years. The stall has changed, the owner too. But this bowl of soup, this flavor — never did.  —  #CambodiaBeefNoodleSoup #TasteOfHome #30YearsOfNoodles #KuyTeav #CambodianStreetFood #NostalgicFlavors #MySoulFood #FoodWithMemory #ComfortInABowl

A1 was really delicious to my taste! I only realized after I got home that I never received the Coke I ordered — that’s how good the food was!  It’s a bit of a shame the staff didn’t double check the order, but I also forgot about it myself,,
Servings were really big.. but taste not so good

My Indonesian  friend invited me to try chicken luksa here. The restaurant have a lot of seat. Self service water and you have to pay at the counter then get your number to waiting for your food at the table. On that day I didn’t order chicken luksa by my friend recommended but I ordered Tom yum noodles soup instead. When my food coming the portions is enough for 1 or you can share with your friend if you didn’t eat much. The soup was tasty a little bit spicy and sour. You will get a lot of rice noodles in your soup. It good to have soup in cold weather. 19$ for one meal is not to expensive for my opinion at this stage. And also they have a lot of variety food you can choose to try like spicy beef bamboo, pork omelette and chicken on rice. Recommended to try to have food in this restaurant. If you like spicy you can ask staff to made more spicy
Always my first place to stop when I arrive in Christchurch. Love this place!
Very delicious The soup is amazing!

Chicken soup bones available with a main order if dinning in.  There are thick noodles to request.  There are a lot of seats.  A long opening hours.  A clear menu with pictures.  A lot of staffs to help. A lot of car parks.  Two entrance, rear and front on Riccarton road.

Ordered 2 dishes noodle soup and fried noodle . After 20 min didn't get my food . Who ever ordered way before me . 6 people's table . 4 people's table get food first than me .. I asked counter how long will be take I get my food they said 10 more min ..... already wait 20 min + 10 min .total 30 min ? And I asked how come other large groups order served first.. the lady said because they ordered noodle soup ?????? . What kind that excuses my order have you wait for 30min ..... and clearly my order was noodle soup and fried noodles ....... is my noodle soup way diffrent than other noodle soup ?? When restaurant busy I understand food can be delay . But 3 or more table served before me don't really think that's fare for anyone have to wait for 30 min ..... and no one explain when I ordered food its will be take long if I order fried noodle. Find other restaurants . Don't go this place .

Wow... I miss this place so much. Nothing beats a good old chicken satay noodle soup on a cold winter days. Reminds me of the days in Dunedin.    The place- lots of seats, self service, clean but not like a 5 star restaurant.  Food- go for the chicken satay noodle soup. Very filling, warms up your stomach! Ask for extra bowel of chicken bone also.  Service- friendly but it's not really where you go for service  Price- starting to go up. I remember the days of spending $8 for a bowl, it's now $12  Overall very nostalgic, will have to make another trip down south soon.

Wow, delicious food and friendly, efficient people. Thank you for the wonderful meal ... we'll certainly be back. Great to have such reasonably priced and fresh, plentiful dishes. Lots to choose from too.
We often get takeaway or delivery (via Uber) from Kin Kin. It is our new go-to Thai. Fantastic taste, portions and service. The Beef Cheek Massamun is my personal favourite.
Loved the food  And lovely service. Definitely will come back. Vegan options available
The best takeaway in the area! Good food, good service and great portion size, highly recommend this place. YUMMM
Never disappointed with takeaway from this place! Great prices, delicious food and really big portions
Ordered Pad Thai, portion is small compared to other with similar priced places.

We ordered two gluten-free Pad Thais with chicken, one medium and one mild.  The medium had big chunks of chilli - my partner said it was like eating molten lava. Furthermore, instead of chicken in both inexplicably there was no chicken but tofu!  The last time we bought a chicken Pad Thai it had a few pieces of tofu, but this was all tofu.  There was also minimal flavour and sauce and while  I waited for the order in store, to be ready, it was actually lukewarm. It was very disappointing and an unpleasant meal but we were both tired and hungry from working all day, so we ate most of it.  We will not be returning even though we have been many times before.  Epic fail unfortunately.
stopped to get salad. got greek salad + falafel + lebanese hummus. everything was amazing. delicious food. would come back if I could.

We have dined here before and never disappointed. This is why we chose to take our family visiting from Perth for lunch and have Trust the King. The whole meal was outstanding. Great service with a bit of banter which we enjoyed.  My Brother-in-Law who is a harsh critic and hard to please said its one of the best restaurants he's ever been to and couldn't stop raving about the food.  Congratulations King of Snake. Of course we will be back.

Our second visit to King of Snake; we very much looked forward to coming back. And it did not disappoint. Very tasty food, and generous portions -- not something you always find at restaurants of this calibre. Can't wait to come back.

My husband and I were lucky enough to be given a voucher for this restaurant. Such and amazing place with the best service I have ever experienced in a NZ restaurant. The food was exceptional, and it was great the way the chefs came out and told you about each course- personalized the experience very well. Cannot speak highly enough of this wonderful place. We had the Chefs Experience fixed menu stunning. Loved the duck dish. A must when visiting Christchurch. Booking is essential- make sure you do this, so you don't miss out on this incredible place. Easy walk from most of the inner-city hotels. Leave your car at the hotel or at home.

We loved our meal. We will be back. Superb food and service. Couldn't fault it at all. I can see why it's one of the top restaurants in Christchurch and why we need to book so far in advance. But it was well worth it. Thank you so much. We loved the cocktails and the staff next door too. Nothing was a problem we were very impressed with the bar staff not needing to write down our order of 9 drinks. Thank you for making our night out 1 to remember

Loved the king of snake to celebrate a birthday.  Beautiful food, fabulous, knowledgeable and attentive wait staff.  Our waitress made choosing an option that worked for our table very easy and even when we cut out seafood due to one person not liking it, she kindly still included a wee scallop entree for myself who loves seafood - she must have seen my disappointment hahaha. We sat on the balcony overlooking the bridge of remembrance on a beautiful warm Chch evening and had a lovely night with beautiful  food. Be sure to book ahead here as it’s very popular and books out weeks ahead.  Great drinks menu too and the lovely Monarch bar next door if you have to wait for your table or want a pre dinner drink.

We ate here our first night in Christchurch, and it still remains one of my favorite meals in New Zealand following our one-month visit. The ambience was superb, in the hub of Christchurch's trendy shopping area, but set off on an upper level and extremely attractive decor. The food was interesting and varied - a perfect way to celebrate our first night in the country.
Great environment and great food. The wait staff was super helpful. Beautiful view of downtown.

Nicest Restaurant we've been to in a long while: upscale atmosphere, exceptionally nice ambiance w:super helpful staff.  We shared delicious plates and wine. would recommend the prawn dumplings, blue cod, tenderloin steak bites and curry pumpkin. We thought the curry pumpkin was the best!
Delicious Asian Fusion, beautiful decor and great service. A bit hard to find, back off Main Street up a flight of stairs.A bit pricey but I'd recommend.

Would have given 4 stars but the service was chaotic and made the dining experience stressful and rushed. All we wanted was a relaxing evening with good food.   The ambiance is beautiful. Romantic and very dimly lit. Lots of cozy seating. And the area of town has so many incredible food options. It's located on the second floor that you reach by stairs or lift.   The cocktail list was good. The food menu had many different choices and you're encouraged to share. Unfortunately our waitress didn't keep track of who ordered what and dishes come out at separate times. A server would just stand at the end of the table with a plate and yell "who ordered this?" And many wrong dishes were brought to our table.  My favorite dishes were the Akaroa Salmon (so good) and the shrimp dumplings (the broth was insanely delicious). I would order this dish every time. My friends liked the crawfish slider. The duck was extremely fatty and we didn't even finish it. We had even asked the waitress if it was fatty, and said it wasn't, which is what encouraged us to order it. I didn't like the scallops at all.

Service was okay.   The food was okay. Small portion sizes for the cost.  Shrimp dumpling in broth was good, but the size of the shrimp dumpling was too big.  A whole shrimp in a dumpling doesn't work for a shared plate.  Salmon was perfectly cooked.
We were initially skeptical due to the location in a tourist area.  We saw good reviews so tried it and very glad we did.  Every dish was fantastic!
Stylish restaurant with great service and food.  Four of us had a series of tasty beautiful small plates. The spinach leaf wrap was a mouthful of deliciousness and the crayfish slider was a real hit.

Our last night in New Zealand and we decided to try this place which was a short walk from our hotel.  We were not disappointed.  We did arrive early around 5:30pm so the place was quiet and we received attention promptly.  Try a glass of Cloudy Bay Brut! Excellent and better than some much higher priced bubbly I've had. Or the Daquiri which has a nice hint of cinnamon.  We had pork wontons which were served golden brown and hot with a sweet and savoury dipping sauce.  Then we had the Kung Pao Chicken (perfectly spiced and made with a rich dark soy base) and a Vegetarian Pad Thai...beware the chilies on the side are potent.  A side of rice and a few beers and all was great.  Friendly and attentive service also.  One of our favourite meals in New Zealand.

OK, we've had enough seafood for a little while, how about something different. Asian? Sure.  My family of four descended on this place, and did, I think, a great job of ordering (with a little advice from a very helpful waiter). We had crispy skin chicken: delicious, moist and tender with delicate crisp skin, great spices, and an insane vinegar broth to dip in. There was duck breast in red curry: nice thick, spicy sweet coconut curry, tender duck breast with good flavor, and not too much fat, plus nice peppers and veggies besides. And we did Szechuan lamb, which, honestly, was not very Szechuan, if you ask me? But was pretty delicious. Tender, good flavor and not gamey, good sauce. Just missing some Szechuan heat, or that tingly Szechuan peppercorn flavor I love so much. And we finished that all off with some of their sauteed greens. The American in me reads that to be "wilted spinach" - no thanks - but it's more Asian greens, more substantial than just wilted leaf lettuce, and they're quite nice. Fresh  tasting, crisp and not overcooked, nice stir fry sauce. An easy choice to accompany any dish if you're hungry for some greens, these kind of hit the spot.  Broken record - price very reasonable for what we got. Service was very friendly too. If you're looking for Asian in Christchurch, this is definitely worth checking out.

Went there as a group on Friday 15 June 2018. Wow!! the food was fabulous, I am pescatarian and there was plenty of choice. Others in the group were also very impressed. I do not eat out unless the food is comparable or better than I can cook. Big heads up to the Server, male with brown stylish hair and glasses. Very lucky to have such great staff. Thanks heaps.

And with a surname of Wong we are happy diners.  So it's not authentic Cantonese, Vietnamese, Malaysian, Singaporean, Korean or Thai.  What it is... a fusion of Asian flavors with local proteins and ingredients.  And in that sense of flavor spirit they do just fine thank you, dojei, kham Sam me da, khap Khun ma khap.  Strong bold and spicy flavors with generous NZ portions (in Asia they would be half the size).  No disrespect intended, but you can only eat so much Fish and Chips and lamb roast.    So a night or meal of a different flavor from another mother is a nice accent to the forever weekly manja monotone.  It ain't any one Asian food profiles but a melange of flavors.   And 9,000 or 12,000 km from the home country it's all good!  Deep fried Pork hock was outstanding!  With lettuce wraps and mayo/rice and Kim Chee purée?  Different take and One hock portion, needs one tummy plus to make this go away.  Clams with homemade XO?  Your got to be gutsy to pull this off.  And it works in a kiwi kind of way.  Even straight up chicken wings are as finger licking good as creamy spiced mayo dip can make it. Decent wine list with a thoughtful stab at a cocktail list.  We do agree service was a bit spotty, but in contrast to two other Sunday dining rooms that were empty this place was busy.   And we all know Sunday restaurant labor is a bit pricey to find.  So just order quick and think ahead for your next drink.  Be proactive with your ordering and enjoy a busy restaurant.  The kitchen rocks with a well timed wok and food comes quick and you just need to add your own lick!   Chefs here definitely have their groove on.    King of Sunday dining for us!  Long live the Snake!
We loved this place.  We happened to find it and were so happy.  We ate in the bar and had the most delicious food.  All the wait staff and bartender were exceptionally friendly and helpful!

My Thanksgiving (from the States) was a meal from here  and I had second and thirds just like Thanksgiving. stuffing my face with some Asian fusion deliciousness. No turkey here but I ate that chicken like it was my own turkey. I was starving so also ordered the stir fry Vegs that complemented the spicy chicken.  If this were Home, I would have licked my plates, but lady manners it was.   The bar area is great place to eat solo without the feeling of being uncomfortable in the main dining room. They have some outdoor seating as well and placed just right off the Main Street, thus a little quieter than one would expect.
Unfortunately we were there during the happy hour so the only vegetarian option that looked good was spring rolls. And we were super hungry. They were good. We didn't try anything else.
It is a ok restaurant. The Asian food is average. We ordered script chicken , it is dry and salty.

You can't research food in Christchurch without seeing King of Snake at the top of every list. And after traveling to Auckland first, I was a bit satiated on Asian food, but alas, we came to King of Snake. Wow...so glad we did! We enjoyed a reasonable lunch, sitting outside in the beautiful weather. We had the kung pao chicken and the kimchee dumplings. The food was SO GOOD. The chicken was a blend of breast and thigh, which I typically don't prefer, but King of Snake must have chargrilled or roasted it for the most delectable flavor    Overall, we were very pleased with the food scene in NZ, and King of Snake is an absolute must try. If it's a nice day and you want to skip the rigamarole of a fancy dinner, the lunch menu offers a great variety, and the outdoor seating is limited and lovely.
This is a must visit restaurant while in ChCh, a really cool bar area, and just delicious food.  Really really good, love this place and we go for dinner here whenever we are in New Zealand.

Went for my wedding anniversary. Food was great but for the price I would expect a better sitting experience. We were at a small table right up against a bigger one so that the persons chair was almost hitting ours- to get to his seat my husband had to navigate around other tables first. And the chairs were less than comfortable. Would recommend the food but was not a romantic dinner for me!! Luckily The Last Word was too far to walk to for a more cosy talk and drink.

Do you like Asian? Do you enjoy trying new flavors? If yes, then this is a must visit restaurant in Christchurch.  We both had a spinach leaf salad (it's one leaf with 16 ingredients you roll and eat). It was small but amazing. We savored every bite. Kung Pao Chicken we decided to share. It was yummy and of medium heat (unless you eat one of the peppers in the stir fry). Our "happy ending" was the lime pudding dessert. This was another choice that did not disappoint. It was tangy, but not too much, and delicious. The chef in this restaurant is fantastic.   We were full with these items but if you are extra hungry you'll probably want to add in another appetizer or another meal to share. We were not too hungry as our eating schedule was off kilter due to traveling and time zones.   If I were to visit again, I would be happy ordering these same items again.

Cool, hip place with a delicious menu. I wish I could have tried more plates. I was searching for spice and the King delivered.  I tried the Thai spicy chile prawns and was not disappointed. These come with a side of white rice and level 10 flavor.   Paired with a dragon martini- delicious. Make sure you have a side of water ready for the prawn!
Loved that food   there's a special atmosphere inside ..it's nice for a random dinner or even romantic date. I'm happy to recommend and for sure will come back :) Thank you
Food was good, great atmosphere. Sweet and sour pork and fried rice balls really good. Not a big fan of the yellow fin tuna salad.
Very trendy place (we were the ones most under dressed) with excellent cocktails, great food, and a nice atmosphere.  This was our most expensive meal in New Zealand, but worth it!
I found this to be very average at best. A poor attempt at fusion & I was disappointed

Amazing meal! An absolute must for your dining in Christchurch. Great service, atmosphere and food. We went with the recommendations of the staff and had an amazing selection of food. The Bo Ssam pork hock is just the best!
I like some of the dishes here like the panang beef cheek, but the restaurant is loud and crowded, and the service is hit and miss.

Nice modern Asian fusion restaurant. Original and modern Asian bites with a lively atmosphere. To recommend oysters, duck and pork belly. Very tasteful dishes with very very fresh products  (same day butchered). Friendly and fast service.

The worst service I have ever had in any restaurant....ever. We were the second table of the night to be seated and watched as every other table filled up, had orders taken, and food delivered...all the while our menus remained in front of us. After 40 minutes we engaged a passing waiter to be told "this isn't my section", a second waiter was stopped and we were told "sorry mate I'm busy". A trip up to the front desk to the greeter/seater lady was ever less fruitful, begging to have our order taken I was dismissed with a rude, snide attitude...it was another 10 minutes before our table received any attention. The food is good, but not worth the price or putting up with rude treatment.
Really nice place with good design, warm atmosphere. Asian cousine, rather spicy.   Good choice of cocktails, tapas, wine etc.
It's o.k .Asian inspired restaurant.service was good ,the place is nice,it also has a little Lounge were you can have some some platters.

A group of three of us had a meal here on a Monday night and it was packed.  A very nice meal and great service combined to make this a memorable evening.  Three small and three large plates and we struggled to finish and none of us are "Bird Like" eaters.  Very nice.

Not a bad restaurant, food is pretty good (Asian inspired), but the wait staff (or at least the one I had) don't really compliment the restaurant. Very slow at bringing water (or topping up an empty glass of water) and bringing drinks or asking if I would like another. Also no new glass with a new drink? It's the little things...

Book ahead if you want to be guaranteed a table. Even on a tuesday night it is busy and we were given a two hour dining window. I hate dining windows but understand why a busy restaurant insists on them. I do give KoS credit for letting us know about it when making the reservation though - at two recent restaurants I have been to we were evicted from out seats with no warning before even getting to desserts!   I have to comment on the decor, which is amazing. The wallpapers are bright and vivd and really add to the ambience of the place. Food is asian fusion style. Definitely order the spinach leaf wrap things, they are one of my favourite things on the menu. Its an incredible mouthful of fresh bursting flavour. The dumplings in broth are disappointing and bland. Other dishes I enjoyed are the moong dal salad and the penang curry. I normally avoid ordering dessert at asian style restaurants but took a gamble on the mango tart tartin. It was pretty good if not mind-blowing. There is an extensive cocktail menu and you are sure to find something you like. I do agree with a previous reviewer who said the signature King of Snake cocktail is not that good - I like ginger a lot but this was just completely overwhelming and almost undrinkable. The service is great and attentive, no issues here.

This is a decent restaurant with good but uninspired food. I had two appetizers and two cocktails, all of which were very one note. Their signature cocktail, the King of Snakes, has the overwhelming taste of ginger. Their coffee cocktail, recommended by the bartender, tasted like an overly sweet starbucks frappe. The two dishes I had, fried squid and pork belly, were uninteresting, but not necessarily poorly cooked. Overall, the experience at the restaurant was underwhelming but not bad. I would not look to go back, but I would also not complain if my friends wanted to go.

This really is a cool place. From the moment you enter you realise this is high range Asian food. Would recommend the sticky need wontons and the spinach leaf. Both are a fab way to start the night. Matched with a glass of Moët (yes they do it by the glass). Great service felt like a celebrity.

I would definitely classify this as more a restaurant than a bar. The food is really good, a tapas theme with Asian infusion but overall healthy food. The bar is very trendy and the bartenders are pro but the bar is relatively small so it's more of a pre-dinner drink bar or after work drinks maybe even pre-drinks before hitting the town. Not a bar scene per-se and they probably close around 11.
Food was really good, can recommend the lamb, duck strifry and the steak. What was really poor was the service. Booking was for 8.15pm but never managed to even get desert or coffee before 10pm.

King of Snake is an interesting environment and a welcome change from your run of the mill Thai restaurants. While the food was good, my experience was marred by the most unfriendly, rude hostess I have ever encountered.   Ionara (Brazilian by her accent) excelled in ensuring that my evening was unpleasant. I made the unfortunate error of enthusiastically ordering two entrees so that I could experience as much as possible. Unfortunately I was not informed that all meals are designed to be shared. As I was dining alone (on a business trip) it became apparent I would not be able to handle the two large entrees and a main. I politely requested that one of my untouched entrees be returned.  Ionara proceeded to inform me in no uncertain terms that as I had ordered the meal, my options were to pay for it and take it away or leave it and still pay for it. Her demeanour was rude and unapologetic.  I don't think hospitality was a particularly prudent choice of career for this hostess and King of Snake would be well advised to take heed. I doubt whether I was the first customer to experience this treatment and I probably won't be the last.
Service is excellent by any standard. Asian fusion food is excellent by Kiwi standard.  Atmosphere is light and fun. Go for it.

We enjoyed both of our meals at King of Snake as we dined there on Friday and were back again on Thursday. I will start out by saying that the service was very good and the staff was more than accommodating. The seating arrangements are a little odd so make sure that you specify the table you want when making reservations. If you are going on a date you would need to specify that you would like a table for two inside the main dining area, otherwise you could wind up in the enclosed terrace area or at a shared table which always irks me. The food was good although my girlfriend was much more impressed than I was (thus the two nights in one week). The servers are fully knowledgable and are more than willing to assist you in deciding which main me be best suited to your tastes. It was east to see why this is the most talked about restaurant in Christchurch.

I like this place.  I wouldn't call it special, because I've been to some very special places... But it's really good.  Service was friendly and good, food was prepared very well.  I'm only giving it 3 stars because, as I said... I didn't feel like it was special...  Perhaps, I am being unfair, as I am comparing the restaurant to some of my more expensive experiences - That isn't to detract from the quality of the restaurant,  just comparing it to my expectations.  I did really like the ambience.  And the wall paper was something quite unique.  I'd go back.  Probably with more reasonable expectations.

We went to KOS on the recommendation of our hotel receptionist. Definitely come early and make reservations as they were fully booked at 6 pm. Service was very nice. They have a fairly short menu divided into meats (seafood, chicken, beef, pork) and vegetables. This place is definitely a bit pricey for the portion size. They tout that you can share the dishes which is true but you won't have any left overs. Now having eaten all types of Asian food from various countries it takes a lot to impress me. The curry vegetable dish ( $30) was really good, with a sweet savory flavor. The vegetables they chose for the curry ( pumpkin, baby corn, green beans, asparagus) are fresh and blend well with the curry. The other dish we ordered was the sirloin which was very tender but I felt did not stand out compared to other Asian dishes I've had for the price you pay. ($26) Overall, a good choice for dinner although you will pay for it.

Asian fusion...your name is King of Snake! this place has officially taken over as the best asian fusion in my book from some very highly vaunted places.  Modern, casual yet elegant is the definition of the interior.  The oyster starters were just perfectly briny morsels that were contrasted well with the black pepper vinaigrette.  This begged us to move on to the mandarin marinated tuna which in the hands of lesser cooks could be a textural disaster, but here it is firm yet infused well with the marinade, the pumpkin yellow curry was a wonderful amalgamation of thai flavors and a touch of Indianness with the cashews and the stir fried cumin lamb a fantastic meaty meal with bits of char on the lamb from the high heat stir fry working well with the toasty almost mild pungency of the cumin. This dish reminded me of a similar dish I had in Beijing and invoked a flood of memories of that trip, yet took me in a new direction.  A nice wine list rounds off this place.  I thought the Marlborough Gruner Vertliner to be a particularly good accompaniment to my food and quite well priced.  Go go go to this place!!
Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. Prices seem to be going up but they're competitive for value through quality!

King of Snake is amazing. Great staff, great food, great drinks, great atmosphere. There is only one catch... Everyone knows how great it is!  You MUST visit if you are in Christchurch. My tip is book ahead, or be relaxed and happy to have a few drinks in the bar area until a table comes up (this is not a bad option at all - they have some great local wines and craft beers, as we'll as killer cocktails!). Even mid-week, this place is PACKED.   Highlights are pippies in XO sauce, the tuna salad with coconut, the duck and lycée salad... Oh man it's all good!

Um, yeah, insanely good. Usually a description of "Asian fusion" send me running in the other direction, but on a cold night in Christchurch I needed to get warm so in we went. Staff were fantastic, cocktails were amazing, food was delicious. We went two nights in a row because it was so great - everything we tried was excellent. Probably best to either book, or be patient because this place is SUPER busy!

Great and friendly service. The waitress gave us great recommendations. Better than any Asian fusion restaurant I have been to before. Try the sweet and sour pork, nothing like you have ever experienced!

We booked our wedding anniversary dinner, and it was a fantastic evening. Lovely food, nice people, and generally nice evening. They made the extra effort to decorate our dessert plate, but it actually said "Happy Birthday" :) As luck would have it, our wedding is actually the birthday of the dog who brought us together. It was not a wasted effort!  One thing prevented me from giving them 5 stars... their eftpos machine presented me with tipping options! It was a very common thing in North America, which I actually found very handy. It was the first time I have ever seen it in NZ and, for some reason, it really irked me.
Too expensive for takeaway food

I've been here maybe 5 times now. Recently I brought some friends that were visiting from Australia to eat here and did not have the best experience. First off, the young waitress accidentally entered the wrong order in, we ordered the sushi+sashimi platter (as it had nigiri and miso soup), but were given the sashimi platter (35$ more expensive). The waitress had confirmed this order when we were ordering as there is only 1 miso soup and she asked if we wanted to order more as we had 3 people. We could tell she was very flustered with her mistake so was happy to pay for the wrong dish despite it being more expensive however asked if we could still get 1 miso soup and 1 rice as that's what was in the original order. The older waitress/manager? then said she was happy to provide free miso but wanted to charge extra for 1 bowl of rice and hinted that it was our fault for not confirming the order when it arrived. Mid way during the meal a homeless woman walked in and tried to get a seat with the staff. When that didn't work she came to our table to try sit with us in the spare chair we had. I looked to the staff to try get some help and saw 4 of them just standing at the counter watching this happen. You are responsible for the safety of your guests that is in your establishment I am so disappointed.

Everything on this plate was so fresh and vibrant — from the sweet prawns to the buttery salmon and creamy oysters. The scallop was perfectly sliced and the plating was absolutely stunning, like a piece of art. You can really taste the quality of the seafood. Highly recommend if you love sashimi and want something that feels both luxurious and satisfying!

Food is fantastic, service is awesome, but the place feels shabby, crowded and noisy. Chairs and tables look like they were sourced at the dump. Prices are very high and portions are, well, smaller than expected - something the menu says should feed 2, 3 or 4 people I could easily devour alone and then ask for more. Still, probably the best Japanese restaurant in Chch.
Outstanding service and quality dishes!!

We were lucky to get a last minute same day reservation for Kinji.  Small, unassuming restaurant.  Friendly service.  Incredible food.  Sashimi was very fresh.  Umeshu was refreshing after a long day of driving.  We left very happy.

Service was stellar at this establishment. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and made our visit very enjoyable. Based on atmosphere and service I'd give this place 5 stars.  Based on food I'd say 3-4 stars. We ordered a salmon avocado roll which was delicious and I recommend ordering. I also ordered udon which was good but I don't fancy shiitake mushrooms which made the broth less desirable. The noodles are thinner than normal and the portion is pretty small so I'd recommend complimenting it with a roll. The fried tuna roll was my least favorite order because it was hard to chew and mostly rice. My favorite was the kfc chicken. It was hot, moist, and crispy and all it needed was a little salt.   Overall, I thought this place was satisfying and enjoyed my experience here. If you're looking for excellent service, decent sushi, and decent prices I'd have a seat.

Visited Kinji with my partner and absolutely loved it. For a little restaurant it was really busy. The service was spot on and checked on us often. And the food, delicious I. We ordered the 10 piece nigiri set, deep fried soft shelled crab, octopus and venison tataki. We were satisfied with every dish. Highly recommend to anyone looking for top grade Japanese food in Christchurch.

Not sure if people in New Zealand are able to fully enjoy sushi at it's best due to lack of locations but this place was just ok.  The sashimi is actually great but the rolls are awfully made.  There is a lot of rice and very little fish in the rolls.  They did not offer much variety in rolls and when we asked for a spicy tuna roll, which is fairly common, we had to tell them what was in it.  If you are really in the mood for sushi, I would stick with mostly sashimi in this place, but if you're leaving in a few days for a trip to Australia, just wait out the cravings.

I came here with three friends on a recent saturday night. They get very busy so I recommend booking well in advance.  Decor is nice and understated, didn't stand out particularly. What you are here for is the food which is amazing.  We ordered a lot of food with the plan to place it in the middle and share it, allowing us to sample a good range. Our waitress seemed a bit shocked by how much we ordered and actually advised us to order less but we plowed ahead (in retrospect she was probably right..) Food comes out fresh as it is prepared and as such is always hot and perfectly cooked. It was all timed perfectly so that as one plate was finished, the next one was coming out.  We started with edamame which is a classic we all enjoy. Highly recommend the deep fried takoyaki (octopus ball) which was incredible. I'd never had them before and we ordered it on the recommendation of my asian companions but would definitely get it again. The spider rolls (soft shell crab sushi) were another standout. Amazing taste and presentation. For mains the particular highlights were the K.F.C (we ordered a second plate of this), and the specials menu and sizzling dishes are well worth a look. The only dish we didn't enjoy was the eggplant gratin.  We finished this meal extremely full and contented. Didn't look at the desert menu.   Service is good and attentive but our waitress did forget to bring us any water during our meal. It can be expensive if you order a lot of dishes but well worth it for a special night out. I think we spent about $80 each, without alcoholic drinks included.   Bottom line: for interesting, unique, and delicious Japanese food in Christchurch this is the place to come.

Best sushi I had a New Zealand. Very fresh and good quality product. Unfortunately we didn't have a reservation but manage to have take away. It was great! Highly recommend if you are in town and would like to try best sushi New Zealand has to offer. The Tuna sashimi just melt in your mouth!
I hope these guys reopen, I love their pork lemongrass with chilli

Should be permanently closed. Once ordered the fried rice and was completely disappointed — only about five tiny pieces of meat, each sliced in half again, mostly just plain rice. Definitely not worth the price for what you get.
The tastiest vegetarian tofu meal I've had for a long time and well priced. Scrummy!

Have tried ordering from Uber Eats and Door Dash, cancelled my order on Uber Eats, did not confirm order after 10 mins of placing the order on Door Dash, tried to call them, they did not pick up the call... Never going to try again...
50% of the time my order is cancelled. Even 1hr before closing. Adjust your hours if you can’t commit. Very annoying.
Had our first takeaway meal from there.  Great friendly and helpful service, tasty food.   Give it a go!
