Garlic chips. I rest my case.
Bite after bite… lost self-control with these Taiwanese fried chicken noodles! There are other beef noodle shops on the list, but their fried chicken is unbeatable!  More food finds on IG: @ida_chch

I've visited Taiwan many times to try their authentic local cuisine. I especially love their salt and pepper chicken, beef brisket rice, beef noodles, spicy fried chicken rice, and stinky tofu—they're all so delicious!
Beef brisket rice is a must-order!  It's so delicious!

IF I CAN GIVE MORE THAN 5 STARS YOU GUYS DESERVED 50 STARSS!!  I forgot to ask the server's name that was serving my table, I came there twice and he served me twice and he's an absolute gem to have around!  It was a farewell and a birthday party for 1 of my friend, everyone loved it! Glad we chose Koji to have lunch! So sorry if we confused or delayed any service tho as we were very wishy-washy about the lunch selection.  Drinks are sooo pretty and delicious! Food is amazing! If we have more room we could've ordered more!  Thank you for having us around and definitely will come back!
Awesome place, awesome vibes, quick service, for an affordable price, 5/5. Would come back again

Going to be honest. I was really looking forward to coming here for the 2nd time and trying the more expensive menu. All I can say is that it was an entire let down. It took over 50 minutes from when our booking was to be given the ordering sheet. It then was another 20 before we started seeing food brought out. Then after only 40 minutes of eating we were told our time was up and we had to put our last orders in. Koji is meant to be a great experience where you can slowly eat small portions over a longer period and have a great night and really appreciate the food. All we got to do was pay $75 to be rushed through my food. I didnt get a chance to order desert and overall it was a waste of money. I know I wasn't the only one at the birthday dinner left disappointed. .  Can't say I recommend it based off that.
Group of 7 loved it!
No time limit, you can take your time tasting every dish they offer. You get your money’s worth.
Awesome experience
Great place! Value for the amount you can eat

We came to Kong last year and had a great night! Dj, dancing and great cocktails. Tonight we found the bar to be super quiet, no DJ and were advised they removed dj element some time ago. Still great drinks and great for a quiet before or after dinner drink but nothing exciting.
Great vibe, awesome cocktail specials! Enjoy stopping in here over the weekend with friends!
Really friendly staff and great cocktails. A little on the pricey side, but everything we tried was delicious and the service was amazing.
AMAZING the bartender was super informative and friendly and all the drinks were superb

Bought the sweet and spicy fried chicken, was really good! Staff was friendly too.  But was very disappointed with the soybean paste and spicy beef stews. The taste was a bit off and unlike the usual Korean stews.

The taste was just so-so. The exorbitant surcharge was no different from the deception. I came across this restaurant with the highest charges in New Zealand, but the service and price were far from worth it. I really wanted to eat potato and pork rib soup, so I specifically took the bus. No one greeted me upon entering; I had to be the one to greet them and ask for the menu at the counter. The soup and kimchi were very salty, and I drank a lot of water. The soup had an excessive amount of oil, unlike what I've had in Korea. Although one of the servers said they were asking if I wanted more side dishes, that was the only good thing, as Korean restaurants generally offer free refills of appetizers, and the rice was also free. However, I was quite disappointed with the final bill because the surcharge was a hefty 2.91 NZD! I only ordered one serving of soup and rice, and while the price wasn't cheap, I could understand it in a foreign country. But this was the most expensive surcharge I've ever seen at a restaurant in New Zealand… In conclusion, it's not worth taking the bus just to eat here.
The best Korean restaurant in Christchurch! The taste is authentic. The service is excellent! Will definitely come back next time we're in Christchurch!
I had such a wonderful time with my friends! The food was absolutely delicious, especially the deep-fried prawns, seafood pancake, and stir-fried chicken. It was truly a delightful experience!
so yummy :)) love coming here, one of my favourite spots in christchurch for korean food
It was an awesome experience and great food and friendly service
I always love eating here. Min and his staff are always so friendly and respectful. The food is brilliant value for money and delicious, with large portions, sides and drink deals.
Kimbap, jjamppong, jjajang, sweet and sour pork
The kimbap is so good, the noodles are tasty, and the service is friendly.
It's OK but not great. Average Korean Chinese restaurant.

The pork cutlet at this place is really bad. It looks like it's frozen, and the sauce is tasteless. The jjambbong and jjajangmyeon are just okay. The fried squid isn't that great either. I don't know what kind of sauce they use for the tangsuyuk.
Pretty authentic Korean food. Shrimp fried rice was very nice. The decor made me felt like I was back in Korea somewhere at Gangneung
Family-style Korean restaurant. Very authentic jjajangmyeon...yummm

If you're in Christchurch and craving authentic Korean food, this restaurant is a must-try. The Korean black bean noodles (jjajangmyeon) are hands down the highlight—rich, savory, and perfectly cooked. Every dish I've tried here has been delicious, with fresh ingredients and fantastic flavors. The service is friendly, and the atmosphere is welcoming, making it a great spot for any occasion. Highly recommend checking it out!

The Tom Yum tofu was good. The Tom Kha was not worth getting. The soup base seemed to be only coconut milk, and was overly sweet. The fresh spring rolls were good. A little pricey compared to similar restaurants in CHC.
Friendly service and delicious food
Great service, food was excellent will definitely come back again.

Kum Pun Thai – 5 Super friendly staff and great service. The Pad Med Ma-Muang stir-fry was absolutely delicious  — one of the best I’ve had. Spring rolls could be better (and more for the price), but overall the experience was fantastic, so I’ll let that slide .  Would love to see later hours on weekends given the casino is right across the road, but still a top spot I’ll be coming back to!

Food is always good and have dined here a few times.  But disappointed last night.  Table booked for 7.30pm.  After 9.15pm no customer service offered to see if more drinks or deserts required.  Just told at 9.20pm that they were closing in 10 minutes.  So, we paid and left.  Not the Friday night dining experience we hoped for.
Kumo Is Very good. I Previously left a negative review but I have been back many Times and I think they Have some of the best sushi
Great atmosphere,  great food!!
Not worth the price especially the mille cake.

I ususally order via Uber. I love their sushi and the pancake is legendery!! However, once the cream of the desert was expired and they usually skip putting chopsticks and no soy sauce at all... It does cost a lot and all orders deserve some chopsticks and soy...

Had never been to a sushi train before and was a really cool experience.  The food was really nice, however the prices could have been slightly better displayed. Mocktails were unknown flavors but nice.  Overall, lesson learned that having a calculator handy to add up the prices as you go could help to keep within a set budget - the money does add up fairly quickly.

La Ruby is our favourite takeaway in Christchurch. I figured it's time to leave a review! Consistently delicious, great portion sizes and easy to order and pickup (best to use the door around the side to go straight to the bar).
Best thai food in Christchurch.
Just ok, much better Thai in Christchurch.
The service and the setting is top notch, menu authentic
Great take away meal. Approval from a tough crowd so will be our new local Thai option.
Loved the takeaways so decided to eat in! Our fave … red curry & pad Thai. But everything I’ve tried is super yummy. And really big servings …
Best Thai in Christchurch, I reckon.
Best go to Thai out east. Duck curry and chicken special outstanding. Excellent friendly service from the restaurant team
We both enjoyed everything about our dinner out at your restaurant.  We will return thankyou
Been here a few times. Always a great experience.
Fish Steaks on hot platter

6 November 2026, arrived at 6.30pm. Waited for a friend to make up 7 people for dinner. A number of people in the resturant, but not full.  Had to ask the server to get us some drinks. I had to ask the server to take our entree orders, which arrived 10 mnutes later. More people came into the resturant, we ordered our mains. The other groups were served entrees and mains before we got mains.  The worst service l had received, NEVER GOING BACK  I told the service staff of their horrible service and they didnt seem to care. They must be making truck loads of profit to ignore us the way they did. GOODBYE, NEVER AGAIN.
Best meal, service and ambience we have had in 10 years in New Zealand. Staff were wonderful, and the food was just outstanding. Fabulous.
Amazing mango lasi and food paired with lovely service! We had no booking and they were very accomodating. Would definitely come back again to try more of their food.
Excellent food and service and very friendly, efficient staff.

Very high standard restaurant with cozy and discrete booths, really helpful staff and jazzy music. The food is delicious ! I had a Fish & Chips and it was crispy and tender with gurnard fish. Exquisite ! My partner had the ribs and they smelt so good !!! A really nice restaurant that we love, we will be back again !
Thaifood hit n miss, bland mince meat rice, under cooked seafood noodle.. fried rice not bad.

Another one of those great finds....that you didn't realize you were looking for! A large food court set up, hidden in a large shed, at the rear of a carpark from one street. But on the street, from the other side. A great cosmopolitan croud, all venues were packed and all seats taken. A variety of cuisines all under the one roof and a couple of boutique bars to boot!
Super food and atmosphere
Food stalls. Got many things: from burger, bbq, asian, drinks (alkohol/non), ice cream.  Matcha is proper matcha.   Had steak n burger from diff stalls.  Grill pinapple from the steak is good.
Kao soi is delicious, very nice service kob khun kha :)

This is the best place to go for dinner if you’re with a group of people as there are so many options! There is something for everyone. I have tried 4 of the places inside now and it never disappoints.
Great food and atmosphere!   Beautiful day here in Christchurch.   There's so many choices you can't go wrong
It is a food court filled with so many amazing restaurants! Everything looked good. I went to the Asian one and it was fire!!!!   There is seating, bathrooms and filter water :)

Doesn't look like much when you walk pass but definitely worth popping in at this place. We had lunch at El Fogón Grill and  the steak and chicken was so delicious and juicy. Ankush gave us excellent service.Tx

When your part can't agree on a cuisine, this is a great solution. Multiple eateries under one roof makes for a bowl of ramen and a  margarita, or ca pizza & sushi. The process are reasonable, and the outdoor seating was lovely. We had starters here, then on to bigger things. However, you could spend a lot of time exploring eateries here, and leave satisfied.
Little High Eatery was a great find. We stumbled across it after having already eaten lunch unfortunately. But we sampled a few things. Lots of options. Beautiful space.

There is not enough seating at all, and after all of this time that Little High has been opened, you'd think it would quieten down and there would be more seating available, but there never is. I've gone there at least 5 times and had to walk away and find a random restaurant at the last minute due to not being able to get a seat.   The range of food is good, although it would be nice to see more gluten free options in the Asian cuisine food stalls.

A great find in Christchurch! There was an option here for everyone. I ended up going with the Thai restaurant and tried their Pad Thai. I was surprised that they put cauliflower in it, that's not something they do back home in Seattle!! But it tasted great, I just wish it had been more spicy

This is a building with several restaurants and shared seating.  This review applies just to the space.  It's a fun set of restaurants with several choices in different styles.  Getting a seat is pretty competitive, we had to orbit a bit to get a spot to sit.  Probably a better choice when it's nice outside and the patio seating is also available -- it was raining and that eliminated a percentage of the available seating.  The signage is subtle so you may need to look around a bit to find it.

We had a fantastic meal here with our friends and our kids. We kind of got some of everything and had quite the feast - it was really fun.   Highlights were a meat plate, dumpling sampler, matcha soft serve, noodles and the apple mango rolls.   Skip the margaritas - no alcohol in them. I paid $20NZ for a large - which it was - but it was pretty much like flavored ice.
Not visible from High Street, at least when I went. You need to walk into the building to find it. Listen for the music. Really great place with lots of food choices, but not much seating indoors.

Little High Eatery is a wonderful, casual area of several small restaurants covering various cuisines and sharing a warm, lively space.  I remember places focused on burgers, pizza, and Japanese, as well as a bar, but there were four or more additional restaurants.  (Thai, Chinese, Latin American, and desserts, maybe?)  There's also a Malaysian restaurant just outside.  I've had very good burgers and pizza here, and I would definitely come again for those or to try more of the excellent-looking places.  There's plenty of indoor and outdoor seating, but the large crowds here do mean that these fill up.  This is especially true of the indoor area during the winter, but assorted heaters keep at least some of the outdoor tables mostly comfortable in the chill.  A very good musician was performing on one of the nights I came here, and nice recorded background music was playing on the other night.

It's nice to have a lot of choices here.  Everyone can choose what they're in the mood for.  We tried the pizza place, which was really good.  It is a little crowded, even during off-peak times, so be prepared for that.

Eightgrains:  I ordered two takeaway waffles, one with vanilla icecream, and one with matcha icecream. After waiting about 30 minutes for my order, I asked how long it would take and was told it was "on it's way", however about 10 minutes later, an employee approached me and asked what I had ordered. After telling her I ordered two waffles, she proceeded to look around and then come back only to say that they would get them started. About 10 minutes later I was handed a bag with the two waffles and the icecream, and when I opened it, there was no matcha. At this point I had waited 50 minutes for two $12 waffles and one of the orders wasn't even correct. The waffles also seemed undercooked and soggy.  The employees were nice enough to add popcorn and some syrups because of how long we'd been waiting, but it definitely doesn't make up for everything.  I understand that when working with food it is easy for orders to be forgotten and occasionally messed up but I'm just very sad.  To boot, when not ordered takeaway, it comes with a waffle cone, but there was no waffle cone. It would just be nice to be told that there is no waffle cone if you order it take away.  I am let down because all of my previous experiences at eightgrains have been wonderful, and after this I am unsure if I would return.  :(

Exceptionally good and an excellent value!  Bacon Bros Burgers are located INSIDE 'The Little High Eatery' which has multiple fine eating establishments.  It's on High Street, but it's a little hard to find because you're looking for the Bacon Bros sign which is hidden, so look for the 'The Little High Eatery' sign (see the picture I posted...)  The whole eatery is more like OFF an alley off High Street and is easily obscured by some taller buildings.  Doesn't matter, FIND IT, it's worth it.  'The Little High Eatery' has about a dozen really cool, bohemian, artesian places.  Always better to support local than chains, go get out of Bubba Gump or the Olive Garden, and go to Bacon Bros.  Seriously kickin' burger, cooked perfectly, all the ingredients were fresh, the brioche bun soft but slightly chewy at the same time, and some nice slab bacon on top.  Very reasonably priced.  ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!!  If I lived in Wellington I'd be a serious regular and they'd know my name within a couple weeks.  It's a serious burger done right...

This food court is a hidden gem in Christchurch. I was in the city for 2 days and went both. The miso and tonkotsu ramen from Sushi soldier were delicious. On top of that, the parrillada for one from El Fogon was really tasty.

Review for eightgrain, the Chinese dumpling place. Pan fried red wine brisket dumplings are fantastic. Plump and lots of meat. The crystal shrimp dumplings are har gow and are tasty. I like the thicker skin on these. The XLB are ok. Skin is too thick and breaks because they have the dumplings touch each other!! Ugh. Flavor is good though. Pork belly bun is bad - pork belly is dry and way way too much peanut on them. If you want pork belly, get a Bacon Brothers burger next door.
If you're interested in a great lunch for a good price, come here.  Clean restaurant. Service is good.  Food is very good!
Great Indian food, good staff and a wonderful service. It would be hard to find better in Christchurch.

Excellent Indian food in the strip mall by the airport. Seriously enjoyed lunch here. Got the vegetarian Thali and it was rich with flavor and ingredients tasted fresh. We got boomeranged back to Christchurch on our flight to McMurdo, so heading back for dinner tonight.

Eat here!  I tried the Onion Bhaji as a Starter, I was not sure what to expect and they were delicious!  It was like an onion potato pancake but better.  Portions for take away are great. It's a lovely place to dine in as well.  I eat here every time I come through Christchurch and I have never been disappointed.  If you enjoy Indian food and a good atmosphere this is your place.  There is usually a lunch special as well!
Great service, everyone was super friendly and helpful. Service is fast and coping and very great. The food taste was also so good.
Great food, great price! I've been once so far on my trip to Christchurch, and I have to go again before I leave. It's wonderful!
The food is terrible. I had a butter chicken and it did not taste anything like a butter chicken.  I threw away most of the meal. I will certainly not be eating here again.
Fabulous full flavoured curries, garlic nan, great taste. Never disappointed!
Nice indian all types of foods and good service.
The food was good. A little pricey but food is generally pricey in NZ. Service was great. Staff were attentive and welcoming. The atmosphere takes you back to India.
Update**  Great food. Great service. Yummy. Maybe pass on the app. Thanks
Over the years I've dined here many times. Every time I've dined in the restaurant it's been first class food service and atmosphere. Well done!

Visiting Christchurch from Norway and thought of stopping by to have some indian food to see the difference in how they make it here. Had a lovely experience and would recommend this place to people looking for a quality experience. Shivanshi was a great server who was friendly and polite! Had a really nice time with my family here.
Palak Paneer was was amazing. Friendly staff and nice place.

Little India at Spitfire Square were excellent hosts. They looked after our cricket team really well, and everyone left completely satisfied. Lots of food, great hosting and all the food was tasty. Highly recommend!

We had dinner here today and unfortunately found a hair in our food. The taste itself was below average, and the overall experience was quite disappointing. Even after mentioning the issue to the staff, there was no apology or discount offered, which was surprising. We were really expecting better food quality and hygiene, especially from a reputed restaurant chain. Hope they take this feedback seriously and improve their standards.
Very good food and service. Liked Chicken chilli and spring roll.
I had such a great meal that I went back a second time, definitely would recommend
Great meal!  Friendly and kind staffs:) thumbs up for them!

Very friendly staff, we ordered shared platter and rice, not knowing it was an entree and didn't come with curry. They were kind enough to give us some curry to have with the meats. Highly recommended!
Fantastic!  Great location and the date Scones  were exceptional. Love how it is right next to the river. Highly recommended

This place was so good we kept coming back! Staff was efficient, kind, and accommodating. If you're in the area and don't know what to do about breakfast/brunch, immediately stop pondering and come here! The food is SO delicious. I had their shakshuka (without meat), chillis scrambled eggs with lemon ricotta, which was such a unique and delicious blend of flavors, and their green smoothie. All were super tasty and I thought the prices were reasonable. Their plating is also top-notch and the interior is super cute and instagramable. Went here 3 times and never regretted it!

Just passing through Christchurch and found this gem. Delicious food and great service. We shared the porridge and eggs Benedict they call Little Benny. Both were excellent. I was worried the chipotle hollandaise might be too spicy but it was perfect. You won't regret eating here.
Outstanding breakfast for such a small out of the way place.  Put it on your list when traveling to Christchurch.

Tasty brunch. I went solo so only took about 15m to get a table. The grilled halloumi is salty, delicious and accompanied by great veggies. A little pricey and service is on the slower side but had a great time.

We went to Little Pom's as part of our brekkie from the B&B next door and what a delight it was from fresh flowers on the table to the bright and airy space and the open kitchen to watch the chefs prepare your breakfast. The eggs done perfectly and coffee brewed hot was just what we needed to start our day. Servers were friendly and as we were from out of country they spent some extra time giving us some history of Christchurch and things to do and see. Loved it!

I had high hopes after hearing recommendations from friends. The service was slow, the kitchen had run out of the ingredients for the haloumi dish, and my coffee order was lukewarm. Nevertheless, there's plenty of parking on site and Pomeroys is next door if beer is more your thing
The combination of high-quality coffee and grilled halloumi was excellent, and the warm, cozy interior blended perfectly with the friendly staff. I’ll definitely be visiting again.

The food was beautifully prepared, crispy, and delicious. The cashier and barista were both very nice. Because I was in a rush to pick up my child, I only ordered some easy-to-take-away items. I plan to come back in a couple of days to try their signature dishes. The ambiance is great, and the semi-outdoor area is very convenient for guests with strollers and wheelchairs! Highly recommended!
Always great food, coffee and service here.
Awesome! Delicious food & coffee. 100% recommend
You guys absolutely nailed it. Great food, service was fast and friendly, the overall decor to staff uniforms. All of it ticked the box.
Have been regularly going to Little Poms for about seven years now. The staff are amazing, the food incredible and coffee great. One of the best cafes in Christchurch!
Cozy vibe, tasty food, and friendly staff   Nice place to hang out
The Amazing and delicious food I ever had.  good service and demon he the best server  Thanx  And want to visit again this restaurant
My all-time favorite restaurant! Amazing service, big portions, tasty food, and such a nice, elegant setting!
Delicious food. Super fresh and burning hot (temperature) when it gets to the table. The duck was impeccable and the orange chicken I’ll order again for sure. And super friendly service too!
Rude lady
I enjoyed the food yesterday with my friend,  so yummy, beautiful ambiance n friendly staffs.

The beef brisket noodle soup was nice. And the black sugar sweet teas were incredibly good. That atmosphere on  a Wednesday night was nice and quiet with only a few other tables. The staff are kind and helpful.

I rarely write reviews especially if I didn't quite like the place...I'd just not go back & never recommend it to anyone. But I'm doing this more for the Asian newbies in Chch who are homesick & craving for some great Asian meals! Was very excited when I found this place especially when I'm missing good Taiwanese food (though I'm not Taiwanese, I've had very good ones when I lived in the US & Singapore). Quite surprising their Facebook page many had given rave reviews. Which has now taught me a good lesson - DO NOT judge a place by it's good reviews LOL! The restaurant itself was nicely set up & rather cozy. Ordered three dishes + 1 dessert (which I would usually order at a Taiwanese restaurant)...    1) Their Signature Giant Fried Chicken Cutlet - as per description it was not that Giant. It looked rather beaten, flat & dry instead of a succulent piece of chicken. The seasoning  though was alright.   2) Braised Minced Pork Rice (small size $6.50) - rather confusing as in this dish usually minced pork is used but in it's description it says finely chopped pork belly. The most disappointing of the lot! In the bowl there was approx. 3/4 cup of steamed rice, literally 1 tablespoonful of the finely chopped braised pork belly, half a braised egg & *note instead of using pickled mustard greens ...it was 2 slices of Japanese pickled daikon.   3) Taiwanese Style Beef Noodle Soup - Surely they can't go wrong with a signature noodle dish which is eaten all over Taiwan! But they did! Egg noodles were used here instead of hand made pulled noodles which has more of a mouth feel. The braised beef was ok. Soup base fell very flat! It tasted like a soup mix out of a packet. Unusually & oddly sweet, not the kind of sweetness that is extracted out of a stock made from scratch. Small plus point, they did have pickled mustard greens in this dish.  4) Mango Shaved Ice with Vanilla Ice cream - Don't know why I bothered haha! Didn't want to make another pit stop for dessert & hey how bad can they mess this one up eh? Unfortunately it was not a sweet ending but a soupy one. The shaved ice was coarse & both ice and ice cream had half melted when it was served. Mango bits were the only good thing in this dessert.   Four dishes & $40 later, totally not impressed ): I felt I was never going to find any good small eats but I did!!! A wee gem in a tiny food court right next to the Countdown Supermarket on the corner of Moorhouse Ave & Madras Street. There are just four stalls there but the one that was absolutely buzzing was Hang Seng Food Bar. I ordered the hot & spicy (& sour) noodle soup with braised beef, tripe, fish balls, bean sprouts & pickled mustard greens $12. A good serving, it arrived piping hot (: The flavours were balanced & one that was immediately familiar as it hit my taste buds. Not joking...it was almost tears at first bite!!! They delivered! SO GOOD!!! As I sat there observing, their fried rice & fried noodles were very popular too. For just a small stall they had an extensive menu (with pictures) & I can't wait to go back to try more!   Peace & Good Eats

I was really excited to find this place. They've been open for a year.   The place- well decorated, low key, good amount of seats.  The food- good selection of all the Taiwanese food that you can crave for!!! We ordered the popcorn chicken. Was a bit disappointed. The meat was on the tougher side and not well marinated. And lacks the familiar salty pepper power that you find in Taiwan popcorn chicken.  The bubble tea was a bit too well done. It's a tapioca was a bit too soft.  Service- good, friendly.   Price- average but not cheap.  Overall it's a good attempt! Good to have a Taiwanese restaurant to go to in Christchurch

Such lovely people run this small bastion of good ole down home Taiwan-style food that I was really sure the food would turn out to be good. I tried the quintessential Taiwanese dish--red cooked beef noodles (红烧牛肉面)--and was thrilled when they arrived and the familiar anise scent wafted from the bowl. The noodles appear to be handmade so they had that essential toothy texture and the beef was oh so tender and delicious. This was a great bowl of soup and at only $12 a steal, too. Can't wait to try their other dishes!
Everything was absolutely delicious! Friendly service, good portion sizes with fresh, flavourful ingredients. 5 out of 6 dishes are gluten free. Highly recommend
These people are so nice and make a real effort to serve you. The food is always fresh and delicious time and time again. It's a favourite spot for lunch

Lovely wee restaurant! Either Bun cha or Bun Thit Nuon are very yummy! I'd Just visited Vietnam, I felt their food are very authentic! Staff are very friendly too:) Also should try their Vietnamese coffee with condensed milk, very authentic as well!

This little Vietnamese spot is a gem! The food’s always fresh, super tasty, and they’ve got great veggie options too. The banh mi bread is soft with the perfect crunch, and the spring rolls are packed with flavour. The guy who runs the place is super friendly and makes you feel right at home. Easily my fave place in the mall!
Delicious bun roll with meat and vegetables. Friendly staff. Nice soups too!
Delicious!
Delicious Shanxi noodles! The pork intestines noodle soup was soooo good!! The staff were nice and I was real happy with my meal.
food was good! boss was friendy!
Great new Chinese restaurant, tasty and good value!
Grwat value for money takeaway and small dining area. Dishes are authentic and not overly oily/salty like other places.
A humane canteen
So good!
From the appetizers to the main course and dessert, everything was impressive and unforgettable such a great restaurant!
Great place to eat, very personal.

Booked a table, the booking confirmation says till 9pm but they ask us leave at 8pm. The food was just alright, all looks like pre-made food. They even hard push the bread, we rejected few times and they till charged it to our bill, lucky that we check before paying.
Two of us had a meal at Londo last night. The food and service were exceptional. I would throughly recommend this to anyone but you'll need to book!

Easily the best dining experience we’ve had in Christchurch during our holiday. The food and service was amazing and all the staff were friendly. Recommend sitting at the bar. We’ll definitely be back.
Great service; really friendly and helpful. And amazing tasty food; I had the Rockin Ribeye steak with delicious garlic butter - thank you!

I love this place. The food was amazing, the service was great considering it was packed Saturday night and we didn't book ahead.  Food wasn't too late about 15mins between starter and main. Drinks were on time. Could live on the ribs so yummy, and the Cajun prawns were amazing. And i love the booth next to the kitchen, much more private which is awesome because i dont like public eating. Thank use :)

If you are tired and have hungry kids avoid this establishment. Our order came later than tables that ordered after us and the kids order came out much later. Rule 1 of any resturant always serve kids first and ASAP. We also had a drink order which was ignored, then when we re-ordered we were again left with no action, it was not until the third request we finally got our drinks. Our wait staff and manager were less than responsive and the compensation for lack of service was unsatisfactory. Perhaps the style of the food is American Western, but the service is as bad as it gets. If the owners are interested in creating an American experience then follow the cardinal rules, customers expect exceptional service not excuses for poor delivery.

The Lone Star features everything "American Western" from the photos of Willy, Cash and Waylen on the walls to Elvis and Cash bopping through the speakers on the wall. By refurbishing the Bush Inn Hotel, the Lone Star acquired a ton of spaces that makes this the perfect spot for your next group event. The food is quality, but may take some time to be delivered to your table, depending on the time of day and the size of the crowd. Spend some time checking out the artwork if you're not in a hurry, this is a definitely a step back into the true Wild West and the beginning of classic country as we know it.
Great food, service & really fast delivery to the table. Highly recommended
It’s always a pleasure coming to Lone Star Manchester Street. The food is consistently good. A special thanks to our host Max. His smile enlightened the day!
Food & service was exceptional! Thanks team! We will definitely be back!
The other night I got a Veggie Burger and it was delicious. Staff was amazing too. I'm grateful for their service, they were very attentive and friendly. I'll come back 100%
Our service was fantastic, Karen was awesome. We will be recommending this place to our friends thank you.
Lovely experience. Yummy food.

Never felt so rushed. Rushed in from drinks to table 1/2 hour early. Chased up dessert menus. Then had to chase dessert from the kitchen. No drink service at the table. Service was atrocious. Had organized 17 to eat, so big party very embarrassing. Definitely eat somewhere else.

Sure the food is alright but it isn't a place I'd run back to. If anything, the food is for people with bland or basic food tastes and there isn't anything incredibly exciting, however, the servings are bigger than expected.  I had the Burrito Ranchero as nothing else really appealed to me on the menu, it was not good nor was it bad. It just wasn't very 'out there' enough. Definetly pricey, around 25+ per meal but if you're looking for a basic restaurant dish then this is your place.

Very pleasant surprise. Restaurants by the airport are usually hit or miss. Mostly misses. This one was very good.   We had the garlic prawns and the fish. Both were quite good.   Service was prompt and courteous.  Good selection of beers.

It's 10mins walk from Christchurch airport, it's my second time to be here. I ordered a Running Bear Salmon, absolutely delicious! The salmon meat is tender, with that sauce is a beautiful combination, their seafood meals must have( I've tried other seafood meal which is good as well)! I like their music with pretty good sound quality, also atmosphere here as well. Highly recommended to enjoy here before leaving CHC airport.

Close to the airport, so my expectations were lowered, but I had a great meal. Johnny Cash chicken (all their meals have non food names), is a chicken breast stuffed with mushrooms and chopped veggies, coated with something thin but crunchy, and then covered with mushroom sauce and more mushrooms. It comes with chips and coleslaw, but I just got extra coleslaw. The chicken was big, hot, moist and tasty. The coleslaw was also a large portion, and was crunchy with a number of julienned vegetables covered with a slightly creamy dressing with a pleasant vinegar taste. The mushroom sauce probably had a lot of calories, but the meal tasted great, and I mostly had chicken and veggies. Three different waitstaff stopped by to make sure I had ordered and then to make sure I enjoyed my dinner. They seemed to be enjoying their work as much as I was enjoying my meal.
Beautiful tasty Thai food, which we enjoyed again.

I purchased the Tom yum prawn. It comes down to the attitude and behaviour of the chef, if he or she is having a bad day, your food is going to resemble this. My Tom Yum was poor, 3 prawns and a piece of mushroom. I got a bad day, Puck it.
Since I’m from South East Asia, I’m longing for proper spicy Thai food. I just visited to Christchurch and found this shop. I ordered Thai spicy level takeaway. It’s super. The chef lady is so nice.
This place so amazing the best Thai Restaurant I ever had the staff so lovelydefinitely coming back again. Highly recommended
I highly recommend Longtail Thai! The food is absolutely delicious. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming and the owner is an absolute delight. I will definitely be going back. 5 stars
Really disappointed in our meals tonight. We always buy thai from here and it's not as good as it normally would be. Was looking forward to it, only to be disappointed.
Best Thai restaurant in Christchurch Staff ver friendly and food so delicious
This Japanese fried chicken rice is absolutely delicious! If the weather is nice, it's also very pleasant to eat it at one of the tables and chairs in the square.
Fried chicken rice is delicious~
Even after buying rice, I couldn't resist the smell when I passed by. The flavor was strong and I really liked it.

What's not to love about this coffeeshop? Fantastic coffee, nice selection of food, friendly staff, and a great view of Lyttelton port. Well worth the drive from Christchurch for a casual breakfast.  I ordered a flat white and a savory corn muffin, which was a surprisingly filling but delicious little pastry for breakfast. If you're eating outside, just watch out for any seagulls eyeing your food. They don't bother you, but will certainly swoop in if you step away. Also note that there are no takeout coffee cups here, so be sure to bring your own for takeaway.

Funky cafe with a hip alternative vibe. Clearly a popular spot with the locals as the busiest cafe in town.  Good food at the counter and the meals heading out looked good too.  Ordered a skim milk latte and a decaf- told they had neither skim milk or decaf. No apology or explanation that they had run out. The way it was said made me think they never do, by choice. If that's the case, next time I might choose not to go there.

Some of the best coffee and breakfast in Christchurch.   DJs and cool musical vibe on weekends I believe.   Can't recommend enough.   Staff and patrons are uniquely Lyttleton    As an aging tired old hippie I don't understand what's happened to "progressive liberals" these days, but that's a conversation I must have with one pink-haired stranger at a time. Sigh.   I digress!    You can't go wrong, give this place a try when you're in the neighborhood.
Great stay and great food. Ordered the eggs bacon and gluten free toast. They must have drizzled basil olive oil on the toast, delicious. Great atmosphere, cool building.
Wonderful spot with outdoor area. Awesome local staff serving good food and house roasted coffee.
Simply an incredible spot for a coffee, bite to eat, and gaze out the window at the beautiful harbour. Even more of a treat in winter when the fire is going. A family favourite!
Nice setting, but very poor service. For the number of people working, they couldn't take orders efficiently, the food was slow coming out, and the staff looked vacant. Would not go back.

Very cool cafe in the heart of Lyttleton. Great coffee, quick service, serves breakfast until 2.30pm. Good range of breakfast options, plus baked goods and sandwiches. Quick and friendly service, we'd return if we were locals!

Really good coffee, a big selection of healthy-style cabinet food, and a decent and well-executed menu of the usual cafe offerings.   Great atmosphere in the converted warehouse, with plenty of exposed brick and sturdy girders.   Spectacular view over the port. Good music, a tad loud while we were there.

What a great local coffee shop/cafe where lumber sexual barista your beans and grinds. Amazing case of muffins and savories. Your bacon and orange yoke eggs are as free range as the staff. The full breaky will hold you for a 1/2 day. Get something from the case for "take away." Cash only
Pathetic service! Staff too busy doing their own things than acknowledging customers waiting to pickup their orders.
As a delivery rider, I can say this is one of the worst restaurant ever.
Very nice atmosphere and very spacious too. Love the aquarium with massive crayfish on display. Very yummy food of course.

Mainly serves dim sum, but they also have a range of other dishes. This time I ordered two fried noodles — they were actually pretty good! Nice flavor, decent amount of meat, and overall satisfying.  But to be fair, the place has its ups and downs. Sometimes the quality just isn’t quite there, sometimes the portion feels a bit small, and occasionally it’s a bit too “mono-protein” — you know, mostly one type of meat and not much else. Still, when they get it right, it’s a solid, comforting meal that hits the spot.

I love the food here and the owner here is the greatest! Great service and food is amazing! Lucky that we can have meals here. The Malaysian lady who worked here today provided absolutely outstanding service, and the owner always offers great service as well. Highly recommended!

This place has deteriorated so much compared to it original days. Food is bad and extra pricey, service is poor and beware they have the tendency to overcharge. So keep track of what you order. There are other good Yum Char places in Christchurch which costs less and treats customers a lot better. Will not go again and not recommended to anyone else.

Great food. Terrible service.   Been here for eat in once and take away twice. Eat in was with a party of 20 and they sent one person to take our orders who seemed very fresh and slow. When dishes started coming out well before all orders had been taken I asked the manager if we could have our orders taken faster. She was pretty rude and said no because they're busy.   The food is delicious but the  customer service is VERY poor. It's reasonably priced so in my opinion it's fine for take away but if you're trying to impress someone I wouldn't bring them here. I even watched the manager texting on her cell phone while customers waited to be seated. No friendly welcome. Just plain poor customer service. Shocking!

Fantastic pan-Malaysian cuisine.  Good regular dishes like beef rendang and laksa with new items like a Dori donut with ginger lime ice cream.   Dumplings were light and tasty. Laksa needed more flavour but the pak Chou with confit garlic was delicious, combined with the very friendly priced lemak ($8) i was very full and happy.  Make a booking and beware the noise levels,  very popular on a Saturday evening
Fantastic. It is undiscovered. It is worth coming into the centre city for the cuisine.
Pleasant ambiance and very good food and service.  The garlic nan is the best I've ever had.

As we were heading to Mumbai for a holiday we thought we would try some local cuisine . A colleague recommended the maharaja indian restaurant.  Upon entering the property I thought we had entered someone's house and weren't sure where to park. But there was plenty of parking behind the building.   The Decor was pretty fancy and the staff were so friendly. I decided on the Mango chicken and wasn't let down. I had to take home my left overs as I could finish what was on my plate.

The place feels pretty fancy with the table cloths, stemware, and the dim lighting. But happily, this turned out to be one of the more reasonable meals I had in Christchurch. The 17.50 butter tikka masala was quite good and they made it with paneer instead of chicken by request, which I appreciated. And apparently I am not their only fan - the phones were ringing off the hook with takeout orders - seriously, almost non-stop.   Nice servers and atmosphere as well in this little romantically lit house.
The service was immaculate! Food was great,  watch out for the special spices they offer (; great experience

Dined in on a Saturday night with a group of 10. I had the Vege Samosa, Channa Masala and Cheese & Garlic Naan with a glass of the Greywacke Pinot Gris. Staff were amazing and very accommodating. Love the new location. The Maharaja Beer was also good! Will definitely be back!
Fabulous food, amazing service and the best atmosphere and setting. Highly recommend the Maharaja Indian restaurant, will definitely be back.

Suresh is absolutely amazing! We dined here for a friend’s birthday using First Table, and he took the time to clearly explain the T&Cs to our group and even gave thoughtful recommendations based on our tastes.  Unfortunately, we had an issue with the First Table discount when it came to the bill, and one of the female staff members handled it terribly! Speaking rudely about us, right in front of us (not realising one of us understood her language). We also overheard another table complaining about the same staff member’s attitude, so it clearly wasn’t just us.  Thankfully, Suresh completely turned the experience around. He was kind, professional, and made sorting out the refund quick and stress-free. If it weren’t for him, this visit would’ve been a very different story!

Exceptional food and amazing flavours! We tried the Butter Tikka Masala and Malai Kofta, and both dishes were bursting with rich, balanced spices. The Butter Tikka Masala was creamy and full of depth, and the Malai Kofta was smooth and perfectly seasoned. Also, don’t forget to try the chilli pickle — it adds the perfect spicy tang to the meal.  I honestly wish I could fly back from Australia just to eat here again. Highly recommended!

We went to Maharaja for our one year anniversary at their new location. They seated me & husband in a comfy booth close to the loo (as I’m very pregnant) which was nice of them to sacrifice a bigger table for just the two of us. The Lamb  & biryani & aijwani fish were the stand out dishes for us! We will definitely be back!

One of the best Indian dinners I have had! From start to finish just exquisite. The appetiser chicken omg! The main were so creamy and the dessert hit the spot! Book in treat yourself. Also a bar too :)
Great place for coffee and brunch. Friendly staff, great service. I'm looking forward to try other menu.

A great place to call into and enjoy a refreshing coffee and food in comfortable surroundings. The staff are very welcoming and provide an excellent friendly service. Well worth a trip to whilst visiting Christchurch.

Lucus -well polished is the first word that comes to mind - so insightful A genuine pleasure to be served by such a professional and engaging waiter — friendly, attentive, and a credit to the establishment.
Just there for a coffee

I’ve visited the Majestic Café three times in the past month, and each visit has been a fantastic experience! The hot and iced chocolates are absolutely divine, and the mocktails are fabulous — delicious, refreshing, and beautifully presented. The food not only looks amazing but tastes just as good, making it a real treat every time. The staff are friendly and welcoming, and I really love the atmosphere — it’s lush, stylish, and inviting. Whether you're after a relaxed coffee date or a post-work cocktail catch-up with friends, it's the perfect spot. Highly recommend — I’ll definitely be back again soon!

The food coming out of the kitchen looked amazing! Our breakfast did not disappoint, it was a large serving and would have to be the tastiest breakfast we have ever had and the cup of tea was plentiful.
Upmarket cafe in the Mayfair Hotel. Had the Beef Cheek Hash.

What you get here with your char kuey teow is pretty much the flavor you'd get at a Malaysian stall - great wok hei and pleasantly charred chewy noodles. What's missing is the extras - cockles, anyone? More than 2 shrimp, maybe? There were a few fish cakes tossed here and there.  A plate of tasty noodles is always satisfying, but it won't be a meal - you'll have to supplement.  Oh, and do say yes to his offer of spicy sauce.
2nd visit in a week, staff are friendly, ordered Penang noodles (rice noddles)!with chicken both times, great dish, I have eaten this dishes in Penang and this version is very authentic
The store manager is the most entitled, lazy and rudest person I have ever met. Treats his staff horribly, wish I never ate his mid food.

It was the worst experience of my New Zealand trip. My first payment was declined, and the counter staff shook his head and made an impatient face. I apologized and paid with another card. I told him twice that the order was for takeaway, as I was unwell and my voice was faint.  When the food was ready, it was served for dine-in. I reminded him again and asked him to pack it. He became unhappy and shouted at me: “Calm down, calm down, I’ll do it.” When I said there was no need to shout, he then replied: “What do you want to do, do you want to slap me?”  I’m very disappointed with my overall experience. No customer should ever be treated this way.

I recently ordered the curry laksa and it was absolutely delightful! The flavourful soup was superb, and while the portion of noodles was generous, I found myself wanting more soup instead—especially after adding a note requesting no noodles. The kitchen went above and beyond and happily replaced the noodles with extra broth, and even surprised me with two cans of Pepsi. I really appreciated their attention to special instructions and the thoughtful extra touches. Fantastic service—will definitely be returning and highly recommend this place!
Coke from the fridge was warm, food was not that yum..

Hidden gem near the airport!   Stopped by Malis Thai for a quick meal and was pleasantly surprised. They have a Clear Chicken Noodle Soup for only $10 – such a bargain compared to most places these days. The broth is light but flavorful, noodles are soft with a nice bite, and the chicken slices were tender. Perfect comfort food, especially if you’ve just landed or heading off on a trip.  Plenty of parking out front and service was friendly. For the price, you really can’t go wrong – definitely worth checking out if you’re around Christchurch Airport!
Don't bother, there are better options close by. All the dishes look to be the same, pile of veggies with 3 bite size pieces of your chosen meat, all drowned in soy sauce.
very bland
This is my thai go to place

I ordered ginger stir fry with tofu for takeaway. Quite disappointed with the quantity of food. I am not a big eater but the meal wasn't enough, very little quantity of rice and veggies were not good either. Additionally, I have found scraps of wok in the food. It's the non stick coating of the wok that came off in my food. Good, that I noticed it before swallowing. And there were tiny bits of it Disappointed.
Great food and service. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The food doesn't take long to arrive and is always delicious.
Excellent service, delicious food, highly recommend.
The best thai restaurant I have ever been to hands down. I will definitely be back next time I am in chch. The service was prompt, professional and friendly.
Best Thai food in town, highly recommend this restaurant, pad thai soup with prawns a must try and coconut rice absolutely good! Friendly team in quick services, we will be back for sure.
Amazing food, fast service, friendly staffs. We enjoyed dining at Mama Ree very thoroughly.
Excellent authentic Thai Street food, enjoyed.
Thai food that tastes like Thai food.
The food is absolutely delicious and the service is 5-star! We can be a bit picky when it comes to Thai food, but this restaurant is truly outstanding. Highly recommended!
Amazing food! Friendly service.
It said that it was open on google, but it is not. Please update you google
Highly recommend…. Beautiful taste food :)
Always quick and tasty.
Enjoyed an early dinner. Buzzy atmosphere (quite noisy). Fantastic food and really lovely staff. So happy this restaurant is in my hood!
Great food and great service.

Such a lovely night celebrating my sons 25th birthday.  Our party of 16 loved their meals.  Such a range on the menu to chose from and the food was delicious.  Smiling faces and great atmosphere.  Lucky we made it due to the storm and our hrs drive to town and the storm kept alot of patrons away so I was glad we came.  The family our party said it was the best meal out they had had and they dine out alot.  So top marks team.  Thank you.  Rebecca
Very happy with the beautiful meal tonight and service was good.  I did struggle with the acoustics but perhaps that's a reflection of the popularity.

3/5 The atmosphere and service were both good, but the food was a bit too sweet for my taste. We ordered the yakitori chicken skewers and the green curry — both dishes lacked any spice, which was disappointing for a Thai meal. It would be great if they asked about spice preferences when taking orders so the dishes could be adjusted accordingly. The mango lassi, however, was very good and refreshing.
Best burritos and tacos in NZ. I have never been disappointed with the service and food. Fine dining without the price tag. If only I still lived in chch but I go whenever I'm back.

The elusive Mamacita's food truck must be found! I had their $5 tacos at the A&P Show and they were amazing. I tried the pulled pork taco with their achiote garlic tequila sauce. They also offer chicken, beef, steak, chorizo & potatoes, burritos and nachos. Definitely the best tacos in the city, but I cannot find the food truck during the week days. Their hours are very infrequent and, sadly, most of the days Mamacita's is actually not operating. Use their website: http://www.mamacitas.co.nz/find.html to see where and when they'll be open to try and catch them, because if you can, it's totally worth it!

went here twice, the first time we had hair on our food, we didn’t complain and just let it go. But the second time we visited, there was hair on our food once again, and I do not appreciate having hair on my food that I paid for. Please keep the dishes clean. Because of this I am giving it 1 star.
Absolutely thrilled with the tuna tinola! Delicious, exactly what I needed today. Preparation and delivery was lightning fast. Highly recommend!

We had the Tapsilog and Pork & Chicken Abodo. Both were delicious and well-presented. The complimentary soup was a welcome addition. We look forward to trying other dishes when we're in the area again at mealtime.
Great food,  excellent service and affordable

I used the website they have going now My meal should have $15 on the website when I paid it was 24.72 I rung and asked why The website is  3 years old Not my problem Get your website up to current year and prices. Annoyed
Nice foods.

Amazing experience at Manu last night. The platter was stunning and packed with flavour, beautifully presented on a metal lobster tray. Every dish tasted fresh and well balanced. Great service, great atmosphere. One of the best spots in Christchurch.. will definitely be back.

Brilliant service from Ahmed on the front desk and Tom behind the bar. As a walkin couple on a fully booked night, Ahmed put himself out to welcome us and find space at the bar. We were then entertained by the excellent Tom who hosted us superbly whilst at the same time having to deal with a stream of orders from the main restaurant. Tom had terrific knowledge of NZ wine too with great recommendations for us. Also loved the sticky lamb ribs!
Second time dining experience. As good as the first time. Had some overseas visitors, who also enjoyed the experience, although outside of their comfort zone.

This restaurant is a beautiful in so many ways, the food, the staff, the art, the atmosphere. We went as a big group and had the banquet, each dish was delicious, and the presentation was amazing. Thank you

Karen and her amazing team of professional hospitalitists treated us to an incredibly outstanding experience on Friday night! Service was impeccable, food breathtaking and the atmosphere one I was reluctant to leave! Simply cannot wait to be back in CHCH to try more of what this gem has to offer :) The Samoan Oka was phenomenal!
Amazing food. Wonderful service.
We just keep going back. Glorious food. They never fail to deliver.
I must say, the owner and staff were so friendly, and the food was a good 9/10, definitely a must visit!

Hands down one of the best restaurants in Christchurch! The food is always fresh and delicious, and Ahmed and the team never fail to make you feel welcome — a spot you’ll want to visit again and again.
It's nice place to eat and hangout with friends and family,
Beautiful food Beautiful staff great service lovely experience will definitely come back
Very tasty and fresh ingredients. Fast and efficient service. Nice location.

Absolutely one of my favourite spots in Christchurch! The food is always fresh, flavourful, and 100% halal, with authentic Mediterranean taste that never disappoints.  I’ve been here more than 10 times, and every visit has been consistently amazing — from the quality of the meals to the exceptional customer service. The team here truly makes you feel welcome.  Every time I’m in Christchurch, I make sure to have at least one meal at Mashawe. Highly recommended for anyone who appreciates great food made with
To be honest, not recommend……..

Had the Beef Fry Ho Fun from Maxing’s Palace. The noodles were well stir-fried — had that proper wok hay and a really nice fragrance. The beef was decent, with a fair amount of protein in the mix. Price-wise, it’s on the higher side, but luckily there was an Uber Eats deal that made it more affordable. Overall, a solid Beef Fry Ho Fun.

If you're ever in New Zealand, Taiwanese friends, you absolutely must try this place! You won't be disappointed.  I went straight here after landing! Every dish was amazing, so delicious I didn't take enough pictures... XD  I'll definitely come back for the soup next time; it was incredible! The service was excellent, and the atmosphere was so comfortable. We even had a birthday party there, and the whole restaurant sang together!  I loved the berries!
This is an authentic Chinese restaurant. The staff were amazing there are some incredible dishes, The staff were amazing

Been here a few times, but the food keeps getting worse.The pork in the dim sims and other pork dishes had a really strong off-putting taste, couldn’t eat it. The dim sums were super dry with no juice at all.The quality of all the food was really poor. It was an unpleasant experience even after spending money.The only highlight was enjoying the sparkling wine the most.Really disappointing.I definitely won’t be returning.
Loved it! The meal was delicious!
Great place to enjoy a game of footie with freinsa followed by amazing food. Staff are brilliant.
Nice place and nice couches
Great spot
Food is excellent

restaurant: May’s Thai (AKA Tarn’s Kitchen) on Wairakei Rd

reviews.text: We stopped by and found out that reservations are required for all dining in, but luckily they kindly accommodated us. The food was generous in portion and absolutely delicious. The pad see eew were among the best I’ve had in Christchurch, and the crispy pork truly lived up to its name. Next time, we’ll make a booking in advance.
We dined in. The setting is cozy and comfortable and the service is friendly and prompt. You order via a form. The food is unbelievably good! The flavours are nuanced and deep. Highly recommend!

My go-to restaurant for Thai food in Christchurch! I’ve been here multiple times and it’s always worth the drive across town compared to my local Thai restaurants. The food is consistently great and full of flavour, also it’s made with some high-quality ingredients, and the portions are generous. The staff are also very attentive and friendly. Keep up the great work guys!

We went here last night for a meal. It was excellent. We had chicken & cashew nuts, beef penang curry, Chicken satay-they make a lovely satay sauce for this dish and the highlight of the night was the black pepper and garlic sauce crispy pork belly dish-it was outstanding. Be sure and consider this restaurant if you fancy really nice Thai food.
excellent service every time I have become a regular now come in atleast once a week and the food is amazing!! side note: no paywave or credit but you can bank transfer
Always friendly, the food is great, and takeaway is easy to order.
Made a reservation for two. Love their food.

i love the mcchicken burger in the morning. it helps me to wake up and enjoy my day like its cocaine 10/10 would bang except you have to wear a tux when u go wwhich is a bit rude i dont like that much  thnx bby

A Regrettable Experience at McDonald's  A visit to the McDonald's on Memorial Ave has left much to be desired. The moment I stepped inside, it was clear that the level of service wasn't up to standard.  The first problem arose at the ordering counter, where it was like they didn't give a damn or cared to take care of customers. It seemed to be as if my being there was a nuisance for them. Although the service lacked oomph, I pushed ahead with my order because I hoped that there'd be a surprise waiting for me on the platter.  Unfortunately, this was not to be. The company's character would be the inedible food. The fries were lukewarm and soggywhich certainly was a far cry from the hot, crisp standard I've come to expect of other golden arches. The burger was no better, smashed together and rather lifeless.  Another problem plaguing this McDonald's was cleanliness. Tables were abandoned to patrons past, covered with crumbs and spills. The overall hygiene of the dining area was suspect, and I have my doubts about how clean the kitchen or food preparation areas were.  Also, the restroom was hardly attractive. It was dirty, there were bad odors and visible dirt; it needed immediate attention. Those conditions are something a fast-food restaurant, never mind one as big and globalized as McDonald's ought to be able to prevent.  Finally, my visit to this McDonald's was one I would regret. Service overall was indifferent; food quality poor and cleanliness ignored. I hope that the management takes steps to resolve these problems and help restore McDonald's reputation, which it has been building over decades. And right now, I cannot pinpoint this particular location and tell others to try it if they want a positive experience with fast food.  - Josh Nuzak

As someone visiting from Los Angles, CA... this McDonald's makes our McDonald's look like s*#t! Seriously...I never eat McDonald's back home because it looks disgusting and doesn't taste fresh. NZ has it good with McDonald's lol This place has self service machines to send in your order and to customize it! Also super clean, can't say much about staff since I order by machine BUT service is quick.
A regular haunt, great place for catching up and relaxing with life long friends, wonderful  food  and great  service

Oh my goodness, stopped in to see their Italian produce and wine. Was not disappointed. What a wonderful selection. Will be back for one of your delicious pizzas that I saw someone eating. Bravo  molto bene.
Rather expensive but nevertheless a well appointed place to buy anything Italian and have coffee and something to eat.
Great place, have been here many times with family. Food is fantastic, vibes are immaculate, and service is quality. Highly recommend the Frutti di Mare and Tiramisu.

This place reminds me of being in Italy! Mediterranean Foods is my go-to place for all Italian ingredients!  Update - has the fresh BEST Tiramisu in Christchurch. I have tried soo many other places and haven't found a place that can do it better!
Food was nice but I've had better thai food. Service was great

Delicious and really fresh food, quick option for a takeaway and reasonably cheap. In my opinion just need some update on the dining in area as have the option for that in the restaurant itself aside of that a good option of Thai takeaway at Papanui road.

Visited numerous times. Really hit and miss. Sometimes the portion sizes are terribly small, other times it's near to what you'd expect pricewise- however still a tad on the more expensive side. Had a few good meals here and have also had some hmmm "ho-hum" "below par" meals too. Most likely won't be visiting here in the near future.
My absolute favorite place for nasi-goreng. Real cool guy aswell good to have a chat with.
Always friendly, Food amazing Prices are super low
Price is affordable, and food can be better

Location is convenient. There are a lot drink options but food menu is relative limited. When I arrived yesterday (Friday) evening, there are still many tables available. We took Table 9 near the window. The waiter seems are a new hand. He walked to us and did not introduce menu but just stand there and wait for us to order. When I asked him is any special today, he simply replied no special. Not sure but hope he feels happy and fine with his job.
Best neighbourhood bar with good food.
Excellent
Fabulous place for a pint. Great Service and friendly staff.
Excellent food! And the cider was fantastic. Highly recommend
I ordered a Margherita pizza and was horrified to pay $25.90 for a pizza with a base you buy at the supermarket. If the chef can't make a base, take it off the menu
Very nice people live close now might make it a regular place to go to, good food also for the pricing!

The food is okay -  very American "Taco Tuesday" style meals as opposed to TexMex or Mexican cuisine. Its a good value if you are in a rush. Having said that - this places is heaps better than the fancy Mexican place I ate at on the waterfront at St. Heliers Bay.

Do they have Chipotle in New Zealand?  I don't remember seeing any, so this might be the closest thing.  Not too far from the Christchurch airport and just what I wanted after a long day (or more?) of travel: chicken, rice, veggies, and some heat.  Tasty and good quality Fresh-Mex at a good price.  They even have those Yucatecan pink onions.  More legit than a lot of what you might find in California.
Fresh Mexican food here. Very close to the airport and Antarctic center. regular Mexican fate of burritos and tacos tasted fresh and good. Recommended

Great Find!  I am down from Texas and this is some great TexMex food.  I had the Jalapeño Chicken Quesadilla and it was outstanding. The Chicken meat is seasoned well and the garlic and lime help make this multi layer flavor. You can get the same in a Burrito (something I will try in the next couple days). All very fresh!  TL - Dallas, Tx
Fantastic food and service, highly recommend.
Had the most delicious food. Beautiful atmosphere , stunning decor, friendly staff serving as with a smile. Bar men served us the most delish Margaritas

We walked in and were seated straight away on a Friday night. Friendly staff - attentive but not in your face (great!). We (two of us) shared a nachos & corn plus a jug of sangria. It was enough for us both without feeling stuffed. I have to commend the corn dish - it was flavourful and soft yet firm. So good! Sangria - lots of ice in the jug, but we roughly got two glasses worth each.
My favourite Mexican restaurant, I would eat here every night if I could!!
Amazing food! Great service.

this jawn was fye (aka this place is awesome)  pardoning my gen z lingo: the barbacoa quesadilla, barbacoa taco and the lamb taco were absolutely delicious, but my soft shell crab taco stole the show!! ('twas munched down before a photo could be taken rip)  good service and kind waitress who was obviously happy to be here!  ambiance is medium volume and comfy benches with large tables, community feeling and very upbeat and authentic  overall this restaurant gets cinco stars!! :) definitely come here if you have a chance! we needed some Mexican food while in Christchurch and Mexicanos did NOT disappoint!!!

Stopped in here for dinner and the food was delicious. Being from SoCal I was surprised that none of the entrees include rice and beans, and it's not even an option to add and make a combo. I enjoyed my meal but it did feel like something was missing as a result. Mentioned it to the server and he'd never heard of rice and beans being standard fare in a Mexican restaurant.
Very busy, great atmosphere. Staff were great. The nacho dish was excellent but the tacos which i had, whilst had great flavours, was very sparing in actual substance. Basically poor value.

Great choice if you're in the mood for Mexican food. We took our kids here since we're traveling from out of town. We were the only ones with children at 7pm for dinner. They did have a kid's menu that included a drink and popcorn sundae. Kids loved it. Tacos were yummy. The pork and prawns had good flavors. The flank steak and chicken needed a little more spices. Maybe a cilantro jalapeño mayo for the beef tacos? All in all a delicious place to eat!

Wow! We had no idea what to expect with Mexican food in NZ. Saw there were good reviews, and checked it out. Authentic for sure. We both got drinks at the bar while waiting for our table. The grapefruit margarita and I forget the one my husband got, but it has basil, pineapple, and jalapenos. Spicy and delicious.   We ordered the corn fritters, nachos, tacos (fish, steak, and shrimp), and sticky date pudding. Everything was tasty. Tacos seemed a bit overpriced for the portion (comparing it to really good places back home), but had interesting flavors. Our favorite was the steak taco as the meat was perfectly tender and came with this tomato olive tapenade? Delish!

We had just arrived in Christchurch and were starving after a long day of travel. Mexicano's seemed like a good option, and boy, did they deliver on delicious food. We started out with chips and salsa. The salsa was fresh, like it had just been made, and the chips were just the right texture to complement the salsa. My husband and I ordered some tacos. I had a grilled shrimp as well as a a portobello mushroom one. Both were perfect, and packed full of flavor. To top off the meal, we had a Sticky Pudding Cake that was served with a scoop of ice cream. It was wonderful- overall, our experience here was all around spectacular! I feel so fortunate to have had such a great meal straight off the plane after a long travel. I would highly recommend this place and if I lived locally, I would definitely eat here often. Great job Mexicano's!!!

went yesterday and had the original fried chicken and chicken quesadilla. The ambience and decor is great. Food was tasty too. Unfortunately, the menu food options are limited and the price for the amount of food given is sort of steep. I guess this is more of your casual drink spot for bringing a date with some delicious bites to eat on the side.

Had a craving for Mexican food while traveling on our honeymoon and Mexicano's hit the spot! Loved the shaken pomegranate margarita that had a chili salt rim. The chicken nachos were delicious - would definitely recommend. Steak taco with olive salsa was a little odd but still tasty. Overall good food, drinks and atmosphere! Also, they take reservations.

Wow - tacos (chicken and pulled pork) were delicious! Would definitely recommend. Braised beef quesadilla as full of flavor, and also highly recommended. Ambiance was very pleasant; filled up fast for dinner and constant on a Monday night. Service was positive!

Delicious food, with each dish having its own distinct flavour. Busy, and we had to wait 30min past our reservation of 9:15.. Maitre De friendly but inefficient. Had to remind him that we were still waiting, and then got immediately seated. But the food is so good, its worth the wait.

A short walk from my hotel, this place was just what everyone said it would be - hip, delicious, friendly, and affordable. An interesting menu, with Mexican staples and unique offerings makes this a place that tempts even a short-term visitor to CHC to come back.

Once we found this hidden gem, everything was fine. Anna greeted us and although they had bookings, wedged us in.  Started with frozen margaritas which were perfect.  Very tart and with a flavorful tequila, of which they offer many.    Smallish menu with starters and small plates, taco's and a few entries. Was sampled several taco's and each was unique and flavorful.  Will return when we get back to Christchurch.

I was looking for some comfort food and tacos is always my go to. So when looking up places to eat this one caught my eye. My friend and I waked in and the place has a great atmosphere about it. The Art Deco and music were wonderful. We sat at one of the high tops and the waitress brought us waters. Gave us a few great recommendations. Then gave us time to decide. We both went with a taco and appetizer. She then came back and asked if we were thinking about any cocktails. I asked what was on draft and they only had 2. Normally Mexican restaurants don't have very many so it was cool. She told us about both and I asked to taste one and she brought both drafts for tasting. It was very thoughtful cause I actually went with the one I didn't ask for. Once we got our food we started eating. And I'm telling you, the grilled chicken taco with mashed Avocado and pickled mango is one of the best tacos I've ever had. And I've had a lot of tacos.   I fully recommend this place to anyone who loves Mexican food. I'm hoping to get there again before I leave New Zealand. It's only been 2 days. But maybe I'll get there today for lunch.   Try them! You won't regret it at all!!

We have been in New Zealand for a week (having a wonderful time thanks to all the great people here) but being from Texas we need a Mexican food fix on a regular basis. On a whim we searched Yelp and we're pleasantly surprised to find this place listed. After seeing the rating it was a no brainer. We started with the standard Margarita and although it was different from our normal it was very tasty (shaken not frozen). We wanted to taste a variety but we were late and their menu was limited for the evening crowd which made the difference between five stars and the four we gave them. Some of the photos posted made up our minds as to what we wanted but couldn't get it when we arrived around 7 pm.  We ended up ordering the potatoes skins, fish taco, pulled pork and a chicken taco and if you like corn on the cob you gotta try theirs.  Roasted corn on the cob covered in white cheese, may be parmessan, and some yummy spices. All the food was five stars and the service was great. They even have a great salsa that we see in Houston. Not our first choice but the fact that they had an authentic salsa sauce made in Mexico was a real sign of their authentic intentions and we salute them for that and their very tasty cuisine. Got our Mexican fix in Christchurch, New Zealand...who'd have guessed
Had a fish taco, pulled pork taco, and house margarita. The fish taco was amazing! So good I ordered another one. Ambiance is cool and fun-they have moustaches and sombreros for sale at the bar:)
Fantastic food. Great service. Really cool decorations. Nice to have a solid Mexican meal on the other side of the planet.
Fab tacos and margarita's!  fun atmosphere!

Decidedly average food, nothing Mexican about it.... Tacos with gross Eta mayonaise and skinless bbq sauce tasting "adobo" chicken? But quite pleasant service and a tasty ceviche, although it was actually not ceviche but poisson cru - hence two stars apart from the defensive and annoying duty manager. Try somewhere else.

Can't to this place because another place I went to wasn't serving full menu so they suggested I come here. However this place wasn't serving full menu when I got here either! But I was so hungry I ate here anyways.  The decorations were awesome. Very cozy and fun looking restaurant.,love the nail light fixtures. Very cool ambiance!  So limited menu since it was before 5.   I ordered pulled pork and beef tacos. Both were very tasty on flour tortilla. I also got guacamole ...home made and very good with salsa that was basically just fresh tomatoes with spices but still very good.   My favorite part of the meal was the dessert! The caramel popcorn sundae! So freakin finger lickin good! Also had cotton candy on top! I highly recommend getting this.   Also the cocktail list was very good. I got two different drinks and they were both very good.   Only downside: there are no rice and beans. Being from Texas I'm like what kind of Mexican place has no rice!? Also hard to get any queso solo. Have to get it with other food.   Overall great experience. Service was also good.

Had dinner here for our first night in Christchurch. Friendly service, nice atmosphere, and the food was tasty. Luckily my friend and I were a bit earlier and was able to be sat before the dinner crowd.   I had the beans as a side, along with the mushroom taco, the titty twister draft, and split the popcorn sundae.   Only suggestion is to add a stout draft to the menu :)

Short answer-it's okay. Long answer.  Potato skins with queso fundito were bland. Fried chicken and braised pork quesadillas were good but not great. Had a bit of an odd experience I think. First wait staff we encountered asked if we had a booking and when we said no (in an empty restaurant at 5pm) she looked concerned and said she'd have to direct is to the manager. He seemed as if it was no problem and told her we could use table 14 until 645. She then relayed that to us and asked if we would like her to go over the menu. We said sure and she basically read the whole thing. I think she was just a bit awkward, other staff seemed to interact with customers in a typical way. Not a big deal, just tainted our meal. My dad tried to mention it to the manager while paying but he was distracted and didn't hear.

Mexicanos , The place is very cool.love the decorations.now the food,it is not an authentic Mexican food it's all a little bland for my taste, but the quality of the produce is very good.what I really enjoyed are the Margaritas .I have been a fan of Mexican food since I remember,at home we eat Mexican food twice a week.I have also lived there for a while.so my advice is ...........Go there have a few drinks at the bar and get a feel your self.

Not too bad, chips need a little work, salsa needs some jalapeño added! When your from Texas you like it hot, hot, hot!!! I had veggie quesadillas excellent... Asked for sour cream... They do not have!!! My husband had the lamb chops special he said it was edible just needed some spice!!! It was a good place to get a chip salsa fix when your missing the real thing!!! $77 for two includes two drinks!!!

Went here while hanging out in the NZ waiting for the weather to be good enough to get to Antarctica.   The Margs were small, but super yummy. We were choosing from the lunch menu and I had the fish tacos.  There were really good.  I forgot to ask for corn tortillas, but the flour ones were yummy. I also got the guac and salsa app.  Fresh and tasty for sure. The service was great and the place isn't really the Mexican that I am used to in the states... but I wanted Margaritas and the ones they had were spot on...  If you get them frozen... I tried the on the rocks one of a friends and it was odd. That's all I am saying about that.
