We visited once only, service was average and food was poor. We aren't great cooks but we can make better Mexican at home with a kit from countdown. They also ran out of beer . I wouldn't go back

Easily some of the best food in Christchurch. From what I can tell, it's authentic Mexican with a few twists. The tacos have soft shells, but have fruit in them (chicken & mango, pork & pineapple) which adds a really nice touch. The meat is juicy and delicious.   I also tried the corn chips with salsa. The chips were plain with some salt on them, which lets you taste the nice corn flavour without any distraction like you would get with Doritos (not that I don't like Doritos). The salsa seemed like authentic pico de gallo, a fresh chunky salsa with citrus and coriander. I don't normally like fresh tomato or coriander, but I could eat this stuff for days.  I also got a beef quesadilla, which was nice and cheesy. Not sure how else to describe it, but it was good.  As for prices, you get pretty good value for money. The tacos are small, but I think they were around $7, which is not bad considering you would pay at least $5 at a food truck for something nowhere near as good. I can't remember how much everything else was, but if you get a couple of tacos and couple of other things to share, then you get a good meal for just over $20.

This place rocks. Definitely recommend making a booking, especially on a weekend. There are two seating areas: the bar (first come first serve) and the dining area. The dining area is mostly tall top tables with some lower tables around the edges. I recommend the dining room as the service is much more attentive and efficient. Be sure to ask for sombreros to wear with dinner (no charge) or mustaches to take home ($2).   The dining menu is more of a shared plate style atmosphere. For 5 people we ordered double tortillas (2/pp), chicken, beef cheek, side coleslaw and seasonal veggies and were satisfied (granted we all had had snacks before we came). We also ordered 2 margaritas (the ginger: FANTASTIC and the Locos y Explosivo: delicious but VERY caliente!). Definitely an interesting dining experience as the theme seems to focus on Dios de las Muertas (Day of the Dead) and their food is very traditional Mexican. They also serve tacos, guacamole and salsas and other options if you're not comfortable with the shared plates concept. Definitely recommend checking this place out if you're craving Mexican!

MINDBLOWING!!! Stumbled here for dinner - the tacos are to die for!  Should the restaurant be full, you can simply go to the resto/bar next door (sorry forgot the name) where you can enjoy all tacos next to a fire pit.   Probably the best meal I had in New Zealand.  Enjoy!!!

To be really honest I was pretty underwhelmed by the food and the way it was delivered. The potatoe skins were terrible and my main was ordinary.  The place is really busy and I'm really surprised.  While I would go back and try something else I'd  much prefer to try other restaurants or go somewhere where I know I'll get the food I'm paying for.   I don't like being so negative but I'm really annoyed by the potatoe skins that they include on the menu but have no idea how to prepare or that they took absolutely no care.

Great little Mexican place we stumbled upon during our time in Christchurch. We were there early (6ish) but it was already pumping.  Started off with the guac, salsa & chips which was really good, and then the fire roasted corn with chipotle mayo & queso which was amazing! I then had 2 mushroom & black bean soft tacos which were great... But then came dessert. OMG popcorn sundae! Just amazing!

Mexicano's is always busy so it pays to make a reservation well in advance. Just be careful as they do have dining windows and you may be evicted from your seat before  you are ready as they will have the table booked for someone else. I don't mind this, as long as you are warned when you make your reservation. In my most recent experience (staff xmas party) we were made to give up our seats before dessert, while people were still contemplating ordering more main dishes, which left a sour taste in everyones mouth.   The food is pretty good but does come in small sizes. You will often need at least two dishes to actually start to feel full. The guac is ok, and I really like the crispy potato skins. The larger dishes are all pretty good with strong flavours. I always try and get a taco (favourite so far is the pulled pork), and a larger dish such as the ceviche or the chicken/chorizo sticks. The braised beef and pork hock are pretty good as well. And of course, some fried chicken for the table. No dish really stands out as a absolute must have, and none are particularly bad either.  Mexicanos is noisy, and dark. The atmosphere is very cool but its not a place for quiet conversations. The drinks list is pretty limited if you are after wine but has a good selection of margarita's and sangria.

From what I can tell, Victoria St is where it's at these days. There's a ton of restaurants like Mexicanos and the street is buzzing with people.   We went to Mexicanos at about 9:30pm on a Saturday and struggled to get a table. Initially we sat outside but were soon told that they stopped serving alcohol outside at 10pm. Inside we went.  The food reminds me a bit of the Mexico chain but perhaps a bit more 'traditional.' We had the usual guac followed by an array of soft shell tacos ($8). Unlike Mexico , the filling were generous and the meat well-cooked. They could of done with more fresh herbs but that was only a slight niggle.   If your looking for a causal cheap and cheerful restaurant with a ton of atmos Mexicanos is worth a looksie.
Best Mexican in town. Have recently travelled to Mexico and had authentic tacos. This place brings Mexico to Christchurch. Authentic flavour and fab paradise slushy. Love it!
Not like Mexican food in the States but very tasty. Great service. Fun decor. Good tequila selection.
Not authentic and not good. Service was ok. Environment was nice. A lot of traditional Mex decor. I would not recommend or return.
Good margaritas and food. Very friendly owner. Loved all the Mexican pictures. Enjoyed it. Good location.

The margaritas are not to be missed, especially on Tuesday, when you get a free taco.  The tacos are great also. We had the appetizer of the jalapeño poppers, oh my goodness,  were they ever delicious, with the slaw that comes with, I'd get those again.

This place is super sweet and has an awesome vibe to it. We were looking for some good Mexican food and found exactly that! Their chips and guacamole were amazing!  .... so we got two!! The service was fast and friendly  , they had some really nice people! Not to busy but obviously a well liked place with the locals. Can't wait to come back to Christchurch and this restaurant!

This is a gourmet Mexican "street food" type restaurant that caters to foodies. It isn't like the usual Mexican food that you find in America and it isn't like any authentic Mexican food I've had. A lot of the entrees are meatless and have creative twists. The chicken that they are famous for is very tender and good. The atmosphere and decor in the restaurant is great-- that alone makes it a worthy destination.

Lovely decor in this trendy tapas joint/bar.  We had 2x croquettas, 2x tacos (vege), and the jackfruit quesadilla!   The jackfruit was good - the tortijja was a little over-done, and better paired with the sauce that came with the croquettas. I don't know what the sauce that came with it was meant to be.  Crocquettes were fantastic, and the tacos great, although were also a little charred.   Quick n easy going place though. Good pricing, and quite enjoyed their personal touches on the hot sauces.

Went here on a whim while visiting Christchurch for 24 hours or so. They only had one option of salsa with chips, no queso or bean dips. Only had tacos, chimichangas, ceviche, and quesadilla on the menu. The tacos were good & the Margarita was fair but the chimichangas couldn't be eaten because they were so salty. For the quality Id say it was overpriced compared to authentic restaurants in Mexico or even California. Wouldn't try again but was satisfying enough.

As someone who has lived in Texas and California most of his life and eats some kind of Mexican food (traditional, street food, Tex/Cal Mex, etc.) a few times a month, the last thing I wanted to do was eat Mexican food so far away from Mexico. But everything else was closed on New Year's and we ended up here - a real blessing in disguise.  We ordered a steak taco, a fish taco, and guac to start. All were great.  I also wanted to order ceviche, but that was too risky - I didn't want to risk ruining our entire trip on the minute chance of food poisoning - and ended up ordered the torta instead. Bad idea. The bread and pulled pork were mediocre - I've definitely had better.

This place is the real deal.  If I could give them 6 stars, I would.  Will definitely be coming back here anytime I'm in Christchurch.   TL:DR -- amazing small plate Mexican food, excellent hot sauces, and well crafted drinks   Food: we split plates of tacos and patatas fritas (amazingly seasoned potato cubes) but the menu of small plates all looked exceptional.  Tacos were all delicious.    Drinks: don't overthink it, just get a margarita and kick back and relax, the margaritas are exceptional   Atmosphere: cool funky vibe with interesting Mexican-inspired art but with a modern funky take

If you are visiting Christchurch and happen to be from somewhere that actually has Mexican food, then you should skip this place. They are confusing burnt and bland as Mexican. Expensive, small portions and not worth it. A very disappointing end to what was a nice trip.
Amazing.  Go here. You won't regret it.  Awesome food and margarita selection.   Sweet as!
Decent food. This is the only place where we found other people. Ask for a mezcal margarita! They don't have it on menu but they will make it for you.

I would give it the lowest stars I could   First of all they are not at all accommodating with topping we asked for green peppers and beans on our tacos and they said no   Specially if you are a vegetarian you shouldn't go there   They have a very limited menu and especially only couple things for Vegetarians   I wouldn't recommend it at all
Great place , super food , friendly staff , highly recommended !! Enough veg options  Dessert took a little time to come , but to be fair they were busy !!

The food here was great. The family and I stopped here our first night in Christchurch. It is definitely not traditional Mexican food, I would consider it more gourmet with a twist. I had the crispy calamari, amazing and tasted very fresh. My family also got the caramelized beef special, the chicken enchilada, and some tacos. Everything had good flavor just unlike the Mexican food I'm used to in Texas. The only negatives were that portions were small and the food did take a long time to come out.

This isn't your typical Mexican restaurant! It's gourmet Mexican food served in small portions - so you can order a lot and try a lot, especially if you go family style.   - Black bean and bacon dip with plantain chips: 3 stars. Good but not exceptional.  - Fried chicken: 5 stars. Crispy and flavorful. With 2 different but equally delicious creamy dipping sauces.  - Pork cheek barbacoa soft taco: 5 stars. Flavorful and the pork goes so well with the pineapple elements in this taco! - Pipian chicken soft taco: 4 stars. Solid. Nice crunch from the sunflower seeds.   One downside: the first night we came was a Monday around 8:15pm. While waiting to be seated, we were turned away and told that they were closing early because it wasn't busy enough. What?! Disappointing and weird from an American standpoint - maybe this is normal and acceptable in Christchurch though? I don't know.

Mexican fried chicken was delicious! Aqua Frescas too! Mushroom quesadillas we should have passed on.   Family style seating was fine until a couple decided to share the one bench with my wife and the elderly man needed a lesson on personal space. Maybe he just wanted to rub elbows with her. Lol!

I'm from the US and Mexican food is a staple in my life. We have so many great Mexican restaurants where I'm from and this place tops them all. The food was unique, delicious, fresh and hot. We loved the interior and the service! We ended up buying all five bottles of their homemade hot sauces.
Wow this place. Wow! Woah wow wowowowow. Great food. Wow. Nice people. Just don't go at peak times. Wow.

Went there today with the family. Food was fast out and very tasty! Guacamole was nice, but could do with some more spicing up. Quesadillas for the kids were very nice. For mains, we tried all the different soft shell tacos on offer. All very good, nicely spiced without just being hot. My favorite was the chicken taco. Kids finished with a vanilla ice with cinnamon churros. I was lucky to score some of the delicious fresh warm churros of one of the little people! Our waiter was attentive and friendly. Overall one of the best Mexican dinners I've had in NZ.
Awesome night out great food ,fantastic service and staff. I went with a group of friends cool atmosphere and music we'd Highly recommend it.

So excited to check out this joint as hubby and I hail from a tex-mex state of mind in the states. The decor is spot on and the music sends you straight to Cozumel. We put our name down for a table for 2 (1 hour wait) and headed to the bar area for drinks and snacks. Reservations are only accepted for groups 6 or more, so be prepared to wait for dinner reservations.   In the bar area, the whole menu is provided for the bar area though only snacks and tacos are available for purchase. Upon seeing that, we canceled our table, ate tacos and salsa and had a caraf of margs. The guac and salsa was solid, but our chips were stale. :-/ Their tacos however, are DELICIOUS! Small portion size but healthy and filling. Definitely reminds me of Southern California's take on Mexican. Order the lamb if it's on special and don't miss out on the chicken! The prices are also extremely affordable which is great. My gripe with the menu is that it is extremely limited. Where are the enchilladas? One third of the page is food, one third advertising and one third drinks. I'd like to see more dinner options available.   The staff still seems a little overwhelmed (give the people some credit, it's brand new!) but our drink order was forgotten as they have a confusing system of who handles the drink orders. Keeping drink orders to the respective seating area (bar v dining area) will stop that in the future. Also, to pay our tab we had to go to two different people (the front of the house and then back to the bar to get our card). There are still some inefficiencies to work out here. I'm confident they will be soon fixed. I will say though that the staff is eager to please and will do whatever it takes to make sure you leave happy. And we did! Definitely take some time to check this spot out and bring back the CBD!

Go for the creative and tasty food - NOT for the margaritas.  We ordered a non-virgin rosewater margarita.  It came virginal.  When we mentioned it to the waiter, he smelled the carafe and told us it indeed contained tequila.  We complained again when the bill came.  The manager came to talk with us, asking us  if we knew how to make a margarita, telling us that Mexico's margaritas are designed to not have a tequila taste and questioning our experience of what a good margarita tastes like.  After I asked him if he was making us wrong he backed off and took the cost of the margaritas off the bill.  The manager would have been ahead had he just asked us what we needed to make us happy - eliminating the difference between the virgin and non-virgin option would have done it...but his arguing with us has just made us more unhappy.  We've been to Mexico in Wellington and Christchurch.  The food is creative and tasty and we particularly appreciate their attention to providing gluten free options but we'll never order margaritas here.  Their original margarita (ordered in Wellington) wasn't very good and this rosewater variation in Christchurch wasn't good either.  Based on two tries we conclude Mexico doesn't "get" margaritas.
Fantastic food value for money , We are pure vegetarian an they made us good veg nachos , veg burrito, veg quesadilla..
Got served old fish that stunk. This made our whole family sick, they need some education in food safety. The worst part is the staff couldn’t care less
If you like mexican,  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND coming here! Food was amazing!!!! Not to mention the tequila tasting board. Along with the sour apple feijoa and margaritas cocktail jugs!! Deliciouses!!!!
Atmosphere, vibe, staff, food; everything was amazing. Margaritas were exceptional. Definitely going back!

I’ve been many times and have never had a bad experience but tonight had bad service and some bad food. Went for a friends birthday and it was an unpleasant experience The Birria tacos were not good, my one was a cold and chewy as was my friends. The pork belly tacos were yum however and the fried chicken. We also had 4 different issues with missing/incorrect items and when we politely asked for them to be fixed we were met with rude behaviours, not from all the staff but definitely a few. Not sure if it’s a change of owners or just bad service but I would not go on a Monday night again

Being from Texas, we are more demanding about our Mexican food. The chicken enchiladas of the day had spaghetti sauce on it! Very odd and not very good. Margaritas had no alcohol. A disappointment all round. Not recommended.

I visited in Mexico restaurant on Saturday night .place was really awesome because of restaurant located in Christchurch city center. I placed the order chicken burrito , pork belly bite, beef nachos, really food was too yummy , delicious, i never had like this food in my life, i specifically thanks to chef’s team and thanks to Service team , they  give us Personalized Service , good attitude, also Margarita drink was really awesome . Thanks to Mexico Christchurch team . I will visit again very soon . And I recommend to everyone visit one time in Christchurch Mexico Restaurant.*****
Not very nice, taste has changed. Service was amazing but the food wasn't
We had lunch from the buffet on Saturday. The food was really good, and the service was great too. The menu had a nice variety with starters, mains and desserts. Definitely worth the price!
Great Indian buffet had some of the best foods, ps have their yogurt based sauce otherwise it may have a bit of a kick to it
Very unprofessional…ordered a cake and asked for pink colour inside but they added yellow and little bit pink colour
Really lovely food

So good we thanked the chef personally! Do not sleep on this place it’s insanely good!! Everything was a 10/10 for all four of us. One diner saying it’s the best meal out they have ever had. Entree was prawn Rangoon, coconut prawns, blue cod bites, and spicy chicken wings. Mains were the pad see yu, beef cheek curry, lamb shank massamam and sweet and sour chicken. Big portions and you could taste love on the plate. Will be back and will happily pay full price for every dish.

Walking through Christchurch we decided to take a punt on this Irish pub for dinner.... Oh my! What a find! The menu is mainly Thai and it's probably the best Thai I have ever eaten. Balanced, fresh and just perfection. Do yourself a favour and walk in, take a punt, you won't regret it.

We stumbled across this place looking for a meal. It didn't disappoint. The food was truly amazing with a delicious green curry and chicken fried rice. To top off the evening we also had a live duo playing music and singing songs we all enjoyed. Great place great service great atmosphere.
Went in Monday night so was quiet. Staff were super friendly. $6 Murphy’s on tap and great Thai food (at an Irish pub… I know)!
Service was awesome. Food was tasty and very generous. Would definitely return!

My family and I came here to celebrate my sisters birthday last night. They were very busy, but service was great, Yoshi? (Not sure if this is his name sorry!) Looked after us and went out of his way to provide amazing service. The food was great, especially the Sticky Short Ribs and Pork and Prawn Shumai. Will definitely recommend and be back again :)

Booked one of the private karaoke rooms for a hen do, and it was such a wonderful venue! Drinks and food orders taken in the room, and then delivered. They had a great selection of songs, and our bride to be had the best time :)

Very poor service. The staff were standing around chatting and were inattentive. We had to shase staff down to take our food and drink orders, despite the restaurant being very quiet.  The food was excellent though and we especially enjoyed the duck. Great value for money and large portions. I would recommend the sweet and sour pork and the golden cauliflower.
Great food and Karaoke is great fun for a night out. Staff are super nice.
Outstanding. Highly recommend.
Great food and choices lovely venue. Food was great quality and tasty.

Upon recommendation from our friends, we stopped into Midnight Shanghai for dinner. We were seated on the back patio -- a covered open-air patio with limited seating. We ordered a lot of food including the red chili fish in broth, a tempura style cauliflower, scallion pancakes, mapo tofu, veggie gyoza (dumplings) and the veggie stir-fry noodles. The food comes out as it's ready, and dishes are great for sharing. This works out well for a long meal, except that our noodles came out about 20 minutes after the rest of the food (and we were about ready to leave). We ended up taking that whole dish to go (takeaway) after it was served.   My personal favorite was the chili fish -- the broth was spicy and delicious -- but everything on the menu was great!

Arrived at 8:30 for a quick bite after landing in CHCH and turned away as kitchen closed (9pm doors close so thought I'd have time).  I haven't rated food as didn't have any.  Place look good and people inside having fun.  Service not great as waitress left me waiting to be seated (or not seated) while chatting to people for 5mins before saying kitchen closed. 5mins feels like an eternity to be given that message.

Such a lovely spot! The food tastes super fresh and the staff make you feel really welcome. Highly recommend if you’re craving good Japanese food in Christchurch. If you haven’t tried it yet, you really should — it’s absolutely worth a try!
It was my first time at a buffet restaurant! The food was amazing — delicious and fresh, and the staff were super friendly and kind! I really loved it. I’ll definitely be back
Nice Japanese food. Good taste compare to another buffet
Food coming too slow and not good service, $80 per person plus drinks
Beautiful kai and staff were so warm and welcoming as soon as we entered. Service was prompt despite the packed restaurant - will definitely be returning!
Great food selection and amazing customer service.
Edamame is not fresh
Perfect afternoon with fabulous food and an all round great experience.  I particularly liked how Ollie found time to chat with us. What a lovely young man. Thank you Miro 5 stars
The food here is fantastic, but the service needs attention.

I had brunch here a couple of weekends ago after my hen's do and wow! Everything was fantastic. The food was delicious, service was attentive and quick, and the building was lovely. I had the braised lamb pie which was fantastic, not too big and presented beautifully. The coffee was also 10/10, so good I ordered two! I had such a good experience that I had to come back the weekend after. (I had the eggs benedict with fried chicken during my second visit, mouth watering stuff!) I walk past here every morning on my way to work and can't believe I've never been before, it's without a doubt one of the top brunch/lunch spots in Christchurch. Highly recommend!

Sweet lunch achieved. Soul satisfied! Everyone orders "French Toast," but this distant relative of mine takes a more elegant approach, definitely not inferior to Hong Kong-style cafes!  More of my food finds on IG: @ida_chch
Always beautiful food and great service, great coffee too
Delicious food, laid back ambience, friendly staffs, enough said. Egg benedict was my personal favourite.

restaurant: Mischief With Wine Cellardoor and Wine Bar

reviews.text: Very good wine tasting experience for NZD10 only and affordable bottles at NZD24. Tasting is waived if purchasing a bottle. My favs were the Sauv Blanc and Syrah. Owner Adam was really friendly.
Loved the Riesling!
A delightful cellar door
Thanks for the loan of the wine glasses! Wine was delicious !

Great wine in a very relaxed food market in the heart of the city. If you come to the Riverside Market in Christchurch, this is the place to enjoy a variety of wines, including awesome withes and velvety reds.

We’ve been to Miso Susui and Donduri a few times now while working in the area, and every visit has been excellent. The food is always fresh, full of flavour, and beautifully presented. The service is quick, friendly, and always welcoming with a big smile. It’s become one of my go-to spots, and we’ll definitely keep coming back whenever we are near by.

The food is incredibly delicious and clean, and after eating, I feel so healthy that I think they must use great ingredients. I want to give this restaurant the highest score of my life. The staff and the owner are also so kind and nice that I'll definitely visit again! K-food is the best! ♡
Best sushi I’ve had in years very impressed
Everything was perfect It was really yum and service was good. Highly recommend here
Excellent rice balls. Best in town. Friendly and helpful staff.
Delicious sushi, great service :)

Don't know how many times we've been here.  Great authentic food.  Miss Peppercorn never disappoints.  Beef salad and the crispy pancakes are an absolute must every time.  Sumner is much nicer than fighting traffic, parking in the middle of town.

Visited MrPippaCorn on a hot, sunny day and tried the Bang Bang Noodle. The noodles were perfectly chewy, and the sauce was incredible—authentic, flavorful, with just the right amount of numbness from the Sichuan pepper. The only downside? Protein was a bit light for $19.  Overall, pretty satisfying—a great spot for anyone craving bold, authentic noodles.

First time here and the food is great. Pick you main and get some appetiser's, as they're tasty.  You will want to book a table, as this place has people arriving all the time that I noticed.  Two tap beers (same company) and the rest bottles with a good selection of other drinks.  Allow some time for parking, you might get lucky with a spot on the main road. Small streets can also be busy (during hot Summer days)
Extremely good food and very nice service! Thanks for being always so nice, even if you're really busy!
Must have noodles!
Excellent Pho! Hot and delicious. Friendly.
Still quick for how busy it gets, and very friendly staff. Don’t forget to get coriander on your food if you like it spicy. It’s the best Vietnamese food in CHCH
A favourite gem in Chechnya CBD. Always delicious and tasty.. superb service. The best in the city.  Food is great and service is awesome.
The fresh spring rolls were great!
Tried the Pho and it was alright, could of been more punchy. It wasn't  bad it just wasn't great same with the spring rolls.

Best cafe experience I've ever had. The guy behind the counter was super friendly without being creepy and the waiter was hilarious entertainment while joking with all the tables he was serving. I ordered a peice of Spanish omelete for $9 which came out 50% bigger than I assumed it would (a slice and a half) as well as a side of greens. It was warmed to perfection and came out just after my coconut milk latte. The coffee was strong and tasty. Heaps of tables inside and outside, good for families or a solo traveler, like me. Everything was perfect!
The best sushi shop in Christchurch! Always fresh, always tasty and always friendly service!! 100% would recommend!
Consistently excellent food and friendly service.
Reliable. Always busy. Guarantee not to get a seat. More a grab and go
Was pretty ordinary Thai food, and not likely to go there again.
Very nice Fried rice.
Moneybags makes the best chicken penang curry ever - absolutely my favorite
Excellent food and  service from this thai takeaway
Delicious Thai and lovely people :)
My favourite Thai takeaway! Very friendly service always & the food is consistently great.
Awesome food, awesome service!

Hit up Monster Chicken last night. We had no reservation but snagged a table.  The place quickly filled up soon after we arrived. Having lived in Korea for 6 years and visiting many a Chicken Hof I know what good Chicken is, but didn't really expect t it to stand up to the real deal.  Got the Monster Platter, Aracini Kimchi balls and a serving of chicken tenders.  Cost was just over $90 for three people.   This was no Korean Chicken hof , but still enjoyed it. The place needed cold kegs of cass and 1 litre steins to make it really special

Such slow service ( 40 minutes) then food very average. Over cooked greasy chips. Salad was lettuce mix with tomato drowned in balsamic, teriyaki wings nice. Classic chicken had an odd taste like the oil was odd.

Had the garlic chicken and the soy ginger chicken. It wasn't good. The chicken was soggy and super fatty. The sauces were basically the same except one had pickled ginger the other had garlic chips and cloves. This restaurant really needs to learn how to fry chicken so that it is crispy! The salad dressing was tasty but they put so much on there it was over whelming!

Back to back fried chicken reviews to start 2019.. I think we can agree fried chicken is great, and when it's Korean style well damn Jackie! But if we're talking best it wasn't quite there.  It's a smallish place but still has about 8 - 10 tables. Dark interior. My favorite part of the decor was the trip advisor awards they had all over their restaurant walls. There were I think 4. And they only had a 4.2, so they really were proud of that low 4. And I love that they maybe thought that would be the deciding factor for someone to eat there. "Well I'm not sure if I want anything but I'm already here in the restaurant. man... That 4.2 on trip advisor really sold me. I'll stay!"  Ok anyways.. Chicken was pretty good. A bit dry. They put sauces on top so the chicken soaks it up if you don't eat quick. But a nice addition. You can choose from like 8 flavors. Photo will be listed. I tried Sweet Chili. Just enough kick to make it taste good. They also have a chili bang bang flavor which is about as hot as you wound expect. Sampled it and I felt like I was shot in the mouth. Pun intended. $18nzd for a portion. The portion size is really big too, enough for 2 people easily.  They serve alcohol too fyi. Something about fried chicken and beer drives Koreans crazy. I dig it too.   Next time I think I'll carry out. And try a new flavor. But I'm no hurry.
Took quite a while for food to come. Waiter was not receptive to custom order. Always good food nonetheless

The food was amazing. We ordered the Monster Platter and it was the best thing ever. The portion sizes of the food was good and would recommend getting the Monster Platter if you're with friends. Overall the whole atmosphere of the place was nice and staff are super friendly.

Visited last weekend and there was a handful of parking spaces available when got inside the interior looked clean, and there was plenty of tables available to choose from. For drinks, I ordered coke and a oreo milkshake. The milkshake came in a little mason jar, and oreo flavor was diluted with milk, so was pretty mid. For food I ordered the Monster Platter which includes 2 choice of fried chicken (garlic and parmesan), 4 garlic bread, potato fries, cabbage salad, aioli and monster pickle. The chicken was delicious and flavorful and all the sides complimented each other. The only criticism I had was the pickle wasn't chilled, came out room temperature. Beyond the service being average, I left very satisfied.

We visited Monster Chicken in Christchurch and tried their Chilli Bang Bang Hot Korean Chicken and waffle fries. The chicken wasn’t as spicy as we expected for a “hot” option, but it was still tasty. The waffle fries were nice too. The place has good indoor seating and is worth a one-time visit to try something different.

Monster Chicken is my favorite. I used to eat one chicken a week in Korea, so you can trust me.  Check-in 9/15 Check-in 10/13 Check-in 10/22 (Highly recommend the Snowing Waffle Fries. They're similar to Ppurinkle.)
Great vibe,staff were fun and friendly.  The food was very good. Surroundings were rustic. Nice outdoor seating as well in the afternoon sun.
Friendly staff and good food.
Great bar with a buzzing energy, rotating the beers on tap always keeps things fresh. bring in a Guiness for us boring people
Fantastic venue to sample a wide selection of tasty beverages. Best of all, they do tasting paddles, so you can sample more flavors!

If you want to eat at 6pm then order at 6pm the night before,wait time is way to long for me,cant call this fast food,any way the Mrs got us steak,blackbean sauce on fried rice & it was disgusting,worst Chinese food ive ever had,tasted like everything in it was old stale shit...never again
Awesome huge servings of great tasting food. 1 order was easily enough for 2 people. During winter the wait is very cold.
Mean feed even better portion

Was it worth the 45min wait as a walk in order, yes yes it was. Huuuge portion, going to last me 3-4 meals. Taste fresh too, not greasy. Very cold in the shop and recommend phoning ahead as you will cut your wait time in half.
Best Japanese curry I’ve ever had
Great wee restaurant for casual dining, fantastic food and warm atmosphere. Really delicious food, great service. Thank you so much We will definitely come back here :)
Was a lovely experience, delicious food and great service from the staff. Would recommend to anyone considering visiting. Thanks
It's a small family restaurant that offers Japanese dishes and Japanese beer on tap. It's a bit of a secret and it shouldn't be.

Went there for a quiz night and what might of been an extra busy night which was quite nice and vibey. But I think that made the quiz started 40 mins late.  Food was nice but the meat needed seasoning. I would go back a 2nd time it was nice.
Awesome service and staff!! Had my birthday celebration here and Jesse really looked after us 10/10 recommend checking this place out!!
A must visit place on any Saturday morning.....rain or shine when in Christchurch. Totally impressed

Morrell and Co has such a warm and welcoming vibe. The food was a highlight- we shared a few platters and everything was absolutely delicious. The juicy, crispy chicken burgers were a hit, and the flavourful  falafel really stood out, as did the perfectly fried cauliflower florets. The ambience is lovely, especially with those high ceilings, and the staff were super friendly and helpful. Highly recommended for a casual meet and greet or a relaxed catch-up with friends
Great food, great staff, clean and tidy, good beer. Will definitely go back soon

This is the hotspot to be for happy hour or before a concert/sporting event at Horncastle or AMI Stadium. I hope you like meatballs! Most of the menu is dedicated to meatballs served many ways. Not a meatball lover? Fear not, there are other pasta/meat/pizza options as well as a small bites menu that features chips, dumplings and the like. Great finger food for sharing with friends. This place gets ROWDY, particularly before a big event, so don't plan to come here on some intimate date. I also highly recommend a booking (weeks in advance for a big night) if you want guaranteed seats. The place fills up fast. It is expensive, but it deserves to be as it's arguably one of the best dinner options on Lincoln (for now).

I walked around Christschurch for hours looking for something that caught my eye and this did! Very inviting exterior with open patio leading into the bar. I love the open interior with subtle breaks in the space to add dimension. The style is classy mixed with sports bar, something doe everyone!   The service was friendly, helpful, and fast!  The bathroom was so pretty I took a picture. I also love free wifi being I'm just visiting and have no other phone access. They don't hide it with passwords or usage restrictions, very easy.   Full bar and lots of delicious brews on tap. I paired my veggie nacho with a crisp apple cider. The nacho, veggie option was loaded with portobello mushrooms! No skimping for the vegetarians here!   No complaints here would highly recommend!

Food is pretty good. Meatballs are their thing and they do them well in a variety of guises. We tried them in the pizza, the shepherds pie and the hoagie. Restaurant area is cordoned off from the restaurant behind screens which seems rather weird and unnecessary. Place was pretty empty, and the restaurant seems to be a bit of an after thought. No matter, it all worked pretty well.

This place is awesome. Something for everyone. The food is the highlight! Decor is comfortable and service friendly. The bar snacks are awesome and the ribs would go close to being the best I have had. 6 stars out of 5!

YES.  This place is so unique. A restaurant/Bar where the dining area is nicely seperated from the bar area which is quite a large space.   The menu is pretty unique. You pick your meat for your meatballs, your style of having them. Straight, with pasta, in a pizza and many more, and then you pick your sauce.  Dessert: I highly recommend the mars bar bread and butter pudding.

Just in Christchurch for a night and looked for something beyond burgers and fries. The chicken tangine was moist and tender with delicious couscous. The parcel we ordered was also very good- would come back for sure. Be sure to order the assorted dips tapas!

Dined in for lunch, had the Burrata which was really nice! Dosent say it on the menu but it comes with bread. We found the daiquiris to be a bit strong. New menu looks good! Good vegetarian options. Really lovely service from the staff.
Our little French helper was just amazing
Great views of Chch CBD, cool atmosphere, & friendly staff

Great food! Salmon sashimi is the best I’ve ever had! Plus wonderful live music from Mac & Mates band. TJ was such a wonderful singer and with the beautiful saxophone. We were so enjoyed our night out.

Went out for dinner with my friend to catch up and have some drinks. Our server Eli was so amazing tonight, such good service and was super friendly. The drinks and food were amazing too. The other bartenders working that night were amazing, super cool staff

Great atmosphere, lovely rooftop experience. High enough to get a view, low enough that people and dog watching is possible! Good spirits, good cocktail menu and classics are available on request. The southside was delightful.

restaurant: Mr Charcoal - CHCH炭烧时代基督城店

reviews.text: The third time visit today as in town and not many places were open on the public holiday. Definitely not as good as the first visit which was back in Dec. The fish was good with generous spices at that time. So went back had screwers in pot, didn’t like it as it was quite pale, ingredients weren’t really quality, this was back in Feb. Thought I’d give another go, tried bbq today. They were a bit dry, not enough flavours. We trusted the lady said that’s all you ordered. Then after left, we realised they missed at least 2 things. So if you do go there, make sure they’ve got all you ordered. Worth to check by yourselves. There is not much service now at this place, probably they are getting more tours, no time to look after small group customers. Takes longer to serve, the place is quite loud with people from tours yelling at each other. Thought they’d do good in Christchurch, quite disappointed and definitely not going back.
Mr Charcoal was very good, need to google some menu items as there are not descriptions haha, lovely people and lovely enviroment full of laughs and fun :)
South Island No.1 Chinese BBQ.
has a bad attitude
Bit pricy but food is yum would come back again
Very delicious, very friendly, would definitely recommend
Highly recommend for unique Thailand food.
Delicious food. My daughter and I love the katsu chicken. Plus I'm a uber driver and I love picking up from this place. The owners are so nice and friendly and are very quick at giving me my order.
A very good restaurant I always order on uber eats.foods are very tasty and delicious.very good customer service.if you in christchurch do ordered from here
I come here all the time, my favorite local food stop. The service is friendly and fast and the food is amazing!
The service was excellent — staff were friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu. The ambiance was calm and inviting, perfect for a relaxed meal or a special night out.

Past there around 5:30pm, went in & saw what many other reviewers have mentioned the $10 for 2 deals. Got two boxes of mixed sushi and two crispy chicken rice balls. The pieces of mixed sushi were decent. I was told the 2 rice balls I chosed were crispy chicken & that's what we wanted. But the crispy chicken within tasted like just the crumb coating & only bits of shredded chicken mixed thru. Thought I might have just been unlucky with the first rice ball but the other one we took home was the same. A whole lot of rice & about slightly over a tablespoon of chopped up crumbs. Hope this is not what people are paying full price for. Even though I got what was the end of the day sale...it felt like a total rip off with the crumbs. Ate a lot of crispy chicken rice balls elsewhere but none of them were like these ones. Really strange, baffled & kids really disappointed! I've added the photo to show what was inside & the ratio between "crispy chicken" & rice

Hands down the best sushi spot in Christchurch! Honestly, Mr Katsu is my go-to place. The sushi is always fresh and tasty, and when they do their daily discounts it’s such a steal. The vibe’s awesome — super chill, friendly, and welcoming.  The guy at the front is an absolute legend — always greets me with a smile and somehow remembers what I like every time. Feels less like eating out and more like catching up with mates. Love the energy here, easily my #1 sushi spot in town!
Great value and delicious!
Delicious food, superb customer service with very generous portions using quality ingredients.... I'm sure you won't be disappointed

2 Sushi Boxes for $10?! Absolute Steal!   Scored big in Christchurch today — picked up 2 sushi boxes for just $10! That’s only $5 each, and honestly, the value is insane. Perfect for students, lunch breaks, or anyone balling on a budget    What’s inside each box:  Grilled rice ball with sesame & furikake  Salmon & avocado roll (creamy and fresh)  Tuna salad sushi (rich and flavorful)  Teriyaki eel nigiri (soft, sweet, and so satisfying)  Veggie sushi roll (light and refreshing)  Even though it’s a pre-packed cold sushi box, the quality is way above what you’d expect at this price. The eel nigiri was the star — tender and coated in sweet sauce, totally restaurant-quality.   Ate it straight from the car — quick, easy, and super satisfying. No wait, no fuss. Just grab and go.   Next time I’m definitely trying their rice bowls — they looked just as delicious!
Delicious, fresh sushi & friendly service.
Yammy my sushi last dinner. Seemed quite large and fresh. I'd never tried brown  rice sushi before. Feel so healthy.  the nice taste made me  happy.  I'd go back soon.
I’m Japanese though, this shop’s all kind of foods Sushi, Donburi and Miso Soup are awesome!!! I really love all of them! We can enjoy Japanese taste!
A hidden gem. Fresh and delicious, fast sushi takeaways or soul-warming main entrees.

Oh my goodness! This hidden gem of a Japanese eatery is an ideal spot for a lunchtime visit. They craft various delightful Dons that are not only visually stunning but also bursting with delicious flavors. Each dish is freshly prepared and elegantly presented in distinctive bowls, providing a rich cultural and culinary experience.
I can't fault the sushi. One of the best in town.
All  are amazing there. Service is great.
Horribly sweet teriyaki salad with a very basic salad for $20. Wouldn't return
Terrible service food took 30 minutes laughed at me about my order
Thoroughly enjoy coming here.  Lovely staff, yammy food, good variety, reasonably priced and excellent service.  One of lovely sunny autumn day, I will take sushi away to hegley park Thank you
Good food and Good response from the staff and the owner . One of the best sushi shop in Christchurch love it . And at last best take away service from the shop.
Alway polite, fast ,fresh and tasty. Whenever I'm at the Colombo i have to have the best sushi in chch.
Always great range of vegetarian options here
I used to come every day until they stopped making the Spicy Tofu Dragon Roll   Bring it back and I’ll change to 5 stars.
Delicious sushi, freshly made. The mushroom inari is a favourite.
You will not disappointed. Lovely service and yummy sushi
Very nice food and service. My favorite inner city sushi place
Delicious sushi! Perfect for a quick bite or a nice relax and catch up over some yummy, very fresh sushi.

This was major surprise in Christchurch. The sushi is fresh, tasty and beautifully presented. The service was friendly, polite, and efficient. I enjoyed selecting my own special plate of exactly what I wanted. Kind of like a stationary sushi train where you can get single serves of what you like instead of committing to a plate. Amazing.
Best sushi in chch
Delicious. Great iced mocha coffee.
Good sushi tad more expensive then St Pierre sushi

My partner and I had a total of 14 pieces of sushi + a coke to share between us. It cost us $54 dollars! This is such an overpriced restaurant and wouldn’t recommend coming. However, the atmosphere was relaxed and modern.
Great Sushi.
Great service and you can't go wrong choosing what's soothing for you! Amazing staff very friendly I recommend this place for all ages and gatherings.
Best Sushi round my favorite
Great Indian food, spicy and yummy .  I really enjoyed it Every time I feel like having Indian food I come here
Great food as always and service. Top effort team Mumbaiwala A+++
Great food
Really great food, good flavors. Fast service.
Amazing food delicious and very affordable definitely will be coming back
Good food and ambiance. A decent restaurant in christchurch downtown for someone craving indian food. A little on the pricey side but food was good.

Flavour-packed, generous portions, great service!  Stopped in for a casual lunch and was seriously impressed. The butter chicken was rich and creamy without being overly sweet, and the naan was fresh and fluffy -- straight out of the tandoor.  Service was fast, friendly, and the portions were generous for the price. Plenty of vegetarian options too, which is always a win. Will definitely be back to try more of the menu!
Service was great, ambience is solid, and food was exceptional. I highly recommend this place!
The food was great and different from what I normally have.  Service was on point and quite quick.  It's a bit loud but it's because it was very busy.  We all enjoyed our meals and would recommend.

Wow! We had an awesome meal at Mumbaiwala. Although two of us ordered four dishes, we weren't too full because they didn't come with rice and weren't as rich as some Indian food. The Prawn Koliwada was six prawns in amazing spices with a dipping sauce. The Sev Puri are small discs with yummy toppings. Not spicy. The Chaat Dal Chaat were toasted lentils with green apples and other spices. The Palak Panner Tikka was paneer cheese that was lightly charred with spinach, tomato and onion. We loved sharing every dish!

You can't miss this place, they are bumping modern Indian music with a flare of EDM/hip hop beats that make you want to dance as you walk by and then question yourself as why you weren't invited to what seems like such a fun party.   Fear Not - this place is not one that requires reservations a month in advance. Show up and be ready for your taste buds to go on an adventure way more exciting than Frodo's Trip to Mordor!  *IF YOU DONT LIKE SPICY FOODS - READ THE MENU CAREFULLY* This place packs the heat!!  Foe those crazy souls still down to test your mouths limits, you've come to the right place.  As soon as you walk in, you'll smell the charcoal burning that's smoking the meats right in front of you. This place makes your dish fresh to order - no hidden microwaves in the back.  Every bite I had was better than the last.  Tandodi Chicken Wings were smokey, salty, and spicy. Use the lemon wedge provided to give that extra acidity and really take this dish over the edge.  Kadai Chicken was thick, complex, tender, and spicy!  It was not as sauce-heavy as a butter chicken, but there was enough sauce to be great over rice. We also ordered the Garlic Naan and it was a perfect addition.   Green Apple Pickle - I wasn't sure about this at first, but I'm so glad we got this side dish. I enjoy spicy food, but I'm no wildfire warrior that can swallow spice without grimace. These Apple bits were the perfect palate cleanser and really reset my mouth before each dish. Still crunchy, and slightly tart, the apples were refreshing and crisp - a welcome reprieve for a mouth slowly catching on fire.  Overall, this place was INCREDIBLE, probably some of the best Indian Food I've ever had (not lucky enough to make it to India yet).

INCREDIBLE MEAL - best Indian food i've had outside of India!  Kripy helped us when we were trying to figure out what we wanted...everything she brought was fantastic! Definitely will return and recommend!

We didn't feel like going out so ordered take out from Mumbaiwala. I mentioned this only because none of the previous reviews, or indeed the restaurant's own  website mentions that this is available. Maybe it's a given in this part of the world. They don't deliver though. I had a very tasty lamb curry with very good garlic naan. My dining companions shared a chicken dish and a veggie option which isn't my cup of darjeeling but whatever makes your day ! Recommended.

Really excellent find. We are foodie Indian Americans from Los Angeles. In Christchurch for 2 nights. Went there last night.   Had ginger and chili themed cocktails.   The Vindaloo chicken wings was excellent. The waitress said it was spicy hot, but not for our palates.  We also had karhai chicken and the special lamb dish. With a regular and a garlic naan.  Finished with kulfis.   Had leftovers for breakfast next morning.   Very good.
Tastiest chaat in town. Paani Poori, Dahi Poori, Dabeli, Puri Chole were all spectacular and authentic. Great service too.

In my admittedly limited experience, having spent only two weeks in Australia and New Zealand, Mumbaiwala serves up some of the finest Indian food available to Her Majesty's antipodean realms.  The vindaloo chicken wings blew me away with their tenderness and flavour. The butter chicken (yes, I know, bog standard) was some of the best I've tasted anywhere.    I must ding them for one small thing, though, the "naan chips" were nearly indistinguishable from the crispy noodles served in Chinese restaurants in the States with egg drop soup.  Even with this, I can't deduct any stars, the rest of the meal was just too good.   Really well done, Mumbaiwala.
Fantastic service, delicious food, fabulous drinks. This is the perfect spot to meet with friends and have a great night. Will definitely visit again soon!
Authentic look and feel of India in the restaurant. Food definitely doesn't disappoint. Everything tasted fresh and flavorful.
I always come here when i am in Christchurch. They have good indian food. And its really close to city center

Great find in Christchurch. Situated in city center this is a great indian dining place. Bombay chucked and butter corn as starters alongwith lime juice was excellent. Tried that dhal makhani and parsi mutton. Both great choices. Highly recommended if you are in Christchurch.

Good food, bad experience with the service. We booked a table for 8:30 pm on the website, unfortunately they were able to seat us only by 9:15. Our server took the our orders another 30 mins later and by the time we got our food, there was another hour's delay.  In their defense, our visit was on a Sat evening and they were definitely very busy. Also, I have to say that our server did everything possible to make it up to us. He gave us one of the appetizers complimentary as well as gave us an discount on the bill. Having said that, I'd rather pay for my food and enjoy the overall experience than go through this experience again.  I'd be happy to go back another day, probably a weekday to see the difference in service.

This place is amazing! We were traveling from San Francisco and SO happy we found this spot. This is seriously some of the best Indian food we have ever had.   The service was quick and friendly, the food was flavorful and filling.  5 stars all around!

Loved the ambiance. Little wait but wirth every extra minute we waited for sumptuous pav bhaji. Right in heart of Auckland. Wish you guys open a branch here in Bay Area, California.   Wishes from tour fans in USA!

Excellent prawns with this spicy butter sauce, the best garlic naan bread I've ever eaten, Indian masala chai, and Czech pilsner.  That's what I had at Mumbaiwala.  The meal was superb, and can even put Indian restaurants in Sydney, Los Angeles, San Francisco, New York, London, etc. to shame.  What a gem of a find in Christchurch!  Service was great, too, they do a great job of being polite and attentive without being overbearing like the tip-dependent staff sometimes are in North America.  Mumbaiwala isn't cheap, but you probably deserve to splurge.  I'd return.

I totally agree with the comments made by Bansal Corp a week back. The same sentiments are from customers -Vijay Shekhar - Husahnpreet Kaur  The behavior of the owner exactly mimics the name of the restaurant "mumbaiwala"  Which basically depicts street person with no customer centricity.Very arrogant and rude . No manners on how to deal with customers. The owner has Absolutely no idea about being customer focus This person Needs to stay in Mumbai rather than in a place like Christchurch  I had very good impression about people in NZ during my Trip so far but this owner really puts a black spot on my total impression Having said that my 99% experience in NZ was just fantastic. I am so so so glad that we left the restaurant without eating their and then were suggested one of the best Indian restaurants in Christchurch called Coriander. Thanks for the owners arrogance and his Mumbai tone ,  I will definitely not be recommending mumbaiwala to anybody in USA and being in field of public relations can at-least help over few thousand people to stay away from this restaurant and arrogant / rude behavior of the owner. My rating is -5 as I believe that if you cannot be good to your customers you should not be in the business of serving people  If anybody needs any more information Pl ping me and I will respond .

Love the decor and the food was delicious. We tried some new things and they were yummy. The waiter was very helpful in describing the dishes. The homemade mango chutney was smooth, sweet, and perfect with the crispy flat bread. We had the chicken curry; it had just the right amount of heat. When you are in Christchurch be sure and give them a try.
Upscale Indian restaurant. They were a lot in interiors and the whole theme, but food was average and pricey I felt. Good choice for once in a while

For anyone looking for good authentic Indian food - this is the place. Really impressed by the decor, service and the food. Must try the kadai chicken. Masala chai could have been better but still was close.
Absolutely amazing atmosphere. Good music. Friendly and helpful staff.  Ask about portion sizes as a few dishes are small.  Flavours are good. Reasonable price considering all of the above :)

Awesome selection and service-- this popular spot was packed on a Friday night, but the staff did a great job managing the crowd.  Plenty to Kingfisher flowing to wash down the spicy dishes, and they've even got a great butter chicken for us novices.  Would recommend in a heartbeat.
Great casual spot in the central city for a Bibimbap fix. Fast affordable menu with friendly faces.

We chose this restaurant as it was recommended and we were craving Asian towards the end of our NZ trip. It seems promising as the waiter attending to us was Korean. However, they weren't particularly friendly, and seemed curt at times. But the restaurant is very spacious and great for groups.   Banchan in comparison to what I am used to is sorely lacking. The dishes we ordered were not bad, but I have had better versions in other Korean restaurants, even all the way in Lake Tekapo.   Another thing I found a bit surprising was this restaurant serving both Japanese and Korean cuisine when the two are quite distinctively different. We did not try any Japanese food though so this review is based solely on the Korean dishes we had.
I had bibimbob and my hubby got spicy seafood soup. Both dishes were delicious!  The restaurant was very clean and spacious. I want to try other dishes next time.

Great Korean food in Christchurch!  We got the spicy squid which was perfectly spicy and the lamb BBQ because that seemed like the appropriately New Zealand thing to do. The lamb flavor pairs surprisingly well with the Korean BBQ flavors, I would've never thought.

We we're excited to see a Korean restaurant recommended by Lonely Planet so we decided to try this place out. First off, it seems like a happening place because it's open 24 hours and they allow you to BYO drinks so everyone was walking in with bottles of beer and wine!  I noticed that all the wait staff was Korean so perhaps my expectations were a bit high.  We ordered the lamb BBQ (since this is something I've never had at a Korean restaurant), the soon tofu soup, and the beef wraps.  The lamb BBQ was the best thing we had, it had pretty good flavor.  Unfortunately, the soon tofu soup was a disappointment, it was spicy but watery at the same time.  Beef wraps were essentially bulgogi wrapped in rice paper.  The banchan (side dishes) were a bit lackluster.  I was glad to try a Korean restaurant in New Zealand, but unfortunately, my mum's Korean cooking is better.  :)

Had dinner which was reasonably priced with a good blend of Japanese and korean. Despite two other large parties we didn't have to wait long for our meals. Host was incredibly friendly and polite. Good atmosphere and would go again.
Great little place.  Has a nice lunch menu and is reasonably priced.  Staff are also very helpful and inviting.

Bar tender Libby was great! Made us on off menu ‘Dark & Stormy’ cocktail that perfectly complimented the gloomy weather. It was also hilarious watching her sprint down the street after a customer who forgot his wallet, next level service!
The Quiz night was different from the usual ones I've been to. It was shorter but  a lot of fun. The food and cocktails were good as well.

We’ve had the pleasure of hosting many singles events at Muy Muy, and the collaboration & experience has always been exceptional. The team consistently goes above and beyond, from helping generate interest to providing outstanding support before and during our events. The staff are always welcoming and professional, and our guests leave with smiles every time.  Muy Muy and the Double Dribble Group are very professional in the best way possible and we’re so grateful for their ongoing support in helping us build a vibrant singles community here in Christchurch. Highly recommend!
Great live music!
Meaty tacos = Very very yum yum.

We visited on Halloween and loved it! The service was unexpectedly fast despite the crowd. The atmosphere was perfect, and the food was great. The margaritas were a bit too sweet and stronger than I expected  just my personal taste.
I like their food,some may not,but I'm happy to back again,its not fine dining thats why I give an overall sore of 4stars...
This place has been around like 20+ years and are top tier   the burger patties taste fantastic , fish is always fresh and tasty   good home cut style chips. Their Chinese food is also grand .

My husband bought chips and fried rice from Asian Take away. When we got home, we found that the chips were burnt. I called and spoke to someone about it. The person on the phone (possibly the owner) admitted they knew the chips were burnt.  I asked why you would knowingly serve burnt food, and there was no clear response.  While a refund was offered, we don’t want to spend our time going back just to get one. Please be more mindful of how you treat your customers. If something is burnt, don’t serve it—get it right the first time.

I was born in England, Chinese food and Indian food were part of my upbringing (as well as British food of course). I've lived all over the West Midlands, Devon and even Derbyshire. I've had many, many a take out because I was either pissed or just couldn't be arsed to cook. I've travelled to Canada, USA, Europe, India, Thailand, Indonisia, Vietnam, bugger me a lot of places. But this Chow Mein from this little freaking taker in Christchurch, IS ABSOLUTELY FREAKING AMAZING. The veg has been cooked perfect, the amount of meat to veg ratio is spot on, the sauce is to die for, the overall portion allows me to have 2 days worth of dinners. The staff were friendly, and the place was packed. I saw several customers bring their own boxes to take away their orders, as they ordered upto 8 items to feed their family. Folks, this place is amazing. I ordered the chow mein as a base line. If this is good then the rest is going to be amazing. Go to this place.
grew up going to this place, food has always been great and the staff are so very kind. i highly recommend trying at least once
Good to chill out
It's died
Friendly, welcoming staff
Had a great  time!

Food all cold, steak so cold the garlic butter slice remained solid, no sign of melting. Fries all cold, the only savimg grace was the excellent fresh salad. Deserts ok but the 20 minute wait was unacceptable.

The maple soy chicken just doesn't suit my taste. The chicken doesn't taste fresh at all. I ordered the regular size, but there wasn't much chicken and only a lot of fries. The fries were thin, so they weren't very good. The fries from Pac'n Save are much tastier.

Once a month, we come to get our fried chicken and rice. We've tried all the flavors, and they're all equally good. The service is professional and courteous.  Thank you for your work, we enjoy it every time.
Chicken taste amazing and chips were really good. Staff were super friendly. 10/10
Good food but not my favourite rendition of korean chicken
Delicious!
Chicken was great and the serving of fries was heaps.
It's okay. Those who say it's delicious probably haven't tried Taiwan's juicy fried chicken.
Chinese meals are awesome, the fish, chips and burgers are absolutely horrible
Crazy good cooked resturant bro goes so hard. prices a bit high for the food but overall good.
Great chips and hotdogs, though the portions were small. Thanks New Wah.
Would not recommend nor buy from this place again, first time buying from uber eats.. and whole family got food poisoning .. I strongly question the hygiene and food quality of this place
Great meal. Highly recommend.

The food tasted really good and was well presented. The staff were nice and manage clearing tables and bringing out the food very well! It’s pretty busy inside though so it can be hard to get a seat depending on what time you go.
Such a chill vibe, great food, great staff.
Egg Benedict was very ok for the price else Banh mi was one the best!!!  Cheese was yum but bit pricey.
Lovely restaurant! I always enjoy your authentic Vietnamese food and variety or drinks! Interior is nice and cute. Great work.
Food was delicious especially the banh mi pork belly. Drinks and desserts were great as well. Staff were super friendly.

restaurant: Nice Cook Chinese Buffet and Takeaway Restaurant

reviews.text: Stopped in to try their fish n chips out and feeling very disappointed and questioning what species of fish we were actually served up as it was tasteless , thinly cut and nothing like you would expect to get from your usual fish n chip shop . It wasn't enjoyable and I don't think I could trust 'nice Cook' and go back again unless they assured me they were serving up elephant fish or shark.

Best value for money that I have found in Christchurch. This outlet has been going for a very long time out in Kendal Avenue, Providing a snogesboard of dishes, Over  the 25+ years that we have been going to Nice Cook, we have never once gone home unhappy or dissatisfied . Best Value in the Northwest Christchurch Area - do try them. I will be going back often. This is a takeaway property and I am not aware of any dining in a dining in area.
Great chicken fried rice

Last few times we have been normally getting a tray of mixed food, it hasn’t been all that great. It seems pretty busy but the foods not all that fresh. Sweet n sour pork- when you actually get some meat and not tonnes of vegetables the chunks are hard dry and yuck (like it’s been reheated) Honey chicken , is a bit the same. The sliced pork, is dry and wasn’t all that appetising Rice and noodles- are flavourless and sometimes dry  Pretty disappointing as it’s not that cheap Use to be yum not sure what’s happened.
I come from Linwood to buy their Chicken fries noodles. This is my favorite Chinese one anytime in Christchurch.
Best smorgasbord and fish n chips in christchurch! Been going there for 8 years
Our go to for Indian takeaways

Amazing staff, service and food. 10/10 butter chicken. Flavour was beautiful and it was full to the brim. 10/10 garlic naan, incredibly fluffy, healthy spread of garlic, cooked to perfection. Bhajis were full of flavor and beautifully spiced. 10/10 experience, new regular.
Good butter chicken top notch

Had what appeared to be a chunk of rubber or something not food in my curry. Very unappealing, the curry I got was Palak paneer which usually I love but this had no flavor. Sad because I loved the Dal curry I got from here last time.
Why are you always closed now in the afternoon? Need to update online opening times. Love your food!

This is the most underrated Indian in Christchurch. You're missing out if you're not coming here for your curry. Hands down the best curry I've ever had! The man was so friendly and threw in a few poppadoms on the house and made my Naan extra cheesy just for the inconvenience of the eftpos being down, which wasn't an issue at all! Will be recommending these guys to everyone I know!
Waiting a order for ages

We did the long lunch deal on the weekend just been. There was 6 of us at the lunch. We all ate the same food as it was a set menu. One person who is allergic to seafood swapped out her prawns for a chicken dish. Around 6 hours after leaving the restaurant, 5 of us became ill. Vomiting, stomach cramps, nausea etc. The 5 of us who fell ill were the 5 who ate the prawns. The one person who did not get sick, had the chicken. I would not have given a 1 star review had the restaurant responded differently to our email letting them know we all got sick. Their response "The staff also ate the prawns and did not get sick". We without a doubt got food poisoning from this restaurant, we all got sick at the same time, all with the same symptoms. A better response would have been acknowledgment and an apology rather than a denial.
Great food, lovely venue.
Very tasty food. Attentative service and superb location. I found a little too much background noise but not detrimental.
Great! Lovely venue, food was nice. Service was OK, all round good. Pays to book, hard to find a table.

This was my first attempt at trying a Bangladesh dish. And I must say it was bursting with flavor. I had the lamb and my God was it amazing.  My friend and I were moaning with each bite. If you visit Christchurch please visit. The cook is not a chef but promises fresh homemade dishes and that's what we got. We went back the next day for lunch.

I've been traveling in NZ for nearly a year, across both the North and South Island, and this restaurant is the most delicious place I have eaten anywhere in the country. I've gone to it several times at this point because the hospitality is so excellent and the food is incredible.  The owner is very passionate about their food, and it's obvious that he's in the business because he loves bringing joy into people's lives by providing a wonderful dining experience.   He's happy to tell you about the food you're eating, such as how he would normally be eaten, or on what occasions, or how it differs from similar Indian dishes. For me that is a very wonderful addition to the meal, but if you are just looking for a place to consume your requisite nutrients and get on with your day then you should consider saving this restaurant for an occasion when you can give the experience the attention it deserves.   Every time I have gone I have gotten one of the specials, which have variable names like "Chicken Special No.2," but they have consistently been the most delightful meals--ones that are not only tasty, but also complicated enough that you're glad you're not trying to make your own version in your own kitchen. The one I had on my previous visit was the best chicken dish which I have had in years.   I highly recommend this place.

Went here because it promises authentic home cooked Bangladeshi food. However, having travelled in Bangladesh and knowing many Bangladeshis I was disappointed. The food took a long time to come - they kept saying it was cooked fresh but having to wait over 40 minutes for some simple starters isn't great. Most restaurants I go to cook their food fresh and it doesn't take that long. The quality of the food was also pretty poor - the fish cake starter was dry and lacked flavor, and my daughter had the chicken and rice which looked very unappetizing, tasted pretty mediocre, and was only lukewarm. When we complained about the long wait for the food the owner was rude and aggressive - both to us, and the the woman who was serving us -- he tried to blame her for the delay for some of our items by saying that she should have told us they were unavailable (even though they clearly were available because he delivered them to us five minutes later??!???). They have some work to do to improve the quality of their food and their service if they want to tempt me back. I would not recommend them and I would not eat here again. Very poor. I am sure the owner will respond and claim that we were unreasonable - ordinarily I would say go along and see for yourself, but I wouldn't wish this experience on anyone. The food is not worth it and the service sucks!!
Epic food & not crazy expensive like the other food places. Noi is an easy choice for an awesome dinner
What an amazing wee gem Noi Ferrymead is. I would highly recommend Noi. The food was superb and good size servings. The staff were pleasant and lovely.

Very friendly and effortful service from here. We ordered a late night takeaway via uber eats which never arrived, after explaining to Tony at Noi this had happened, even though they were closing in 3 minutes, the team kindly remade our meal and delivered it to us personally allowing us to pay by phone.  Unbelievable service, we are very grateful as we were not able to get out to collect or shop for food at this time having just arrived to Sumner having just moved here.  Thank you very much. Needless to say, the food was also DELICIOUS ! Great vegan options too!
Delicious food and friendly service.
Super friendly staff, very accommodating. The meals are tasty and priced very decently.  We will be back for sure.
Excellent food, great flavours. Been three times now

Noi ferrymead eater was a nice treat   if you after an thai/veitnams cross over menu ! We found the food was delicious and a good size portions , we both had the starters and they where something we would definitely order again  the place is lovely and bright  with great views of the ferrymead surroundings , the staff where so helpful and polite  we definitely be making a return as it definitely ticked all the right  box's.
Goood goood goood goooooood

I recently went here for a meal with my family. The food was excellent, the plates had plenty of food on them. Staff were friendly and very efficient. The price for 7 adults was really great. I can really recommend thus restaurant.

This is a very calm, nice South Asian restaurant. There's a good range of Thai, Vietnamese, Chinese, Malaysian and Burmese food. I had lunch here with friends. I enjoyed a Thai Tom-Sam Prawn Salad which was beautifully made, fresh and colourful. My companions had a Massuman and Vietnamese Stir Fried Noodles. Everything was lovely, so delicious and enjoyable. Service is respectful and very professional. Meals don't take long to come. I'd definitely come back, thank you.

We were so taken with Nom Nom and the meal we forgot to take photos to share. Ordered the crispy squid and it was exactly that topped with sesame seeds and a good portion. Then came the combination meat fried rice and satay noodles. Again, plentiful portions and all consumed as it was hard to leave anything.  It is also worth noting that the service here was first class and so often you read reviews where service was average yet the restaurant is at a higher end of pricing. The Nom Nom family have got it right here.  Next time I’ll share some photos.

Not sure what happened but it was not that busy and it seems that they forgot our main courses. We waited a long time and eventually asked when our meals would arrive as tables that arrived after us had already received there meals. The waiter advised that they would check with the kitchen and then returned saying they will prepare the meals now. It was about an hour wait in total and eventually the meals arrived staggered. There was no apology and I cannot understand how the staff did not realise the mistake before we mentioned it. The company was great and we had a great time so all was not lost
Food was delicious and the staff were just fantastic. Should be a 5 star plus rating.

I like the interior. It was a long wait but we had a large group of 16 so I guess that's alright. Food was nice, I found it a bit too sweet but I'm sure they make it for Kiwi tastes. Server was very onto it with taking orders, that was impressive. I'd like to go back with a smaller group to try more items.

Excellent service from start to finish. All waitresses were attentive. Food came out at Olympic time. The decor is captivating and probably thee greatest meal I have had in a long time.  I ordered Pad Thai seafood combination with a strawberry cheesecake. The sticky chicken starter is the best chicken I have ever had in Otautahi.  5 x 5 everything was simply perfection. Thank you Nom Noms kitchen.
The food was delicious, the service was great, the staff were very attentive, and the Thai tea was delicious.
Very very good service! Very very good smile! Very very good boy
Khao Soi is very delicious
Always good food here. Khao soi is really good! and lovely crew working there! Shoutout to Kem! Best service
Delicious authentic Thai food, just like back home! Lovely atmosphere and very friendly staff. Highly recommend!

reviews.user: นายยศสรัล ซ้อนกลิ่นสกุล
reviews.text: This is a beautiful place with authentic thai food , Good vibe and friendly staff
Extremely friendly staff and yummy food! Tons of options, including vegetarian. Make sure to specify if you want spicy ;) Cost effective, average bowl is $9.

Hot and fresh meals for a cheap price. I can still feel the warmth of the tasty food hours after eating it. The owner was kind and polite put in hard work to make his food more than exceptional. I got myself some noodles and sweet n sour pork
Love this place. I do take out.
Owners are amazing and such good food
Absolutely love the Satay chicken, of course with a few wontons.
One of my favourite Chinese places ever
Handy on a monday night

Used to be our weekly go-to — but tonight, they served up disappointment in a bowl. Normally, this place hovers around a 3.5 to 4-star level: decent enough to keep you from cooking, reliable enough to order again. But tonight, their food and service took a nosedive.  I was served what I can only assume was fried rice left to cook while the chef took a nap or wandered off for a bathroom break. Charred, bitter, and completely inedible. One dish out of a four-dish order, sure — but the rest of the family ate while mine sat on the bench like a warning from the culinary gods.  I called, thinking a refund for the burnt mess would be reasonable. Apparently not. Maybe they like their rice blackened to oblivion, but I prefer mine edible.  We used to order every week. I guess it’s pizza night from now on.
Very disappointed tonight. My meal was burnt  and was too disgusting to eat.  Unable to get refind
Worst Pad Thai I've had. Sure it's a food court so expectations aren't high but even still...
Amazing lovely staff will come back
Stunning find, just off the main road. Amazing sushi and other options too. Lots of space to sit and enjoy your meal.

We parked on a side of the building just to pick up sushi from Nori table and got fine for $80. There was no sign we couldn't park as customers, and that’s not the first time we arrived and other customers were using the same parking. That’s ridiculously expensive sushi if you ask me. You guys need to set up a sign there and warn your customers about fines like that. We are frequent customers but after that i don’t think we will be back again.

I work nearby and come here often for sushi with my colleagues, this is honestly the best sushi place in Christchurch that I've found! Food is always fresh, beautiful and satisfying. Presentation is great and the place is nicely decorated. Have never had a bad experience here!

Beautiful fresh mouthfuls of flavour. We stopped in for lunch when out for a walk and found this lovely sushi cafe. Tried a selection from the cabinet and also Karach chicken served with rice and coleslaw. We will be back
Really good selection of serve yourself sushi. Everything was delicious.
Delicious variety of japonese food.
Has to be the best sushi in Christchurch. You can pick what you want my favourite is the tempura chicken. Will not go anywhere else for my sushi
Best sushi in chirstchurch without a doubt. Fresh, delicious and authentic nori table is great for lunch dates or midshop snack.
So yummy
Best sushi iv tried
Fresh authentic sushi and Donburi.  Had the fresh Salmon Donburi paired with miso soup.

Tried takeaways here(as we've had reasonable sit downs) but this was unacceptably awful. Both entrees deep fried from frozen with the sick taste that causes. Fried rice with slabs of gristly and fatty meat and a steak dish with the same low quality ingredients. It is possible, I suppose,  that the kitchen had only just opened but this food was unacceptable and we threw the whole lot out when we got home.
