North and south gourmet is a great place for dim sum/ morning tea. It is great to come here with a group and order a variety of different dishes. As an American who likes to venture out of my comfort zone and try different foods, I loved bringing a group of friends and ordering dumplings, spring rolls, meat balls, pork ribs, bao, and even tripe. The spinning table is a great feature for sharing among friends, and the food is reasonably priced and delicious.
Ordered their mixed pork (BBQ and roasted) rice and Xiao Long Bao. Mixed pork rice is great with generous portion of pork. Xiao Long Bao has room for improvement.

After having local food for 10 days. We are craving for Chinese food. We manage to try this restaurant visited by many Chinese living in Christchurch.  It is Hongkong style food.  Pickled duck wings. Steam blue cod fish.  Ginger and spring onion Venison hot plate.  Crispy skin Peking duck.  Steamed oyster with vermicelli.   All cooked to perfection and taste like food eaten in Hongkong. . Food : 5/5 Service : 4/5 Price : $$$ Place : 3/5 . Halal Rest : North & South Gourmet Location : Christchurch City : New Zealand .

Dishes are fast & fresh however not a huge selection of dishes if taking the Yum Cha option on the weekend. Bookings advised as they get incredibly busy but they do have a takeaway option available. A typical Sunday lunch for 2 would be $35-$45. Friendly obliging staff & overall a good consistent place for a casual lunch.

I'm not completely convinced on this restaurant.  It's OK... Their Dim Sum (Yum Cha) is good... Better than their dinner menu.  We have been here several times over the past few years, and, I feel like it used to be better.    On our most recent visit for dinner their seasoning was rather bland.  So, minus 2 stars for that.
This very busy restaurant is the Best yum cha in Christchurch. Best to book early as they fill up quickly. Fantastic price for what you get and there are enough choices to suit all.

As far as Chinese restaurants in Christchurch go this one is certainly up there.  We regularly go there for Yum Cha on a weekend and know that you have to book well in advance to get a table.  The Yum Cha selection is extensive and generous with trolleys frequently coming out.  Evening meals are also pretty good especially the roast duck and the pork with ginger and spring onion.  We always start with hot and sour soup which is done really well here.  The popularity the place is testimony to many happy customers returning again and again!
I was really disappointed with the samosa I tried today. It was stale and tasteless.
The food is amazing and well priced! Very authentic Indian, I can't wait to go back.
Very beautiful experience really love this place, food is so delicious and love everything about this restaurant

This is the best “real” Indian food in the South Island, not only is the food incredible, but the staff is second to none. We started going there six months ago, and now we have lunch there every Tuesday at noon. The great thing about it is we are not Indian so, when we come there they just feed us something different every time. And there deserts are out of this world. It’s so much fun. Love these people. Bill and Jennifer
Love the chats, a good place in Christchurch to find some authentic Indian snacks
Surcharge on paywave was not displayed on the machine, so there was a surcharge without my knowledge.
Great service by mr shamsher Food was really good as always Excellent customer service Highly recommend

I am from Amritsar and I’m very disappointed. This is not Amritsari Kulcha at all — just call it Kulcha. The taste is completely off. Who adds saunf and sesame seeds in a real Kulcha? Stop doing these fancy experiments just to make it look cool. Stick to authentic flavors. Totally disappointed and won’t recommend.
Fab food Can't wait to go back

Recommended by a local hotel.i have little experience of Thai food. The smell of Cooking was very evident when we entered.Staff  were welcoming and very well informed and helpful.Starters beef strips in batter with oyster sauce was fine as was moo ping a little greasy  and the meat fatty and not trimmed. Mains boozy duck was slimy and a little bland but hot to taste but of uneven temperature which was very worrying.I had a chicken main with egg and noodles,uninspiring and also slimy.Reviews are great but this is not supported by my experience.The ventilation is poor and we smelt really foody when leaving.I thought it very expensive for the quality of materials used.
Food was ok, below my expectations. Food slow to arrive, drinks quick to arrive.

We were holidaying here and ordered takeaway. They told us to go through deliveroo all good. The Nusara packed Tomyum soup into a paperbag and placed on top of it all the rest of the order. It arrived at hotel reception taken out of pouch and subsequently the bottom of the paperbag fell apart. I called Nusara who said I would have to contact deliveroo after taking photos of the incident. The problem of their not properly placing the order in a plastic bag NOW became problem to rectify, they would not contact deliveroo I HAD TO DO IT.! It was a shame the food was good the responsibility was dreadful.
Delicious food, great value, friendly and accommodating staff. Would recommend
Warm, cosy and kids friendly!

Slow service when we were inside and drinks took a long time to come. Out of quite a few of the cocktails we wanted and the table beside us too, which was disappointing this wasn’t indicated before hand. We’ve been to OGB many times before and had positive experiences so maybe this was just an off day.

OGB is absolutely amazing! The outdoor vibe with music on weekends creates such a lively and fun atmosphere, perfect for catching up with friends or just enjoying good company. The staff are genuinely the best, always welcoming, friendly, and they make you feel right at home every time. The drinks are always spot on and beautifully made, and the overall energy of the place is unmatched. Definitely one of my favorite spots in Christchurch!

This place has such a warm and welcoming vibe! The atmosphere is amazing, and the staff are always kind and friendly. I always enjoy going there it’s the perfect spot to relax, and hang out. Highly recommended!

OGB is such a beautiful spot — the architecture alone is stunning! We weren’t quite sure what to expect, but loved discovering how the building has been thoughtfully divided into different businesses, each with its own character. The indoor dining area felt cozy and welcoming, with its mezzanine level and intimate layout. I’d noted my dietary requirements when booking, and the staff were incredibly accommodating and attentive. The food and drinks were absolutely delicious — I’d highly recommend OGB to anyone visiting Christchurch!
Team are wonderful. From floor staff, the Bartenders and all the way to the Kitchen. Atmosphere is exquisite and such a vibe. Definitely recommend
Pre show dinner. Service was quick and friendly. There were very good choices from the pre show menu. Cooked well and very tasty.

Lovely place to come for a drink with a friend. Speakeasy vibe with cosy tables, ambient lighting, and really great, friendly service from everyone you encounter. I must add that the fries are top notch!
Staff are great but there's something about the atmosphere in here that I just don't like. Drinks are bit pricey too.
What a great little pub, we loved this place we went back twice.  Great specials, they had two steaks for $45 and we had nachos the next night too.
Best steak lunch in christchurch
best meal i think i’ve ever had!! awesome service from the girls & the chef- will be back here many times!
Good place free pool some days

Went there around 4pm today, my partner asked for a toastie only to find out they had run out of bread, she was offered something else and she pick chicken that was served on a hot stone with gravy, not sure want it is actually called. When it arrived she was served almost raw chicken with possibly a mushroom sauce, the drink prices are fair based on other bars around the area but raw chicken, that is dangerous.
Fireball 5 star Guinness 2 star Niall laffan
Menu was disappointing wasn't updated online. But friendly place and good atmosphere for a drink
Bar staff are amazing to talk to, friendly service great atmosphere
Best place for an unpretentious quiet ale late afternoon after a long days toil. Wild Buck Ale on tap is the best price in the city!.... You gotta check them out, make it your new local
Stonegrill Tuesday works, better options on the house beers please ......trying to maintain my figure
If you ever hear about the wine walk..... Go But also had expresso cocktail was deeeevine!!

The menu looks excellent and we chose to do the 89$ each trust the chef. The menu states there will be some dishes from the menu and others just for the night. We were told by our server it was 4 courses. Unfortunately we received only 2 dishes from the menu and the rest were off menu. Disappointing as if this was made clear to us we would've chosen to order separate to the trust the chef. Some of the dishes from off menu were great but the sides with the main were extremely simple and not worth the money paid. A bowl of simple roast potatoes that were undercooked on the inside with a sparse amount of bland sauce and a bowl of nearly plain lettuce leafs. One of the dishes we received from the menu was the focaccia which was delicious but we got one small piece each which again doesn't seem worth the money (on the menu the focaccia is $13 so i assume that ordering it not as part of trust the chef you would receive a more generous portion) We calculated how much it would have cost to order all the dishes we wanted from the menu and it would've actually worked out cheaper than doing trust the chef. We were also never told and it does not say on the menu that dessert was included in trust the chef (it became clear to us that this would be the 4th course when the 3rd course delivered was the main) there were no desserts listed on the menu given us. Two issues here - the main one being that I wouldn't have ordered dessert and therefore didn't factor this in to the cost of our decision and I didn't eat it. Secondly the dessert given was very small - about a 1/5th portion of a normal slice of cake with a mini scoop of gelato. Again poor value for money. (but at least my partner could easily consume both given the size)  In saying this - the beef main we were given was delicious, the drinks were good, the service was excellent and the vibe of the restaurant is lovely.  Our issue really is the value for money of the trust the chef and the poor reflection of the trust the chef compared to the menu - definitely give Odeon a try but my recommendation would be to order off the menu over doing the trust the chef.

My brother and I had a lovely evening at Odeon for his birthday - the service was wonderful and friendly, the food was delicious, there was a candle in his dessert, and we got given Court Theatre tickets as a surprise when we paid. Very impressed.
a great place to dine. The beef was not up to standard, but immediately talked to chef and credited it. How good is that. Really nice ambiance, helpful staff. Well done Odeon
Old Government Building (OGB). Service. Food. Staff all top notch for the higher end foodie.
Charming and cozy decor, reliable service, good music. It's a great place for cocktails.

Funky hip bar. Inside area very small but great atmosphere. Outside nice seating with blankets but cold in winter.   Great bartender who mixed s mean martini.   Food options good but a lot of fried food. Broccoli I delicious as were prawns.   Only let down by slowish inattentive service - although friendly when there.

Had lunch here with my family and was surprised by the vegan options! I ordered a charcuterie board made of plant based foods and also tofu fried chicken. Both were great and there were still many great options for those who are not vegan (the rest of my family enjoyed their non-vegan food).
Awesome food and i love the hospitality and food of this place. This is my hang out spot when i am in Christchurch. And they have amazing Bloody Mary's for breakfast!

We were looking for a nice place for lunch on a sunny yet cool and blustery Saturday yesterday. While cool, we opted to eat outside and it was perfect.  We both chose the fried chicken burger. It came with fries.  Sounds simple and boring, but no, it was amazing.  The burger was not, I believe, a single piece of chicken breast. It seemed to be various nice pieces of well trimmed chicken that had been, with the help of cheese, formed into a patty and then breaded and fried. It was topped with thinly sliced pickled onions, like the pink ones you get in Mexico, mild dill pickle and thinly sliced red chilies.  It was not super spicy hot, but perfectly spiced up the sandwich. Wonderful!  The fries were simply amazing.  Thick cut and freshly prepared, they were served with a bowl of large grain sea salt on the side along with a small container of ketchup.  I'm not sure what had been added to the ketchup, but it had a very unique and very tasty combination that complimented the fries as well.   The burgers were NZ $22 each (US 15) and worth every penny.  We had an amazing New Zealand Riesling from Pegasus Bay winery near Christchurch.  It's famous winery & top rated Riesling.  So depending on what you want for a beverage will determine your bill, but for us, this place was great value for money and a very memorable tasty lunch
Stopped for lunch while taking in Christchurch.  Nice place with outdoor seating.   The lamp was nicely done.  The service excellent.   I liked it.

Wow! how can I be first to be review? OGB is great.  They are in a great spot in the reviving Central Christchurch. On a nice day you can sit outside and if the weather is poor they have cozy indoor seating.  Our guide recommended the place for cocktails and he was right.  We enjoyed a platter and cocktails one afternoon and came back for breakfast on another day. The food was tasty and they were able to accommodate our vegan-gluten free daughter.

Tonight my wife and I had a wonderful dining experience at O.G.B.  Waiter was unbelievably friendly and helpful.  We split a salad and she had swordfish with squid and I had a lamb dish.  Both were wonderful as was our bottle of Two Hands Angels Share Shiraz.  We also had an unusual desert which was a sweet potato muse with caramel that came highly recommended by our waiter and is considered a local treat.  I don't especially like sweet potatoes but I have to admit that this was a fabulous desert that we would like to try to replicate at home.  We feel very fortunate to have found this place and highly recommend it.
One of my go-tos on campus
i just spent $9.72 on this and my heart is breaking go to sushi ball house instead this sushi is not good
My favourite sushi place in the country. They live up to their name, truly oishiiiiii.
The sushi here tastes so delicious and there’s so many different options to choose from. Before they close the cabinet food is all 50% which is really good.

Excellent pick-your-own sushi, the roe is particularly good, and everything is generally fresh and delicious. The octopus takoyaki I got wasn't cripsy, but soft and mediocre, however maybe this was due to early afternoon Graduation day. Definitely my favourite place to eat on campus, its just a shame they close so early, and their vegetarian options tend to be limited.
Got a vegetable okonomiyaki. Very bland…could be because they seem to use frozen veges
U can find them at Sunday Market in Riccarton, fresh hand made from scratch at site, absolutely delicious and authentic. Made my day!
Great okonomiyaki!

There's only 3 things on the menu, okonomiyaki (traditional.japanese pancakes), okonomiyaki styled fried noodles at yakisoba, and okonomelette which is an omelette with yakisoba inside instead of rice. Very creative and tasty. The queue is usually not long and serving fairly quickly compared to other busy stalls.
Great value and yummy.
Great new find. Absolutely delicious food.

I've been traveling for two weeks and I've really missed Asian food. This place feels so familiar. The fried rice and noodle soup are delicious, and the stir-fried dishes especially have that wonderful "wok hei" (wok aroma), it tastes just like home!
Amazing, delicious food! Wish I lived in Christchurch so I could eat there more often. Really delicious. They need a bigger store though, for good reason - it was packed when we went!
It was a Wednesday night and the place was busy. Best Malaysian food I've had outside of Malaysia. Even got cans of 100Plus. Worth a detour.
Good service and prices. Tasty food. Good portions.

Every time I travel, this is one of the places I never miss. The food here is authentic, delicious, and reminds me so much of home. The portions are very generous, and the prices are really reasonable for the quality and size you get.  What I love most is that it truly feels like eating in Malaysia — the flavors are rich, comforting, and bring back so many memories. On my way back, I always make sure to takeaway some food to take home because it’s just that good.  If you’re craving real Malaysian food with great value and heartwarming taste, this is the place to go. Highly recommended!
Great food & variety. 10/10 customer service. 100% reccomendation!
Top notch  A+++ self serve single peices, with some extra ordinary surprises,
First time buying sushi at Omi. A wide range of vegetarian and different sushi compare to others Great service and fresh sushi.
Excellent sushi, friendly staff and a lovely atmosphere! One of our fave spots in Christchurch

We had sushi for lunch from Omi yesterday.  The sushi was good and the ingredients fresh, although we found it a little sweet, which may be down to the rice they use or added sugar. Plenty of other sushi places in Christchurch would make sushi of similar quality, so I'm surprised at a few of the reveiws waxing lyrical about how good the sushi is. This score is mainly in relation to how expensive this place is. Maybe it's due to the location and relative lack of sushi options nearby, however the sushi is very expensive.
Very nice place, great food, great prices. Highly recommend
Love the chicken Katsu on rice from here!!
It's one of the best katsu bowls I've ever had before will definitely be back for more

Best prices, delicious sushi, great portion sizes of other dishes. Everything is fresh and tasty. Its a walk in and grab sort of place (sushi is self serve/pick you own), although there are tables available for eat in. Service is quick, and the staff are friendly and happy. One my my frequent lunch spots during the week.

We were staying nearby and found this place on Google and we’re so glad we did. Don’t expect much atmosphere but the service is friendly with a smile and the sushi prices and size are some of the best I’ve ever seen. Tasty, fresh, and fast! I ordered some chicken sushi, chicken pieces and some avocado sushi. Came to $12! Bargain! Would 10% revisit if you just want a cheap and delicious feed!
The first Chinese meal in NZ. Taste quite good and the service is excellent.   Price is fairly okay. There are plenty of choices of different fried rices. Recommend if you want a quick Chinese meal.

This is my favourite authentic Chinese restaurant in Christchurch.  Delicious flavourful food. Accommodating if you want to make changes, within reason. Fairly priced given the quality. Nice little out of the way diner experience.

restaurant: Orange House Restaurant & Takeaways 大家乐餐馆

reviews.text: small friendly restaurant, very delicious food ,  visiting it for the 5th time and it is delicious

Orange House is one of the restaurants I frequently return to with my company’s collaborators and clients. The service is consistently high-level, the dishes are very good, and the staff are friendly and attentive. Thank you, Orange House, for the pleasant experiences every time!
Good as always.
Dined in for the first time today, highly recommend and definitely will be back (way better than anything Rolleston has to offer so worth the travel) Cheers.

I tried the Beef Ho Fun with Gravy (Wet-fried Noodles) at Orange House and it was amazing! The beef was tender and flavorful, and the noodles had that nice wok aroma while staying silky and not overly oily. The sauce was rich and perfectly balanced, making the whole dish really satisfying. Generous portion, cozy atmosphere, and friendly service. Definitely a dish worth coming back for!
Very yummy.
The food is absolutely delicious, (our number1 for Chinese takeaway and we've tried a few places) Service is always amazing and the atmosphere is great.
Great food

Had a great experience here yesterday. Went in for the lunch cocktail club with some friends. Great drinks, great food. Would have a loved a little more on the antipasto platter however all the food was delicious. Very accommodating to my friend who wanted mocktails and who arrived slightly late and they brought her out her own mini antipasto platter since she missed out on the main one. Highly recommend.
Wonderful food, if you don't mind waiting for no apparent reason .
The food was delicious, i had travelled from Australia, the place had a great vie
Great food, great service.

The Sottilette rolled pizza base with napoli sauce, Wairiri buffalo burrata and fresh basil was tasty and delicious.  The NZ Southern Stations wagyu was cooked to medium to medium well instead of the medium rare I asked for, and was a little under seasoned. But it did have a nice chargrilled sear. The black garlic purée tasted burnt and the texture was very grainy. For $45 dollars, the dish felt incomplete.  The Pappardelle al ragù di cervo, braised venison ragù with juniper and thyme, finished with berries and crème fraîche looked amazing and the fruit gave the rich sauce some welcome, acidic respite. Unfortunately the pasta and the sauce were severely lacking seasoning.  It was interesting that the restaurant styles itself as an Italian inspired eatery but there was no Italian wine on offer. Not to worry though, as the Mt Difficulty Pinot Noir was a fine accompaniment to all the dishes.  Where things really went off the rails was the level of service we received or didn't receive. When our starter was finished, our plates and cutlery were not cleared before the main came out out. There was no cutlery for the main at all, including the rather essential steak knife. We had to approach the bar staff in order to find some wait staff to then get us what we needed to eat our dishes.  The server who attended to us was very apologetic and rectified the issue straight away, and even asked us if we'd like more drinks or desserts --- something we had yet to be asked by the other staff who had previously attended us.  When it was time to pay, the front of house staff member who collected the bill did not think to ask how we found the meal and we left rather disappointed overall.
Good atmosphere with pleasant, helpful staff. Great food
Sophie and Emily made my morning with their excellent service! Best coffee in town
Excellent pizza and arugula salad.  Service was fast. Nice location.  Enjoyed our lunch in Christchurch.

The cocktails, the appetizers/starters and the Italian fare are outstanding.  I have visited this corner restaurant right on the River Avon in beautiful Christchurch 3 or 4 times.  My last visit Christmas week of 2024, I was very hungry and ordered the steak. I was not thrilled at how it was cooked or all the sauce they pour on it. Next time I'll ask for well-done and no sauces.  But service, location, atmosphere and most everything else is worth a visit. It won't disappoint!

Starters were great service was great! However the mains were terrible.  The Pork in the Carbonara and Caesar salad were both horrible cubed over salted and seemingly from a can. The croutons in the salad were crazy large dry and hard. I don't understand how a restaurant thinks cubed pork is a valid substitute for guanciale in a carbonara.
It's no longer here. I came all the way from a cruise terminal excited about the menu and it's not here.

This place was absolutely terrible. Ordered Jambalaya bites, which was a sad attempt to disguise undercooked rice with tomato paste and chili peppers. Fried chicken was overcooked and tough to chew.  Yuck.

To celebrate my 39th birthday, I found this restaurant called Orleans here in Christchurch, New Zealand. I did enjoy cajun and creole soul food from the USA, so it was a perfect dining option. Plus, it was a couple of blocks from the hotel.  Turning 39 years overseas was interesting, since the time zone difference in the USA was a day earlier, so it allowed me to celebrate twice. With that said, I arrived here at the Orleans restaurant and bar around 8pm on a brisk Monday evening in mid September 2018. I thought initially that the restaurant itself was closed, since there was construction going on the opposite side of the street, not realizing that the restaurant was on the other side. To my relief, I was okay and entered the restaurant. I almost had cut my losses and tried to find somewhere else in walking distance, but thankful that I had found the restaurant. During my visit here to the Orleans restaurant, it was typically Monday night in the city. I guess I came in when the dinner rush was largely over and found a group of people finishing up and leaving, letting me having the entire restaurant and bar to myself. The ambiance here was very casual and basically what you'd find in a bar setting.   The overall experience here at Orleans restaurant and bar was nice and quiet. Kind of like the casual attitude of the place and didn't like the loud noises when coming to such places. Maybe I'm getting old and like quiet places. Either way, Orleans was nice and cozy. I dig the decor and the service was nice, friendly, and fast, even for a place that was slowing down for the night. They told me they were closing at 9pm, but the yelp page said till 12 midnight. Probably need to change it sooner or later. With that said, celebrating a birthday here with southern comfort food was nice and definitely one to remember. While I was dining alone, it was nice and pleasant. Orleans restaurant and bar is located at 89 Litchfield Street in the heart of downtown Christchurch, New Zealand. They offer live music, but during the night I was there, there was no live music. Probably on the weekends or something. They accept major credit cards, usually Visa, which are usually a great thing for us tourist folk who live on the plastic.   Not sure about parking, although street parking is your best bet. I'm not from Christchurch, but I walked it here during my holiday in mid September 2018. Hotel was nearby and I had a craving for New Orleans type of cuisine. I'm sure Christchurch's public transportation can get you here too. There's always uber, which is nice. I ended up spending an hour here, enjoying my meal and soaking up the fact that I am not 38 anymore. It's kind of disappointing, but that's life. For my meal, I ended up getting a po boy sandwich, which is basically standard for any southern style delight. Along with that, i ordered some curly fries, which ended up being some sort of regular fries curled up and spiced up to taste differently from your Burger King type fries. I finished it up with an order of sweet ice tea. I should have gotten liquor, but I figured I'll celebrate with that later on. The po boy itself was good and tasteful. It was delicious and harmoniously hit the spot after a long day of travel from Sydney, Australia. The fries were surprisingly epic and the sweet tea was interesting. With the restaurant closing earlier than I thought, I opted to get dessert elsewhere.  Prices here were okay. Their menu was surprisingly and shockingly limited, but I guess that's how it is sometimes. Although the food ordered and the ambiance was pretty good, I thought for an place that served Cajun / Creole USA cuisine should have more items. 3.5 stars for the overall experience. 4.0 stars for the ambiance and the food. 3.5 stars for the service.   Support local!  C+

First time trying Orleans in Christchurch. Food was very tasty. The waffle stack was delicious and a great share. The beetroot salad was light and refreshing. We then tried the cheesecake sample and the Orleans Beignets which are incredible! Our waitress Grace was amazing and checked on us to make sure everything was going well. It made the experience that much better!!

We ended up here a couple of times while we were in Christchurch.  The atmosphere was fun and the food was great.  We tried the waffle stack, which I recommend, but their recommendation to be hungry or eat it with multiple people definitely applies.  We couldn't come near to finishing it.

I used to go here a lot when it first opened, mainly around 2015-2016. When Orleans first opened they had a fantastic menu that was simple yet delicious. Their food was always hot and on time and they worked to a "first come first serve basis" without taking reservations for parties smaller than 6.   Last night me and my Mum went back to find we were not able to sit in the restaurant because they were "fully booked". Obviously this was our fault for not researching it however I'm disappointed they have changed they way they run things. They did offer to give us food if we sat at any of the bars in Stranges' Lane (three other establishments). This sounds like it would work however after our experience, theres evidence it does not.   We decided to stay and sit in Capa (which used to be Vespa) We looked at the menu to find that our favorite classic dishes/ sides were gone e.g no Po boys, mac'n'cheese or cornbread as well as the fact that we couldn't order a jug of lunch as we used to before. Instead we ordered two gin cocktails, overpriced for what they were- watered down, juice like cocktails, not nearly as good as we expected from this establishment. We ordered chicken and waffles and pork belly as well as a side of grilled cheese cornbread. The food took almost 40 mins to arrive, we then had to wait an extra 5 mins for cutlery. The food had clearly been sitting out as the kumara mash on the pork belly was stone cold, the pork belly was extremely chewy and impossible to eat the pork crackle. The chicken was warm, not hot and the waffle was soggy as the syrup had been sitting on it for ages. The grilled cheese was hot however the basic recipe was flawed- cornbread on its own is meant to be sweet bread as a side. When you add cheese or jalapeños (which this had) it overpowers the cornbread - basically rendering it just bread. Whoever decided to change this recipe - I really don't think they've had/ appreciated southern American cornbread before. Overall it was extremely disappointing - which we expressed to the staff at Capa. He offered us two more drinks but at that stage we just wanted to leave. We would expect this sort of service and food at a cheap takeaways however we expected a semi-fine dining experience as we had two years earlier and it was definitely not worth the $61 we paid for in our final bill.   It's my opinion that management has changed the fundamentals that made this restaurant so great. Their kitchen may be able to handle food service for four bars in Stranges' Lane but their staff certainly can't. As we left we found another couple visiting from Australia who were also disappointing in their cold food and said it had been the worse meal they had, had in New Zealand. It makes me angry enough that a great restaurant in christchurch has been changed for the worse and I have wasted money, but to have it be a poor representation to the tourists this city dearly needs, that makes me rope-able. I won't be coming back again. And I dearly hope they change their system and menu back to how it was or least find a way to improve.

For a seafood fan - an entire  flat fish baked and stuffed with cajun prawns - simply delicious.   1-kg of BBQ beef ribs served with tangy cucumber pickles...what a combination. . Food : 4/5 Service : 4/5 Price : $$ Place : 4/5
I went here for dinner. I ordered the waffle with fried chicken and the fish..the taste were okay. Staff were friendly..  CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED

This is a very cool place in a precinct close to the downtown bus depot.  I had the spicy wings, which were delicious.  I also had the rum punch cocktail -- also very good.  The service was attentive and the bar space itself was relaxing to be in.

I had just returned from working in Antarctica for 5 months and the things I missed the most was southern food and real bourbon. I found it here. Albeit, the portion sizes were not up to par what you'd find in the Southern US, but who gives a crap, morbid obesity isn't rampant in New Zealand like it is in the States. Coincidence? Maybe. Probably not. I don't know. I'm writing this after drinking several quality bourbons.  I almost cried when I saw they had Sazerac Rye. The chicken and waffles was phenomenal. The slaw was meh. But back to the bourbon. Yeah. I'm freaking thrilled about that.

My family and I stopped here while on vacation. We happened upon it while walking around Christchurch. We are from Texas so we definitely know southern food and we were very impressed. We tried the chicken and waffles, the potato sald, the burger, and fried ocra...all of it was amazing! Fresh tasting and reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend stopping by this place while in Christchurch!

Great Southern US style food in a great atmosphere. You can sit outside in Stranges lane and order from Orleans, Stranges or 9th street, all variations on the same creole style food. Food was fantastic, the manager gave us great service, chicken & waffles, Po Boys, loaded fries, pouting with dirty gravy, fried green tomatoes....all good. Desserts even better and alcoholic shakes as well. They had a great craft beer special when we ate there, a dark IPA. I can't complain about anything really. We'll probably go back later this week as a group with my work.

Probably hands down the best chicken and waffles in New Zealand.  My family and I were skeptical of eating Cajun food in New Zealand, but Orleans proved us wrong.  The shakes were wonderful as well!!  Excellent service! Live music on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday.
Have had a number of good meals here, i'm a fan of cajun food so keep going back - menu changes frequently which is great because everything they add seems to be as good as the last!

Stopped in this place for lunch while on holidays. An absolute amazing layout that is in a cool precint. We shared the mumbo gumbo that was a great size for two people. With drinks about thirty a head. Would happily stop here again

I checked this place out based on previous recommendations and have to say it was very good. The chicken waffles were very tasty (but the waffles a little cool), as were the potato skins. The chicken was perfectly cooked. The pecan nut tart dessert was nice but a little to pre-made for my liking (e.g. ice cream scope frozen solid in round shape :( The service was great; attentive and very friendly (but not over the top). Overall a good place for food & drink. I will likely be back.

This is located in a groovy little cafe precinct that you would walk past and completely miss if you weren't looking for it. we were recommended this restaurant by friends a colleagues and it did not disappoint. The meals were authentic New Orleans fare, the beer was cold and the service warm. Oh and there was live music too!

An absolute must-visit in Christchurch. Conveniently situated next to Strange's Lane in the most hip area to come back since the quakes, Orleans flawlessly blends New Orleans soul food with the Kiwi hospitality. If you visit this establishment, bookings are not accepted for groups under 8, so be sure to arrive early. Around 8 pm the place is crawling with hungry (and thirsty) patrons. For imbibing, I recommend the Hurricane pitcher to share or the Dr. Pepper Martini. For food, you'll absolutely kick yourself if you don't order their chicken and waffles with a honey glaze. It's simply perfect, and a moderate portion size so you're not too stuffed to order and additional side or dessert (which must be the cookie sandwich). I love their curly fries, but if you need something healthier, the burnt cauliflower is fantastic (and not burnt, dispite the name). I love the jazz and New Orleans soul music that plays in the background and the decor is spot on to theme. Definitely don't miss this amazing restaurant!

One of the few open options near my hotel - absolutely fantastic food. Deep South, Soul Food, Yum. Fried chicken, pork belly, slaw, ribs, CHICKEN WAFFLES.... Nice interior done up like blues bar. Get in there. Highly recommended.
The food was delicious! I asked for the Kava curry lamb and really enjoyed it. Portions were very generous,  including the starters. I will highly recommend this place.
We had a really lovely time here. Loved the stuff and the food was delicious. Trying Kava was interesting. And I recommend the cauliflower dish.

What a wonderful place to dine, such a lovely homely warm atmosphere when we arrived, as well as a warm welcome. The small group of us 4 had various starters and main courses. We were all impressed with the high quality of food and service. Definitely be back and highly recommend to all.
Don't let looks deceive you.  The food is amazing and the service impeccable. I can thoroughly recommend the chicken madras... this has become my new favourite Indian dish.

Best Indian food in Christchurch <3 soulful nourishing food, fresh ingredients, rich in flavour, amazing! Kava was great; we really enjoyed serving kava from the authentic bowl and sipping from coconut cups <3 love love love everything about this experience, will be telling everyone about this place and come back again soon. If you want proper Indian cuisine, this is your place.

Pacific kava restaurant first of all very good costumer service secondly very yammy food enjoyed every bite of my meal The atmosphere is so relaxing and  calm No regrets at all will definitely recommend my family and friends to go to Pacific kava when they in chch

Friendly, welcoming hosts greeted us as late arrivals and fed us delicious food. The garlic naan was something to write home about, we demolished every morsel of it! Our curries were delicious and portions generous. A most enjoyable meal!
See my review per next door at the church.
Great place to have a beer or 6,great staff great service
Was really nice loved it there and the team Ben and Georgia are awesome as, happy to have mu first drink in years
Friendly staff
Papas pizza is a great family business delivering beautiful pizzas with a huge range of toppings, cooked on hot stones, you get great value for money and is remarkable for a takeaway Resteraunt

I just had the worst pizza ever at Papas Pizza. I ordered a pepperoni pizza which was very simple - pepperoni , mushroom and tomato and cheese. Guess what. - when I get it home , there's no pepperoni ! How can they advertise a pepperoni pizza and then not put pepperoni on it? The base was disgusting - it was very thin , but doughy. How can a pizza base so thin be doughy? The base wasn't even warm. So I got a tasteless pizza on a floppy doughy cold base. Disgusting!

This place is a hidden treasure! It's located in the airport business park so you could easily miss it!!! Great... Did I say great? food!!!!! Very friendly and efficient staff. The restaurant is well laid out and inviting.  A memorable time to be sure!

Best take away I have had!  The lamb is so perfectly seasoned and tender! You can tell the dish has been cooking for some time! The potatoes soak up all the juicy goodness but don't mush. The peas are perfect with a hint of mint and made to order.   The service is efficient and friendly.   Please note it seems that when they run out they close as I tried for a couple days before I successfully got to order. You can order from an ap for delivery so that is a choice as well. Also, you must pre order if you would like a leg.
It's a takeaway joint. There aren't any seats nor tables. I bought it back to savour with a group of friends. It was the best lamb shoulder I've eaten! Meat was just nice. Very enjoyable

It's simple.  They have the BEST lamb.  Lamb and potatoes, it doesn't get much better.  They have figured out the secret recipe to these two simple and delicious dishes.  If I wouldn't feel like such a fatty, I would eat an entire shoulder by myself in one sitting, just because it taste so good.  If you are in the area, do yourself a favor and go pick some up, bring it somewhere and eat it while enjoying a bottle wine.

Pedro's House of Lamb is a takeaway restaurant operating out of a trailer in a parking lot. That having been said, they do only one thing, and that they do very well. It's all about the lamb. It is very moist, tender, and delicious! It comes with scalloped potatoes, period. That's it for the menu. The price per portion is $50. It wasn't until I got home and opened the box that I realized that one portion easily feeds two people. The benefit of buying too much food is that there are left overs for another day! One can book online but if ordering between 4-8pm it is better to order by phone. If you like lamb shank, this place is for you.

Walk up for takeout.  Such a succulent piece of Lamb. The rosemary and spices were absolutely done to perfection.   Simple pan of meat and potatoes, but add a salad or pick one up at a store, and this is a "MUST DO" in Christchurch.  Huge portion for $50 NZ  My petite wife and I afterwards, were thinking, I can't believe we almost ate the whole thing........  Well done guys!  I will eat here again and bring friends......and then we will go to the park and have a great meal and enjoy the park beauty.

This place is the bomb!  I was staying at the George and was looking for a bite to eat--this place was only a 2 minute drive away and the reviews looked good so I gave it a shot.  The lamb shoulder and potatoes were delish!  More than enough food for two.  The key is to shred the lamb a bit and mix it in with the juices--makes it nice and tender and flavorful. Highly recommended.

Our debut into New Zealand lamb, and Pedro's did not disappoint. Luckily, they were close to our hotel, because we had to check back a couple times to catch them at a time when they were open (4-8). Other than some novelty shirts and sausage, they only sell one thing: lamb shoulder with scalloped potatoes and you can buy bread baguettes.   The sales guy was great, even showed us the plate of food so we could understand sizing, and recommended bread for soaking up the juice. The lamb is so tender, almost like a pot roast, with a lovely, crispy exterior. The potatoes are not as cheesy as scalloped potatoes I've had in the past, but they accompany the lamb very well. Definitely get the bread...because soaking up the juice is the best part!  I wish there had been a few outdoor picnic tables, but nevertheless, we grabbed our mound of food and had a nice time eating it back in our hotel. We even had leftovers for breakfast.
So easy and so good! Rosemary infused potatoes and lamb braised to perfection. They offer excellent rustic baguettes tthat are well worth the $2. Don't miss this ample, delicious meal.
wasn't outstanding but simply good. if you drop by christchurch, this is a must try. I love the lamb but not the potato though. maybe just my taste.

Love it. My first meal in NZ and what a winner.  Cost is still 40$ which gets you plenary of food for 2 people.  The lamb shank was perfectly cooked and very soft.  The potatoes are ok- personally I would've preferred roasted m or mashed.   Add some bread to dip in the gravy.

You know those delicious-looking wool-covered white things that you see all over New Zealand? Well they actually are delicious. I have not found a place in the world that cooks 'em up better than Pedro's in Christchurch.  If you mistook this place for a place that screws around, then you would be mistooken. They most certainly do not. Pedro knows what the people want, and what they want is a big ol' lamb shoulder + potatoes, bathed in the juices, paired with either a top quality brew from an establishment like 8 Wired, Epic, Renaissance, Tuatara, or Liberty, or a top quality pinot noir from Central Otago. That is it. You do not need anything else on the menu, or in life. (Maybe tacos occasionally, and a good episode of "Game of Thrones")  If you're by yourself like me, aimlessly roaming around New Zealand as Bob Dylan would say "Like a Rolling Stone" (in my case I like to picture myself as Mick Jagger), and you go here, be hungry. Very hungry. There's one meal you can get here. It's enormous, and it's $40. Want something else? Something smaller? On a diet? Vegan? If so, the only thing to do is GTFO and STFU. The guy there pegged me as a morbidly obese McDonald's-gruffling American even though I'm only a slightly overweight taco-gruffling American, and he said I could probably finish it all. Dude thinks we're all Joey Chestnut. I'm not, so it lasted two meals. May last more than two for you if you're not American and/or not fat.   In short, this place is the most legit lamb joint in Kiwiland. For the upcoming elections for the king of the "Game of Thrones" House Lambister, I have three words for you: VOTE FOR PEDRO!
Highly recommended as a good all-round top class meal - those that remember dining in at Pedro's pre-quake can reminisce and the rest will still love one of the heartiest meals known to man!!

Looking for a GREAT meal at a great price? Looking to savor some delicious New Zealand lamb? Look no farther - this is the place. They say it serves two, but if you have three people you'll still each have a full meal.   Slow roasted lamb, accompanied with scalloped potatoes. Cooked to perfection the meat falls off the bone.   Accompany this with a glass of Otago Pinot Noir and you'll have the quintessential NZ dinner.
We love Pedros! One dish comfortably feeds both of us with sandwiches for the next couple of days. It's just a good hearty Lamb meal with delicious potatoes as well. We normally add greens as a side.

This place SO rocked and they were open on a Sunday night.  Chef told us one tray would feed two but we ordered four trays, three of which was a good feed for 10! Lamb was cooked to perfection and the scalloped potatoes were the perfect addition. Pedro's is located next to an equally awesome liquor store with a great selection of libations.
Zc. I couldn't be in New Zealand without having New Zealand lamb I stopped by Pedro's and pick up the best meal I've had since I've been to New Zealand

I understand the skepticism for a five star review of a food truck located in a liquor store parking lot, but you have to trust me on this one. You can pre-order your lamb dinner to pick up on your way home so you can strut through the door like the dinner hero or, if you arrive on the early side, can try your luck the day of. The meal is easily enough for 4 people to enjoy and consists of a perfectly prepared lamb shoulder that is fall off the bone delicious and roast potatoes that are smooth and creamy. For $40, you absolutely get your money's worth and then some. I recommend it for couples on a budget as you can get several meals out of this one amazing dish. Can't fail to mention how nice the guys in the truck are either!

Pedros does one dish, lamb and potatoes. It used to have a restaurant location, which was destroyed in the earthquake. They've reinvented themselves as a food truck with no seating.  A small place with no real physical location is easy to evaluate. The lamb is fantastic and potatoes are mediocre. There is plenty of food (3 of us shared it for a lunch and were full). And at $35, it's one of the cheapest meals around.

Pedro Lamb that falls right off the bone. Delicious! The meals are huge - with the lamb and the potatos so you get a lot for your money. Since the quake Pedro has set up home in a little food truck in front of Liquor King. Pedro and his staff are always lovely to deal with. Highly recommended.

Quoting from the last reviewer, "roast lamb done right".  That's exactly what Pedro's is.  It's lamb, out of a food truck, with sketchy ever-changing hours, no seating, and they run out of food some days if you leave it til too late, but they do their roast lamb right.  We got a lamb shoulder for $35, which fed two girls (*ahem* ladies) for two meals - so I think a family of four could turn this into one tasty, complete meal.  The lamb came with potatoes, also done right, in a large takeout aluminum container.  Definitely delicious, and definitely worth a try.  I thought it was expensive at first until I realized how much food we got. Dinner for four for $35 in NZ?  That's practically unheard of!

This place obviously specializes in lamb, and as a food truck/trailer literally serves only lamb shoulders and legs, along with scalloped potatoes as a side.  They also sell some pork products imported from various parts of Europe, but that's definitely not the emphasis.   The first night we tried coming here we found that the lamb was already sold out- the owner kindly told us that it'd behoove us to call in an order for the next day (which was the last day of our trip in NZ).  We did so, and picked up a HUGE leg of lamb and a large tray of potatoes for ~$50 NZD.  The leg was more than enough to feed my parents, my wife, and me.  Flavor wise, the lamb was done very well- it was simply roast lamb done right.  There was a crisp but not charred/burnt surface, with a pool of natural juices enhancing the flavor of each bite of meat we dipped into it.    We ate our meal off of a picnic bench in front of a bunch of kids playing tennis before returning our rental car to the airport.  Nothing elegant about it- and I woudn't've had it any other way.  This place is a winner folks.
Great pub. Very very helpful staff. They go leaps and bounds to make you feel welcome. They do some absolutely glorious grub too. Make a mighty brown brew too
What a fantastic place on a Monday night with talented musicians playing joyful music, it was a pleasure to find this little gem in the middle of Christchurch
Good pub with quick service and good food, not badly priced, the worst part was finding close parking within a fair walking distance. Good atmosphere, friendly staff and tasty food.
Been many times. Always wonderful. Great service. Amazing blue cod and chips. Wonderful expresso martini (a work of art) and lovely desserts to finish. We will return.. Again and again and again!
This is an amazing location in the middle of town. The atmosphere is great and the service was amazing. Simon is an amazing host and is full of life. Would highly recommend this place to anyone

We ordered a starter meal, when it came out it was the wrong, meal, our main came out the rice was hard and under cooked, the butter chicken was tasteless, meals were small, nan bread was doughy, once we finished our main we then got the right starter, chicken was tasteless. Very disappointed with this meal tonight.
Yummy! Obviously family run. The food is wonderful.

Good restaurant but one of the chefs has become the manager and he needs to get everything up to scratch. Menu prices aren't accurate, it's $20 for most vegetarian mains. If there's any trouble with the phone or online orders then I recommend to simply visit. They are open most days but not on Monday and not on Sunday for lunch (should be open on Sunday for dinner though)
Best cheese and garlic naan ever! Curries are also so good.  Also the service is quick, you're welcomed with friendly faces. The owner was so gracious with giving me free rice for takeaway?
My Uber eats driver friend had to wait over half an hour to get his order! There were another 4 drivers waiting! The owners prioritised restaurant diners and takeaway customers. Absolute disgrace!
Brilliant staff and food! The oyster dish would be my all time favourite meal. Wonderful and posh ambience. Definitely a degistation venue you do not want to miss!

why why why?? i was SO close to giving a GLOWING review....and then their restaurant manager ruined the deal...to be covered in the service portion  ambiance//***** the restaurant's ambiance is modernly upscale without pomp or circumstance when you step through the quilted doors, the reception area's chandelier provides a hint of the glamour that awaits! the coolest thing is the wall decor made of burnt zip ties.....who knew something so ordinary could be elevated exponentially??  service//** the waitstaff, and especially hostess eiko was pleasant for the most part halfway through, i discovered an EARWIG in my water O_O EWWWW! the waiter took my glass away without an apology...and we had to ask for new glasses it was extremely disconcerting...and my cousin was upset enough to mention it to eiko when she was taking care of our bill....she was equally horrified and apologized quickly moving to inform her manager  the manager merely said they would write a report so the entire staff would know....uh...WHAT? they didn't even have the decency to comp us for our drinks...HOW RUDE  food//***** there are 3 dining options...the 12 dish pre-fixe . 5 dish middle menu . or a la carte  we decided to go with the 5 dish and ordered each of the available choices...so we really had 10 dishes and a few extras like the amuse bouche kickoff  their dishes were delightfully plated and tasted exquisitely delicate...favourites of ours include the fried oyster . smoked eggplant . cured venison with a name like pescatore, it's a given their seafood would be delightful....but their meats were also prepared with elegance the 8 textures of white was the only disappoint, but the milk & honey was lovely the paper thing dessert crisps were the lovely end ~*~ how i would have liked to recommend you highly....but all i can say is check your water!! i know for years to come, pescatore will be remembered as our weird earwig experience.....can't say you didn't make it a memorable night
Great food
Authentic.
Amazing food and atmosphere
The food was excellent taste wise but the portions felt extremely small
Some of the best Thai food I've ever had
Disappointing. Panang curry was watery and not flavourfull , small portions. Rice was overcooked :(
OK food,no spoon or fork to eat with on takeaways.yes I would go back.
Great Yam Cha As good as any in Sydney or Melbourne. Friendly efficient service.
Although the environment is a bit dated, the service was very friendly. The food was also delicious. Highly recommended.

The service staff were very nice. There were too few tables for two people, so only two could fit two people. It was a bit uncomfortable to be in front of the cashier. The dishes were average. The meat in the preserved egg and lean pork congee was too big and a bit fishy. It might be because there was too little pepper or ginger, which didn't suppress the fishy smell of the pork. The chicken feet were okay, but there was a taste that was not the traditional black bean sauce chicken feet. It was acceptable, but not a big fan. The ginger in the xiaolongbao was too big and you could chew it. The hawthorn barbecue pork bun was bland.
The dim sum and dishes are delicious. The prices are reasonable. We go there every time we come to Christchurch.

Tried out the newly opened Phoenix, and I was blown away by both the creativity and flavor! Their Black Gold Prawn Dumplings are a showstopper — jet black with a gold shimmer, and packed with juicy, sweet prawn goodness. And don’t even get me started on the Durian Pastry… shaped like an elegant black swan, it’s almost too pretty to eat (but I still devoured it, of course ).  Other highlights from the feast:  Spicy Chicken Feet  Crispy Pan-Fried Dumplings  Red Rice Noodle Rolls  Silky Congee  Juicy Pork Meatballs  It’s modern, it’s bold, and it still hits all the nostalgic dim sum notes. If you love dim sum with a twist — this is your new weekend go-to.

Morning tea was okay, shrimp dumplings and siu mai were just so-so, and xiaolongbao was okay. The shrimps in the red rice shrimp intestines are relatively small and not plump, but very crispy. The preserved egg and lean meat porridge is light and delicious, but the pork is very big.

Interesting that this place is called Pier Side Cafe. It is beside the Brighton Pier, but it isn't really a cafe. It's more a pub/bar that does coffee and meals. The bar dominates the eating area, along with a pool table and juke box. There's 1980's rock music playing and most people come in for a drink. There's an outdoor area too. Having said that though, I enjoyed my omelette for lunch. It was served "pub style" on a board with a salad and wedges (which I omitted). All in all it was fine.
Great coffee roasted here and delicious pies and pastries. Owners are so friendly and provide welcoming service. Everyone should go here for a great breakfast.

We held a 50th at Pink Lady and cannot recommend it highly enough. The location and outlook are already excellent, but added with the friendly, attentive staff, great selection of food and excellent range of cocktails, a wonderful evening was had by all of our guests (about 45), ranging from 18 years old up to mid 70's. It's a unique place to hold a function in Christchurch, with an elevated view across the city and and a great vibe. We were looking for somewhere a bit different from the ordinary, and Pink Lady certainly provided!

Booked a table of 14 for my birthday dinner about 3 months before the date. When we arrived nobody came to offer us drinks, we had to go and ask even though there were 5 bar staff. The same with the food, then we were told when we finally got to order food that it would be a big wait because there is a big 50th birthday downstairs and they got the food pre ordered for 8.30. Why would you not come and tell us that sooner? My table was booked from 7pm FOR dinner, 3 months in advance. The food wasn't too bad, the calamari was inedible. The cocktails were yummy but this experience honestly ruined my 40th birthday, pretty sad about it.

Me and my partner went for the free flow pasta night. We didn’t have anyone ask for our drink order so didn’t end up getting any. The pastas were ok, quite bland though and the bread came out after we got pasta. Service was also slow and we got placed right next to the till and when asked to move the waitress was not helpful. I’ve only ever had good experiences here so was quite disappointed :/

Friend was absolutely covered in the lemon meringue drink by the waitress….. the restaurant wasn’t even going to offer compensation until we asked and they only took off 1 $12 drink, 2 hrs for food to come out and just overall wasn’t happy with how the staff dealt with the spill- I understand mistakes happen but last time I came drinks were split by the waitress- suggest changing the glass for the lemon drank as the staff don’t know how to balance a tray!
Busy night so service was a little slow but to be expected when busy. Drinks great staff fantastic
Long lunch
Long lunch

restaurant: Pint and Pony Sports Bar and Bottle Shop

reviews.text: Fantastic local sports bar! Friendly and funny staff, great food, even better pricing  well done to all

Awesome local bar! Bar staff are so friendly and great prices! Had a lovely meal of fish n chips outside in the sun. Can’t wait for summer, will be awesome to sit outside in the sun for a drink. Will definitely be back.
Great atmosphere and vibes. Lovely, genuine staff. Excellent wines on offer.  Can't wait to go back in summer and sit outside overlooking the park.
Great little local pub
Very nice Had a beer and a lite bar meal
Always love it when they have bitterbitch on tap

I wasn't expecting the pub I picked at random because it was close to my apartment to serve the best spicy chicken burger I've ever had, but here we are.  The service is great, there's a pretty big beer selection and the food is both very nice and reasonably priced.

On the record, our favourite pub in the ENTIRE country!! We live in Whakatū Nelson but will make the trip out to get our Pomeroy’s fix. The staff are always so lovely and welcoming, truly the heart of a perfect pub. The joy that comes from warm lighting, classic brick walls, and the gorgeous doggies that sit at the feet of their owners just enjoying a night at the pub - truly couldn’t ask for anything better. The menu is and always has been the best! Perfectly cooked steaks and the most delicious cauliflower burgers! Have talked a lot about moving so we can spend more time here :’) WE LOVE YOU FOREVER POMEROY’S!!!
Amazingly delicious food, cosy atmosphere and lovely service. So happy it's our local
A proper British style pub. Hand pulled ale. The bestest bitter is great.

If you're into craft beer, make sure to stop in at Pomeroys. Staff are always helpful and friendly, happy to let you try samples before choosing. Heaps of choices of taps with a range of styles of beers. And the chips are so good. Nice atmosphere. Lucky to call this one my local!

Portershed is my favorite vegan place to eat at in Christchurch.  The owner and staff are wonderful and amazing people!  I always have a blast eating there.  I have not had a bad menu item here. They have a wide range of menu items ranging from various yummy desserts, delicious meals, and drinks.  There are so many options that I have trouble deciding on what I want to eat whenever I go there.  On top of that, they sell other stuff on the side such as hemp protein cookies, snacks, milk, jackfruit and cooking ingredients.  Portershed is life!
Amazing vegan choices, great atmosphere and friendly staff.  A must for those who want unique plant based options without breaking the bank!

What a lovely place to visit and dine! The food is excellent and it's definitely worth going in!  Yes - it's fully vegan, but keep your mind open and enjoy trying something new and rest easy knowing you're doing you're body good!  If you're vegan or vegetarian it's novel and frankly amazing to be able to order anything with no worries.   The food itself is very nice, truly enjoyed the sausage roll and the others enjoyed a pinwheel and the dumplings. They're a great proxy for the 'original' items too - if you're concerned about that sort of thing!
All items on the menu are vegan. I would definitely recommend the quarter pounder burger. Possibly the best vegan burger I've eaten. Certainly the best in Christchurch.

This place is just amazing We stopped here during our road trip The food is delicious  The place is very nice on a sunny day the garden is also wonderful, good variety on the menu, lots of desserts to try. Recommended for everyone.

We had our lunch here as per friend’s suggestion. Nice environment with friendly staff. Many choices on vegetarian menu as well as Vegan. I tried bagel  and my wife tired the breakfast burger - both are delicious. Happy with our visit. Great place for food lovers especially for people who are vegetarian or vegans.
Big breakfast was both big and breakfast. Possibly best chorizo I've ever had, they said it was house made so kudos.

This vegan restaurant has a fantastic array of cabinet food. They have a small shop with a good selection of vegan goods too!  I was quite impressed with the big breakfast, very unique, flavourful, well presented and hearty with a rustic vibe  Their onion rings are no joke, kinda gourmet for onion rings, would recommend  loved their desserts, can't wait to come back!
The big breakfast was absolutely incredible and some of the best vegan food I’ve ever had.
Absolutely amazing vegan food. Very well presented and wonderful flavors.

I wish I’d read the recent reviews. The food was super disappointing-if I could give it zero stars I would. We ordered the duck bao buns, pork and coriander dumplings and xiao long bao.  The xiao long bao were too big and lacked any flavour. The duck bao buns had two small pieces of duck and the skin was chewy The pork dumplings had a weird texture and also no flavour.  Cost us $60 too…Avoid this place!

Just ate there. The food was poor as it had clearly been store bought and reheated badly. Could peel the dumpling skin as if it was the dead bits of skin on my feet. What’s meant to be fried dumpling was all soft and hot as if a microwave had reheated it. Don’t let the somewhat nice setup in there deceive you from the meh food. Like if you don’t know how to cook Asian food that’s okay! Just don’t make an Asian restaurant. Make something else instead. Also, the restraunt was basically empty and we got put into a seat with the sun directly in my eyes when there was a free booth right infront of me. Service was good.

I’ve dined at this restaurant before and absolutely loved it, so I was really looking forward to my Uber Eats order.  The bao buns were good, but the dumplings were nearly inedible — rock hard in places with some raw patches on the outside, like they hadn’t been cooked properly. They were still warm, so I don’t believe it was a delivery issue. We only managed to eat a few of the 16 before giving up.  I’ve sent an email and a follow-up with no response. Really disappointing, especially given the cost and how great my past dine-in experiences have been.
We love this place! Great food, great service and a lovely atmosphere.
Really good food, struggled to find somewhere to eat and stumbled on this. Will just come straight here last time. Recommend the bao and dumpling

This place might have good food - we wouldn't know. We made a booking 24 hours beforehand, and arranged to meet friends for an early meal before heading to a show. We arrived to find another group (not booked) using our booked table. The staff were completely unhelpful - just shrugged their shoulders and were unwilling to move the people. We commented (politely) that we were not impressed, but in the end went to another restaurant. What annoyed me the most was the 'we really don't care' attitude of the staff.  We're never going back that's for sure.
Excellent!  Just What I needed.  I have been cRaving good dumplings since I left Taiwan  12 years ago.  Fresh and tasty.

I'm not sure why this place has good reviews.  I found their dumplings to be surprising average-- they don't even use homemade wrappers.  Tried the pork and chive dumplings and they were just not special. I also had the cha shao about which were ok.   Where I am from this place wouldn't survive.

Hip little dumpling restaurant in Christchurch.  After a month of traveling and not always having the best food, I was definitely craving some Asian comfort food.  When I saw dumpling bar, it was like my prayers have been answered!    We ordered so much food!  Pork 'n' Garlic Chive Dumplings, Pork 'n' Ginger and Spring Onion Dumplings, Pork Belly Bao Bun, Beijing Duck Bao Bun, Pork & Prawn Shumai, Steamed Asian Greens, and PSDB Signature Xiaolongbao.  I was soooooooo excited for our food.    But then, a few items came out, we stuffed our faces, and then the food just stopped.  It took a very long while for the rest of our food to come out.  Turns out they forgot about the rest of our orders.  I was pretty frustrated (but still patient) at the time, and the server was very apologetic about the wait.  They even gave us a cucumber salad for free.  When I finally got the check, they took off about ¾ of our bill - most of the dumplings and even our drinks.    So, in the end, we left as happy campers with full bellies.  Would I come back?  Absolutely!  The food was phenomenal.
Yum lunch, prompt food, the coriander pork dumplings are my favourite! Good luck getting a table during the lunch hour- they share seating with half a dozen other places in the food court area

We are Asian Americans who were on the last leg of our honeymoon when we came upon this place.  Let's just say I was longing for some Asian food after feeling like I smelled like a New Zealand lamb from eating so much of it.  Dumplings sounded like an amazing idea.  I knew I wasn't supposed to expect much..  First thing I noticed.  We were the only Asians in the place when we walked in.  Hm.. hope that doesn't mean anything..  Second thing, The place is kind of dark, like they are trying to make eating Chinese dumplings a cool, hip, bad-boy, thing to do.  Strange, but okay.  I didn't like the weird eerie dark background music with random Chinese going on.  Eerie, very eerie.  Now what about the food? Food was good.  The dumplings (fried) were nice and crispy, though as another reviewer said, kind of an interesting style I hadn't had before.  The steamed dumplings were not bad as well. The xiao long bao was good, but the skin was not as thin as I like (It's not DIN TAI FUNG, k guys?).   They ran out of duck :( so we also got the pork belly "burger" ... that was good, crispy pork deliciousness, and kind of funny.  It's basically bigger than your average pork belly open faced bun (IDK how to say it in English), so they call it a burger!  Also, the service, was, really, not there.   I would have given them higher stars if they had been a little, LITTLE more attentive.  We were waiting for so long sitting at the table with our menu that I started to wonder if we were supposed to go to the counter to order??  Genuinely!  We weren't.. ?  We also were given no napkins to start with.  We asked for a refill on water and it came the first time, but the second time, it didn't come.    --Bottom line, it was good for a dumpling craving coming from California, but it was more expensive than what we were used to and we didn't like the bar feel.--

On our way out of Christchurch, we stopped at Pot Sticker to grab a quick bite. I have to say that their website is quite clear about their enthusiasm about dumplings, and the storefront - with a lot of manga art around the front - is similarly reflective of the affinity for Asian culture.   Placing our order was relatively quick, and after a ~7-10 minute wait, we sat down at the bar surrounding the restaurant, we started chowing down. The one upshot here is that the meat filling, particularly the pork, is much higher-quality stuff than your usual generic pork meat that gets stuffed in dumplings. The flavor of the pork is very good, and I really liked the flavor of the winter warmer dumplings. Unfortunately, the technique was not up to snuff, detracting away from the overall experience. The wrapper on the steamed dumpling was a bit rubbery, making each bite a tad strange. The fried dumpling was even more puzzling; it appears that all that is done is taking a steamed dumpling and having it sit in a skillet covered with a thin film of frying oil. All this served to do was give the outer edges a crisp, but since they were steamed, it made them extremely dry.  In short - while the filling is pretty top-notch, the wrapper and cooking technique of the dumpling fell a bit short of what I would expect in my favorite dumplings. If they could perfect that, along with doing a true fried dumpling (e.g. don't steam them, then attempt to fry them - just throw the whole thing on the skillet and give it a good oily crisp on the bottom) - this would definitely get a marked-up rating from me.

This is a tiny corner-store in the Colombo mall that looks like it belongs in a Japanese manga!   Order a dozen steamed or fried dumplings, choose your filling and dipping sauce, then sit back and wait for the magic to unfold!    Watch the little dumpling masters expertly cup each pot-sticker wrapper in their palm, slap a bit of filling, then lace it with sesame oil and the hot, soupy juice that will squirt out when you bite into it! A thumb here and there, and before you can say 'kung fu', the edges are sealed and neatly crimp frilled!   Slosh goes the oil, in goes the pot-stickers until they start to brown, then comes the scoop of hot water and down goes the bamboo lid! Ask for steamed dumplings and watch the pot-stickers get chucked into boiling water and gently poked around until they start to float!   Pick them up with your chopsticks, dunk them in the sauce and stick them in your gob for the best dumpling experience - this side of China!   If you're still not convinced, then surf their manga-style website and prepare to have their red and black digital ink brand you with an unhealthy obsession for dumplings!
The best dumplings you will ever taste in Christchurch.  Obsessed and I have tried all their menu items. Would love to go again and again and again...

I am obsessed with dumplings and this place does some of the best in Christchurch. I spent a year in Napier where there are no decent dumplings to be found for love or money so it was such a relief to return to Christchurch and discover Pot Stickers a mere 100m from my work. Don't expect to find any food here but dumplings but thats ok because they are exceptional.  There are generally about 4-5 different flavours, and they do vege tuesday. The beef and beetroot is surprisingly spectacular (I had my doubts) and my personal favourite is the classic pork and coriander. Your options are 6/12/18 steamed or fried. Be prepared to wait if you want fried as its always busy. Steamed is faster. I go for the "dozen matter" which offers a selection of all the flavours, and yes you can get 6 of the dozen matter if you are just after a snack. These dumplings are exploding with flavour, packed full of filling, and perfectly cooked. There is a window that looks into the kitchen so you can see the dumpling chefs hard at work while waiting for your meal.  I come here at least once a week and can recommend it wholeheartedly.

Nom nom nom.  Dumplings.  Nom.  This uber popular casual mall eatery features 4-5 flavors of dumplings daily.  You can choose steamed or pan-fried and watch your order prepared from behind glass.  My favorites are the pork & coriander and the beef & beetroot.  An order of six is not quite enough for one person, but twelve equals nap time.  Just know that going in.  Haha.  Wash the delicious bites down with a ginger beer and enjoy procrastinating at work the rest of the day.

This amazing little dumpling joint is tucked away inside Colombo Mall. I have only been during the lunch hour and the line is always at least 5 or 6 people long. They offer 5 flavors (4 are always the same, one changes) and you can order them by the 1/2 or dozen. I prefer to order the "Dozen Matter" where you can get whichever dumplings you want. My favorite flavors are Garlic Pork and Chive (staple) the Vegetarian option (staple) or Beefroot (speciality: beef + beetroot). They also have chicken dumplings, too. There are 3 sauces to choose from (or get all three) chili, vinegar, soy. You can ask for them to be extra hot if you'd like (as someone who can't stand heat, the chili does have a bite).   There is seating in the mall, both at a large communal table and on stools against the dumpling joint. I love sitting at the stools because you can watch the dumplings being made, which provides entertainment while you wait (at least 10 minutes from order time).  Street parking is definitely hard to find, and you will need to find a spot longer than 30 minutes. This is not a quick "in and out" option as the dumplings are cooked to order. I definitely recommend driving out of your way to have lunch here. You will not be disappointed as these are some of the best dumplings I have had (outside of New York City)!

We had dinner at Pothichor last weekend, and it was wonderful. The staff were polite and welcoming, and the food was simply delicious. If you are missing Kerala food, this is the place to go — everything tasted fresh and truly traditional.

I have been here for 3 times: Experience 1 : ordered mysore masala dosa, got Bug in sambhar. Owner not ready to replace the dish just got me a new bowl of sambhar. However, they offered us cold dal pakoda at the end for the compensation. Experience 2: Ordered mysore masala, waited for 45 mins, still staff was serving everyone else but not even answering to us for the delay. We asked them to cancel the order as it was taking too long. They didn't cancel the order. At the end we left after 50 minutes. Experience 3: politely requested staff to get the table cleaned, got replied very rudely to keep calm. Staff hardly understand English and it is very hard to communicate even simple things like ordering food from their own menu.
Very poor service, I waited for almost like 45 minutes for just one dosa. Very disappointing service.

We’ve always loved South Indian food, especially the fish, which is why we regularly ordered from Potichor with our family. The food has always been good in the past — but this time was such a disappointing experience that we won’t be returning.  We ordered through Uber Eats, and the fish that arrived was extremely cold, stale, and clearly not fresh — completely inedible. We called the restaurant to inform them, and the person on the phone casually said, “Just microwave it for 2 minutes bro.” We explained that we had paid for fresh food, but he insisted it was made fresh “today,” which is already concerning for seafood. When we questioned the freshness, he said he’d bring new fish to “see who’s lying,” but he never showed up.  It’s really disappointing to see how the quality and customer service have declined. We used to love this place, but after this experience, we’ll unfortunately never order from Potichor again.
Went on Saturday, was busy but great food and great service. We had prawn roast, kizhi parotta and chicken curry and beef fry. Loved everything.

We recently went to this restaurant with a group of friends, had a great night, we thought the food would be too spicy for our American friend, but it wasnt and she liked it. Every one had a wonderful time, had kababs, rices, rotis, Chicken curry (the best), Doogh - this reminded me of sour buttermilk my mom used to make. It was great!  Pros: Great food in great quantity, price - reasonable, good staff, clean place, fantastic location.  Cons: Heating - we had to put our jackets throughout the dinner.
Love the food and relaxed atmosphere (29 deg Spring day) we brunched outside.  Perfect and welcoming as always AAA+++
Great local spot with plenty of seating options both indoor and out
Great place. Beer selection
Popped in early Sunday afternoon to pick six craft beers for my partner’s birthday. Staff were super helpful, and he loved his gift! Keen to come back for food and the atmosphere in the future.
Beer n stuff
Great variety of craft beers. The hazy IPA from Garage Project was excellent. Plenty of nice indoor and outdoor seating.  The pork ribs and chips from next door were tasty too.
MotoSocial event. Great atmosphere
Delicious breakfast menu, cabinet food for lunch, superhealthy and amazingly delicious and beautiful. Just go!
Tasty traditional Japanese food with their own twist. Dont think twice go

The first five customers to arrive after the shop opens will receive a free whole soft-boiled egg!  This small shop has a small room where they seem to make their own noodles. This is our favorite ramen shop in Christchurch so far.
Really good!

Really enjoyed the curry rice dish here. There were a few spice levels to choose from, I got very spicy, and it was just right. I feel like the heat is like similar to habanero hot peppers.
