The curry was sweet but also salty, and has great flavors.  I dont say that much about Japanese curries but this place was really good.  The ramen was also very good with good  flavors in the broth. The pork chasu was cut very thick.  The condiments on the table was also labeled. There was also suggestions on how to flavour your ramen.  Run by japanese people so you know its authentic. There is plenty of parking on Leslie St car park. Also noting they dknt accept international payment. We had to go withdraw cash from a nearby atm.  Whole heartedly recommend dining here and prices are very good!
Best Ramen in Christchurch! The broths are rich in flavour while the noodles and protein are cooked to perfection
Heads up, they don't take pay-wave or credit. There's an ATM across the street, and the food+atmosphere is worth it!

The stock is rich with a subtle seafood note, balanced beautifully with the chicken base. The noodles are fresh, and the karaage chicken is cooked just right—tender inside, crisp outside. The savoriness pairs perfectly with the creamy mayo. A well-crafted bowl of Japanese ramen—I’d definitely come back
The noodle is very nice and chewy. There were a lot of meats as well. The broth is a bit too salty but it works well since it made the noodle a lot more flavourful.
The service was good, and the food was okay
Good ramen place and good atmosphere. the umami and savouring are still slacking though. Decent ramen but great service. Not very spicy. Beer tastes good but was charged at an insane price.
Delicious and special taste

I visited for dinner on Sunday night and ordered the spiced edamame and signature miso ramen, both of which were good as always. However, the service was dissapointing. Despite the restaurant not being particularly busy, I had a long wait. I was seated upstairs and had to wait 20 minutes for someone to take my order, at which point I had to get up and go to the counter myself. The male kiwi waiter seemed distracted by his phone and didn't seem to notice the dirty tables around me. After I got my food, I had to ask for cutlery, which took another 10-15 minutes to arrive. It was a bit frustrating, especially given how empty the restaurant was.

It was alright. I ordered the jumbo size, and it was definitely big enough. Just to let others know, my jumbo ramen was served in a normal-sized bowl, while it’s usually served in a jumbo bowl. The soup was quite different from other ramen shops—it’s thicker, which must be their own style.

Myself and a small group of friends have been on the hunt for the best ramen in Christchurch for the better part of a year now. We've tried many different spots, but always find ourselves circling back to Ramen x Music. We can't fault it. It's my absolute favourite (...bonus points for playing Oasis as it's a nice reminder of my hometown ). You'll always be greeted warmly here and leave feeling happy and well fed
Been coming here for years, a family favourite especially when it’s cold outside!

Best ramen I’ve had outside of Japan. I am guessing some nights they may have piano music but not the night we went. Still was an excellent meal, super friendly staff, and I felt like I was in Japan. Will come back one day I hope!

Soooo delicious  we were recommended this place from a friend on our next visit to Chch and it did not disappoint! Authentic, rich and delicious ramen - took us back to our visit to Japan.  Will be coming here every time we go back down to chch.
Stingiest portion sizes aye, get a dog in ya

Delicious Asian dishes, not your standard fare. Orders are shared, but you should plan on at least two dishes per person, as the portions are intentionally small. Very friendly service, good wines. Overall, reasonably priced.
Delicious food!! Lots of unique flavours and great textures. Fresh, exotic and nutritious fare. Really friendly, helpful staff, and my favourite wine was on the menu too.
Always amazing. Have been more times than we can count and for good reason. Mouth watering dishes , great service and lovely atmosphere.
Best place in town. Amazing food and great healthy options. Loved the chicken curry and the nga sein chin! Highly recommend to my friends.
Unique experience
Love the food here. It’s so flavoursome and the service is amazing.

A memorable and mouthwatering experience at Rangoon Ruby  I had the pleasure of dining at Rangoon Ruby on Colombo Street in Christchurch, thanks to a thoughtful recommendation—and invitation—from a friend originally from Burma. What a delightful discovery.  The restaurant’s interior is simply stunning. Modern touches blend seamlessly with traditional Burmese details—from the intricately designed menu on the wall and the colorful umbrellas adorning the ceiling, to the striking mural of Burmese women gracing the back wall. It creates a welcoming and culturally rich atmosphere.  From the moment we stepped inside, the hospitality was exceptional. The hostess greeted us with genuine warmth, and we were pleasantly surprised when the Chef and members of the kitchen staff came out to say hello. Our waiter was equally impressive—friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu.  Now, the food. Every dish was a standout. The seafood was perfectly cooked, infused with delicate yet vibrant flavours. The beef curry was melt-in-your-mouth tender, no knife required. I couldn’t get enough of the Tea Leaf Salad—I nearly finished the entire thing myself. We ended on a high note with a dessert that tasted like a comforting blend of warm rice pudding and sponge cake, paired with fresh fruit and cream.  All in all, Rangoon Ruby offers a truly special dining experience—flavourful, heartfelt, and beautifully executed. It’s an absolute must-try.

Beautiful, modern and spacious Burmese restaurant in Christchurch.  The server was very friendly, accommodating and actually from Burma/Myanmar.  Food was very tasty with authentic flavors, but can be adjusted for Western palates (primarily by dialing down the heat). If you have spicy food lovers, be sure to ask for the chilies on the side...they pack a lot of heat!  We enjoyed the Le Pet Thoke salad, Seit Da Kin (lamb skewers) and Jetda Ono Hin curry.  Everything was delicious and goes well with their selection of beers.  Only thing that I would change is perhaps having a little more tea leaves in the Le Pet Thoke.  Overall a lovely dinner and nice change of pace from the other Asian (mostly Japanese, Chinese, Thai and Vietnamese) restaurants in town.

If I could give more stars, I would. The food is amazing. Every dish is well thought out. They use the freshest ingredients to create magnificent dishes. Please give this restaurant a try, you won't be disappointed.
Very good traditional Burmese cuisine  Wait staff were friendly and helpful. Try the Tea Salad

Burmese food in Christchurch? We were intrigued so we decided to check out Rangoon Ruby for our first dinner in town. It's merged with The Bodhi Tree so don't confuse the two; it's now under one roof. Mama Hooch is located right next door to them.  We dropped in for an early Monday dinner (around 5:45pm). The inside is gorgeous with two floors and a very clean, modern look. Interesting that most of the clientele was Caucasian.   The menu is short and sweet; nibbly bits, soups, vegetable/salad, meat, seafood and desserts. The drink menu is standard but at least the bottles are reasonable.   - Lepet thoke ($14.50 NZD) - tea leaf salad is a Burmese speciality. Pickled tea leaves mixed with lentils, nuts, sesame seeds and chili. Barely any heat nor much tea leaf flavour but still a tasty dish. Also, way too pricey for such a small appetizer.  - 2x steamed rice ($3.00 NZD/person) - we weren't sure but turns out you can get free refills on rice. Sweet because it's steep enough for plain white rice.  - Nga kin ($17.50 NZD) - a boneless fillet of fresh fish (grouper) baked in the oven. When this dish got dropped off, we did a double take. Smallest piece of fish I've seen on a plate. Fish was nicely cooked but plain. Luckily, the side sauce was BOMB; could have drank that on its own. It was sweet, spicy and tangy (a mix of soy sauce, fish sauce, vinegar, cilantro, chives and hot pepper). - Seit da nut ($16.50 NZD) - lamb curry cooked with lemongrass, ginger and curry leaves. You get three pieces; again, small portion but the lamb was tender and delicious. Wish that you'd get some vegetables with this dish.  Good flavours but know coming in that portions are small. 3.5 stars.
First review! Haven't eaten yet but smells mouth watering so far  Here in Christchurch for a night with Cheetah girls on our road trip through New Zealand.

Went out for a client dinner. 6 of us and tucked into about 9 or 10 sharing plates. The food was amazing. The crab balls, salmon croquettes and fried chicken were probably the highlights but every dish was impeccable. Adam, our server, was very knowledgeable and ensured that we were ordering the right amount of food for our party. The wine was fabulous and his choice of a NZ pinotage (didn’t know we could produce it here?) was sublime. Desserts were perfection and we all left with a very pleasant taste in our mouths.
I’ve been here a few times and the food has always been incredible, the cocktails glorious and the service just unbeatable. 100% recommend
The concept is based on sharing plates with bold, well-balanced flavors.  The chef didn't seem to be in the best of moods that day, but his dishes were still excellent.
4 of us had a delicious lunch at rascals with share plates which we all really enjoyed. The waiter was very attentive  and informative. We will definitely be back.

We visited this restaurant today for lunch. From the time we walked in warmly welcomed. A great choice of food to share, beautifully prepared and so delicious. Lovely atmosphere. Will definitely be returning
Absolutely lovely experience. Food was great. Service was even better. Will come back.

Rascal is one of our firm favourite restaurants in Christchurch. The food is excellent with a regularly changing menu. The must haves do stay for us to enjoy again and again. The service is first rate and we enjoy the advice and banter from the team. Last night we had grabbed a First Table, but we often dine in the restaurant. My fiancé had a lovely birthday dinner. Thanks team, we will be back again soon L & D

Visiting from the US,a family member suggested we eat lunch here. After walking through the newly constructed city we were very hungry and ready to eat fulfilling food. For an all Vega menu everything we had was amazing. If we lived in Christchurch we would eat here every week!
Because there is ample seating but most customers stop in for coffe-on-the-go, this cafe is the perfect place for tea, elevensies, and a quiet conversation or work hour. Pleasant staff.
Great service, wonderful food, overall just a great experience!
The food we ordered was very salty and we had to wait a long time. I don't like the way they order the food

If you’re like me, sometimes all you want for lunch is a hot plate of rice with a few hearty, familiar dishes. I found just that at a humble Chinese restaurant in Christchurch — and the best part? It was only $10.  Here’s what I had today: •	 Mapo Tofu – Silky soft tofu with a light kick of spice and that signature numbing flavor. Not too oily, super comforting, and perfect with rice. •	 Stir-fried Celery with Pork – Crisp celery and tender pork slices cooked simply but full of wok hei — tasted just like home cooking. •	 Braised Beef Brisket with Potato – The beef was melt-in-your-mouth tender, and the potato soaked up all that rich, savory sauce. It honestly felt like something that had been simmering for hours in a family kitchen.   Served with a generous portion of steamed white rice, the whole meal felt hearty, warm, and deeply satisfying. No frills, just honest-to-goodness food that reminds you of a meal back home.   If you’re in Christchurch and craving a real Chinese lunch that doesn’t break the bank, this spot is a hidden gem. The dishes change daily too — so there’s always something new to try.
Good place for chinese food, parking available. So many selections
I went to Red Bowl for the first time today and I really enjoyed the food and service and the price for the lunch menu is great.
Great food, great service
One of the best Chinese restaurants in Chch, really recommended “Kung Pao Chicken” and “Small potato big dish Chicken ”

Food was really nice and very reasonably priced. Service was a little slow, chaotic at times, and some of the staff had little English. A part from that they were very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was nice, and tastefully decorated while still retaining a traditional Thai look. Good selection of foods and a easy to understand Spice Scale (see pic). Definitely would go again.
Great service and amazing food. Pad kee mow and the Roast Duck Curry are absolute winners.

Absolutely love this Thai takeaway! The service is always friendly, and the food is consistently fresh and delicious. The veggie wontons are a standout, crispy, flavourful, and perfectly made every time. Highly recommend!
Grate food
Peanut sauce was all veges half cooked, won't go back.
Delicious food, good service, very handsome owner
This is a great place for Thai takeaway, fast, friendly and super tasty.

Absolutely love this place. We have had it +5 times and it never fails! The Pad Thai is so delicious and full of flavour, also has decent veges! The green curry is devine! We love the vegetarian wontons too. There is always a lovely man on the phone when you confirm your online order. Portion sizes are excellent too.
My red and green curries had a good flavor but way too much sugar. It almost tasted like a dessert!
This is our go to Thai takeaway café. Food is always delicious and they use plenty of veges.  Love it. Can trust the flavor and quality.
Amazing food, the taste is delicious! Great service, good size meals and great price. Best Thai in chch!

I was pleasantly surprised at how affordable this place is despite located at a touristy place at the top of the Christchurch gondola. Most of the lunch menus were $18.50. Despite this, it was delicious and would match restaurants in downtown. We ordered the seafood platter for 2. The serving was plenty for two people and it comes with some salad greens despite not being listed in the menu. A table beside us ordered fish and chips and that also came with some salad greens. They also commented on how affordable the food was.   The restaurant also had self-serve glass of water on the far right of the counter, which was a very nice gesture for those who don't want to order coffee or tea to go with their food.

At the Red Rock Cafe, I found surprisingly good food at the top of the Christchurch Gondola.  There was good variety to the menu, and very good flavor to the dishes.  (I was surprised by the quality as I expected the more bland food often found at locations where tourists have basically no other options.)  It was pricey for lunch -- checking the boxes of both tourist spot and in New Zealand -- but really enjoyable.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  While you eat, there are pretty views through the windows that wrap around you on three sides.
Amazing pad thai! Huge portion that can be shared between 2 people
Very expensive and Over priced
Good portion size
Great food great pepole

My friend and I were looking for a decent place to catchup over wine and dinner- this place was perfect! Good atmosphere, great hospitality and tasty food!  The atmosphere is intimate and cozy. It felt like I was going to an Aunts house for dinner. The waiter was so pleasant. He didn’t miss a beat and did everything to ensure my friend and I were well taken care of. His hospitable personality is a big reason why I would go back again.  I got the phallow which is like a pork belly stew. It was super tasty! I loved the richness and depth of the flavours. Only thing I would change is the chunks of black cardamon throughout the dish- Instead I’d find a way make it more evenly spread.  We bought our own bottle of wine along as This is a licensed BYO restaurant. Notably, there is an $8 fee corkage fee per bottle of wine you bring to the venue
The food is very delicious

The hospitality from the Thai Gentlemen in the glasses who served us absolutely amazing service! Our meals were delicious and full of flavour. We ordered Green Curries, Pork Spare Ribs and Spring Rolls. Beautiful presentation of the food My hubby ordered another serving of spring rollsHopefully the Woolston locals and the surrounding suburbs will support this wee Thai Restaurant. Loved our experienceHighly recommend and we will be back

Of the few places where I’ve truly felt welcome! the staff are so friendly and genuine! Great service, delicious food, and such a lovely atmosphere. The only thing I’d suggest is giving the couches a quick vacuum or steam clean. Will definitely be back!
The food was delicious – especially the  cheese fondue – and the service was great. After 10 years again memorable Zurich tastes in NZ - CH. Friendly staff, great atmosphere, Highly recommend!
Was delighted with the food and service. Although it was quieter as it was a Tuesday night but still maximum effort from staff.
We had a great dinner there. The food was amazing!! Highly recommend! The quality of the food was outstanding!
Had a birthday dinner here to try the cheese fondue,it was very nice and good amountfriendly staff,great place come with groups or couples for a meet up!!
Ordered fried noodles and satay chicken with rice. They know how to cook !

3years Ago: 2022 Tasty and Budget-friendly. Try their Supreme Satay, deluxe seafood noodles, honey Sesame chicken, and Beef Brisket noodle soup. Kids and wife are satisfied.  PRESENT: 27/10/25 3 Years AFTER. same Order + Pork padThai.... SAME TASTE,  SAME SATISFACTION, SAME COMFORT and QUALITY. Riccarton Aunthentic Noodle House gives us that  province feels. Where our Auntie (main cook) preps and chops the ingredients at the visible open kitchen, cooks and serves everything to perfection. Nothing Fancy. Just pure mouthwatering tasty goodness. Thank you!!!  - From a Filipino Family of 5.

I'm disappointed with the service during our visit today. We placed our order when the restaurant was very quiet (only two other people present), yet we have been waiting for over 30 minutes for our food   It is apparent there was an issue,, as a group who arrived and ordered after us has already received their meals  We are still sitting here waiting. This suggests our order was overlooked. A better system is needed to manage kitchen flow and prioritise customers.
Saw on Neat Places. Had to check out. Clean and refreshing soup noodles with an old friend.
Very disappointed. Boiled, tough meat in a basic broth, go across the road to Ancient Lanzhou, they have “atmosphere” & well presented, chewable food.

⸻   “I’ve been a loyal customer of Riccarton Noodle House for over 30 years and counting! The flavors never disappoint. Their chicken bone broth is absolutely amazing—rich, comforting, and full of depth. And the spicy fried noodles? Perfectly cooked with just the right kick. A true gem for anyone craving authentic, delicious noodles!”
A bowl of warm noodles^^

a good noodle house, with an open kitchen, large menu and good prices.  They are known for throwing in complementary chicken bones that were used to make their broth.  It's an interesting touch that I've not seen from other places, and made it a worthwhile stop during our visit to Christchurch.   My brother and I learned about this place from a staff member at the Hyatt Regency in Sydney, who let us know that this was one of her favorite places to go when back home in Christchurch (especially for the chicken bones).  So we decided to center our day around visiting it, once we got off the ship on a Thursday.  It's more than 3 km from the centre of Christchurch, so a decent trek, but was able to take a bus back after a filling meal.  It also brought us to the Riccarton neighborhood.  If there is a 'Chinatown' in Christchurch, the Riccarton neighborhood is probably it.  There were a ton of places that we passed, that we would also try out if we had time.  The restaurant opens at 11 and was already fairly busy when we stopped in around that time.  It is an open kitchen, staffed by two ladies.  As one can imagine, they were very busy but were still very friendly and patient to answer our questions.  We learned that they will throw in the chicken bones with any purchase.   The menu itself is not specific to Cambodia but is a mixture.    I was really craving noodle soup, so ended up getting three dishes along with an app to share between the two of us.  #7 Noodles Soup with Chicken (NZ$17) - the better of the two soups, it used the flavorful broth from all that chicken bone braising.  You have your choice of thick or thin rice noodles, and they give you plenty.   I enjoyed nibbling on the chicken bones, trying to find those missed meat morsels.  #9 Beef Noodles Soup (NZ$18.50) - I thought this was OK.  The broth was very clean and it did come with uniform strips of food grade quality beef, and a lot of rice noodles.  Shrimp Pad Thai (off menu) - (NZ$ 25) - This was an OK rendition, with a decent amount of well-cooked shrimp.  Deep fried spring rolls (NZ$9.50) - Both of us really liked this dish, using whole seasoned shrimp, wrapped in spring roll paper to resemble miniature cones.  They were freshly deep fried and were delicious, coming with a sweet Thai chili sauce.  They market themselves as a noodle house specializing in Chinese and Thai favorites, but also with a Cambodian flair.  With their large portions and reasonable prices, free wifi for customers, and friendly hospitality, Riccarton Noodle House is a good stop for locals and tourists, alike.
Top spot. Fantastic Wonton Noodle Soup. I always eat here when visiting Christchurch. Highly recommended

Second last dinner in Christchurch. We were debating between a few spots in Riccarton but ended up choosing Riccarton Noodle House, a Cambodian spot. It's more like a mix of Vietnamese, Cambodian and Malaysian.   We dropped in on a Tuesday evening (around 7:00pm) and it was empty. The inside has a bit of Cambodia decoration (Angkor Wat painting on the wall) but other than that, it's bare. Service is non-existent. You go to the counter to order where you also can grab water and utensils (self serve).   The menu is up above the open style kitchen; special spicy, noodle soup, satay, stir fry noodles, specials, side dishes and sweets.  - Curry laksa with chicken (#31) ($13.00 NZD) - I can never say no to laksa but in hindsight, this was a poor choice. Laksa isn't a Cambodian speciality; should have got one of their noodle soups instead. The laksa was half decent but nowhere close to being authentic. Barely any ingredients inside and they used udon noodles... - Black pepper udon with seafood (#30) ($15.00 NZD) - we asked for claypot yee-mee and got this. No idea how the chef messed up our order. We decided to eat it but should have complained instead. Super stingy on the seafood (only a couple small pieces of squid and three prawns). The pepper was overpowering and vegetables consisted of the cheap, bland variety. Bad, just bad.   One of the most disappointing meals of our trip. I was still hungry afterwards. 2.5 stars.

The young girl serving on Saturday afternoon seemed rude and uninterested. She was on her phone, had a frown on her face, and didn’t pay much attention when we asked questions. That said, the drink itself was actually really good.
Younger girl who served us on Saturday afternoon was hostile and Cole and barley a said a word. On her phone inattentive and gave attitude when asked a question. Drinks were good.

We sat here because we saw a lot of people. Cocktails were bad. Ice in the aperol was almost melted, so it was barrely chilled. Spicy margarita had way too much spice in it (I like spicy food but it just overwhelmed everything in the cocktail). Bartender incompetent, have no clue of how and when to pour ingredients into the shaker. Would bypass this place 100%

Riverside Cantina is a fantastic bar with an excellent cocktail selection. The espresso martini was enjoyable, and the spicy margarita was outstanding. There is ample seating, although it is shared with other restaurants.
Fantastic service everytime I come through, and great range of drinks available - super fun original cocktails!!!
Staff were really nice with a good reccomendaction
Omg this place is litro fricken amazing such fantanno service xo

I had the roast beef and loved it. The lady on the counter was lovely and asked me if she had put enough gravy on, salt and pepper also. Cooked well and I barely had to wait for it to be prepared. Good value, I'm stuffed full for $13. The waiting area could have been a bit cleaner with some rubbish on the floor, but it's takeaway and not eat-in anyway.
Absolutely delicious pork roast, one of the best I’ve ever had!! Service was great with lots of friendly staff. Will definitely be returning in the future.
Had the best fish and chips I've ever had, really friendly staff and great atmosphere, came with whole family and not a single meal was disappointing, would highly recommend
Pretty boring place. Probably the worst fish & ships I've ever had.
partner an i had awesome meals at robbies in riccarton tonite 10plus will be our new local very impressed with service & meals
Sorry but Food was so disappointing, steak sandwich, steak was so overcooked and dry didn’t bother eating much. Really poor for $27.50. Wasn’t worth 12.
Great food, Great staff,
Great for coffee and tea in between shopping at The Hub in Hornby.  Friendly staff, yummy food, great coffee.
What a fantastic night, fabulous food & even better service from Spencer! He was so engaging & provided some great laughs for our table! We will be back!
Our waiter Spencer was sensational. He helped us out on the menu choices didn't oversell us but made very great choices for our group. This place is amazing . Food and service on point

Our group of 12 ate here as a part of a corporate trip. The atmosphere was elevated and the staff were attentive, but above all the food was phenomenal. Because of our group size, we had a sharing-style menu, which had a good mix of food for all dietary requirements. Every dish they brought out was eaten very quickly! We were seated out on the balcony, which has heaters for the colder months. ROCA was the perfect setting for our group.

Great find with incredible food! We sat on the outdoor balcony and enjoyed the Trust the Chef menu. We especially loved the potato croquettes, cucumber salad, and the tender chicken. The limoncello drink is one of my favorites ever. Would highly recommend!
High-quality, well-cooked food. Excellent service. The restaurant had a quiet and peaceful atmosphere. Good value for the quality of the food.

This was the best choice we made today! My family and I all have such different taste palettes so as you can imagine making a decision on where to eat for dinner is very hard! However, making the decision to eat here was rather easy. We were all impressed about how versatile the menu was. From pizza to rib eye and fish, we were all happily satisfied with our dinners!
The vegan banh mi is 10/10 incredible, and service is so lovely.

Best Banh mi ever. My friends and I go here once a week for our lunch Break and I get the tofu Banh mi. It’s so flavourful and delicious!. The fresh bread and ingredients make the difference. Best ever.
Had a pork Banh mi at there food truck at the Ferrymead night market on Thursday. It was so delicious we had to go back and get another. Man serving us was very friendly! 10/10 recommend :)
Lovely people, great service, FANTASTIC flavour. Genuinely up there with the best Bahn Mi in town
Amazing food and value. Will come again as delicious
Not sure what they put inside the coffee but it's out of this world. Bahn mi and spring roll was good. Can't wait to try the pho if I'm in the area again
Love their banh mi. Tasty and a good price. .
I tried beef pho and Vietnamese iced coffee today. Very generous portions of beef. The iced coffee was delicious. The staffs were nice.
Great place to chill out and have a beer
Good service  good atmosphere
Perfect atmosphere ans a perfect pour to go alongside it. Go take a load off. You've earned it.
Very nice place
Not what I was expecting. Screens, Pokies and TAB seem to be the vibe and it was very noisy, with no spaces you could go to get away from the noise...

Great pub grub, a lot better then other establishments in the area & very reasonably priced,  Great raffles - Peter timbs meat packs - Quality !  Great atmosphere , went here after my father passed away, introduced a lot of people here and it’s there new local!

Their slogan says it all ... Sit long, Talk much, Laugh often ... what a delightfully relaxed place this is. I dropped in and enjoyed lunch here. It wasn't very busy but I was intrigued by the fabulous collection of china cups and other pieces. My lunch was fine (poached eggs, salad and cheese) but the atmosphere wins the day. There's no sense of hurry here. People come in and enjoy a leisurely visit. I hadn't planned to stay long, but I did. It was so enjoyable. Coffee is good. There's parking at the rear too. Thank you.

This gorgoeus little vintage Cafe serves freshly baked cakes and scones, breakfasts etc but it's the surroundings that make it special.  You are surrounded by vintage china and artefacts, some for sale, as you sit and enjoy a good coffee or tea. Friendly, helpful staff, well worth a visit.

restaurant: Roti Chai Indian Street Kitchen Halswell

reviews.text: First time visit last Thursday, this place was recommended by family member. Restaurant front is inviting and interior has a cool layout; person who took our order was welcoming. My nephew and I ordered the lunch special to go, comes with choice of curry and comes with rice and Naan bread. He got mild butter chicken and I got hot lamb Rogan Josh. Both consumed within minutes as soon as got home. The spice of my Rogan Josh was expectedly hot, wishing it could go hotter. Naan was hot and fresh. Will come again for sure. Edit: visited here again last weekend (Sat 1st Nov 2025) and the food was just as exceptional. Instead of takeaway we dined in this time round; ordered entrees onion bhaji and samosas with complimentary sauces, they were filling and tasty, with just right level of spice. Mains were lamb korma and lamb Rogan Josh, both spicy and delicious. Service was attentive and excellent, can't recommend this place enough. Six stars
Delicious food. Amazing customer service.

Had a wonderful dining experience at Roti Chai in Halswell! The food was absolutely delightful — the chicken biryani was packed with flavour, and the palak paneer was fresh, creamy, and perfectly spiced. The restaurant had a warm and welcoming atmosphere that made us feel comfortable right away. Highly recommend Roti Chai for anyone craving authentic Indian food and sincere hospitality. Five stars all the way!

It was my first time ordering food from rotichai.i have ordered chicken buna and some naan.....it was so yummy and still i can feel the flavour and aroma.They have the good presentation tooo ....  Great customer service too.We loved it  Highly recommended place

We have ordered from here a few times and it has been good tonight something was off the butter chicken tasted off and smelt like off bacon it was not nice at all my whole family could not finish there plate at all.

Beautiful little restaurant and very friendly staff. Food was perfect, just the right amount of spice for a guy who doesnt like his food too hot. I could taste all of the flavors but still had a little bit of heat to enhance the experience. Highly recommend coming here.
Really nice food - tried something different with the Lamb Palak and no regrets. Good sized portions, great service - will be back!
Yum curry & lovely service

Always delicious, fantastic portion sizes, and great value for money with the combo deals. The staff are friendly and polite. Royal Tandoor Sydenham is the first place I think of when I'm wanting comfort food and I look forward to next visiting.
Great meal tonight from here, takeaway meals were great and enough for lunch tomorrow.

Got chicken korma takeout. Nothing like korma. A floury creamy tasteless sauce with no flavor or heat, with a few pieces of tough chicken floating along the bottom of the pottle. It was all sauce and did not resemble any Indian food I’ve ever had. Poor and don’t recommend. Didn’t eat madras. Expensive slop for $51. Suggestion you go elsewhere!!! . (Papadum and nan was ok)

Got the butterchicken takeout dish. It had 3 pieces of chicken in the pottle, the chicken felt as it was heated in a microwave or something as rice was hot chicken was almost cold. Poor customer service when rung on feedback. Abused me on the phone and argued there was more than 3. Definitely poor rating & will definitely not recommend.

Would not order from here again, placed an  order over the phone and when I arrived at the restaurant I was charged an extra 12 dollars, turns out some of the menu on the website has incorrect prices to the Menu’s that are available in house. Food was also bad quality, the quality of the chicken is very disappointing, texture of it is dry and gritty. Would not recommend

Ordered the Prawn Malaburi on Doordash. The price was very affordable, making it a good value for a casual meal. The taste was average—nothing stood out, but it was decent overall. Great spot if you’re after budget-friendly Indian food without high expectations.
the Indian taff here are rude disgusting bahevior
Came in to collect a massive order for the city council, Small crew handled it brilliantly, Even helped me to carry it to my car. Absolutely cannot recommend them enough!

Sickos has a dead fish sitting in their tank. I told them about it and a lady went and looked at it and laughed. Didn’t understand what I was trying to say and just walked back behind the counter and left the fish there. Gross
Great food. The palak paneer was delicious and fresh, with quick service. Definitely ordering again!!
Food was amazing, they serve best Indian food in newzealand and it feels like a home
Great experience

If you're craving authentic Indian flavours in Christchurch, Saffron Spice in Hornby is the place I keep coming back to,and for good reason.  From the moment you walk in, you're greeted with the comforting aroma of spices and a team that treats you like family. The ambience is relaxed yet vibrant, perfect for a casual dinner or a celebratory feast.  What sets Saffron Spice apart? Consistency. Their biryani is a personal favourite,fragrant, generous, and packed with flavour. And if you're into heat, the vindaloo delivers a satisfying kick without overpowering the dish.  Service is always prompt and friendly, with staff happy to guide you through the menu or tweak spice levels to suit your taste. It’s the kind of place where you feel looked after, not just served.  Whether I’m grabbing a quick takeaway or settling in for a slow meal with friends, Saffron Spice never disappoints. It’s my go-to spot in Hornby when I want food that’s bold, comforting, and unmistakably Indian.
You can’t go wrong with their chicken biryani . The family pack is definitely the best option — it easily serves at least 8 people! Kadai and tandoori chicken is highly recommended as well.
Delicious food and service

been to this restaurant many times - multiple name and ownership changes over time. Masala Dosa has always been my favourite there - having been recommended it to me as 'the best in Christchurch'. Very disappointing this time. Filling mainly consisted of onions. When pointing this out and questioning the change of recipe the response just was: 'maybe a different chef since last time'. The naan the worst I have had as well. Won't be back

Best Indian in Christchurch hands down! Have tried plenty of other Indian restaurants and none even come close to this one. The food is always so consistently good and flavours are amazing. The chicken posht is a highlight plus the naan breads are divine especially the jalapeño and cheese!. The service is always 10/10. Would highly recommend!

I have been here twice in this week... Tuesday I dropped in super hungry after shopping with my daughter.... First things first.... welcoming smiling faces, then the menu came with recommendations, then came the plates... the plates were HOT... my dad always said that that was the sign of a good restaurant!!! And true to that,  the food was fingerlicking good... had goa prawns and garlic Naan on Tuesday and mutton rogangosh, butter prawns and garlic Naan.... Overall 10/10

Very average. Wouldn't go again. Got the platter to share. The squid and spring roll was alright. Other than that everything else was out of a bag and deep fried. Didn't get popcorn chicken. Was chicken nuggets and some weird corn nuggets. Wilted salad greens on side. The pancake was crunchy hard and bland. The seafood pho was terrible. The broth was super sweet but that is the only flavour you got. No lemon or accompaniments to go with it. Not even a lemon wedge to squeeze in to it. Grilled pork and spring roll vermicelli salad was probably the better dish. Their nuoc cham was already mixed in which isn't what im used to. Not enough spice or fish sauce. Fried rice not much to say. The wait for food is long. Our friends starter came out probably 15 minutes before ours
Honestly one of the best pho places in Christchurch. Had the ox tail beef pho. The soup based was really good and really thin noodles. Highly recommend
Best pho in NZ!!!!
Love this place, staff are welcoming and very attentive. Food is always quick and hot, great for a work lunch on Fridays.
Delicious food! Lovely staff
The best tofu ... chilly and lemon grass dish in the city
Food was delicious, really amazing prices and wonderful service!! Will be back!!
Always a good lunch meal and only 16.50 with an entree
Excellent food, so fresh
Great spot
Excellent takeaways - very tasty, esp the peanut sauce with roti was absolutely delicious. . Very easy to order online, unfortunately can't pay online.
Great ambience, exceptional service, great tasting food, looking forward to returning
Went to a Saigon Sister Kaiapoi for lunch today.Absolutely wonderful service.And food to die for.Will be going back and will also be trying their takeaway menu.
The food here is amazing and the people are so nice. We got free spring rolls with our order. This is my new favourite Vietnamese place!
Fabulous place, will definitely return and highly recommend, made feel welcome
Good food, good service and good music. Don't be fooled by the slightly old and traditional exterior decorating, this restaurant is a hidden gem
Really nice atmosphere and delicious vegetarian options
Loved the ambiance, feels very homey. Enjoyed the Pho, ingredients were fresh. Will definitely be back!

Saigon​‍​‌‍​‍‌ Star is definitely one of the places that you can get pho at its best in Christchurch, a delicious broth that is packed with flavor, fresh herbs, and noodles that are just right. The beef on the hot stone plate was probably the best thing there, very tender, packed with flavor, and it was even more flavorful because it was still smoking, and hence very hot, freshly served right at the table. Nice service, beautiful presentation, and inviting atmosphere. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for authentic Vietnamese ​‍​‌‍​‍‌flavors!

I ordered the hot stone beef pho and fresh spring rolls. The broth was rich and flavorful, so deep and intense that it almost made my lips stick together but I really enjoyed it. However, the dish didn’t come with coriander or a slice of lemon on the side.
Good food! Noodle soup so yummy.i love it . I Will come back again!!
Tasty lunch
The overall price is high, but their Vietnamese pho is very delicious, and fried chicken fillet is also worth recommending.

Saigon Star has been our go to for lunch & dinner for maybe 10-15yrs? The food is delicious, reasonably priced and service is quick. Staff become your friends pretty quick. Vege pho is the best. We're sad to be moving  ... can you buy a restaurant up north please!! We'll miss ya heaps & will pop in when we're in chc next.  Mike & Winnie

A five star cheap eat. I found it on a cheap eats list - read the reviews and decided to visit after a long day on the road. Service was super quick (though we were one of two tables on a Monday night and close to closing time) and they over-delivered on flavour.   The chef wasn't just going through the motions, he was lovingly preparing our order. Attention to detail and care were evident.   I've had top notch Vietnamese and paid top $ for it. It was next level. This by contrast is humble food done brilliantly.  I would totally recommend it.
My husband and I come here all the time. Great food, great ambiance and 5 star service
Good food and excellent customer service.
Excellent as always. The chicken saagwala was delicious. The goat biryani was also nice. The staff are super friendly. This is a regular place for us.
Good Indian and more than usual quantity.

Came in for a takeaway as I was craving a hot Indian meal on a cold and wet Christchurch night. The man taking the orders was fantastic, sorry I didn’t get your name or see a name badge or anything but he gave me Fantastic service, very polite and friendly. I got a chicken madras (hot) a garlic naan and a roti (buttered) came with complimentary Popperdoms, all pretty decent, nice tender chicken and depth of flavour and spice,  was expecting a bit hotter but that was fine. Would definitely recommend and look forward to trying out some of the other dishes here.
Just adequate. Very good marinated meat, bland mainstream sauces, not a place with freshly made sauces. First and last visit. Took an hour to get food. Find an authentic cooking experience elsewhere.
Best mango lassi ever!!
First time trying takeaway here with the new owners, it was very nice.
Very good curry and friendly staff

I had the best experience at Saket Indian Restaurant in Opawa. The food was absolutely amazing, full of authentic flavours and cooked to perfection. The service was excellent — the on-duty manager personally came to our table a few times to make sure everything was alright, which made us feel very well looked after. Overall, it was a wonderful dining experience, and I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys delicious Indian food and great service.  — Sandeep Uppal
really nice people and really yummy curry
Lovely food.

We used to absolutely love the food at Magic Masala. Since changing ownership and becoming Saket we have noticed the food isn't what it was. The Lamb Korma we had tonight was very disappointing which is why I've updated my (previously 5 star) review.
We have ordered popular dish malai kofta It was delicious and naan was good Highly recommended if you like to try authentic indian food
We had salmon teriyaki and vegetarian teriyaki at 5 pm. Delicious!! I highly recommend this place!! From Argentina, Patagonia, Neuquén. Rolando and Viviana.

A bit surprised to find this small Japanese restaurant that serves food that is serving delicious dishes using just right amount of flavour. Too often I see restaurants offering dished with excessive source/ toppings. And I can tell the food we had was right on spot. I recommend this restaurant that is cozy and small but serves surprisingly delicious dishes.

The worst sushi I’ve ever been to in my life. The rice was badly cooked, the fish didn’t taste fresh, and the presentation was terrible. On top of that, the service was slow and unfriendly. I honestly don’t understand how this place has good reviews. I wouldn’t come back even if it were free.
The food was delicious! I loved the salmon sashimi! So fresh!
A refreshing selection of Japanese classics with a Sakimoto touch. A hidden gem perched on the edge of the beautiful Tramways junction.
Thought it might be gimmicky Japanese food. But I was wrong. I was served by a Japanese lady with the usual Japanese courtesy and efficiency. My beef noodles was delicious.
The good wss nice but the servings tiny and costs huge
Yum! Thanks so much
Amazing gluten free menu!
Great value for money lunch sets, their chicken teriyaki is a standout. Will visit every single time we're in the area.
The salmon & avocado roll deserves a 5-star rating.
Favourite place ever, food, staff, and service is beautiful. Will continue to be a repeat customer!!
Best Indian restaurant in christchurch, really like it
The best Indian restaurant I've been to in Christchurch. Will definitely be back again
The overall experience are good. The staffs are all very friendly, helpful with answering questions regarding the dishes. All the dishes are unique in taste. The dessert was interesting to try!
Food was excellent. Highly recommend it.
FAMILY MEAL was delicious - good serving amounts, very tasty, beautifully cooked and presented with great attention from staff.

Honestly, quite disappointed with the overall experience. The food was way below average compared to other restaurants, especially considering their higher prices. The curry had an unusually strong color, which made it look artificial, and the taste was almost bland.  What really stood out was the hospitality — it felt noticeably friendlier toward local customers than towards us. No one even asked how the food was, and most of the attention seemed focused on impressing the locals.  To add, this wasn’t our first odd experience here. A few years ago, we walked in and were told there were no tables available unless we had a booking. Just out of curiosity, my wife called them right after we stepped out, and suddenly, they said a table was available. When we went back in, they realized their mistake and apologized, but the whole situation felt quite uncomfortable — almost as if they didn’t really want us there in the first place.  Overall, not a place I’d return to or recommend. There are plenty of restaurants around offering much better food, value, and respect for all customers.  Update on your response  Thank you for your response. I understand you may see things differently, but I’ve simply shared my honest experience as a paying customer. It’s disappointing that instead of taking the feedback constructively, the reply came across as defensive and personal.  Also, thank you for taking the time to look into my Facebook account to find my mutual friends — that level of effort says a lot in itself.  Regardless of what your internal notes or assumptions might say, my experience at the table didn’t feel welcoming — and as a customer, that’s what matters most. Feedback is meant to help improve service, not start a debate or a personal investigation.  I wish your team the best and hope future customers have a better experience.
Good value for money. The young lady should be more approachable toward guests—she'll be okay.
If you want a quick meal before the theater or movie it's not bad.  I had ckicken and stirfried vegies on rice with a satay sauce.  The meal we had was tasty but not marvelous.
Shocker, food was bad, service bad, dishes dirty, don’t waste your time

The food wasn't great, but the portions were quite generous. If you're traveling alone and have a small appetite, I wouldn't recommend this place. The service wasn't very good either. There was a Chinese-looking lady who couldn't speak Chinese, so she gave you a rather reluctant look, as if you owed her something.
The hot and sour soup was super salty. I only took one sip. I couldn't drink it at all.

The worst meal I’ve had in Christchurch. Absolutely no service, and when staff did interact, the attitude was poor and I would say rude. Having lived in Malaysia for two years, I’ve tried plenty of similar cuisine, but this was bland, tasteless, and very disappointing. The environment was nothing special either. Definitely not worth it.
Satay on rice
Great chicken and corn soup.

Really subpar Chinese restaurant. Food comes out really quickly and the locals seemed to enjoy it. I ordered mapo tofu which you had to pay extra for rice--if it's a dish that you're supposed to eat with rice, just give the customer rice. I would understand paying separate for rice if I ordered like a noodle dish but it should just come included! So I rolled my eyes at that. But wait, it gets worse. Worst mapo tofu ever. Not completely inedible but when you use the frozen veggies for the carrots and peas but can't find a package that doesn't include corn so you just throw in the corn as well... China would be embarrassed. Not sure if it was from the froze. Veggies but the texture of the sauce should be more gelatinous rather than liquid and it was all just liquid with meh flavor. If I spend any more time in this city I would never come back here. Not worth my money.

I got off the tram stop (#17) nearby for the hop-on-hop-off tour about 4PM. It turns out there's no real restaurants open for food service during this time. I found a small cafe with sandwiches and a bar only serving take away items, but that's it. This and a South American restaurant were the only places open at the time!   I ordered the mini spring rolls and deep fried crumbed prawns ($20.50 total). Both were pretty bad. The spring rolls hardly had anything in them, and they were so hard they hurt my teeth, which rarely happens. The prawns were VERY greasy without any flavor. I only ate a couple. At least they had jasmine tea to cut the grease!   I've definitely eaten better in the USA at countless restaurants, hence the "experienced better" rating. The waitresses were more interested in chatting than serving. Since I've an American accent, they assumed I only wanted silverware (no chopsticks placed on the table) despite being Chinese. Since so few places are open for full food service from 3-5PM, there's no reason to be good, right?

Had a decent meal here after a long day of travel. Really liked how many veggies they had in the Kung pao chicken dish. Had to pay extra for rice. They didn't know what egg drop soup was but had something similar with tomatoes. Other than the tomatoes in it was a little bland. It fit the bill but I have had better Chinese.
Sampan is your place for cheap Chinese food with an extensive menu. Food was served quickly and in large portions. The Chow Mein rice was great.
Fast service and large portions served. Very close to the Novotel Hotel to get supper. Be hungry or think leftovers. Beer and wine available along with other non alcoholic beverages

I got the Mapo Tofu and it tasted different from any other kind I had had before. Honestly the sauce reminded me of Buffalo wings back in the States, which I am not a fan of, unfortunately. I wouldn't ask that particular dish again, but I would be more than willing to visit again sometime, if possible!

Great westernized Chinese restaurant.  Willing to add back authenticity when requested.  I had a hankering for some extra spicy Szechuan dry fried beef.   Although I was told that they lacked the the Szechuan pepper corn ( hua jiao ) an ingredient quintessential to the dish the rouse up to the challenge(ref. Picture titled: 91...). The flavors were comparable to the proper preparation though accented by the Guangdong based Cantonese ingredients.   Staff was very helpful and accommodating.  Little cleanliness issue (strictly observed on the water bottle seal, not the food) could have ensured the fourth star.  But a great little restaurant none-the-less.

If you Google Samurai Bowl, Colombo St., you'll see that they were knowlingly serving food infected with Staphylococcus aureus.  I loved their ramen, so decided after they reopened to give them a second chance. I should have known better when seeing a pest trap out in the open on the floor of their dining area.  I was violently ill after eating ramen - with the exact symptoms listed for ingesting Staphylococcus aureus bacteria.  DON'T EAT HERE!!
I always go back because the quality of the food never change and the best ramen i ever had around Christchurch. Keep it up!!

I recommend avoiding this place. Since the current owner took over, the quality has dropped and there have been some serious concerns about management. According to recent news reports and comments, the labour laws are violated, staff were unfairly treated or even forced to take unpaid breaks during rostered hours, and even more worrying, the owner was caught selling recalled products that should have been removed from shelves for safety reasons. This seriously puts customers’ health at risk. The food quality is also not authentic compared to proper Japanese ramen. For example, the “spicy miso ramen” uses Chinese chilli oil instead of Japanese seasoning, which is far from traditional flavour. It’s also unusual to see some new 5-star reviews recently, which strongly makes me question the accuracy of the ratings. To be clear, this review is only about the Colombo St branch. The Samurai Bowl on Wairakei Road is very different – their ramen is authentic and much closer to Japanese standards, and I would recommend dining there instead.
Too much food for me, good value for money and really nice and relaxed atmosphere. Will happily go again.
The vegan/vegetarian option was sooo good, the broth was super yummy!
Suggest avoid. Cold, cavernous atmosphere. Dreadful food - grey looking chicken that tasted like smoked fish.

I went there a few years ago and it was nice. I remember it was running by Japanese. I knew something went wrong when the staff has no expression and feedback from what I said. I found out Chinese drinks in the fridge. I guessed the owner is changed. The food is normal now. I am a bit disappointed. I don’t think I will go there again.

I don’t understand how a restaurant with a history of deceiving customers and exploiting its employees’ labor can still operate as if nothing happened.  Unbelievable—ten years of hard-earned respect, all destroyed just like that.

I’m not sure if this place has the same owner and chef as it did back in 2007–2010. It used to be one of my favorite restaurants to visit with my friends, and I was really looking forward to coming back this time, but the experience turned out to be very different. The flavor of the ramen and curry has changed, and the staff’s attitude wasn’t very friendly. I remember the owner used to be very warm and welcoming, but this time I felt unwelcome and even looked down on. It wasn’t just me—my family felt the same way. I originally wanted to happily share with my old friends that I had returned to our favorite place, but it seems my expectations have unfortunately fallen through.
Ramen is very authentic. They bring back as in Japan.

Oh my goodness the food here is outstanding and the portions are huge! It’s an unassuming venue with well known musicians posters on the walls & the takes and chairs are basic so you don’t come here for the decor but you do come here for the food! The karaage chicken is fantastic as is the curry and the kitchen was very accommodating as I requested salmon with my noodles & it was well worth it! The salmon was cooked beautifully too - yum!!
Went last weekend hungover as best remedy 10/10 amazing staff!
Always delicious, fast and friendly service. My partner and i have been coming to this resturant for their ramen and curry for at least 8 years and the constantancy is flawless.

Food were served fast, the taste and presentation upon serving is great. Staff are friendly and accommodating, they immediately greet you when you walk in the front door.The place is tidy, spacious enough for customers and the ambience upon entry is truly inviting.
Didn't expect much from such a simple place but the food was unreal! The pricing is very generous, so cannot complain! If you love Japanese, this place is a must go.

I think this a a Japanese ramen chain. They sell frozen ramen packages in the restaurant. The noodles were a bit too soft and the broth was both a bit salty and scarce. It's decent enough to scratch your ramen itch but it's not special enough to make a dedicated visit.
Great place for a weekday lunch but just as good for dinner - many a meal had at the Samurai and never fails to deliver! Very fast delivery after ordering is a plus
Delicious. Cheap. Consistent. They scream your order over  their shoulder in Japanese. Spicy miso ramen is a must.... and dont forget to add an egg.
A load of ramen and rice dishes not typically seen in expensive Japanese restaurants.    Chow down!

Maybe coming from Auckland where there's an array of Ramen, Samurai Bowl didn't seem to impress me that much. It was super packed on the night we went and you have to order at the counter. Meaning there's a really long queue of people right through the middle of the already tightly packed restaurant.  The food itself wasn't bad. But wasn't mind-blowing. And the prices, I suppose, are reasonable.
Came all the way from auckland to try a sushi ball. It lived up to the hype!!! It was so so fire oh my days. The ratio was so so good. Heaps of meat and avocado. Deliciously saucy. 10000% recommend
Very delicious and great value for money! My favourite sushi shop in Christchurch
Amazing freshly made sushi
Best riceballs in Christchurch
So grateful to have such a nice place in the neighbourhood. We tried different dishes and they are all delicious. Excellent customer service. Highly recommend.
I just love the meal it is super tasteful

Yummy and fresh-tasting food with friendly service. The shop looks reasonably hygienic. We had the chef’s special beef salad and chicken curry — the curry was a touch too sweet for my taste (though my kid liked it), but overall still really good compared to several even Thai restaurants I’ve tried before. Huge bonus points for the service! It was such a lovely surprise to see lollies and a free drink for my kid when we came on Halloween day.

Ordered on Uber eats. The order was taking a while so I called them up and asked on the progress, they threw in a free drink for the inconvenience! The food turned up hot and fresh, the Chicken roti was so so tasty! This will be my new go to Thai spot I can tell!  Thanks for such a good service team! Alex C
Yummy food, big portions and excellent service! Great balance of flavours. Our new go-to Thai place.
Reccomend.
Nothing but good things to say about this place, excellent service and delicious food would highly recommend. Katsu Chicken is on another level.
I had a ramen at lunch time.  The male front service staff was extremely professional and friendly. A wide range of options on menu.
one spicy miso ramen onegaishimasu! <3
Comforting food
Love Sasuke for authentic Japanese food and friendly staff
The ramen noodles are to die for.... very satisfying especially during cold weather. The wait staff are very friendly and helpful.
Fabulous place with lovely staff Good choice of food which is well presented and great coffee. Unfortunately, it can be a bit noisy but there's always the outdoor option. Well worth a visit
Great experience at Savoire. Coffee’s are excellent & great options in food.  Loved the staff very friendly and welcoming. It was sunny great to dine in courtyard

I had such a fantastic experience at Saviore Café. The food was absolutely excellent – fresh, beautifully presented, and full of flavour. Every dish tasted like it was made with real care. The service was just as impressive: warm, attentive, and genuinely welcoming without ever feeling rushed. It’s clear the staff take pride in what they do, and it really makes the whole visit feel special.  Whether you’re after a relaxed coffee, a proper meal, or just a spot to catch up with friends, Saviore is a top choice. I’ll definitely be coming back – highly recommend!

we were from out of town for a function and went here for breakfast on sunday morning. My husband wanted bacon and eggs on white toast and because I am celiac I wanted just Gluten free toast. After several attempts at getting the staff to understand what we wanted we sat and waited. My husbands meal came out...bacon eggs but no toast.. ok.. he decided to just eat it. He had finished when my toast came..2 really small pieces of toast in a small bowl!! No jam...just 2 really small pieces of toast. I would have thought this could have been made with his and we could have eaten together.... totally rude and very dissapointing... It was just after 9am..they were not that busy.

Waited 30min for our food during a period when the place wasn’t super busy. Could have been a nice experience but coffee was cold by the time food came. Food was just eggs on toast so not complicated, hash browns were overcooked
Great cafe
Had an awesome meal there last time I visited

We had a great time here, welcomed as soon as we walked in. Ordered Fish n chips, and toastie,  massive sizes great value for money had some good wins om the pokies! Lovely bar lady, very nice. Definitely come back here for lunch on a day off!
Wasn't bad at all
Ok but food average
Its our fave thai restaurant..

We started our  trip in South Island, New Zealand by having dinner in here. During our 2 weeks trip, this is the best Thai restaurant we ever had. Before we fly back to our home, we finished our trip by having another dinner. Red curry fish and sweet chilly fish are very recommended as well as the Tom yum soup.  The staffs are very kind.

Really disappointed..been a long time customer of Sema Thai, only to have collected our takeaway, got home and found incorrect order. Rang and then had to argue about what I’d ordered…then asked if we’d eaten the incorrect dish, bring it back and collect the right dish.  No apology nothing just “we’re right you’re wrong!” Then to add insult to injury 3 roti ordered, we couldn’t find the 3rd and yelled at again!! Will never support this business.  Will find another Thai takeaway that actually value their customers!
Great foods
Massaman too sweet. Jungle curry too watery. Much better food at Hammersley on the corner of Hills and Warrington Sts.

The food was so good I'm writing a review. I had it yesterday, but I can't stop thinking about it. The flavors were just impeccable. It tastes 120% better than it looks!! If I were a millionaire, I'd come here every day.  Boss, work less and earn more.  It was so delicious. Thank you.

We travelled all the way from Dunedin just to try Seoulful, and it never failed to impress us! The food was absolutely delicious — every dish full of authentic Korean flavor. The owner was super friendly too! Definitely coming back soon with friends.

The food is delicious, reasonably priced, and the service is excellent. The chef prepares the food in a transparent, open kitchen with great care. Definitely a five-star recommendation!   The food is delicious and reasonably priced. The service is excellent, and the food is prepared in a transparent, open kitchen. Definitely a five-star recommendation!
Family owned with tasty authentic Korean food! Very nice restaurant too!

We showed up with no booking and were seated without any delay.  the staff we very friendly and helpful with our menu choices.  Fried dumplings were great, the KFC was excellent and we also tried the bulgogi, bimbap and gimbap. All were very good.  I'd highly recommend this restaurant if you want casual dining with authentic Korean food!

23/07/2025 While in Christchurch for work I went for dinner with my son whose at Uni there. I had the Bulgogi and he had a chicken Udon. We also shared some chicken Gimbap. Delicious! My Bulgogi was lite and tasty and the Gimbap with the crunchy chicken was tasty with great texture. The lady serving us was friendly and helpful with explanations of the menu. Tried to go for lunch the next day but couldn't get a carpark but will be back next time I'm down.

The Ward was unique. Its probably just what escape rooms should be about. Lots of little sections that you have to make your way through. If you absolutely get stuck on something , you are going to get moved on , so it kind of limits the frustration. Well built sets. Great fun and also replayable. 12/10.
Escape room was lots of fun!! Best one I’ve done so far (can’t remember the name) but it’s the horror one - we loved it
The staff there was very kind!! The escape room for the cabin is rlly scary. Had 4 people in total and made my friends Dad go into the rooms first.
Me and my 9 year old had so much, and it was nice to try something different. we both can't wait to come back and try a different game the were very friendly and helpful also
I came here on a weekday and had the best time, the service was amazing and very friendly, the drinks were great overall I had an amazing time I will be coming back and I definitely recommend
ate here for the first time, ordered the Karage curry - the chicken was good, but the rice was not cooked and it was hard and crunchy, hurt my tooth.
Very oily spicy beef soup. Over cooked veg. Average.
We had sushi, tempura prawns and karaage chicken delivered exactly on time for a party It was all beautiful Highly recommend
Great food always, best karaage chicken in Christchurch
These guys are a Sydenham Institution. Their Vietnamese Spring Rolls are delicious and they have great sushi and bento as well.

I've been to Sevanti's a few times, and I always like it enough to go back, but it's certainly not somewhere I'd rave about. The food is nice enough, there are lots of gluten free options and it's got a decent atmosphere but it's just so expensive for what you get. I found the service very slow, it took at least an hour for our food to come out, the waitress didn't understand half of what we were asking for, and I found it ridiculous that they were unable to provide food off the lunch menu (as we had a number of food allergies at the table, the lunch menu had the better options).   The food itself was okay. Three people at the table ordered the steak - they said it was nice enough but the meat probably wasn't very high quality - they were also slightly overcooked, one person ordered the rack of lamb which again was okay but nothing to rave about, another ordered the fish on risotto which she said was a bad combination and I ordered the crispy chicken which wasn't too bad but the chicken was a little overcooked. For the price you pay, probably not worth it, yet it probably won't stop me going back again.

Simply beautiful food with the Chef's Tasting Experience, highly recommend. The steak, pumpkin mash dish, and yuzu mousse dessert were simply to die for. Such friendly and professional service from the lovely staff. Enjoyed the subdued lighting and our seat at the high table that runs the length of the window for the view and twinkling lights of Christchurch. Yuzu mocktail was so refreshing. Can't wait to return

I went with my family for a belated Mother’s Day celebration and thoroughly enjoyed the dining experience of Trust the Chef.  The food was sumptuous and adequate for the 4 of us.  The flavours were different but outstanding.  A great shoutout to the staff who were very warm & personable, enhancing our dining experience.  Well done and keep up the good work!
Awesome atmosphere. Not too loud snd chaotic. Quite chill. Welcoming staff snd good food.
First time dining at Seven and it won't be our last. Great food, attentive relaxed service and lovely atmosphere.

Absolutely delicious sharing plates. We came away appreciating the well presented plates, lovely service from our waitress and enjoying the view. It was a very pleasant experience and we would absolutely recommend. Thankyou to the chef.

Amazing food and amazing service. Service was attentive but not in your face.  Great waitress Lisa and another one but don't know her name. Couldn't fault it at all. Will definitely be back next time in Christchurch

22/10/2023 - Butter Chicken Combo on the Menu was $19.99. I was charged $20. I know it’s only 1c but if they are doing this for every transaction? I’m disappointed with the Dis-honesty and I will never be back because of 1c scamming.  May contact the IRD.
Standards have dropped. Chicken trebbile food slopped all over tray' only one napkin  to clean mess.
I used to dislike this place because of their attitude and poor servings but since the woman have been serving it has been a much better experience ..keep it up please
The food is very good! The staff are very pleasant. Highly recommended
Food is full of cream. Doesn't taste like Indian food.
Very mediocre flavour and the customer service is very lacklustre. An uninspiring experience
Tasty curries, warm spices, and friendly service. Portions are generous, prices fair, and the cozy atmosphere makes meals feel comforting.
Try to ordered a large combo which is $37 Ask for it clearly , but at last the charged me $47 for everything , definitely a scam and don't recommend it

I ordered mango chicken and naan, specifying that I didn't want rice due to an allergy. I asked for four naan because I ordered two curries. Although the person taking my order initially said he would discount it, I was charged the full price. In the end, I only received two naan despite being charged for four. Additionally, I was charged an extra $11, bringing the total to $70 for a simple curry and naan. Unfortunately, the food tasted off, and it made both my father and me sick; I vomited it all back up. My father tried calling to request a refund, but there was no answer.
Worst food.. worst service
The food is good, but the man who works here is very rude, and the signs are wrong
I got food poisoning and as I'm writing this I vomited 5 mins ago.
Very bland butter chicken. The chicken itself was rubber hard, and the Naan wasn't good at all. The service was nice
So rude and arrogant, don’t know how to interact with customers.

They accepted cash or card (an earlier review said no cash, so I wanted to mention this).  Atmosphere was a 3 purely because it's in Eastgate mall and not the nicest place to sit around.  I got a Tikka Masala and a Garlic & Cheese Naan to takeaway. The food was really nice! A lot nicer than I expected it to be. They didn't ask me for my preferred spice level - like most Indian restaurants do, but maybe it's different due to the foodcourt setup? This meant the Tikka Masala was a tad spicy for me, but I still eagerly finished it.  The portion sizes are a little on the smaller side but I don't eat much so it was perfect for me! I got lots of chicken pieces and the chicken was nice and tender too. Perfectly cooked, thank you! Beautiful and friendly staff and I would happily return.  $21 for Curry with rice and a drink.

Ordered the Rogan Josh combo. The dish had good flavour and the lamb was  tender. The naan bread was fluffy rather than thin, flat and lifeless like you get from some places. Was a tasty satisfying meal and ticked all the boxes for me
Da bestest Indian food yummo
Decent foodcourt Indian, fairly priced. Recommended if at eastgate.

one off the worse service  i have experienced at eastgate shamiana restaurant.. Last 3 years  i and my families was with shamiana but from today we're going to leave off shamiana service. How come 3 Peace lam rogan could price 15$????it’s funny

Felt like home-cooked food. I got the chickpea curry while my boyfriend got the melt in the mouth butter chicken. The portion was given generously and we were full. Definitely going back there to try more dishes!

Came to get dinner and was about to pay when they were going to overcharge by an extra 20 dollars when i pointed it out the worker only sighed and didn't say anything then just changed it quickly. Then when i got home i opened the naan bag and realised i got given the wrong type and wrong amount. When i tried calling the place the phone was out of order. Seems like they just scam customers for money
Delicious butter chicken and tikka masala.

I don’t have a problem with the Food it’s delicious but For future reference if you have a bell  on your counter and you don’t want customers to use it to get service please remove it or have a sign saying you are closed or display a sign saying when you are open. I arrived at 9.45am your display units were full of cooked food lights all on at your counter lots of people eating in the food court. There were no staff at your counter when I used the bell that’s provided for service Instead of two friendly faces coming to the front I got one guy I recognised who didn’t say anything and one guy I didn’t recognise snapping at me to wait a moment. They both disappeared round back and I never saw them again. Two women who were sitting came up to me and said they did the same thing and got a nasty response. Lucky for me they recommended the guys right next to your counter and they were fantastic friendly and the sweet soy chicken was delicious. I know that you won’t care you didn’t get my money but I’m glad you didn’t and won’t get any of my dollars again. It’s not hard to be respectful to people especially those who support your business. Lastly always remember that every Action has a Reaction.
Best European burgers on the East Side. Freindly service. Good prices .

Was here with a friend today. We got the food really fast. It was really tasty and still hot. On a paper plate but who cares (we don't). A lot of good Curry together with a lot rice and good naan bread. All on all really good. Atmosphere could be better but it is in a Mall, so what do you expect? For a good portion of rice, a whole bowl of curry, one slice of naan bread and a drink we paid $21.99. I think that's a good price

Tried to get just the curry,these guys reakon 32 dollers  to fill both sides. i cant eat rice... they were going to charge full price without rice or double price to fill these two small small portions curry
Really poor customer service
1 star for your pathetic customer service.
The food serving method was wrong. Half the food was falling out of the bowl. The onion pakoras (fritters) were not cooked at all.
The lady serving me was rude and cold. My naan bread came cold, and it was unclear where to order. Would not recommend.
got like three pieces of chicken

worst place ever the staff didn’t even bother serving me he’s looking at his phone and i was standing there in front of him and didn’t even bother acknowledging or anything until i say something as if he didn’t see me, second staff hygiene is disgusting didn’t even cleaned his nail and there’s some black stuff in his nail.
Worst Indian Restaurant in Christchurch. Lack of hygiene. Unfriendly behaviour from staff. These guys are still stuck in 1980s.

I’ve been eating at Shanghai Bistro for years with my family, I’ve even come for my brother’s graduation celebration and I’ve always loved their food and service. The other night I came with my friends, and one of us had dietary requirements which I made it clear to the waitress during ordering - she was Muslim. I spoke in Mandarin Chinese so there’s no way she heard me incorrectly. Since we didn’t want to risk meat, we ordered from the “Vegetables” section on the ordering IPad. Now, I’ve never personally ordered from this tab because my family are meat lovers so I thought these were all completely vegeterian dishes. On the IPad ordering system there’s also nothing indicating what has meat and what doesn’t. Now I understand that the waitress probably thought the eggplants were for the rest who wasn’t Muslim so she didn’t say anything but I don’t understand why a dish with meat would be in the vegetable section. They should make it that more clear with labels on every dish on what’s vegeterian and what isn’t for any future vegetarians/vegans/muslims. However, I do have to say that the waitress did do a nice job defusing the situation, she allowed us to order another dish and this time walked us through what’s ACTUALLY vegetarian in the vegetable section and changed my friend’s rice, plates, cutleries, etc. We also had no issues with their other dishes. But again, I’d advise all vegetarians/vegans/muslims to be careful while ordering and understand that their “vegetable” section isn’t vegetarian until they change that, or just go to a different Chinese restaurant to be safe. :)
Love the food and tea

I first visited this place 5 years ago, but I just realized I haven’t left a review for this hidden gem. It’s always my first choice whenever my Chinese stomach craves good food. The dishes are always fresh and delicious. The boss, who is also the chef, often comes out to chat with customers and listen to their feedback.  Last week, I ordered a seafood noodle for my daughter. Since we had just recovered from a stomach ache, I asked the staff to make it less salty. The noodles came out exactly as we expected — light, comforting, and tasting just like homemade food.  I truly love this place — from the food to the staff, even the cozy decoration. Highly recommended!

My parents loved their dishes, we ordered a variety ranging from the pan fried buns, to the beef stir fry rice noodle and sizzling beef.  While it is an acceptable meal on a holiday, it doesn't stand out for me. Value for money is there, if you pay in cash. Do note the card surcharge if you're opting for that payment method
Delicious food, good service, and a nice atmosphere, but unfortunately no Wi-Fi.  Delicious food, good service, and a nice atmosphere, but unfortunately no Wi-Fi.
Vegetarian options were gone by 9.30 .
It was delicious! We really love Shanghai. Recommendations: tofu pudding, soy milk, fried dough sticks, steamed buns, mixed noodles, and wontons.
My friend from work recommended this to me. She's from Shanghai and it didn't disappoint. We had the xiaolongbao, beef braised noodle and beef wonton soup.
The owner is very mean. The portion of pork chop is very small. You need to eat two portions of noodles to be full.

Very bad. This is a very arrogant Shanghainese restaurant. The portions are super small. Even at $35 per person, you can't feel full. It's not tasty. Avoid it!!! I have never eaten at such a bad restaurant in New Zealand!!!
Great food thanks team

We had dinner with no idea what it would be like. Absolutely delicious. If I lived in ChCh it would be my ‘go to’. We ate in but they also do takeaway. I’m surprised it was so quiet. One of the best meals I’ve had of this type.
Kids and I loved it great service and food
We were the only ones in there to begin with..... but the place was lovely, clean. Food was YUMMY. Dumplings (pork n coriander)...  Yummm Pork Noodles and Fried Rice .... very nice.

Service is always really slow, even when it's a quiet night. Staff are more focused on what they look like, chef jackets, rather than the food. Oil from chips doesn't get drained long enough and chips are over salted.  Akaroa cod batter always sticks to the paper and is very soggy. Have given them three chances and each time they have failed! It use to be good value for money and fish and chips were really good. Since there have been new staff/owners there it has got worse.
1st time at this Indian shop. Food was  outstanding,nice n tasty. Service was good nice n friendly men. Plenty of food for lunches next day.

I’ve been living in New Zealand for 10 years, and today, for the very first time, I truly felt welcomed and well taken care of as a customer. No place has better service than Simply Delicious Taste of India! I absolutely love curry, especially Indian rice (yes, I’m obsessed with rice!).
