Everywhere I go, the rice portions are usually small (I’m not a big naan eater), but here they kindly gave me extra rice — and even offered us a mango lassi to try, which I’ll never forget. What an incredibly delicious drink! I couldn’t recommend this place more. The food is fantastic, the staff are wonderful, and the whole experience was just perfect. Thank you so much, and congratulations to the team for the amazing work!
It's simple just get down there and try it, good chef very good service great food
They are lovely people and serve the food beautifully. Their food does not disappoint.

Me and my partner have just been in and got a butter chicken combo each 10/10 service the owners are absolutely wonderful and very welcoming food the store is very clean. tasty  creamy butter chicken 10/10 would definitely recommend coming here cant wait to come back and try the lamb!
Very delicious Food, great service, highly recommended restaurant to visit.
What a vibe! Coffee and staff are great! Food is vegetarian friendly and the sandwiches are huge!
Great service and food.
Such a find, great friendly service. Deviously good homemade bread sandwich. Coffee was great too.
It’s not a child friendly space but good for meeting a friend for a quick coffee. Merivale needs more child friendly places..
Decent portion burgers, high quality fresh ingredients. Definitely a 5 star burger joint with a cool theme
Great place the guy running the bar is great.
The 2 English staff behind the bar are just fantastic, a real asset to Smash Palace
Always a great atmosphere for after work drinks

Went on a hot spring Saturday, great atmosphere with plenty of people packed into the area. Quite noisy and busy but didn’t have to wait long to get a drink. Had a bowl of chips which were quite good. Highly recommend for a good social experience.
This is my favourite bar in the world.
Nice atmosphere. Resist AI
Wednesday night at Ferry Road Smoke'n'Barrel, good vibe, great people, AMAZING food!!!! Thank you!!!!!
Great food and great service. Simple food done well

It was quiet with one table leaving as we were entering to the restaurant at 5.30 pm.  The place began to get filled up 5 minutes after we sat down. We asked the guys leaving the restaurant how was the food and their quick response were that the food was very good.  We glanced the menu quickly.  We decided to make it easy for two of us and ordered a platter for two.  We did not have lunch but still could not finish all the meat and the fries.  Our comment is that be prepared to be hungry for platter for two.  A staff came and offered a box; relatively friendly and good service. The sausage was good. Meat was tender; it would be better if we could taste a bit more smoky on the meat.  Overall it was good food and tasted good with hands and figures. It would be nice if there was eating gloves or wet napkin as we were spoiled in the restaurants at home.
Simply fantastic. The meat was truly exceptional, as were the side dishes. We ordered the sharing platter for two, and even for two, there was plenty of food. A real treat!
We spend a great time. Amazing food, good prices and great service. We will come back soon.
Honestly the driest burger I’ve had, asked for no pickles or mustard due to allergy and guess what I received in my burger of dust, pickles and mustard
Really good Thai Takeaway! by far the best in the area and would go further to say in the wider region too. High quality produce , fresh and delicious!
Main Meals here are always phenomenal. Best Thai Takeaway in Canterbury in my opinion. And great value for money if you stick to the chicken/beef/pork options
Delicious food,  generous serving and very well priced. Curry puffs took us back to the streets of Thailand.  Aroy mak kobkhun khrab
Great food. Love that they take the time to repeat your order back to you so there a are no mistakes.
The food was delicious. The Yellow Curry and Pad Thai are divine. Songkran is our favorite Thai takeaway. Highly recommend.
I ordered a hot chicken larb and it is mild and relatively flavourless. Pretty disappointed especially after seeing all of the good reviews.
Disgusting I DO NOT RECOMMEND chicken was UNDER cooked yet the batter was so hard it was inedible disgusting could not even bite it was so hard. Also had missing eggs ???? Made me feel sick.
tasteless ramen

A better name for this place would be So Shite instead so Soshite .  Food was pretty gross tbh and definitely wasn’t fresh.  Service from the man absolutely appalling.  Don’t waste your money, much better places around!

Only thing that was disappointing was that more people weren't inside enjoying the awesome food. Prices were outstanding and had me expecting shrinkflation-sized portions, but for less than $30 I had a feast. I suggest you get a signwriter to make the place stand out!
Thank you so much, one of your workers personally dropped off my rice to me that was forgotten in an order, such lovely service!
So yum!! takeaways were still warm when they got here, worth it.
Huge portions & very tasty

Just discovered this humble ramen spot — Soshite Hikari, and it’s quickly become my go-to budget-friendly comfort food place, especially during the start (and end!) of the month. They specialize in affordable, clean-tasting, and light ramen, and even have $10 lunch specials on weekdays!  ⸻   Transparent Pricing, Super Wallet-Friendly •	Signature ramen is only $12.8 — easily one of the most affordable bowls in Christchurch •	$10 weekday lunch specials with great variety — and no, they’re not just filler dishes!   Light Broth, Springy Noodles I ordered the seafood ramen, and the broth was unexpectedly light and non-greasy. It’s that kind of clean, refreshing soup that won’t leave you thirsty afterward. The noodles were perfectly cooked with a nice bounce, and the toppings included fresh shrimp, half a marinated egg, greens, and wakame seaweed. Great value for the price!   No free noodles, but free soup refills! If you’re a broth lover like me, this is a huge plus. The free soup refill makes the whole meal feel extra satisfying and cozy.   The $10 Lunch Specials Are a Hidden Gem Their rice bowl lunch sets are just $10 and perfect for a quick and filling midday meal. The portion is decent too — definitely enough to keep you going through the afternoon.   Their takeaway packaging is adorable! The ramen comes in a pull-tab container that looks like a drink can. Super cute, totally Instagram-worthy, and still keeps the soup hot — love that fun detail!  ⸻   Who I’d Recommend This To: •	Anyone who loves ramen but prefers it on the lighter, less salty side •	Students or office workers looking for a solid meal without breaking the bank •	People who enjoy clean, simple flavors and unique presentation styles  ⸻  Verdict: Soshite Hikari doesn’t go for flashy gimmicks, but wins your heart with honest pricing and gentle, satisfying broth. Whether you’re a local or a traveler on a budget, this spot is definitely worth checking out!
We visited here for the first time after a friend said they were awesome. I have to say the food was fabulous as was the service, would highly recommend and will definitely be back

First visit to Soul Quarter. Wow!! We ordered the Trust the Chef menu, every dish was simply amazing and so tasty. The dishes were presented beautifully and the portion sizes were very generous. The service was really good, attentive. The interior is stunning. We will definitely be back - thank you Soul Quarter
Excellent food, wine and service. We'll be back!

We went for a late anniversary dinner. We booked first table but unfortunately we arrived super super late due to our car battery dying. Luckily everyone at Soul Quarter was understanding and welcomed us in. We had been looking forward to it because we’d been there once before and loved it. So I was so disappointed to be so late, but their friendliness lifted me back up after quite a stressful afternoon. Their food is truly amazing. We had the southern fried chicken and charred broccolini as entrees. They were delicious. We both had steaks as mains and it was just so good. They also have yummy mocktails, we had a berry lab and a strange fruit. Such a special place. We highly recommend.
The two ladies that served us tonight had the best service! Bless them!
Absolutely phenomenal food and service

restaurant: South Garden Chinese Restaurant 南园中餐

reviews.text: The food is delicious

The char siu pork was so delicious! We ate here twice as part of our group meals, and it was very popular with the Chinese members. The dishes were cooked really well; my friends said the chef must be excellent!

We were waiting in line and they told us there was a seat available. We walked over and were told it wasn't for two people. We went back to the line and continued waiting. There were many people cutting in line and no one was there to manage the door. There wasn't even a number plate. The service and management were very poor.
The food was fantastic. Generous portions. Great variety I can't wait to go back and sample the huge dim sum menu earlier in the day.
Friendly and authentic Chinese restaurant. Food was tasty. Peking duck could be tastier and should have been served before the other dishes. There are a few car parks located outside.

Really disappointed tonight we ordered a chicken korma and it was nearly pale white and tasted bland and floury,  the chicken in it was allso grissly and chewy!! Girlfriend got the GF Naan and it was so dry you could hardly eat it.  Onto the pakora's "vegetable battered in spice and fried " The potatoes slices were raw and crunchy and half the box was just dribbles of the batter mix. extremely disappointed. And hungry I will not ever be returning to this restaurant again !!

This is one of the finest Indian restaurants we have had the pleasure of visiting in quite some time. The vibrant spices and rich flavors beautifully come together to create a truly memorable dining experience.

We had a meal here a few years back and it was one of the best Indian restaurants we had tried. However, tonight was the complete opposite. Bad service on the phone when ordering, quite run down inside the restaurant, fabric on chairs hanging off the underside and not very clean looking. Very quiet for a Friday night only 2 people dining in opposed to completely packed last time we went. Someone sneezing in the kitchen while i was waiting for the order and to top it off a long hair discovered in one of the curries!! Very disappointing will not be eating Indian food for the foreseeable future.

We moved to South New Brighton just over a year ago and wanting to use local got a takeaway from South of India. Have used them numerous times since and have eaten at the restaurant on 3 occasions with different friends who would all consider themselves curry aficionados. Every visit and takeaway has been of the same high quality and service. I consider South of India to serve a great curry always and would recommend that anyone who enjoys a good curry should give them a go.

Lovely little curry house. Staff were freindly and polite. Lots of choice of differnt currys Not so much choice of drinks Been twice now Tables were always avaible The atmosohere was always very quite. The menu is large and you have differnt choices of many currys of flavours and spices and you also have the choice if  you,d like it HOT or not. My choice is always HOT.

Ordered on their online website, went to pick up our order, it was not ready for pickup because apparently they have a new website and blamed us for the food not being ready by telling us that we should have called to tell them which website we used. When we received our food the butter chicken tasted weird the prawn malibari just taste like they had used powdered tomato soup. The papadoms tasted like the ones from the supermarket and the pickled mango tasted off. Our samosas that we ordered were soft and obviously a bit old. One thing I noticed while walking towards the restaurant was that there were pieces of wet newspaper on the window covered in mold. We have been going there for years now , we have told all of our family and friends that they are one of the best, unfortunately thats not the case anymore, will have to let them know not to waste their money here. Extremely disappointing.

restaurant: Southern Asian Restaurant 潮州餐馆

reviews.text: Good food !

We went for lunch and had our bicycles. We had no reservation, just wanted to try the place out as it had a good rating. I went inside to go ask if it's ok to park the bicycles around the entrance, as there was no specially made bike parking. not one of the three employees inside knew English, couldn't communicate with anyone. So we had no choice but to leave. The food could be awesome, we don't know. We might never know. Service was crappy from this point of view.
Great food
Very poor customer service
Very good
Authentic ChaoZhou restaurant, highly recommended
Fantastic night out and perfect venue for a gig! Easy to get to and fantastic service. Would definitely recommend
Funky wee Bar. Great for live music
Best pizza in the town. Go on Brazilian Jam day. Excellent music and happy people.
Good beer and pizza. Even better people.
I found the music gig too loud but the artist was amazing. The soft drinks are very expensive but kudos for not supporting Coca Cola

We went to Spagalimis to for a birthday family meal. The booking process was very easy online and when we arrived our table had already been prepared, which was lovely. The service and amazing staff at Spagalimis are always very welcoming and add to an enjoyable atmosphere. Our food and pizzas was delicious, as always. We all had a great evening and are looking forward to the next visit to a great Christchurch institution. Thanks Spags. See you soon.
Excellent food, outstanding service. A Christchurch institution that can’t be beaten.
Very poor customer service just overall not a good experience and food time was atrocious!

Three of us for dinner before going to a concert in Lyttelton. Booked for 6.30 and were seated by 6.35. Drinks order taken promptly and served. 2 large pizzas and Spags chips ordered when drinks delivered. About 30 minutes later the waitress asked if we wanted anything else. We reminded her of the 2 pizzas and chips. She had NOT placed our order with the kitchen. 5 min and the chips arrived. Another 10 - 15 minutes and we had our pizza. This delay over shadowed the meal which was ok. Venison pieces were sparse and chewy. Chips were great but could be because we were getting quite hungry. We ended up 20mins late for our 8pm concert. Disappointing.  Updated. Received an apology voucher. Thank you. That was not expected.
EDIT. I've been loyal for years. But honestly 15 bucks for a small box of soggy cold chips. Really? That is totally taking the piss. I'll be looking elsewhere from now on

I think spagalimis needs to update there computer systems they say they give perks to sign up and yet I've not seen one nor my birthday gift via spagalimis.not good spags and I've been long time customer no I won't remove as it states free pizza not buy a pizza and then receive it take it further as I am correct I've been buying from colombo since 2022 don't threaten me as I said take it up further as I know I'm correct Henry of ur business said use are having faults then says I need to buy one to receive on then that's not a gift.other business stick to there word so please don't threaten me I'd be more than happy to stop buying at ur store

The pizza was fine but damm their beer was awesome.  Lots of beers on tap.  Nice weather sit outside in the garden it is awesome.  Pies are on the smallish size but good flavor.  Happy hour is the way to go.
Good pizza but one of those restaurants that even when completely empty will try to seat two people at a table for two. We sat ourselves at a table for four and the server looked completely shocked.

I wasn't tremendously hungry but I wanted a place to sit after a long walk and Spagalimis arrived at the right time. I managed to convince the hostess to find me a seat with a power outlet which ended up leaving me alone in the bar area. And I was alone for a long while. Close to 20 minutes before I was packing up my stuff when my waitress stopped by to try to take my order. By that point, I was up and on my way to somewhere else.  It looks good. Give it a try. Bring patience.  [Review 399 of 2024 - 52 in New Zealand - 21432 overall]

That was rough.  Ambiance and service are great, presentation was excellent-- pizza came on a wooden baking paddle and everything.  But the pizza (I think I had the Spag's special recommended per the wait staff?) was pretty gross. Crust was thick and bready, which in itself was not a problem-- but it came out so steaming with moisture that it quickly left its own puddle of water under the pizza, and the result was distinctly un-appetizing.

I made a reservation to eat at 32 Salisbury St. Spagalimis for 15 people a week before. When we turned up we were rudely bump out at the bar which was extremely noisy. I hated it. I know they are so busy but the way they handled it was so unprofessional. I  was so disappointed and they only told me basically to suck it up. It was a farewell dinner with my classmates and tutors and it would have been nice to be seated nicely and comfortably where we can hear each other talk. I don't know what went wrong with our booking here. So disappointing.
The food and the staff were absolutely incredible!! Loved the experience - small little restaurant and authentic vibes but meant the food was even better! Give it a go!!
Fantastic service and food!
Great moussaka!!! And the hummus!

Me and my wife went there for dinner at date of our wedding anniversary. The place was cold the Greek music too loud, the atmosphere/decor spars. The service was friendly enough, but not timely, because the main, an open souvlaki, arrived while we were finishing our starter. The main was poorly presented. The meat over and undercooked, the lamb meat so chewy, the tzasiki was an accident with garlic, so was the humus, the salad nothing like a Greek salad, the bread soggy and there were chips !??  We didn't want to complain and spoil our evening  but we won't be back.
Very lovely service. Delicious food. Super accommodating. Would Highly recommend.
Great food and drink. Chill environment
I'm dining here this evening for the fifth time. Every time has been such a treat.  If you want to enjoy beautiful food, service with a smile,  and the perfect atmosphere, Spartan is the place to be.
Always a great time here! Good food, great service!

Not impressed. Waited 15 minutes to be served. Ordered the blue code at a price of $29.90. Came out to the table slightly crunchy with the fish a little too wet - clearly not fresh fish. But what really got me was the size of the blue cod and the meal! The pieces of cod were no bigger than a crumbed fish finger - it was equivalent to a children's size meal. How can a chef or any hospitality establishment look at that and feel proud of what you are giving your customers?? Seriously disappointed.

Thank you Speights Ale house! We had booked in lunch here for 20 people for labour weekend this year to celebrate our upcoming wedding. These guys, despite there being a sporting event on, made sure we had our own space upstairs away from the crowds. We were especially delighted with the service we received since it was so busy (the staff looking after us handled our group and the busy environment exceptionally!!) And many of our friends described it was the best meal out they had enjoyed in ages!!  We will 100% be back, thank you so much for ensuring our lunch and celebration went smoothly.

Dined out for lunch here and so impressed with everything. The table service from Jasmine was absolutely wonderful. She was prompt and how nice to have a happy and friendly waitress these days :) food was on point and came out super fast so we weren’t waiting around for ages. Well done Speight’s ale house! Impressed!
Excellent food and service. Staff were very helpful.
Great place to meet friends

Have eaten from here in the past and always enjoyed their food but tonight the food was completely different. As soon as I opened the tikka masala I could tell it was a different consistency to usual. It was bland and extremely salty. The garlic cheese naan was chewy and dry and lacked cheese. Have the chefs changed/ new chef I wonder? So disappointing  ordered from door dash and they don’t offer refunds??
Delicious curries from Spice Hub this evening 10/10 we had the palak paneer and chicken kadai would highly recommend both
I tried Saag Lamb for lunch right after I drop my customers off to gondola. As a tour guide, I’ll strongly recommend. It’s very nice. Can’t wait for come over to try something different next time.
Great curry and Naan bread. Thanks

The food was very very average. Did not enjoy the flavours. Cheesy garlic naan was NOT cheesy, nor very garlicky. Felt very undercooked and was not pleasurable to eat. Have been a local for a while but this was the worst it has been. Very dissatisfied.
Best curry I’ve ever had
The kadhai, saagwala and korma were all fantastic. Very quick. Amazing naan. Highly recommend.

Worst service I've ever had. The food was amazing, but our waitress never came to us and we had to ask to be served. Then we filled our own water up and they didn't give us one of our meals. The server then left for over 10 min and we couldn't ask where are food was. If it weren't for the shitty service this place would get 5 stars because the food was very tasty. If you don't care about bad service I would recommend
The meal was pretty good but the flavors could have been more intense.  My favorite was the spinach leaf Thai salad bite.  The service was friendly, but it took a while to get our wine.

Hidden local gem, we passed by the bar and decided to have a drink to kill time while waiting for the other restaurant's reservation. We ordered a beer and an appetizer.  After we tried the appetizer, we cancelled the other high-end restaurant's reservation and decided to stay in this restaurant to have dinner. The food really impressed us and they served the food so fast (very important as starving tourist) so we visited this place twice within 2 weeks (in each visit of Christchurch, based on our itinerary of traveling in South Island)  Great food, great service, spacious dining area. (also tax included, no tips) This place should have more reviews! (or maybe yelp is not popular in NZ?)  Must try the shakling beef (slowly cooked beef cheek)!

We arrived on the train on Christmas was delayed & it was 8pm by the time we checked in. Not many places were open & we stumbled in to what turned out to be a great authentic Thai restaurant. The slow cooked beef rib was simply fabulous!

Meal was delicious but unfortunately we had a set menu for a reserved early seating for a large group. Food for the price was expensive and sparse for the total number seated at our tables also rushed through so fast that people ordering desserts had to eat at the bar.Would not recommend for a big group.

We came on a busy Saturday evening - the staff very kindly opened 15 minutes early for us as we came from a marriage ceremony. We all went for the surprise 5 course menu which was great. Everything was very fresh (especially scallops and gropher fish), and tasty. The better French food I have ever tried, that's for sure. The dessert was the star, poached pear, blue cheese ice cream and red wine reduction. Amazing!!!!!! Not too sweet, and just a little pungent from the cheesy ice cream. My one frustration was that our wine was constantly filled up, and we felt compelled to drink more than we usually would. I ended up with 6 drinks poured - I would usually only have 3 so felt unwell after - but didn't want to waste good French wine. Please ask your customers before refilling. Other than that, it was a great experience.

This is one of my most favourite "special" restaurants in Christchurch. The staff are knowledgable and attentive without being annoying,the ambience is perfect, and the food makes for a wonderfully memorable experience. I can recommend the wine matching degustation menu which was stunning.

Came here with a friend one night just because I had been craving some french food. I found the restaurant difficult to find and managed to drive past it twice! In all fairness though, that may just be my own poor sense of direction. Park in the hotel right next door.  This is a very elegant restaurant with a classic and restrained decor. Tables are beautifully laid out with white tablecloths and the chairs are comfortable but of a solid quality (my favourite type). We went on a random wednesday night so it was fairly quiet. Service was excellent - a french waiter which certainly adds to the ambience!  As for food, I was a little disappointed. Maybe my expectations were to high. I ordered the escargot (entree) and the cassoulet (main). Both were good but didn't wow me. The duck in the cassoulet was actually a little dry. My friend picked much better than me and next time I would probably order what she had. She had the foie gras for entree and the steak for main and both were absolutely excellent. Perfectly cooked, lovely well balanced flavours.  Dessert was delicious, I can never go past a perfectly cooked chocolate fondant.  Good wine menu, and served in nice big glasses which I like.   Next time I would probably choose the surprise menu, the only reason I didn't this time is that I had a major craving for some cassoulet and some escargot and didn't want to take the risk that they might not be included!   Price wise this is at the top end of the scale for Christchurch but food and ambience are of a high quality. That said $90 each for a three course meal and a glass of wine is not unreasonable.   Bottom line: great for a fancy date night, or just randomly treating yourself (like we chose to do!)

restaurant: St Pierres Sushi & Bento Bowl (Colombo St)

reviews.text: I’ve been here a few times only because it’s close to where I live and they open late. Unfortunately, the customer service is consistently poor — the staff always look grumpy and unfriendly, as if you owe them a million dollars. I once ordered a “baby roll,” which turned out not to be baby-sized at all. They also seem reluctant to accommodate made-to-order requests. Overall, it’s been a disappointing experience
I don't eat sushi, but the little person I bought it for loved it

$10 for this is unbelievable. Also once the udon noodles soup was also unbelievable salty, we had to ask the chef to add hot water to our bowl 3 times, 1 big ladle each time and it was still too salty to eat.
Very friendly staff,  great food, lot's of seating there's something for everyone
Our go to place
Honestly, don't bother, really bad customer service. There are better sushi places..

Extremely disappointing service. The staff were dishonest about the wait time, telling me it would be much shorter than it actually was. As a driver, I observed several customers who arrived after me receiving their orders first, while mine was delayed until last. I’ll be contacting Uber to file a formal complaint regarding this experience.
Absolutely love coming here the stuff always friendly and your food is always made fresh and quite quickly!

Best Sushi in the city. There are more than one outlets but they maintain the food quality consistently. Variety of sushi are there and even budget package like sushi of the day etc.  Realy the authentic taste.

This particular franchise, in the St Pierres chain, is my absolute favourite. Reliably good and made with love. The rice is cooked and seasoned to perfection, fillings are generous and all of the salad vegetables are fresh as can be The staff here are absolutely lovely and will accommodate even the fussiest of requests. The food is presented beautifully, as sushi should be, these guys are true sushi artists. Even once the food is encased in its little plastic container, it is not squashed or crammed in, making it more appealing to eat. Generous portions of wasabi and ginger, compliment the dishes. 10/10

St. Pierre's is an amazing spot for sushi definitely my favourite place to eat. Their Katsu Chicken on rice is my go-to, and I’d absolutely recommend it to anyone. It’s super tasty, really filling, and perfect for lunch. Plus, they even have a loyalty card program, which is a great bonus!

Sushi is yummy but also a little bit mushy and wet at times but is still ok. Sushi rolls fall apart easily too. Good price for sushi, definitely one of the cheapest better quality sushi places in Christchurch. The things with avocado can be a little sickly too but it’s still good. The staff are quite quiet and don’t offer you a bag most of the time either. Would come again for a quick takeaway.

restaurant: St Pierres Sushi & Bento Bowl (South City)

reviews.text: Bad customer service, I will not go back.
It's so so good !!! Delish Sushi
Food is fine. Customer services needs work i.e more hospitable.
The worst St Pierre’s Bento Bowl I had! The service was also bad! Never go again!

absolutely disgusting treatment of customers by staff at bento bowl South City.  Clearly when motivated by a free coffee from her boyfriend on a lunchtime visit she can be quite pleasant but if you are a customer standby for fierce treatment and an unmissable reminder that you are dirt.
Always excellent service & sushi
Yum yum yum!! So good fresh, delicious and healthy! Very cool vibe & lovely staff.
Repeat customer. Love that there are a handful of vegan options. Service is always so prompt. Requests are not a fuss. The loyalty card is appreciated.
Standard St Pierre's menu and pricing. Doesn't have salad or bento bowls range but everything else. It's within a Subway and Caltex. Super friendly staff!! Popular at lunchtime.
Walk in on the spot order 3 platters .The sushi was amazing fresh as my son said "it was like eating fresh seaweed and smelt like the sea. Well presented
Great service great food spent 2 hours in there , weren't asked to leave for being there to long, very relaxed atmosphere

St Pierres has good and bad days where sometimes I find scales and bones in my fish which really puts me off, thankfully this branch is a good one, they took good care in making their sushi and everything was lovely. Thank you

It's pretty hard to screw up sushi, especially when you're working to a standard build, from a tried and tested menu. However......... This particular branch, out of the three St Pierres that I usually buy from, is just missing something. Let's ignore the fact that the staff here would rather you weren't there. The assembly is poor and taste is oddly different, like it's lacking flavour, plus the meat quantity is low. It's an uncomfortable atmosphere inside this store, meaning that nobody dines in very often. Parking is a nightmare, as the tiny carpark is shared with several other businesses
Best lunch in the city centre
Very excellent
My favorite KFC, have this for lunch every week.
Very good!

Want on a busy Saturday night, chose the chefs choice menu and so delighted we did. Lovely meal, with good sized portions and beautiful flavors that progressed through the menu. Delightful evening with lovely service, good cocktails and a cosy space.
Our first visit to Story and we will definitely be back. Wonderful friendly service. Cosy but comfortable setting. Food was next level delicious celebrating local and seasonal produce.
This was one of the best experiences we have had in a very long time! The food was beautiful and the service impeccable! Highly highly recommend heading to Story!
We had a great meal at Story. The fried zucchini appetizer was fantastic!

Booked a table for 6.30pm, walked in with no wait. The staff were very accomodating and lovely. The food was fabulous and was spaced out well between dishes. Seasonal menu so look online before going in to know what to expect. I have a nut and seed allergy and they were very accomodating. The drinks were prompt and delicious! Would definitely return again!!
I had dinner here last Saturday and the food was excellent , as was the service we had the best waiter ever. He was terrific. I highly recommend this place

Food was great! It is within our hotel's premise so we went in conveniently.  To our surprise, the food was well prepared.  We were all satisfied with what we ordered.  If you happen to be in Christchurch, give it a try!

1. Excellent food choices and a wide variety from vegan, gf, meat, seafood, land-based meats and wide variety of veggies and meal choices.  2. Great service quality.  3. Good bar / wines.   Only negative is that service was linear so those arriving first typically got their meals, deserts based on the queue.  There were opportunities to serve desert to those who had ordered and finished main meals well ahead of other tables who started first but were slower to eat.

This is one hopping place on the weekend evening!   We arrived without a reservation and they still found us a table straight away. Had there not been room they would have us sit at the bar. Great service throughout the entire experience from start to finish.   The restaurant itself is small and cozy.   The menu is the perfect size with plenty of choices yet not overwhelming. We all chose a different dish and each one was spot on delicious! We enjoyed our experience and would love to return for breakfast one day.
This is the perfect place to come for brunch! The food is delicious and the plating is picture perfect.
Nice food and great service .. save room for dessert... so many deli-shish choices to try.

This came highly recommended with good reason. Wonderful service, love all the big Windows and yummy food. We came for a late breakfast during the week so didn't have to wait. The duck hash was delicious, unusual and perfect. Poached eggs, added bacon and avocado which made for a huge plate of fine food.

I made a reservation for my partner and I to come here for my birthday because I've heard great things about the food - especially the desserts. Big mistake. On arrival we waited at the top of the stairs to be directed to a table. The waitstaff stood there and made no effort to greet/communicate with us when we approached them and snapped at us as we went to walk over to a table as we weren't getting directed to go anywhere else. We established that we had a reservation and were then directed to a table. There next to ours was another empty 2 seater table with a view out the window so we decided to move to that. Another member of staff came over and she proceeded to snap at us to move back to our original table. We decided to leave before ordering anything. I have never been treated this rudely by staff. Definitely ruined my birthday. I wouldn't have had a problem if she was polite and friendly but it appears she didnt have an ounce of customer service skills. Wouldn't recommend and wouldn't go back.

Came around breakfast/brunch with my sister. Eggs benedict was good, strawberry pillows to die for. I wanted the lick the plate it was that good. The desserts are definitely a highlight! The portions were surprisingly hefty, so sadly couldn't try more of the desserts. I would have liked to order the entire menu of dessert options if my stomach and wallet allowed it.
Excellent food!  Highly recommended! We enjoyed a sensational breakfast at this establishment!   Awesome egg benedicts!

I feel bad for being the only low star review for Strawberry Fare. My friend and I came here for dinner services. Honestly I think its dinner that was really bad because everyone seems to come here for desserts and brunch.   This was what we ordered:  Kikorangi Blue Cheese Plate Salmon Ceviche Braised Lamb Pappardelle  Tropical Coconut Freeze  All the dishes lack in flavor, especially the Pappardelle. Watered down sauce, with no flavors, and the pasta was not good. The lamb was so tough and it shouldn't be because it was braised.  As for the ceviche, they give you a lot but its does not look like the normal ceviche you would get anywhere else, just gross.   We did like the Tropical Coconut Freeze. It was our only dinner in Christchurch and it was disappointing. Also, service was super slow even when the restaurant was not packed. I just don't understand the high reviews.

Delicious food and delicious coffee. The eggs Benedict was to die for as well as the tomato chutney that came with the eggs and toast. The flat white was my favorite so far in NZ. The service was exceptional and the waitress was willing to give us all sorts of recommendations of places to visit on our trip.
Went there a month ago Most overatted and expensive desserts .Never going back .Rather get a sundae from macdonalds

We started our South Island trip in Christchurch and this was our morning fuel up stop before we headed out, and what a good decision it was to come here. Impeccably decorated, clean, gracious service and delicious food. The upstairs looks out to the street which is lined by weeping willows, and downstairs you have to option to sit in the sunny balcony. Breakfast eggs, waffles, French bread they have it all. Highly highly recommend, this was of the the best places we tried when we were in New Zealand.

Yummy yummy in my admittedly oversized tummy! Strawberry fare is a real treat for me and my hubby but it truely is a worth while experience. The fillet steak is to die for (so tender!) and the mash potatoes are oh so creamy mmmmmmmm  the desserts are my guilty pleasure (besides of course my sex swing collection) the ultimate chocolate dessert is my go to every time I love the moose and the grainy ice cream is just brill. Unbeatable. I must admit the pre-earthquake location was better but they are nevertheless doing well in the new place!  I will be back (not a dark Vader reference)

We got eggs benedict! By far the best Benedict I have had to this date. Their poached eggs were the best. . We also got the warm raspberry drenched cake which was a bit sweeter than we expected but nevertheless great because of the texture
Loved this place.. amazing waffles and egg benedict. Staff was so good. Reserve this place as it gets busy during weekends.

This place is well known for its delicious desserts and for good reason.   Bring your appetite, the dishes we had were generous in size.   Not much more to say than if you're craving for a sweet treat then this place will do the trick.
This place is famous for its desserts. When I'm in trouble with the missus I treat her to some of their desserts and I'm back in the good books !
Easy to find, can park just outside the restaurant, friendly staff but most importantly the food was amazing.  Was there for breakfast and had Eggs Benedict and a Duck Confit Hash.  It was soo good.
Was very disappointed in the mains meal we had, didn't bother to stay for the dessert. We had heard a lot of good reviews but didn't do much for us, sorry Strawberry Fare but we won't be back

Just booked a reservation for our third visit, during our four (split-up) nights in Christchurch.  We're touring the South Island from the USA and have multiple stops here in Christchurch.  The first two experiences were great.  The food superb.  The drinks I ordered however were just ok.  I ordered a Moscow Mule and it tasted good, but wasn't served in a copper mug as it should.  And yes, it matters.  Another night I had a Mojito, which was just so-so.  I wouldn't order it here again.  The food however made up for it...both times.  I had the risotto the first time and the duck the second.  Both were very tasty and cooked to perfection. Service was better the first time around and just average the second.  I hope it will be better tonight. With some slight improvements, I would have given it 5 stars.
Wonderful atmosphere and the service was incredible. I had the duck hash and would recommend highly!

We are tourist who came for breakfast and decided to do dinner the next day. Excellent choice on our part. I had the fish and my daughter had the filet, both were excellent! Their sauces are amazing! Not one piece left uneaten. Save room for dessert. Dessert prices are high but the desserts are fabulous. Thank you for a lovely birthday dinner. What a meal to remember

I didn't think the price point was on the higher side like other review said. I feel like this is the price you will pay if you are going to a nicer restaurant that has quality food.   We only ordered deserts here but saw someone had proper brunch that looks like they also gave generous proportions.   I ordered the Chef Trio because I'm a libra that just can't decide on anything . ($21.50)   Chocolate cake ( rich and moist with slightly melted vanilla ic cream) Cheesecake was super delicious and creme burleeeeeee ( texture was thick and creamy but not too sweet) yummmm!!  10/10  Dad had the Strawberry Pillow - this one was suggested by the waitress stated was the most popular but we all agree this one was the least favorite one from all of us. Its just angel cake splash with some fresh berries (which we appreciated and lots of whipped cream and sauce) Angel cake was decent . 6/10   Poached Pear and Ginger Pudding - it was also good but nothing wowing! 7.5/10     Well this also depends on what you like but seems like the locals here usually go for the cheesecake and chocolate cakes. Menu is massive , you can definitely find something you like !   Oh yeah, Parking is a b*tch! Good luck! I would come back here if I'm in Christchurch to try their breakfast & brunch.

Fantastic food, but do to the proximity to a hotel, had a lot of family traffic on the day I went.  I had the grilled fish of the day and it was really good, everything you want in a main with a mix of complex flavors that blended well together. One bite gives the lemon of the sauce over the fish, the next gives a hint of the balsamic under them.   Wine selection was limited, but covered all the varietals.  I definitely recommend.
A little bit on the expensive side, wanted $5+ for sides such as avocado and bacon, but the food was delicious and the staff lovely. I would go back.

An overall solid place for dinner or just for dessert. We sat around 8pm and it seemed like most parties seated came especially for dessert.  Highlights: Each dish was placed beautifully. Get their fish of the day pan fried. They also cook a good steak. They have more desert options than meal options and the creme Brule was AHMAZING.   Low light: Pork cassoulet was way too salty but otherwise well flavored.
Lovely atmosphere and great food.  Desserts were amazing and dinner was very good.  Worth the splurge!
Enjoyed great service and superb food here. Been to breakfast and lunch. Great steak with true taste of quality. You have to try Salmon Croissant for breakfast.  See pics bellow

The classic Christchurch dessert destination. Expect to wait for a table if you don't book, but it's worth it! Staff are friendly and the setting is cosy but comfortable and quiet. Limited parking though.

One of my favorite breakfast/brunch spots in Christchurch. Delicious Eggs Benny, *incredible* French Toast, and very decadent coffee concoctions.  I've been told that it's equally amazing for lunch and dinner, but have not personally tried those meals.  And the desserts are one of the main draws.

We have always talked about coming here for brunch when we pass by. So glad we finally did!! Such a lovely place. You get to sit above street level and get a nice view of Hagley Park. The food we had was amazing and the prices weren't crazy. We both had 2 mimosas, a mocha, a flat white, fritters, and French toast. Everything was made well and tasted excellent. I can't wait to come here for dinner!! Definitely try it out.
This is so Frickin good like omgi can't explain yum oh hell really good stuff no crap at all really good I'm talking no shit it's good

Worse service ever we had a birthday party there only 7 of us, they forgot orders, forgot our table and left us waiting along time for food, so disappointed as I had heard great things. When I expressed my unhappiness it was blown off with just oh sorry bout that, will not spend a single cent there again.

This is absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in Christchurch. It is the perfect spot for all occasions: anniversary, Sunday brunch, casual afternoon catch-up with a friend, drinks and especially dessert! The second story seems to attract a little bit of a nicer-dressed crowd while the lower level seems to be for those who just rolled out of bed or came from a workout. I wouldn't come here in anything less than a nice pair of jeans, at least. Strawberry Fare prides itself on serving local, fresh and organic food whenever possible, so you won't find fresher food anywhere else.  For breakfast I have tried the french toast (which I think is their best breakfast item), the BET (which just seemed plain, though the flavors are nice), the blueberry pancakes which are delicious and looks like the batter is poured over a scoop of large blueberries on the skillet. The Corn and Capsicum Fritters and Salmon Deluxe were huge favorites with my friends.  For lunch I enjoyed the bruschetta and the summer chicken salad. The bruschetta is fresh and the summer salad is refreshing but also has large pieces of asparagus.  For dessert I absolutely recommend the Sunken Chocolate Cake. It is gluten free and vegan, but you would never know. It is also beautifully decorated with thin, frozen honey drizzle. The little girls I was with devoured their ice cream sundaes (but who doesn't love ice cream?)   The cool thing about Strawberry Fare though is their baking school! You can take classes at the restaurant to learn to bake (almost) as good as their chefs. This is definietly an experience everyone must do! If you haven't been to Strawberry Fare, put it next on your list - you'll be glad you did!

My friend begged me to go with him for years,  I wasn't enthusiastic as this isn't a place I fit in. But the ultimate chocolate dessert is amazing, everything is perfectly placed and has amazing flavor, I would come back just for that.

I think that  the reason SF does well is that it is one of the only places in Chc that specialises in desserts. So when you think 'dessert' you think Strawberry Fare.  Good marketing, but it would be better yet if the desserts were actually better for the price charged. Citrus Dreamy Cheesecake is closer to one of those gelatin cheesecakes that doesn't have much taste,  The Chocolate Drench cake is really a mud cake - wish it had been advertised as such.  If you want a dense slab of chocolate, that's the one for you.  I was hoping for a nice piece of actual cake.

Went for Saturday brunch and got a nice window seat. Decided to order BET - bacon eggs n tomato on kitchen's own seeded bread. Figure if a restaurant can't do basics, it'll fail everywhere else. And it was quite nice. Eggs nicely poached, bacon crispy, tomatoes ok. But the bread is delicious. Pity they only served one piece!!!

Strawberry Fare used to be my favourite restaurant. Now they're back, in a different location and it just feels very different. The vibe and atmosphere is different. The meals are limited and overpriced... the desserts are still very good and I would probably recommend just going for dessert. The lunch/dinner meals are good but the old menu had much more choice and the mains never seem to change. The service is also very slow. Nevertheless, still a great place to go.

Went here on a whim and I was very pleased. I had the beef filet and it was so tender!!!!! My dish also came with truffle mashed potatoes and asparagus (also amazing). For dessert, my boyfriend and I shared the Carmel and hazelnut torte. Wait staff was friendly and I think my only regret that night was that we didn't order more dessert! Lol

This place is popular, and I have heard the desserts are awesome.I went for the bread pudding, which was pretty good, but not worth the $16.50 in my book. Ironically, it may be that creme anglaise, a special ice cream, and the sticky date bread and the caramel sauce is a bit much - and why raw bananas on top of all that? The place was packed though, so maybe other things on the menu are a home-run?  Also, allow time for parking - there are only a handful of spots.

Great food and friendly staff . Lots of parking.Excellent Customer service. Good quality food and great  portion. Best ambience around.  We have been here several times and always had the best experience.  Kids friendly +++.
We had a lovely birthday lunch. Food was fabulous, service was excellent and we had a window seat as well. Coffee was perfect too

Went for a meal with partner and friends and was super impressed with the service and food. Steak main was cooked to perfection and the dessert didn't disappoint. All 4 of us had different mains and desserts which were of a high standard across the board. We were made to feel very welcome by the attentive staff. Would highly recommend the experience.

We sat down at 6 PM and ordered half a dozen oysters, a filet mignon, and a risotto. The food didn't arrive until 7 PM (while the two tables that arrived later had already received theirs). Then they informed us that the oysters were sold out. I questioned why this wasn't mentioned when I ordered. I came specifically to this restaurant wanting some oysters; if they had told me from the beginning that they were sold out, I could have chosen another place. The waiter called the manager, who insisted that she had informed me (but she really hadn't; the only thing she said to me was, "We didn't have many servers today, so the water was a little late, please forgive us"). It was a very unpleasant experience; I suspect I was discriminated against. Please avoid this restaurant.
A fave of ours.Always lovely service and very nice cuisine.
customer service, handsome waiters, and delicious food
Lovely Food, Incredible Desserts, Gorgeous View, Brilliant Staff, shame about the very steep stairs - but can't do much about that! The food was worth the climb!
Absolutely beautiful food

The only blemish in our amazing Chch trip was coming here. Advertised was buy 1 dessert, get 1 free however upon reviewing my receipt when I got home I noticed I had been charged full price for the desserts. When I emailed them they admitted their mistake and said they would refund me the next day. After leaving it a week I followed up with an email which I got no response from. I am still waiting for my refund nearly 2 weeks later which is disappointing. Happy to change this review if I receive my refund.  EDIT: Shortly after posting this review I finally received my refund. A shame I had to write a review outlining my experience to get a refund.

This pub and eatery is located at the Northwood Shopping Centre. It's easy to find, on Main North Road. There's tables for those who come for a drink, with nice areas for others who choose to dine also. It's good for groups of friends and families too. The service is lovely and atmosphere is relaxed. I haven't eaten here yet, only come for drinks, but it's an enjoyable place. The music isn't too loud for talking. There is plenty of parking as part of the shopping complex.

Enjoyed the atmosphere. I loved my twice cooked port and th'boys kids menu was good. He struggled to choose - and loved his  cheeseburger. It did look good. What really impressed me though was that K's steak was tough. She couldn't cut it - really! The reaction from wait staff was excellent. Meal was replaced - K switched to cod. Staff reacted with sympathy and concern.   Look - everywhere can have a bad steak. The way the place reacts is the telling point as to their service. I can't recommend these guys highly enough. The cod btw was superb! Well done guys :-)

A local favourite!  Great beer selection and a fantastic place to catch up with family and friends for a drink. There's an outdoor seating area which catches some awesome afternoon sun, perfect for your beer!!  We've also dined here for brunch, lunch and dinner several times! If you're with a group, there's a great private dining area off the side - so quiet, you'd think you're at home. The menu is great, and as the name suggests, there are a large number of stone plate dishes that come out sizzling hot!  One of our favourites is the sharing platter. Great value for 2 people, and less than two mains. We struggle to eat it all. Pretty much an entree, main and dessert all on one board!  They have regular specials on different nights. Quiz nights and other entertainment available too (but we try to avoid that!).   Be sure to book, because Styx and Stone gets pretty busy!
Went for a 21st, was a great evening, we had finger foods which were lovely and atmosphere was good. Service excellent.
Wonderful service, polite server very accommodating
Fabulous place to hire for a function * sensational service and place
Outstanding! Fantastic service, fantastic food. Do yourself a favour and have the bbq venison salad, best meal I've had in Christchurch in a long long time....and great value for money.
Yuzu Ramen is the BEST
I visited here this evening it was not that busy, good food and ramen was so good spicy.

Ordered Taiwanese Mezasoba ramen and Kakiage curry donburi as takeaways. The Kakiage curry donburi had no tempora deep fried vegetables. The ramen was full of slightly warm noddles. Both dished were very disapointing. We threw out the ramen after tasting it.
Their Japanese food is just as the same Japanese Restaurant in Christchurch. Their desserts have bigger portions. Good to try for experience. Very cozy place

Worst service I have ever witnessed. We walked in, was waved in the general direction of some tables.  We chose our own seating.  We were not given a menu.  Noting that the staff was busy, I went and got a menu myself.  As we were deciding what to have.  We saw some dishes delivered to the wrong table.  One customer decided to leave after hearing her meal would take another 30mins.  At this point I was having doubts.  Please note, the restaurant was not full.  Only half the seating was occupied.  After about 10mins, we were still not attended to. That's ok, I assumed that it's order at the counter.  Went up to the counter to place my order.  There was one person in front of me.  He was there when we walked in.  After he made his order, I stood in front of the counter.  Waited.  And waited and waited.  What seemed like 7 or 8 mins.  No staff even looked in my direction or acknowledge that I was present.  I walked out.  Never would I ever come back.  Edit:  Thanks for your response.  I noticed the new staff.  But I was ignored by all your staff.  I was willing to wait.  But will not tolerate being ignored by all that worked there.
Amazing raman and lots of others option. Nice place to dine out.
This place was insane! The food was absolutely amazing!
Food is great but service is really slow. Been here twice and both times I’ve waited almost an hour for 1 meal!! The staff are not attentive at all
Great value

I have purchased several times via Uber Eats and each time the food has gotten worse. I only kept trying because Sun Ning used to be really good but that's it for me. Disgusting, old tasting, poor service, cold food and expensive for what it is. What a shame to see the Sun Ning become this. The people that started it really did a great job with the most basic of food, and the place can no longer provide even that.
We loved the food, perfect taste and full yummy,. Highly recommended
Very good value for money.

Large variety of Chinese food and Fish & Chips. The service is always efficient. Fish & Chips: Fish batter is crispy, chips are clean and delicious. Hotdog is a saveloy if you like that. Chinese meal: Always end up getting Beef (steak) & black bean and the combination fried rice. Both a HUGE, full of meat and veges. Always lasts us a few meals given how big they are, and yet all very reasonably priced. Our local go-to Fish & chip shop and Chinese place.
Great prices excellent food
Absolutely delicious food and good amount of food for the price as well

Sun Ning is AMAZING!! We drove across town to try it and it will be our new go to for great Chinese food. The servings are super generous, there is a lot of meat and they are big pieces too, they were very reasonably priced, the chicken chowmein and chicken and cashew were loaded with meat as well as heaps of delicious veges. The beef in the fried rice was so tender. The sweet and sour pork was still a little bit crunchy which was lovely, with a perfectly balanced sweet but tangy sauce, and delicious won tons too. Thoroughly enjoyed, thank you! Also very busy at 6pm so is a good sign, and seemed to be quick cooking and getting the food out to customers. Top marks from us.
Always busy, always get such a wonderful feed of freah and yummy food
Slow and unorganized, Delivery drivers wait times excessive. And thats not including drive to to get there !!!
I love their egg foo young n sweet n sour pork..
amazing service
Lovely food. Great service.
Epic service with really good food :) thanks to the little lad who served us and thanks for the extra potato fritters!!
Last minute order! Thankyou, food was delicious  I’ll definitely be back
Great food, good prices, wonderful friendly and fast service.
First time for us, nice food, good value.  Fried chicken noodles & wontons not greasy.  Will definitely return again.
I think this will be one of my favourite takeaways in Christchurch. Love it.

My son and I come every week because it has the best hotdogs my son inhales them. Great chips. Service is always efficient and friendly. Love that they have interesting tabletop brain games to play while you wait too.
Sushi was very sweet like a whole lot of sugar was added to the rice. Had to stop eating because of how sweet it was. Only gf item was the salmon. Disappointing for the price
Hands down worst riceball I've ever had

Was walking by right before they closed. They had a sale on sushi/rolls that were made earlier today and the one left was chicken with avocado and it was delicious   The rice was soft and freshly made and it was only $5.50 for 8 pieces. Would def go back!
Quick grab for lunch or dine in for a hot meal. Delicious
BEST SUSHI. We came early in the morning and the sushi was INCREDIBLY fresh. HIGHLY recommend
Great food (specifically the chicken udon) at a very reasonable price point for the area!
Fantastic customer service. Warm, cosy atmosphere.
Tastiest Chicken Udon ever! Decided to stop here for lunch, I’ve never been here before. Friendly staff with fast service for quality food on the go. :)
Great chicken on rice! Good service.

Really dissapointing, kitchen is never open, out of rice???  I've been here a few times because it is convenient to work.  The food is really average. A lot of it is prepared and refrigerated. For example their crumbed food. This makes it not crispy and has a stale, soft texture to it. Even though they call it crispy chicken or crispy prawn.  They are frequently out of simple ingredients. INCLUDING RICE! What sushi shop runs out of rice.  Their kitchen closes really early. Used to be 2pm then 1:45pm and now 1:30pm. Which seems silly as that is lunch time. And the kitchen is fully closed on a Sunday.  I've given up on this sushi shop.
The chef prepared the food face-to-face, which was a pleasant experience and brought a lot of joy to the diners. Overall, the food tasted great.
Nice service but the food was too salty

I was on a business trip so did the a Le carte menu which is cook led on the teppanyaki grill.  The food is of a very high quality but exceptionally expensive if you consider volume. The drinks menu is good.  I would say as a lonely business traveller of experience, they cater for you very well.
Great place for a teppanyaki meal, the chefs put on a good show for everyone seated around the hot plates.  Food was delicious.
Delicious food and fantastic service with lovely staff, a family-friendly place with a cool atmosphere!
Here was great and there is a Japanese chef, He was awesome , kind, nice smile and perfect skills. We had a great time Hope to meet him again Recommend to step into here. Thank you so much !
Absolutely can’t get enough of this place! My favourite thing to get is the crispy chicken rice ball, absolutely delicious EVERYTIME!!
Great rice balls. Great price for the size you get.
Love this place.  Staff are lovely.  They know my son's order so sometimes it's ready before I get to the counter
Good food, fast and easy to order, very filling

Got the mixed chicken rice ball (medium) you’d have to be really starving to finish a large I reckon, this thing was big and luscious, still warm and gooey. A must try if you haven’t already, the line all the way out the door tells you it must be good. Can’t wait to come back and add the extras I didn’t see until after I’d ordered.
worth the hype. queue was very long during lunch time though.
Never disappoints! Best rice balls in CHCH .

Use to come here for rice balls and went back today. Ordered rice ball crispy chicken and avacado. Had maybe 1/2 a teaspoon of avocado which I paid $1 extra for pretty disappointing use to be very generous with their servings.

What the rice ball lacks in structural integrity it makes up in flavour.  Reasonably priced, speedy service and tasty - count on these guys to get you thru your lunch hour if you're out Colombo St way.
I’ve been going for about 15 years on and off since I Don’t live in the Area anymore, great value for money! And the staff that work there are always friendly - couldn’t recommend them enough
We love this place! So delicious and really reasonable prices. The owners are so kind each and every visit. No bad things to say!
Korean Bbq Chicken is yummm

amazing, good service, the crispy chicken poke bowl is so so fresh and is a great option for lunch. good price, nice location and the perfect spot for a fresh light meal. that sweet chilli changed my life
Best sushi in Christchurch
Excellent service! Su always greets us with a big smile. The sushi is fresh, expertly prepared, and offered at the best prices.
Best sushi and service in Christchurch.
Such lovely staff and yummy food
I love this place because it is quiet (no loud music and you can hear yourself think). Food is great and good value too
Huge range of great sushi and other Japanese food, friendly staff, fair prices
I had sushi court a couple of weeks back, and it was great! I really liked the self service, and the variety of dishes available.
Good selection of sushi. Enjoyed the double chicken salmon I purchased

Been here a few times, usually been good. Got it today and the sushi I got from the chicken section was actually shrimp. Didn't notice until I already started eating it because it is covered in sauce so you don't see the meat. My partner has a shrimp allergy and if I shared some with her she would have gotten sick, in which case I would be suing them..
Trash and over priced
Nice vegetarian sushi and friendly staff. Just the carrots could’ve been grated finer

Sushi was alright. The staff of the other hand, most of them are rude. Did not greet me or ask if I preferred chopsticks or a spork. This one woman also aggressively snatched the tuna sushi out of my hand which was very off-putting when putting it into a small bag. Me giving it a 2 star is rather generous I'd say.
The sushi is very dry and tasteless. It falls apart when I tried to eat it. They wonky have a fork instead of chopstick to eat the sushi.

Very bad experience with Sushi Express. An excessive business mindset led to me spending 18 NZD on a tuna combo without even getting a single packet of wasabi. Nowhere in the world do sushi places refuse to provide soy sauce and wasabi. This has been my worst sushi experience after eating sushi over a hundred times! Such an extreme cost-cutting approach, where even small packets of soy sauce and wasabi are not provided just to maximize profit, is simply unacceptable. Wishing you great success in your business!
Friendly service. Good value. Fresh sushi. Recommend the spicy crispy chicken!

Got a medium platter today for our teenagers birthday party, was last minute and they rushed it through had it ready in an hour! Presentation was Immaculate and price is very reasonable for the quality we received. The platter was dealt to in very short time by all party goers with very happy reviews.  Thanks to the staff and Id recommend them to anyone looking for a party pleaser
The night specials are very cheap and the staff are very nice.
Best sushi in chch
Great and fresh sushi. Recommended! Cozy shop too
Our family loves Sushi Fresh!  We have been many times and the quality is always very good.  Always so fresh and such a great selection.  Such friendly, helpful staff.  Love that it's our local :-)
Food is excellent, I try to go every week
Love a pick and mix

I am a spicy food lover, of course, not just a spicy food though. Anyhow, I recommend that having a spicy ramen if you are spicy food lover. Also I have to say their sushi is so good and it’s so beautiful, you should try!!
Yumi is the best! Best sushi in town! I'd eat here every day if I could.
Good sushi place!
Delicious independent sushi takeaways! High quality food at a very fair price, taste is always on point. Highly recommend.
Best sushi north of dunsandel Owners are so genuine and do a great job Without this place democracy would struggle to exist
Delicious, very fresh.

Best sushi in Christchurch my family and I truely won't go anywhere else. If they don't have what you want they'll make it for you on the spot, so helpful and friendly and the sushi is exceptional. We visit at least once a week as my son loves their rice balls and my daughter loves the sushi sticks, you can't go wrong with whatever you order. The platters are also amazing for events, we always get them for birthday parties and everybody raves bout them.
Best sushi I've found in Christchurch!!
I found a black hair and bit of plastic in my rice ball today, wouldn’t go back.
Very good! My go to local. Great Donburi served here with Japanese curry.

Very friendly staff and yummy food, I've been coming here for years. It will always be my go-to place for a rice ball! I love that you can choose between small, medium, and large rice ball sizing. They have a good balance of rice and meat. 10/10 would recommend giving it a go at least once!

I always come to Sushi mart for their Crispy Chicken rice balls. I think it's really good value for money, and the food tastes really good. The staff are nice and the food comes reasonably fast as well.
says on the hours of operation are 8am to8pm it's 4:16pm and it's not open lol false advertising and the lace is dirty as but food is good
Honestly best donborui I've had, here almost weekly Wish I never found this place because now I can't stop coming back!
Best of its kind in all of chch
Some of the best fresh sushi in the area! It’s a weekly must for city goers!
Ordered the Yakiniku bowl for $14.90. Absolutely delicious!!!! It was definitely all fresh and warm and not too much or little of anything. Would go back again easily.
Absolutely love this place, have been coming here for more than 6 months. Always get the crispy chicken box! Superb value for money!

I stumbled into here in a moment of extreme hunger after a day of meetings and ordered a crunchy chicken rice box of some sort. What I was not expecting was the sheer SIZE of it, or how taaaasty it was. I'll be back when I'm next in Chch.  Only comment I'd say is it maybe wasn't the most practical box to eat from.

This is a must-visit restaurant in the city, offering fantastic food, beautiful ambiance, and top-notch service! It’s also student-friendly with affordable prices but generous portions, making it the ultimate dining spot.
The freshest, most delicious sushi I've ever tasted. I never want to eat any other sushi again. SUSHI POP

restaurant: Sushi Rice Box Japanese Food Bar

reviews.text: Awesome, highly recommend it.
Such a friendly person with exceptional food to match... A top recommendation.
World’s best Chicken Katsu Don !!
Tasty Japanese food
Sushi looked & tasted amazing until i found hair in my food, disgusting major put off wont go back
Great food at a great price

Average sushi at an average price. Too much plastic is used for a tray of sushi and a riceball. I'm always looking to reduce waste and the lady there always never asks if I want a bag or fork she loads me with the bad, fork, soy sauce and the plastic that the tray and the rice ball come in, please ask and attempt to limit the waste!
Love the Crispy Chicken Kat su Don it is amazing along with the teriyaki chicken too
I ordered teriyaki eel donburi for takeaway but when I came home and checked, it was salmon one. Staff language skill is not good so that’s the reason to take order
Great food! The fresh spring rolls are delicious and the individual cabinet sushi is incredible. Staff are really friendly and it's a nice little spot to spend my lunch break!
Best sushi in Riccarton.

I purchase from your store 3 time a week.  Always 3 sushi from the cabinet valued over $10.  I have a loyalty card, and when I spend over $10 my card gets stamped.  I have been doing this since you opened.  Twice now I have been told off by the same woman who tells me I cannot use my loyalty card as it doesnt cover the cabinet sushi.  The cards says, "all sushi over $10".  Over the very multiple times I visit, the service is fantastic, so friendly, except this woman who has only served me twice.  Today, I was scolded and told off in front of customers I was wrong and if I wanted to use my loyalty card it was only boxed sushi.  I pointed out it says "all sushi" again she told me I was wrong, shook her head and was insulting me in her language.  I have learnt a few expressions.
Just got take away from here. The best scallop and lobster sushi i have had since visiting japan.
The service attitude was very poor. Last time when my sister and I went there to buy sushi and paid for two self-service sushi, the waiter rolled her eyes at me, which was not recommended.

Lovely bright and welcoming eatery with fresh and flavoursome food, staff are friendly and welcoming - great addition to the mall food options! My son loves the crispy chicken skewers and tuna (panda) balls!
Delectable Sushi!
Burnt wontons, and took 30 min.
Very good ramen
Sushi Soldier serves up incredible food! We tried their 'Give Me The Maki' sushi platter and everything was so fresh and delicious. Definitely recommend this place!

I ordered via uber eats. Wait time was so long about 45 minutes. I got the crispy chicken bowl with rice and salad, didn’t have much salad though. Overall pretty good. I also brought a fortune cookie that resonated with me which was cool!
Amazing Sushi and great portions!
"Completely tasteless laksa, not like laksa at all, and waited 30 minutes for tasteless dumplings. Don’t recommend this place to others."

Good food. Had fried squid, fried chicken and poke bowl which was a lot of food for two. All delicious! Building says open until 1am on Fri but they started cleaning up at least an hour early like all the places in there.
This is a must go place! Awesome food with friendly staff. We went there 2 times during our 2 day stay at the town.

This is one of the most popular eateries in the Little High complex so be prepared to wait.  I  ordered a hot and spicy ramen - it was very good with delicious melt in your mouth roast pork belly, chewy al dente ramen and rich broth.  Unfortunately the broth was lukewarm which spoiled it.
Really fresh sushi and sashimi, and quick service,  perfect for a quick, healthy lunch on the go. I wish they'd ditch the little soy sauce fish though - horrible waste of plastic.

This place has done amazing riceballs for years. Unfortunately today, found out they have gone the way of many chain sushi places - all rice and minimal chicken (for $8.50!). People are still lovely though.

The best sushi in Christchurch  Thank you Yumi and the sushi time team! We’ve eaten at Sushi several times, and it’s always been delicious, with warm, friendly, and outstanding service. The highlight was definitely the two beautiful sushi platters we shared with friends during a bachelor party : simply unforgettable! I could eat here every day. See you soon!
Thank you Yumi for the sushis !!! Best in Christchurch
good, food is yummy, LOVELY AMAZING FANATASTIC SEXY SUSHI
It is best sushi in chch!!
Very nice spicy chicken

I’m not kidding when I say this, it was the worst sushi I’ve had. The rice was dry and falling apart. The chicken looked so slimy. This is the first review I’ve done so take that into consideration it was so bad I’ve gone out my way to write how bad it was!
Simply awful. The food was stale, week old vegetables and tasteless. Threw it in the bin.
I love sushi ya they are soo underrated I love the rice balls they r soo good,100% recommend
Amazing service from Scott, and the BBQ pork bun was perfect,  and at a great price! Would highly recommend, will be back soon.
Got tuna and mayo sushi and chicken popcorn. Both were dry to my taste bud and throat.
Owner made as i wanted the sushi to be, really fast service
Dry rice, poorly rolled, waste of money.
Very friendly service! :) the crispy chicken rice ball and sushi are the best!  It’s mine and my partner’s favourite
bus sushi gonna try again
Best sushi in town!! I couldn’t find the order option on the website and they’re so busy it would be great if I could order by messenger.
Highly recommend the mini teriyaki balls and the crispy chicken rice ball. I dont fall apart while you eat. Super yum
Excellent sushi, really tasty and great value great service

My absolute favourite local sushi spot! I’ve always loved Avonhead Sushi Time - especially their mini sushi, which I’ve been getting for years. I also recommend the prawn sushi roll, it’s so yummy! Prices have gone up a bit, but that’s just the cost of living these days. Still highly recommend!
The best Sushi I have ever tasted. Anywhere. Friendly staff too.
Best roll sushi in chch.
Great food, usual service for a Sushi Time. Limited menu compared to The Palms and South City.
We usually enjoy the food here. But tonight the chicken was old and dry. The rest of the food was bad quality in general. My stomach felt sick an hour later after eating.
I always dine in, crispy chicken don w miso. Never fails, delicious, great serving, fast and efficient! Recommend!
Excellent pricing. Such good value for money it is really good as well!
Sushi always tastes fresh and delicious! The staff are always kind :)
The teriyaki chicken don is amazing!
will be ordering again nice and fresh cheaper than most sushi places will be recommending to others thank you
Generous portion, fresh and yummy food! Thank you :)))

I tried Taberu for the first time today. Some of the BEST Japanese food I've ever had. The chicken Ramen was delicious and the gyoza (and sauce) was absolutely amazing. I will definitely be coming back
Good food
I ordered on uber eats and got the fried chicken and ramen and both dishes were amazing
I odered on uber eats, this is the best kastu curry! I want it everyday!
Uber eats - great value for money. Kept the broth separate so it was nice and hot. :)
First time ordering and it was absolutely amazing definitely will be returning
Best chicken curry in Christchurch with affordable price.

restaurant: Table at Monks Coffee and Eatery

reviews.text: Yummy Egg Benedict for brunch! More of my food finds in IG: @ida_chch
Best cafe in Christchurch.

We found this place on our first morning in Christchurch and proceeded to come back the next three days because we loved it so much! Coffee was great especially the cold brew with vanilla cold foam and particularly loved the bagel with halloumi and pesto. Sad this place is not around the corner from home as I would be here every week!
Top tier, they got blankets, patio, good food, good prices, and free water
Amazing service delicious food just overall great atmosphere

Tried this place out on a whim a few nights ago and I was really glad I did! I ordered the Fried Chicken Donburi Rice Bowl. . .so delicious!. . .The meal was served nice and hot and the noodles were especially tasty. For dessert, they offered a delicious chocolate cake with ice cream. . .the service couldn't have been better. . .very attentive and offered with a smile. . .Needless to say, I will be going back!
Food and service were fantastic!
Continually impressed with the great food and service
Delicious combo — tender beef rendang, flavorful tonkotsu ramen, and perfectly juicy pork & chive dumplings.
Amazing service, lovely atmosphere and lots of yummy gluten free options. I'll be back.
I'm disappointed I spent almost $30 on salad and rice and wasn't given cutlery/chopsticks or a napkin with my takeaway order.
A lovely family friendly suburban restaurant with great service and delicious food!
Fabulous food & service
Walked in this evening with 5 kids and we all absolutely loved it! The service was awesome and the food was incredible.

My son has finished exam so I asked him to order anything he want. I ordered about $90 for two people. I liked this restaurant before but no more. Don't order beef spare lips. Really fatty. I complained about it but she said that it is suppliers problem. I paid but couldn't eat.
Great Cantonese dim sum! Authentic taste. Very traditional decoration as well! Love it!
Nice restaurant with yummy food. Very close to the airport. Staffs are friendly and helpful.

This plate of chow mein is absolutely fantastic! The noodles are wonderfully chewy and cooked perfectly. It's packed with ingredients—the vegetables are crisp, the meat is tender, and every strand of noodle is evenly coated in a savory sauce that is flavorful but not too salty. It has that fantastic "wok hei" (breath of the wok) that makes it incredibly satisfying to eat!

This restaurant's Cantonese cuisine is exemplary! Every dish we tried showcased the chef's meticulous control of heat and the inherent flavors of the ingredients. The signature open-oven roast duck boasts crispy skin, tender meat, and a juicy texture; the steamed sea fish is cooked to perfection and incredibly fresh. The dim sum is a must-try, with shrimp dumplings featuring paper-thin wrappers and a hearty, al dente filling. The elegant ambiance and attentive service make for a truly enjoyable dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking high-quality Cantonese cuisine.

Love this place! The food’s always amazing and never disappoints. The vibe is super chill and welcoming, and the staff are absolute legends, always friendly, smiling and on to it with the service. Always hits the spot! I’ve been here heaps of times and it’s consistently awesome. If you’re after good food, good vibes and good value, you can’t go wrong with Tanoshi. Definitely one of the best feeds in town!
Staff is very accommodating and friendly
The food was superbly crafted with a lot of love. Super tasty. Warm and friendly service as well. Definitely recommended.
Best Japanese ramen we had in a while! Highly recommend
Amazin food Trust the chef Just do it

If I could give more stars, I would! The most gracious and friendly hospitality from all staff the moment we walked in the door, to the moment we left. The food - absolutely everything was SENSATIONAL! We had a variety of food on the table ( the konkatsu was my personal favourite). Loved all the salads, the Ramen, the pancake and the takoyaki balls.
