The wonderful staff also surprised my son with singing Happy Birthday, and matcha tirimasu. This place is phenomenal  Thank you Tanoshi
Awesome spot for a pita, dont wait for an hour in line at souvlaki, walk two blocks and come here
Lovely food and the lady serving us was so sweet and pleasant,  I felt like the food was made with love. We ordered takeaway.
Very small portions
All good
Got Thai hot lamb chef special. Was Beautiful dish full of meat and vegetables and a great sauce with heat. Also got the Curry Puffs and they were also very good.
Thai food
Super kind service, and delicious food! Highly recommend, my go to Thai place !
My comfort takeaway food! Always feel welcomed when l order from them. Their food is exceptional.

Was so looking forward to getting x2 chicken green thai curry meals costing $20.50 each but sadly I would rate it 2/10 as it lacked taste and next to no filling as it was 85% of liquid & I wished I paid a few dollars more to go else where  It hard to support smaller businesses when they let you down and can't deliver on what they offer, that's why we all end up supporting bigger companies,  just saying to be honest!.
Lovely food  for birthday party  Lovely  pub to relax
Can be a bit crowded but the food is always amazing.
Finger lickin' good - bubba approves
Basic food, serviced with a smile in a place that feels really comfy. Thanks guys. We're regulars
Good solid pub meals
Tasted so bad i stopped eating it, just as well because it gave me the worst case of indigestion ever. Thai food is supposed to be light and beautiful, this was a degradation !!!

“ The Underdog “ I’ve tried pretty much all thai restaurants in chch and i’ve tried the authentic pad thai in few cities of Thailand as well. They got the best food among all, according to my taste buds lol

Ordered on Uber eats. was impressed with portion sizes but that's as good as it gets... spent $60 on green curry, phad Thai, and a roti. Phad Thai was extremely spicy for a medium which wouldn't usually bug me but I have severe indigestion so needed a maximum of medium. And it was literally just over cooked spicy mush and I gave up eating it not even a third of the way through. Roti was cold and stale- reminded me of stale pie pastry rather than the classic Thai roti I was craving... very disappointing. Green curry was okay ish,  but still disappointed again as I've often made a lot better myself. At the end of the day, I was wanting to treat myself and this just ended up being a disappointing waste of money. Wouldn't go here again.
Just had our first meal from here. Food was delicious. Will certainly be back. Went back,, one of the best take out meals I have had in a long time!

When this place opened I raved about it. It was amazing taste and size. We have had a few times now over the past 6months and less rice which would not even to 2 people. Tonight I had one spoonful and the green curry come with water I am sure,don't get me wrong it is like that but we got 6 bits of chicken, and vegs a little amount. Rest just bamboo, why??. Pad thai what a joke. I laced in the bin. Such a shame for a place that was amazing.
All the dishes I have tried  have been amazing.  Thank you for the yummy food
Favourite Thai in Christchurch and it’s not overpriced

I ordered a beef death by chilli's and was not spicy at all had nothing of the ingredients in it that was mentioned on the menu. I also got a prawn pad thai and was more of a seafood peanut satay pad thai, it was very peanutty the noodles weren't you're normal thick pad thai noodles they were very thin. The curry puffs were like curry mash wrapped in pastry. I asked for fresh sping rolls and was given fried spring rolls.  The service itself was okay communication barrier was a little difficult as we both struggled to understand each other but having the menu infront to be able to point at what I wanted was helpful. It seemed like a very busy place as when I was being served the person serving me had to keep going away to had out orders or answers the phone.  The place was clean tidy doesn't look like much foot traction comes through but if there were to be people dine in they would probably want to play somthing other than infomercials.  Don't be fooled by the pictures as the look of the pictures definitely does not match the taste of the food. It's not a place I'll be going back to especially if I'm going to be spending over $80 I expect the quality and taste to be some what decent.

The Terrace Tavern need to think about the help they hire out the front. Last night my glasses and my phone were broken by a bouncer. I was dragged out of the crowd after the bouncer saw me in a choke hold, and told me I was the problem. I wasn't allowed to attempt to look for my glasses and there was absolutely no convincing any member of staff to help.  Overall very rude service, with a bad atmosphere to go with it. For my own safety I will be staying far away from Terrace Tavern.

We stopped here for lunch and I orDered the Pastrami sandwich and a glass of Sauvignon blanc. My husband ordered the oysters and they were not tasty. My sandwich was great. Menu had some great items and they have free Wi-Fi

Passed through for a late morning meal and was happy to see they were still offering their breakfast menu.  I ordered the Eggs Benedict and was impressed with the entire plate.  It wasn't traditional per se given it wasn't served with an English muffin or ham but their choice of bread or grain worked paired well with the salmon.  Our server was great and attentive.  The location is only a few blocks away from the touristy hustle and bustle, and really close to the local street tram stop, so it was very convenient.
Everyone looks under 25 and hungover No service Staff sit at the bar after work Will not SURVIVE  Very very poor

Great spot to have a beer. Food looked nice but only had a beer this time. Tried the Ginger Tom beer and it was a nice alcoholic ginger beer. Nice seating watching the trams and people walk pass. Would come back :)

We ate here twice during our stay in CHC. Amazing staff! Amazing starter and mains. The green lip mussels are to die for. The lamb rump also to die for. Prices are extremely reasonable. We paid double for green lip mussels another night in Queensland. We are happy we found Terrace Tavern in CHC!

I wanted to eat somewhere this afternoon near a park and with an opportunity to enjoy the sunshine. I was not disappointed at Terrace Tavern. Menu has many options and they were serving brunch until 3 PM on Sunday. I opted for sharing the corn and and crab soup with my aunt, and having the grilled cauliflower with halpumi, couscous and arugula salad. I was very impressed by the number of vegetarian options at this Gastro pub like spot. Most of the patrons were seated near the door or outside. Many were enjoying beers and snacks that afternoon. I was also super happy that the food was not overly salted. In fact I could've used a little bit more but was glad for them to err on the side of less. Service was friendly and helpful; the only drawback was that I asked for my bill three times before it came.
Most of the menu can be made vegan
Best Thai I have ever had. Staff were amazing with allergies and over all amazing. Highly recommend 10/10
Got a takeaway (so can't comment on service/atmosphere) but was disappointed - bland flavours, no option for spice, chicken was almost raw.

We had a table of 10 all but 1 person got there meals in a semi timely manner, we asked 3 times where the other meal was to be told its coming right out. While they continued to take at least 15 other meals to the table beside us. So very disappointing as this was for my mums 75th birthday,  after having very stern words they finally bought out the meal most of us had almost finished our meals,  I had to suggest they didn't charge for the meal! They still charged full corkage to the table which i thought would of been a no brainer to compensate for ruining mums dinner.  10 people with a very bad experience so wouldn't recommend this place!
Friendly and fast service  super tasty food and good sized servings, highly recommend.
Not worth the price for takeaway fare unfortunately! The wife loves it though, just not really enough flavor for my taste.

UPDATE Visited again in August with a large group booking. Service and staff interaction was excellent. Food was top quality in presentation and taste and delivered exactly as requested for the event format. I totally recommend having a birthday event at Thai Box as they have a great layout and seating to handle the numbers!  Great taste and value for money. Recommend paying a visit for Quality Thai food
To my delight, each dish had a distinct flavor, and the desserts and accompanying wines (drinks) were also delicious, soothing my Asian stomach after a long intercontinental flight.
Used to be very good but the dishes itself slowly become more budget
curry is watery
Loved it here!
It’s the best Tom yam soup I’ve had in Chch, all food is good with a acceptable price, in a large beautiful place , definitely will come back again

Thai Chef’s Restaurant truly delivers an authentic Thai dining experience — every dish is bursting with flavor, perfectly balanced, and beautifully presented. The ingredients taste incredibly fresh, and the attention to detail in every plate shows real passion from the kitchen.  The staff are warm, especially Nattakorn, attentive, and genuinely make you feel welcome, which adds to the cozy and inviting atmosphere. Whether you’re a fan of classic Thai dishes or want to try something new, this place never disappoints.  Highly recommended for anyone looking for real Thai flavors with top-notch service. I’ll definitely be coming back again.

We got in town late after a long journey. We were all tired and famine, therefore walked in the first restaurant in sight. And here we were! The restaurant looked very fancy, cozy and the manager at the front was friendly. The waitress was confused about our orders, but the manager straightened it out. As a person in our group summed up the dining experience perfectly: "expensive for what we got, but we fed our tummies."

Great decor and service as well as food. The food was pretty authentic. The only downside was that it was a bit pricey, but if you go on a deal day such as Mon or Tues between 5 and 7pm you can get two dishes for the price of one.
Ace friendly service, fabulous food
Fresh, fast and flavoursome. A big feed for under $20

I had a very disappointing experience at The Thai Container today. The staff member at the front counter, possibly named Jade or Jane, was extremely rude and dismissive. I have arrived to the front of the food truck and requested a delivery order and she went to the bag to pick this order to bring it to me. While another colleague was already serving a customer who was ready to leave, she came back with my order and  interrupted them to engage in a personal conversation, even though the customer was already served. This meant that I was left waiting, even though she was not busy with another customer. When I tried to get her attention she’s just turned her back to me and pretend that she was doing something in the computer so I insist  politely multiple times (five or six times), she continued to ignore me and refused to provide the manager’s name or assist further, stating that the manager wouldn’t be available until Sunday. This behavior is unacceptable and reflects poorly on customer service standards. No one should be treated this way, and it truly ruined my day.

We order from Thai Container very often, and the food is always delicious! They’re super efficient and always get our special requests right, and make it exactly how we like it. The food is usually ready in 10–15 minutes when we call ahead for pickup. Great service and tasty food every time!
Incredibly delicious food, decent portions and friendly service. I very much enjoyed it during my stay. If only I didn’t live on the other side of the world, I’d be a regular :) Love from Belgium

First time visiting New Zealand -and walked a few blocks to get this in the cold.  No line and about a 10 minutes or less wait for the food.  The place is like a food truck with picnic tables to sit, which is probably used more during the day and not at night because it is freezing at night.  The chicken pad Thai was so good!   So glad that I decided to venture out to get take out.
Delicious meals and good price! We ordered Panang Curry and Pad See Ew noodles. No complaints about either one. Would definitely return again.

Stopped in Christchurch for a couple of days before my return flight back to the states and was told to check Thai Container out. Had the veggie spring rolls and Panang Curry and it did not disappoint! The spring rolls were really fresh and I loved the basil they added in. The Panang was sweet and creamy just as it should be. Service was quick and I had my food within minutes. If I am ever in Christchurch I will plan on stopping here again!
I'm so in love with this place ..it's maybe because of my passion for Thai but anyway as a takeaway it's on a high level and it od necessary at least to taste once

A pretty popular takeaway place but food is far from authentic Thai. To be fair, being 1/3 Thai, I might have too high expectations when it comes to Thai food. The phad tai were pretty bland in taste and nothing like the dish. Tom yum ghong soup lacked the authenticity and was just overly tasty with msg. Satay chicken skewers, though not exactly Thai, was surprisingly good. The Larb salad was OK but to be fair its a pretty process nased salad to get right. Overall the experience of buying from a container kitchen outweighs the actual food.
Great curries, the fresh spring rolls are good too, affordable. Just a shame the seating is outdoors in winter!
Good Thai food at the container mall. Had the Tom yum and egg noodles. Excellent flavor and quality. Yum!

It was just okay... The veggie stir fry wasn't bad, the tofu sweet & sour needs help! It's like cooked tofu with sauce that was frozen mixed into it! I'm sorry don't leave your spring rolls sitting on counter not refrigerated and try and sell them to me.... Ugh!!!

The meal we had last night was some of the very best Thai food I've ever had. The lamb in the masa man curry was so tender and delicious- I highly recommend this dish! Pad Thai also perfect - not too sweet just like I like it. 4 of us had 4 dishes which came to under $60. We all felt this was great value for the amount of food and the high quality of it. Thanks for a wonderful meal!

This place gets five stars not because it is the best Thai food in the world (it is good but not great) or because of service (it is basically a stationary food truck so how good can the service be?) or because of the beauty of the location (it is on a fairly busy street in what can only be described as the "motel district" of Christchurch). No, the 5 stars are for a combination of price/value efficiency and intangibles. There is something about Thai container that is really appealing. I went there three times in almost as many days and thought about going even more. The food is good. They thought I had an Australian accent, which is hilarious (I am an american) and like all Thai restaurants in the world, as far as I can tell, they seemed worried about me trying anything too spicy. The spicy noodles are not that spicy, but hey are good, as was everything else I tried.
Another wonderfully delicious meal tonight to celebrate my birthday. We all enjoyed our dishes and took some home with us, they are very generous portions. Simply Devine
Love love love this place have been 20+times and have never had a meal that wasn't perfect.
Great food fast service what more can ya ask for definitely be back
Have eaten here twice lately and both times the food was delicious. Very friendly team and reasonably priced
Great customer service and care . Thank you for a great night.
With a group and service was welcoming and efficient with drinks served as requested and meal orders taken and delivered in a prompt manner. The staff were very efficient aand attentive to our needs

It was ok,the staff were rushed off there feet and didn't seem to be prepared for our party of 20 .( yes booked well in advance, you think they would of had more than 2 staff on ) plus taking care of the bar orders and what ever else came along during the evening. The food left alot to be desired.. I had lamb shank in what appeared to be a bowl of soup...the lamb shank  had no real flavor and the soup very watery.. A friend across from my had the salmon..and albit ,was  very well portioned again lacked any flavor at all and was quite disappointed.. The person next to my right had the Duck and seemed to be the only one i spoke to that enjoyed his meal.. Another person at the table had to leave because of a food allergy.. She told them ..( gave them specific instructions which were ignored) .. Which resultsed in a reaction. So all in all.. The evening was pleasant..but not fantastic!
Fantastic restaurant, we have been coming here once a month for the last 2 - 3 years. Delicious food, wonderful service - definitely our favourite spot to dine!
The portion size is typical for a large New Zealand meal. The taste is good. It's a decent Western option, offering another choice.

The food with live music was a 10 out of 10! The atmosphere, the food, the owner, and all the staff were incredibly friendly, welcoming, and attentive. Our last night in New Zealand was even more special.
Everything is 10/10!
We loved the food here! Super yummy food and the service was fantastic! Thanks to Nan and Kristina for looking after us, you did a great job!
I had a great green vegetable curry here tonight. The staff were really helpful and great service for my food requirements. Decor and presentation of the dining area is great.
Very good service; I wish I would have ordered a spicier dish. It was a busy place but  we received our meals very timely.
Amazing food and service!!! I highly recommend it if you're craving for good Thai food!!

We needed a vegan meal on a Monday night (many restaurants closed!) during Lunar New Year (Chinese restaurants closed!) in Christchurch. Thai Orchid to the rescue! Although not a vegan place by any means, the staff listened very attentively to our dietary restrictions, confirmed clearly that they understood, and then delivered an absolutely delightful meal.

ABSOLUTELY THE BEST THAI FOOD EVER!!!  Okay...In full transparency, I have never been to Thailand. However, I have had a lot of Thai food all over the United States and nothing has even come close to my experience at Thai Orchid! I normally order either Pad Thai or Geen Curry, but the owner had a few other suggestions. We took his advice. My husband and I split the #9 Goong Tod, # 31 Pad Phed and #41 Ped Thai Orchid. The #31 was so delicious that we decided to go back on Christmas Day! That night I ordered the #31 AGAIN and my husband ordered the Pad Kee Mao (not sure of the number). The food is authentic, fresh and full of flavor!!! I don't think you could go wrong with anything on the menu. Bonus...The service is FABULOUS! The owner is amazing and all of the servers are great!!! I would make a trip to Christchurch next time we are on the South Island just to visit Thai Orchid. I cannot recommend highly enough!!!

What a find! Crispy duck, spring rolls were fantastic. Even though they were not very busy, I would say the service was terrific with very helpful suggestions for our dinner. If we weren't leaving NZ in two days we'd definitely go back...next trip for sure.

Excellent food and I really appreciated the great service too. Very friendly staff, and the manager went out of her way to show us her hiking (tramping) photos since we told her we were going hiking. We had the pad Thai (#44) and #23 curry, which I can't pronounce well. Hoping to visit again.
Amazing steamed salmon special! Super tender and flavorful. The red curry was delicious too. FYI the orchid salad consists of 90% fried chicken and shrimp and only 10% salad.

We came to Christchurch for the post Christmas week and unfortunately most restaurants were closed on Dec 26, Boxing Day. However, this unfortunate event turned out to be a blessing - That Orchid was open tonight and we got really lucky!  Although the ambience is modest and nothing much to write home about, the service and food is everything one could desire for.  We ordered Pad Thai; Massaman curry, chicken wings and fried banana with ice cream.  Every dish was fragrant, well cooked and delicious, the surprise was definitely the dessert. Would definitely advice everyone to save room for dessert :)

I was travelling through Christchurch and saw this restaurant had good reviews so we decided to try it. We intended to do take out but the charismatic owner convinced us to dine in. Thankfully we did, the decor was gorgeous, the service was absolutely amazing and we felt very well taken care of. The owner had many suggestions for food, we ended up going with the Fish Cakes, Fried Rice, and Pad Se-Ew. The fish cakes were okay, a little bit on the greasy side but everything else was fantastic! The owner insisted on the fried rice being cooked in a special way using green curry to give it an extra "kick" and it was a great suggestion. The pad se-ew noodles were delicious with a generous portion of tender beef slices. I would highly recommend trying this restaurant and if I'm back in Christchurch I will definitely be coming back here!
For Malaysian I think the food is okay okay Tom yam soup more like ready-made(diluted) Food is less spicy

I am on travel from the U.S and I have been here several times now.  The staff are courteous and provide great service.   The food is amazing and I have not had a bad meal here.  Their prices are reasonable as well for the food portions. A plus is that they are vegan/vegetarian friendly!  That is hard to find out here.  I will definitely be coming back more often and recommend for others.
Friendly service. Nice ambience. The food was very tasty! Definitely try this place out.

We happened upon this place just before closing time, but they welcomed us in and never made us feel rushed. The food was wonderful - especially the Gaeng Kari curry and the crispy duck! Really warm, nice people and delicious food - what a great find in Christchurch!

Important - this restaurant has been around for years but this summer it was bought by Jules and Jum. Since then, most of their ratings have been outstanding but they are still averaged in with the poor ratings from the previous owner.  We recently spent 14 days in New Zealand and Fiji and found most of the restaurants we ate at to be unremarkable..until we accidentally found the Thai Orchard.  Jules greeted us at the door as if he knew us and started tutoring us on selecting a Thai beer.  His partner Jum came right to the table to offer her selections on their best dishes. Believe me, she didn't steer us wrong.  It was by far, the best meal we hAd in all of New Zealand. The desserts were out of this world. But what made this place so fantastic was the staff, especially the owners. I noticed a previous comment about the decor...like I said, Jum and Jules are new owners and have great plans for the place. In the next few months they are updating the decor, fixing up the outdoor patio and adding the Crazy Horse Bar upstairs. Give the place a chance, I promise you will love it.  If you are one of those that tried it under the old owner, give Jum and Jules a chance to win you over.

Excellent food and excellent service.  Jummi is the owner and very friendly and welcoming.  We had actually gone to a different Thai restaurant first and we treated so poorly (and their menu was Thai fusion at best) that we left without ordering.  Thai Orchid was wonderful.  Soup, chicken satay and yellow chicken curry were all delicious.

This is a hotspot for the post-work wine drinking crew. When I arrived for dinner, I had to claw my way through the extremely space-limited bar area to get to the dining room. I was disappointed though to see that the wine list is limited and not high quality. The decor and the dining room is very dated and could use some updating, but that has no bearing on the food quality. I had the spring rolls, which were fantastic and fried to perfection. The sweet and sour sauce was no slouch either. I had the Pad Thai for dinner and it is a huge portion! I could not finish the whole plate, but Lord knows I tried. The Pad Thai tastes pretty authentic and has good flavor. i was missing a little "green" though, and would have like some spring onions or something garnished on top. Overall, if you're staying nearby and need a quick, tasty Thai meal, this is a great spot to check out.

Good food, shonky decor! We dined here when extended family came to town. We shared 8 dishes including three different curries, larb, beef and mushroom, and a tofu dish. All were very tasty and at least moderately authentic. I especially enjoyed the red curry. The decor however, left a fair bit to be desired. For one, we found ourselves looking into a laundry area (possibly the owner's home?) whilst dining. Also, the table  was very unstable and on closer inspection was actually a larger piece of wood attached to a small table underneath! Wait-staff were very casual but perfectly friendly and overall it was a nice evening out!
Our large group enjoyed superb service and each of us was impressed with the dishes we chose. Each was beautifully presented and tasted delicious.
Absolutely beautiful food and great service!
Delicious
The best Thai in Christchurch! Our go to for takeaways, staff always so lovely, food is made quickly and always tastes 10/10. Highly recommend!

This wee Thai restaurant was fabulous!!. Intimate atmosphere with welcoming and attentive staff. Food was delicious, and hot, so obviously prepared to order rather than stood under heating lamps in bulk like some places do. Very clean and well maintained. Will definitely be back.
great food and lovely staff

First time dining at Thai Rendezvous for lunch. We were greeted by the friendly team and given a table quickly. Delicious authentic food and enhanced by fresh vegetables.  Highly recommend to anyone looking to dine in or takeaway - excellent parking is a bonus!

Had lunch at Thai Rendezvous and it did not disappoint! I ordered their Nam Tok–based salad and it was absolutely outstanding. The grilled meat was tender and smoky, with just the right amount of spice and tang from the lime and chili. Fresh herbs and crunchy veggies balanced it beautifully — every bite was refreshing yet bold in flavor.  The menu has plenty of tempting options (curries, noodles, and some great lunch specials), but if you’re after something light, vibrant, and packed with authentic Thai flavor, the Nam Tok salad is a must-try. Definitely one of the best Thai spots I’ve been to in Christchurch!

We arrived a little after 6:00 on a Friday and didn't have to wait, but it was jam packed half an hour later. We just told them3 people and sat down and they brought us food. Salad, rice with chicken & lamb kebab and butter chicken (drumsticks) all incredibly delicious. Mostly Afghan clientele but everyone was warm and friendly, chef called all the men "brother." Served ourselves water and bussed our own table and we happily anticipate our returning here.

Wow what a great restaurant.   I called them to ask if they had Afghan specialties such as Aushak or Mantu.   Someone answered the phone, I asked my question and he answered me in a heavily thick Afghan accent yes we are open and hung up.   I found that funny.    My hotel check in clerk recommended this restaurant to me and said it was delicious.    I got to the restaurant and it was jammed packed.   I was looking at the menu on the wall and someone waiting for carry out said to me "you have to ask the cook what he has tonight".    The menu is never updated.  There is only the cook and a cashier/assistant working in the restaurant.  So I approached the cook who was working furiously in an open kitchen in the same area as the dine in tables, carry out waiting area and cashier.    There were about 20 people sitting at communal tables and when a dish was ready for the seated guests the cook would just hand the dish to the nearest customer waiting for carry out or to pay at the cash register and asked them to take to "that table". He was working furiously and had not yet noticed me standing in front of him.  He was doing about six carry out containers at once with rice, one chicken kebab and one ground meat kebab with a side of salad.    He looked up and started giving people their carry out orders and each was 20 NZ dollars or about 14.50 US (per person).  All the time smiling and greeting everyone with hellos and goodbyes unless you were Muslim then it was assalamualaikum (peace be unto you).   I told him I will have that same dish and he assembled it on the spot and added another container and said this is free.  I was hoping that was Afghan bread.   I paid my 20 dollars and left.   The food was some of the best Afghan food I have ever had.   I lived in Afghanistan for awhile and have eaten Afghan food in many other countries.  The ground meat kebab was lamb, it was moist and had all the right spices, superb!  The chicken kebab was marinated in a red yogurt spice which resembled red Tika but tasted better.    The rice was divine and the extra container was a butter style curry chicken with two chicken legs that was spicy hot.    It was the best butter chicken I have ever had.   I had no room for the salad so it went uneaten.  If I go back to NZ I will make a side trip just to eat here. All portions were huge.

: Every single dish absolutely blew us away. The price point is there for a reason, and I'd gladly pay double. The flavours worked so harmoniously with each other, complimented with wonderful cocktails as well.  : What a phenomenal experience with such high end service. We were so looked after, even with how incredibly busy it was.  Follow Foodie Mama NZ on Instagram for more reviews
Awesome food, & the flaming cheese was incredible. Excellent service also.
Great atmosphere with great food well worth having a meal here.

We dined here for my birthday, group of 7 and the staff were very professional and friendly. The food is 5 star, definitely up in the top few restaurants in Christchurch, and cocktails are amazing as well. Free glass of bubbles for my birthday too which was sweet. Highly recommend!
This is one of the best original greek restaurant outside of Europe we have ever joined. Great delicious dishes, good wine selection and friendly service. We felt very welcome.

restaurant: The Avonhead Tavern and One Good Horse Restaurant

reviews.text: If you book a band, you need to pay them on time I question the Manager of this venue as he has misled the payment structure to suit himself. A band is booked, yet told payment be days later which has not happened. Terrible business. Still waiting for payment.
This is our local favourite pub to go to. Cheapest beer in town and amazing service. Has a lovely outdoor area too.
Great meal good service plenty of space to relax for a meal
Great place to meet up with friend and work colleges. Service is always really good.
Louie gave me the best servicing best pint of panhead pay rise for Louie

Bouncer gave me the creeps. Kicked me and my friend out for apparently no reason, just told us "time to leave"! And the way he grabbed me as we were escorted out was aggressive and made me uncomfortable.. not too keen on going back

We were moved here as the restaurant didn’t have tables. Gorgeous place polite staff - same menu.  It was empty so the atmosphere was going to be important. When I plucked up the courage to ask if we were going to have to listen to country music all dinner- yes was the polite apologetic response…. So gorgeous polo bar theme, fancy cocktails and expensive food and music that was so off brand it killed the atmosphere.

Dispointing to say the least been here many times but this night was differnt,  when your sitting at a table and the bar staff put a reserved sign on it and say its now booked in 10 minutes is just rude. Won't go back in a hurry.

Had a private function here a couple weeks ago and the staff were amazing. Have absolutely no complaints and highly recommend this venue for anyone looking for a place to go on a night out. Jay and Tom were 10/10 for service and amazing

Would not recommend this place to anyone! We were told to “fix our face and come back” when we had dinner and one drink prior to coming. Definitely a racist remark from the security guard of African descent!!!!!
Had my daughters 21st in the function room. I would definitely recommend this venue. Great food and the team were very accommodating. Can take your own cake and the minimum spend wasn’t too high

Enjoyed our weekend dinner there!  Service was very efficient and friendly.  The food prices were fair and it was a very nice jovial atmosphere.  Clearly this is a place where friends and families meet up for a shared meal!  We enjoyed ourselves immensely.  The mushroom halloumi burger was on my mind for days!

We won't be back after a disappointing meal the tacos were so bland nothing more than some coleslaw that had no taste, lamb that needed salt and flavor and what looked like tinned tomatoes it was horrible. The staff member wasn't really interested in my complaint but was still happy to charge for food that wasn't really even touched because it was horrible. The place could do with a good clean and personally im not really into staff that are more interested in being on their phones than working and serving customers. The food is nothing more than overpriced food that you could make at home but 10 times better we ended leaving and going elsewhere.

We were recommended by a load of people to the The Bealey when asking about going to a pub.  We had a really lovely experience, with classic pub food - opting for burgers as there was a Tuesday $20 special on.  Recommend asking to sit out on the deck in the restaurant for this coming summer, there was decent cover and the last of the days sun sent the beers down easy.  The fry on the fish, chicken and chips for the burgers was actually perfect, and made for a pretty great dinner. Chef could be a smidgen heavier on the seasoning, and would love to see citrus with the fish burger to make this a truly classic pub fish dish.  We'll absolutely be back to try some more meals, as they have a lot of amazing Glutenfree choices too.

Stayed here for our annual conference and had the restaurant food for 3 days (breakfast, morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea). Service was great but the food was ok and the selection is limited in my opinion. The $15 lunch deal is very reasonable though and the portion was good size. We were also unfortunate that the coffee machine has ran out of coffee beans  which were not delivered until the next day.

They need to change their wording on their website for Quiz Nights, it says under Quiz Night info "Book a Table" so we did, then when we turned up they told us they don't take bookings for Quiz and that we were seated in the restaurant where we couldn't see any screens and all tables in the suitable area were taken, very disappointed.
Excellent option for economical Halal food
Very fast and very good service
Honestly amazing I always get it on deliver easy and is so favorable always 10/10
Very average
Awesome food!! Had lunch there with friend. We like the food there
Food was absolutely amazing  we got kebabs and will definitely go back
The meat on fries  was yummy, garlicky and with a little spice. Gets quite busy especially at lunchtime, hard to find a seat.
Very good service and patient helpful people as we had young ones. Great kids menu option. Good wine selection from Central Otago - like that. Nice beers. Suggest a no alcohol cider is added.
As always - a great evening for a birthday celebration.  Thank you and see you again.  Lamb is AMAZING!
Lord of fun for Halloween
Delicious fron breakfast, lunch and dinner rhe birdwood is a hidden gem of the chirstchurch gastronomy scene.
First time here. Loved everything. Had smoked salmon eggs bennie. Perfect. Will be back to check out an evening meal in future. Many thanks for great birthday breakfast

Four of us just had a great meal here.   All the dishes were good and were generous sizes.  The seafood pasta was ordered by two of us and we could have easily shared one.  There was so much seafood in it.  Really tasty.  One had a pizza that had a ton of meat on it and the other had the lamb gnocci which was also tasty.  We all enjoyed our meal.  Prices were reasonable. We would go again for sure.

Very disappointing experience trying to have a Sunday lunch The bar manager was so rude This young lady really should not be in the hospitality industry Canceled our meals after being humiliated by her in front of other customers (we were struggling to find something on the menu they had available) According to a local who overheard this is how she speaks to customers She then refused to give me a full refund It cost me $12 to order food they didn't have I do not recommend
Great local pub. Went with a group.
A great place to wind down after a long day at work. Staff are freaking cool and the food..... the food is   great.

Ordered the Carbonara Penne Pasta from The Black Horse Restaurant via Uber Eats — it was absolutely delicious and tasted incredibly fresh! Loved the personalised note, such a thoughtful extra gesture. Really happy with my order and definitely recommend everyone to try it!
What a great day with the Celtic social club at the Horse. excellent food and hospitality. bravo !

3 of us had the new butter milk spicy chicken burger. OMG, it was excellent. Not super spicy but enough to make you take notice. Curry mayo was a great touch. Definitely did not skimp on the chicken. It was a big meal, plus chips. That was one of the best chicken burgers I have ever had. Cudos to whoever came up with that combo. Perfect

Food reasonably priced. Steak cooked as requested, nice gravy, salad fine, good quantity- not bad for $25.  Plenty of staff on yet not much customer service happening - tone set by the manager who did best efforts not to acknowledge us when we walked in. If you don't want customers not engaged in a function, close your venue to the general public. We just wanted dinner and a drink and were done well before.
Great service the beef pot pie had 2 pieces of Beef. Maybe it should be a gravy pie
Great bar at anytime.
We went at Lunchtime, staff were very friendly and helpful, beer was great also.
Live music, cocktails and beers. Good food choices, happy hour prices and excellent service.
I popped in from Google review(we are traveller's from Auckland) Butter chicken was so good and reasonable! (We shared for 1 serve was very enough) I wish the restaurant was in Auckland!
We regularly order takeaways & have also eaten in. Their food is excellent, quick service, very reasonably priced & nice people.
Very delicious butter chicken
Thank you to the girl at front she looked after us very well. Thank you chef for cooking for us without onion glarlic at last moment. Thank you so much Hare Krishna
Excellent food, superb price, highly recommend.
Its a pity that the service is poor

Saw a stand-up comic called WOMB perform at The Bower yesterday. What an unexpected treat. His cerebral brand of comedy sometimes went over the head of the audience. But at times he had them eating out of hand like love struck puppies. And that mic drop joke to end on ... ... simply wow. Big future!
Amazing food and service. Very friendly staff!

restaurant: The Brewers Christchurch Bar Pub & Restaurant

reviews.text: Ticks all the boxes!
The Brewers has Greer food and service Especially when Rosie works Harry’s not bad either
We enjoyed a delicious  meal,  prompt friendly service, good price, and good atmosphere. I highly recommend  The Brewers pub Christchurch for a drink or a meal
Kitchen was closed 2 hours prior to restaurant's listed closing time. Bartender seemed nice about it, but still a shame.
Amazing team here especially Rosie! The food is delicious and drinks are great too and all super fairly priced!
Great place, staff are cool, food damn good, love the pool table

HORRIBLE!! I went with my wife and young son, staff immediately became very rude and homophobic towards us. Sat down and ordered the "leccapiedi per figa" and it came out disgusting and I'm positive that I got food poisoning, will not be returning to this place.
Has to be the coolest place for a Friday afternoon beer.   Just when you thought you should leave... They bring snacks... Time for another   Nice polite and smiling  bartenders

So impressed with this place! We are visiting tourists that tried the croissant sandwich and sweet muffin. Both were so unique in their ingredients combination and both were delicious! We got black tea and coffee- both were great. This is a must visit place.

Excellent flat white coffee and delicious breakfast! We stumbled upon this place at night while walking around and made a note to go back the next day. The line was a little long but well worth the wait. We sat outside and enjoyed our morning and even ordered another cup of coffee to go. I would definitely recommend.

This place was so tasty! They made a great flat white coffee, but the avocado toast was amazing! It is a little higher priced, but totally worth it. It was more of an undone type of avocado toast with seasonings, poached eggs, tomatoes, and some sort of tangy butter or aioli, I'm not sure. It was just so pleasing to the eye and tasty! I did have much more avocado left, so I wished it had a bit more bread but it was still a good amount of food. I would recommend, it seemed to be a busy place with a few tables inside and some outside seating. Also a great spot on regent street next to other shops.
Great coffee and food for breakfast. There were 8 of us and the restaurant managed our order well. The outdoor setting is very nice right at the square with the trolley line nearby.

Didn't think I would be writing a raving review about a breakfast place, but this place definitely needs a mention. Just around the corner from the Rendezvous Hotel, I decided to give it a shot over the same tired breakfast buffet at the hotel.  The flat white coffee was awesome, but guess that was to be expected. What did surprise me though was their Chili Scramble -- scrambled eggs with red chilies, shallots and Parmesan shavings on country sourdough bread. The shallots were crisp, the chillies fiery and the eggs just right.
The hot dark chocolate is a must have for any dark chocolate fans out there. It's an actual 70% dark bar of Peruvian chocolate dipped into the milk, the taste is just surreal !

This is a cute little corner coffee shop that has a variety of yummy breakfast choices from eggs and toasts to breakfast sandwiches and other breakfast goodies for a sweet tooth. Everything looks and tastes fresh! The service was good too. It is a quite small little coffee shop with a few tables inside but they do have outside seating for a nice day.
Very delicious breakfast-smoothie, muffin, eggs on toast, and acai bowl were all  great. The coffee is excellent too.

I can't think of a better coffee joint to inhabit adorable New Regent Street than the Caffeine Laboratory. This is a great, small cafe that specializes in all things coffee, but also pumps out some pretty amazing cafe dishes as well. I'm pointing at you, Bacon and Egg Brioche. I had a hard time choosing what I wanted to pair with my flat white because their menu items sound just as appetizing as their case items look. The menu is small, which helps you make the decision quickly, but I can promise that no matter what you order, you won't be disappointed. Seating is limited so I wouldn't bring a group of friends (5 tables) but it's great for a coffee date or for takeaway.

I'm glad we found this hidden gem. You walk up the stairs and this spacious and stylish restaurant awaits. We had the pork belly, seafood paella and lamb rack. Very impressed with all three. Especially the lamb rack which was perfectly cooked. For a dessert we shared the white chocolate mousse and this velvety goodness just melted in your mouth. This place is a must visit. We will definitely be back.

Dumplings are huge but super salty, especially the pork and chive one. Prawn toast is also very very salty. Pork and prawn noodle soup taste ok but the noodle is not what you’d expect for this particular dish, and we ordered take away but the soup wasn’t separated from the noodle as most restaurants would usually do, so as a result there wasn’t much soup left by the time we got home as noodles were soaked in it.
Very expensive takeaways and eat in options, mains were full of vegetables, hot and spicy chicken was flavourless, no salt and barely any spice.
Very very expensive takeaway

Excellent food, large variety of flavours that will suit anyone looking for a beautifully executed meal, great friendly service. Really quick food . Every aspect is good and clean! From bathrooms to kitchen. Friendly, attentive and happy staff. Highly recommended.
I’ve come here for dine in and takeaway over the past few years and food is always consistently good and good value for money
Food is great and staff are lovely! Great value for money and the food is always fresh and tasty.
Good food at a good price. Service was quick and staff were friendly. Highly recommend.

Came to Christchurch for a holiday and saw this restaurant and had to give it a try. It did not disappoint. The sweet and sour pork is tender and delicious, and their fried rice was amazing. Would come back again if I ever come back to Christchurch.
Good meal at good prices. Service with a smile and they happily accommodated my toddler and 7 month old.
Would  go again  bit noisy last time

Wow! Walking in to this stunning pub, really next level decor! Pulled Brisket Pizza   best pizza ever! Large or small options (we had large between two and still took two pieces away with us.)  Great service and a good buzzy atmosphere at lunchtime Will be back. Thank you
Really nice place. $16 Pints of beer. Really??
Very Nice and simple meals. Especialy the Fish and chips. I will be back for sure.
Great atmosphere,beers ok
Cool, cooler, The Church Brew Pub
Great atmosphere for the young   and for the young at
Very friendly staff, amazing food and decent selection of beers on tap.
Great thanks gigi
Had a nice evening, nice food and staff were lovely.

Went to first table and was very let down… Enjoyed the food but was extremely disappointed at the end. The price ended up being 90 dollars for 2 starters and 2 mains (that was meant to be half priced). Didn’t specify the rules clear at all after the owner stated that they did when we came back to ask about the price. The drink that “we forgot to order” which wasn’t clarified ended up making us pay full price for the meals won’t be going back after the service was terrible and couldn’t find a solution.
Always a great evening at Craft Embassy!
Great ra ge of beers. You can get to taste first, if you like
Good ribs an beer.
Great beer, staff and food. Unfortunately I couldn't eat all the steak, I was full. Far better than leaving feeling hungry.
Everything was good, the service was great. Really nice staff, especially the bartender, she was outstanding!
Great place for a beer and in particular a Hazy IPA
Breakfast was amazing  full Irish breakfast like home in Ireland me and my mates really enjoy this pub, definitely go there !

Karaok, it used to be great , now they kick people out for drinking water. The security guards are on a huge power trip. Shoving people for no reason. Never showing up again. They also  never do first in first serve for Karaoke I got In early to put my name up first and had to wait over 2 hours to be called up
Nice place, ultra rude lady working. Everyone else was alg, she wasnt
PK served us, He was amazing he accommodated all our needs, We played some Pool and drink some beers

Went to the toilet, white blonde female behind the bar tried telling me I spent 10-15 mins in the toilet as to why they took me and my partners 2 drinks away, spent 4 mins in the toilet as per timer. Tried charging me for another two drinks when I came to find mine gone, said they had performed two floor sweeps in the time I made a 4 minute phone call and defecation session. Not the first time I’ve found this decrepit place scrounging for any dollar they can. Might as well drink at the Sandridge, friendlier staff, better quality toilets, and they won’t steal your more than well paid for drinks! White blonde females practices should be reviewed. Nothing like the staff that upheld the Craics good name years ago. Won’t ever return, no matter how late it’s open.

Went here yesterday to take friends for cocktails only to find out from Mexicanos next door the Dirtyland is closed on Sundays and Mondays now.  This is not featured when you google their bar, it is not until you go into the website this information comes up.  My friends and I were terribly disappointed as I had built our afternoon of cocktails, nibbles and chat up to such an extent.  I wish the Dirtyland would make it very obvious that they are closed on Sundays and Mondays as I love this place and its such a drag to go and its closed.  Mexicanos was good but the cocktails not nearly as good as DL.  Tacos fab as usual though.  Thanks Fizz and besties
Great service by knowledgeable staff. Excellent co tails and choice of red wines to choose from.
Great food, fantastic drinks and excellent service! highly recommend
Was really quiet when we were there, service was great and food was good .

Food was brilliant, cocktails were brilliant, service was brilliant, the quality of the water however, is up for debate, I would recommend that perhaps a water filter could fix this issue, all in all an 8.5/10 night, thank you
Went to Dirty Land for Millie’s Birthday. We had the best time, amazing service and the yummiest cocktails.
Lovely bar, great cocktails. We had small tortillas with the drinks… it was very very tasty Special mention to Belen, the lovely bartender
The food was absolutely delicious,  and the service impeccable.  Will definitely be back!
Girls night out. Food was amazing. Beef wonton,chicken noodles and the beef were all amazing. Beef so tender and the flavours were so good. Definitely be back
Great meal. Terrific service. Totally recommend
Dish has a great atmosphere, tasty dishes and attentive service. Would rate it in the upper ranges of good Christchurch fusion dining.
Nice fitout,  but concrete floor,  noisy when people drag chairs. Lacks atmosphere when not many customers,  Excellent service ,good food.

Family of five trying out for the first time, love every dish we ordered! Chicken skewers with satay sauce, juicy and source was great! Noodle soup, fresh spring role, my boy love pineapple fried rice! Service was icying on top. Thanks heaps
My partner and I were recommended to try diversity. We are both really happy with all the dishes we ordered, especially the signature satay dish. We'll be back!!!
Amazing food and service, highly recommend this to everyone. They cater to everyone's dietary needs
Wonderful place. The Laab was so flavoursome and delicious. Friendly service. Highly recommended
Beautiful service. Delicious food! Thank you
Fed 9 of us and we were all happy
I had the best Peking Duck ever here.  The staff were friendly and it was a lovely quiet atmosphere.  Definitely come again.
The second time we have been to this lovely restaurant. We had the pecking duck 3 ways and  again it didn't disappoint.
Excellent food

Tried Dragon Express on a whim and was genuinely impressed. Food came out hot, fresh, and full of flavour—especially the black bean beef and fried rice. Good portions, fair prices, and quick service even on a busy night.  Great local option when you need something tasty and no-fuss. Will definitely order again.

Ordered peking duck first time eating duck was  very tender, really fatty, I guess that's what it supposed to be friendly service and explained how to eat, which was nice. I wanted half, not a whole duck should have asked before ordering lol
Very friendly service Great duck

Tried Dragon Express on a whim and was genuinely impressed. Food came out hot, fresh, and full of flavour--especially the black bean beef and fried rice. Good portions, fair prices, and quick service even on a busy night.  Great local option when you need something tasty and no-fuss. Will definitely order again.

Easily the worst meal I have had in a restaurant. Of the 5 dim sum dishes we pressed, only 2 were even edible. The spring rolls were still frozen in the middle and the pork dumplings were doughy and the filling was cold. The beef with vegetables had a distinctly off odor.  The service was equally appalling.  However, the steamed shrimp dumplings were delicious and the Singapore noodles were just fine.
Awesome place tucked away in the middle of suburbia, great staff, friendly patrons, great food for a reasonable price.  Just a place that makes you always feel welcome.
Good food and drink selection, staff weren’t 100% sure on allergies but ended up being fine.
Awesome local pub
AMAZING LOCAL! The staff here are absolutely amazing and have exceptional service. Bonus the food is delicious and well priced. Quiz night is also a must. Keep up the great service!
Really nice carbonara, huge serving and well priced. Staff were great.
food was OK. beef tacos were dry and bar basket only had one or two of each item and heaps of chips so not really worth $22.  no tables to sit at either..

Went for an unexpected date tonight and the boss man reccomended the chicken palmy for only $18!!!! YUM but I’d happily pay the full $26 I think it was for it! Steak was yummy cooked perfect and the burger normally  is like a pulled pork burger but it was pork pieces thick!!! even amounts of meat to sauce to salad which is so rare!!! Service is always mean here. Thanks so much team we had a primo night had a drink my partner had a tap on the pokies and we left happy 10/10 and our new local for date nights/family kai

Messaged the Fitz to book a table for our family group for Dinner. We got there and the table was in front of all the patrons watching the game which was a little loud-ish. My suggestion is when you get group bookings esp for Families put them in that space infront of the Dart Board because we didn't have to talk over each other and it's a perfect spot near the Big Screen where you can still enjoy a meal, drink and watch the sports. We set up the tables there.  Service is friendly but waited awhile ordering the platter for 2 off the smokehouse menu. The Waffle Fries and Sausage is what I enjoyed. Everyone's Burgers looked amazing I think they enjoyed them? You have to go to the bar and order your food. They don't have a person coming to your table to take orders. Looks like there were only a couple staff serving the whole pub?

I went for dinner and omg this is the best place to eat. The smoke house pork was the best I've ever tastedThe meat melts in your mouth and wasted nothing. I recommend this place to everyone. The service was awesome  Thank you

So rude! We were told no jugs for 30 minutes in a very rude and unwelcoming way, we waited 30 minutes and returned to be told no jugs at all, then asked if there are cocktails and were told “no cocktails while we are busy” which was silly because there was two people waiting to order a drink, and the bar itself didn’t even have all its seats filled. Honestly, just a rude experience when there was absolutely no need for the treatment we received. Where is the customer service?? As someone who has worked years in hospitality this was so unnecessary, people politely coming to order and being told “no” to every request without even a kind “no sorry we aren’t serving that anymore.” This is clearly a show of ageism, if not plain rudeness, with uni students being treated poorly for no reason whatsoever.
Did a bunch of events at The Foundry in late 2024 alongside DJs, always a solid student bar with a packed crowd, great energy, & easy to work in.

Disappointing. In all my experiences with the female manager she has never been hospitable. Great to see the coffee/matcha is popular but being the only prominent bar on campus shouldn’t need to wait ages just to get a tap beer as a result, there are already plenty of other cafes on campus.
I basically live here
Good drinks and good music. I went to the Taylor Swift party it was a fun party.
Dead bar. Rude staff. Uni should change management

Terrible bar run by bad managers. Bad service by rude staff. Dumb closing times (6pm on a Thursday). Poor stock management (didn’t have any beers at all on tap). Haven’t let me order drinks on my Australian ID (I’m over 25). With over 22,000 students, this should be a thriving bar. The university should step in and change ownership. It’s a huge embarrassment to UC and a loss to student life.

Too many know about it already haha. Excellent food, wine and atmosphere. Big screens for sports, brunch menu, hot stones menu, what's not to love! Seriously want one of the serving staffs Guinness establishment only t-shirts!
Gastropub. Average food at reasonable price. Service was OK, nothing outstanding. Pretty average in all departments.
Good food and beer, brilliant atmosphere.
Nice food
Superb food and drinks.
Amazing food ! Could go back every night ! Deserts divine  staff attentive and very knowledgeable...thank you for our wonderful experience

This place was good, but definitely not great. The acoustics are terrible and the noise is loud when the place is close to full. I found the service to be just slightly below some of the better restaurants in Christchurch.

Our second time back to the Goldfinch on a short visit to Christchurch and, happily, just as good as we remembered . Cheerful, helpful waiter (Amit), chilled music and vibe sitting outside, food was excellent, as were the mocktails. Our favourite was the terrific blue cheese wontons but I imagine everything is good. Lots of different textures and colours and tastes going on. Vibrant and memorable, thank you!
We had a delightful meal with great service (thanks, Amit!) and delicious food. Try the scallops and save room for dessert.
taco gooood！
The staff were super attentive and upon learning it was my partners birthday , they bought out a complimentary dessert which was a really nice gesture. Good team , good vibes .. well done .

Our first time eating out at The Goldfinch whilst visiting Christchurch. A reservation was made by our son for us to eat out during our short stay in the city. There was plenty of choice and the staff were very helpful in explaining the various dishes on the menu as we were unfamiliar with some of the selections available. Although very enjoyable I think we should have ordered additional dishes off the menu as our main meal choice only seemed to last a short while. All in all a lovely evening meal and I'm sure I'll be better prepared next time I visit to select more off the menu.
Great food. Great service.
Absolutely love this place, the flavours in the food is just incredible!
Delicious and affordable prices. Excellent service. Garlic naan is a must.
Food was really good. We ordered Chana masala and Paneer pyaza. Both were delicious.
Great food and really good price. Authentic taste and good service. Place is pretty run down inside but good spot to grab some lunch or takeaways. Do pyaza and tikka masala were fab!
Delicious. And I think very reasonably priced compared to many takeout places nowadays.

A great dinner to share combo B. Very well priced. Unfortunately we weren't given the Naan bread but the rest was great and they have promised an extra next order, thanks. The butter chicken was really moist & cut to a good size in a tasty sauce. I particularly liked the onion bahji. Will certainly become a regular.

Fine dining at it's intimate best. Perfectly balanced 8 course tasting menu was a real treat with every dish having it's highlights. Wonderful waitstaff were friendly and attentive without being intrusive. Delicious local fare at a reasonable price. Highly recommended and I for one can't wait to return soon!
I had a great meal and thought the food was excellent the service was also top-notch I wasn’t used to being so tended to really appreciated this this is a gem and I encourage anyone to go here
Lovely friendly staff, delicious food, highly recommended and will definitely go back
Great food!
Came here for a quick bite for our show in the Town Hall. The ambiance was nice, the food we ordered were both very tasty.

I went there with my wife for the first time last week. What a wonderful place!  The location is ideal, the staff is very friendly, and the sandwiches are fantastic! I tried the smoked fish one and my wife had the spicy one; both were delicious! A real gem. Thank you to Bobby and his entire team for the warm welcome and the quality of the food.
Honestly, best sandwich I have ever had. Keep going back for more!
One of the best sandwiches I’ve had in my life

The staff here are amazing, my gluten free order was mistaken with another on Uber Eats and they went above and beyond what I expected to get me what I originally ordered. The food is always amazing and they don't charge extra for gluten free. They have a fantastic team.
Yum sandwiches, lovely staff!

Tried Indian Bites recently — the portion size was pretty average, but still a decent amount overall. The food was affordable and satisfying for the price. Nothing particularly special, but overall it was alright — a simple, decent meal that does the job without breaking the bank.
Lamb madras was amazing! Highly recommend it. Also the chicken Tikka rice ball was bloody awesome as-well, I really enjoyed it! Thanks so much for this meal its made my day
Good food Best prices and taste
very tasteless and watery chicken korma. also the garlic naan was depressing—almost had no flavour. sweet lassi tasted like chemicals
Yummy cheese chilly
Korma was good
Every time I want Indian Kingfisher wigram is definitely the go to! Food is always impeccable every time I order and the staff are very friendly. I recommend dining in here!

What a shame, ordered prawn pakora and garlic tikka. It was blend and tasteless. Both the dishes was tasteless. I respect food but it’s a chef who make it delicious, I paid for it but it’s not value for money. Sorry
rocked up 2 mins before kitchen closed and they wouldnt serve us. like bruh there was still 2 mins left. terrible service would not recomend to a friend or even an enemy.
very good & lovely service
I ordered tandoori chicken ,onion bhaji,butter chicken, kadai paneer and garlic Naan. Food was exceptional, staff is welcoming and polite I would definitely come back again

Just finished a long day shift, wanted to eat indian. Ordered a schezwan fried rice and a whole tandoori chicken. Fried rice was ok but the tandoori chicken was absolutely pathetic. Looked like my dog had thrown up, and it was cold. I walked there and walked back so didn't have the energy to go back.. ate rice and just thrown chicken away. Absolutely disgusting place

Waiting staff cleared tables before we had all finished eating and cut off table service for drinks without explanation (upon further investigation we must go to the bar and only order for ourselves). All in all just an unwelcoming vibe. It felt like we were overstaying our welcome and that was felt among our group. A bit of a shame as the food was decent. Would not recommend particularly for group bookings

AMAZING service from the wait staff, the bartender made us a special mocktail since we weren’t sure what to order and it was delicious. Loved every bit of our dining experience, food and drinks exceeded expectations. Highly recommend
Delicious food and great service, highly recommend
Excellent dinner - perfectly cooked pork and wonderful service from Indie .  We’ll be back soon .

Dinner was superb, next level presentation with amazing taste. Love the wine options and all the staff is fantastic. Thanks Indie for making it a special meal! Pictured is tomato corn soup with focacia, and seafood chowder with sourdough. The cod main is exceptional, see the video. The breads served with the soups are spectacular. Truly rank The Lane at the top.
Salmon is amazing! Staff is super friendly. Perfect for a quiet dinner

The Lane is absolutely one of our favourite restaurants to dine in! Tasty dishes beautifully presented, service was top notch! Spacious modern-looking dining area in junction with Sudima hotel in the central city. Posted photos for your enjoyment!
Perfect start before court theatre. Delicious selection of spirits with friendly efficient service. Cheers

Went for pre drink tonight before going to Issac theatre.  I have never been so rudely treated by a barman anywhere in world.  Absolute disgrace.  His level of disinterest was staggering.  After several exchanges re drinks order  I decided I had had enough and told him to forget it as his attitude sucked snd walked out.  Whoever is running this place get better staff.  Disgraceful.
Wonderful staff create a relaxed atmosphere perfect for a quiet night... conversation, cheese and whisky!
Came to try flights of NZ whiskey only to find it’s not offered weekends. Old fashion is decent.

This bar was decorated really nicely with nice velvet couches, board games and a fireplace. They have a few mixed drink options, we both got martinis. Otherwise they have a lot of whisky. We did ask for other suggestions of drinks but it seemed like we had to stick to the few on the menu. The jam on the martini was really good and a unique garnish!
Great Irish pub with tasty breakfast snacks
Bouncers have a picture of me from another bar from an incident years ago that they circulated in a group chat despite never having an issue at this bar and being sober I didn't get let in

A nice Irish pub in the heart of the city! Irish stew is delicious as is the roast pork. We certainly enjoyed our dessert too, the pavlova! Likely everything else on the menu is equally good. The vibe is definitely that of an Irish pub, very lively.

Staff are a joke. Cutting people off at 6.30 on a Tuesday and then laughing at them. Imagine trying to have fun in an Irish Pub? Not my group, but very disappointing to see as an Irish punter. Would not recommend.
I like that there are so many different restaurants.
Huge portions of great quality food. Great service and great atmosphere.
Large pub with plenty of space.  The ribeye steak was a bit too sinewy.

One of the highlights of our trip to Christchurch - so good we went for dinner twice! Fabulous food, great service and we also loved the entertainment - the Irish session band and Adam McGrath. Will definitely visit again when I’m back in Christchurch  :)

Went there for  cup day  and wasn't  disappointed   staff were amazing,  and big screen  was great for watching all the races    , I don't think I had to go to the bar once to get a drink  as the staff were on to it
Perfect.
Hour wait for wings!!!
Tasty food and cozy atmosphere, but definitely not authentic Indian food  this is a place run by westerners and the food reflects it.
Beautiful food at really fair prices. Love the quiet time in the morning
The food is always delicious and nourishing, and the staff are friendly.
Stunning service, food and atmosphere you just have to visit! Honestly this place continually gets better and better each time, highly recommend
delicious vegan breakfast!
Delicious food, calm ambience and lovely shopping for natural well-being items. Also do takeouts. Gosh must have gone here on and off for 20 years?
Great service, lovely atmosphere, AMAZING fresh food, and very kind staff. I love this restaurant! Many vegan / vegetarian options. Best vegan place in town :)

What a wonderful place for vegan food with plenty of gluten-free options. The wait staff are so friendly and welcoming. Due to the earthquake in Christchurch, their location is a bit off the beaten path but well worth the effort to get there.

Ten stars if I could!! Awesome venue, friendly staff and the food was incredible!!! Generous portion sizes, well priced and soooo tasty!! Beautiful building as well. Four of us went, we all loved our dishes. Would live off their food if I could @sophiewelco

This is a truly beautiful find! Not only a restaurant but a music store and unique gift shop. I really enjoyed the nori roll and soup of the day. They make their own kombucha and raw desserts from scratch. Just an enjoyable experience all the way around.

A Vegan/Vegetarian heaven and a great place all together. The dishes are simply wonderful and rich, the decor and service are impeccable. It's all good, really. Very welcoming to any other dietary needs. Best place by far @ Christchurch.
The best restaurant in South Island for Indian Vegetarian food. I wouldn't dare to try any other restaurants for Indian food.

I almost want to cry when I enter The Lotus Heart in Christchurch. Why? Well,a couple of reasons but the main one is how to choose from such an awesome menu. Everything is made with love and the finest of ingredients in the spotless kitchen. I did struggle with not ordering the curry dosa -  again. This time I had the dhal which comes in vegetarian or vegan options. I had the vege option. The Lotus Heart makes the best dhal ever. Simmered to perfection. They make their own kombucha and kefir on the premises as well. Afterwards I could not go past a slice of raw chocolate cake. Best raw desserts I've had. There is a terrific atmosphere in the restaurant and if you want to guarantee you leave somewhere with a smile, eat there. Afterwards you can wander into their music shop and bang a drum or two.

Five star service, food, decor, the lot! We had lunch here recently with a large group, our friends booked ahead and the staff created a beautifully decorated table with so much colour and attention to detail I complimented it twice!  The service was prompt, friendly and understanding. And the food? - Amazing! I had a rice pancake (dosa?), with curry;  doesn't sound like much I know, but it was very large and very, very tasty. Full of flavour and served with 2 type's of relish.   They offer a range of unique and equally amazing smoothies, I had a coconut kefir smoothie that I would gladly drink daily if I had the means. I tried 2 other's that friend's ordered which were equally delicious, unique and healthy.  The place is decorated and designed with opulence - a gallery in itself. Plus, they have a music store, book shop, gift shop and produce for purchase.  Hand's down the best restuarant I have been to when visiting Christchurch on several occasions over the past few years.

If you are wanting the MOST DIVINE experience then this is the place to eat. What joy and delight this whole building is. The food has been prepared with such care and precision and looks so amazing it is hard to believe it comes from quite a small kitchen. The entire atmosphere is wonderful, the staff very professional and you just want to order everything off the menu which is why people just keep going back day after day. The research and time spent in getting each dish just right goes on behind the scenes and certainly shows in their presentation. Coming here is like entering a wonderful world of sheer bliss. Run by the Sri Chinmoy meditation centre, this restaurant certainly deserves high class credit for all their work they have put into their beautiful building, the small shops hiding away that bring dazzle and fun to the whole experience. Such well earnt beauty, may they succeed for many more years to come and leave such lasting memories to those who visit.

I can't believe how long it took me to come to this place. Having a number of food allergies and preferring to eat paleo, I saw on their website they had a selection of raw, vegetarian, gluten free and onion free foods. I thought it'd be worth a try. I took my sister and my boyfriend with me, both big meat eaters and my man is never keen for vegetarian food. It took us ages to order because there were so many options. Even I wasn't sure whether to try the superfood smoothie or the dosa with curry. I went with the dosa. It was so delicious. My sister had the nacho's and my man had the burger with vegenut pattie, he really loved it! We finished off with a raw cheesecake - yum! I loved it so much I took my niece and mum back a week later. I would recommend this place to everyone. Not only is the food great but you're surrounded by a great sense of calm as soon as you walk through the doors.
Very flavoursome  well presented and friendly service. Table for 8 and all enjoyed their meals. Highly recommended,  easy parking. Will return for sure.
Always delicious and friendly. Our go to Thai

Nice small restaurant, have been three times now and have enjoyed the food thoroughly each time. It’s actually authentic Thai food so definitely go try and the prices are reasonable as well. For 2 adults we usually only get an entree and a main as portions are quite good.  The guy who was at the front desk tonight gave great service as well.  It’s been quiet at the restaurant every time we have gone in as they seem to get uber orders and takeaway orders regularly.
Great food, and service love this place …the plants in the restaurant are amazing and I love looking at them all and all the little ornaments highly recommend
Excellent service for our takeaway Thai tonight. I had a special dietary request, and it was accommodated without fuss. A delicious meal - thankyou. Ann
We had takeaways for our whole family omg such lovely dishes and generous portions 10 out of 10 totally five stars don’t wait try Lucky Thai soon
A perfect neighborhood bar!
A great Pub with awesome meals and live music. The staff are very welcoming
Their cheese toasties lived up to the hype. Some of the best around. To cheesy and filling. To die for! Definitely recommend getting them or making the trip out to Addington just for these

Great place. Nice and cozy. Very relaxing.  Staff are very friendly and certainly cater to your needs very well. Very professional presentation and the food is good value.  You get what you pay for I guess. And this restaurant certainly delivers on food quality as well as close attention to presentation.  The standard of service is what you would expect from an establishment of this calibre. They also offer a good selection of beverages.  Meal prices are in that middle to upper end dining experience. I felt they delivered an experience well worth the money spent. I will certainly dine there again.  Very nice place. Pleasant, friendly, and welcoming staff certainly make the dining experience all about you.  Parking is not too bad in the area and can often be found close by. They accept Usual payment methods: Cash, EFTPOS, Credit Cards.  Good wheel Chair access. Bookings are essential and can be made via their web site.

The Monday Room was a really awesome experience for our team. The food was 5 star and absolutely delicious! Our waitress was absolutely amazing, super friendly, polite and so efficient! Thanks to Ryan for when I initially called him to make a reservation, for being so friendly, understanding, efficient and accommodating of our bigger team. It was truely a first class experience! Thank you to the whole team at The Monday Room and of course the chef for the amazing food!

We were a very noisy group of 6 who were wonderfully accommodated by great staff, and although we were the last to leave, we were never rushed.  Food was great, we did the set menu which had lots of variety.  The bombed alaska dessert was a great way to finish the night with flare, and can easily feed 4 people, not 2!  Overall, a great experience, thanks team!
Food is overpriced and not worth the value.The steak dish is embarrassing for $58..Do not eat here..Bad food and terrible service
Cool venue. We sat upstairs where it surprisingly busy for an early time. Ordered the lamb to share which was sensational. Friendly service. Everything was excellent!

Myself and partner dined last night through first table and from the beginning felt welcomed and truly looked after by friendly and attentive staff. The food was beautiful and well presented, cocktails delicious and beautifully crafted. Quality dining experience.
What a great restaurant! I had a large group of 21 people, and we had such a great time. The food and service were excellent. Thank you, team of the Monday room.

I came here for a birthday dinner and it was beyond expectations! The food was outstanding , everyone was so welcoming and knew their stuff. We very much look forward to coming back. Definitely recommend the chefs menu!

Had a lovely dinner at The Montreal. The decor and atmosphere were tidy and cosy, and our food was all perfect. We ordered 3 small plates, a large plate, and a flatbread, between two people. It was probably a bit much, but all the flavours were fabulous and I’m glad we didn’t leave anything out. Our waitress Isla was cheery, kind and helpful, and made us feel us feel very welcome. Top notch service, and top notch food!
Fantastic food and great service. Highly recommend

Wow! What a “hidden” gem! Exquisite flavours - flatbreads are amazing in particular (we had dinner here twice). Good selection of wines all delivered with an easy grace by Isla and Ella. Wish we could be back next week however it is tad too far from Oz! Andrew & Liz Cooper

We had dinner on two nights and breakfast on two days. Everything we ate was exceptional and of the highest quality. The service was really good and the atmosphere was cosy and comfortable. All in all 5 stars. Here is everything we ate and enjoyed: 1. Market fresh oysters (bluff oysters) 2. Umami wagyu beef sliders 3. Fried chicken 4. Middle eastern lumina lamb stone baked flatbread 5. Pork stone baked flatbread  For breakfast, we had the 1. French toast - this is a must must try 2. Hummus and bean quesadillas with poached eggs 3. Avocado croissant with poached eggs4” 4. Poached eggs with hollandaise sauce on a crispy potato pave - this was very heavy and can be avoided if you don’t want to take a nap! 5. Fresh scones  Please note, the dinner menu is not available post 9pm (please confirm with the restaurant), so you will have to make do with the bar menu, which is what we did.  They also had a good collection of wine.

so disappointing had 3 different  mains no one was happy pork belly was tough pork strip steak was tough strips fish was skinnest salmon ive ever seen we should have gone and had a bar meal would have been better we would  not come back or recommend so disappointed  bar was empty very expensive  disappointment we would not recommend

INCREDIBLE! We're visiting Christchurch and I wish we'd discovered this restaurant earlier in our trip to have visited a couple more times. The space is welcoming with a beautiful patio heated by wood burning fireplace and electric heaters. The staff is friendly and attentive. But the FOOD, y'all! Each thing we tried was creative, beautiful, and incredibly delicious. Tonight's fish was grouper and it was served 2 ways: fried and grilled - both absolutely stunning.
