The tomato and peach burratta caprese would have been delicious as is but was topped with basil ice cream instead of fresh basil and it was one of the most unexpectedly scrumptious things I've ever had. What a culinary gem!!!

This is a vegetarian's perspective. Went in craving some hot soup or curry, but we were told that all their curries, even the vegetarian options, come with shrimp paste. To me shrimp paste is not vegetarian, so curry was not an option for us. So we ordered pad thai instead, along with pad puk, a vegetable stir fry in vegan sauce. Instead of a side of rice, I ordered roti for the stir fry, but the roti was way too oily; after the first bite I couldn't have any more of it. The pad thai was good, and the stir fry was good as well. Too bad they didn't have any soups or curries that could be made vegan, since that's what we were craving in the first place. The place is quite cozy with small tables for two, and service was good.

Tucked neatly between the colourful buildings of New Regent Street, this small restaurant owns a rather apt name. The interior was fairly dark, but cozy. My companion and I ordered a lunch menu curry each (mine costing $15), additional options being red meats, chicken, or vegetables, we asked if we could substitute prawns instead. They did provide our seafood alternative, however did not mention any additional fees. I ordered a Panang Curry, it was quite rich but still tasty and satisfying. The prawns however hadn't been correctly prepared, some still with scales. I ordered a beverage with my meal which was listed at $8. When I paid, I requested a receipt. I was charged an additional $2 for my curry, and was charged $9 for my drink. I couldn't help but mention the extra charge for my curry, as the person who served me did not care to bring it up when I ordered. I was refunded the additional fee, and refunded the extra paid for the beverage.  Overall, the food was good enough, and the service had issues but managed to make up for them.

We ate dinner there, I had lamb shank massaman, with a side of rice, my wife had shrimp pad Thai. I would rate my Massaman 3/5, the pad Thai had an off taste like stale peanuts. Service was friendly and prompt., 4/5. 0verall food below average, service above average.

We ate here for dinner one night after we couldn't get a table at Francesca's around the corner.  The restaurant was quaint, quiet and intimate.  I liked how it was decorated.  We were seated by the front window.  Our table was very small, just barely big enough for the two of us.  We both had the Pad Thai, and we both liked it.  Pad Thai is my wife's go-to dish at Thai restaurants and we agreed that theirs was above average.  Overall, we had a good experience here and I would eat here again.
A really nice place, quality food and even better staff. The manager is lovely and makes a great coffee.

Excellent little cafe the in middle of New Regent Street. Varied menu, good coffee and friendly staff. My meal was out in no time! Highly recommend the fish and chips. It's a very small space with a number of tables outside.  No wifi though :(

This restaurant was just around the corner of my stay. Didn't have a good experience with 2 other Thai restaurants I tried some time back. This one just hit the right notes for me. I tried Thai red curry with medium spice levels(which doesn't come with rice had to order separately), which should be good for 2 light eaters. I am going back for more for sure. Like some other reviews mention, they could have a combo option for solo travellers. The place is bit cramped, I was bit early so didn't have problem finding a seat. Definitely recommend for those Thai food lovers.

The restaurant was only 5 minutes walk from our hotel and opened on Monday night. The place was super busy and every table was full so we were there at the right time. We had 2 cocktails to shared. I had a basil chilli crispy pork with rice while my husband had a tofu veggie peanut sauce stir-fry with rice. The food was delicious but massive  we were so full before we could get through the whole plate so had to skip the dessert! The lady who look after the door and casher was super friendly and calm with the crazy paces of people come and go and needed to go to the threter! The restaurant is in a beautiful colourful stripe
Friendly staff and great food.  Better than your average thai food.

The Nook Thai Eatery in Christchurch isn't just good; it's an experience. As someone who's sampled Thai cuisine extensively, I can confidently say this was not only the best Thai food I've ever had but also ranks among the most exceptional meals of my life. The dishes were a symphony of flavors, expertly crafted and bursting with freshness.  Beyond the incredible food, the staff's warmth and attentiveness truly stood out. Their genuine smiles and dedication to customer satisfaction created a welcoming and delightful atmosphere. Fawn (the owner) was incredibly sweet and a lovely person overall!  Without hesitation, I will be returning to The Nook Thai Eatery and enthusiastically recommending it to anyone visiting Christchurch. Do yourself a favor and prepare for a truly unforgettable meal.

One of the worst dinning experience of our life. There were ANTS in our food. We ordered fried rice but was served with live ants. When we notified the server, she went to kitchen and bring the same rice back. She said that she just took the ants out of it.  Just imagine, they had the audacity to serve the same rice that had ants crawling. Taking them out does not mean they did not left their dirt on the rice.  Not apologetic at all. We lost all our appetite and did not had courage to wait to see other dishes that we ordered and left.

restaurant: The Old Vicarage Cafe, Restaurant & Bar

reviews.text: We never miss an opportunity to go here when we are in Christchurch.... Love it, the food and coffee is great .
Never fails in service or food quality simply the best
We went on a Saturday, food was pretty good but service was slow  they were a little busy but we waited 20min just for our 1st coffee. But we'd still go back.
Great dinner in a nice setting. Good to have separate rooms as not noisy
Food was mediocre for the price. Everything else was good

Underwhelming experience. Had cocktails and nibbles. Incredibly slow service with only one more table taken. Each round of cocktails (3) took 20-25 mins. Also overpriced. Will not return, even though the view is a nice to have, but there are better roof top bars in town.

This is a great Venue in the heart of town easy to miss if you didn’t know it was there ,  we was able to enjoy drinks on the rooftop balcony and then seated for a nice dining experience with above average food and attentive staff making this an easy recommendation

We had a great time dining at One Bar. The food was amazing, from eggs benedict for breakfast, to steak and duck at dinnertime. Service was perfect! friendly and professional. At dinnertime the maître'D,  Brian looked after our wine and his knowledge was much appreciated. Their wine list is superb! Thanks to the team.
Very welcoming staff, great service.  Food was good, dessert was best!  Lovely views - will be awesome to sit out on the terrace in the summer!

Such a pretty restaurant with lovely attentive staff. We both had entrees ( salmon and a beetroot dish ) and a main each ( duck and beef) with a side salad. Both entrees were stunning, the duck was a little over cooked and the beef unfortunately was so tough my steak knife wouldn’t even cut through it, therefore I didn’t eat it.
Of course it's nice food and drinks however quite pricey and small portions, plus they need Kenny g music playing.
Amazing service, great personalised experience with very comical wait staff. Lovely views and flavourful food and cocktails . Love the light up menus, luminescent decor and French ambience.
Excellent Avocado on Toast, and Excellent Filter coffee.
It's great that all the options are vegan. The interior is simple, clean, and has a nice feel. The staff are very friendly.
I’m yet to have a nice coffee there! I even try to get a different coffee each time to see if it’s just bad luck but nope it’s just so watery each time. I go but in hopes it’s changed
Amazing cafe!! Delicious food, varied menu and lovely service. Thank you!!
For my friend’s wedding, the 5-course meals were specially prepared and served at Origin Café. 100% pure vegan, exquisitely crafted and beautifully presented—an absolutely stunning experience.
Worth the visit for sure! Excellent food and coffee with lovely service.
Nice staff and coffee. Every time I have had food here it has also been great.
Lovely experience, always nice to go here. Food is delicious, attentive staff. Great for a catch up with friends.
Yummy my food! Cocktails great price will definitely be back
Excellent customer service, only down side to our meal were the chips because they were very over seasoned aside from that it was great food highly recommend the beef burger
Highly recommend Pedal Pusher. Delicious food. Great service. They have First Table which is an added bonus. We'll be back.

Awful, rude service and the food was poor quality. Staff appeared melancholy and the atmosphere was constantly ruined by a slamming door and kids running in and out of the restaurant, bar area and kitchen. This is not a gastropub. It's cheap eats at inflated prices at best.

Awesome food.  Great drinks.  Cool atmosphere.  Fun hip vibrant.  You can go big and try their signature dishes (the duck and pork belly are awesome) or try more standard pub fare like a burger or fish and chips.  Everything tastes gourmet but the atmosphere is more fun, hip, and down to earth.  If I could import this bistro to Denver is would be the most popular place in town hands down.  Staff is super friendly and the service is impeccable, yet nothing feels remotely pretentious.  Also nice outdoor patio for warm evenings.  I travel to Christchurch often on business and this is definitely my go-to joint.

It used to be my favourite breakfast place but the quality has dropped a lot. Last few times it's always been overcooked eggs. And even when it's not busy it always takes forever to get your food. I like the interior but not sure if that's enough to make me go back. Maybe for the ribs, which are so tender and well seasoned.

Great food, particularly the pork sliders. Very nice, trendy environment and the service was also excellent. While it doesn't come across as a cheesy 'family' venue, it is equipped with a change table and high chairs and the staff are very accommodating. There's quite a range of low alcohol drinks. Would get five stars if they had some good NZ craft beers available.
Fantastic food, great setting, friendly staff and great GF options. A very pleasant place to eat and grab a decent beer.
Just a question please cause I'm new down here Christchurch and I'm looking for a kareoke place so I can sing please how much to paid or is it for free please someone guide me through I love music.

Thanks so much for a fantastic night on Saturday night!  We booked the Poplar Social club for a birthday party, and it was great!  Sarah was wonderful to deal with before the event, helpful and professional with great suggestions, and we felt organised and in control.  The night went completely to plan, including timing for all the food, and Adam was absolutely fantastic behind the bar and helped make it such a great night.  Thanks so much guys, it was awesome
Great cocktails and atmosphere
Great ambiance, friendly bartender who tailered drinks to my taste, highly recommend
Great bar.  Excellent cocktail.  Awesome  barman.  Really cool vibe
The best cocktails I’ve ever had, reasonably priced and a great atmosphere. Not sure what the bartender’s name was but he was great! We had a fantastic night!
Great service, spectacular range of drinks for a smaller space and wonderful live music.
Great bar excellent service.
Best coffee, beautiful cakes and quick friendly service. Very reasonably priced.
The most ghastly “cheese” toasted sandwich today. Inedible!  Bread glued together with some sort of 3 cheeses. Also doors open - cold breeze. Could do better.
It’s great place to have a coffee
Lovely coffee and cheese scones

We went here for breakfast and it was very disappointing. They serviced us a coffee with off oat milk, luckily they made us a new one and refunded us for it. I got the eggs on toast, the toast was dry and hard to eat and had no butter on it. Our eggs were cooked too long and weren’t runny. The breakfast bap we got was nice but for $15 should have at least came with abit more bacon and a wee side salad. It looked very sad all on its own on a huge plate. Apart from all this my bottled apple juice was nice and the cookie we got. Unfortunately for an expensive meal we left hungry as the portion sizes weren’t that big. I probably wouldn’t return.
A Thai man very much adapted to the local cuisine... quite disappointing.
Great asian food for the price
Heaven on a plate - Reasonable prices - Great service
Food good as always
Prawn toast to die for Great staff excellent food and service

The food is excellent value and with excellent service from the friendly service staff, I would definitely recommend Rockpool Bar and Grill to everyone. The Pad Thai my partner, said was beautiful, while I had the Rockpool steak, which I quiet enjoyed. We also shared the Garlic Loaf and thoroughly loved that with the herb vinaigrette! The venue itself has quiet a few pool tables at the rear, with a few TV's placed around playing sports of the day, a number of seating options and quiet a large bar down the left side. A very good selection on Menu, to suit all tastes!
Great  poo tables

The most unprofessional bouncers I’ve ever encountered. I honestly don’t know how they even got there COA. It’s clear they have no idea how to de-escalate situations or use reasonable force. I witnessed a completely unnecessary and excessive use of force — it was honestly disgusting. These guys judge you the second you step in line. If you ask why you’re being denied entry, they can’t even give you a straight answer. All you get is some nonsense excuse about “the camera” or whatever. One night they’ll let you in, the next night they’ll tell you you’re not allowed — with zero explanation. And what’s with the so-called dress code? Do they expect everyone to dress exactly the same? What’s the difference between a shirt with a design and a plain one? It feels like they just assume anyone with a bit of style is in a gang or there to cause trouble. That’s pure discrimination, and it’s pathetic. Keep treating people like that, and karma’s going to come right back around — especially when you end up letting the wrong person in because they “look right” to you.  THIS IS BS.
Fun place to hang and enjoy a game of pool. The seating is comfy and warm, the decor good. I haven't eaten here yet but fully intending to soon.
Its okay
Drunk bouncer didn't let me and my friends in because he didn't like how one of us looked; it is a shameful image for the place to show.  "I get paid by the hour, not by the arse" - Drunk Bouncer

This is a bar, restaurant, night club with food so much better than expected.  Excellent ingredients, preparation, and portion sizes.  Had the salmon and capers fettuccine and the bangers and mash.  Both were excellent. Nice selection of beers.

A girl passed out, I'm a trained paramedic and I went up to the bouncer to offer my assistance to adjust her into a recovery position while he was on the phone and the bouncer says "It's time for you to leave" disregarding anything I have just said. I feel this is bullshit as it's a human life we're talking about. The Rockpool should check who their staff is actually. Utter bloody nonsense. Really disappointed with this place.
Lamb shank and fish and chips are sooooo yummy here! Our first meal in New Zealand! Awesome!

restaurant: The Spirits Workshop at Riverside Market

reviews.text: Fabulous Gin! The mulled Sloe was also special. But the atmosphere with Josie’s service and conversation was the best!!
Awesome Gin and Gin Experiences with amazing service and product knowledge from Josie. #Amazing @Riverside Markets
worth the stop!
Superb location, supreme selection of sensational beverages. Top notch customer service, who are very engaging and informative, Georgia who helped us out at lot. You've gotta try them out.
Thanks for the sparkling water
Lady made us a drink even though she was closing...fantastic service and great drink
Great mulled gin, excellent for a cold day
The gin tasting was delicious and a fond memory of my trip to Christchurch.
Great everything,   service food,  etc
Expensive parking otherwise fab
Great food will surely go back some day
We had a lovely lunch date at The Square. The service was excellent: very attentive, knowledgeable, and her recommendations were delicious. The ambience was relaxing. Highly recommend!
We love our breakfasts here.
Absolutely lovely food and great service from the staff.
Yum vegan options! Staff are always friendly.
A casual takeout restaurant with a huge selection of Japanese favorites! Sushi, ramen, curry, rice bowls, and more. Spacious parking available. It's also conveniently close to I Ramsukra.
I personally found the food a bit plain.
Your typical sushi in the airport.  Not bad and price is also not bad.

Before leaving, I had breakfast with the kids. We had Hikari's katsu curry, katsudon, and sushi. The wide selection of dishes was great, and the food was delicious and generous. I loved the clean exterior and the presentation. I highly recommend it.
Great sushi and service. Would come again when visiting the airport next time.
This is my second visit. The food is still delicious, and the service is great.
For the price I expect real beef in the spicy beef noodle soup. Not sliced shaved beef you’d get from the Deli. Otherwise was reasonably tasty.

Seriously the worst food I think I've ever eaten. It tasted like it had been in the cabinet all day, dry, barely warm and tasteless and expensive considering it's condition. We ate around 6.30pm and the staff seemed to be biding time to knock off. No smile, no interaction, nothing. So disappointing. I can see how why people were lined up at Burger King.
Generally decent! Ramen was nice, Korean snacks were quite tasty!
Great little Authentic Thai restaurant. I had the red duck curry. So good.
The foods great but the hours are inaccurate. If you could update your hours on website to when you’re actually open that’d be great.
Delicious Thai food that warms the soul.
Best Thai in town. Consistent,  full of flavour, fresh, well priced, large portions. Great service
Great food.
Love the atmosphere of this place, so humble, never too busy on weekdays which makes this hidden gem so good. No other Thai food in chch can compare in my honest opinion!

Expected some decent food from the reviews but the curry and wings were super sweet like a dessert. Not impressed. Thought the wings would be nice and crispy but are slowly cooked in another sweet sauce
We will definitely be back. Food and service was very good.
Fantastic and very attentive staff, great food
Eclectic cafe, with lots of quirky touches, food and coffee is great too. Must stop while visiting Christchurch
Terrible service. Had to wait 30 min for cabinet food. Coffee was burnt. Staff didn’t seem to care. Place felt dirty. People around us were also complaining of the long wait for cabinet food.
Very delicious. Recommended. Suitable for group dinner.

I booked to celebrate my partners birthday and was an amazing time! The staff is soooo friendly, they prepared a happy birthday to him, thats make our day!  The food was sooo yummy, everything was great! Thank you so much for all the staff (waitress and kitchen team)! I highly recommend that place!
Food tastes good, staff is great too, service is good. A little too high price for the small portion of food.
Great menu at reasonable prices. Great outlook and alfresco area.

We go to the Hop every Thursday for Happy Hour. The beer selection is great and always changing and Matt is always around to advise on choices.   I would give them 5 stars if not for the food which is ok but not inspiring.

We visited The Twisted Hop on the 4th of July. They were promoting a 4th of July celebration event that evening and we decided to check it out. The first small victory was the private parking the back. Though there aren't many spaces, it was nice not to have to fight street parking. We entered through the back patio door which leads onto a covered, cozy patio great for enjoying a beer with a friend on a warm day. The restaurant inside is dark and rustic, but the bar is aglow with the colorful chalkboard promoting the beers on tap that day. We spent some time with the bartender discussing the beers available and he helped us find the perfect fit for our palates (pilsner for me!). We sat at a four top table near the wall of books at the front where you can buy a book for a donation that benefits the Nepal Earthquake Relief Fund. I can get behind that! There is a spot for a stage and a counter full of board games. Awesome. For dinner, we stuck to the American-theme menu and ordered tacos and wings. They were delicious, but the tacos were definitely my favorite. Next time I would like to try something off of their real menu, which looked wholly filing and belly-warming. Do you have a favorite brew? They take special requests and will do their best to stock it for you! Definitely recommend this a top bar to spend the afternoon or the evening imbibing craft brews and devouring delicious snacks.
Excellent atmosphere and welcoming décor, not to mention the beer. Staff are always friendly as well. I haven't eaten here for a fair while so can't review the food just yet.

One of the best brewpubs I have been to in the world. Whatever else we may want to say about the English, they understand the science of crafting a good pub, or at least they used to. Wooden tables and floors with a comfy interior that beckons you to sit, drink, think, and talk in a convivial mode. The twisted hop has all of this as well as great food and beer.   They brew their own beer, or rather Jim brews it, and they specialize in English style "real ales" although they have other varieties of beer and wine as well. Real ales are ales that are cask conditioned, that is, they continue to ferment in the cask. They are also dispensed with a hand pump instead of a C02 tap. This makes them delicate and amazingly flavourful in a way that typical lagers and "bright" ales are not. The beers at the Twisted Hop are great and you will want to give yourself some time there since you will want to try them all, maybe more than once.   The food, despite The Twisted Hop's English DNA, is really good as well. They have Scotch eggs (ask, or maybe don't ask, what is in them), excellent chips and fish, and everything else looked good too. If you live in Christchurch, you should be reading this while seated at the Twisted Hop. For those traveling to Christchurch, this should be on your list of stops.
Best steak and veg in Christchurch. Do yourself a favour and try it out. You will not regret it. Staff are amazing!

Dropped in here for a drink recently, and the staff member was so nice that we decided to return for dinner. That's great customer service! Fortunately, it was a Sunday, so we had the roast meal which was outstanding. The rest of the staff we encountered were equally as warm and friendly. It was very busy but we were well looked after and would happily return anytime.
Grat bar & live music for a Sunday
Expensive drinks but close to cathedral square
The Two-thumb Yorkshire Bitter on cask was superb!!
Great service
Went to see a band i ha e meaning to see for ages.. 1st time there, also last time there..
Great pub on a Sunday arvo the bands are fantastic
Went their for a fun night out, live band playing. Lovely friendly staff, good quick service.

The waimakariri tavern is a gr8 place to visit for a quiet drink with some friends. on the weekends they also have live music Saturdays and Sundays if it's a lovely day it's awsome to sit outside and toe tap to the music

This is a great pub in Ferrymead that's well worth the drive from Merivale for quiz night on Wednesdays. (You definitely need to make a booking if you want to play.) The bar is right off the water and the outdoor patio seating receives a nice cool, salty breeze. There is plenty of seating inside from tall top tables to more intimate seating and group tables. There are plenty of TVs to catch a game or catch the clues for quiz night.   The menu is limited but good quality. The chicken sandwich is hearty and topped with an aioli dressing and bacon. The side of chips are thick-cut and soft on the inside. You can order aioli or ketchup on the side. I have seen a fish and potatoes ordered, the fish are smothered in a sauce and, as a non-pescatarian, I find it sloppy and unappetizing. The onion rings as an entree would be a good choice as they are crispy on the outside and slimy onion on the inside..just the way any good onion rings should be. I recently tried the three ice cream and warm chocolate chip cookie which was heavenly. The cookie is thick and crumbly and the ice creams were stellar (double chocolate, vanilla with cherry and mint chocolate chip).    There are on Monteith's beers on tap and some rotating summer options. There are other beer options by the bottle if you prefer as well as an adequate wine selection. Soft drinks and well drinks are available, too.   The staff is great (our table loves Alex) - they're quick with orders and always wandering around looking to help. Definitely the best drinking establishment in Ferrymead and worth a stop if you live in the area.
Delicious food and beautifully presented! First time trying mango sticky rice in Christchurch — it definitely didn’t disappoint. Just wish the portion was a bit bigger!

Absolutely love Thonglor Restaurant! The food is packed with flavour — just like what you’d find on the streets of Thailand, but with top-notch quality and presentation. Every dish I’ve tried has been delicious. If you’re craving real Thai street food done right, this is the place to go in Christchurch!  PS. I was so lucky to get to enjoy Mango Sticky Rice with fresh mango, especially since it's only available for a limited time! Iff you’re craving it, be sure to check with them first to see if they have the fresh mango available! You won’t want to miss out!

Genuinely some of the best food I've ever had, delicious drinks, amazing staff. It looks gorgeous, the lighting and all the pictures on the walls really add to the vibes. I will dream about the Massaman Pork Belly Curry forever, absolutely divine. Well done everyone.
This is the bestttt Thai food ever in town! Me and partner got really addicted to their food! The tomyum soup is our favorite! Very authentic! My partner really likes their crispy pork salad!
One of the best thai food in NZ  Highly recommended! I can confidently say this is AUTHENTIC Thai food — boat noodles and krapow are absolutely delicious

I’m a big fan of Thai food, so I ordered quite a few classic dishes to try. The prices here aren’t exactly low, so I was expecting a bit more in terms of quality. The first two dishes were pretty good, but the Tom Yum soup was a bit disappointing The seafood didn’t taste that fresh. Pad Thai was nice, but the mango sticky rice didn’t live up to the hype — small portion and not worth the price.

I came from Westport and been here 2 times now. The food at this restaurant is very delicious. The taste of the food is like the original recipe from Thailand. Good price. I'm very happy and enjoy eating.

Just popped in on a rainy Monday afternoon before closing with my two kids and the guys were patient with serving me (having a taste, filling a growler) and we watched the brewing from the mezzanine. Really nice staff, really tasty beer. Thanks for enriching our holiday (from UK) to NZ!
Fruit juice and beer: a perfect combination
Excellent beer! Great service! Takeaway beers too! Great selection of food trucks on Fridays!! Often have special taps as well.  Some new brews available now.
Good beers
Great beer!
Good beer, great music, friendly staff, would like to visit again!
Very friendly and social, especially Friday evenings, closes early 8pm Friday

Love this place , very private , great bbq an amazing drinks ! Top

OH MY GOSHHHH!I come to this place almost every week! I love the skewers,shrimp,fried noodles!exellent service ! A little spicy,but enough for kids to handle I love  the chicken hearts and the drinks!I appreciate the kind staff!especially the young staff they are doing great!I own a restaurant down in Riccarton windmill center,but i love this place even more! It taste amazing!I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND 5 STARS!

The spice level isn’t too much for Westerners, but it still has enough kick for Asians who love spicy food. Prices are reasonable , the service is great, and I’ll definitely be coming back often!

GUYS THIS PLACE IT SO GOOD THE PEOPLE THE FOOD THE WTMOSPHRRE ARE ALL TOP TEIR PLEASE COME VISIT THE FOOD LITERALLY CURED MY ANAREXIA AND IT MADE ME GALLOP IN JOY ALSO THIS ONE WORKER SHES VERY BEAITIFUS IF YOU GUYS COME YOU GOTTA VISIT HER !  ANYWAYS EVERYONE WAS SO NICE THEY SMILED SO SWEETLY AND THEIR PEARLY WHITES WERE ALL SO WHITE AND YEAH PLS VISIT THIS PLACE IS AMAZINGGGG
Great bar with amazing decor. with delicious cocktails and attentive staff. Really enjoyed the ‘amber’ cocktail and will be back soon
Rhys is a seriously knowledgable mixologist, gave us a good variety tasting options and was phenomenally entertaining. A good time was had by all.

This venue exceeded my expectations in every way. We reserved the bar for a 21st birthday celebration and were blown away by the excellent cocktails, food and atmosphere. The owners, Jay and Mon, provided incredible support throughout the event. Their exceptional service and top-notch cocktails made it the perfect spot for a night out with friends. I strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a great venue, whether you're from out of town or just looking for a spot to grab drinks before heading out on the town.
If you like sweet taste, don't miss what kitie wants, it will be the most unforgettable and wonderful experience about cocktails. Amazing artistic cocktail, deserves a try
Jay was an expert behind the bar, and provided amazing conversation. Prices were reasonable, especially for the high quality of drinks
Absolutely spectacular drinks, with great atmosphere and very well designed. The owner was very charming and made our night!

A classic Mexican food truck (caravan really). Fast and delicious, it's everything it looks like it should be. I had the chicken Burrito with added guacamole and it brought me right back to the Mission in San Fran or my favourite Burrito places in Dublin. At $10 a burrito it's pretty good value too.
They have a good take away Indian cuisines.They have good service and the lady in the counter is humble and nice.
Simply Amazing
Every weekend we go there & every time it’s beyond our expectations Loved paneer momos a lot
Amritsari fish 100% recommended     it was original taste
Lovely food the Soya chaap tasted like India o would remember this dinner for life
Great taste! Must try - Chicken Tikka & Malai Chaap & Tandoori Paneer.
I and my friends order chicken roll. Amazing experience! LOVED IT
Very yummy food. Would recommend.
Lovely little place with quiet, friendly atmosphere & delicious food full of classic & interesting flavours. The duck & homemade pickles were brilliant (and the hotpot (and the beer)). Cheers
Best Japanese in chch
Quiet experience, family friendly, lovely food and prompt service
It was a bit too long for the waiting and also a bit stingy when we asked for chili powder as we spent quite a lot, but they were not generous and not enough staff
We just live around the corner and decided to come in for dinner. Very cosy atmosphere and the food was absolutely delicious. Service was friendly and helpful.

I recently visited Tony’s Teppanyaki in Ferrymead, Christchurch, and I was extremely disappointed. The restaurant advertises itself as an all-you-can-eat experience, but it felt like a SCAM. The price had recently changed without any notice, and it wasn’t mentioned when we arrived. We were seated from 5:30 pm to about 7:10 pm and only received about one and a half rounds of food. When we asked for more, the service was painfully slow. There were only four staff members: two chefs cooking, one chef running around, and one lady handling drinks and seating. With just five tables occupied, there’s no reason the service should have been that poor. On top of that, the portions were smaller compared to Tony’s in Riccarton, and the whole experience was frustrating. If you claim to be all-you-can-eat, you should actually deliver that not make customers wait ages for minimal food. Overall, this felt misleading and disappointing. I would not recommend the Ferrymead location at all.

Have eaten here often, but have never been as disappointed as we were tonight. Service very slow. Our drinks sat on the counter for nearly 20 mins before being brought to us. 3/4 hr before getting out first dish. Fish had no taste. Asked for fried rice and received boiled rice. Other tables not cleared after guests left. Had the "all you could eat" and were told we could only have 1 extra dish each, waited for 30 mins and still didn't receive it. Use to be good value but not now. Staff had very poor understanding of English language.Won't be returning.
Absolutely delicious  the desert was amazing
Excellant food and service, will be back
I love having my Japanese food here, the All you can eat is great value...

So far waiting for our food for 45’…  Before going I read the reviews and was hoping they weren’t right…  Plenty of people had jackets on, it was quite cold, the waiting time was way too long before and in between dishes, no ambience music. The food was very salty and they run out of rice so had to wait for a new batch.  I understand business may be tough and you may be trying to survive and I wish you good luck. Your saving grace was the very very attentive and lovely waitress. She is a star.

Not the teppenyaki experience. The wait staff gave amazing service, and the food was delicious with generous portions. But the chefs did not engage with us at all like we expect for a teppenyaki meal. For $50 pp its an expensive meal when you don't get the show/atmosphere that teppenyaki is famous for.
Always a great service. Staff apologised for the delay in food (wasn’t even that long) and offered a free dessert as an apology.  Best restaurant in Chch.
From Las Vegas and we get a lot is sushi options.  This place is very good, friendly and fresh.

Brilliant restaurant !! Meals are cooked in front of you!! Prices are brilliant, you definitely get a generous amount for what you pay for. Amazing experience, definitely bring the kids along as they will love it ! Great service, nice layout, beautiful and delicious meals. Would %100 recommend!!

These guys never fail to get it right. Highly recommend the Lava Roll it's superb. Bookings are a good idea as they get super busy from 7. They also have an all you can eat option Monday-Thursday which is great value for money. The place to go for consistent food & service
Outstanding food, extremely good service. The place was not that busy which means the single cook, waiter, cocktail mixer could give all his attention to us. Exemplary
Excellent food and service! We ordered the braised beef cheeks, keto steak and French toast for dessert.  Thank you, Kanav and to your staff. It was a great dining experience.

Lovely brunch. The food was all delicious so hard to pick out highlights but I did love the beetroot hummus, and the catch of the day fish dish (sol was cooked very well). The owner was gracious throughout. Would highly recommend!
Town Tonic never fails at giving great service And fabulous food. Beef cheek for lunch was amazing and we all lived our experience.
Lovely mela and great service
Great place for a lovely breakfast, food and coffee was great. Good vibes

With chefs who’ve worked in a myriad of hotel kitchens the quality of the food from Town Tonic is balanced and fun in its flavours and presentation. The attention, friendliness and care offered by the staff makes this a great place to eat in Addington whether breakfast, lunch or dinner. PS great coffee too

Town Tonic was once a nice restaurant. We used to come here almost every week and always enjoyed the service and food. However, a few months ago a new owner decided to show up. Every day was a different food eg. Carrots this was very lame and boring especially that we couldn't order our ordinary food. This started to get worse when we saw the manager of the restaurant spying at other restaurants eg. Mexico. This place is definitely not worth your time or money.

Most disappointing dining experience to date. Promised so much but delivered very little. The restaurant decor was nice. The service was terrible. The waitress was unapproachable & had a bit of a attitude (worst thing is I am sure she was the duty manager). My friend asked what was gluten-free as she can get severely sick from ingesting gluten- this comment was not well received & she was told to read the menu. The menu did not say whether the fish was dredged in flour! The potato skins promised truffle but sadly there was none. The main meals were good. The dessert was very lack lustre. The PBJ was average- only redeeming part was the raspberry sorbet. My friend got the ice-cream sandwich which was inedible. You needed a pick-axe to even attempt it. The part we could try was the ice-cream but only a small bit we managed to chip off. It was icy!! What was the chef thinking even plating this up! The sponge was rock solid. My friend paid for it & all the chef said that if we'd said something about it, they could've fixed it. We did but the waitress didn't care. And let's be real- there was no saving that dessert. So if you want an below average meal with terrible service and pay plenty of $$$ for the experience, please be Town Tonic's next guest. All I can say is diner beware!!

A few of us stumbled on this place a couple of months ago and we all really enjoyed the service and food. So a month later I tried to book to find the pate I was wanting had to be made the day before. So last Monday I thought I'd get in early & was pleased the chief answered,who clearly was busy & not bothered with my questions but I still requested and booked in the pate for 4 of us & stated we were coming in for a 2nd attempt for pate on the Thursday. Anyway 15 mins b4 the booking my gut feeling said ring and check and confirm. To my horror they only had enough for one. So 4 people 2 times have missed out on my business. I won't be back even though it is convenient for Me and my parents.

Visited Town Tonic on a Saturday morning around 10 am, and unlike most Chch brunch places, the place was barely alive with only four other patrons. I was a little nervous, but we chose to stay and were seated at a tall top table by the window. I suppose the crew that visited Town Tonic into the wee hours of the morning were still sleeping off their hangovers.   Our waiter was a little quirky, but friendly and efficient. We ordered an americano and a trim flat white. They both arrived quickly.  The menu is very concise which makes choosing your entree easy. There are your breakfast classics: muesli or french toast, but the rest of the menu features eclectic specialty items that are impeccably prepared: Mexican Salad, Duck Liver, French Sardines, vegetarian options or the Gourmet Croque Madame.  The croque madame was served on thick slices of bread with prosciutto "really good cheese" (their words, not mine), mustard all drowned in truffle oil with a fried egg on top. If you're not a true fan of truffle oil, this sandwhich will be a bit overwhelming by the second half, but the first half will be amazing. I ate every bite.  The large hot breakfast looked like something straight from a mexican restaurant: Mushrooms, potatoes with jalapeños, tomatoes, a fried egg. My husband licked the plate clean and said this is one of his all time favorite meals in Christchurch (he didn't even save me a bite).   We were very pleased with our breakfast option and recommend this joint to anyone in the area to check out for breakfast, lunch, dinner or drinks!

This is a cute little family business that maximizes use of their modest space with high quality European foods--everything from canned and packaged products to meat goods for wonderful dinner parties to cheeses, tarts, and meat pies for park picnics. The owners are incredibly friendly with infectious smiles. This business is well worth a visit, or two, or three.

Wow!  The duck pate is to die for.  And guess what - it only has duck liver, butter, brandy, orange peel, and spices!  IE no modified food starch, stabilizers, or other cr*p.  Yowza - the real thing!  If you like good, wholesome deli foods (cured meats, pates, raw cheese, etc) come by here.  And did I mention the pastries?

Avoiding Asian food due to visiting there the next week, I found this restaurant within walking distance of my hotel. Inside was cozy, as the fireplace was decorated for Christmas. How pretty!   I told the waitress to "bring me something sweet and white," for a wine, and that she did. There are two sizes of wine offered (see lines on your glass), and I chose the smaller one. I was brought riesling (see photo), which was light, sweet, and had a clean finish. It was just what I wanted!   I give 3 stars because of the spaghetti carbonara. It was quite oily, and the balance of pasta vs the mushrooms and bacon was not correct. My bowl was still 1/3 full of the other stuff even though I'd finished the pasta. Furthermore, the top layer of parmesan melted and hardened, to the point of being inedible. If you're Italian, you may want to ask for no cheese on top since this isn't done in Italy (at least where I was in Rome, Florence, etc).  I also ordered the side of salad greens. I wasn't told it came with dressing or what kind (normally don't eat dressing), so I was surprised to see a brown gravy-like substance on top. It turned out to be a balsamic vinegar based dressing, but be sure to specify if you're particular about dressing.   I wouldn't mind coming here again but also wouldn't mind skipping this place next time. My whole meal cost $42, including the wine. On to the next!

We had a very good experience enjoying the food, atmosphere and service equally.  The staff was welcoming, friendly and provided excellent and timely service with a smile. The food, from starter thru main dish, was well prepared, quite tasty and nicely presented. Will recommend.
Good selection of Sauvignon Blancs. Enjoyed two choices. Bluff oysters were on special when I was there, and these were also good. Lots of menus options to choose from.

Got off train in Christchurch at just after 7pm, Saturday evening.  This place had high reviews on Trip Advisor.  We were not impressed. The service eh, we have had better. Trust me we have eaten at quite a few places since we have been traveling. We ate outside and the manager couldn't get the heater to work so no heat. The Long Island Ice Tea didn't do the trick either!! I mean so people get heated up when drinking. It didn't happen for me at all. We were served our food and the waitstaff person did not even check on us. We had to chase her down for our dinner tab. My husband had the spaghetti and I had the ribs.

Trevinos is a great place for a night out or dinner.  Despite the wonky floor that makes you feel like you've had a few too many. The atmosphere is brilliant especially on a Friday or Saturday night. The menu has an excellent variety of dishes with daily specials too.  Gambas al ajillio.(Spanish style Gallic shrimp) for starter, a personal favourite of mine, took me back to Spain it was exquisite. The beef cheeks for main were cooked to perfection. Everyone at are table couldn't fault the food. Service was also excellent extremely attentive some might think too much so but enjoyed it. Wine menu could have been better but that's my only complaint and not a big one.

Came for a drink with a friend and then got tempted by the dessert menu. Was a decision I was happy with as their sticky date pudding with caramel sauce is Delicious! We both agreed our next dinner out will be here as everyone's meals around us looked amazing

This was a great little spot for our Christmas Eve in Christchurch. The wines and meals were wonderfully. I had a salmon chowder and lamb shanks for dinner. Both were made deliciously.   Service was great as well.

I have been looking for slow cooked lamb shank for several days and now I found it. Very tender as should be expected from a slow braise. The blueberries in the lemon posset pudding dessert tasted awful as if dehydrated. Service ok but could use some polish

restaurant: Tussock Hill Vineyard and Cellar Door Restaurant

reviews.text: Such a unique menu and every dish had exquisite flavours. Truly our favourite spot this trip, even beating Queenstown. The beef short rib was unreal! Attentive and prompt service as well.
It was our first visit to their restaurant. Must say the food was so great and the staff were very friendly and very professional. We would highly recommend this place.
SO GOOD!!! :D if you haven’t already been book now! You won’t believe you are still in Christchurch as felt like we were on a special holiday! Service and food were impeccable too!!!
Was just a pleasure. Sunny chch day. Brilliant food. Friendly service. Crudo so good we had to order another.

I am so delighted that I booked Tussock Hill for a very special birthday lunch. The chefs choice lunch set menu was just sensational. We could not fault one dish, and in fact we were so pleasantly surprised with sensational quality throughout. The service was perfect and we will definitely be back again!
Wow simply stunning Food Service and atmosphere shared plates divine will definitely go back I wouldn't walk to it either...

Truly an exceptional experience! A spur of the moment treat for us, but make sure you book ahead for a window table!  Utterly fabulous staff; personable, knowledgeable and passionate. The food sublime. Exquisite dishes crafted to perfection. Beautiful and entirely original blendings of the very best local ingredients. The sum of each dish greater than it's individual elements.  I am very much looking forward to a special occasion to indulge in the Chefs Choice.  Absolutely Fabulous!
This place was amazing and the oysters are to die for! Will definitely be back again.

Had a wonderful meal here . We had the tagliatelle in seafood sauce , fried calamari and the Tiramisu for dessert. We were visiting Christchurch would recommend this restaurant. Would recommend making reservations we had to wait inspite of reservations this place is busy Thursday nights too .
Lovely little Italian triattoria.  We were in Italy last year and the food here reminds us of what we had in Italy.  Molto Bene!!

A bustling little spot with solid food! We went during peak dinner hours on a Tuesday, so street parking was a bit tight and we ended up having to park down a side street and walk a bit, but not too much of a problem. We didn't have a reservation so we were seated at a counter and then later moved to a table.   The highlight was definitely the tiramisu --delicious and served with a little scoop of gelato as well. The penne carbonara was also cooked well and tasty. The cannelloni was decent but really packed with spinach --could've used a bit more of the cheese mixed in to balance out the flavor. The burrata appetizer was not my favorite as the inside of the cheese was not very soft and runny.   The service was decent throughout and the prices were about what I would expect for the area.
Food service very slow. It was explained to me as I ordered an entree you have to wait extra long for your main. Food didn't have a very authentic Italian taste. Won't be going back.

We visited on a Monday night and the restaurant was packed! Smelled great as soon as we walked in. I ordered the spaghetti Roberto (spicy Italian sausage, chicken meatballs, and red sauce) and my boyfriend ordered the beef cheek gnocchi. Both were delicious, probably one of the best meals we ate during our two week trip around the South Island.  Service was relatively quick as well. It was so good that we ordered the pizza bread appetizer after our meal. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Christchurch!

We requested a table for 20 - were seated in three sets of 6/7, 30 minutes late  One waiter (with glasses) was rude and condescending towards guests upon requesting menu alterations. Then continued to act in a rude, unenthused and to be honest, a can't be f***ed attitude.  Then finally upon requesting a take away box, the waiter returned and poked me with the box.. grow up mate.

Tutto Bene is located in a suburb of Christchurch called Merivale. We searched the neighbourhood and found only pubs and one expensive restaurant. At Tutto Bene we were greeted warmly. The menu is typical Italian (more than adequate for us) as well as lamb, beef and fish. The food was delicious and presented elegantly. Service was superb. Ambiance 5 out of 5. Affordable prices. Their BYO policy contributed to a very nice evening.

Waited 55 minutes for my mains to be served. Other tables that came and ordered after my table had been served and left. I feel very disappointed. Made a booking for 7.45pm. Only ended up getting our meals at 8.30 or so. Would probably never go back there.

This used to be our go to Italian restaurant in ChCh. Unfortunately the meal service left a lot to be desired. The service was not good. Drinks service was slow. People did not arrive together and people were left waiting forever for drinks service. There were 9 at the table, food was ordered including starters. Only 1 garlic bread was delivered, 1 was missing. After reminding the server that 2 breads had been ordered the 2nd was delivered at the same time as 2 of the mains. Where are the rest of the mains? We start eating the 2 mains then woops! Those meals were meant for another table. The meals were taken away and we were promised 2 fresh meals would come out with this rest of the mains. The meals came out but the 2 meals were returned same as they departed. The tail of a prawn that had been eaten was still on the plate, and the scallops had not been reinstated. What a disaster.
Fun, busy Italian place. Nice outdoor patio. Attentive owner was helpful and accommodating. Great selection of pizzas. Nice pastas with local seafood as well.

Wanted a quick but great meal and definitely delivered. We had veal, fish and venison. We were impressed! The meals were rich, tasteful and unique. The NZ Chardonnay were definitely worth the $$$. We decided to buy as the corkage was $10.50 per person which was a bit rich.

We were traveling thru Christchurch for 2 days, and on our first evening in town, we discovered Tutto Bene. We had never been before, and it was fantastic. I had the pasta special, which was "homemade fettuccine verde with braised octopus in a chilli, garlic and tomato sauce."  The noodles were excellent and the flavor in the sauce was incredible. You could tell that all of it was homemade from someone who knew what they were doing. The octopus paired well with the sauce; it was like they were meant to be together. If I ever pass thru Christchurch again, I would visit this spot again.   We didn't get the pizza, but we saw some at the tables around us and they looked amazing too.

Tutto is not Bene, unfortunately. I was here with my wife for Christmas Day dinner. Our shrimp appetizer was okay but overcooked. My wife had rack of lamb as main and it was overcooked. Nothing on my venison dish was properly cooked. Meatballs, venison horribly overcooked. Beans on the side - undercooked. Tiramisu was great, fortunately!   If you want to come here it might be best to stock to pasta and pizza and not feel too adventurous.

What can I say,all I heard was good things about this restaurant so I decided to try it. The first thing is the place,I loved it,it really looked like an Italian trattoria,it also has a great atmosphere. The food was very bad,hubby and I had a pasta  arrabiata and a it was very bad,it was extremely over cooked. I had a pizza Margerita,which did not taste of anything.It was very bland.

I would arguably say this is the best pizza joint in all of Christchurch. The place is always hopping come dinner time, so I definitely recommend a booking. In the summer months they have "dining al Fresco" in their back courtyard. Though it is tucked under umbrellas and right along a little creek, it is patio seating in a parking lot by dumpsters. Not totally my thing. However, the rest of the restaurant has plenty of seating for groups or intimate date settings as well as casual tables up front.   The pizza is FANTASTIC. The Cantadina, Margherita, Pollo Pesto and Quattro Formaggi are among my favorites. Di Carne and Umbria are my partner's. He prefers bold flavors like black olives and meat while I am after the cheese and basil. My dad has ordered the traditional spaghetti (bolognese) and our whole family had to dig in and eat some of it. The Della Casa salad is a great salad to split to add some more greens to the meal. The waiters will gladly help you pair a great wine with your meal if you ask.  The service is efficient as they need to keep the tables turning over and if you call for takeaway, as I do frequently, the order will be ready in 20 minutes. Though the price is a bit steep for a pizza, you have to remember that you're paying for the best (and the cost of overhead in Merivale). This is a great date night spot or a great place to order takeaway for your family on a weekday night. The food is quality every single time and made with love, the true Italian way.

I've eaten here a number of times. It can be busy and noisy but the food is always good. Serving sizes are generous. I particularly like the Funghi Ripieni (appetiser) and the salmon pizza. The menu is varied and extensive and you are sure to find something that appeals.   Service can be a little hit and miss when the place is crowded. A booking is strongly recommended. There is good wine list but they do BYO as well so be sure to hit up the Fresh Choice across the road at Merivale Mall which has a decent wine selection.

Quick service & friendly waitresses. Gnocchi a bit salty, otherwise everyone enjoyed their spaghetti bolognese, salmon pasta, salmon pizza, calamari, vege pasta & polenta fingers. Tiramisu was excellent as was the caramel cheesecake!

: My goodness. The BEST Italian food we've had in Ōtautahi so far. The dough for the pizzas and flatbread is so airy and soft, the sauces on everything were divine and the gnocchi?!   : We've been coming here for years and the service is always so exceptional! You really feel like family when you dine here   Follow Foodie Mama NZ on Instagram for more reviews

We love coming here, every time we visit Christchurch it is a must. However it just didn’t hit the mark. Table by the door with exposed plumbing pipe & curtain/cable ties & salad drenched in balsamic vinegar put me off.

We had a dinner at Tutto Bene on Friday night. Reserved a table over the phone without any issues. Staffs are friendly and food is delicious. We tried seafood pasta and Vegan Fettuccine - both are yummy . Overall great experience.
Gorgeous meals, staff are friendly and engaging. Went back a second time in one week!

We went to an amazing Italian restaurant, Tutto Benne, and absolutely loved it! We tried their pizzas and the flatbread pesto — both were perfectly cooked in a woodfire oven. You’ve got to try the Garlic Prawns Pizza — it’s incredible!  The Italian music, cozy vibe, friendly service, and delicious food made the whole experience special. They open from 5 pm to 8 pm, and I think reservations are a must. The prices are a little on the higher side, but definitely worth it for the quality and experience.  They also have a Monday and Tuesday deal — 2 selected drinks and 1 pizza for $45. A must-visit spot if you love authentic Italian pizzas!

I ordered the arancini balls and rissitto to takeaway. When I got home I was disappointed with the food portion of the rissoto and I still felt hungry after. It's not what I expect after paying $55. I will not be ordering it again.

Always a pleasure to dine at the Twenty Seven Steps. The staff is very welcoming and knowledgeable, the food is fresh, everything home made (including the deserts, which is very rare in Christchurch). Completely unpretentious and tasty, visibly using local, seasonal and fresh ingredients only. In the middle of Regents street, so a great spot to start the night away from the more crowded and pricey Oxford terrace.
Excellent food and superb service.

Delicious food and great service. I ordered venison, my first time trying it and it was beautifully cooked and absolutely delicious. Our waitress was very attentive, and I really enjoyed the whole experience. I even walked out without paying because I was so relaxed after the meal. The staff kindly caught me downstairs to remind me. I blame the cocktail and yummy meal !  Highly recommend

We have dined at Twenty Seven Steps at least 4 times since coming to Christchurch 6 months ago. The food is always superb, the service friendly and excellent and the atmosphere always buzzing with always a full restaurant. My Venison was cooked to tender perfection - venison can easily be a bit tough when rare, but never here. My partner's fish also done perfectly (and no problem with his allergy to pepper .... easily dealt with). Then the sticky toffee pudding ....... yum! We will be back again and again.

This was my first dinner during my vacation in Christchurch, and it was absolutely fantastic. The staff were incredibly warm and friendly, and the food was delicious. A perfect dining experience, I'm really happy.

A warm greeting followed by a delicious dinner served by friendly happy servers .... What more can you want ?? I had read about their duck parfait app which to my dismay was not on the menu that night !!! A quiet inquiry and lo &behold , the duck parfait app was delicious !!! Squad leader had a tenderloin and i had rack o lamb in a delicious veg succotash. A delicious meal w/ exemplary service mere steps from Fable Christchurch Hotel. . Highly recommend

Twenty Seven Steps - what a spot! Intimate space in a lovely location with great service, expansive wine selection and they are happy to make you a tasty mocktail that suits your palate.   Now... the food. Epic. Seasonal. Simple. Divine. I started with their marinated tomato salad which was fresh and flavorful. Entree was the steak with potato, onion rings and veggies - absolutely incredible. Naturally I had to save room for dessert and landed on the vanilla crème brûlée (though all the options sounded amazing). It came with fresh fruit and pistachio biscotti and was a great way to round out the meal.   I would come back here again and again and again. Bravo!!

Visited here while on my stop in Christchurch. Easily the best meal I had in town. They're on the second floor, above their sister restaurant, Downstairs. Upon being seated, the server was extremely thorough going over the menu and offered excellent recommendations. I got the duck liver pate and their lamb. Both were incredible, especially the duck liver pate. Will definitely be back if I'm in town again

Everything in here was amazing! One of my favorite places!  The service is top-notch. They are so attentive and flexible depending on the needs of the table.  The food is always on point and priced reasonably. Cute 2nd story location, in a bit of a smaller space but the tables are spaced appropriately and comfortably away from other guests.  Make sure to make reservations as they do get quite busy.
Cool atmosphere, great service, and the good food. The soup and monkfish was delicious!
Everything really.  Staff very friendly but that venison meal was just superb  I am booking real early next time to make I can get a table  :)

really wonderful restaurant and wine bar. they have a changing menu that has very unique creations. staff is super friendly and welcoming. sadly i don't live near here, otherwise i would've been here all the time!

It's a pretty fully booked place and it's almost impossible to get in without a booking. Luckily enough, the sister restaurant downstairs allowed us to sit down but still order from upstairs.  The food is okay I guess. I was way too hyped about it so it was a bit let down that the food didn't live up to my hype. It wasn't the restaurants fault. The service is really good. Food wise, it's not bad at all but I wouldn't necessarily come back again cos it's just fine. But not like Wow kinda food.

Grilled peach salad was exceptional only to be topped by the Monkfish. Excellent sauces, exquisite mix of veggies & greens. The dark chocolate hazelnut tort -  delicious. Lovely setting & excellent service. Highly recommend.

Don't get this place confused with the sister restaurant downstairs. Twenty Seven Steps is upstairs (and ONLY upstairs). Tiny place so reservations are highly recommended. I wasn't able to make one but they were able to squeeze me in (party of one) if I finished in less than an hour which I did. Seating is a little cramped in some areas but I appreciate them for trying to accommodate as may guests as they can. Food is fantastic and high quality and pricing is fair. Portions are adequate and I was stuffed. Service is standard.
Very tasty. Great service. Nice environment.      Strong recommended!  Too many characters need to do.
This darling little restaurant serves fantastic food and very good wine. Reservations are a must! The vegetarian offerings are always excellent, which I appreciate.
Have to thank ChatGTP for the recommendation. What a cute little restaurant with fantastic food. Definitely make a reservation as this place gets busy.

Excellent dinner. You go upstairs to the restaurant which was a wee bit of a surprise as downstairs is merely a waiting area. Stater we had a superb "special" duck pate and fir main I had a wonderful fresh pea risotto, my partner loved the lamb rack. Sticky dare pudding was easily big enough to share and yummy too. Will be back for sure.
Great place hidden upstairs from Main Street of New Regent St. wonderful food and great ambience. Well worth the visit.
This restaurant and the food was amazing. I highly recommend it. Our waiter was Dean and he was extremely attentive and made great food recommendations. This was our best dinner in New Zealand.

This restaurant will not disappoint you. Before going I searched Yelp and found Twenty Seven Steps with super ratings/reviews. The appearance of the restaurant is a bit underwhelming but that just added to its appeal. We had the mushroom risotto and grouper, their fish of the day. Both dishes were excellent and cooked to perfection. The staff was friendly and very efficient. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Alright so I hate to be the dissenter but this place was just ok for me. The food tasted great but the portions were exceeding small. I got the lamb rack which was four pieces, each with meat about the size of a cherry tomatoe (see picture). There was a small serving of potatoes and a meatball as well with veggies. At $42, it was definitely overpriced. I have had bigger portions at about half the price for the same taste elsewhere in NZ. The service was hectic and spotty. I think they may have taken the modern European thing a bit too far.

Lamb kidney surprised us the most. Rich flavor, well combined, please order one if you feel like trying something new today. Beef fillet is above average. Overall the food was good, but seatings are all very close to each other. You can easily get bumped by people walking by.

My wife and I recently had a nice dinner at Twenty Seven Steps. During our visit I ordered the White Onion, Cider & Apple Soup, the Roast Canterbury Lamb Rack, and the Black Forest & Dark Chocolate Delice. The soup was rich, flavorful, and lightly sweet. The lamb was juicy and tender and paired with a seasoned meatball, savory mashed potatoes, and tender veggies. The chocolate delice featured rich chocolate, fresh juicy strawberries and cherries, and creamy ice cream. Overall, Twenty Seven Steps is a quality spot for a nice dinner.
This was a real treat during my visit to New Zealand and Christchurch in particular.  Delicious and unique flavors.  Wait staff very helpful and friendly.

Our daughter made this reservation for us while visiting New Zealand and we are so happy she did!  It's not easy to find, but oh so worth it.  My husband had the Venison and I had the Lamb.  Both were cooked to perfection.  Our wine from the region was perfect, too.  Service was amazing too.  If you visit Christchurch, New Zealand, you must eat here, however, make sure you make reservations, since it's always full.

Sometimes I am completely surprised by how good restaurant is when it looks more like a bistro - this was one of those times. During our visit to Christchurch we found several interesting places to eat and wanted to make our last night special by choosing this locally well rated restaurant.   As the name suggests, you enter by climbing 27 steps to find a very small space with minimalist furnishings of very simple tables and chairs. A small complete bar is to your right as you enter - we were quickly seated at a postage stamp sized table. The menu is basically what the chef fancies to prepare for dinner - so on-line menus just list items that are basic rather than recommended for each evening. I enjoy one of the best prepared filet Mignons I have eaten in a long time and shared some of my wife's risotto and a house made bread to make a wonderful tasting meal! Although they were very busy, our server took her time with us to ensure we got the best of what they had to offer - including a very tasty Pinot Noir fro the region.   Highly recommend and will be back!

Very popular and thus crowded Christchurch bistro, upstairs (27 steps--get it?) from the pedestrian restaurant street. Good but not memorable food. The usual friendly and sincere New Zealand service. It was an enjoyable dinner.

Delicious food and lovely atmosphere upstairs on New Regent St. However, the waitress we had tonight was very abrupt and did not seem very genuine at all. I know it can be tiring working in hospitality but we did not feel like valued customers even though we were paying the $$$ prices. We were hurried through our entree and main, and the request of dessert was hurried. We said no to dessert as we weren't ready, and the bill immediately came to the table. We hadn't finished our drinks and felt like we were just being pushed out the door. We had a reservation by the way, 6pm, Sunday night. Hardly a peak busy night where they are trying to turn people through quickly. Otherwise service was prompt and "polite" enough. But not warm or inviting.  Anyway - if you've made it this far - the food was so lovely! I had pan seared scollops with pork belly and a perfectly cooked beef fillet with potato gratin.  4 stars because of the waitress's attitude.

I enjoyed a fabulous dinner with family and friends here. We booked the second sitting (7.30pm) and were seated at a very nice table. There is a blackboard menu and menus on the table, then staff make sure they explain the dishes also - this is very helpful as people receive information in different ways, a good idea. We enjoyed marvellous food - entrees were Scallops, Soup and Pork, then main courses were Angus steak, Venison and Risotto - all were served beautifully and totally divine. We were treated with friendly but professional and respectful service throughout the evening. The serving staff, particularly Natalie, were thoroughly delightful. Natalie paid particular attention to my brother, whose birthday we were there to celebrate. Thank you - I look forward to coming again.

Call. If you can't get through, email. But if you are a foodie and you're in Christchurch, EAT HERE. The food is spectacular. The chef prepares interesting, locally sourced masterpieces paired with an excellent wine list.  The two appetizers (entrees for our friends from everywhere else) we chose were a scallop special and the calamari. Both were creative, smart and delicious.  The mains were a special risotto of pears and spring onions and ricotta that tasted so much like freshness on a plate, and the venison special, which melted in our mouths.  Dessert (embarrassing, I know, that we kept eating) was a blood orange crème brûlée that we just couldn't resist. Service was attentive and fun. Decor is minimal and chic. Get here. Don't miss it.

We just happened upon this place during our visit, and last stop, in Christchurch. it seemed slow in dead on the first floor but we were led up to the second floor and saw how packed and lively it was! We decided to split three courses, all were exceptional. The first course we ordered were are the sautéed lamb kidneys, something neither of us have had before and it was so flavorful very tender. We have been so impressed with the meat in New Zealand so we ordered the aged Canterbury 200g beef cooked medium rare. Wow. You will taste nothing like this in the United States. Highly recommend!!!! For dessert, we ordered one of their seasonal selections which had a confit pear, ice cream, caramel popcorn, and praline. All plated so beautifully.

If you don't have a reservation, come early because they are packed (and with good reason). The food was HEAVENLY - I had the risotto of the day and will dream about it for years to come. The scallops were phenomenal and juicy, I would highly recommend them. The salmon pâté was also delicious. Overall, one of the best meals I've ever had.

Recommend reservations if you want to attend here. I would give it 6 out of five. The food is sublime and both meals we ordered was as fresh as could be and melted in the mouth. The before dinner bread was so perfectly soft it was like cake. Very nice asthetic to this place and yes its romantic. Meals are higher priced around $40 dollars but you see where the money goes in the quality. Very popular.

The meals were superb and they were extremely flexible and accommodating with our dietary needs.The staff was very freindly and professional and service was excellent. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

This restaurant is great for vegetarians too!  We started with a salad.  Had the risotto and a plate with a whole slow roasted beet, smoked shredded potato, cashew cream and greens.  It was magnificent and tasted so much better than it reads.  Menu changes based on freshest available.  I would trust them to always create something fantastic.  Great selection of wines by the glass with knowledgeable servers.  Service and atmosphere are relaxed, comfortable and professional.  I would go back right now for the same dishes.
Our whole party of 4. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal. Risotto, lamb x2, fish. Topped it off with a bottle of wine from Hawkes Hill.

We had one meal in Christchurch before leaving the next morning for home and I'm so glad we chose 27 Steps. We walked in at the opening time of 5pm as we didn't have reservations and for the entire hour we were there a handful of tables were seated during that time; Pro Tip: have an early dinner! We had the scallop and chorizo app, 300g rib eye special, and a couple cocktails. The star of the show was the Rib Eye with duck fat and horseradish cream; I have lived in the Midwest US for the past 5 years and I thought it was in definite competition with steak I have had in the meat Mecca, which is saying a lot. Sadly we didn't stay for dessert but they had several that I considered, get one so I can live vicariously thru you.

We made reservation for Friday night for 3. Depsite the place being pretty busy, service was great.  They start you off with wonderfully fresh sourdough pumpkin hummus bread.  They also had a pretty extensive wine list with delicious selections!  The most delicious part of our meal was the chargrilled chicory, cauliflower, dates with a coconut yogurt (tasted like lemon ricotta cheese) and organic greens.    We also had the soup or the day - which was yam with spinach and buttermilk topped with amazing pesto. Delicious and warm - perfect for a cold night. We alsohad the special appetizer of the day - scallops with chorizo. The scallops were a tad small - but I always feel like restaurants overcharge for scallops - so this was somewhat to be expected. We finished off with the beef fillet with vegetables, potato and Yorkshire pudding.  The beef fillet was cooked perfectly and since we got the leaner cut of meat, they added camembert cheese - yum!

Nice atmosphere and recommendation for the Pinot Noir. Servers were very friendly and the lamb was delicious. Came on a Tuesday night at 6pm and it was nearly empty. Highly recommend if you want to have a nice, quiet weekday dinner at a good local restaurant.

Had a fantastic meal here. I got the lamb and hubby got the steak--all were delicious and paired wonderfully with wine by our server. Service was also fantastic, friendly, and very knowledgeable about the food, wine, and the general area. Would definitely go back if in the area again!

We dined here on our first evening in Christchurch. Reservations are recommended. The restaurant is located upstairs. There is a bar on the lower level as well as a small one upstairs. They serve fresh homemade bread! Your first serving is complementary with your meal order. Otherwise you are charged for second helpings. The food was fresh and delicious. The specials are wonderful. Everything from the starters all the way to the dessert was superb! If we come to NZ again we will definitely come back!  Great Date place!

I was lucky to get a table when I walked in around 5:45pm. The restaurant wasn't too busy then but within 15 minutes it was packed! You definitely need a reservation, especially if you're coming in after 6pm.  They start you off with a thick piece of herby bread and butter and a jug of lemon water. To drink I tried a glass of the "skin ferment" wine, which I'd never heard of, but the servers insisted it was worth a try. It has a reddish orangey color, kind of like rum punch. And it tastes a bit like fruit juice or cider. It wasn't bad! I don't know that I would order it again with dinner, but it could be a fun drink-outside-with-your-friends wine, like rosé's cousin.  For dinner I went with the herb crusted salmon over a bed of roasted potatoes, tomatoes, and capers. It was pretty good, but I wasn't able to finish it. The salmon portion was huge and it was just drenched in herbs; too much for my taste. The potatoes and tomatoes were on point though!  Service is friendly, but slow. It took awhile for my order to be taken, and my wine came after my food.   Overall a decent dinner. I'd be curious to try some of their other dishes.

The place is always packed so book ahead. But certainly worth the wait if you don't mind. The food was top notch - we had the beetroot soup which was beyond belief. Everything we ordered - including bread - was Michelin worthy. Highly recommended. Not the perfect place for dates though as it gets quite busy and a bit loud for romantic conversations.

This place is delish. We have been here a few times and I've liked everything we have ordered! The wine is good and I didn't feel it was super overpriced.  I'm not a big lamb fan but when my fiancé got it, I had to try. It was cooked well, melt in your mouth, and not overly lamby. I know that sounds weird but I find lamb has a very strong, pungent taste.  Definitely a must when on new regent street and Christchurch CBD in general. Just don't count the steps and you won't be disappointed.
Incredible rack of lamb. Probably the best I've had! Great service, ambience and presentation. Highly recommended, even if you find yourself in Christchurch for a day or so.

Wow! So many good things to say about this place. Definitely make a reservation as it is a cozy place with limited seating.   To begin, the decor is adorable and welcoming; the staff is super friendly and attentive; and the seating is comfortable and cozy.   I sat alone, but had great conversation with the different staff. One of my servers discussed my wine tastes before letting me try two before settling on a glass. Both of her picks were spot on AND she let me know that a bottle was open that was not normally open so I could try a glass of that, as well. Really great service there.   Let's start with the bread- homemade heaven with butter. Crumbles in your mouth. I don't normally eat bread- this bread is bomb.  I was having trouble deciding on the menu since everything that was delivered near me looked and smelled amazing.   I settled on the roasted red capsicum tomato and red onion soup with got cheese, terragon and lemon creme fraiche. While not a fan of goat cheese (AT ALL) this was a delight hunt of flavor in a wonderful soup. It's light and creamy but still satisfying and bursting with flavor. They also let me get a *teacup* size since I didn't want to ruin my appetite on the starter.   For the main, I chose the Pan fried salmon with capers, garlic crush potatoes, summer veg, and a banana prawns + lobster Marie Rose sauce topped with a cucumber salsa. The salmon fell apart on my plate. Even the roasted tomatoes on the side were amazing.   I've had salmon 4 times while traveling NZ- this one takes the cake by far. This meal was fabulous and a great way to close out my New Zealand adventure.

Came here for dinner on a Thursday night. The interior had a good ambience and felt cozy. Had to wait until 7:30 for the theatre crowd to finish dinner but the dinner itself was amazing. We ordered the seared ox tongue special, rack of lamb, risotto, and an affogato with ameratto. Each dish was splendid, especially the ox tongue. Perfectly cooked inside, lightly seared outside. Would recommend to anyone visiting Christchurch.
Wonderful service and the food was awesome. Loved supporting this business in central Christchurch while we were on holiday.
Food was incredible, service was great and we never felt rushed even though they began to get busy during our time there.  Was a bit pricey but we think worth every penny!
I travel 13k each way to this shop. No one else makes a Chinese dish or chips like this place. Lovely Family owned. Great sense of humour and so nice.

Walked in to be confronted by what appeared to be a pretty full-on domestic row, albeit in Chinese so had no idea what was being said. After placing my order the barking at volume between them continued, which made me feel very uncomfortable. The male in particular seemed quite aggresive in tone towards the female, and I was frankly glad to get my food and get out of the place! Food wasn't that great to be honest, so will not be returning after that side show!
Best fish n chips ever yummo
Shop was clean, service although not very friendly  was prompt.  Food was well cooked .  Solid shop.
