Iv been going there for years food is always fantastic cooked to perfection. I can never find fish and chips as good when they are on holiday  twins is the best in nz and being a truck driver iv tasted all over nz and not tasted better
Great food, great service
Always good, try their homemade wontons!!
The food and the service were fabulous. Super tasty, fast, and inexpensive! You really feel welcome here.

I had loaded fries, butter chicken with garlic and mozzarella naan, and a mango lassi. Everything tasted really good – fresh, flavorful, and served quickly. The restaurant is small, but beautifully designed and cozy. The atmosphere was pleasant, and the owner was exceptionally friendly. I will definitely come back.
Excellent taste

We came here for dinner one evening a week ago and we had such a great experience. Food was great, staff were lovely, service was awesome! We took our leftovers home and they filled up our containers with rice so we would have enough for lunch the next day. The sauces with the popadums were really great. Will definitely recommend and come here again! :)
Went out of their way to make a share platter of GF food for us. Great find

Took my family for Dinner, from the moment we walked in the service was fantastic, after having a minute to look over the menu we were offered our drinks and ordered our starters, and the entrees were delicious, we decided to do something different with the mains, we chose a couple of mains and asked our waiter to choose one for us, something different, he knew we hadn’t been there before and he chose a delicious dish that we would have never picked. Overall a very enjoyable experience and would absolutely recommend.

We had a fabulous evening here.  Quick service by friendly server, fantastic starters, and delicious mains.  Couldn't find anything to complain about. Excellent location in the CBD with a paid parking lot right outside the door. We will definitely return.

restaurant: Two Thumb Brewing Co. on Manchester

reviews.text: Nice brewery with live music on a Sunday afternoon. Quite a wide selection of beers.
Beware closing time - it is announced very quietly and no flexibility
Had our daughters 21st here.  What a great venue! Food was awesome and great variety for our gluten free guests. Loved the atmosphere. Particularly loved the Lemonade! Thanks so much Leroy

What a fantastic local bar with amazing beers, great food, service that is impossible to fault. The prices are very reasonable with an amazing array of beers.  The food is very good with most gluten free or can be made gluten free. The live music is varied and always of a high standard, the quiz night on a Wednesday good fun and very relaxed.
Great range of quality beer
Just a really great atmosphere to relax with some mates over a pint of quality beer and delicious tacos.

We love this place & it has quickly become a favourite stop of ours to visit each week. A friend introduced me to buying their riggers of beer online for collection during lockdown & I fell for their hoppy Red Rye IPA, Anchor Me Hazy Pale Ale, California Dreaming malty steam ale & now their spot on Yorkshire Bitter or ESB. My partner enjoys the best Pilsner in NZ, the lighter Kolsch, Uprising blonde ale & particularly the unusual turmeric flavoured pilsner... Oh and some tasty guest beers or several tantalising gins from across NZ!  We loved it so much that we held our wedding reception here! Now it's great roomy beer shed has become the favourite regular haunt for us, accompanied by some cool live bands,  musical playlists & tasty in-house food. With welcoming & considerate bar staff to polish off the experience & a cosy log fire for those cold nights, we look forward to going there every time, without fail... that said, there's always Two Thumb on Colombo as a trendy alternative.
Friendly staff. Service was good. Food was great.
Haymish the bartender was so nice!!!! He made us pamola that wasnt even on the menu! he was so friendly thank you :)
We enjoyed the halloumi spring rolls

Excellent service. They were a little late with some of the meals,  not that we were worried but were very attentive and apologetic. The servers were very helpful and were making sure we were taken care of, providing a complimentary bowl of chips - but they didn't have to.
Love the beer must visit
Ordered the “Chiefs Blackboard” Go Chu Jang Burger. I think it’s the best chicken burger I’ve had. Compliments to the Chief, Gabe whom we met on departing.

Second visit. This time a late lunch with friends.  Burger of the week was mmmmmm - chosen by two of us. “Gochujang spiced maple, chicken, bacon, slaw, and pickled onion”  Also Pizza, scotch egg, bruschetta, kids meal, wines, beers, coffee. Friendly service from Hamish in the bar, prompt fab food from Chef Gabe in the kitchen.  This will become a regular. PS - also love their place at Diamond Harbour!
Yummy Food!!!  Went in with friends and started to eat before taking photos. Recommend, definitely come back again.

Claypot Rice in Christchurch?! Worth the 30-Minute Wait  Christchurch finally has real Hong Kong-style claypot rice — and yes,FIRST ONE TO ORDER AT 12:00pm, OTHER CUSTOMER CAME AROUND 12:20PM still I waited 30 minutes, but it was totally worth it. This new spot is still finding its rhythm, so expect a bit of a wait… but once that sizzling pot hits the table, you’ll forget all about the delay.   I ordered the Lup Cheong Claypot Rice — topped with smoky Chinese sausage and crispy-bottomed rice, just like it’s supposed to be. Pour the soy sauce over and mix it up — the aroma alone is enough to bring tears to your eyes   On the side: THESE CAME REALLY QUICKLY   Garlic Pork Belly (蒜泥白肉) — thinly sliced pork belly drenched in garlic-chili sauce. Cold, bold, and the perfect contrast to the hot claypot.  Daily Soup — loaded with carrots, mushrooms, bamboo, and pork. Comfort in a bowl.  Heads up: It’s made fresh to order, so be patient (we waited 30+ minutes). But honestly? Zero regrets.   Price: Around $15–20 per dish  Tip: Dine in if you can — the claypot crust doesn’t travel well!  Update:  They’ve got BBQ now  Tried the chicken wings today — crispy on the outside, tender and juicy inside  The aroma hits you hard, and the flavor just keeps pulling you in! Best part? It’s super affordable! Pair it with a cold beer and you’ve got the perfect combo

Claypot was good, however a lot of rice with less topping.  I would have prefer more topping and not just meat.  Vegetables would have been great in the claypot. The noodle dish was very good. I had heard it was hard to get a booking but we went on a Saturday for lunch and didn't have a problem.  A September 2025 visit. Be careful of where you park.  If unsure park on the street.

Really enjoyed the food here! The beef claypot rice was flavorful and comforting, and the steamed blue cod with chopped chili was absolutely delicious. Highly recommend this place for authentic Chinese dishes!
Been here several times and never disappointed. Staff are friendly, coffee and food is tasty, love sitting outside-so peaceful.
Wow Really chill and inviting Greatboutdoor area Toms of parking Lovely food option and great coffee
Heaps of options Great food and coffee Service was  Will be back

On a recommendation from friends we were greeted with smiles. This unassuming cafe is not on a busy road. As out of towners was a little hard to find without Google maps. Well patronised and would recommend booking. Menu is small but potions large. Salad with either chicken or tofu Thai style was great. Pancakes, well lucky I didn't order but one of our party did. Struggled to get through the mountain. Soup was thumbls up. There are choices of pies and cakes. Liked this little gem of a business.
Feels very homely, like visiting Grandmother. Lovely staff, $0.50 off for your own cup, yay! $5.20 is pretty good for 2025. God bless! Jono.

Stunning architecture in the Art Gallery building. Contoured glass floods the cafe with light and gives great outlook.   Good coffee and a delicious savoury muffin. Friendly staff.   Would have been four stars but had to send coffee back as lipstick still on the cup from previous user.

Universo is a modern bar and grill, in a perfect city location. The property is spacious with clean chic decor, mingling perfectly alongside the Christchurch Art Gallery next door. Kind staff, excellent food quality and their signature fries make the experience unforgettable. The house cocktails are very unique and fresh, accommodating plenty of tastes. I will definitely eat at Universo in the future, as it's the perfect scene for day or night.

This is a lovely place to sit and enjoy the world passing by. Situated in the Christchurch Art Gallery it has a fabulous relaxed vibe and is a great, airy space. The atrium ceiling is particularly nice. I enjoyed a good coffee here in the cafe and the restaurant looks great too. Service is professional, quick and very good. I'll definitely be back. Thank you.

Beautiful room with a varied menu. We shared the Beast Board. If you're a meat lover, this is for you. This can easily feed 3 people -- pate on toast, grilled steak, wagyu patties, Yorkshire puddings with lamb, hand cut chops, pickles, coleslaw, and bread rolls. C4 coffee is perfect.
We are visiting from the US and loved this breakfast spot! Great service vibes and prices. Definitely recommend stopping by
When we first arrived in Christchurch, we found this wonderful place. Had to come back again. It's delicious.

Beautiful place.  Lots of sunlight streaming in .   Food was delicious. Got the avocado toast.  Lots of avocado. Tomatoes fresh.    Husband got the classic.  Which he thought was okay.  But I think he ended craving the other pastries in their display.   Everything was very good.

Warning: this is not a low calorie review. Seriously, this place is awesome (said with new Zealand accent)! There are so many flavors bursting out of these dishes, it's difficult to process them all. The avocado toast had perfectly poached eggs with sautéed spinach (bonus ingredient) and wonderful hearty bread underneath with just the right crunch. The "classic" breakfast included rich, savory mushrooms and exemplified fine cookery. The orange juice was fresh and my dry cappuccino was made to order. In fact, the cashier remembered that ordered it the previous day, and even finished my sentence. It gets busy around 9:15 am so come early if you want to be seated right away. Highly recommended if you're in Christchurch.

My husband and I are here for vacation. Our hotel is just a few minutes walk from this place.  Staff were friendly and service was great! When it gets crowded, it can be a bit noisy.   Their pastry display had so many tasty looking treats.  We both ordered the quesadilla for breakfast. It was huge, delicious and filling!  If you are in the area, give this place a try!

Absolutely beautiful inside with lots of natural lighting and pleasing decorations. The menu had a lot of great options and all seemed appetizing. I got a benedict with mushrooms and it was quite filling even though it might not appear that way. Both my food and coffee were delicious and nicely presented. Too bad I was in a rush otherwise I would've stayed longer. This is a great place for both small and larger groups.

I am very picky when it comes to breakfast food, so when I find a place that ticks all the boxes, I want to let the world know! Their avocado toast is so much more than that - the quality, quantity, and details matter!  I dream about Unknown Chapter when I am not in Christchurch, and it is the one thing I make plans around when I return. Thank you for being so excellent and reliable!

Visiting here from the U.S. over our winter break in December/January) and saw the delicious photo of their pastries.  There's a good amount of paid street parking right in front of the restaurant, and there is also outdoor seating for anyone who wants fresh air or has a dog in tow.  The breakfast is pretty hearty.  I had the 2 eggs with toast.  I asked for the eggs over medium; however, they came out over easy.  I figured it was just lost in translation.  Overall, the eggs were a little too underdone for me, but the toast was very good.  I also had the mango/coconut smoothie which was very coconut forward, which I enjoyed.  It looked like a lot of the other patrons were enjoying their berry smoothies!  My husband had the breakfast burrito which pretty much had to be eaten as a open-faced burrito since there was so much filling!  I loved that it came with a good amount of avocado as well.  His long black coffee was more bitter than the other ones we had tried in other parts of New Zealand, but it was still pretty good.  Bonus - water station where you serve yourself.  Plus, you place your order at the counter, making the whole experience more efficient.
This may be the best breakfast we've ever had. The food was incredible and the atmosphere was really wholesome and cozy. Strongly recommend!! Also, the chocolate chip blueberry muffin is 11/10

We travelled all the way from Utah and this was worth the time to include in our plans. This place is divine, taking your everyday breakfast foods and making it a much more magical experience with each bite.

Stopped in for a quick breakfast and it was delicious! The flat white was smooth and perfect. The roasted chicken tortilla stack from the case has a lot of chicken in it and delicious creamy veggies in the layers. Came with a simple salad as well. Plenty of space and loved the hanging plants and light.
Awesome place for coffee and food. The roasted veggie frittata was out of this world and the coffee was delicious. And Love the plants hanging from the ceiling!
Came for a coffee and muffin. Both were great. They roast their own coffee on site. Great staff and environment. Will be back.

I tried Gol Gappe, Vada Pav, and Pav Bhaji tonight, and they were absolutely amazing! Every bite took me straight back to the streets of India — so authentic and full of flavor. The taste, presentation, and service were all top-notch. Thank you for bringing the real essence of Indian street food overseas. Can’t wait to come back and try more!
Great service. Delicious food. Pav bhaji must try. And specially the staff(girl) is really great in hospitality.
Best Pavbhaji in Christchurch, and best service from Dhwani. It was such a nice  experience.
Excellent service by staff and food is very tasty   Keep it up

Absolutely Delicious! Tried the pani puri at Urban Tapri and it was an absolute treat! The puris were perfectly crispy, generously filled, and topped with fresh sev and onions. The pani had just the right balance of tangy, spicy, and refreshing flavors—exactly how pani puri should be. The presentation was clean and inviting, making the whole experience even better. If you’re craving authentic and flavorful street food, Urban Tapri is definitely the place to be!
We had Tawa Pulao and it was the best in Chrischurch
Must try all items

I rang and made a booking for our group to have a social gathering. They couldn’t have been kinder. It was so easy. We were asked if we wanted inside or out, high table or normal size. I ordered a platter so we could supply finger food to our group. It was amazing. We also had chips and wedges which were top class. The service was wonderful and they provided everything we needed. They continued to check on us for any further requests. I thoroughly recommend them for any occasion as there are so many sections of seating that could cater to any group. Well done Valley Inn for making our night perfect.
A great place to start or end a walk over the hills. Happy staff and great outdoor spaces.

Only has 5 gaming machines!! What's the point in having them? They're also in the restaurant/bar area or mere metre's from them so it felt kind of strange with about 20 pair's of eye's always looking over when the machine makes lots of noises like they do. This place need's another 10 gaming machine's and a sectioned off area for the gambler's otherwise it's not worth going there unless it's for the other entertainment.
Good to see there are now more vegetarian options (and yummy ones too) available here as I love the setting and atmosphere. Great on a sunny day or tucked inside on a cold one having a wine .

Velvet burger is a good burger place with a decent menu. I ordered the luxe bird which had good flavor and a bit of a spicy kick. My table also ordered the fried pickle chips, which might've been the best part of the meal. Overall, everyone enjoyed their burgers and were happy with their orders.

Great generously sized and delicious burgers, with tons of chips in various sizes as well as a nice selection of beers. Awesome place. I found the guys there really friendly and helpful - just stumbled on the place after landing in Christchurch with terrible jet lag.

It's not the fault of the burger itself. All wrong is the staff. When I entered, three of them were in the kitchen being not that friendly. One male staff came over to speak to me. I am a foreigner visiting here could hardly understand what he said especially he spoke so fast. He spoke to me with food in his mouth, and the more terrible thing is that he almost "forced" me to order chips even drink, apologised to me after I asked if the price for the big  bro concludes the chips(absolutely not) but the way he speaks is "do you like skinnies or fatties".. well this meal is the first meal I have in Christchurch after I landed. Perhaps I got this experience just because I am Chinese.
There was lots of food near Westfield.The crew was friendly and helpful. The homegrown burger was yummy and the vegetables were fresh.

I'm not a big fan of burgers, but my friends from Dunedin were ecstatic when this opened up in Christchurch! I love their deals from their Facebook and their burgers are yummy. They have cool combinations and they have a couple different meat options like chicken, beef and I believe there might be lamb, venison and vegetarian as well. (Depending on location and specials I believe). I always end up getting a burger here when I'm in Christchurch.
Nice.Just disappointed it didn't have dinner after！
Amazing little spot, great food and lovely people. Will come back asap!
Comfortably the best Pho in town.
Delicious food. Amazing service.
My friend and I had the pho and it was delicious! Great food and great service, will definitely be back :D
Very nice beer on tap. Go somewhere else to eat.
Great selection of Craft Beers.

I thoroughly enjoy coming here. They usually have a great range of beers. Usually on tap they have a good IPA's, Hazy's, and Stouts. However everytime I visit they never have any brown ales (my favourite). I assume this is due to the drinking palate of most people. The food truck does a great range of pub type food and is reasonably priced. It has a very relaxed atmosphere. There are large tables and plenty of comfy sofas and chairs to relax in. Definitely recommend for that craft brew you might be looking for.
Always  welcoming and comfortable. And a huge selection of good bers
My first time here. Quite a nice and cozy space. They sell a wide range of craft beer  so you have a choice of what tickles your fancy.
Good pizza and cocktails
Craft beer is  very good and nibbles
Great place for a crafty! Plenty to choose from and the foods pretty good too!!
I drive 25 minutes to get their combination chow mein Without a doubt the best Chinese takeaway in ChCh

Elite Chinese takeaway. Insane prices for insane potions. $18 and the containers like the size of my head. So tasty as well! My fav, workers are always a vibe even when I run in and out they manage to make me smile
The Prawn Chow Mein was such a let down.. They are not Prawns.. They were the smallest wee shrimp I have ever seen.. Other than that there food is delicious and great portion size..
Definitely the best old school fish and chips, good price, massive portions. I’d say it’s the best fish and chips in Christchurch
Go here heaps, real legit fish and chips store, they don't mess around, they nail it.
Such a beautiful place. Delicious food. Highly recommend

The cafe is inside the Fo Guang Shan Buddhist temple. Modern architecture building and nicely decorated inside. The foods are all vegetarian but very tasty . They provide free water ( infused with lemon) which is very nice. Their high mountain tea is very good. Overall, great experience.
Hard to fault. Delicious variety of fresh food served in a serene atmosphere, this is a restaurant as much if not more than a cafe. Great for meetings with people you like , business or friends.
Exquisite. 5 stared delivery at everything. Water Drop VC deserves a Michilin.
I've been there many times and the food is always incredibly good. Very tasty and keeps you full for many hours.

What a lovely café. The atmosphere is peaceful and welcoming, with a calm energy that makes it easy to relax. Staff are friendly and attentive.  The menu is full of fresh, nourishing vegan options, all beautifully prepared and full of flavor. You can really taste the quality of the ingredients and the mindfulness that goes into every dish. Portions are generous, and everything feels wholesome and satisfying without being heavy.  This café is more than just a place to eat - it’s a little sanctuary. Perfect for anyone looking for delicious plant-based food in a beautiful, serene environment. Highly recommended.
Great vegetarian and vegan Asian food. A huge menu on offer.
Everything we ordered was delicious and as vegetarians we didn’t taste or get any hint of fishy or meat flavour, which is so rare to find. Loved it!!
Poor customer service. Zero food quality not recommended any one..... Bad bad bad customer service I ever received
Very authentique restaurant, love the ambiance good and easy going, the was good

Extensive vegetarian and vegan menu, good portion size and yummy food. Found this restaurant by accident and decided to try it out. It was a great experience. The only thing is if you are overseas traveller, bring the cash as owner told me that they don’t take overseas cards.
Well worth the visit, the extensive range of options and variety were impressive, service was prompt and welcoming, and food was affordable

the decor would fool anyone as the tables and chairs look like something out of the 1960's but the food is very good. I'm not a fan of loads of tofu so I went for the sesame crispy mushrooms with bean sprouts and the ginger brown rice which was the favourite dish with my friends. The green tea was subtle and enjoyable, and we enjoyed our lunch. I've labelled the photos as unhelpful as I don't think they have done justice to the food but unfortunately I did not take any myself.

We ordered 3 takeaway lunches and a soup. Glad to see a 100% vegetarian Chinese restaurant. The food was good. If you like spicy food, suggest you ask them for chili paste. Don't be fooled by the unassuming appearance of this place!

All Vegetarian and plenty of vegan run by nice people.  Almost all dishes came on a bed of fresh crisp mixed vegetables.  Started with the dumplings- just OK.  My least favorite dish we had.  They were not the chewy type I usually favor. Moved on to stir fried ham ( soy, not pig) with green vegetables. Good! Smoked soy with vegetables.  Also very good.   #6 hotpot lemon and red roast noodles - sauce was more catsup and not lemony but the  chewy gluten fake meat on top was excellent. Last dish was Beijing stewed something (#19).  Excellent!

This was our most walkable dinner option and it turned out well. We let the proprietor suggest based on how much cash we had (they don't take credit cards) and we had a noodle and a rice dish, both with tofu. It was ready in less than 10 minutes. We'll return.

Great choices for vegans. 100% vegetarian and about 80% of the menu are vegan. The dishes we tried were so delicious. The service was great and the food came fairly quick. Prices were resonable.  It's not a fancy place and I wouldn't recommend it for a first date but it's definitely worth a visit. I wish there was a place like this at home.

I recently bought food from there it was saag paneer and tandoori rotis, it was worth , it was tasty and roties were done so nicely, and went there after that and got same great service again, now wouldlove to go back there again
Momos was so yummy !!!! Samosa is crunchy and feels like we are eating in India !!!
Delicious food

Update: they called me to say sorry and were super lovely about it. Honest mistake. 5 stars.  Really nice staff & had good experiences. Food tastes great. Unfortunately ordered a medium and received a mild, but as the receipt was correct I didn't realise until back home. Bit of a shame really.
Best food in Christchurch I have had. Amazing food and amazing service. This place really deserves more. Appreciate it, Keep it up guys recommend dish: Momo, Chicken drumsticks curry, Chicken Naan
The best atmosphere and kind staff how does as per customer needs. And the taste is also outstanding.
Fantastic steak and fried chicken , love them
Cocktails from a can. Food ok.
Its a nice cafe....Allpress Coffee. Can be a long wait But coffee is good enough.
Great brunch. 7 of us, lots of space.  All food was very good.  Recommend.
The second visit 8 months later, Turkish eggs seem not as good as the first time and quite different ingredients and seasonings as well.  First time: Turkish eggs were delicious. Coffee was good too.

I ordered eggs on toast and asked for 3 extra eggs, but there was a little mix-up — the wait staff accidentally logged it as 3 full meals instead of 3 eggs. I was so shocked when three plates of food came out!  Luckily, the staff were super quick to fix the mistake and handled it really well. The food was so good that I actually wished I had gone ahead and ordered all three plates! Good service, tasty food, and a fun experience.

Honey chicken on rice was disgusting!, only two stars because the Honey was nice, If you going to charge $19, then the chicken shouldn't be chewy, rice was dam near un eatable.  Viggie undercooked. Just goes to show, all those 5 star reviews,  and that's what you sell me. Makes you wounder. Ill never return!
Ordered honey chicken noodles, chicken really dry/tough or overcooked, sauce didn't really taste like honey chicken ive had before, bit guttered to be honest as past reviews were really positive
Pork on fried rice is an insane meal, becoming a regular
Whales is the best food  and the friendlys service ever

UPDATED (26-JUN-25) BELOW. Wow! Prawn Star, Beef Courgettes & Pork Belly. Absolutely delicious, highest-quality restaurant ingredients at takeaway prices. The slow-cooked meat came apart beautifully & the homemade sauce was incredible. Immaculate premises & super-friendly owners. Can't wait to return soon, highly recommended. P. S. Returned for (outstanding, gourmet) beef & chicken burgers with chips, 5/5 again, thanks so much guys! 26-JUN-25: "Masterpiece! Masterpiece! Masterpiece!" That's all I could enthusiastically say to the team last night, after devouring their Pulled Pork Burger. So good, I'm back for a repeat today. "Winner, Winner, Pork Bun Dinner!!!"

A great chain bagel/pizza joint that boasts it's "New York Style bagel" while I'd argue they're more like Montreal-style (smaller and chewier and, in my opinion, tastier) they are baked perfectly and fill a much needed niche in New Zealand. Having moved here from New York, I was quite delighted to check this place out!   The restaurant is clean and modern and has great eye-appeal. You can create your own bagel sandwiches (for $7.50) or select one of their options (~$9/10). I tried the Pilgram with chicken, bacon, mayo and tomato salsa on a rock salt bagel. I HIGHLY recommend the combo. While the sandwich lacks the amount of fillings a New York bagel would have, it is still satisfying. My husband had the Big Schnitz and he enjoyed it, too. Haven't tried the pizza, but if it's anything like the bagels, you're taste buds are in for a treat. Don't want a sandwich? You can also buy their bagels as bagel chips!

I have long been waiting for a Wholly Bagels to arrive in the South Island and was so excited to see it has recently opened in the new complex corner of Ilam and Creyke roads. This means I can stop pestering my wellington friends for us to quickly stop by Wholly's up there for my fix. There is plenty of off street parking but only two parks actually reserved for Wholly Bagels customers so snag yourself a street park if you see one.  This is a new fitout so everything is clean and fresh. The bagels are amazing. My favs are the pilgrim and the salmon. The bagels come in a variety of flavours and are freshly made with no preservatives. The fillings of the gourmet bagels are humungous and delicious. I really want to try the pizza sometime as well - the Jumbo size truly is jumbo!!  Service is pretty good. They took a while to take our order as they were busy cooking out the back. They also forgot our hot chocolates but remembered just as we were finishing up and bought them to us as takeaways instead with a lot of apologies and a free bag of bagel crisps (YUM!) so all was forgiven. The hot chocolate was really good actually, generous with the marshmallows and not flavourless like I find so many are.  I recommend checking out Wholly Bagels for lunch, especially for Uni students as its very close to campus. They are also open till 8ish in the evening, and you can do an online order to speed things up in store.
Me and my team were down for tech week. Becca was awesome on to it and catered to us even when we were a tad difficult. Will definitely be back!!
Down for dramfest, place was baller
service from Charles was 10/10, great chat & one of the great blokes, made drinks off the menu to our taste
Nice place in the city center, staff is very friendly. We had a great time here. Thank you
Amazing cocktails, thank you Charles! Super friendly. 90s hip hop was playing throughout. Very nice ambience and vibe. Only wished they close later!

STOP scrolling ! You’ve found it. If you want a great bar that feels like your own. With a great chat and amazing beers on tap. Just head to Wilko. I’m a tourist from Australia and visited Wilko twice. Was the highlight of my trip.
Not a good look for barman to be swinging customer round Holding tight.
Jake the barman is a awesome lill phat dude
I come for the pokies, staff here are always happy and friendly to deal with

I have travelled to NZ for the cricket on my own and found this pub. I was made to feel at home straight away. Rebecca, Shelley, Roman and Jake have been amazing. The locals are all so welcoming, I have never felt so welcome and at home at a pub before. Thanks guys

I visited Christchurch for the first time in 18 years and wanted to reminisce about the food I had back then. I went with my two kids, and they gave me a piece of paper that looked like a coloring book. I didn't realize there was a kids' menu on it. I thought they were just giving it to the kids to keep them entertained before they got their food. When we ordered, we ordered pizza and fries, and the fries were $10. There were $5 and $10 sizes on the kids' menu, but they should have at least told us when we ordered. It wasn't that busy, after all. When we were paying, I saw a sign on the wall that said the kids' menu was free on Wednesdays. What was that? Why didn't they tell us?
Great evening at their quiz night, only mis-step they put onion on the salad when we had requested no onion.
Service was quick and thoughtful, and the food was absolutely delicious. Everything was cooked to perfection, and the pizza snob in the family declared the pizza to be the best he’s ever had!
First time there definitely be back wonderful meal
Just had a takeaway mushroom pizza - it was excellent!
Food and service great but overwhelmingly loud when busy. Needs something to soften the intensity.
Really good pizza's, great environment to hang out and eat some really good food.... Craig Owen
Bad service! In fact NO service! We waited over 20 minutes for someone to take our order but were ignored by all wait staff. We left! Don't waste your time or money!
Went here for a late dinner. The service was good and the pizzas were amazing. We also had a Greek salad to share. Highly recommend.

This is a great spot to gather with friends and family. This space is large, the atmosphere is loud and the pizza is de-licious! I definitely recommend a booking, especially if you plan to eat around dinner time on a Friday. There is covered outdoor seating, a more "intimate" seating area (2-4 tops) off of the bar and large family style seating in the main dining room. The service is quick, the staff is helpful and friendly. We ordered a half and half pizza: The Italian and the Chicken, brie and cranberry (a Winnie Bagoes favorite). Seriously, that was the best pizza I have had in Christchurch! It even tastes great as leftovers. We also tried the jalapeno bites which was basically a fried ball filled with a chipotle mayo/jalapeno mix. It's pretty hot, my mouth was definitely sweating, but their sauce on the plate and a beer helps to ease the burn. Cheap prices, great food, definitely worth a repeat visit!
Great place for a beer and pizza. The pizza are among the best in Christchurch and the venue is also rather nice with indoor and outdoor seating.

Tonight I ate at Winebagoes Christchurch. I must say I had a bad time. Bad enough to make me want to write a negative review. It took 30 minutes for 2 cokes to be delivered to the table despite the bar and wait staff standing around doing nothing. Once we ordered our food it took a further 45 minutes for the food to arrive, after it took them 30 minutes to tell us that they were out of fries.  Once the food arrived it was excessively average, not something I would pay $33 dollars for again. Will not be eating here again.
Good food. Had their curry chicken rice and wonton soup. Dining area is limited with the capacity of about 30pax.

Malaysian food in Queenstown? Yup. After a few weeks of eating burgers, lamb chops, and steak I wanted some non-white people food.  What a find.   Shrimp noodle- Not bad but it looked amazing and only tasted ok.  Chao kwei tewo- oh man. Perfect. Make sure to add their homemade hot sauce.  Very close to authentic.  Hainan chicken-so so. Actually it was nothing like the real thing.   So why the 4*?  Cause this place is one of the few gigs in town.  Plus the food is reasonably priced- $10 per dish. This was one of our best abs by far cheapest meals in NZ.   Go figure.
I highly recommend C:MoMo and Chowmein — it was absolutely delicious! The host was very calm, composed, and welcoming — it really added to the pleasant experience.
Another great meal with beautiful flavours
Best Lunch experience within 6 weeks traveling in New Zealand. So kind people and simply the best dumplings I've ever eaten.
What a wonderful place! Incredibly fantastic, delicious food and hosts who make you feel like you don't want to leave, or at least want to come back again and again. With a joyful heart, thank you
Been wanting to try this out a while since I love dumplings and it was great! Maybe some acoustic foam would be a good idea since it's quite echoey, food was amazing and service really good too <3

As a Nepalese person myself, Yak&Fern is absolutely a gem and offers the most authentic Nepali food there is in Christchurch. The customer service is fantastic and the staff were absolutely welcoming. It’s the kind of place that makes you want to come back again and again. Highly recommend Yak & Fern to anyone who wants the authentic Nepali experience and flavour!
Great food, great experience

This became my new favourite place to eat in New Brighton!  The food is very good, full of different flavours. I have tried the mo:mo all the different possible ways (steamed, fried, in soup, etc...), their fried rice and fried noodles a I have never been disappointed.  I like that the interior is all modern, clean with large windows providing heaps of natural light.  Last but not least, the owners are amazing nice and friendly.  Make sure to visit them and encourage those initiatives in New Brighton.
A great neighbourhood Japanese. The food is fresh and reasonably priced. The agedashi tofu is delicious as is the beef tataki.

I actually planned on going here but before I arrive I saw how they treated uber delivery people and I condemned those who treat others rudely. Will not be coming here for sure  reply to your reply:  well i dont know should i justify what you  said: but here Dear Sir/Mam I  was Visitor  in Chch to catch up with few friends and not a uber delivery person. uber driver might have made mistake but that doesn’t mean they have to stand out side(restaurant )while there can be a small waiting area inside. thanks
Excellent
food poisoning from the Banh Mi from Uber Eats - Joanne A
We had a lovely celebratory dinner. The team were friendly and helpful.

We had a wonderful meal here.  Started with delicious fresh spring rolls, followed by beef cheeks plus a green salad (which was much more interesting than the ones I make!).  Will definitely visit again.  Thanks.
We had a performance to attend and a short dinner window, the food was prepared so promptly for us, tasty and fresh, thanks team!
Food and service was excellent and quick but no Tap Beer and the Dacquiri Cocktail was too sweet.
Great food and service
Delicious and flavoursome big portion dishes. Beautiful service and atmosphere. Will be back again.
A brilliant Asian experience awaits.
Finally found the Chinese Restaurant I was looking for!!
Staff always delivering good service.
Super quick with preparing food for delivery, superb quality of food and really generous servings!
Great food
Best Thai food in Christchurch.
Best value Thai takeaway in Ōtautahi!  Very generous portion size for the curry. Great value. Hot, fresh and delicious.  Highly recommend the green curry and chicken curry puffs.

"After preparing and plating the noodle dish and the stir-fry, I had to wait over 40 minutes for the other dish. The noodles became overcooked and lost their texture, making them unappetizing.and food was getting cold.

I had been wanting to order from here for ages after hearing good things about this place from Friends. Finally had the opportunity tonight and my review is a little mixed.  After reading the other reviews I knew that there would likely be a long waiting time for the food. They opened at 4:30pm, and we called through to order at around 5:10pm. They quoted a wait time of 1 hour and 15 minutes. We were happy with this as we had called in early.  The wait time ended up being pretty accurate - which was good service. When my partner came to collect around 6:30ish another person came into order and left pretty quickly after being quoted a 2 hour wait time for food. This seems like a major issue for this place - they can’t handle many orders as there is only one guy cooking the food.  We ordered mild chicken green curry and chicken Pad Thai. The portion size of the Pad Thai was great and the Pad Thai was good. For $15 this was great value for money but taste wise was not anything amazing.  Unfortunately the big let down for me was the green curry which  was what I was most looking forward to / craving the most. Green curry is my usual dish at places at little high, thai orchard etc.  On the phone the lady asked if we wanted the curry mild, medium or hot. We said mild and she repeated back to us that it was mild we were  ordering. My Partner can handle a bit a spice, but I can’t so I always like to get mild to get a mild spice flavour or no spice at all.  THE CURRY TASTED LIKE SPICY WATER. I’m certain I was probably given a hot curry by mistake because it was so hot I couldn’t eat any of it. My partner also said it was very hot and he couldn’t have a lot of it due to the bland flavour / texture. I can acknowledge when a dish is spicy and flavourful - however all you could taste was spicy water. It was horrible and went straight into the bin which is a real shame. No nice curry texture, coconut or anything. I wouldn’t recommend the curry even if you could handle the spice. No flavour, bland and tasted awful - the spice didn’t even match the flavour profile of a typical spicy green curry.  Due to the fuss with the waiting time, probably won’t come back here again as it’s not really worth it. Very disappointing :(

Was recommended this place by a freind, it had been playing in my mind to order here as I had tried their lard about three years ago and it was average as. Nonetheless I ordered. We were told 40 mins.  We waited some more.  With a 40 minute wait you’d expect to walk in and have mutlple chefs gone but no. There was one.  I walked in the store and got the food. After a brief and frisk drive home, the smell of this takeaway wofting into my nostrils had me readily for a goon. I then got home. One sip of the Panang curry, One bite of curry puff, one tear of spare rib.  I knew I’d hit a gem!  Ken oath legends  This Thai place is a keeper!

Never thought I would find so much foreign food in New Zealand. I don't really know what I was expecting. I guess I assumed it would be burgers, fish and chips, seafood and lamb. With the occasional Chinese restaurant sprinkled in. Because they're in every country. But Thai? From New Zealand? And pretty much the entire crew are Kiwis?? No fruit isn't running this restaurant that's what they call themselves here. This place though.. It was good. Really good!  The inside has an upscale look but you don't need to dress classy to eat here. They don't overdo the fact that they are an Asian restaurant. You know how some places can be.. Oooh let's put a tiger in that corner, and oh a Buddha in that corner, maybe a temple print wallpaper.. No no. This place keeps it simple.   Staff was great. They don't work for tips in New Zealand but still cared about me just as much.  Let's talk food!! The menu runs deep. Like 50 numbers deep. We ordered 3 items. 38-Black Pepper Stir Fry, 20-Pad Thai, 12-Tom Kar which is a soup. Everything had such great flavor. Lots of meat in our dishes to. 3 items and it was plenty for 3 of us. And they make sure to label the menu to let you know what is spicy, and extra spicy. So no surprises here!  Oh they also have a small section for Vietnamese food. Shutout to my Viet friends. But.. We didn't order any of that.  5 stars for great food and service!

We stopped here for lunch on a day trip to Christchurch. The staff were very friendly and polite, and the food was delicious. We got the fresh spring rolls (reasonably good; like a salad in a spring roll wrap), the green curry with tofu (excellent), and the spicy noodles with tofu (also delicious). Lunch prices were very reasonable. So glad we stopped here!

Had a recommendation to come here from our air bnb host and boy it didn't disappoint.  The satay is amazing! The laksa has vegetables in it - odd but nice enough. They forgot our pork balls, then we reminded them, they brought them out but still it wasn't great... they were very plain balls with a sweet pineapple sauce...  The pepper beef was nice but I would've enjoyed it more if it had more pepper.  Overall though, this place is nice. Service is great - they check how the meal is going etc and cater to ANY allergies.  Go there - you won't regret it.
Always great food here ,staff  is friendly and the atmosphere is calming
One of my favourite places for asian cuisine! Their beef cheek is melt-in-your-mouth!

This was my first visit to Zaffron, I've been to many Thai restaurants and I was blown away.  The portions were generous, I had Guri and Peanut Tofu... the peanut sauce WOW! It was a lovely thick sauce instead of the usual thin sauce at other places I've visited. I'm keen to return to try more!
Great food!
Great vegan options! The lunch was really well priced and a good portion. Recommend!

Some of the other reviews had me worried, but the food was great and the staff were warm and friendly! Not to mention the food was delivered to our table within 20 minutes. No diarrhea later in the night either!

restaurant: Zak's Kebab House - The best in Central City (Halal)

reviews.text: Kebab was OK the it was pretty small and didnt have much vege and sauce

Well the kebab wrap was ok, but lacked flavour. What was that red stuff that the chicken on the vertical rotisserie was smothered in? It didn’t taste of much … and I certainly would have preferred the doner meat to have crispy, caramelised edges, more seasoning (i.e. banging with flavour.). The salad was good but light on sauces.
Every time I'm in Christchurch I go here. The food and service are so good.
Best in town no one can beat zakk kebab
One of the better shawarma's I've had in town, Surprised at how good the size was, Tasty selection of food and sides.

Freshest salmon I have ever encountered. The dumplings (we had chicken) were good as well. Best of all, the service is so wonderful: staff were kind and helpful and made us feel so welcome. Highly recommend for a meal or quick snack :)
This restaurant offers some of the best sushi and sashimi I have ever eaten. They serve the freshest salmon ever.
Excellent Sushi
Food was super yummy, however limited menu but the quality of the food makes up for it!
Location is central, plenty of seats. Good service, food was good
Had the karaage chicken and it was delicious!! Peaceful place to eat, very nice service.
Great food & service. Super reasonably priced.

My partner and I had the most amazing meal, service was excellent, great atmosphere. A must place to visit , best crispy chicken starter we have had by far and the duck pancakes were just delicious   we can't wait to revisit and try some more of the varied menu.
Delicious cocktails, amazing vibes, super chill and friendly and room to dance. Nice staff! DJ DWIGHT was amazing! Thanks for a great night!
Highly Recommend. You won't be disappointed. Bookings essential
Cannot fault anything, service was amazing, food amazing, Panang Beef Cheek Curry

I gave this place a 5 Star last year for the Cocktail Lunch Club and its still a 5 Star as of 02/11/2025! Great vibe on a Saturday night, hard to find a Bar on the Terrace that has a R&B + Hip Hop DJ and it wasn't overly crowded made the experience even better tbh. Bar Staff were friendly, drinks like wow budget friendly as we know places on the Terrace can charge your soul for drinks Definitely recommend for all looking for this kind of vibe  Did the Cocktail Lunch Club as a Pre Mothers Day and wow absolutely amazing experience. It's a 2 course lunch and they bring everything out to share that's on the menu and 5 cocktails per person. Great value for money. Cocktails were to my liking, staff were friendly and atmosphere of the place was my vibe. Would definitely recommend to all to try this. Food was yummy!

One of my favourite places in Chch, every visit is a hit. Food very tasty, high quality, and consistently good. Service attentive and very fast. Nice happy hour offers. One star less for ambience, because the indoor area is very dark, it is hard to see the food even. I recommend sitting outside.

Service was great and really fast for a busy Saturday night. Food was also great, full of flavour. Atmosphere was good and the outdoor heaters worked perfectly. Would definitely recommend going here. The menu was also huge and had plenty of choices.
Absolutely beautiful food. The service outstanding

The curry had great flavour but the meat wasn’t very tender. The service was bad, they took an hour and a half from when we got there, until we had food on the table. In there defence we were a big group but It had already been half an hour before they even took our order. If you are booking for a large group I wouldn’t recommend.

This is a review for the takeaway service. Fast and friendly, the food was really satisfying and very good value for money. They have a large menu for traditional or vegetarian diets. I would suggest a more sophisticated array of drinks. I'll be coming back soon.

The wait time at this place is disappointing and after a long day if customers walk in to enjoy dinner they want and need to be served on time. Walked in at 8.23pm and the food took one hour to arrive at the table. They take their own sweet time to prepare the food like there’s no tomorrow. Quite disappointing experience and it was my first visit here wouldn’t come back for sure

I ordered off uber eats before looking at reviews. I was a bit on the wall with some good and not so good. Have always said dont knock it till you try it. I have to say, my food I got for myself was perfect. Medium heat  Portion size  Flavour  Temperature  There isnt anything I could fault. My garlic naan was soft, fluffy and tasty. Loved how my Mango Chicken wasnt sweet, and the chucks of chicken were nice decent bite size peices. My mums Chicken Korma was a wee bit too hot for her. Id ordered her medium. And for her tastebuds, not as creamy as shes used to having. Our first time trying and Id definately order again. Thanks team!!!

Medium means medium, not mild. Butter chicken is always a good tester for a new place and it was the best butter chicken I've had yet, real flavor and a little kick with the medium  is not the closest to me but I'll be back

We were a bit disappointed with our visit. The staff especially manager didn’t seem to care much about our dining experience, which took away from the overall atmosphere. The food was 45 minutes late and lamb curry still tasted like sweet and had a flavour that wasn’t quite what we expected. The chilli chicken was okay, but the butter naan was unfortunately half-cooked. Hopefully, the restaurant can improve the food quality and service in the future.
Delicious food, decent portion sizes and great service. Will be back again
